Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: Wa L
Reviews.Content: Great place. Kids will love the multiple pools and awesome water slide (big kids aka adults will love it too!). Walk right to beautiful Kaanapali beach. Conveniently close and right next to Whaler's village where there is shopping, a food court and some decent restaurants. A special shout out to our great maid, Virginia, who always make sure our room is always stocked with that wonderful Kona coffee, extra cups, sugar and cream. We definitely need our coffee even on vacation especially for our early morning excursions for the drive to Hana, sunrise at Haleakala, and early morning whale watch. In short I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: trish41_11
Reviews.Content: A nice ocean front resort with beautiful landscaping, pools, shops, and activities. The rooms are slightly dated but very clean. The staff is wonderful and the breakfast buffet is great. The views from the beach tower are awesome. Please note that this is a very busy, family oriented resort.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: knspr
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews, I had very low expectations but our overall experience was a good one. I am Starwood gold and I was updated to a deluxe ocean view in the beach tower. The view from the balcony was stunning. The room adequate, a little worn and dated, but the beds comfy. The outside weightlifting deck was great. So fun to work out and have an ocean view. The location was great for our teen......he could wander down the boardwalk and over to Whalers village. Extremely crowded and hectic but fun if you are looking for action. Loved walking down the boardwalk and having happy hour at Leilani's. Great band and happy hour food and drink specials. The pools are pretty and we never had trouble finding a chair. If you want shade, get your towels out early. We stayed four nights before moving over to the Westin villas, which are much nicer than the hotel. The villas are a better choice if you want a nicer room and a prettier, peaceful setting.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Return to the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Rosssalyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Kaanapalli the week of March 12th. I thought the staff was very nice, always asking if they could help. The rooms were the only disappointing part. They were very small and dated. I am talking popcorn ceilings and peeling wallpaper in the bathrooms. The rooms were cramped, making it difficult to move about with two adults and two kids. I mean, there was not even a closet, just an armoire. But, the beds were awesome, and that was the most important part to me. We liked the facility itself. Nice nice pools, especially compared to the hotels in the area (you could see them as you strolled the boardwalk). We had considered staying at the Sheraton, but after walking the grounds of the Sheraton, I am glad we chose Westin. That being said, if we go again, we'll probably splurge and stay at the Mona Kai. It was newer and seemed a lot nicer. Overall, the Westin was a good spot to bring little kids with the two water slides, one for big kids and one for little kids. Also, the pool-side cafe had a nice big children's menu. And, I enjoyed the location of the Westin, right next to Whaler's Village where you could grab some dinner. I recommend booking a whale-watching excursion through the Westin on the Gemini. It was great. Watch for the $25/day resort fee. Some of the guests did not know about it and were surprised that it was tacked on. I knew about it and thought it was fair considering it gave you your parking, 2 bottles of water a day and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Glad i chose the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Raquel_B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a premium deluxe oceanview room as part of my first trip to hawaii. This room i could not fault and you really must get a room that is in the beach tower as they are a little larger, bigger balcony and view is fantastic and if this is out of your budget then opt for an ocean view room in the ocean tower. Room service was fantastic as were the hotel restaurants. Whalers village is next door so you can get some snacks to munch on. You will really need a car in Maui especially if you want to drive aroud the island (which I recommend). Great hotel and my first choice for Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: mikiemd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite nice, though the rooms are a bit dated. The staff was very helpful in all ways. The only criticism of the food would be the price of the buffet breakfast, which was a bit steep for what you could eat. Tropica had a fantastic tasting menu - we did the 4 course with wine pairings. Our server, Lorain, was top notch and kept things coming at a pace where we felt neither rushed nor slowed. Our room was a deluxe ocean view on a higher floor, and it was nice, though needs some updating. It would have been nice to have the toilet in a separate space. The walls were a bit thin, so noise and bathroom noise travelled quite easily. Self parking was pretty easy, but the spaces are VERY narrow. When we checked out the valet had parked a car blocking ours, but they came out quickly to let us get out. Nonetheless, we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Grounds and Pools”
Reviews.Author: RichFromOmaha
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its surroundings are just beautiful, The rooms are okay, but who stays in their room? Our room overlooked the pools and the ocean, so we enjoyed hearing the surf, the waterfalls that are part of the landscape below, the music and the sounds of people having fun. One morning, we had a massive rainbow appear just above the sail boats moored offshore. The beach is very narrow, but has a nice sandy bottom with few rocks. The beach goes on and on, so you can find a place to your liking if you look. There is a walkway to the other hotels along the beach that makes for a great walk, The Whalers Village shopping area is right next door. The staff and concierge were very helpful and pleasant to talk to. The front of the hotel is a bit hectic with so many cars coming and going, and the lobby areas can get crazy. Parking can be an issue. The pools are magical and I certainly appreciated the adults only pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it so much!”
Reviews.Author: tropical
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Westin Maui for 10 days in January. It was our first trip to Maui and after many months of research finally decided on Westin Maui because of the location (which is great). We arrived from Honolulu after a short 3 day stay there at around 1pm. We had a car and valet was great and very friendly. We were able to checkin early which is always nice. We were upgraded 1 category to deluxe ocean view. The room is typical Westin at first glance, but they really do need upgrading. The worst thing was the balcony. All the cement was crumbling on it so if you go out in bare feet your feet are covered in cement. Also, the view was look hard to your left and there's the ocean. This room was going for almost $600 a night! We didn't pay that, thank god (we used points). So, certainly for that price you go in with pretty high expectations. Very quickly noticed that there is alot of construction at the resort. They were redoing the area where the Luau is held so the adults only pool (another reason we booked here, we don't have kids) was listening to jackhammers all day for 10 days. Not impressed. The breakfast buffet is outrageous at $28 per person. We always ordered off the menu as the meals were plenty of food for more than half the price of the buffet. We did eat at the hotel once at night but the service was terrible. So incredibly slow. I'm not used to that especially at a $600 a night hotel. Another night we went to the "lounge/restaurant" for a nitecap. After waiting for our drinks for half an hour and being told over and over "they are coming" we just left. No thanks, $15 for a drink too! The location is great, right next to Whaler's village. We loved that and ate at the restaurants there every night. Lots of them have great early bird specials if you don't mind eating early. So, all in all we loved hawaii definately and will be back but definately not at the Westin. And it's too bad, I really wanted to love it as I am a huge Starwood fan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the beach, whale watching, pricey, not perfect, black swan , flamingos”
Reviews.Author: Je7375
Reviews.Content: Whales watching with Gemini was unbelievable. Not only we saw whales and a lot, service on the boat was spectacular and quality of food was surprisingly very good for such type of entertainment. My 12 year old loved it. Surfing lessongs were fun, but I didn't learn to stand on the board and only one person from our group did. Morning breakfast is pricey, around $27 per adult and arounD $14 per 12 year old kid. Food was good, not awesome, but good and view was nice.

Reviews.Title: “watch your credit card drawings”
Reviews.Author: familyof5Queensland
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week and they drew over 8000 usd on our credit card. after many phone calls we are still waiting for this money to be released. never heard of it before but they say it is a security. Rooms where prepaid and all trips have been paid. Please explain. Still have to wait 24 hours. Not fun with a credit card limit of 10000. Never again. On our Honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for families, but does get crowded”
Reviews.Author: Hi-there-all
Reviews.Content: This was our second vivist after 5 years ago, We arrived christmas day after an overnight flight from Australia, this was our second christmas day as we crossed the date line. You cannot say that too often you had 2 chrstmas days. We had mountain view rooms looking out over the car park and golf course which was quite pleasent. We enjoyed it so much we came back and brought our friends. Staff were great over the resort and were so helpful from front desk right through to the room staff. Our rooms were cleaned daily, our rooms were more than clean and have been updated since our last visit. We snorkeled every day at Black Rock which was very handy and easy to do. We took our own face masks but hired fins right next door to the hotel which cost $7 a day or $10 a week, we took the week as it was better value. Whalers Village was right next door which kept the wives and girls very busy, the boys speny hours looking at skateboards at 5 different shops. The hotel was at 100% full, so unfortunately even before 7am every single pool lounge was taken which was a shame with towels and tshirts etc. Anyway this didn't worry us too much and to the beach in the morning and shopped in the afternoon and evenings next door and at Lahaina. Staying at a beadch hotel and and if I wanted to sit by the pool I could have stayed at home for that. The free shuttle to Lahaina was great which we used every day, this time we didn't hire a car as it was not necessary for our quick 5 day stay. Bubba Gumps at Lahaina although cheesey was great, food was service was fantastic. I could not fault the service provided. Thanks again to the Westin Maui team, I look forward to naother stay soon hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort But Crowded”
Reviews.Author: SeanandKristin
Reviews.Content: The Westin Resort and Spa at Lahaina is a beautiful property. While it could use a little updating in places, it was in very good shape overall. The landscaping is excellent, and the exterior design is very nice. Our main concern was the sheer number of people who were using the property -- beach chairs sold out very quickly, and conveniently-located chairs on the pool deck could be hard to find. The resort restaurants serve very good food, and the staff is courteous and diligent.

Reviews.Title: “Just chill out for once”
Reviews.Author: coffeebean818
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews on here, I was kind of worried about what I might be getting into here with all of the complaints and "do not stay here" posts. Now, after my own stay here, I am convinced that some of those posters must work for a competitor!! Positives of the hotel - - The grounds at the hotel are beautiful - waterfalls, flamingos, pool areas, etc etc. Beach is beautiful. - HAPPY HOUR from 5-6 is a must - you have to get the $5 mai tais... out of this world! Live music is also playing as well, so great to either sit on your balcony and listen/drink or stay near the pool. - Location is great as well - while I would agree that other resorts are a bit better in terms of overall "ambience" (think Ritz, for example), the great thing about this resort is that it's right next to Whaler's Village if you feel like getting off the resort, and also only a 10 min shuttle to Lahaina. You don't feel like you're stuck here. - Service: everyone was really helpful, from concierge to wait staff. - Weather: can't beat Ka'anapali... lots more rain just 10 mins north (kapalua) and much windier in the south. - Beds! If you ever slept in a heavenly bed, you know what I mean. To be fair, some things could be improved on. Our room wasn't ready at check in (about 1 hour late in getting ready), so that could have been taken care of a bit better. I was also a little disappointed in the hot tub as it's not one of those completely in-ground ones and looks as though they forgot about it in the plans and added it at the end. Room was nice, but not spectacular. Overall, a great stay. It takes about a day to wind down and realize that you're in Maui where things are not so fast-paced, but once you reach that point you don't want to leave!! I hear some of the reviews that mention things could have been better/improved upon, etc, but if I'm not mistaken, that is what a 4 star hotel is - fantastic, but has a few areas that can be improved upon and are not as good as 5 star. If you are looking for flawless 5 star + rooms, amenities and service, then you can pay $800+/night at the Four Seasons. There is a reason for price differences between hotels.. that's all I'm saying.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Worldclassgirl
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking view as soon as you enter, we found the pools and beach very well kept and relaxing, ocean view is well worth it. The Luau was average, entertainment was great but food was terrible and pretty expensive...you could probably find another one better. Service was great, but I will warn you to check your restaurant/dining bills as this resort adds a 25% service charge (automatic gratuity) onto your bill, and then there's a line for "gratuity" on top of that. Hmmm....trying to double dip there? We always tip 15-20% regardless, but 25% seems a bit much...and then to ask for more gratuity? Just a warning to read the fine print :) Also keep away from the white swans....they bite, but the black swan is very gentle.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: Rachel L
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. What hotel has single pane windows these days? This place has a great pool for the masses of kids, but a quiet spot does not exist at this location. If you want to roll with the masses, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lauren502
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Ritz in Kapalua before moving down to the Westin Maui. While the rooms at the Ritz were much nicer, we really preferred atmosphere at the Westin. The grounds are beautiful and fun. There is an amazing waterfall in the lobby with flamingos and a black swan. There are multiple pools with waterfalls and even a slide, including an adult only pool. It is just steps away from a beautiful beach and right next door to Whaler's Village, a really great shopping center with stores and restaurants. We decided to go with a mountain view room since we figured were wouldn't be in the room much. This was a good decision for us because we were hardly in the room and our view of the mountains wasn't bad. The room itself was small and dated, but not awful. The shower was pretty dingy and old and the vanity was extremely low. This would be a great property if they renovated the guest rooms. We had some issues with noisy neighbors, we could hear everything from the adjoining room doors. This was pretty annoying and we should have requested a new room, but I didn't really feel like packing all of my stuff back up. Overall, I would definitely go back just for the hotel grounds and location. Hopefully they manage to renovate the rooms soon.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DLFSanJose
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of the larger chains, the Westin Maui offers a convenient location and lots of pool/ocean recreation opportunities. We upgraded for an ocean view with breakfast. For the view it was worth the small amount, and when you look at the price for a simple breakfast, the breakfast and view more than makes up for the incremental cost, especially if you donâ€™t have kids. The pools are great with what seems to be 3 groupings. There is a separate pool with spa area for adults, a separate pool area for kid activities, and a separate pool area for the rest of us. We booked it through Alaska Air vacations and paid a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “I can be bought but this place was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: verdegris
Reviews.Content: Just finished 10 days at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. The 5 star rating is almost entirely because of Aliko (sp?) who recognized our disappointment with the room we were originally given on the 3rd floor of the ocean tower. We ponied up for ocean view to make sure we had a good spot. However, I guess since it was part of an "escape package" (better deal?), it ended up being hardly what you could call ocean view. You could see slivers of the ocean through all the trees and resort grounds so it wasn't technically false advertising but we were very very disappointed. Also, since it was a two queen room, there was very little space for us to get around - my wife is pregnant and we brought our 3 year old who slept in a crib so it was really cramped. I went to the front desk right away and was not mean or pushy but said we were not happy with the view and that we felt cramped. Aliko went to work and found us a great room in the beach tower on the 7th floor. It was AMAZING! It had an awesome view, was a single king room and had about 100 sq ft more room than what we had originally. We are SOOOOOOOO thankful that Aliko did this for us. It is because of him that this gets 5 stars. In reality, it was what we were expecting for what we paid (even with the "escape package" - it wasn't cheap). The positives: Aliko (as I said, he made this trip for us because of the room change/ upgrade). In addition to Aliko, Carlito and Elena at the host stand for breakfast were always very very sweet to our family. In addition to the people I mentioned, the property, pools, beach, grounds, rooms (ocean view in the beach tower) are really really great. I've heard others talk about the tired feel or the property/ rooms and that this isn't Westin quality but I've stayed at other Westin properties and this is definitely up to par. The beach location couldn't be better - right on the beachwalk that goes past Blackrock/ the Sheraton on one side and past the Hyatt on the other. Totally beautiful. I'm all about the beach and this place delivers. Close to the best beach I've seen in Hawaii (I've been the Big Island, Maui 5 times, Kauai, Lanai, and Oahu). By best beach in Hawaii, I'm really talking about all of Ka'anapali but right in front of the Westin is no better or worse than any other place in Ka'anapali unless you want to walk right out of your hotel and snorkel which is pretty good at Blackrock (which again, is not a far walk from the Westin). The pools and slides are beautiful, great too - plenty of room to swim around through waterfalls, into a little cave pool area, etc. Our daughter loved it. Lots of pool chairs and only sort of had trouble finding an open one the first day we were there (we did find a spot for the whole family so it wasn't a problem). I'm not a spa guy but did go there the last day we were there because it was raining. It was really really nice. Probably on par with other great hotel spas but I was very impressed. If it wasn't Hawaii and the beaches and pools weren't so awesome, I would probably have spent more time in the spa/ fitness center because it was so nice, relaxing, clean, quiet, etc. My wife got a couple massages there and said it was great. So, in summary on the positives, the place is really, really nice. It felt worth what I paid but in the eyes of the Westin, I probably got a lot more than I paid for because of the upgrade. On the negatives - the past 10 days felt very very crowed. I think they were bursting at the seams (which I why I was so amazed that we got the better room). I don't mind a lot of people at a place but it meant that the personalized service/ attention (other than those I mentioned) was difficult for them to deliver on. They got you what you needed and did respond to issues (see below) but I think they could have used a few more people to man the front desk, etc. I've been to other resorts in Hawaii where you come in, they put a flower lei on you, they give you something refreshing to drink, give you a cold towel, sit you down and explain everything to you and make you feel special at check-in. Here, they have to get you through quick because there were so many people waiting to be helped at all hours of the day. Parking was cramped but when it was full, they gave you free valet so you never had a problem getting a spot. However, the spaces were very close together (similar to other places in West Maui). I recommend not getting anything larger than a full size car if you stay here because of the tight parking spaces. We did have problems with our toilet. It just could handle any toilet paper going down it (similar to South America or some places in Europe I've been to). I'm almost positive this was an isolated incident to our room but we had to have them come 6 times to unclog it. We even had to use the bathrooms near the Ono grill instead of our room because of the problem. They always came promptly to take care of it but it was a little annoying/ embarrassing having to call almost every morning to have them come take care of it. A relatively small sacrifice to pay for such a great room but if I had paid for the room outright, this would have really made me upset. We did see one cockroach. The body of it was about 1 1/2 inches long. It was right outside our room and we shewed it away so, as far as we know, it wasn't in our room while we were but unfortunately, when we shewed it away, it ran under our neighbor's door - sorry! Positive/ negative - the buffet breakfast was totally awesome but it better be because it was $30/ per person. Fortunately our 3yr old was free. I know this is pretty standard cost-wise for breakfast buffets at nice resorts but it still always feels steep to me. They have an alternative in the resort where you can get a la carte items and only spend about $15/ person to get a decent breakfast. Despite the cost, we ate at the buffet almost every morning and I don't regret it at all. The selection was great, food was great but the bonus at the Westin that is better than other nicer resort $30 buffets I've ponied up for was the view. If they tell you or you ask for it, you can get ocean view seating (they seat you where the Tropica restaurant is). So great to sit there in the morning and have breakfast with the family next to the ocean. Tropica restaurant was pretty good. We only ate there one night so we could experience all the other great places nearby (Roy's, Leilani's upstairs and down, the Hula grill, etc.). At Tropica, I did the tasting menu which I now kind of regret because the main course was steak (I like steak but this one seemed to have some sort of alcohol base in the sauce which was too overpowering). The big positive surprise was the baked Hawaii. I wasn't expecting anything but this was delicious! I liked it even better than Roy's molten chocolate cake or the Hula pie at Leilani's. So, a total tangent to the Westin review but the perfect meal in Ka'anapali is Roy's regular green's salad (the creamy sauce is great), the Walu (if they have it) at the Hula grill and then baked Hawaii at Tropica. In summary, it was a great trip thanks to the upgrade from Aliko - otherwise, I think I would have felt shorted. Five stars for this experience at the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Completely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Maggie A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Maui for our 5 yr anniv. When we arrived we were told the only king avail was over the cafe so we compromised with a double for an amazing view. To say the least the room was filthy, we even requested for someone to come up and re-clean. We also had maid service everyday but they never cleaned thoroughly just "refreshed". Stains on the floor, sticky soda on the ceiling, bar, bathroom floor, etc. An accumulation of dust had formed on the door, as well as finger prints, water stains. The bathroom tub was dirty, the floors were disgusting and we wore our shoes the entire time. We did eventually complain to a manager who responded with thanks for your feedback and here's some points. On our last day we woke up to sheets covering the hallway to soak up blood from an incident over the night. They finally came to steam clean 8 hours later. There was also blood in the lobby that was still there when we checked out at 10am. The grounds were beautiful including the pools. The restaurants were great also. But we will not be returning to the Westin Resort on Maui anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of my own fault”
Reviews.Author: Sue J
Reviews.Content: So, I'm used to the Carribean Islands, and decided to try the Hawaiian Islands for a change. I knew Maui would be more quiet than some of the others and I hate the idea of skyscrapers on a beautiful island, so Maui it was. The room was okay, but this resort is so big that I felt like I was stuck in a German sardine can. There were three pools but none of them were big. If you didn't get up really early and reserve your chairs, you might not get a spot. Pools are way too crowded. Food is not good enough. I don't care that it was expensive , but expensive and crappy food is not okay. If you have an endless supply of money, don't mind paying $12 for a watered down drink, poor food and thirty to sixty dollars for a pool or beach cabana or lounge chairs, then this is your paradise. Everyone is between 50 and 70. The resort bars shut down by 11pm. Again, I hate people who whine about how expensive a place is without doing any research . I knew this was an expensive place to go. What I don't like is spending well over 15 thousand for a 3 week vacation and not enjoying myself. I'm heading back to Barbados where the beaches are wide and endless miles of white silk, lots of things to do during the day and night. More bang for your buck, just a longer flight .Good luck to you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mcoleary
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much! Stayed for 10 days in a premium oceanview room. Great views! Room very comfortable for us, 2 adults and one child. Service at hotel was excellent. Thanks to Jasmine O - front desk manager for making our stay extra special! My daughter loved the pool and waterside, being close to whalers village was convenient. We attended the luau at the hotel it was great fun! Definetly recommend this hotel We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: NB007
Reviews.Content: After having to wait until 4:30pm for my room to be ready, I was already starting to dislike the way people are handled at this â€œresortâ€� as its called. The room I purchased said, and I quote â€œOcean View. Panoramic View Of Pacific and neighbor Islandsâ€�. What a downright , and outright lie. All I have is a panoramic view of the roof of the bar, and a glimpse of water.. at nearly $500 p/night this hotel rips people off. I rang and complained and all I was offered by management was worse rooms, and when I mentioned that the room description she said she would speak with her superior to have it altered so it better matched reality!.. doesnâ€™t help me much.. but hopefully the next person wont get robbed like I did. Great way to spend the first night of our honeymoon. Yes the pool and garden area are nice, but unfortunately outside of that all I have seen is rude staff and highly overpriced, out-dated rooms with very dishonest room descriptions. DO NOT STAY HERE this is barely a 3 star motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: DrZ38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at the Westin on our recent vacation, Many of the points in other reviews held true, but I will review our experience in deference to how things went for us. Parking- As you see in almost every review, it is very tight and most of it is built for mini-Coopers. We only had a couple of times we could not find a place, and the hotel was very accomodating about valet; didn't even charge me for the first night when I used valet on purpose for check in. HINT- go to the last row in self-parking if you have a SUV or bigger car. The spaces are larger, particularly against the back fence. Overview- Very pretty property with a nice lagoon with pink flamengos. Good layout to get to everything and no real problem getting around. Only 5 minutes from Lahaina and 10 from Kapalua. Give yourself 45-50 minutes from the main airport as there is only one road and plenty of traffic. Only consistent service gripe was that it look usually 1-2 minutes for someone to pick up on the Guest Service line whenever you called. I guess it's just a busy place. Check In- No surprise here that we did not get an upgrade even with Starwood Preferred statud and AMEX Platinum booking. They weren't mean about it, but don't expect them to go out of their way to help you find an upgraded room. If you want a better room, better book it. Room- Mehh. It was ok, pretty much like rooms I stay in weekly for business. View was very nice. We were on the 7th floor for an Ocean View room and looked out over the lagoon and out to the ocean. Lagoon and birds are noisy if you plan to keep the sliding door open, but drowned out most of the noise when closed. Room definitely needs a makeover; new paint, fixtures, carpet, would help. Bed was the Heavenly Bed, which was very comfortable which is always important. I give Westin props for always investing here. Resaurants- I did not each the $35 breakfast buffet so cannot comment, though it looked good. We ate at Tropica the first night and got a table on the beach (or on the golf grass in front of it). Everything was fanstastic and definitely recommend going there. We also ate at the Hula Grill next door at the Whaler's Village, which was also very good and I recommend it. Leilana's is also quite good in the same place. Beach/Pool- Didn't really get in the pool, but they looked great. Rented a cabana for the beach and had great service all day. Pretty cheap (only $60 for the whole day) and worth it to have better service and some privacy. You can look right out to the Molokai and we saw a number of whales throughout the day. Check out- This is the one place they get a 0, or 1 star if I have to. Called for help with bags. After 15 minutes, called again. After another 10 minutes, gave up and hauled down bags ourselves. My wife let them have it the desk. Better service needed here. Overall, it was a very nice time, and the negatives were not enough to detract from our experience. I would have expected a little better from Westin, but I think this hotel is extremely busy and well used, and they have not taken to effort to renovate where needed. Service could use an upgrade if they ever aspire to add a star to their rating. It is average with some bright spots (restaurants, valet, and beach) and lows (front desk, Guest Service,a dn bell service). Probably will go back to the Grand Wailea next time on Maui or stay at the Ritz in Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Joe H
Reviews.Content: We just got back from getting married at the westin maui, sarah snider was a huge help in making this happen. they gave us a nice room for the wedding night and when we showed up there was rose pedals all over the room and a bottle of wine for us to enjoy. Everyone at the front desk was helpful and nice to deal with. The grounds for this resort were so nice we enjoyed every minute. You can see whales off in the distance right from the beach, the restaurants were amazing, i had one of the best steaks in my life at tropica. Having whalers village right next door for shpping and cheaper food was great as well. my only complaint was having to leave!!! cant wait to come back to maui it was truly paradise on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha spirit is the best!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel206
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th or 10th stay at the Westin Maui. And we definitely intend on going back. This is a great hotel for families with teens. Whaler's Village is close for restaurants, shopping and free hula shows. There are pleny of activities to participate in right at the hotel or on the beach --- paddleboarding, scuba lessons, snorkeling trips, whale watching, etc. Don't miss Michael Schenk the agricultural specialist the the hotel. Besides selling the most delicious pineapples --- Maui Gold -- and even more importantly, he is one of the reasons we come back. He takes the time to connect with our children teaching them all sorts of things -- not just about pineapples and our children look for him each year. He remembers them from year to year. This year we had lots of wonderful attention from Mandy and Ronzine at the bell desk, Carlito and Faith at Tropica for our daily breakfast buffet, Katie and Nene by the pool. Our only disappointment was to have our first room looking over the garbage dumpster and hearing early morning delivery trucks for the Whaler's Village. We love the location --- with a great beach right off the property and snorkeling at Black Rock -- this year there were lots of turtles at Black Rock. We also love Gemini Charters for whale watching and snorkeling trips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved seeing the whales in the ocean from the balconey”
Reviews.Author: followsun
Reviews.Content: My husaband and I spent a week in Jan 2012 at the Westin. Very nice hotel with lovely pool area. We spent our days at the adult pool. We first had a mountain view room which was nice as we would have coffee in the morning sun on the balconey. After two nights, my husband decided to surprize me and upgraded for the ocean view just to watch for whales, because I get fascinated and excited to see the whales and it was enjoyable to watch from the balconey. The Westin is next door to the Whalers Village Shopping Complex with restaurants and a food court.. The Westin is pretty central on the Ka'anapali Parkway. In the evenings, we would stroll on the beach sidewalk, which you can go in both direction to see all the hotels/condo on the beach. Lots of places to eat and have drinks. We would stay here again!! From Edmonton, AB

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jakegreen
Reviews.Content: Though a little crowded, they make it easy to relax and enjoy everything from the beach and pools to a great daily brunch with great whale-watching views. The beds were comfortable; the lanais were a little dated but the hotel was clean and in good shape with fun pools, attractive grounds and easily accessible activities (though a little pricier than going into Lahaina for the same rentals and trips.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing trip to paradise”
Reviews.Author: xrciznut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled frequently to Maui and have stayed at the Westin many times over the years. However more recently we have been staying hotels in the Wailea area and decided to go back to the Ka'anapali side and stay at a hotel we frequented often. Upon arrival we noted that the grounds were still quite beautiful and were greeted warmly and escorted the the "newer" Beach Tower where we used to stay many years ago. We are Starwood preferred guests and expected a nicer room and good location but to our dismay our room was close to the elevator, over looking the top of a pavillion and part of a pool area and had a partial ocean view. While we were not thrilled with our view we were even more disturbed with the cleanliness of the room. The furniture was extremely dusty, there were numerous finger prints and marks on the door, greasy looking areas on the headboard, a marble shelf next to a coffee station with sticky residue and a rusted cracking cabinet that housed a refrigerator. A dirty decorator pillow and the frosting on the cake was finding some prior guests underwear still on a shelf in the closet!!!!!!! We tried changing rooms but were told they were completely booked and had to have housekeeping come three times before it was acceptable. Additionally through all of the complaining it was very difficult to get through to guest services to even get attention and had to literally go downstairs to the front desk to complain. Next problem was the restaurant Tropica with cold food and beyond slow service that made our first night the beginning of a disappointing trip to paradise. The pool areas are beautiful but crowded with the most uncomfortable chairs, no cushions unless you want to rent a cabana you cannot get a cushion!! The highlight of this hotel are the bellmen, valet's who have been there for many years and still are extremely helpful personable and cheerful. Unfortunately that cannot be said for the rest of management who after all of our concerns only response was sorry for your concerns and hope you will return and we can do better! Well I think that is NOT going to happen as we will take our travels to Maui elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “fun stay”
Reviews.Author: MAamyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in different places while in Hawaii and really liked the stay at the Westin. The lobby was nice, the kids liked the pools and waterslide, and we were close to snorkeling at Black Rock. We actually saw fish and a few things (squid?) while snorkeling right in front of the hotel. The beach out front was a soft sand and had waves for the kids to ride. Our room looked pretty new and was clean and comfortable with a small refrigerator. Our only disappointment was that we are SPG gold members and we were hoping for an upgrade from a mountain view to ocean view and didn't get one (we always seem to get one with Marriott). We stayed with points so I'm not sure about the cost but it was a relaxing, enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome amenities and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beachbumjk
Reviews.Content: Maui Westin Resort greets you with a shell lei at the door, followed by a great Koi pond, and awesome waterfall. From there you can wander about the many pools and waterslide, that includes an adult pool area and 4 family pools. The staff was friendly and quick to assist. Drink and snack prices were as would be expected for a resort of this nature. All in all it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all over again!”
Reviews.Author: buddybutler
Reviews.Content: We did a week here in February a year ago and had such a terrific time we booked it again. And it was as good if not better this time! We like to kick back and relax and the Westin makes it pretty easy. The hotel was full -- it was leading up to Washington's birthday weekend. Although it was busy it never felt anywhere close to jam-packed. It didn't hurt that we got a generous Starwood upgrade to a junior suite in the Beach tower that included an extra spacious bathroom. Hotel staff remembered my wife's birthday with a beautiful cake and a pricey bottle of champagne! The room was perfectly quiet at night, and had a spectacular ocean front view. We could sit in our sitting room, look out the balcony and see whales breaking! My wife and I were both hooked on fish tacos for lunch served poolside. The fish was mahi mahi, perfectly fresh. The servers, Lupe and Allison, both remembered us from last year! They took great care of us. Parking was never an issue; valet parking was free when self-parking got full at night. Last year our vacation highlight was a concert by Elton John at the MACC center. This year we took a recommendation to see Warren and Annabelle's magic show in Lahaina and it was hilarious and amazing. We are still convinced that the Westin's location is one of its best assets, within reasonably walking distance of shopping and plenty of restaurants -- even a McDonald's Express and a submarine sandwich shop. My only gripe -- I wish the pools were heated a bit warmer. At a large property like this it's not easy making everybody happy. But when I look around at the Westin I sure don't see any unhappy faces. We'll be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Onion bar and grill service rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: cohen71
Reviews.Content: Donna our server at onos bar and grill was not only fast but extremely friendly. I highly recommend going there for happy hour!!

Reviews.Title: “Great overall location next to Whalers Village and is a beachfront property.”
Reviews.Author: Nona4
Reviews.Content: The location of this resort is one of the best! We had great whale watching right from our lanai. There are several restaurants and many stores at Whalers Village. (If this is your first time in Hawaii make sure you check out the ABC stores where you can get almost anything at a reasonable price- there is one at Whalers Village). The reason I did not give this resort a 5/Excellent rating is I the room we occupied showed it's "age"....it is an older resort and the bathrooms are very small (at least ours was). The sink and the adjacent area over the "bar type refrigerator" with coffee pot was very small. The beds were lovely, comfortable Heavenly Beds. Overall, I'd say the room was smaller than we expected for the price; however, that said, this is Maui and this is a prime location. We stayed during whale watching season and the hotel was at 100% occupancy. We were in the Ocean Tower and the rooms may be newer and larger in one of the other Towers. All this said, I would return to this resort and request the same room because of the view! Despite the full occupancy we never had difficulty getting a lounge chair at the pool; yes, there are chair hogs that leave their things on a chair and then disappear - but despite this we could always find a nice location with sun for me and shade for my husband. There is a very large and expansive pool area, a more private location for adults only and other areas with great water slides for children. Currently, there is some renovation going on but we did not find this a distraction.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: Horrible Hotel. Railings on balconies rusty. Management & staff rude. Food mediocre quality. They let birds eat the food off the buffet while your serving yourself. The service is slow. The staff doesn't know how to use the computers so the edit your bills with incorrect amounts (so they can make larger tips). They run out of towels daily at pool. They over charge for crappy beach chair service. They are constantly doing construction and making noise early in the am. The rooms have horrible sounds through out the night from other rooms. The maids barely clean the rooms. The internet is sporadic which is supposed to be free. The pool staff is not friendly, rather rude when asking for help. 90% of the concierges have no clue what they are talking about and all they want to do is book you to listen to the time share pitch at the westin villas. the spa treatment staff talk during your whole massage or treatment. bottom line there is a hyatt right down the beach that is way better or a ritz up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, wonderful service, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Alanna S
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin Maui was lovely. We booked through Westjet so we unfortunately had separate beds. And the room was a bit dated. But that's all par for the course when you are staying at a hotel with vacancy rates as low as this one! We would visit again in a heartbeat - the grounds are stunning, and the lobby will make your jaw drop as soon as you walk through the doors (doors? what doors?). One of the concierges, Yvonne Geving, went above and beyond to make us reservations at great dinner spots. The dinners and the day trips made us feel like we stayed for 2 weeks instead of just 1 -- thanks Yvonne! From Alanna and Cory.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place...The Down Side”
Reviews.Author: Smithills
Reviews.Content: The down side was that we only booked for one week. We rented a car, but didn't use it very much so there is so much within walking distance. Anyway, a wonderful resort with a wonderful staff. I don't understand the people on here that complain about the cost of things. You're in a waterfront resort in Maui. If you want to spend less, move inland or stay home. We're booking for two weeks next year. We won't bother with a rental car for the first week, we will make use of the car in week two. By the way, we highly recommend the Blue Hawaiian Helicopter tours, it is worth every penny. Anyway, enjoy. We certainly did, and will again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “I love the heavenly bed.”
Reviews.Author: marieglodt
Reviews.Content: Aloha from Maui, I have to admit it has been many years since I have stayed at the Westin, Maui. One of the things that I always love is that heavenly bed. It is so comfortable you just don't want to get out of bed. Their robes are really comfortable too. This is one of the things that is such a delight when staying at a deluxe property such as the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. Marie Glodt Travel to Maui

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Indyboy_10
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 5 day stay at the Westin Maui. From the minute you walk in and see the great waterfalls and ponds to the great service by all of the staff. Room was very nice and always meticulously cleaned everyday. About the only negative was the really high prices at the in-house 'Starbucks". $ 19.00 for a tea, coffee and 2 small snack bars!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: We recently returned for our second visit based on our previous excellent experience. On this occassion we were accompanied by 3 other couples to share in my 65th birthday celebration. Once again we found the staff to be extraordinary and the accommodation superb. Our friends have indicated this was one of their best travel experiences. We'll be heading back with the knowledge our expectations will be exceeded. WELL DONE STAFF!!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Mpolonica P
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel we will stay in again and again and again. A beautiful home away from home; rooms fantastic and ocean at your doorstep. wonderful lobby and ambience; Katie (in charge of fun at the pool) was a great part of our enjoyable experiences. great central location to restaurants and whalers village shopping. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite”
Reviews.Author: gretchstars
Reviews.Content: Can't believe I waited so long to review. My boyfriend and I have stayed here 3 times now and we love it. The rooms are nice (upgrade to full ocean view), the staff is great, and the pool is wonderful. You can walk the beach and have so many shops and eateries within walking distance. We don't love the beach, but mostly due to wind & they charge you to use their chairs there. Other than that, we recommend this hotel to everyone we know, and I am sure we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay! Great Service”
Reviews.Author: William A
Reviews.Content: Never having visited Maui before we didn't know what to expect but the room was great, view was excellent, and service was wonderful. Tropica Restaurant manager Eric and server Lorraine went way beyond the call of duty to make sure that our Valentine's dinner on the beach was perfect and that we were treated like royalty. We loved the pools, the water slide, and really enjoyed the convenience of being so close to Whalers' Village shopping area as well as being just down the beach from a perfect snorkeling site at Black Rock. Literally everything we wanted to see or do on Maui was within easy walking distance or available by taking the free resort shuttle into Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Westin”
Reviews.Author: hitechwoman
Reviews.Content: Very busy with a lot of small children. Pretty loud around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation in 20 Years”
Reviews.Author: genny r
Reviews.Content: We just west to Maui for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and booked the Beach Towers which we stayed in 2006 and loved the view. Our view was not what we hoped and had requested so Alix Morris located the perfect room with a fabulous view and moved us the next morning. Thanks to her outstanding customer service we had the best trip in 20 years. Everything was first class. I can't describe how perfect our view was. Stay at the Westin, the view is great, shopping at the Whalers' is so convenient--we found all our special buys there.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hawaii, amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: sox311
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our first anniversary on our first ever trip to Hawaii in May/June 2011. We felt it was heaven on Earth. The hotel is beautiful, from the grounds to the pool and beach. We did not get an ocean view to save some money, we weren't in the room enough to justify the extra couple hundred dollars a night. But we did check out the ocean view in some friends we met room and it was amazing, truly beautiful. The rooms were very clean and a good size. Pool- The pool is amazing, it was a great time with plenty of room to lay out and relax when we were there. We only ate the pool side food once but it was the chicken nachos, and they were very very good, especially for pool food. Drinks were pricy at the pool. But you could walk into the hotel and buy cheaper beers from the gift shop and take them out there. But the best move we made was buying booze and mixers at a store in town and making drinks and taking them to the pool with us. Lots of Malibu rum and Hawaiian Sun drinks! They were great! Bring a small collapsible cooler with you to bring drinks down to the pool with you, or buy one for around seven bucks at the store. There was a nice bar just off the pool as well to watch some sports and belly up to the bar. It was a great group of people it seemed, not too many kids. We are both around 30 and we met many people to have fun with if we wanted, but we spent most of our time spending it together. There were a lot of pregnant women on baby-moons and they had a great time. Location - The location was amazing. Whalers Village right next door with all sorts of restaurants and shops. Hula Grill, Leilani's, and Kane and Taro right next door for great food as well as the in house restaurants and Starbucks. It had everything we needed and wanted. We were a twenty minute drive to Lahina for all the shops, galleries, restaurants and just overall awesome time. We ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise which was great, the Lahina Pizza Company was over priced. The beach walk right in front was a great way to see the beach. Just to the right, looking at the ocean, past Whalers Village is a little hut to rent snorkeling and other sports equipment. Just a ten minute walk takes you to the Black Rock where the snorkeling is wonderful. Enjoy! We took a boat out to Molokai to snorkel. It was ok, a little pricy considering there was a great place to snorkel just a ten minute walk away. The parking was good. If you got in late at night or when they were packed they would valet at no additional cost. We arrived and check in went well, the lobby is beautiful. We went to our room and it was on the third floor overlooking the parking lot. I didn't like this so called and asked for a change, they changed us the next day to a room on a higher floor which was much better, however, we were right next to an elevator which was actually very disturbing. But we dealt with it because we didn't want to move again. One night the fire alarm went off and we had to evacuate. It was a trek, but it was a small kitchen fire or something like that. So, no big deal. This was the best trip of our lives, and we have a trip to Kauai' planned for next month. We could have eaisly gone back to the Westin, but wanted to try a new place out. Book here and love eery minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Westin, Maui (Ka'anapali)”
Reviews.Author: Elspur
Reviews.Content: Travelled from 15 feb to 19 Feb (4 days) at very expensive rate $349 per night, but included breakfast, was able to get free upgrade to ocean view room because it was my birthday. Hotel REALLY nice, clean rooms, kind of on the small side for the price, but very safe, nice service, concierge and front desk kind of slow. Breakfast buffet was awesome, we ate tons and took apples for our lunch, excellent location near Whalers Village and Black rock beach for snorkelling, where we saw turtles. Self parking included in resort fee as was internet, but internet connection extremely slow. a sofa in the room would have been much better than an easy chair. beautiful pool but kind of stingey on the towel service

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui--not that great”
Reviews.Author: sam m
Reviews.Content: This Westin property has been very neglected. It is old and dated, and it's showing all of the signs of aging. The rooms are very small and smelly. The carpets are very worn. And even though the grounds are beautiful, you can still tell that they have not done any major renovations on this place for the past 20 yrs. That being said, however, it does look like they are remodeling some portions of the hotel. The parking is a nightmare. Supposedly included in the $25/night resort fee is "free" self parking. If you do manage to snag a spot, it will be very tight squeeze in a lot where the asphalt has been totally damaged by tree roots. But worry not, you won't be able to find a spot, therefore, you will be forced to valet. Whereupon, you will be charged another $17 or so. While I understand that a lot of hotel properties have now succumbed to charging resort fees, I think that the Westin does not offer anything "extra" for this fee. It is supposed to include the wifi (super slow), parking (impossible to find of spot), and bottled water (ours was never restocked). I would not stay at this Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Swensonjuj
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place to stay right on the ocean with beautiful amenities and plenty of opportunity to explore this beautiful get away. The lodging itself was gorgeous enough not to speak of the setting. Very comfortable room that had a jacuzzi in the bath that could open up to the room to sit and look out the window to the ocean. Very nice lanai to sit and soak in the atmosphere as well. We only ate at one spot and spent most of our time exploring Lahaina for eating establishments. The resort is close enough to take day trips away and see the sites of Maui. We enjoyed both the beach and the pool. The staff there was very accomodating. We were celebrating a birthday and I wanted to have fresh flowers in the room and they arranged that very nicely for me and included an "unasked" for small birthday cake for my traveling companion. They went all out to make it a wonderful stay, my only regret is that we only spent 3 days there and then were off to Oahu. In retrospect I wish our week would have been on Maui. It is a much more of a relaxing and less hurried atmosphere than we found on Oahu. It depends on what you are looking for. As for the Westin, do stay!

Reviews.Title: “Typical large hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerry448
Reviews.Content: Showing some wear and some remodeling in process. Staff very courteous. Self park fills up at night so have to use valet. Windy weather conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Vacation”
Reviews.Author: gt2hvit
Reviews.Content: The Westin was recommended to me by a friend but like you I read some pretty negative reviews on the property so went a bit sceptical. First, book thru Costco. They are the biggest seller of HI resorts in the U.S. This means that when you book (and of course pay the big money) for an ocean view, you get it. If not you call Costco from your cell at the front desk. They will correct it. The property in general is what you would expect from Westin...beautiful grounds and good service. What is not typical Westin is the lack of attention to upkeep and cleanliness of the rooms. You can see that the landscape and common areas is where the revenue re-investment goes. We had a very nice premium ocean view room that had seen a lot of turn over without a good cleaning. Stained carpet, dusty, dirty walls and a bathroom that had not been sanitized since...well who knows. I had them send housekeeping after we unpacked but not a lot improved. The bottom line is that any Maui resort is going to cost you plenty and you will be lucky to find the perfect room. What you will find is a beautiful island, incredible waters and a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: smpkg28
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. What a vacation! The hotel lobby is incredible with lagoons, waterfalls, hidden walkways, birds and fish. We were greeted with shell necklaces upon arrival. The rooms were comfortable and clean. We had a great view of the ocean. February - March is definitely the time to visit. You can see the whales right from the hotel!! The pools are pristine, the grounds are beautiful and you are right on the ocean. Food at the hotel was pricy but delicious. If you can rent a car and eat off the resort, you are better off. Right beside the hotel is the Whaler's Village which has tons of shops for groceries, gifts and clothes...even high end chains like Coach and LV. If your flight home is not until later in the day, be sure to ask for access to a hospitality suite where you can shower etc before heading to the airport. There is also a photographer at the hotel who will do photo shoots with you. You get a free 4x6 and then they try to upgrade you. Prices were reasonable. The best little gem is the hotel gift shop...the one to the LEFT as you walk into the lobby. We bought a ton of souvenirs here that were exactly the same price that we paid for off the resort. Don't waste your time shopping around! There is also a complimentary shuttle that takes you into Lahaina...well worth the trip. MAHALO Maui! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Defender09
Reviews.Content: So I did it again. I took my daughter back to Maui. The Westin treated me exceptionally well. They gave me the luxury suite again and I rewarded them with 6 nights there. The property is beautiful, right on the beach, and the brunch is delicious. They are still hard on the late checkouts but when they give you a 1300 square foot room? How do you complain? The latest I could get was 1pm. I will be back. Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: I agree with Mary Chico that this is not what you would expect of a Westin, though I'm starting to doubt Starwood in general these days. I'll start with the positive. First, the location is good, and the common areas are pretty and fairly well kept. The pool areas are fine. The rooms all have balconies, which is nice. Those are really the only highlights. The rooms and especially the bathrooms were pretty gross. Our bathroom had such a strong mildew smell to it I searched for a hidden wet towel that had gone un-noticed. The tub was dirty, the door was institutional, and the decor was just depressing. I have seen nicer bathrooms in hospitals. The cleaning staff did a very cursory job of cleaning each day. Even more shocking was that they didn't actually clean the rooms until the afternoon. On our first full day, our room remained unclean until 2:30 PM. They barely make the bed for you and don't straighten anything, so I am unclear as to what takes so long. There is nothing even close to turndown service. For the first two nights, our cleaning lady's scent- a mixture of soap and bad perfume- permeated the room and the sheets. The service across the board was almost laughably bad. When I complained about the stench in the bathroom and the cleanliness of the room, they said they would have to call me back, but never did. A couple days later, we asked for some cotton swabs and they said they would have them sent to our room. They never did. I'm a Starwood Gold member, so I thought that may invite some concern for our happiness, but it only got us an unsolicited sales pitch for a new property they are building nearby. The room came out to be over $400/ night, so it was a fairly high price to pay for such poor service and a terrible room. I really would recommend looking elsewhere. We thought about moving to a different hotel, but the island was pretty busy. It's just a shame that they get away with this.

Reviews.Title: “It's an excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Jalpa S
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful resort properties around. Excellent service, friendly staff, beautiful views, great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Grimy, packed with people, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: maryChico
Reviews.Content: This is NOT your normal Westin Hotel, don't be fooled into thinking it is quality because of the name. The hotel is dated, has a grimy feel, is incredibly busy, huge, packed with people; not anything like a relaxing Hawaiian resort should be. We were booked for eight days, left after two and moved next door. Had to wait for a room to vacate next door or we would have been out of there on day one. Room was dingy, cramped, and SO loud! The only plus was the shower head, but even that was hard to enjoy because tub didn't drain well and standing in six inches of water took away the pleasure. This is a conference hotel, not an individual stay resort. There were three conventions there when we were booked. Our friends were at other Westin on Maui, Westin Garden Inn, I think was the name, and it's beautiful, well maintained, and a much better alternative if you must stay at a Westin. Don't waste any money staying here, unless you are clear as what to expect.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “1st time in Maui. Incredible.”
Reviews.Author: Joel N
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and we loved it. We went with friends who were attending an OB/GYN conference that was also held at the Westin. Our housekeeper Virgina Go was excellent. She kept our room clean and well stocked. She knew us by name and it was always a blast to see her. Two other people who deserve special mention are Ely and Aida at the omelet station. I enjoyed talking to them every morning. Ask for the Ely special, its delicious. Concierge was very helpful and made awesome recommendations for trips. All the way around this was a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Somapesu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the westin. We paid extra on booking for an ocean view room and were glad we did as the view was beautiful. After seeing the grand lobby, we were a little surprised with the room - which was a little dated. However the beds were really comfy & we didn't spend much time in them anyway. The pool area is fantastic & the location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Customer Experience”
Reviews.Author: r w
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Westin Maui as frequent visitors to this resort. Once again we had a great time. One memorable item worth mentioning is the great guest experience that you get at the Westin Maui. One staff member in particular is Joven. He is very friendly and knowledgeable with a "can do" attitude. Joven provided us with exceptional customer service our first day there and was always willing to provide us with information on making our stay the most enjoyable. Joven knows alot about the Islands and travel in general. When you talk about the Westin Maui, you have to say World Class.

Reviews.Title: “It is just like home.”
Reviews.Author: Saltzman63
Reviews.Content: We always feel like we are at home. We travel to Maui every December and have been doing it for nine years. The Management and staff are more than accommodating, nothing is too much trouble. Our House-keeper Josefina, who has looked after us so well every year. She always has a smile on her face. Senior Sous Chef John.M.King and his team including Michael Wong, went above and beyond to make sure that my child, who has developed a major food sensitivity and is now on an extremely restricted diet, safe and over the moon with amazing meals. We also dined most nights at Tropica, Eric Wardell the new Manager with Ikaika Manaku and their wonderful caring staff. We dined there only once in the past, many years ago and found it over priced and very average food. Now it is number3 restaurant on the island and amazing. Thanks also to Gigi Gaea, Nathan Davis, Katie Fruean, April Phillips, Sean Ganhinhin, Nathan Neiwman. We can't wait to return in December 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: aerainier
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip 11 months in advance and traveled with family with a total of 9 people total, 3 of them kids. I sent the guest manager, Sean an email a month prior to our trip to let him know this was our first trip with a Starwood Property and that we were very excited to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary during this trip. Upon arrival, we were greeted by several valet attendants who all welcomed us with huge smiles and helped us with the kids and our bags. At check in, I was excited to learn we had been upgraded to an Ocean View room by Sean. Will brought our bags up to our room and gave us a quick yet detailed run down of the property and what to do and how to get there. Our room was fantastic! Great view of the ocean, the pools and the whales every morning! We went out for dinner shortly after for less than two hours and returned to find a delicious cake and a bottle of champagne waiting for us!!! Thanks Westin! That was the best birthday I had ever had, HANDS DOWN! And that was just the first night. We enjoyed some relaxation time in the pools with the kids the first night after a long day of flying. The second day, we retrieved our vehicle from valet and the attendants told us some Road to Hana tips and even loaned us a CD with a guided tour to help us on the trip. Each and every hotel employee that we came in contact with had a smile on their face and made us feel like we were at home and were the most important person on property. The people who claim everyone was rude or unconcerned with them, I can only think that you get what you receive. Smile at someone, and someone will smile back. On occasion, the line at the front desk was long and the process seemed a bit tedious. If you want something quicker, check and see if you can find a Holiday Inn near by and go there if that's the biggest concern you have. YOU ARE ON VACATION. IN HAWAII. RELAX. The rooms are great, the beds somewhat heavenly, I am pretty picky when it comes to beds and I slept like a baby on them. The rooms were quiet, which is a huge deal for me as I am a light sleeper. The fridge was a great plus to have in the room to keep drinks cold, and a few snacks on hand with the kids. My brother in law even got a microwave in his room to warm food and formula up for their daughter. I was never concerned with anyone jumping on to my patio to break into my room, not from the 9th floor, and I wouldn't have from the 2nd floor either. The sliding glass door has two very suitable locks. Use them if you feel it necessary. The only problem I had with the property involved the internet. I never EVER leave my credit card on file with a hotel after a HORRIBLE problem with another property that you can read about in my other reviews. For some odd reason, not having a card on file prevents you from accessing the free wi-fi that comes with the resort fee. This boggles my mind, because my resort fee had been paid for, why does that not cover my wi-fi? It also covers parking and not having a card on file didn't effect this. I think that is something Westin needs to work out to ensure a better hotel experience. On one occasion, we also didn't get housekeeping while we were out, we left later in the day when they came by I am sure and a quick call to the front desk had it taken care of upon our arrival while we were at dinner. I also think there should be some double checking by housekeeping for rooms that don't get cleaned in the morning because not everyone gets up and our by 10 or 11 AM. Other than those two issues, and the fact that the parking spots are very tight and people don't know how to park in between the lines, this place is spectacular! The staff is wonderful, in fact I have never been to a hotel with a more friendly staff. There is golf right across the way, several amazing restaurants with great seafood. If you need any tips on anything, just ask the valet guys. They know everything! We even left some beach toys we purchased at their stand so if you need them, go borrow them and return them for the next kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tara S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 20-26, 2012. From the moment we drove up to the minute we left we were in heaven! The hotel is beautiful inside and out! Very lush property, decorated with classy, modern, and hawaiian style. Customer service was excellent! We had the best customer service here, and on the entire island, that we have ever had! The food is great! Tropica is terrific, especially at sunset! Ask for Dave as your waiter!!! He is Excellent!!!! The pool is a great place to relax! If you are by the bar, see Joseph! He is great, so are the Mai Tais!!! Lunch is great there, too! If you want the adult only pool, get your chair before 8am...they go fast! Oh, the pools are not heated...the only downside! If you have any special requests for your room or your stay, email the hotel or call, and contact Jasmine. She upgraded our room, had a microwave, and got us into the Beach Tower as we requested. This hotel is on a long strip of beach with many hotels/condos. Very nice walk along the beach or sidewalk. The Whalers Village shopping center is right next door...lots of shopping and great restaurants...Leilanis for dinner (ask for Mea), and Hula grill for nice drinks/lunch/happy hour with live entertainment!! So glad we didn't put too much weight on the negative reviews, but they did allow us information that I was able to get Jasmine to help with in advance! Also, Lahaina Town is only 5-10 minutes away!! Oh, definitely do a whale watching trip if you are there during the season!!! We did 2!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Kurt M
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui and the resort did everything to make the trip wonderful. It was a business trip so my wife got to take advantage of the fabulous spa. Dinners were wonderful although a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Lively or just plain noisy”
Reviews.Author: Chwarae422
Reviews.Content: Check was very slow and I was the only person there and an SPG member- didn't do me any good. First room had a lanai and a roof top at the same level, allowing easy access to my room if people were inclined to jump the rail. This was not a safe option. The front desk staff were simply not pleasant. Second room in the same "renovated' tower, had the ocean view I had paid for but I had to pay more as it was higher up, gone from floor 2 to 6, and this was the ONLY room they would give me, a case of take-it-and-pay or stay-where-you-are. Said they were fully booked but it didn't take much to figure out that was a whopping lie. The interior rooms have the bird noise but really not so bad, however the catering staff setting up breakfast was noisy, or go to the other side overlooking Whalers Village and hear the delivery trucks at silly-o'clock reversing every morning. End result was to close the door and not hear the ocean at all. No happy solution. The beds ceased to be 'heavenly' a long time ago, sheets were thin and grey, towels also were thin and grey. The dual shower head was turning a rather pretty shade of green, maintenance issues not to mention health issues. The room was ok, and big enough, decent wallpaper and paint but not Westin quality. One meal persuaded me to never eat there again, and a Starbucks at $5.95 is ridiculous. The resort fee of $25 plus tax of over $1.00 was supposedly for the wi-fi ( didn't need it), 2 bottles of water, and the privilege of self parking. The pools and interior landscaping were pretty, but at the height of summer you'd be cheek by jowl with whoever is on the next bed. Another indicator that the hotel was not fully booked, even with a small convention there. Right on Ka'anapali Beach and adjacent to Whaler's Village. Is this really a Westin? I wonder.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Spa”
Reviews.Author: tracy m
Reviews.Content: While we were staying at another nearby hotel, I sought out the Westin for their spa and their daily yoga offerings. Compared to the other local top notch spas, the regular price ($145) of a 50 minute massage was very reasonable. But we were very lucky to get an early bird special - you book a massage for 8 or 9 am on any day of the week and the 50 minute massage was 99 plus tip. The non-discounted price was 145. That was a great deal and the massage was wonderful (Kelly was the masseuse's name). The steam room, hot tub and other amenities were lovely. If staying in that area again, I would absolutely book there again - unless of course you want to splurge for a $255 treatment at another spa that includes pineapple scrub. Great staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jordypa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, ok service but very expensive (like most of the island). Would have been fine staying in something cheaper cause everything to do is off the resort property (unless you want to pay extraordinary prices to eat and play at the hotel). Won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lwynnmd
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Westin. While the rooms are a bit smaller than some Westins, the accommodations are still heavenly. The view from our balcony is well worth the upgraded price. I also appreciate that there is basic Internet service included and not the typical $25+/day per device charge. You can pay an additional fee for premium service, but I found the basic service has been adequate. The breakfast buffet at Ono is descent. It's included in our conference package, but I wouldn't pay $27/ person each day. There are many smaller restaurants along the beach that look like good options as well. I love how close we are to Whaler's village. It's a nice mall with a museum as well as less expensive food options if your wallet needs a break from the high prices of Maui restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ed s
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Maui and our first time in a Westin Hotel and I must say we were very impressed.From the moment we arrived the staff was in help mode. Our room was not ready upon our arrival and they provided us with a gift certificate for the resturant. It was our anniversery and upon entering the room was a bottle of champagne. The grounds were impressive, the room was great with a spectacular view.We spent 4 terrific nights and should we every get back we stay there again.Ed s.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Mark986
Reviews.Content: We just spent a wonderful 9 nights at the Westin Maui. The hotel is a few steps from Kaanapli beach and we could hear the peaceful sound of the waves breaking from our room (deluxe ocean view, room 1185). The Westin beds are very comfortable and we slept very well during our stay. The hotel has 4 pools that are beautiful, we only used the pool once during our stay, we took a scuba class with Doug in the pool and then a beach dive at Black Rock. Doug is a excellent instructor, my girlfriend was nervous about diving and her ears hurting, Doug did a great job of calming her nerves and she really enjoyed the lesson and beach dive. Because the beach is so beautiful we spent our time on the beach rather than at the pool. We ate dinner twice at the Tropica restaurant which is part of the Westin. John was our waiter on both occasions. His service was excellent as we're his recommendations. My better half has some food allergies (onion and garlic), with John's advice the chiefs were able to modify their dishes and both our meals were 1st class along with the wine pairing. Â Its was the best meals we have had here on Maui along with Mamas Fish House. We enjoying the buffet breakfast every morning and both Carlito and Nazzy took good care of us. The buffet breakfast really set is up for the day, most days we skipped lunch as we were still full from breakfast. We booked some excursions with Stephanie and Stevie at the Amex office at the Westin. They were both very helpful and knowledgable about all the trips and gave us some great tips. All in all we had a great vacation in Maui and can't wait to come back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the westin when some friends of ours came to visit us here. Being that we live on Maui, we were excited to see and experience this side of the island and this fabulous looking hotel. But, when we arrived, the bell hops and valets were very abrupt. As we toured the grounds and made ourselves familiar with the pools and amenities, it became obvious that the staff were more interested in chatting than they were being polite to their guests. Anyway, the grounds are amazing, but the room was tired, the hallway was cluttered, the staff looked tired at times, or not happy, and one of the staff helped himself to half a subway sandwich that was in the fridge as well as taking the pool towels out of the room before we checked out. We had planned to take a swim. I would avoid this hotel in the meanwhile until they have figured out how to treat their guests. So not impressed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible vacation get away.”
Reviews.Author: Janet F
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Westin for 10 nights in January. We were very pleased with the room and the service. All the staff was very polite and friendly and helpful. We loved the Tropica restaurant and had dinner there several nights. Our waiter, Dave, went above and beyond in his service for us and the restaurant manager, Eric, was superb. He was very knowledgeable and friendly and efficient. I would definitely recommend both the hotel and the restaurant to anyone who would like to have a wonderful vacation experience.
