Even all you locals, the food is ONOlishus....you gonna love it! The chef has a flair for flavor and a style that really makes you feel you have "dined and gone to heaven" Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: FelicePDX
Reviews.Content: The Westin is located on the nicest strip of beach in Kaanapali. The rooms are on the smaller side but very comfortable. Service is impeccable. If you do a massage make sure to do it oceanside instead of inside. My husband and I stayed 21 nights in May, 2010 and liked it so much we returned in May, 2011. Can't recommend this hotel enough although just being in Maui makes everything magical anyway.

Reviews.Title: “$25/day resort fee and now they limit you go 1 towel per day at the pool.”
Reviews.Author: MauiBoy22
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this on my 2nd day if a 14 day trip Things started out poorly. We paid more money this year to get a good room since they won't upgrade Starwood members who purchase rooms via Expedia or ORBITZ. So we spend the extra money for premier deluxe ocean view and we get a handicap room. The front desk said they were full and couldn't move us (the place is as empty as I've ever seen it in the past 12 years). we end up getting moved the next day but the front desk was very rude about it. Then we find out they have a new towel rule at the pool. Only 1 towel per guest. That doesn't even cover the chair! They used to tell me that the resort fee paid for things like pool towels etc. I guess now that only covers 1 towel. On top of that, the pool towel manager was very rude in explaining that to me. What the hell? Is this a Westin or a Super 8? You seriously have to question a management team that could make that kind of customer service decision. The rumor is that this hotel is owned by private investors and that the Westin in only managing it for them. The Westin brand us making a huge mistake if that's true. I've been a Starwood customer for years but am considering a switch to another brand... Especially in Maui

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered!”
Reviews.Author: Two4ruffin
Reviews.Content: It had been a few years since I have been back to Maui and was looking for a relaxing vacation. The Westin Maui was exactly what was needed and the staff delivered at every level. I am a Platinum Member of SPG and they upgraded my room to a beautiful ocean view luxury suite which by far is the best place that I have ever stayed. The level of treatment from the valet to the front desk to the concierge was hospitable and the level that you would expect at the highest end resorts.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Westin Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: jennifer529
Reviews.Content: First impression was not good! Arrived at night , after a long flight...checked in and was not given room we had booked! Went to bed and spent the next day being moved around and finally were given an ocean front after 4 tries!!! I'm sorry, when you pay for an upgrade, you should get it!! Booked through COSTCO.com and they were more helpful with getting what we booked, NOT the Westin staff! After a useless first day, we were able to start our vacation...resort is beautiful....we booked a 1 bedroom and was very spacious and modern. Enjoyed going to Whaler's Village to shop and watch a beautiful sunset at Hula Grill. Went back twice!! Black Rock was great for snorkeling..if you go to the Westin Resort and Spa...you can walk right to Black Rock! Tons of fish and a few sea turtles! Calm water! Road to Hanna was long and myself and daughter were kinda car sick....topped the trip off stopping at Mamma's Fishhouse.....most spectacular view and delicious food...kinda pricey, but so worth it!! Laua at the West Resort was nice..food was okay, but I figured if you go to Hawaiii, you have to do a laua!! Weather was perfect...first day was kinda windy, but that day was kinda wasted do to Westin's mistakes!! The rest of the week...sunny and warm! Oh..can't forget ...Captain Steve's Whale Watch.....great trip...and got to see at least 8 whales...also seen a few whales right in from of the Westin Kaanapali!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: luvt0travelthew0rld
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa and while this hotel is still a high-end resort and has a great location on Kaanapali beach in Maui, we were disappointed with a number of things during our stay of five days during the Christmas/New Year period. First, we were given an awful room on our first night next to the elevators and facing the front of the hotel. The noise made it very difficult to sleep. Fortunately, we were able to change rooms for the balance of our stay. Second, we were disappointed that every day we had difficulty finding lounge chairs at the pools. Third, There were simply too many people and not enough lounge chairs and many guests would place towels on the lounge chairs and simply disappear for hours on end. Fourth, the gym was also very busy and waiting for the treadmills was not uncommon. Fifth, the line ups at breakfast were also too long. But most of all, the hotel is in need of a serious makeover. The property is dated and tired and needs major renovations. For a Westin property, the hotel has not been maintained to the level we would have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: AmandaOD
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights as guests of this hotel. We were glad only 3/19 nights of our vacation were spent here. Pro- excellent location for swimming in the beach and to hang out by Black Rock. Since we are Starwood Preferred we got upgraded to an Ocean View room (but the delivery trucks start very early outside) Cons- None of the pools are heated and the hot tub is VERY hot. The toilet area in our bathroom reeked of urine but the concierge had it cleaned the same day I asked and it did not smell any further. If we returned to Maui we would probably not stay in this hotel again since the scene is a little overpopulated and you don't feel really like a guest. You feel more like a room number. We prefer a more personalized experience.

Reviews.Title: “Peak period disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Sandra19
Reviews.Content: Booking a trip in absolute Christmas/New Year peak period and conscious of high occupancy rates is always a risk but our recent holiday experience at Westin Maui was nonetheless disappointing. The apparent (?) release of a new reservation system causing long laborious checkin queues certainly didn't help and cannot be blamed on reception staff. Service generally throughout our stay was poor, no greeting nor bell service evident at all, self parking 'full' requriing valet every time. The incredibly expensive ocean front room was extremely tired and cramped with an ancient bathroom and poor quality / insufficient soaps and lotions. Food at breakfast was inferior and we continued throughout our stay and subsequently to battle with discrepancies between our reservation (which included pre paid breakfast) and what was received at the hotel as to our entitlements. Many hours were spent in the long queue to try to sort this out and remains unresolved at time of review. Dirty plates from in-room dining remained in the corridors throughout our stay and there was a general down at heel/low quality feel. We have been Starwood members for a long time and have visited this hotel many times over the last 20 years as it has a great location however now it is in complete contrast to a fabulous stay at Four Seasons Wailea which interestingly cost less for the same peak period. No question what our future decision will be..!?

Reviews.Title: “Very good, luxury hotel....but you have to pay also for breathing....”
Reviews.Author: ELOISE R
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is very good. Yes, the beach (Kanapaali) is very beautiful and really good for snorkelling -> but you have to go to the opposite side, where you find the Sheraton Resort. I saw many different fishes among the beautiful reefs and two turtles :-)!! The breakfast buffet is really good (28$ if it's not included in your package). There are 3 parrots of the hotel, very cutes. If you go in the morning around 08:20 - 08:30 where the stairs to the gym and the spa starts, you will see them "free". Afterwards (around 08:45) they get in their cage. Like I wrote in the title, this resort is really good...but, you have to pay and pay. The plate of fruit salad for 14$ (excl. tax and tip) was still ok, but a fresh juice of grapefruit in a small glass (!!) costed 9$! I went on the beach (in front of the hotel) and I had to pay 37$ for one umbrella, two long chair for one day...ok. BUT NOT OK is the fact, that at 4:50 p.m. the guy of the resort came, telling, I got to move my stuff by 5:00 p.m. since he had to put all things away. I beg you pardon? Scusa?? 1) We are guests 2) but, we still have to pay for the umbrella on the beach 3) for how much?? 15$?...no, 37$! and 4) You tell me I have to leave by 5:00 p.m. when the best (=sunset) starts at 05:30 ???? Bad bad service for me. I wanted to rent the snorkelling gear, but they told me "15$/day and you have to bring it back latest by 4:30 p.m.". ?? Usually you can take them for 24 hours. If you stay at Kanaapali beach is ok, but I wanted to go to Kapalua (ca. 9 miles north from The Westin -> very nice beach and is said to be good for snorkelling. Indeed I saw more varieties of fishes compared to Kanaapali, but no turtles and there are less reefs. But the place is really nice, and very close (walk distance) to the Sea House Restaurant, which is part of the Napili Kai Beach Resort). Anyway, I found on my way to Kapalua a supermarket on the left side of the road ( after 5 miles from The Westin), and next to the entrance of the supermarket I found this shop which rent snorkelling gear for a good price and for 24 hours! Back to The Westin: if you are a couple and want something romantic, go there! They also organize beautiful ambiance for wedding (I saw this on one night). BUT...be ready to spend your money. Last tip: if you like the cocktail Daiquiri -> don't take it there, it's not good (or maybe only mine was not good?), BUT a very good one was at the Sheraton Resort (at the very end of the beach, going right from The Westin)...and it costs lesser....and the ambiance is also very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location does not make up for poor service”
Reviews.Author: TravelbarbNiagara
Reviews.Content: On arrival, no one was there to greet us, help us. Our bags were finally taken but left in the sun unsupervised for more than half an hour. Check in was SLOW. Phone calls to Service Express were not answered. Concierge are selling timeshares. Our room was dingy, furniture scratched and sink cracked. All this for $375 a night! We did get our room changed - new one overlooked the garbage dumpsters! Saving grace - the lovely location and grounds and fine dining. But we were horribly disappointed for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great...”
Reviews.Author: Codypooh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Westin before and I think the hotel is great. Rooms are not very big (it might have been just in our tower) but overall the stay here was great and location is perfect. This hotel is next to Whalers Village so whenever you need food and do not want the hotel food, you can just walk right next door to Whalers Village and they have a little food court. We tried the restaurant right by the pool and that was good as well. Not too expensive but not that cheap either. While staying here, we ate a couple times at Leilani's at Whalers Village and we loved that restaurant. It's a restaurant right next to the beach so you have a nice view of the boardwalk and the ocean. The hotel has a great pool. My kids, at that time 9 and 5, enjoyed the pool and the water slides. They thought it was awesome. They enjoyed it very much as this side of Kaanapali, the beach right in front of the Westin was a little too wild for my kids to swim. You can always walk to the end of Kaanapali, right in front of the Sheraton, to the Black Rock and that is more kid friendly beach as water is calmer. Parking was not hard as we valet parked the whole time. It was convenient as we drove somewhere almost everyday and when we get back, kids are tired so that was our choice. I think self park was not a huge lot anyways so valet parked might be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Pools”
Reviews.Author: STPMKH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui in early January 2012. It was a pretty slow week, but things began to pick up when we were leaving. Checking in was no problem. Like many of the other reviews, the hotel is a little older, but was in a very good location. It is on one of the nicest beaches in Maui and a short walk from Black Rock (good snorkeling). It is right next to Whaler's Village (a shopping center). We purchased several items from the ABC Store in the Whaler's Village. Our main complaint about our room was that it was very dusty. Other than that, the room and hotel were good. The resort fee of $25 includes a shuttle to Front Street in Lahaina, wireless internet, self-parking, two bottles of water and other things. The first night we were there, the self-parking was full (and valet parking was free). The rest of the days, there was always self parking available. For those who don't care for the open water, there are 5 nice pools with lots of waterfalls. We usually took the shuttle to Lahaina to eat, but we did eat at Ono once for breakfast. I was pretty decent breakfast buffet and had a large selection of breakfast items and an omelet station. Aside from the dustiness, our stay was quite pleasant. Because our flight was leaving late, we were allowed to check out at 2:00 p.m. (regular check out is at noon). Checking out was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for travelors without a starwood membership”
Reviews.Author: lilikoi-66
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel via an agent and requested a king size bed with mountain view. My flight was delayed and checked in around 8 PM, When I check in I got double beds with parking view. The staff at the front desk said, "Starwood members can get their fovorable rooms but not from travel agency." Sounds like they treated us like not real guests. This was the original bait and switch, I say this because the answer sounded way too rehearsed. When I asked whty they don't let the agents know that to make sure the customer know that request will not be honored, I couldn't get a clear answer becuase one was not rehearsed. Also, an elavator was not woking in the morning. It was busy time for breakfast. Hotel staff should let customers know about a trouble with the elevator at least. NIce garden and pool, but a guest room ( probably worst room we got) was dusty and really small. I don'y think this room is worthy I would not come back this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Kaanapali hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicolanikai
Reviews.Content: At the westin Maui right now, staying in a mountain view room. A great bed, dual shower heads pools are great and the beach is nice. When you come to Maui it's to enjoy the outdoors not hang out in the hotel room. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are run down!”
Reviews.Author: CamerabuffSeattle
Reviews.Content: For a Starwood property the room quality is very poor. As a Gold member, we were placed in room 970 adjacent to the elevator shaft. Our room wraps around the Beach Tower elevator shaft. Avoid this room. Due to a late checkin because of a delayed flight, and an at capacity hotel, there were no other rooms. Location was good, but sneezing at night with the air conditioner going, and hearing the elevator constantly going up and down gives our experience a 2 thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pools, Heavenly Beds”
Reviews.Author: Jaime P
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel! Rooms were on the small side, but everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: IrvineCaligirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here thanksgiving 2011. We stayed for 4 nights, and it was a pleasant experience. The property itself was really nice, the pools were fun and the beach was fine by the resort. The rooms were so-so-there are some hotel rooms in the old building (main) and then some in a tower. We switched hotel rooms a few times -and by far the tower rooms were nicer. Way nicer. The first switch was b/c the first room simply was dirty (hair over the shower head, dirty carpet . . ) The second switch was b/c a suite opened up and b/c my husband is a platinum spg member we were offered the room. Personally I wasn't the biggest fan of the suite-it was spacious, but the room felt a little old. My husband loved it however. The service was amazing. Everyone was really helpful and accomodating. We did eat breakfast at the hotel-which was great-although probably over priced. Overall, the grounds were perfect, the people were friendly and while the rooms weren't amazing-they weren't bad. I would reccomend requesting a TOWER room, there is a night and day difference in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here over and over, it's a favorite.”
Reviews.Author: CaptAmazing
Reviews.Content: Ocean view rooms have a dynamic view of Lanai and Molokai. Mountain view rooms are very nice (even though your view is over the carpark). The pool areas are fantastic (one note here: if they have a business function that tents the pool area you will have limited access with little notice). The slide is great fun. The bartenders are a great group of guys. The rooms have become a little dated but the beds are extremely comfortable. The showers are nice. Bathrobes in the room. The waterfalls in the entry and the beautiful fish and birds are a real treat. This facility has a shuttle that will take you into Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else the next time you're on Maui”
Reviews.Author: DMR33
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. We're loyal Starwood visitors and we've stayed in many of their best properties. To say we are disappointed in the Westin Maui would be an understatement. Our room is old and badly in need of a renovation. It's also very, very small. Despite having Gold status and being Starwood "VIPs" we were not given the customary upgrade, and instead received a tiny, shoddy room that literally overlooks a trash dumpster. We were told there were no upgrades available, but the hotel is not booked to capacity, so we find that hard to believe. Grace at the front desk was rude and unhelpful. However, many of the cleaning staff and bellhop staff are very helpful and accommodating. The hotel is in a great location, and the common areas (pool, lobby, etc) are pretty nice. Bottom line; next time you're on Maui stay at a nicer place, even if it costs more. The Ritz Carlton in Kapalua and the Four Seasons in Kihei are more expensive, but you get a lot more out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hms4uk
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Rooms.... AMAZING Service! My family and I were visiting Maui for a basketball tournament. We had 2 Deluxe ocean rooms that connected. Each room had a king bed, large dresser with tv, couch, desk, and patio with chairs. The bathroom was very nice, the bathrobes were great- I always request a robe when Im traveling. The resort was packed but this in no way effected the service. Great pool options, Great bar staff, Great beach and AMAZING Spa! I had a treatment each day we were there and it really was an amazing vacation. Tips: Make requests through the hotel not some bargain website Bypass the hotel breakfast and go next door to Cane and Taro- Pancakes=Amazing The ABC store in the mall beside the resort has EVERYTHING- stock your fridge in the room and grab a small cooler for the beach and you're set! If you want rest and relaxation- go to the adults only pool

Reviews.Title: “Just don't eat here”
Reviews.Author: OpusTO
Reviews.Content: front desk staff was amazing, hotel and amenities were fantastic, and the stay was wonderful...just do yourself a favor, don't eat in their restaurants. They have yet to hire a real server...the service is so bad that it can actually ruin the meal...we've tried three times now. Especially at tropica, where meals for two range in the 150$ area...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: chaz_mart
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely friendly at this hotel. The rooms are typical Westin, nicely furnished. The Ocean view rooms have a beautiful view of the pools, beach and ocean. We stayed for our anniversary and they upgraded us to an ocean view without me asking for it. They also delivered a bottle of champagne on our anniversary. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants at this property so I can't comment on those. The minah birds that overnight in the tree are extremely noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: richard t
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this resort and WOW! Did we love it. Everything was perfect. Just wished bar stayed open a little later. We had our travel agency Endless Travel Vacations book every thing and put trust in them. Top notch!! Kudo's to the Westin and our Agent.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very helpful staff, buffet breakfast needs work”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, overall very pleased with service the hotel was not so big as to have lost its friendly touch which isn't always the case with large resort hotels. My only comment would be that breakfast buffet food was pretty cold well before the end of breakfast and therefore poor value for what is a rather expensive buffet. they do give some complimentary water for guests which is a nice touch and I wish more hotels of this standard would do this.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: harrinrj
Reviews.Content: I am a starwood platinum member, so used points for my stay from Dec 30th to Jan 6th. To keep it short: Hotel property was beautiful and the view from the room was great Ordered champagne, pinapple and chocolate covered strawberries for when my wife and I arrived. The strawberries were a too tart, I had better pinapple at the buffet, but at least the champagne was cold. Dont order drinks from the hotel, they are weak at best. They seriously need to visit how they instruct their bartenders to pour a drink, espically at 14 or so a drink. Hotel staff did very well in assisting, real good job to the people who did the work Room itself was not very good. I had a bi-polar in room AC that nevery worked (couldnt change rooms because they were completely booked). The room had a musty odor and it is definately time for a remodel. Service was great and we enjoyed the stay, although you can see I was very critical of the room itself and the food/drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon location!”
Reviews.Author: theblackcat17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and in all it was a good to stay. The room was on the Starwood preferred guest floor and the rooms were big comfortable with good facilities. The bathroom was a little tired but ok. As in line with other reviews this is an expensive place to eat, even the Starbucks was double the price of one that is a mile down the road. The Tropica restaurant was good but again overpriced. The hotel is located on the beautiful beach and is a great spot for would be surfers and whale watchers. The pools were also great, particularly the adult only pool. The staff were good and efficient, the concierge were knowledgable and helpful. Would also recommend the tours office, Jan in there was great in advice on trips and day excursions! Loved Maui and hope we can return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place one year later”
Reviews.Author: Jeanjavert
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in just over a year and I have to say this place is still a great family hotel to stay in. You can't beat their stretch of beach and the 5 pools and slide are awesome. Our room was deluxe ocean view with a great view of Black Rock. Being right next door to Whalers Village is nice. Fair Notice: They have HARD mattresses. If you like this, great. I prefer a softer mattress. Ask for Foam pillows if you don't like down. We got every 3rd night free and free breakfast. The parking does have small slots BUT the last two rows by the tennis courts are a good size so just use them. The beach is AWESOME. So are the pools. If you have kids this is a huge plus. BIG HINT: Don't buy a boogie board. Every day we saw them piled up by the garbage cans from people who had gone home. Also, try the lost and found and ask if they have any leftover beach or pool toys. You'd be surprised. Yes the concierge hit you up for a timeshare presentation but they are very polite about it. Just say no and that's the end of it. The luau was a lot of fun. Great location near the beach. If you like the fire knife dancing this is the one for you. We tried the Sheraton luau and it just wasn't as good. The Westin Luau is table service. They bring a course and put it on a lazy Susan. The show was very good. We had a premium table which was nice. We never had problems with the staff. They were always nice to us. If I may? Treat them like people, not staff. Ask them how they are, smile! Also, you came to Hawaii. Learn to run on Hawaii time. I think this is huge. Go with the flow and you'll be fine. RELAX. This is a family hotel. Lots of kids. Know this up front and make your decision accordingly. The resort fee is what it is. Nobody likes it, every hotel seems to have it. Load up on the waters and coffees and shampoos in your room. You paid for them! Wireless Internet has improved a lot since last year. Basic speed in your room included in resort fee. Are things pricey? Duh, this is Maui. Maui is pricey. Load up on Costco and K mart goodies. The Resort Aspect? There is an activity hut by Ono restaurant and activities are posted in the lobby. Your kids can feed the koi fish in the lobby. Just ask about it. Honestly the pool, waterfall and slides and beach do a great job amusing kids of all ages. Shout out to specific staff: Carlito and Jocelyn at Ono. The cleaning Staff on the 9th floor of the beach tower. Ray the Concierge. Melissa Stephen, Manager. To sum up? Get a deal, ask for the Beach Tower on a high floor away from the elevator. RELAX. Be nice to people. Be aware this is a hotel that is big with families. The pools are great for kids. Park in the last two rows for a bigger spot. if there's a problem don't freak out and just try and get it dealt with. I will stay here again. I have read all the bad reviews for the past three years but I just didn't experience them. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Too Busy for the staff and Us.”
Reviews.Author: ozziecharlie
Reviews.Content: A Nice hotel but I thought the staff were all fed up with their customers. It was over Xmas and it was busy but I expected better from The Westin. Great swimming pool and slides for the kids. Well located for restaurants and shuttle bus out to town [Lahaina]. Would not stay again, there are better places to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “30 years to late!”
Reviews.Author: gottcoke
Reviews.Content: My only problem with our stay is my wife and I should have come 30 years ago for our honeymoon. We found the Westin Maui to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. From the moment we arrived, the staff was over and above helpful. After a long day and arriving late from Oahu (Moana Surfrider), the staff was very friendly and the desk staff was fast in getting us checked in and made sure we had a welcome lei. When I booked, we asked for a ocean front but we were glad that we got a ocean & pool view room in the Beach tower. Room was roomy and very clean. Nice bed and nice bath/shower. There was even a bowl of flowers for the ladies to wear in their hair by front desk. nice touch! The only problem we had is that the birds in the garden/pool area are loud at night even from room on 10th floor. Beach was great and pool area is very nice. Talking to another couple we found that the Ocean tower may be a little dated, but Beach tower is nice and up to date. We traveled the first week of December and the hotel was dressed in Christmas finest. We enjoyed a couples massage on the cabana area. Yes! food is expensive, but your in Hawaii. If we return to the Ka'anapali area of Maui, we will return to this very fine Hotel. Thank You and Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “A Resort in need of Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChrisV8
Reviews.Content: The facilities at the WestinMaui are fabulous: great location on Ka'anapali Beach, impeccably maintained grounds, awesome swimming pools and water slides and nice restaurants. As Gold SPG members, we chose the Westin for it's signature Heavenly beds. We have pbeen to the hotel several times before, usually staying in an oceanfront room in the Ocean Tower. This trip our room was a mountain view in the Ocean Tower. We reached our room after an exhausting 18 hour trip and just wanted to collapse into bed (which is why we didn't care about the view. We were not willing to stay in the room, however, even for one night. The room was small and cramped. The wallpaper was peeling in more than one area, the furniture was scratched and disheveled and the room smelled musty. Turning on the air conditioner only made the smell go from bad to worse. To his credit, our Bellman, Leo quickly recognized that we were uncomfortable with the room and call the front desk to get us moved. We were relocated to the Beach Tower and our room was wonderful! Just the type of from we 've come to expect from Starwood. I would still recommend this hotel IF guaranteed a room in the Beach Tower. The Ocean Tower is in serious need of an update!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: BMulch
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the westin Maui resort and spa for 6 nights and 7 days, we had a fabulous time! The service was great, there were lots of friendly aloha's everywhere we went. The rooms were very good and the beds were amazing! The only restaurant we went to was tropica's and the 5 course meal was superb. The grounds were the nicest on the strip with lots of things to do so we never got bored in our room. Overall it's a bit pricey but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised !!”
Reviews.Author: pegandbern
Reviews.Content: We read reviews here and were prepared to have some set backs BUT had the opposite experience. Upon arrival the parking lot attendant was very kind, the front desk person likewise. So far so good.......I had called a day ahead to talk to the front desk and have them verify my preferences as to the room we would like (ocean view..king size..non smoking)....I suggest you do that to avoid any hassles upon arrival. It was a good idea and it went so smoothly at check in. The next days flew by as we were always able to have a comfortable deck lounge with towels in a lovely setting. The adult pool was our preference but to be honest watching the kids play in the family pools was not a bad pastime either. We ate some meals at the Whaler Mall (next door) and only liked HOLU....Lealiani was very unsatisfactory....Also we had real TREATS at the YOGURTLAND shop..delicious ! The concierge staff was NOT pushy at all and infact were helpful and low keyed...so you need not worry about them trying to sell you timeshares....they were KOOL. Our king bed was very comfortable and our room was quiet. A word to the wise: don't be afraid to tip..TIP! we paid around $300 + a day for the room so a couple of extra 5s or 10s over our weeks trip were not alot of money in scheme of things but yet make things go so much easier. Don't forget: they charge you a RESORT FEE of $26 a day which includes water for your room, internet, self parking, and towels at the pool (not the ocean chairs). We look forward to returning here again.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit to the Westin Maui - Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: SuperDave15
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG Platinum "Ambassador" member who spends at ton of nights a year at Starwood properties. After visiting the Westin Maui about 2 years ago we decided to come back for another visit over New Years with our 10 and 12 year old kids. While much hasn't changed many things have and some not necessarily for the better. The good: 1. You can not beat the Westin Maui for it's beach 2. Fantastic lobby 3. Proximity to the golf course, Whalers Village mall, other restaurants 4. Great pools and waterslide Some areas requiring attention: 1. The rooms at the hotel are becoming more and more outdated and really need to be refreshed. We had 2 rooms and the rooms had broken tiles, banged up walls, scratched up furniture, problematic A/C units etc. 2. Outrageous prices at the Starbucks in the hotel. I get the buffet, restaurants and bars being on the higher end but the Starbucks prices were beyond exorbitant with the majority of the items being $4-6$ each. 4 drinks and 4 pastries was $40. 3. Customer service has gone down from my previous visit. Concierge staff seemed disinterested in helping with recommendations and rushed us off vs. the last time I was there the staff was extremely helpful. Concierge used to give lots of perks for Platinum members (chocolates etc.) but now they don't offer much of anything unless you go on a timeshare tour. 4. Other charges have gone up ($37 for 2 chairs on the beach for 1 day - come on!). General message - the hotel charges a premium rate for the majority of it's amenities yet is not delivering a premium service. Don't get me wrong...this is a nice hotel with a great location. Just be prepared to keep your wallet open for the majority of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: taxman1420
Reviews.Content: Food was great, rooms were wonderful and staff was awesome

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hawaii - PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: MeaganKS
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maui right after Thanksgiving 2011 and had SUCH a wonderful time at the Westin. It was both our first times traveling to Hawaii so we didnâ€™t really know what to expect, but we were blown away by this hotel. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and clean, the staff is INCREDIBLY friendly, the grounds are kept so nicely, the different pools were awesome (rent a cabana at the adult pool, 100% worth it), and the restaurants were great. I highly recommend staying in Ka'anapali rather than other parts of the island, itâ€™s gorgeous. My boyfriend ended up proposing the first night we were there and I can't imagine one thing I would change about it taking place at this hotel. Very romantic and fun but in a laid back kind of way. I have already recommended this hotel to others and canâ€™t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This resort has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Cdgreen
Reviews.Content: We met Grace DiFriamco at Check-in, and she became a Wonderful resource for our Family. When we made the reservation, a Girl named Cynthia helped us, and Was very patient. Our experience was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed Disappointing - Prefer Condos”
Reviews.Author: mkoehn
Reviews.Content: Was so excited about the Heavenly Bed and it was the biggest disappointment ever! When I think of heavenly beds I think of light fluffy clouds. The bed spread was so heavy and uncomfortable we couldn't sleep with it. Don't expect a duvet! which is what I prefer to sleep with. My bed at home is more heavenly that this. Let down! Went here for a family vacation where we didn't want to have to worry about cooking so we stayed in a hotel. We usually stay in suites with kitchens and I realize how much I prefer that now. After two days of eating out I was tired of it. Especially when breakfast buffet is $27pp and lunch/dinner at the Ono Bar and Grill costs $16-$25 for meals that are really average. Walk to the HULA GRILL and eat there for way better food and lower pricing. You will save money not eating at the resort and they don't have a large enough fridge to store food. Tropica sunset dinner AWESOME!! Go for the early bird dinner at 5pm-6pm. Great value and amazing quality. You have to eat early in order to see the sunset. If you go after 6pm the sun will be down and you can't see the amazing waterfront views. The pool is probably one of the nicest on the strip and you are right in front of the beach. The beach area is so nice compared to the Sheraton. Really recommend splurging for the $60/day for the cabana. The servers bring you Ice Cold water all day we never ran out, at lunch they offer the Ono Bar & Grill Menu and bring it to you, if you want drinks you can order them too! Great service and surprised they offered fresh pineapple around 11am which was so fresh and sweet. Live it up and get a Cabana on the beach :) Best part of my stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort- but watch out at the luau!”
Reviews.Author: K H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort recently for our honeymoon. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the resort. We were very impressed with the friendly and accommodating staff. Everyone was eager to speak with us and we felt very at home. There were however 2 issues that occurred from the luau that we attended. During the luau we purchased 3 Tikki carvings from Siren's Tikki & Treasure. Specifically from a man named Villi. When we attempted to pay for them by credit card, Villi advised us that it came back declined. We tried twice but he advised us it was the same result. We did not get any receipts for this and assumed it was because we were from Canada that the transactions had declined. He had told us that has happened to him before. We then paid by cash. We again did not get a receipt. Upon returning home we found that both credit card attempts had indeed gone through. We called our credit card company and Villi immediately, but have not been refunded the total amount as of yet. We felt that everyone should know about this situation in case it happens to other guests of the hotel as well. The other smaller issue is that because of the payment issues with getting the Tikkis, we forgot to pick up our luau photo at the end of the luau. We called the extension for the luau the next day and left a voicemail but no one returned our call. We then called the concierge and they provided us with the phone number of the photographer. He called the day that we were leaving and advised us to email him with the a description of ourselves when we got home. We have never heard from him, nor received our photo and are disappointed in the level of customer service. Overall, our experience at the Westin was great, however we do feel the level of customer service provided to us by the vendors at the luau does not match the level of service provided by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hawaii with kids in tow”
Reviews.Author: Tracey B
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Westin July. We had a FABULOUS time! Our kids are 10 and 7 and they LOVED the pool area. It was great that they were independant swimmers though as there is no lifeguard (except at the slide) and you cannot keep your eye on them at all times (which the kids loved because there were so many things to swim in, around, and under.) The hotel was PACKED while we stayed and yet we didn't have any trouble scoping out two chairs for my husband and I to relax while the kids swam. Snack shack on site made life convenient too for shaved ice, etc. Location was perfect. The kids loved the smaller waves on the beach to play in. We walked to Black Rock (5 minutes) and were snorkeling with turtles. The beach was clean and sand was great. Whaler's Village proximity made life easy as well since we could grab a "cheap" lunch at the food court or a nice sunset dinner at Leilani's (with Hula Pie!) We also saw a free Hula Show by local dancers (young and old) which was very impressive. My kids actually liked see the whale museum. Our room was clean which I consider amazing because each day we would haul in more sand from the beach! I applaud our cleaning ladies for their hard work keeping the bottom of our shower grit free! The bellman who brought up our luggage was amazing. He suggested we call the front desk and ask for a microwave (they do have them upon request.) He also offered to loan us boogie boards for the week. By the next morning, there were two boards at the front desk FOR FREE (which we returned at the end.) My only complaints are the $25 a day fee but I must say we tried to get our monies worth. And the onsight restaurants were quite pricy. We went into Safeway in town and stocked up on breakfast foods and lunch makings since we had the frig and microwave though to combat the prices the Westin wanted. We did not try the onsight luau - went to Old Lahaina instead. The free shuttle to and from that event was great (since drinks were free there!) Overall, I think this is a perfect location for families. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: Jana N
Reviews.Content: As a Christmas present to my family, we just spent a wonderful week on Maui. My children have never been to Hawaii, it was especially exciting to see Hawaii through their eyes. Our stay at the Westin, over all was very good, very very expensive but good. Part of reason we chose to a hotel like the Westin was the amazing spa they advertise. Spending time at the spa was a major part of my daughter's Christmas present. The spa was very disappointing. I tried to make an appointment for my daughter to get the tiny braids in her hair, while I got a set of fake nails put on. I was informed they didn't do those services. I then tried to get us a manicure and pedicure, but they don't offer them together! I tried to get us a facial but they were booked for two days. I realize that that it is a very busy time at the hotel with people everywhere, but peeking inside there wasn't even anybody in there. Somethings a little off here. In my opinion, if you want a fun no frills family hotel with a spectacular pool this is the place for you. If you want a spa in a hotel, this isn't for you. They should rename the hotel and leave the spa part out, it is misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful resorts that I have ever seen! The service is great, the smiles and alohas are are everywhere, and the ocreanview from the room is postcard perfect. The grounds have nice landscaping with native plants, beautiful swimming pools, coy ponds with pink flamingos. The white sand beach is great to swim in and walk along, and there are tons of activities like surfing, snorkeling, volcano tours, etc. The only downside is that in adition to room rate and the $25 daily resort fee, you still have to pay for things like beach chairs, etc. But you do get free fruit flavored ice water and starbucks coffee when its dark :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, but...”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSD3
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very nice stay at the Westin Maui resort and spa, but all was not perfect in paradise. We had an ocean view room and we there for 6 nights (12/26 - 1/1). This was our first big vacation with our 2 year old son outside the mainland, so there are a couple thoughts to share. We have traveled (airplane) about 5 times with our son already, but most travel has been in the lower 48 States. Checkin - I have never seen a check-in process this chaotic. We got to the hotel about 1pm, put our name in and they said they would call us when the room was ready. This seemed perfect, however we did not get our room until 5pm (2 hours late.) If it was just my wife and I this would have been fine, but with a kid in tow it can be a little nightmare. I witnessed this happen to about 10-15 families...which should not happen at a hotel chain like the Westin. When you're spending good money, you expect a room at 3pm checkin. My wife and I have traveled a decent amount around the Caribbean, Mexico, S Pacific and have never seen this type of chaos before. I noticed it happen every day as we walked by the lobby. The hotel did comp us (and others) for the delay, but I would have much rather had the room at 3pm to get settled and enjoy the day. Room - Our ocean view room was good. We were in center of hotel on 6th floor with a pretty nice view. However, anyone on our side of the hotel was pretty close to the lobby waterfall, so it was loud at night. You could sleep with windows open, but it was surprisingly loud. I can't imagine those rooms right above the lobby waterfall, it must have sounded like they were sleeping inside the waterfall. The beds, although the heavenly bed, were not good. They were old and need to be replaced. Pool - The pool is very nice. However, we had some high winds (35 mph+) the first couple of days, so the pool was cold. Most of the little one's we saw (under 3/4) and spoke with were not in the pool as you froze in and when you got out. The older kids were fine. Our son spends about 200 days a year in the pool since we live in San Diego, but our pools are heated, so I guess Westin is trying to save money. Prepare to wake up at 6am to reserve your pool chair, otherwise you are out of luck. Beach - The beach is beautiful and great for people watching, activities etc. However, due to the steep drop off, this is not a good beach for kids under 3 years old. There's no way for them to wade around and play safely. We went down to baby beach in Lahaina which was perfect to chill and wade in for our son, so if you're in the area head down there for a day. For older kids the beach in fine. You can also jump on the many catamaran's right from the beach to whale watch, snorkel etc. This is very convenient. We rented the beach cabana's for 2 days which was very nice (although it's $60/day), so if you're looking for some chill time I would recommend it. Just make sure you reserve it early as they sell out. Food - food on-site is good, although prepare to pay. The breakfast buffet is pretty nice and you can sit in the Tropica restaurant right on the water and people watch or see whales breaching in the distance. It was also nice as kids under 3 eat for free with their parents at the Ono restaurant (near pool.) For those of you with young kids you know eating can be fun adventure, so having free meals all week was nice. At night the Ono restaurant has live music which our son loved to listen to. Premises - the landscaping, ponds, birds etc on premise are pretty amazing. They have done a beautiful job and our son loved to watch the waterfalls, Flamingos, Koi fish, parrots etc. It was a great activity just to walk around the premises. Nearby - The Westin is right next to Whaler's village which has 2-3 nice restaurants (Hula Grill, Leilani's and Cane & Taro) as well as high end shops, grocery stores, ice cream etc. It's a great place to eat, walk around and just enjoy the night air. The Westin is also close to Lahaina which has calm beaches and a great little downtown to eat and stroll around in. Overall the Westin is a nice hotel but needs to be updated and run a little more efficiently. As stated in other reviews, the Westin also nickle and dimes you for just about everything, which I don't necessarily mind, but it can add a decent amount of money to your trip, so budget accordingly. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “terrible reservations”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times over the past sixteen years. The past ten years have been with children. I specifically told them when making the reservations that my wife and I were travelling with kids and needed adjoining rooms. The first e-mail reservation confirmation did not include the second room. I immediately corrected that. A day later I was informed that to guarantee adjoining rooms they would charge me an extra $100 per night. The hotel has been getting a bit tattered in recent years and now they are punting on the last attribute they had going for them... being family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a major makeover.”
Reviews.Author: SeabournFan
Reviews.Content: After spending a 12 days over the holiday season, (6 Maui, 6 Kauai) the Westin Maui just didnt measure up. The resort, rooms, pools, and restaurants are all in need of a major makeover. Considering the high cost per night ($450 + for premium oceanfront), the resort fee ($25), one would expect a world class Westin resort... instead, you are given a 3 star hotel on the beach that is showing its age - badly. Do not recommend staying here until a major renovation is completed. Westin's brand is really slipping in Maui and Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Digiorno12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for a week and a half over the Christmas holiday. Let me just say the grounds and landscaping set the tone for the entire property. The hotel staff are just as meticulous and attentive to the guests as they are with the grounds. Our room was very quiet and the beds were AMAZING. What a great night's sleep after a day full of ocean and beach activities. The hotel was slam packed during our stay, but the staff handled it effortlessly. Room service ran a little slow, but reasonable considering. Great pool and oceanfront, very close to restaurants and shopping. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but expected more from Westin”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at The Westin Maui Resort & Spa over the Christmas holiday. The Westin Maui Resort is the perfect spot for a family to enjoy a vacation by the beach. However there are a few gotchas you should be aware of when staying at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa. I found that everything at the hotel was very expensive. It seemed the hotel was more interested in making money than focusing on customer service than making sure guests have a good time. Coffee, kidâ€™s milk, Orange Juice will cost you $4. Thatâ€™s double what Starbucks charges for the same cup of coffee. Go downtown Lahaina to Starbucks instead. Pineapple pieces for breakfast are $8. Breakfast buffet was around $20 per person but kids are free. Beach umbrellas and chairs are $37 per day if you can get a reservation. I got charged $18 for parking for the first night. Basic Internet access is free however if you need more bandwidth its $14. This is all on top of the ridiculous $25 per day resort fee. Try getting the hotel to remove the resort fees when checking out. I had the resort fees removed. Be advised that the checkin process was slow. Checkin counter seemed understaffed and wasnâ€™t able to provide me with a room until after 3pm. Even with prior communication with the hotel regarding our arrival time etc. Next time I will ignore those emails from Starwood asking if I have any special requests for our staff. Basically the hotel never received the information. The Westin Maui Resort & Spa has four or more concierge counters located on the property. An American express travel desk is also located in the lobby. I would recommend not getting to comfortable chatting with the concierge staff. Their goal is to schedule a tour of the Westin Maui Villas. I was suckered into taking a tour of the Villas. Waste of three hours unless you have $100k and interested in buying a timeshare. Just collect your Westin Bag, map and view the restaurant menus book available on the desk. Use opentable to reserve restaurants. I also got a box of chocolates from the concierge counter. If you take a tour of the Villas ask for the $100 spa voucher. I highly recommend taking advantage of the SPA services. Massage was awesome. Book the massage for the second day. Also recommend using the SPA facilities. The hot tube and relaxation room are heavenly. Guess that is why they call it the heavenly spa. The gym is also brilliant. The gym has a great selection of machines and weights. Our room was an ocean view overlooking the ocean and pool. Highly recommend request an upgrade for an ocean view. The Mountain View rooms look directly over the car park. The rooms are dated and based on the popcorn on the ceiling I would say date back to the 1980â€™s. I heard a rumor that a renovation/upgrade will happen in the New Year. With almost 120 nights in a Starwood hotel this year, the Westin Maui Resort & Spa has the worst bed. Every morning I woke up with a bad back. I donâ€™t believe the hotel uses Westin beds. The beds sank in the middle. I spoke with the front desk about the bed but not action was taking to replace the bed. The toilet also flushed by itself. However the rooms seemed to be well insulated. I never heard the neighbors. Room comes with a coffee machine and refrigerator. I heard you can request a microwave. There are four pools and one hot tube located on the property. I found that you needed to reserve your spot by the pool at 7am. By 9am all the pool chairs where gone. One day I did ask the staff to help me locate a spot by the pool. I was never able to reserve the private cabanas. I never ordered food by the pool. Instead walked over to whaler village and ordered food from the food court of fish tacos from Lahaina on the beach. If I go back to Kaanapali I will look into staying at the Sheraton or another resort. I found the Westin badly managed with a donâ€™t care attitude. I was never able to speak with the manager even after requesting his or her contact information. However on the last day I did discover a true gem. Her name is Dawn. I believe Dawn is the only Starwood representative on the property. I would recommend calling dawn prior to your arrival to request an upgrade to best available room etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Elevators need some help, but other than that you could not find a better place to stay on west Maui .Dawn at the front desk is AMAZING. She is very friendly, remembers you from prior trips, and if management reads this she is truly an asset to your organization. Be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found...”
Reviews.Author: ScrappyKFPanda
Reviews.Content: We just finished a wonderful stay at the Westin Maui on Kaanapali Beach. We had a pre-Christmas/birthday family holiday that was amazing. The front desk staff due in most part to Lisa Rafanan, Dawn and Grace was able to get all five of our rooms on the same floor in the same tower. They even had a surprise birthday cake waiting in the room at check-in. As expected, the resort embraces all that one would imagine with the friendly local Hawaiian Aloha Spirit. It is lush, romantic, fun and exotic. We enjoyed the pools and wonderful friendly attentive service from Robert, Koeke, Lupe and Jerome. They always made sure we had plenty of towels, drinks and snacks. My favorite part of the resort is the Heavenly Spa. Kelli Keahi is the best Masseuse I have ever had. I always book my massages with her long before I arrive as she tends to be booked in advance. The rooms we nicely appointed and the Heaven Beds are a dream. Gigi, our housekeeping person always greeted us with her warm smile and made sure our rooms were well supplied. She even managed to work around 5 teenagers in one of the rooms. This was the most awesome stay we have ever had in Maui. My advice tips for Maui and the Westin are to welcome the Aloha Spirit and respect the locals.

Reviews.Title: “very expensive and needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: KevinR6
Reviews.Content: Nice resort but in fire need of updating. Elevators temperamental room furnituretacky, scratched and in need of replacement. Very expensive and yet another resort that does not cater for a family of 5. Had a great time however and nice beds.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and convenient, but crowded and kid-central”
Reviews.Author: Lcny2001
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for the most part. The property and landscaping were beautiful, and the rooms were quite nice. However, if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, remote experience, this isn't it. First of all, there are kids everywhere, so it's chaotic and loud. It's a good place for families, but probably not single travelers, though there is an adult-only pool that's nice. Also, the food prices are outrageous, but the food is only average. Don't eat at the hotel -- take a short stroll down to Whaler's Village for dinner. I suggest hitting a grocery store to keep breakfast and lunch options in your room so you don't have to spend $8 on a bagel or $30 on the breakfast buffet. But overall, the location is good and the beach is on your doorstep, so you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Christmas vacation becomes a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Bond_007
Reviews.Content: It was the afternoon before Christmas day, we arrived an hour early around 2:00 PM and they could not give us a room, could not let us go into a room in the process of cleaning, so my wife and daughter became ill during the wait. I asked the desk clerk to speak to the manager, I was told he was too busy! I finally got into a room around 5:00 PM. I have had better service at a Motel 6. Never, ever coming back to this hotel. They definitely need a new hotel manager. I will be writing directly to Westin Corporate to voice my views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: smduja
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin. I was a little nervous after reading some of the earlier reviews. But all worked out. Check in was uneventful. No special greeting, nothing to really make us feel welcome. Lobby is nice. I felt the room was average hotel sized. Nothing special about the room. Yes, a little dated and could have used some deep cleaning but nothing to ruin our stay. One night the self parking was full and my car was valeted but the person doing it didn't seem to thrilled about having to do it. Like I was asking for a special favor. We were right above the waterfall and the "bird tree". Though the view was amazing the noise in the evening and early morning was a little to much. My 7 year old loved the pool and the beach was very nice. the $25 per day resort fee seems a bit ridiculous. If you choose to not have your room serviced you are supposed to get a $5 credit toward the restaurants. I only got one and you also do not get the water that you are supposed to get with the resort fee. Overall, I wasnt over whelmed with accommodations or service. Yes, I would stay here again but since this was my first stay in Maui I certainly will look at other places and it'ole oils be nice to have more space such as a condo.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas crowd reveals the true spirit of the place”
Reviews.Author: lots_of_travel_4_me
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Westin Maui Resort on Kaanapali Beach (Lahaina) from Dec 14 to Dec 24. This is the peak of the season with 100% occupancy at the Westin. It is easy to have a good, welcoming experience when the staff is relaxed and the hotel is half-empty. Christmas on Kaanapali Beach is a unique experience - crowds are just about everywhere. But, this time also stretches the staff to its limits and that's why I think my experience at the Westin is particularly noteworthy. On check-in, I was not satisfied with my room and discussed my concerns with one of the front-desk managers, Giadee Kaiwi. Remember, the place was crowded. To my surprise, Giadee worked for several hours in the background to assist me and almost "miraculously" all of my concerns were resolved. The next day, I got a call from Giadee, who brought me a little package of home-made cookies she had baked on her day off. I think this is a unique touch - in over 1 million miles of business travel, I never had that type of experience. Over the next 10 days, I got to know a number of other staff members at the Westin and realized that Giadee is not unique. I believe the Westin has an outstanding staff, giving their very best to make their guests feel welcome even at 100% occupancy rate. I find that remarkable. I give them five stars on service and staff dedication. Overall, I like this place a lot. It is conveniently located, has great grounds, good restaurants, and a spectacular architecture. The rooms in the Ocean Tower need a bit of a face-lift (I was told that major renovations are planned for 2012). Once that renovation is completed, I consider coming back for Christmas 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in Maui before heading off to Oahu to visit family. Overall, a great experience. The beach was slightly on the windy side, not sure if it's just because the time of year, but still beautiful. Plenty of chairs at the pool. We asked for late check out and while they were unable to grant us it, they did let us book the hospitality suite so we could stay at the pool a little later and take a shower. Great property with lots to do, took a yoga class in the morning, and my husband went for a run along the beach (nice little path). Loved the proximity to Whaler's Village and Lahaina. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family resort”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: We travel to Maui twice a year. We have stayed at all the major hotels. We found the Westin to be the most kid friendly and the transportation to Lahaina very convenient. We have gotten to know a lot of the staff. Dawn Jacinto at the front desk is wonderful. She is always smiling. The hotel is a bit older but is kept up nicely and the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: tifw1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another fabulous stay at the Westin Maui. I have been coming to this property multiple times a year for the past several years and cannot say enough great things about this property-I feel like it's my second home and some of the staff there like family. Count on Lupe and Alison at the pool to take incredible care of you and help to make an amazing day even more fun. These two ladies are a big part of what keeps us coming back. Also the front desk is incredibly accommodating to a high maintenance SPG Platinum guest like myself. Big thanks to Gia and Joey for always looking out for me. While the property and view and activities are spectacular in and of themselves, the reason I keep coming back here is for the wonderful service and spirit of aloha that I get on every stay. I love this place and already looking forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you would Expect from from a large complex”
Reviews.Author: R55wilson
Reviews.Content: Nice place with all you would expect from a large hotel complex. Great beach location next to the Whalers Village. You will have to pay for parking or purchase hotels food to get validation on receipt.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family vacation”
Reviews.Author: LML2513
Reviews.Content: Getting ready to head home and feel compelled to say what a terrific property this is--exceeded my expectations in several ways. The location is great, right next to Whalers Village and across the street from 2 great golf courses. The hotel layout is great. The massive wrap-around pool is awesome and my kids loved the 150 ft water slide. There are several conciegre desks staffed throughout the day and they were very helpful with booking all our dinner reservations. Highly recommend the snorkeling cruise which you can board right from the Westin beach (book ahead). Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pink Flamingos in the Atrium”
Reviews.Author: drsdc63
Reviews.Content: This is the first time for my wife and I to stay at this property. We stayed here only one night and then we transfered to the Villas. We got a wonderful Ocean View room and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Maui Westin was remarkable! The service was phenomenal, especially from Virginia G. of the maid service staff! My fiancee & I are looking forward to our next visit. Mahalo, Michael W.

Reviews.Title: “Still nice but getting long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: Dyanne2448
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip so didn't get to really experience the spa aspects or recreational aspects of the hotel. From what I saw,however, the pool areas, beach, lobby , and common areas, the resort is very beautiful. The rooms , however, are in need of a bit of a facelift/update. We were in one of the more expensive rooms because of Platinum status upgrade and it was still in need of some refreshing. The hotel also seemed a bit short of staff as it took some time to get wine glasses from room service and a long wait in line to get amenity information. Regardless, we would stay here again because of the location and proximity to Lahaina and other attractions. Looks like a great place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing to the Sound of "Emergency Repairs"”
Reviews.Author: KLopez929
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days as the first part of our honeymoon. This stay was actually our wedding gift from my aunt, so we were obviously very excited. The first day we were there, after getting our fill of sunshine, we went back to our room hoping to nap and relax on the first full day of our honeymoon. After about 5 minutes being back in the room- this obnoxious drilling noise started. After waiting about a half hour for it to stop - we finally called down to the frot desk to complain. They told us not to worry - it would be over in an hour. This made me pretty angry, but we decided to go down to the bar and make the best of a bad situation. The next day was our last morning at the hotel. We went to breakfast and returned to our room hoping to relax a little before our checkout. And can you even believe it - about 10 minutes after being in the room- the same drilling started again. This lasted for over an hour. It was 9:30am; I am sure many guests were still trying to sleep. We decided to check out early because we no longer wanted to be here. Before we left, I wanted to speak to a manager. Apparently, because of other similar complaints, the manager couldn't see us for another three hours. We waited. When we finally spoke to the manager, she apolOgized and said that it was a shame we hadn't asked to switch rooms since there was apparently "plenty of vacancy." She offered no other sort of anything to make up for our horrid experience- she just sent us on our way. When staying in a room that's $500 a night - as a guest- you would expect to actually be able to spend time in that room when you would like to. ... Especially in a place like Maui that is renowned for romance and honeymoons. This hotel was the least accommodating hotel that I have ever stayed at. While I would love to go back to Maui, I will never go back to this hotel. (The Westin's timeshare resorts, on the other hand, are lovely.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: veggierunner
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at the Westin for Dec 2-6, 2011 using Priceline, name your price. We got a great rate. Check-in was the worst part of our experience. There was no real welcome or introduction to the hotel. We had been awake for almost 24 hours at that point, so a little bit of hospitality would have gone a long way. We were initially told there were no king rooms available, but after some some persistence, she eventually was able to find one. Our room was small, but comfortable. Bathroom was adequate, but nothing fancy. Bed was very comfortable. We had a mountain view room, over the parking lot. The view was actually very nice, and I really enjoyed watching the sunrises. The balcony doors are not at all soundproof, so I would suggest bringing earplugs if you are noise sensitive. Ammenities- we loved the pool areas and the waterslides. Lots of places to relax and we did not feel crowded at all. My husband used the gym and said it was adequate, nice view, but could use more weight equipment. We snorkled at Black Rock and loved our experience there- saw rays and green sea turtles. Restaurants- we ate had room service once, and had drinks during happy hour at the pool side bar. There are 3 hours of happy hour deals at the hotel, and this offers great value. The location of this hotel is very convenient to Whaler's Village and the other hotels on Ka'anapali beach. We also stayed at a 4.5 star hotel in Wailea area on our trip, but we preferred the more relaxed atmosphere of the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Tonya D
Reviews.Content: We booked a vacation at the Westin Mauii Resort and Spa not knowing what to expect and I'm so glad we did. The beach was great! The service was very nice, we had the best restaurants on the beach. We tried some of the other restaurants at other hotels and were so happy we chose the Westin Mauii. We definitely had the best pools, however it did take me a couple days to find the hot tub. We also went to the spa and had a wonderful experience. I thought the breakfast was pretty expensive, but there was a huge variety and worth it since you could skip lunch after the breakfast buffet. There was one concierge there that had an attitude but we enjoyed making fun of her, and there is a funky smell on the 11th floor from the sugar cane I assume, but we said something and they sprayed right away. Overall we had a great time and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: deandebuck
Reviews.Content: There are several major hotels on the Lahaina beach area but the Westin has the most unique first impression with a lobby waterfall and 5 real flamingos to greet you. Their consistent level of well appointed rooms does not disappoint. This hotel is near Whaler's village which has great shopping and several cataramans leave from the shore close by. Their luau looked spectacular -- like a Gala evening. We went to the Old Lahaina one but looked in on the Westin one and were almost sorry that we didn't stay for the Westin one.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation hotel in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: chris s
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of staying at The Westin Maui for our 5th year earlier this year. Needless to say, we enjoy every moment of our annual vacation at this hotel. Rebecca Dean at the front desk is just GREAT! She is always so bright and full of smiles. She is a pleasure to see each year. She is so helpful in getting us checked in and making sure we have everything we need to make our visit the best it can be. She helps us in choosing a ocean view room best suited to our needs and has never let us down. Rebecca even had flowers waiting for us when we arrived on our honeymoon! Everyone here welcomes us back (and remembers our names!) each year from the servers, to the bellman, to the bartenders. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and we really don't even need to leave the hotel if we choose not to as everything we need is right there within walking distance. We truly feel like this vacation is a real escape and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Might make this a yearly trip”
Reviews.Author: jpfitzy7
Reviews.Content: For our 8 year anniversery my wife and I decided to head back to Maui. We had planned on staying at the Hyatt on Ka'anapali Beach where we had honeymooned but the construction changed that. Instead we booked at the Westin. Wow, what a place. We had a terrible flight and felt awful when we arrived and we were looking for something to perk us up. At check in I inquired about the possibility of an upgrade from our Mountain View room to an Ocean View. Boy did they deliver! We were given a room on the 10th floor overlooking the pools and ocean. The balcony was the perfect place to sit with a bottle of wine and watch the sunset. The entire staff was awesome. Nathan at the bell desk loaded up all our luggage, grabbed us some ice and gave us great dinner recommendations for our first night. Tropica Restaurant is great. We went a couple of times and sat at the bar for appetizers and drinks. Tommy and Freddy are great bartenders there and make sure you try the Kona Lava Red and the Pohaku. One of the high points for us was the adults only pool. Even though the hotel has 5 pools we never left this one. It's enjoyable to be able to relax with a drink and not worry about getting splashed or listening to kids. The pool side bar is located there and they are great for drinks and lunch. One negative would be the hot tub. Not sure why but the hotel had the temp cranked really high on it. It was impossible to put more than your feet into it. The hot tub was the meeting place and a great place to hang out with new friends and talk about island experiences, restaurants or just share a drink. The beach in front of the hotel is great! Perfect waves for beginner surfers and I recommend you try it. Josh and Phil at the surf desk are great teachers. We arranged a dive at Black Rock through the tour desk and Doug is a great dive guide. The sea life and visability is perfect. Also Whaler's Village is right next door for shopping and some great restaurants. My wife and I have decided we might make this an annual trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Stay”
Reviews.Author: mariachurchill
Reviews.Content: My family spent a week here and there was something for everyone, age 3 to 83. My son is 3 and my father is 83. We had to find a place that was convenient for both. My son lived at the pirate ship pool and my dad was happy ordering his beer and hanging out at one of the pool bars. My mom, 74, even had a great time at any of the 5 pools. She loves to dance and the Ocean bar played great music. Our rooms were very new, nice, clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The view from the bath-tub was fabulous. you could open the double doors from the tub and the curtains form the master bed and see the ocean while you took a jacuzzi. The resort has 4 pools for swimming and 2 for Koi fish. They let you feed the fish, so my son participated during feeding hours. The main pool, near the Ocean bar, has a very fun, long water slide. But you have to be able to swim on your own to go down. My son and husband were banned from going down in tandem. We really loved our suite and would recommend it. There is a shuttle into the town of Lahina, so you really do not need to rent a car, although we did, as we drove to Hana, horse back riding and cycling down Haleakala. The snorkling at the beach in front of the hotel is incredible--probably one of the best places on the island. The food at the Tropicana--the restaurant by the ocean--was excellent. We would recommend this place and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great room!”
Reviews.Author: Centuryclubtraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked an ocean view room facing Whalers' Village but were thankfully upgraded to an 11th floor room overlooking the pools. What an awesome view! My wife and I were married here 9 years ago, and we were celebrating our anniversary with our two small boys. We enjoyed swimming in the 5 pools and sliding down the waterslide. My 6 year old and I took a surfing lesson just south of the property and had the time of our lives! We ended the stay with a dinner at Tropica, which exceeded our expectations. A nice bonus was being able to shower and clean up in a suite after a day in the pools before leaving for the airport for a red-eye back to the continental U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dpefine
Reviews.Content: I was originally returning to the Hyatt for my second visit to Maui, but switched because of the terrible construction situation there. I'm glad I did because the Westin is beautiful and service is top notch. Everyone is extremely friendly and the aloha spirit is alive and well here. It is infectious and the guests can't help but be sucked right in. Yes, the hotel and its restaurants are expensive and there is a resort fee, but you get what you pay for and then some. The food will always be delicious and the service will always be fantastic. You will never be disappointed and that counts for a lot! A couple times the parking lot was full. In those instances, they valet for free so there is no wasting time circling the lot. The beach in front is great with a rough patch to the left for good surfing and gentle surf elsewhere for swimming. The location can't be beat. You can walk to Black Rock in 5 minutes or less for great snorkeling or jumping off Black Rock. The huge two level shopping area, Whaler's Village, is next door. Fantastic restaurants like Leilanis and Cane & Taro are in Whaler's Village. The adults only pool is major plus because this is a big family resort and there is still an oasis for singles and couples. The bar in the adults only area is really cool with friendly bar tenders and servers pool side. We needed a late check-out and with no issues were given a 2pm check-out. We needed wine glasses and a cork screw and room service delivered them incredibly quick. The grounds are meticulously cared for and lush green. The activities booth on the grounds (American Express Tours) is good and very helpful. Their scuba is excellent for beginners! Beware: the people at the surfing booth are great, but their equipment is not. For example, their paddle boards don't have leashes so if you fall off you are swimming frantically for your board -- that's bad!! Their surf boards are beat up too, but at least have leashes. So if you want to paddle board (and I hightly recommend it), you have to go to Trilogy Ocean Sports and Beach Center right in front of the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. They are cheaper and have much better boards and paddles. I would also recommend checking out Maui Dive and Surf in between the Westin and Whaler's Village especially for more advanced divers.

Reviews.Title: “A truly amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: martinktyler
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is one of those places where the hotel makes you feel like you are the only person staying there. We stayed over thanksgiving - and the quality of the hotel, the staff, the food and surroundings simply blew us away. I'd recommend it to anybody - assuming you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Beachfront ... Relaxing Get Away”
Reviews.Author: jaxnova
Reviews.Content: After being glued to Tripadvisor and reading numerous bad reviews beofre we arrived, we were a little hesitant at what to expect at this property. Here's what we experienced: NEGATIVES: We arrived extremely exhausted from Australia and just wanted to check-in, dump our bags and freshen up. Unfortunately, our room wasn't ready so we went for a walk, got a coffee and sat by the pool until we could. This is where the first hiccup was ... got our key, entered the lift, got out and our room was right next to the lifts, we remained positive until we entered the room to find we were looking out over a concrete rooftop, plus looking straight at the side of the Ocean Tower (a blank concrete wall) plus three huge air-conditioning turbines/cooling towers!!!! Oh yeah, we'd found paradise ... NOT. We booked an Ocean View Room (confirmed six months prior) and advised that we were SPG members (obviously, that counted for nothing). So we grabbed our bags and headed straight back down to reception absolutely fuming mad. Luckily my husband handled the situation (as I couldn't speak due to the tears welling in my eyes).
