After a firm discussion with the desk clerk, begrudingly he found us another room two floors up on the 7th floor overlooking the pools with a 180 degree view of the beach - suddenly, our holiday improved 100%. So our question was, why put guests through this trauma in the first place? Finally, let the timeshare thing go people - stop nagging every guest who arrives ... very 1980's and unprofessional. POSTIVES: Apart from the first hiccup, we had an absolutely fabulous time. The five pools were fantastic, plenty of lounge chairs to relax in, the beach was gorgeous and the service was seamless. Fantastic location, every other resort was within walking distance, Sheraton, Hyatt etc. Snorkelling at Black Rock is a must, Whalers Village is right nextdoor with restaurants, shops and ABC store (where you can buy all your essentials at normal prices). Take the free shuttle bus in to Lahaina it's well worth it, plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. We also did an island tour which was worth doing if you don't feel confident hiring a car. We dined at Tropica and our server John (from Virginia) was an absolute delight ... the food was modern and uncomplicated. We chose not to eat breakfast at the Hotel as we wanted to do our own thing. ADDED TIPS: We had dinner in Lahaina at David Paul's Grill ... if you are a foodie, you will appreicate the entire experience - unique flavours, original cocktails and excellent service. We used Speedi-Shuttles both on Maui and in Waikiki - hassle free, clean and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: LynneandSteveCapon
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time we have stayed at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa, and it is as amazing as the very first time we stayed here. The atmosphere here is one of a very warm and friendly one. The staff here are a delight to be around. Their is not one thing we could complain about whilst staying here. Our rooms have been fabulous and the beds speak for themselves they are "Heavenly".. we cannot wait until the next time we are here again. Thankyou from the bottom of our hearts. Lynne & Steve Capon

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, will be better with an upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: Joanne313
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days, and had a fine time. The rooms are tiny, a bit claustrophobic, but everything was clean. Our room faced the pool, had silvers of ocean views from the third floor. Negatives: sliding door never closed properly, and a small lake formed in the bathroom when you took a shower - some kind of leak. But rest was OK. Do NOT depend on the hotel's WIFI if you need to do work or log in to a secure server. Was dumped up so many times, can't even count from the room, balcony and the lobby. Oddly enough, best signal I had was at the pool, but hard to do real work from there. The "free internet" (included in your resort fee), is terrible and beyond unreliable. Workout facilities are lovely. Oho restaurant was good. Pools were clean, enough lounge chairs and the towels were soft and plentiful. Parking lot's spaces are as tiny as you will read in other reviews. But park in the last row, by the tennis court, and they get a touch bigger. Closer to the hotel = the smaller the spaces. So this place isn't the best place to stay, nor the worst. It was fine. But it definitely could use some tweaks by Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, but would not return.”
Reviews.Author: JD61649546
Reviews.Content: Positives: The hotel and location are beautiful. Our housekeepter, Lori F, was OUTSTANDING. She and the consierge, Sheryl Johnson, made our trip worth it. Negatives: the clerk at the check in desk mistakening ran our credit card 3 times and refused to release 2 of the unnecessary credit holds - substantially putting a "hold" on any futher expenses during our stay. The food prices are outrageous. We were charged $50 for a small bowl of yogurt, small bowl of granola, small bowl of berries and regular coffee. A female member of the check in desk staff was extremely rude during our whole stay. For example, when we asked why our $408 deposit was not credited to our room account here response was, "I don't see that here. Get a bank statement and prove it!" Not very professional, especially after we proved that we did, in fact, pay the $408. We also had a rude staff member, Kay K., who canceled our first room reservation without notifying us. After a member of the hotel mangement corrected this, she said some very mean things about us to other staff members. Also not very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: mommy_barbie
Reviews.Content: Our review is mixed - we would avoid staying here again unless significant changes are made. There are a good deal of other desirable hotels on this side of Maui - we will be looking more at these for a future visit. See our thoughts below. Pros: The grounds are lovely - nice pools (though nothing special like a river run or elaborate water slide for thrill-seeking kids), flowers, trees, swans etc. The beach just outside the hotel is also very nice - clean sand, nice water, but a lot of traffic and tourist development. The staff and service they offered, at the front desk, at the concierge, the quick service line on the telephone (always answered promptly and in a friendly, helpful manner, and the valet), was terrific - the staff deserve high commendations for their warm, helpful disposition. Negatives: Rooms out of date, furniture damaged, dust covered furniture, tiles on floor broken, walls dirty. All we had to do is slide a lamp over to see that the tables are not adequately dusted - hard to get at areas are even worse. The fountains outside are ludicrously loud and will keep you awake all night, as will the arguing of neighbouring guests through the paper-thin walls of the adjacent rooms. Plan to enjoy the lanei? Be preparing to inhale cigarette smoke as smokers are allowed to smoke outside their rooms here and the balconies are right next to one another. The elevators were under repair more often than not, but this is not a big deal, it is more the condition of the rooms and noise (difficulty sleeping) that led to our disappointment. Important - the Westin aspires to "resort" status but they charge their patrons for the "rental" of plastic loungers on the beach. We have travelled extensively and have never seen this. Want a seat? Be prepared to pull out your wallet (or your room number) - otherwise loungers are shackled. A Side Note: We had a negative experience at the Spa here owing to the behaviour of one of the staff members. The spa is already dated, nothing special, with plain, barren cubicle-type rooms and little in the way of outdoor treatments. While it is a treat to go to a spa on any occasion, we would not recommend the spa at the Westin due to the lack of atmosphere, and more importantly, the staff, which, in the case of our therapist, was outright rude, insulting, and not at all interesting in trying to accommodate our needs. Note that we did visit the Salon and we were happy with the staff there who were friendly, good-humored and keen (and well able) to make a good impression on customers. Unlike our experience at the Westin's spa, our experience at the salon was well worth our travel dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pools, location and gardens but rooms are dated, small and average”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for the Maui classic BBall tournament for a week. The gardens are very pretty, the pools and walk ways are very nice with the ocean back drop. However the hot tub was a very high temp and extremely small. My 20 something age children told me at night it was quite crowded and awkwardly cozy in the evenings. The rooms seemed very drab and rather dated. The sink area in our room was very small, although it was larger in our kids mountain view rooms. I was disappointed in the quality of the sheets used in our Garden View room. The sheets had a scent that was not a clean and smell but a rather stale mildew smell to them. With the gardens, pools and location I would have given it a 4 star except twice in a row we have been given sheets that had stains on them. Big GROSS in my book. The final thing that dropped them to a 3 is the noisy elevator. Our room was right across from the elevators and they ding loudly when ever it passes our floor. I was very glad I brought ear plugs to cover up all the dings coming from the elevators. Last but not least was the mini frig that was just on the floor in the room. what gives with that? Just an after thought so you don't build it in? It was so small and missing shelves it held a few things but not much. Every time I looked at it it made me shake my head wondering exactly how much they were able to up charge these rooms with this tiny cube frig plopped down on the floor. If you don't intend to spend much time in your room and aren't incredibly picky about you room the grounds and pools are very nice. The beach is very nice and just beyond the pools and there is very nice shopping right next door. The few staff people we interacted with were pleasant and helpful. The only downfall to the staff was the housekeeping never leaving us our complementary water bottles and they also used stained sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play!”
Reviews.Author: Irishpub1
Reviews.Content: The location is the key to the Westin. You can walk right into the pacific and do some nice snorkeling right from your room. Great pools and slide. Walking distance to Whalers Village for shopping and dining. Choose from a McDonalds or fine dining. Service from the staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin always impresses”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: We were wowed from the moment we checked in! The grounds are beautiful and serene. We loved the layout of the hotel, pools, and restaurants. We got upgraded to an Ocean view Suite, which had an amazing view and was so relaxing. We loved this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jgzjkiwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for 6 nights for the 3rd year in a row and once again we had a really enjoyable time. Although it was busy the first day we never once had a problem getting 3 pool lounge chairs together, always got a carpark and found all services working except for 1 lift undergoing maintenance. The pool is great and it is only a short walk across the beach to the water which is warmer than the pool. Black Rock is a 10 minute stroll up the beach and to walk in and swim with the turtles was just amazing (they always seem to come in to feed off the rocks around 2.30pm). Right next door to Whalers Village and the free shuttle to Lahaina is really good and convenient. Cannot wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st time to Maui. Wonderful stay at the great westin”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful Resort, when we arrived and stepped on the grounds it was like we were in heaven. My wife and myself have been looking back at our memories on Maui and the westin and can't wait to go back. We had a room on the 11th floor with a ocean view which was beautiful, the staff was great the location was great close to everything. The bedding amazing after a day and drinks on the beautiful beach. The daily breakfast at Ono is to die for great selections, the resort sits right on the beach which is amazing, the grounds and pools are so very beautiful, it gives me chills to think of the time we had in Maui and at this beautiful beautiful resort. Front street and the road to Hana also made for some great memories, ps the best shaved ice is on front street at Ululani's Hawaiian shaved ice what a great treat. Can't wait to bring my beautiful wife back to your wonderful resort. Thank you so much what a dream come true in Maui at the westin...............till next time mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colocav
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have stayed at the Westin having stayed at the Hyatt nearby on numerous occasions. The oceanfront Kaanapali location for these properties is fantastic. However, the Westin property is pretty dated. The rooms are small and in need of an upgrade. Two elevators were not operating for periods of time during my stay, leading to extremely long waits. Restaurant and convention food and service were good. The front desk service was good but I did notice that the line was frequently long during my stay. A tip when dining at the restaurant for breakfast, ask to sit in the portion of the restaurant that is oceanfront.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Grounds and Pools”
Reviews.Author: ParamedicLondon_ON
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best grounds and pool area of any hotel/resort I have every stayed at! We had the most beautiful beach and the water was calm enough to swim in. The sand was white and clean! The pool area has mutiple pools that were never too crowded and the hotel was sold out when we arrived! Never had to get up early to claim a chair. The open air lobby with its beautiful koi pond with amazing waterfall was impressive! We always had amazing service at all the restuarants including Tommy at the Topica bar and Donna at Ono (get the fish Tacos and there is a great drink called the Tropical Monkey). And when needing something from the front desk like the complimentary late check out, so we could go ziplining on our last day, it was never a problem or a hassle! We were given a free upgrade to ocean view room and there was a bottle of chamange in our room upon check in to celebrate our anniversary. We did have to wait two days and move rooms to get an ocean front since the hotel was sold out due to weddings for 11-11-11, but the hotel made it very easy for us and it wasn't a big deal. So thank you to Kain and Joven at the front desk you help ensured our stay was relaxing. This was our first trip without children and we enjoyed the quiet of the adult pool but the pools were never too loud and there were lots of families enjoying them. As for the rooms. We were in the ocean view tower which is what people call the older tower. It was nice and clean (in both rooms we were in). They are a typical Westin hotel room with comfortable beds and nice ammenities. Our room was always cleaned and the cleaning staff never woke us up! We were in a room on the 10th floor that had amazing mountain views for the first 2 days and my only issue was that is was right next to the elevator so I could hear the dinging like it was in my room (Room 1020 Ocean View tower) when we got moved to the Ocean view room (Room 917) with the great king bed the view was out of this world (it is worth paying for the upgade if you have to)! There is nothing special about this room and yes if you go over the room and tower with a microscopic eye then you will see paintchips and such but nothing that was unacceptable in my mind and I am easily offended! So if your looking for the Four Seasons then I suggest staying at the Four Season (I think there is one on the island) but if your in Hawaai and your hanging out in your room then your doing something WRONG! Also thanks to Sara a concierge for loaning us her own personal CD for the road to Hana! Saved us some much need $$$ since we left a lot of it on the island! Have a great trip and Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui, A+++++”
Reviews.Author: mikejay924
Reviews.Content: Just a beautiful hotel, location, resort, etc. Staff was very friendly and polite. A morning "aloha" from the maids. Whole staff was helpful, friendly and informative. Food on resort was great. A little pricey, but it's Maui. Not as expensive as Tahiti, though.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: TommySanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: Having benefited numerous times from Trip Advisor, I felt it was about time I contributed. My wife and I have been married 36 years, with Maui being our absolute favorite vacation spot. Maui is our home away from home. The Westin Maui Resort has been our getaway destination over ten times, We absolutely love the Westin. Even though we own a time share from the Westin as well, we just can't keep away from the Resort and Spa, it just feels right. The staff makes us feel at home. I would especially like to acknowledge Ms. Rebecca Dean, who is an anchor at the front desk. She is the face of the Westin to us, always warm, helpful and friendly. Rebecca makes us feel like her Hawaiian family. If you are looking for a hotel that has the "Aloha Spirit," look no further, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: Super location and very comfortable beds! The Westin staff is excellent and we really enjoyed using the pool as well as lounging on the beach nearby. Their restaurant, Tropica serves up excellent food with a commanding view of maui's famed glorious sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “What a honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: DrewLuck
Reviews.Content: We had a great week long stay at this resort. We were booked for a garden view room in the main part of the hotel that's above the lobby, and we were not happy with it. It looked and smelled like a college dorm room, and had a horrible layout. The bathroom door blocked access to the bedroom, and there was a box fridge just thrown in the corner. The view was of the waterfalls and garden, which was fine. We complained and were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view. WOW, what a difference. You wouldn't know it was the same hotel. The room was renovated and modern. The view was amazing. We were happy from there on. As of October 2011, the hotel informed me they are starting to renovate that smaller tower in 2012. So keep your fingers crossed. The pool choices are endless. They even have an adult pool for those of us who don't want to listen to screaming kids all day. And there was even a poolside bar at the adult pool. Jackpot! The beach was small, as the tide has washed away a lot of their sand. But there is still plenty of room to not have to be close to other people. They rent a pair of wood chairs and an umbrella for $30 a day, or you can get the more comfortable wide recliner chairs for $10 each a day. We did that and we were much happier. I think the people on the wood chairs were jealous. We spent an afternoon at the spa, and that was amazing. It's blows away any spa you've ever been to. You will pay for it though, as with anything on the island. Location is excellent, only 2 minutes from Lahaina. You are 45 min from the airport, but everything is. There is a one lane highway all the way to the hotel, but the drive is spectacular. We took 100 photos just on the drive from the airport to the hotel to check in. The hotel is directly next to the whalers village, which has a handful of restaurants. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, and the buffet is the way to go. If you order a la carte, then you are going to spend more than just doing the buffet. Don't pay any companies to take you on a snorkel trip. Walk yourselves down the beach about 300 yards and snorkel at Black Rock in front of the Sheraton. It's free, and the best snorkeling you will find on the island. The water is calm, because the giant rock blocks the big waves. My wife was struggling to swim when we did a test run in front of the hotel. We saw sea turtles and lots of fish. There is a great natural reef over there. Rent a Jeep or convertible and don't bother valeting. They have free self parking that you are already paying for in your "resort fee". For internet, connect to the business center or lobby wireless, and don't bother paying for the "faster" room internet. They limit the speed on the "free wifi" for the rooms. It was sad how slow it was. I connected to the business center from the 9th floor and got 7MB down and 1MB up. The housekeeping staff was very good at their jobs. We had a very sweet lady on the 9th floor that kept our room immaculate. We did our best to keep it organized, and she did such a great job. Don't forget to tip your housekeeping if you are happy with their services. That goes for any staff on property. They are working hard to keep you happy. The rest of the hotel staff really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The concierge was so helpful. We got some great tricks and tips from them. If you intend to do any amount of driving on the island, go to the GyPSy Guide stand in Lahaina and rent the GPS unit they have. Google it to find them. It tracks where you are and gives you history, tips, places to see, places to avoid, and basically gives you a tour of the entire island based on where YOU want to go. You can rent by the day or week, i believe. We only got it for one day towards the end of our stay, and I wish I had it the whole week. It was great. Eliminates the need for any maps or books about the island. We brought $100 worth of books with us to Hana, and we didn't open one of them, because the GPS guide knew it all. It told us which waterfalls weren't that impressive, and where we could pull off. It let both of us keep our eyes on all the sites. So overall, go stay at the Westin Maui, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay In Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney R
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Maui, and I always stay at Westin hotels because they do not dissapoint (and I'm a Starwoods girl!) The Westin Maui exceeded all expectations I had, The room was amazing, everyone was very friendly and the property was beautiful not to mention right on the beach which made it even better! But the highlight of the trip was the great guys that work at Onos restaurant! I was vacationing with my friends so of course we wanted to have a great time and we did because of Junior and his amazing Mai Tai's! By far the best Mai Tai I have ever had! And Junior was awesome, he was nice, fun and friendly which made Onos the nighlty spot for my friends and I! Also I have to say the food was great!!! And the servers excellent especially Derek and Sam! They were so friendly and fun and leant to an amazing atmosphere at Onos! Overall I had such an amazing time! I will for sure go back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience, Once Again”
Reviews.Author: mauisnow
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to the Westin. Each time we return our trips just keep getting better and better. On our recent trip we were greeted by WILL McNabb in the valet/bellman area. We actually met Will on our first trip and look forward to seeing him again when we return. He's the most accommodating, professional, friendly and knowledgeable person. The Westin is lucky to have such a genuinely nice guy working for them! At the front desk, Dawn checked us in. She is so friendly and sweet and made sure we were 100% happy with our room location. Not only is she prompt, she was great in providing us recommendations for restaurants at the Westin as well as in the area. Dawn Rocks! Every other employee (including Regina our housecleaner, Edith at the pool area snack shack) were very professional and had true Aloha spirit. Our room was very clean and the beds comfortable. The pool is perfect for families - there is a small waterslide for younger kids and a larger slide for the older kids/adults. They even had waterslide races each morning at 9am. There is also an adult pool. The hotel is located right on the beach, which makes pool/beach hopping simple. The Westin location is also convenient to Whalers Village (right next door), which has great restaurants and shops. We can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PJinSP
Reviews.Content: I found the service to be excellent overall with the exception of the front desk. The front desk was understaffed and very disorganized. Everyone else was great, from the waiters and waitresses, housekeeping, and the valets. The pools and grounds are beautiful. The food at the Tropica restaurant was delicious and the view was breathtaking. The rooms do need to be updated and the Whaler's Village side is very noisy. If you're looking for peace and quiet, this probably isn't the hotel for you. If you enjoy a lot of activity and being conveniently located to shopping and restaurants you may enjoy staying here. As another reviewer mentioned, I have never heard so many chirping birds in my life. The good news is the noise in temporary, only in the evening when they go in the trees to roost. The Westin has some very nice touches such as providing workout clothes, free of charge. Delivering a birthday cake to your room. Free water and a free tote bag. The beach is beautiful and literally just steps away from your hotel. Snorkeling is close by at Black Rock and you can rent equipment inexpensively at the Maui Dive and Surf shack along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: tyip
Reviews.Content: Customer service from this Westin's managers is below expectations, but may meet that of a Super 8 motel. There are too many problems discuss and will update (with pictures) when I can gather my fustrations, but at this time I would advise travelers to stay away from this hotel, regardless of any "deal" that is offered, unless it's completely free.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, magical gardens”
Reviews.Author: Maybeperhaps
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The hotel pool garden area with 5 pools and pink flamingos is beautiful. The walk between all the hotels is beautiful, and the Westin is next to the Whalers where you can basic groceries at ABC store. There is a small fridge in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “A less than expected experience”
Reviews.Author: StanS40
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa â€“ arriving on Wednesday, 10/5 for 5 nights. The resort is in a great location and the grounds are nice and are well maintained. The beach was perfect and the restaurant did a pretty good job for breakfast and lunch. We were really disappointed when we checked in to find out that although we had reserved a room with a king size bed, we were told that we would have a room with 2 double beds. Our reservation was made a month prior to our trip and when we made it clear that this was not satisfactory, nobody seemed to care. The rooms are pretty small which people should anticipate. Our room had a nice patio with a good view. The wing in which we were staying had 2 elevators. During our 5 nights there, only 1 was operational and we saw no signs that anyone was working to fix the other. We had delays of several minutes each time we were going up or down. The hotel has no business center. They placed 2 computers in a narrow alcove that is part of an outdoor cafÃ©. The area they were in is cramped and has little ventilation. During our 5 nights, 1 of the computers was broken so I had to stand around waiting for 15 minutes or so to be in line to use the 1 that worked. All in all, people should not approach this resort with high expectations of a quality stay.

Reviews.Title: “Need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: vancouverchu
Reviews.Content: Old style high-rise hotel with ocean view, but the common areas need upgrading. The beach front restaurant was the best part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, large room, loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladydi2109
Reviews.Content: We were relocated here after making plans to stay at the Hyatt. When I read on trip advisor about the rennovations being done at the Hyatt (five days before our stay) we immediately called our wonderful travel consultant, Maui Kay (mauikay.com) who incidentally lives on Maui, and she was able to get us into the Westin. We were there from Oct. 28th to Nov. 3rd. We had a room on the 9th floor of the Beach Tower. It was a large room with a large bathroom. Our view was that of the pool area and grounds and the ocean. We were very happy with our room location. The decor was not my style, however, and it was not very Hawaiian looking. The dresser was wood with a glass top. The carpeting was old and bubbling. The patio chairs were worn and uncomfortable, but I could get past all that since the view was so nice. The bedding was comfy and they give you plenty of pillows. Our biggest complaint would be the noise people made when opening their sliding door to the balcony. Some days it started at 6 a.m. Our package included the breakfast buffet each day. We took advantage of having a good meal at the start of the day, a small snack for lunch, then a dinner. The breakfast buffet was usually the same each day and there was a chef who would make you eggs of your choice. We chose to eat ocean side each morning, which ended up being in the Tropica Restaurant. The view, the breeze, the setting.....ahhh, a must do! If you don't have the buffet you can order off the menu. There is also a cafe in the lobby area where you can purchase coffee, bagels, pastries, yogurt, and cereal. The grounds of the resort are beautiful. There are several waterfalls, flamingo's in the lobby pond, five pools, one being adults only, and a tiki bar. There is also a bar at the Ono Grill and at the Tropica Restaurant. We ate lunch one day at the Ono Grill. The food was good. The sandwiches we ordered came with fries or Maui Chips and cost around $12 a dish. Drinks not bought during happy hour could cost you eight dollars up to fourteen. A Mai Tai was $11. Take advantage of the happy hours. As far as parking, we only had to valet one night, and it was probably a luau night. We were not charged, but did tip the guy when he brought our car around the next day. We did not attend the luau there, but we viewed the area where it takes place. It is a small area and there are 20 or so round tables of eight, a stage, and in the back, an area where the buffet is served. We only encountered one employee who was unsmiling, otherwise everyone seemed helpful and friendly. At the pool area you do need to wear a wristband and you have to return your towels before 5p.m. or they will charge you $25.00. There is a stand near the pool that sells smoothies, shaved ice, popcorn, hot dogs, chips and other snacks. They also have waitresses who will bring you food or drinks. There are cabanas to rent in the pool areas or chairs with umbrellas by the beach. The beach chairs cost $35 to rent (you get two) and there is a limited amount. Get down to the pool area early to reserve them as they go fast, or reserve them before you get to Maui. Since alcohol isn't allowed on the beach, they do not have waitresses who come down to the beach. At least not during our stay. On arrival you get a Westin bag and a coupon for a free coffee mug at the cafe. Also a free 4x6 photo but they take more pictures in hopes that you buy them. We didn't bother with the photo. There are lots of scenic views on the grounds that allow for several photo opportunities. We had no problem waiting for an elevator, but we were also there during off season. The hotel was maybe 60% occupied. We never waited in a line for the buffet or at any of the restaurants we tried. There were not many children at the resort either. Another benefit of staying during off season is being able to get a late check-out, or if you're really lucky like we were, the use of a room until 4p.m. for no charge if you have a late flight. There are a few manned activity and tour desks in the lobby and while they are convenient, be advised that the rates they quote are higher than you might pay booking the activity or tour on your own or with a coupon. Or better yet, call Maui Kay and she'll take care of you! The Westin is right next to Whaler's Village, the Hula Grill and Lelani's. We saw several rainbows over the mountains behind the resort. Even the mountain view is gorgeous. We had a wonderful time here and would stay at the Westin again if we are fortunate to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: SportsFreak30
Reviews.Content: Constant birds in the outside restaurant is the only annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Maui”
Reviews.Author: matty3471
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is a really great place to stay. The pool is really nice. The ocean is a ton of fun. We enjoyed body surfing the great waves. The Westin is in a perfect location. The views are spectacular. There's plenty to do along the beach. There's a shuttle that'll take you to Lahaina. We went on a snorkel sail the left right from the beach in front of the Westin. There's descent shopping and some cool bars just next door. I just can't say enough about the views and the location of the resort. The only downfall is that it's an older resort. The balconies were extremely small, but when you have that view it's hard to complain. We had free breakfast coupons, so we made use of that every day. The birds looking for bites of food were somewhat annoying though. We went to the Westin Luau. It was awesome. They greet you at the door with a Mai Tai, the food was really good, and the show was great. No need to go anywhere else for a luau. The fact is Maui is a wonderful island. This was my first time to Hawaii. We stayed on Oahu and Maui. Maui was unquestionably much nicer. Way too much traffic on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui location”
Reviews.Author: hollydollyMontreal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a package deal through Hawaiin Airlines and got a great deal. We chose an ocean view room and it was amazing to wake up every morning, walk out on onto our balcony and see this amazing view. There are 5 different pools to enjoy along with the beach, one that is for adults only. There was also a hot tub and a bar! The staff were always friendly and helpful. We had dinner a few times at the Ono bar and restaurent. The bar staff, Junior and Shannon were great. They made us feel welcome and remebered us and our favorite drinks the next night. The only negative comment would be the cost of some food and drinks but I think that is indicitive of Hawaii on a whole. I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Here is the REAL scoop!”
Reviews.Author: againtravel
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler who keeps an open mind. I understand that as with all things in life, one experience should not define something. Having stayed at this property 6 years ago, I think I can offer a relatively objective opion. This property is "tired". According to one of the managers we spoke with, it is scheduled for a 90 million dollar renovation starting Jan 2012. Not sure if that is true, but if so, it needs it. Having said that, we stayed 6 nights at end of October and had a nice time. The Ocean Tower rooms are older and smaller than the Beach Tower. Spend the extra money and get Beach Tower, Ocean View. Well worth it. Our room had a sofa, although the carpet was "bubbled". Bed was very comfortable. We booked through Costco (although we are not budget travelers) and were able to upgrade for $100 per night. Just ask. Then negotiate. If it is low or shoulder season, they should accomadate you. Pools are very nice, but you can hear the waterfalls from everywhere on property. Didnt bother us. Common areas were not always clean and the furniture is old. Hopefully they wil update these too. The continental breakfast is very expensive if you dont get a breakfast voucher in your package which we did. A family with 3 small children under age 6 in line in front of us spent $65 for breakfast of bagels and pastry. Try to find a package deal. Then you can upgrade to the breakfast buffet for an additional $12. Nice buffet, well stocked, fresh omlettes,lox, fruit etc. Location is best beach on Kaanapali. From the Westin property to the Sheraton the beach is biggest, gentle waves, close to shopping and restaurants. Parking is ridiculous. Not much more to say than, good thing you are probably in a rental! All in all, an average hotel. Not indicative of the Westin brand.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: JC1090
Reviews.Content: Don't skimp - pay extra for the ocean view!!! It is so worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: jsem1955
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Maui, our first stay at the Westin Maui. Property is immaculate. Business breakfasts were excellent. Staff at front desk and throughout the property were very helpful & friendly. $25/day/room mandatory fee covers self-parking & internet. My daughter ordered take-out from Ono bar restaurant twice with no issues. We dined off-property at the adjacent Whalers Wharf restaurants (Hula Grill and Cane & Taro) and also at Duke's and Java Jazz restaurants about 4 miles north. Great snorkelling right off the Westin property & the Sheraton property 1/4 mile north. Good shopping at Whalers Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Saved Our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: KLS101511
Reviews.Content: We visited three islands for our honeymoon in late October, and Maui was our last stop. We were scheduled to spend five nights on Maui. After having a horrible experience at another nearby hotel, our travel agent was able to get us switched over to the Westin, just a few properties north of where we were originally booked. We were so thankful to spend our final three nights of the honeymoon at the Westin. Lucky for us, the Westin was able to accept our reservation without any prior notice the same day that we checked out of the other property. We waited for a few hours, but a beatiful ocean view, king size room became available for us. For being ocean view, this was pretty much ocean front. Our room faced the ocean and looked out over the gorgeous pool area. The view was about 75% ocean/beach/pool, and the other 25% looked out over Whaler's Village. The room was spacious, clean, and modern, and the bed was the best part. It was so comfortable, we wanted to bring it home with us! The bathroom area was large enough for both of us to be getting ready at the same time, and we really enjoyed the extra counter space and bar above the mini fridge and safe. Within 10 minutes of us being up in the room, there was a knock on the door. To our surprise, we were treated to a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice with two champagne flutes. We were pleasantly surprised since the hotel didn't even know about us until a few hours prior. They really went out of their way to make us feel welcome and special on our honeymoon even though it was totally a last minute booking. The pool area (five pools in all) was just beautiful. Tons of tropical landscaping, and plenty of waterfalls. We appreciated the "adults only" pool, and we never had an issue finding chairs. We particularly enjoyed the hidden whirlpool area tucked away in a cave that connects two of the pools. It was a private area, and we were the only two in that area of the the pool at night. The staff is friendly and accomodating, and we really liked the valets. We only used the valet parking one night. When the self-park lot is full, your car will be parked by the valet without having to pay for valet. Even when we didn't use valet, they were so kind. One noticed that we had our suits on and were headed to a beach away from the hotel. He offered us fresh hotel towels to bring along so we didn't need to dirty our own. The location of the hotel is perfect. There is plenty of sandy beach area along the ocean, and it's right next door to Whaler's Village. Such a short walk to dining and shopping! We did have dinner at Tropica, the resort's restaurant, and felt it was a bit overpriced. However, we received a complimentary dessert since our reservation for dinner was booked through the hotel concierge and she gave us a coupon. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I would stay there again in a heartbeat if we make it back to Maui. Great room, great location, great staff, and all around great hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool, lobby, beach..”
Reviews.Author: remphish1
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the lobby, pool and beach. Really a beautiful property. Gym was nice too. My only complaints are the room was a little tired and the parking lot was over crowded and the spaces are the tightest I have ever seen and I live near NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Wristbands? You've got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: RotaryRoamers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent several wonderful days at the Papakea Resort on Maui but needed an extra night before our flight home, so we checked in to the Westin Maui. As some other reviews have noted, the hotel rooms are generally small and nothing to write home about. The ocean front room we were assigned had a comfortable king size bed, a very small refrigerator and, to our surprise - no closet, but rather an armoire. The ironing board was in a special cabinet built for this purpose in the bathroom! The Westin Maui, like some other resort properties, banks it reputation on opulence throughout the hotel - other than the guest rooms. We found the grounds pleasant and the hotel staff very helpful. However, when we went down to the pool area and asked for beach towels, we were advised we had to wear wristbands "for security purposes." I advised the young man that I no longer went to summer camp and also studiously avoided all-inclusive resorts where wrist bands were required. I did remove the wrist band, as did several other guests, and was not bothered (there were no "security" staff checking for these). This is an extremely strange requirement, given that the Westin is virtually inacessible to non-guests. Parking is controlled and it's a fair hike along the beach from anywhere else. I likely wouldn't stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not Westin I know..”
Reviews.Author: mstwright
Reviews.Content: Checked in yesterday and Sooo unimpressed with the room. Lobby is amazing, but rooms show age of hotel (circa 1969). They get an A for effort in updates, but I'm not fooled or impressed. My mountainview room is right over a parking lot. They offered a gardenview after I complained, but the room was mysty, so I stayed in the parkinglot, oh I mean mountainview. I've NEVER written a review, just read, but this prompted me. I chose this hotel because I thought westin had one universal quality like Starbucks, cheesecake factory...I was wrong!

Reviews.Title: “just one night”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in at 11am due to transferring from Ocean Villa property. We had a mountain view with small terrace. Room is on the small side but has refrigerator and safe as well as work station. Beds are large and comfortable. The pool area is very nice and the beach nice but not that wide. Snorkeling is better at the Sheraton which you can take the shuttle to. Food is pricey, but Tropica has an early bird sunset menu which we enjoyed. Next to Whalers Village makes it very convenient. The hotel is showing its age--the elevators are slow and several were out of order. The breakfast buffet is $28 but there is a coffee/pastry station to get a quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Christopher E
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the self-parking lot was filled, so they comp'ed our valet for the night. Many people welcomed us to the resort with warmth and smiles. The luggage was taken by the bell hop, and we proceeded to the check-in desk. The entry way is nicely decorated, and opens up to a waterfall and large koi pond. Very beautiful. After a few minutes, we get our room number, 281... not what we were expecting.. we had booked a room in the old wing (better views), but were placed in the new wing. The new wing room was average for a maui resort.. the view was of the neighboring hotel, which was under construction. With a small corner of the window looking at the ocean.. so, it was an "Ocean View" room... We requested to move, and was granted the move the next day. We drove the road to Hana the next day, and in the evening, we went to our new room. 1149. An amazing view from the room, with almost the exact same layout as the previous room. (Highly recommended) The only difference we could see was that the sink was in a different place.. The food was a little pricey for us newlyweds, $35 for a continental breakfast for 2. So we drove to get food. The spa is wonderful. The personnel and facilities were above all expectations. The therapists we had were very skilled, and was well worth the money ($300 for 2 / 1hr each) The pools are beautiful, and the location is perfect for snorkeling. From this resort, we would recommend walking north to black rock and snorkeling. There were many (4) large tortoises and lots of fish to see.. the coral is average to low for hawaii, but still worth seeing. There is a cliff jump on black rock if you are interested. It is about 20 feet. Just enough to get your adrenalin pumping. All in all, a wonderful resort, and a beautiful place to stay. I would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great 20th Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: pt995
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week here for our 20th anniversary. This is a very nice hotel with all the amenities you could ask for. The food was good in all the restaraunts. The service was exceptional from all employees we interacted with. We had an ocean view room that was on the north side of the beach tower (4th floor), it was a bit noisy due to deliveries to the adjacent Whalers Village Mall. The pools and beach were excellent and not overcrowded. Overall a great place to stay and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 50th at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: For my 50th birthday, my husband took me to the Westin Maui Hotel. We enjoyed a fabulous luau, followed by a wonderful brunch. The beach was pristine and not overcrowded. The many pools provided variety and relaxation and a choice of being with families, or in the adult only section relaxing in the hot tub with a cocktail. The option of using one or two shower heads was a big plus, but the quality of the bed was the greatest luxury. Overall, the staff was friendly, efficient, and helpful.This is my third trip to Hawaii and the first hotel I would definitely go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views on the beach in Maui”
Reviews.Author: backcountrytraveller
Reviews.Content: We recently were in Maui for the Maui Marathon and stayed at the Westin Resort and Spa for two nights. (The start and finish lines were right outside of the front of the hotel.)We had a deluxe room with an ocean view. The view was gorgeous, and we loved the balcony. The room was very large as well. The only drawback was the fact that our room was by the elevator, and it was very loud at times. The food and service were very good. The pool and beach area were spacious and very clean. The hotel was very prepared for the large influx of runners arriving for the marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Da whistlin' westin”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for one week only because of a medical conference. However, the overall experience was fabulous and I could see us coming back. Our maid, Virginia G, was adorable and went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. Actually, the entire Westin staff was extremely helpful, from the bar tender to the concierge. The rooms were slightly used, but clean and comfortable. The pools and landscaping (gorgeous) made up for it, especially if you have children. The best part about the hotel was choice of 4 pools, plenty of chairs (you don't need to wake up at 5:00 am to get a good seat), wonderful 24 hr work out center, and beautiful views. oh, and the live pink flamingos, parrots, fish, and swan were a great touch. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools and snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler1727
Reviews.Content: We've been here twice and enjoyed a terrific vacation each time. Try to get the Beach Tower which has larger and better rooms. Our room wasn't huge or fabulous, but it was just fine and had a nice lanai with ocean view. There are several linked pools with waterfalls, a cave, slides -- so much fun, even for adults. Also one adults only pool, nice break from Marco Polo. There's a really nice beach and we kept going back and forth from ocean to pools. Great snorkeling at Black Rock about a half mile walk up the boardwalk, which we did every morning. Go early for the best visibility and swim with multicolor fish and huge sea turtles. Rented gear for the week at Maui Dive Shop kiosk next door. Hotel has a good buffet breakfast, which is very expensive unless you get it included with your package. There's a shopping center right next door to the resort with 3 wonderful restaurants, all with patios facing the beach and one with live music entertainment almost every night. The mall also has outdoor entertainers some evenings. Sure, the hotel is crowded and there are some annoying people and too many kids ... but that's true almost everywhere in Hawaii. If you want solitude and 5 star service, go somewhere else. But if you want a nice hotel with fun pool system, wonderful snorkeling nearby, and good dining options to walk to, this is a terrific choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but gets busy”
Reviews.Author: SuPeru07
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the front desk staff never smiled. No I havent seen him before, nor borrowed money from him. The simulated water falls looks nice in the lobby. We stayed in the garden view and the room was like anywhere else. The bed was comfy, there were 2 shower heads and bath had double vanity. The pools were nice and their restaurant was good. There was a bottle of wine in our room which was supposed to be for honeymooners. I called up the front desk to check if we can use it, and they said they will send someone to remove it. I felt it was pretty cheap of them for one they serve $10 wine for honeymooners and two, they wanted to remove it since we were not honeymooners. Anyway they called back in 10 minutes and said we could drink it if we wanted. They sounded as if they were giving a great discount. Parking was a pain. You have to circle around until you find a spot. For a hotel of this size, when charging for parking they should make sure it is not as hard as it is. Spa was good. Sauna/Steam bath was great. The walkway around the hotel was nice.It was also next to Whaler's village. Overall my experience was mixed and would not recommend either way.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mc2315us
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin Maui! The location was perfect in the middle of Kaanapali, near Lahaina where there is a little more going on. When you walk in, you are met with the waterfall and flamingos and it's all open-air.. just beautiful! The pool area is amazing with a hoop court, volleyball court, children's waterslide and an adult waterslide. Maui is expensive and eating at the Westin is costly. You will have to get in your car to stop by a McD's or Taco Bell for a cheap lunch, but we expected this. We did order the Kahlua Pork Nachos one night at Ono Grill and have to say that it was delicious! We booked a mountain/golf view room and we asked for a higher floor, which they gave us and our view was beautiful. I'm sure the ocean view was better, but our view was still very nice. We checked in very early; our flight got in at about 10am and despite the rep at the front desk commenting "you're early", he still was able to get us into a room and was able to meet my preferences. We were not bothered by car alarms going off in the parking lot below us as other reviewers commented (the parking lot is on the mtn/golf side). The room was nice. I'm not sure why some ppl say they are outdated, it had dark wood furniture, a flat screen TV, and a very comfortable bed. Maybe it's the popcorn ceilings?! hehe I guess it could use a little bit of cosmetic work, especially in the restrooms. The bathrooms weren't anything to rave about....a toilet and a shower. Our room was cleaned every day, but just for appearance sake, the bathrooms could use more attention for sure. When we arrived, there was one main elevator out of service for at least 2-3 days, but I later heard that they are remodeling, not to mention, I read constant complaints regarding the elevators, so I was not surprised. Not a major complaint, but it could be an inconvenience for most. We learned to just go to the other elevators on either end and those were quicker. And, we just had to remember that we were on vacation and not in a hurry, so just relax! My husband said it would be great if they added a lazy river since the pool area is so large and connecting. But, we walked around to nearby resorts and still thought the Westin's pool area was better! Also, a suggestion.... play some island music at the pool area! It would add to the ambiance... may even "encourage" more drink purchases. ;-) During this trip, we opted not to do a luau, which was fine. We got lucky and found a spot where we could actually view the dancers at the luau above the stage so that was great! In reading even the most recent hotel reviews on here, I could see how others may have had a bad experience with rude staff or unclean rooms, because there was some staff who never smiled. They could use some improvement in their customer service skills, but luckily, we didn't encounter anyone blatantly rude.. lol. Luckily, we did not have a bad experience here!! And, surprisingly, it was not over crowded when we went. There were times, we wished there were a little bit more people there, but it was fine. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the Westin Maui and would definitely return. Oh, I forgot to mention that we called ahead of time to let them know it was my birthday and our anniversary so, they had a bottle of champagne and a delicious small birthday cake in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kapuak
Reviews.Content: My family and I flew over to Maui from The Big Island to attend an event in Lahaina, on departure of our trip to return home we began to itch and after some medical investigation found out that we indeed had bed bugs from our hotel rooms. WE told the hotel of the incident and they replied a month later that there was no evidence of a bed bug infestation and brushed us off like a bunch of nobody's. A bunch of nobodys wouldn't fork almost $1000 for a weekend stay at their property. Very disappointed and I will NOT be returning to any Westin properties.

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Sarah E
Reviews.Content: At first you think this is it! They have an incredible pool, a famed spa and a marketing presence that makes you drool with anticipation. Then you get there and the hotel is full of Grouponesque guests who are rude and obnoxious...and we haven't even checked into our room yet. The room was very small, but hey it's a room and we're not living there right? The shower was full of hair (stuck to the wall and faucet) and some kind of goo build up around the edges of the tub (icky!!). We had to have the bathroom cleaned again before we could shower it was so gross. But wait it gets better...The sheets on one of the beds had not been changed before our stay and sadly something we discovered the next morning when I realized my son had slept in blood (YES BLOOD) stained sheets that hadn't been washed. We were sooo tired and had the lights down low when he went to bed, we could not see the spots (Now I check the bedding very closely before letting myself or my family get in a hotel bed). Then I went to make some coffee and there were pubic hairs (at least that's what they looked like) in the coffee pot. That was it...we left immediately and moved to another hotel. For what the Westin Maui charges we expected a far better and cleaner experience. There are much better options (even the cheap hotels are mainted better) on Kaanapali beach. This hotel is gross and should be avoided unless you prefer filth and trashy fellow guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, but Poor Service with little exception”
Reviews.Author: Tammi B
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Hawaii and 2nd to Maui. We have stayed at Starwood Resorts (Westin and Sheraton) a few times, but this was the least pleasant experience. First, when we arrived at check-in time. after 3:00pm we were told that our room was not ready and to come back later. Literally, 2.5 hours later, our room was still not ready and it seemed as if the front desk person was being inconvenienced to provide a room. She was inconsiderate and did not seem sympathetic that we had a child who was extremely tired from the long flight. Also, several times when we were in the line for the front desk there was only one person who seemed to be working with guests although there were others who were at the front, but not acknowledging that there were people waiting for assistance. Second, the room was outdated and dirty, with dust all over the fixtures, desk, phone and crumbs on the floor. Good thing I had brought my own Lysol wipes to clean. The bathroom was okay, but our toilet had problems (running constantly) and it sounded like a wind tunnel in the commode area. Third, I agree with other reviews that the lines for coffee and pastries was at least 10 minutes every day and the servers were not smiling nor attentive. I often waited at least 2-3 minutes to be acknowledged at the counter. Fourth, the self-parking was often crowded and we were concerned that the parking spaces were too close together and our daughter and myself had to exit the car prior to parking in the tight spaces. Also, twice cars were parked behind us and we had to alert the valet to move the car so we could leave. Fifth, the food was outrageously expensive. Yes, I know it's Hawaii, but why would I pay $5 dollars for a small OJ that I can get at Safeway (down the street) for less than $2. Same with other food items: $5 for a muffin, $8 for a breakfast sandwich, $8 for a fruit smoothie. Sixth, the internet (both wireless and room) was terrible. We had little signal and were often having to reboot our respective devices to reconnect. My husband had to sit down near the front desk to get even close to a constant signal. This service was also supposed to be part of the $25 dollar resort fee. Last, we paid $25 dollars a day for 2 small bottles of water, self-parking and who knows what else -- definitely not worth that amount and often less at other hotels. There were two high points, one of our servers at the Ono Bar & Grill was very friendly during our first day and sympathized with our wait for a room. Second, was the concierge Mike who treated us so kindly and was very enthusiastic to book our Luau experience. Overall, the stay was purely average and I would think twice about booking at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jenny H
Reviews.Content: Though it rained most of the days we were in Lahaina, staying at the Westin still was a beautiful paradise oasis. Rooms were spacious, clean and the Oceanfront room views left you breathless. So beautiful! When we checked in though the person was not in the most cheerful mood, but she did her job and that's all we can ask for. We did mention we were on out honeymoon and we were presented with a bottle of chilled champagne which was nice so thank you moody lady! Also our AAA package came with breakfast and the breakfast buffet was delicious! Not much variety that changes day to day, but overall it was still good.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING TRIP ! memories for a lifetime !”
Reviews.Author: Rick L
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time in Hawaii 2nd time in Maui, stayed on the big island in the Waikoloa Village ,Huge and alot of kids, stayed in Waikiki, also rented a private million Dollar home in Makena, This Hotel is awesome! the grounds are beautiful and the constant sounds of the ocean and water falls are so soothing we kept our terrace door open every night to hear the tranquil sounds. the adult only pool is the only way to get away from the crowds , we brough a football and it was always being tossed around by all every day , great vibe at this pool cool people!as for the rest of the pools, the crazy water slide is a BLAST! If you can book up the private Cabana's (the Point or the Bar cabana's) its $90 extra a day and boy is it worth it, its a 12' x 12' enclosed cabana for privacy (wink, wink wink!) you get several lounges chairs for in and out of the blazing sun and a few tables and chairs and a loaded up ice box with fruit and water stocked all day long, we took the cabana every day ! The Staff here are really nice and they gave us a high floor all the way on the end close to the beach with a elevator that no one really uses !! the Food is fantastic , its a lil expensive but heck we're in Hawaii! we rented a car for the entire trip drove all over the island and the GEM of resturants is STAR NOODLE in Lahaina its MUST go to place and they ROCK. we ate there 3 or 4 times , also Leilani's On The Beach Fish taco's in the Whaler's village is a must. We participated in all the daily activities including the ukulele lessons which my girl and i ROCKED since we both play guitar, it came easy to us. we also went on the "timeshare " presentation,Scott is the guy who hooked us up with that ! Scott YOU DA MAN !! our car came in handy since we went to walmart and picked up alot of "supplies" and drove around the island alot! bottom line if this is one of the hotels your considering, just book it , its beautiful, great ,fun and you'll thank me for it !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!”
Reviews.Author: legend2x
Reviews.Content: Everything is amazing and wonderful!! The service was great and everyone of them is sincere with his/her "aloha". Beautiful set up of landscape inside the resort with several large pools connected. Convenient complimentary shuttle service allows you to get to other hot spots of Maui nearby. Have breakfast & dinner at Tropica and enjoy the beach view. Shop at "Whaler's Village" right next door. Take a romantic walk along the beach. Enjoy the spa and other facilities within. We did all that and more.. We totally relaxed and had fun. Here is just a few for improvement: - At breakfast buffet, birds got their share from open-exposed serving spoons and condiments. - Better in-room food selection after 11PM. - Server at Tropica needs more training. We were not able to locate our waitress at many times until 5 minutes later each time. We believe she was taking several breaks in the kitchen. We walked along the beach and checked out other hotels and concluded that Westin Maui is still the number one choice in the neighborhood. We would definitely consider coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: fyodore
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience of Hawaii and I loved it. The Restaurant here was great, and has great holiday drinks. We went to an owner tasting for wine and had a great time. The concierge helped us book all our activities and it could not have been eisier. The spa was great. I didn't want to leave. This place is right on the beach and nice to walk along the beach. The pool is clean, and the sports bar had very attentive waiters, as did the pool side. A great place to spend time in hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: JBFNashville_TN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary for 7 nights at this property, and loved every minute of it! The grounds are breath-taking and very well kept. It was everything I had hoped my first trip to Hawaii would be, I was hoping for a tropical resort-feel, and was not disappointed. We had an ocean-front room, the view was awesome! Food is expensive, but not unreasonable for Hawaii. We made a small grocery run to a Safeway store 3 miles from the hotel, and with the small refrigerator in the room, were able to have several breakfasts and lunches in the room to save money. Very short walk on a sidewalk along the beach to the Sheraton, where you can snorkel at the Black Rock. Ate at Hula Grill several times, also just a short walk from the Westin, great food and atmosphere. This sidewalk runs along between the beach and hotels/restaurants, very convenient to other restaurants and shopping. The staff was superb, very accomodating. There's a concierge about every corner, they are everywhere, and super friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: subadiver1
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and the staff is incredibly accommodating. We received complimentary champagne (requested for our anniversary). Rooms are given either mountain view or ocean view. If you get a mountain view room, try to get one on one of the upper floors as we did (the view is gorgeous up high, just call in advance to request this). The parking was hassle-free. The gym was clean, had various types of cardio machines that are state of the art, and the weight machines are all you need to get a good workout in. The spa is $25/day (unless you get a treatment, which are expensive but appropriately priced for a high-end hotel). The hotel is beachfront, so there's no drive or long walk needed to go into the water. The beach itself is not packed by any means, the water is clear and warm. Good place for snorkeling (Black Rock), and there are many activities that you can book through the hotel (AmEx). If the salt water isn't your thing, the multiple pools are amazing as well. There's even a division between adult pools and children's pools, which makes it nice for those of us who are looking for a quiet and relaxing place to sunbathe. The guests are mostly couples, and young families. The standard room is decently sized (~250sq ft, not counting the vanity area and bathroom), w flat screen TV, sleek furniture and sizeable armoire, marble countertops, a safe, a minifridge, balcony with a couple chairs and a table (great for drinking your morning coffee), free wifi, and a blowdrier... Ray (the concierge), Steve (scuba instructor/dive master), and Virginia Galenato (our cleaning lady) are top of the line people and are best at what they do. We went to the lu'au on the premises, which was fun, although the meal layout was a bit awkward... they bring one big plate of food that you have to share/ration amongst yourselves at the table (~9 people at each table). The resort is also closely located to the Lahaina strip, where you'll find many shops, boutiques, restaurants, etc. The down sides- half of the elevators were down at any given time, and there's no shuttle service to/from our airport (kahului). This being said, our stay was fun and relaxing all at the same time, very enjoyable, and well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A much needed vacation”
Reviews.Author: moulderkeb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus our 3 year old daughter stayed here Sept. 21-27, 2011. This was a good date to choose because the weather was great and the resort did not have the crowds others have written about. When we pulled up to the resort, we could tell it was a mega resort ( which we like) and could also see that the beach tower looks a little out dated from the outside. As others have mentioned, the lobby/resort area is very impressive and has the WOW factor we all want. We booked our stay through Costco which I highly suggest ( all kinds of extra perks/freebies). After mucg debate, I called Costco and payed for the upgraded toom to Oceanview. This is a must!!! You will be disappointed with there Mountian View rooms. While waiting for our car each day, seeing the mountain view rooms, my wife and I commented how awful the view was. Absolutely without hesitation get the resort/ocean view room and request the Beach tower. It is much newer. Also request away from the elevators and above the 4th floor to get better view and not hear the noisy elevators. The beds are awesome here!! we slept great. The rooms are nothing fancy, but honestly you spend more time enjoying Maui than the rooms. We did have to move rooms because the first rooms was very dirty and did not have the view we had paid for. The resort moved us to a great room on the 5th floor Beach tower. Pools are very fun and relaxing. If you do have kids though, there wlll be no access to a jacuzzi for you on your trip. The only jacuzzi is at the adult pool. Take advantage of happy hours for food/dring at both the resort and Whalers village. There is Martini hour at Tropica and happy hour at Ono's. I also suggest the happy hour next door at Leilani's restaurant. This is a great way to keep cost down. As everyone else suggested, stock up on snacks for the room at ABC store in Whalers Village right next to resort. My wife and I both enjoyed great massages at the resort, look on the website as they have specials every month. You must take time to snorkel at Black Rock, it is fantastic. Saw turtles and spotted Eagle Rays. The Gemeni sail boat the resort is great too. Staff is awesome. Book on their website, it is cheaper than booking at the resort itself. We did the sunset cruise which was relaxing. All in all we had a great trip and I would suggest this resort especially because of the grounds and its central location in Kaanapali!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: ameri s
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely beautiful!! I stayed at this resort on my honeymoon and had an amazing time. The open lobby and swimming area is inviting and provides a great tropical feel. The entire staff was wonderful! They were incredibly nice and accommodating! The food at the restaurants was terrific and fresh! Although my husband and I are easy to please, The Westin went out of their way to take care of us on our honeymoon and we had the best time!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ktown25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for a week at the end of September for our wedding/honeymoon (we got married in Lahaina while we were there). When I walked in the lobby I immediatly felt like I was in paradise. The open lobby, with the waterfalls, the flamingos, birds, and fish created a great ambiance. Check in went well, they were very friendly but the front desk did consistanly have a line of several guests. The wait was never more than 5 minutes or so, so I didn't mind too much. The room was not as nice as other Westins we have stayed in but it wasn't bad either. Kind of small and maybe a tad outdated, but they did have the Heavenly beds and shower and that was really all we used it for anyway. The food & beverage and the staff were great. From the first drink we had at the Ono, we fell in love with the staff there. We looked forward to seeing all the bartenders daily (especially Shannon & Junior!). We had lunch and dinner there several times and I still dream about the pork sliders! We also had the breakfast buffet one morning, although it was pricy, we were not there to pinch pennies so I would reccomend trying the buffet at least once. Tropica was hands down the best dinner we had on the island. We ate there twice and watched the sunset during dinner and the food and the view were AMAZING! Again, you must eat there at least once as well. The beach was great, we rented paddleboards several times and did some snorkeling in front of the Westin and a lot down at Black Rock (the Sheraton). The erosion on the beach did not bother us at all but we are from Florida so we are used to all kind of beaches. The ocean water was refreshing, we never felt cold in the ocean but the pool was COLD! Maybe it's just my Florida blood but I could not stay in there more than 5 mintues without having a few drinks first LOL! We did, still, make it a point to go down the slide at least once a day. I enjoyed the spa one day which was very, very nice. Beautiful spa, with great monthly specials. The location was great we loved walking to Whaler's Village and to hang out at the Sheraton. We rented a car and we very, very thankful we did. You need a car to get around Maui. But, even though we were there during "off season" the parking got full just about every night. When it did they would valet complementary which was nice, but it still was a small inconvenience. All in all, great trip, great hotel, would highly reccomend. Already trying to plan ways to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful outdoor areas, budget-style rooms”
Reviews.Author: lennyorange
Reviews.Content: The hotel's outside/common areas (lobby, pools, restaurants, gym) are very nice, however our ocean view room in the Ocean Tower was motel quality AT BEST. The bathroom was particularly small and ugly - it really looked like the kind of bathroom you'd find in a cheap motel on the side of a highway. Waitress service for drinks/food was good at the adult pool, however it was non-existent at the other pools. Also, even though it was called the "adult pool," there were children around there all day long, especially in the hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but probably won't return...”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights in September 2011. This was our 7th trip to Maui and our 2nd time staying at the Westin; the 1st was on our honeymoon in 2000. Overall it's an attractive property and we got a reasonable room rate with their promotions (about $350/night), however between the noise issues and feeling like you are being nickel-and-dimed at every turn, we will not be staying here a 3rd time. Pros: -Friendly staff -They upgraded us from a standard ocean view room to a deluxe ocean view room when we checked-in (larger room/closer to the ocean) -Good sized lanai -The rooms are nicely furnished and clean -The property is beautiful and close to the beach, shopping and restaurants -Within walking distance to Black Rock (great place to snorkel) -We love to occasionally splurge on room service and their food is pretty good -One of their pools is for adults only -Convenient jacks so we could hook-up our iPod and listen to music thru our TV Cons: -The biggest reason I won't return is that every night from 5 PM to 9 PM they have LOUD live music in the restaurant. Call me crazy, but when I go on a beach vacation I want to listen to the waves crashing on the sand, not some guy putting his personal spin on Margaritaville. Even with the sliding glass door closed and the TV on in our 7th story room, we could still hear the music. Perhaps if we'd stayed in the Ocean Tower, which is further away from the restaurant, the music wouldn't have been so loud. Of course then we also would have been further away from the ocean... -You have to wear a wristband when hanging out by the pool. I understand and appreciate that they only want hotel guests using the pool and hanging out in the lounge chairs, but why can't they just determine this by the pool towels? They already have a system in place where you have to check-out and return the towels using your name and room number. -There were very few and sometimes no staff to take food/drink orders by the pool. -The pool waterfalls are lovely, but loud; especially at 5 AM when I was trying to sleep and my husband was going back and forth from the lanai to the coffeemaker. -The room does not come with a DVD player and if you'd like to rent a movie in-room it costs $17.99 for new releases. Yes, $17.99! -The $25/day resort fee includes basic internet, which is very slow. If you want to upgrade, it is an additional $9.99/day and even that is still extremely slow. -The pools are really cold. After being on the beach all day I like to just hang out and relax in the pool for a while. I'm sorry, but freezing cold water is not relaxing. -Uncomfortable chairs on the lanai. Some units have lounge chairs and these may be more comfortable than the small stiff chairs we had.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GMCann
Reviews.Content: We recently spent time at at the Westin Maui after finishing a cruise from Vancouver to Hawaii. From the moment of arrival to our reluctant departure, this was one of the best vacation stays we have ever enjoyed. The staff, to a person, were helpful, pleasant and very cheerful; the whole resort had a buzz of joy and enthusiasm. Our room was spacious and comfortable, you felt like you could melt into the bed.Room service was great, food was tasty and there were lots of options at the many restaurants within the hotel and along the beach. This may have been our first trip to Maui but we are already talking about returning and the Westin Maui figures highly in our plans.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay for families, but maybe better for singles?”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from September 20 to 25th with my husband and 2 kids (3.5 yrs and 1.5 yr). I got there early for check in and they said my room wasn't ready, so they checked me in and said they'd call me when my room was ready. We waited around the hotel and even went to the Whaler's village, but even at 1:30pm, our room wasn't ready. I was beginning to worry that the cold food we had in our insulated bag was going to go bad (we stayed 5 nights prior at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Villas where we had a full fridge). I asked the bell hop and asked if they can put some stuff in the fridge and they were so helpful!!!!!! After that we went to Kuhului to run some errands and in the meantime, hotel called and said our room was ready. When we got to our room, I was so regretting booking two hotels for our 10 night trip and wished I just stayed at the Villas. Our room (ocean view in the Ocean tower) was pretty small, the carpets looked like it needed to be replaced and so did the wall paper. As someone mentioned earlier, I thought this should have called a Sheraton or better yet a Four Points! However, as we settled in and spent the 5 nights, I walked away thinking it wasn't as bad as I first thought. Here are some of the good highlights: - Heavenly shower! - oh how I missed you!!! Hotel gives you an option to not have both shower heads going to conserve water, but I'm on vacation and one of the reasons I love Westins is because of the heavenly shower! - Recycling bin in each room - just because I don't want to conserve water during my showers doesn't mean I don't think we should recycle during vacation. Each room has a recycling bin, so I thought that was convenient. - Lobby area - The lobby and the grounds of this hotel is really nice. From the water falls, to the flamingos, black swan, koi fish, parrots, it is all very nice - Decent pools - Pools were nice and some of them connected through a cave sort of thing with waterfalls -Tropica restaurant - I'll have a separate review for this restaurant (the good and bad), but I did like having a restaurant ocean front. They also have a early bird and late bird dinner specials which I thought made things a little bit affordable. (since I have two kids, we normally ate early anyway) - Location - Location is kind of nice since it's it's right next to Whaler's village and basically in hotel row where you can walk to other hotels through the beach front sidewalks. - Shuttle service - We used this to go to the Sheraton hotel which is like 2 hotels down, but with 2 little ones, we took the shuttle. I heard there is great snorkeling on the beach near Sheraton. However, with two kids, we didn't snorkel, however, we did see 3 turtles within a couple of feet from us standing in the water, it was pretty amazing. Here are some of the stuff I didn't like as much - This place needs major room renovations - the grounds are really nice, but the rooms do need to be re-done and updated. Also the walls are really thin and you can hear the conversations your next door neighbor is having.
