I kind of felt bad for our neighbors because I had moments where my boys were acting up. - Beach - the beach is not as great as I had hoped. it's actually really short (from the sidewalk to the water) due to eroding. - It's a bit crowded and a little commercialized - Although the grounds are great, there are vendors on the grounds and I feel like too much is going on. I don't feel like it's truly a getaway peaceful resort. However, I think this place will be great for singles since there seems to be a lot going on and lot of people. - Parking - I think many people mentioned this. I went in September when it's not supposed to be even that busy, but it WAS THAT busy! Most nights we were not able to find parking and they had to valet it for us (which is technically free if there is no parking space, but we tipped all the time, so that kind of adds up!) And as I mentioned being crowded with no parking space, it's overall looked like it was a very full hotel as I saw bunch of rooms facing the parking lot (even on the 2nd floor overlooking the valet area) all occupied. I think I will most likely stay at the Westin Villas when returning to Maui, but if I couldn't get it, I can say I would stay at the place. P.S. The only reason I put average for sleep quality in the ratings is because I couldn't sleep well because I could hear the waterfall (which this wouldn't be so bad to some people, but I'm just a sensitive sleeper).

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: travellingvv
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner had a fantastic time at this hotel for 4 nights. only pros because we did not encounter any cons! - The staff was very helpful and welcoming and always pleasant. (They even mailed something back to Australia that I had left there free of charge!) - The facilities were spotless and very well maintained. - The rooms were spotlessly cleaned and very comfortable. - The food was amazing although a little pricey. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: spursfreak21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 9 nights in the Westin Maui. We loved the stay at the hotel and would go back again. The staff was very nice and pleasant , check in was easy even though we arrived 2 hours early. The self parking lot would fill quickly at nights, but when this happened they would Valet park you for free. The beds and showers were very comfortable and while the room was small there was enough room for the two of us. The pools were great, and the beach was very close to the hotel. The hotel is also very close to Whalers Village, and the hotel would run a shuttle to Old Lahaina which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it at all costs”
Reviews.Author: UncleTravellingMike
Reviews.Content: The building is showing its age, and the business is nickel and dime-ing its customers. The elevators are SLOW, the hallways are dark and all the ceilings are LOW. They charge us for internet and other services, regardless if we use them or not. I stayed in 4 places while in Maui, a hostel, couch surfed, a VRBO condo, and the westin, and the westin was the worst by far. my room at the hostel was bigger! not to mention cheaper! Don't let the brand fool you. This building needs to be razed and something more modern should be built in its place.

Reviews.Title: “This is why we come back to the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Golpher
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the mainland from a 10 day stay at the Westin Maui. We had booked a Premium Deluxe Ocean view room and located us on the 11th floor. These rooms are in the Beach Tower (the tower closest to the beach, da). The other tower is called the Ocean Tower. The rooms are smaller in the Ocean Tower as well as being older. I would recommend the Beach Tower due to it's proximity to the pool, dining and Whaler's Village. It is so nice to come down the elevator and there is the pool and dining. You don't have to walk a quarter mile (such as the Sheraton or Hyatt) just to get to the pool or dining. Our room was quiet and the maid service was excellent. Yes, there is an additional $25 daily room fee which includes 2 bottles of water, internet service and parking, but it is no different than any other large resort. It's Hawaii and it isn't cheap. We will be back as it is our 4th stay in the last 6 years.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2011 for our honeymoon. We were upgraded to an ocean view room when we indicated it was our honeymoon. They also gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. We loved the view. Resort far exceeded all of our expectations in all areas. All staff that we encountered were helpful and courteous. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Hawaii. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “loved Lahaina, Maui, location, resort ok too”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel27
Reviews.Content: This resort was ok. The best part was the location, next to Whalers Village which has a great atmosphere at night and walking distance to black rock to watch the cliff dive every night at sunset. All the resorts along this walk look onto a beautiful beach and walkway is fantastic along this beach between all the resort. We had breakfast at the Sheraton one morning, which looked really nice too. We'd probably look into this one next time. The pool looked really nice. We unfortunately didn't get to snorkel at black rock as it was really rough and the beach was closed. The waves were pretty big and took our some poor people getting married on the beach!! We really like Lahaina. It had a nice feel, beachy, casual, not too stuffy like Wailea (we also stayed at the four seaons, which was AMAZING!). If we returned to Hawaii I'd definately return to Maui and it would be hard to pick between Lahaina and Wailea. We went to the Old Lahaina Luau one night which was lots of fun too. I had a pizza near the pool and it was the worst pizza I've ever had. However my partner had a burger and said it was really nice. We had breakfast one morning which was ok. But found a bird was drinking from our milk jug when we returned to our table from the buffet. The rooms were nice, more like a hotel type room. Very comfortable bed. They room and bathroom looked quite new, and updated bathroom. The pools were good, not very deep and probably not as impressive as the pictures look. We got to the end and had to pay a resort fee, which didn't seem to add value to our stay. it included a picture in the resort, which was always booked out, access to the gym, and perhaps water in the room or some other small things I can't remember. I think they should just include this in the cost of the stay, as it leaves a bad taste. Overall it was a good resort which we would probably return to, but would also look into the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui Resort & Spa: Wonderful, Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: JCMHuss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here for a week for our wedding anniv. and it was outstanding over all! Beautiful location; awesome, fun pool area; very good, helpful, informative and friendly staff for the most part (we experienced just one lackluster concierge during our stay); cool, interesting and entertaining luau (Wailele); great restaurant w/ amazing views (Tropica); etc. We will definitely return and would definitely recommend this wonderful hotel to others. One particularly shining point: Grace at the front desk - She was outstanding and went out of her way to make our wedding anniv. experience at Westin Maui a stellar one. BIG kudos to Grace for going above-and-beyond! Thanks so much for genuinely exceeding our expectations. Lastly, a few few small negatives: 1) the aforementioned less-than-awesome concierge (don't recall her name), 2) the fitness room had a couple Precor-like machines - the ones facing pool area - that didn't work properly or at all, 3) our room, especially the balcony and incredible view, were amazing, but the interior design and color was a little unimpressive, to be honest (much more attractive and stylish interiors, for example, at Westin Lagunamar Ocean Villas in Cancun where we spent our honeymoon last year) and 4) speaking of aesthetics, the exterior of the resort could definitely use a paint-job; nice, new, crisp white with maybe some vibrant colors mixed in would be much nicer/more attractive. Again, though, overall, we love the Westin Maui Resort & Spa and will absolutely be returning to paradise ASAP if not sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Not Ultra-Luxurious, But Close Enough”
Reviews.Author: KevDough
Reviews.Content: First thing to remember with this review and any stay in in Maui: You're in Maui, so relax, and rest assured that almost every one of these hotels, especially in the resort town of Kaanapali (all the town is is mega-resorts, nothing else) are going to be of a very desirable class and are all situated right on the main strip of beach that makes up this area. They all line-up in a row, one resort after the other, all in about a half mile stretch that ends at the Sheraton and the outdoor mall/restaurant area. Now to the Westin, and what I expect from a Westin, and what this Westin actually was. The hotel is gigantic, the grounds are impeccable, the pool is everything you imagine from the pictures and more, and the beach is right out the back door. Anything you want here, you can get, and all the services and staff are very good. But it's not a Westin like you'd see in New York City, L.A., etc. It's a mega-resort, like all the other ones that surround it. This is not, however, what I would deem to be a four-star resort. 3.5 in a heartbeat, but not 4 star luxury and elegance. It's clean, comfortable, well maintained, nicely staffed, semi-newly furnished, but still not an elegant 4-star experience. It's a family place, it's ultimately very pedestrian, but not where James Bond would stay, it's where the Bond family from Topeka goes every June, if that makes any sense. Nice place, but if you expect butlers and ambiance and celebrity sightings, go stay up the road at the Ritz for a lot more money. This place is totally fine for the money (note: I book via Hotwire or Travelocity so I pay much less than regular rates, maybe $150/night) and I can't see many being disappointed if they go into knowing that it's a 3.5 start hotel, with everything you'll need, but not ultra-luxurious. The location is great, as all the hotels are right in a row on the beach. This one is situated nicely right near all the restaurants and bars in Kaanapali (tourist traps), and offers free shuttles to Lahaina, where the better restaurants and nightlife can be found.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: itslisaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin for a week and were so pleased with the accomodations. The property is beautiful and right on Ka'anapali Beach. We were upgraded to ocean view and took advantage of the beautiful patio overlooking the park and ocean. The room was nice and included a jacuzzi tub. The staff was attentive and we enjoyed the restaurants onsite. They had a sweet onion dip that I loved. They were nice enough to even give me the recipe (now I just need to find Maui sweet onions in Oregon). I'm sure we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: mcr0132
Reviews.Content: Came for the Maui Marathon a week ago, and sadly was forced to come back to reality, but am already planning for next year. The Westin is a great resort in a beautiful area. You can practically leap off your balcony and land on the beach (not that I would recommend that!) Was there for a week, and had a nicely quiet room until the night before I left, when a bunch of yahoos came in singing around 2am. BUT until then it was nice and quiet. The pool area is incredible, and loved that they had a specific pool for ONLY adults away from the wonderful madness of little ones screaming with merriment. I loved the bar, and the spa was great. The workout facilities were pretty good, but if you are in Maui, I just thought a run on the beach path was sufficient. Directly beside Whaler's village, and some pretty good eats. All in all I would recommend the hotel. The room was a little in need of renovation which is the only reason I give it 4/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCalvin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for our 15 anniversary. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful with a waterfall and pond. Parking is a bit of an issue but if the self parking lot fills up the valets will let you park in the valet lot for no charge. Check in was a breeze, our room was on the 10th floor and was beautiful. Updated and very nice. There is a great shopping area just to the north of the property with multiple great restaurants, the Whalers Village I believe is what it's called. The pool is beautiful with slides for the kids and a private adult area with a bar. Pool side service was a bit slow but the bartenders are very nice and serve good drinks. You can walk along the beach right from the hotel. There is a great breakfast area just off the lobby where you can get Starbucks coffee (it's not a Starbucks) and lots of breakfast items. Much cheaper than the $30 per person buffet at the restaurant. Overall, this was a decent hotel. I'm sure there are better ones but we enjoyed ourselves. The lu'au was pretty cool, check it out if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Worse resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: CMyers91611
Reviews.Content: Paid big $ months ago for room, arrive on our honeymoon to find out they don't guarantee king size bed for what we requested in advance with pay! Thanks for taking our money & giving us crappy service the minute we check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Maui1025
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are beautiful with lots of foliage and waterfalls. Sheryl ,at the concierge desk,is accommodating until she gets you to commit to preview a timeshare. After you go for your preview, she doesn't even acknowledge you when you pass by. The room was clean, however, the carpet and mattress were old and need to be replaced. There is very little availability of handicapped parking due to guests parking without a placard. They need to be monitored on a regular basis to prevent unauthorized parking. In general, the employees have the Aloha spirit and are very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel On The Beach”
Reviews.Author: SB_maui
Reviews.Content: We come back to this hotel every year for over ten years now. The lush vegetation, flamingos, swan, birds and fish add to the ambience of the hotel. The waterfalls and numerous swimming pools create an atmosphere to relax and unwind. You don't have to constantly be on the run while on vacation; it is pleasant just to sit at the hotel and relax. Staff is very nice and helpful; however, don't expect great service from most of the concierge, who feel they are doing you a favor by answering questions. They also push attending a timeshare presentation, which we completed, but once they get their commission they are no longer as helpful or friendly. The hotel has a great buffet and there are three persons in particular who make us feel welcome and valued as a guest in the hotel; these persons are Nerio, Tami Mello and Alaine; they provide great, friendly service which makes a difference and encourages us to come back every year. The buffet is constantly being replenished with fresh items. My only suggestion regarding the buffet is to add a new dish every couple of days; after being at the hotel for two weeks and eating a buffet breakfast every day, it would make a big difference to have a little more variety. We also ate at the Tropica restaurant. The restaurant has greatly improved, with more variety and tasteful choices. Becky is an excellent server, who is friendly and attentive. John Hernandez who is a food runner is especially nice and friendly and conveys the Aloha spirit; he will do whatever it takes to make your dining more enjoyable. He stated that he was raised to respect people and to treat guests at the hotel as if they were part of his family. We also had a great housekeeper, who throughly cleaned our room and was always cheerful and friendly every time we saw her. Her name is Leonara C. and she made us feel welcome and appreciated to be a guest at the hotel. The hotel is undergoing renovation, new paint, new large bird cages for the parrots and updated elevator interiors. We were also told that the rooms will be renovated in the near future. The rooms are clean, however, they could use new carpeting and updated bathrooms. The shower contains old style shower heads (two of them) which waste water; I would prefer the new rain shower type which are becoming prevalent in other hotels. We prefer this hotel versus staying at a timeshare type of property or condominium due to the lush grounds and friendly, attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “meh...it's allright”
Reviews.Author: tourista01
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location. near whaler's village, parrots, and a black swan. fridge in room, big pool Cons: no shallow kid's pool, poor concierge service, busy lobby area, elevator was broken so it took awhile to get to room. This hotel is OK but for the cost of the hotel I wish it had been more than OK. The pool is a constant 4 feet so not the best for little children just learning to swim. Kaanapali beach is nice but pretty crowded, not very peaceful. The hotel was clean and in a great location. We often went to whaler's village for frozen yogurt. For families with younger kid's the Marriott Kaanapali seemed better. If I went to Maui again with little kids, I might stay there or in a condo in a quieter area and with a microwave as well as a fridge. The concierges weren't that great and seemed annoyed with me for asking questions as soon as they found out I wasn't interested in the time share presentation or eating at a restaurant on the Westin property or selling me a ticket to one of the activities they promoted. This is my second time staying here (stayed here 6 years ago) and at that time one of the elevators was broken and it took forever to get to my room. Same thing the entire week of this trip and same elevator! Is this elevator ever working?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but the place felt like a vacation factory”
Reviews.Author: theregularguy
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about my stay at the Westin Maui. In short, I found the staff to be very accommodating, but you need to be comfortable spending your vacation around a LOT of other people. If you like peace and quiet, the Westin (and Ka'anapali) is not for you. I should preface my remarks by saying that, before arriving at this hotel, I spent 7 days in Wailea, which I found to be a much quieter part of the island. The Westin--and all of Ka'anapali for that matter--has a lot more people hanging around. My wife kept saying that she felt like she was in Vegas: there was just too much activity. Based on my stay, I can see two reasons why someone should choose to stay here. First, after the Sheraton, it has the best beach access of all the local hotels on the strand. (However, even this is relative. The beach quickly drops off and parts of it are pretty rocky, so it's difficult to play in the waves.) The second reason to stay here is the close proximity to Whaler's Village, which is an upscale shopping mall. The room itself was a little dated and impersonal, and I expected something a little larger for the price that I paid. The bath/toilet area was quite dark, and there was mildew around the tub. I also think it's funny that Westin crams their trademark double showerhead into a dated and small shower/tub combo. They're going for luxury, but the whole thing ends up looking stupid and tacky. I did appreciate having a fridge in the room. The pool area was nice, but the deck chairs are packed in pretty tight, and it was difficult to find shade. (Shaded cabanas were available for an extra fee.) Speaking of fees, getting two chairs and an umbrella at the beach went for $36/day, which seemed a little unreasonable to me, especially given the high price of the rooms and the added resort fee. I've had good experiences with the Westin brand in the past, but this stay was disappointing. I've stayed at other hotels along the Ka'anapali coast that were superior to the Westin, and I will return to them, instead, on my next trip to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Aly2000
Reviews.Content: The pool and grounds are beautiful, and the staff was very friendly and helpful, without exception. The only minor complaint we had was that the housekeeping was not very thorough, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We love it here”
Reviews.Author: Hollyblueeyes
Reviews.Content: We were worried after seeing some comments but after being here for a day everyone has been great. Rebecca at check in made us feel right at home. We had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room for our anniversary. The resort has been very peaceful and relaxing. Had fun at whalers village and can't wait for our next day of fun. Only negative is the lighting in the bathroom is poor. We couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the beautiful memories!”
Reviews.Author: mezso
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at The Westin with my father, who was visiting from Hungary following my mother's unexpected death in June. It has been my Dad's lifelong dream to visit Hawaii so we were especially looking forward to this visit to Maui. The resort was amazing and so much more. The grounds were immaculate and beautiful, from the first impression of the grandieur of the entrance to the last Aloha and Mahalo as we left. It was as if the staff of The Westin thought of every single detail and made it beautiful. The room was spacious and comfortable, the Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Shower exactly THAT, Heavenly! I now want a double-headed shower for home :-). The pools were pristine and inviting and the location right on Kaanapali beach cannot be beat!! Thank you also for the small things...such as the plumerias and orchids with the tooth picks attached already, so us ladies can just tuck them behind our ears! The talking parrots were a riot, made everyone smile from young to old. Finally, our weeklong trip included 9/11/11 and the commemoration of that fateful day was beautifully done by your staff. Thank you! We had the most amazing time at your hotel and cannot wait to return again soon. Mahalo nui loa!

Reviews.Title: “Outdoor better than indoor”
Reviews.Author: seznang
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 5 nts,very enjoyable resort with great rooms, make sure to get ocean view room! Waterland playground earns it name and reputation. Room service over priced. Kihai has good coffee and breakfast bagels. Front St for best shopping and must try shaved ice. Luau at old lahaina and next door for low key good food restaurant affordable.. Best coffee you will find inside hotel that houses dukes restaurant- also awesome views to be had here. Get in early at the gazebo for brunch near Nepali beach! Had overall great experience, definately Maui is a place for couples, but prefer Waikiki anyday.. Avoid drive to sacred pools at Hana, unless you have lotsa time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for 25th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: pvillesmalltowngirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 9 nights from 8/26 to 9/4/11. We loved the hotel, pools, room and beach. We did not have an ocean view, but we did have a mountain view on the 13th floor and a small side ocean view. We were not in our rooms that much, so an ocean view was not important. Our room had nice amentities, granite counters and a wet bar, bathroom had marble floors, bed was comfortable king size bed, nice flat screen tv and rich cherry furniture. They also had a bottle of champagn waiting for us in our room with a nice anniversary card. The cleaning staff was very good accomodated our requests expeditiously. The hotel pool area and grounds were gorgeous and very tropical. There were plenty of chairs by the pool and they did have an adult section, but we found we liked the larger lower pools better, because it was closer to the beach. There were some kids, but not that many and they did not bother us. We loved the location of the hotel, close to places to eat and Whalers Village. We utilized the complimentary shuttle to Lahaina daily, which only ran once an hour, so if we missed the hotel shuttle there was another shuttle next door at Whalers Village and the cost was only $1 per person. We also loved that walkway that was along the beach, which you could walk to different resorts and Whalers Village, which was very convenient to not have to drive everywhere. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: eds15
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time had at the resort, hotel inside and out was of high standard. Love the interior decoration of the hotel and the landscaping of pools and Koi ponds. We had connected suits with my parents which were stocked with everything we needed for our stay. Service was top notch from the breakfast (lovely girl made us feel so welcome) to the car valeter. I must also write that my parents in there late 60s came from UK with no idea of tipping and had an accident with the toilet which they called housekeeping. Within 10 mins a lovely gentelman came to there rescue with a lovely attuitude towards the situation and unblocked it in seconds, my dad then went to tip him and all was great but on the way out he came back and said I can not take this as it is too much! My dad had accidently given a 50 dollar note instead of a 5 dollar! I have never had a tip returned before but it does show the honesty of the staff that works at this hotel. I am sure I could think of a few things that the hotel could improve like every other place, but overall we had an amzing time there and will be back soon!!! Thank you all from the slide guy who encouraged my dad to have a go, to the towel guys which took the time to entertain us all! Basically the staff and of course the location made it special!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: RC999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week here in Sept 2011 for our honeymoon. Overall, the property is very nice (especially the waterfall entrance with the flamingos and black swan) and well taken care of. Perhaps it was because we went in September, but we didn't see many families here - mainly couples on their honeymoon, young couples with a baby or couples celebrating their anniversaries. Also, we had no problem finding two seats at the pool (even in the afternoon) but this may also be attributed to the time of the year we went. PROS: - 5 connected swimming pools with waterslides that are also fun for adults :) - Centrally located in Kaanapali (right next to Whaler's Village for easy access to ABC Store and food) - Ono restaurant had nice lunch menu with fair prices - AWESOME freshly cut pineapple at the beach towel pickup stand!! CONS: - EXCRUCIATINGLY slow Wi-fi connection - Parking lot tends to get full by around 08:30 PM --> forced to take car in for valet

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Carrie48359
Reviews.Content: There are hotels with nicer rooms, but if you want a clean bathroom and a comfy bed and a great view and a balcony to enjoy the view, the rooms here will suffice. The beds were very comfortable! I will say we got there to find a man's used socks in one of the drawers, and the carpet was clearly not vacuumed, but needed it, but we let it slide. The big pluses were the pool, and the location! The pool here is so beautiful and so much fun. Waterfalls, an awesome slide that even mom had to go down several times, grattos with massive whirlpools, an adult section to the pool with jacuzzi and a bar. Locationwise, this hotel is centeral to everything. A great outdoor mall is right next door with wonderful restaurants and stores that are unique to Hawaii and some that are chain stores, but not common to the east side of the U.S. If you rent a car, getting anywhere from the Westin is easy and worth it because driving anywhere in Maui is worth the time just for the views. A car is not necessary if you like to shop, however, the Westin has a great shuttle that goes to most of the places you could want to go. It is hard to want to leave the property so you have to force yourself to get out. The stores in the hotel have great things to buy and satisfy any cravings or sundrie needs. The restaurants on the property are very good too and they have the best breakfast buffet ever... fresh, delicious food, and I consider myself a "foodie." As far as fun things to do, location, again, works for you. We took a catamaran ride to a great place to snorkle. The ride there was as fun as the snorkling. The Gemini catamaran is right at the hotel beach. People come from all over Maui to take this excursion and it is right outside the hotel. If you want to para-sail, again, the location is right at the beach outside the hotel and it is a blast. We went tandem with 3 people and they took us up 1,200 feet! You can't do that everywhere you go. The better luau is not at this hotel, but the shuttle will take you to Old Lahina Luau where you will experience the best Luau in Maui and includes all premium drinks and all the wonderful food you can consume. I didn't take advantage of the endless cocktails because I was with my kids, but if it were me and a man... it would be different.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Mommy & Me" get-away”
Reviews.Author: Marla H
Reviews.Content: Spent 6days/5nights at the Westin with my almost 3yr old daughter who was the flower girl in my brother's wedding. After a scenic drive from the airport, we pulled up to the hotel by way of a tree-lined driveway and met by a friendly staff. They were quick to grab my stuff and place it in my room which was already waiting for us; a welcomed surprise with a jetlagged toddler especially considering we were a bit earlier than normal check-in time. Upon walking in we were greeted by an impressive walterfall, live flamingos, large koi swimming in grand pools and a traditional Hawaiian shell lei/"Aloha" by the staff. After a quick check-in, we headed up stairs to our room which was nicely appointed with 2 beds, small refrigerator, all the bells and whistles. The room had mountain views overlooking the golf course, Surgar Cane Train and to my surprise also offered a peek of the ocean. The grounds of the hotel were thoughtfully laid out with attention given to an "Adults-Only" pool/bar complimented by plenty of space for kids and families to play without being disruptive to honeymooners, etc. There are several waterfalls withon the pools, a large slide for the big kids/adults and a little shoot for the keiki. My daughter went down the slide at least 100 times. By far the highlight of her trip (great for me because it was free). Other free perks included feeding Harvey the black swan, catching a quick peek at the luau show and dancing to the music til she pooped out. Also, because she is 3 and under, she ate for free. We both got the best 5 nights of sleep I can remember due to the lush beds...ah the beds! I was actually a little sad to sleep in my own bed. Happy to shower at home but miss the beds! NOTE: If you like a firm pillow, call guest services. There are several activties offered at the hotel but they don't push them on you. In fact, so much that I overlooked the offer for a free 4x6 taken by their professional photog...heard about that by my brother. There are kid-friendly, cheap eats at the poolside eateries and pristine beaches in front of the hotel. Safe swimming for my daughter and fun snorkeling for me were just a quick 10 minute stroll to Black Rock. FAVORITE WESTIN MOMENT: my daughter's "Baby" arrived in Maui filthy from travel so I sent it to the laundry manager with her flower girl dress needing to be steamed. They did not charge for cleaning it had it propped on the bed. Another personal touch that really made it feel like home when she walked in the door. I would easliy visit the Westin Maui and will probably investigate other Westin resorts when traveling again with my family. Although my daughter may be too young to remember this trip but it will live a lifetime in my heart!

Reviews.Title: “Best one amongst the 'big ones' in Kaanapali but don't go during high season”
Reviews.Author: Sailaway1002
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with five pools, best beach area along Kaanapali and very courteous and friendly staff. The parking was quite packed during our stay and we were twice waived the valet parking fee. Breakfast was abundant and fresh, but unfortunately during the 6 days we stayed the offered items never changed. Got a little boring. Free towels a nice touch. The only negative to mention is the very old looking rooms and decor (we stayed in the beach tower). The room had a moldy smell on arrival, and the couch was stained. No biggie as we didn't spend too much time in the room, but still for this type of hotel would expect more. Also the wifi connection was rather poor. Overall would stay here again but please renovate your rooms. I think you are better off going away from peak season as the lines for food, at the pool etc.. can get long and the service not as great

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lfour44
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel from one up north farther that was too far away from any night life. We were so glad we did!!! The property is so beautiful and every person we saw was friendly. The bartenders were great and fun to chat with. The pool area and slide are great. We rented a cabana one day and that was good so we had shade but could still enjoy the pool fun. The location is perfect. Right in the heart of Ka'anapail with places to eat and things to do everywhere. We ate at Tropico and had a table out on the grass by the water, very romantic and excellent service. The bar here was excellent also and Freddie is a great bartender and kept giving us samples of different drinks. My 20 year old son loved the fact that he could walk around and there were lots of people his age there. Wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Kula11
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife has a great stay here in Maui. Try to get a sea view room as they are spectacular and great for the sunset which is right over the water as you are facing West. We really enjoyed the concept of a $25 /night hotel charge which covered parking, wireless internet throughout the property, bottles of water, and some other items. The adult pool was quiet and the happy hour had some good deals such as $5 Mai Tais. Black Rock is a short walk away for great snorkeling and they offer hourly shuttle to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: NelCalifornai
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at this property with our 3 children. We were able to get ocean front connecting rooms. The service was good and we loved the pools. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every moment of staying here”
Reviews.Author: Travelhopeful80
Reviews.Content: Reading the negative reviews on the Westin Maui, I was worried that we had booked this hotel. We found we had NOTHING to worry about. We had an oceanfront room in the ocean tower and got a beautiful view of the grounds and the ocean. The room was clean and up-to-date. The lobby was beautiful and pleasant to come back to each day. It easily had the best pool of all the hotels along the beach. It had excellent beach front access and the hotel provided nice, comfortable towels. It was right next to the Whaler's Village which provided easy access to restaurants, souvenirs and emergency items at the ABC store. Yes, the parking spots are small, but the lanes are wide enough that you can make a big, wide turn and get in just fine (as long as the guy next to you parks correctly). If there are no spots, valet handles it and they were always pretty quick. We had NO issues getting a spot at the pool. If you go in the middle of summer at peak summer vacation, maybe it is, but at the end of August/beginning of September we didn't have any issues! I heard people complain that the pool was cold. We had no problems with it except early in the morning, but even then our opinion is that pools are supposed to be cool. It's not a hot tub. Only warnings...1.) unless you're prepared to WAY over pay, don't buy breakfast at the small cafe in the lobby. A bagel with cream cheese was $4.50! However, there are PLENTY of other places to grab breakfast off the grounds. 2.) If you check in/check out at peak time the line does get long and can be slow. So try to avoid peak time. 3.) The internet is free but SLOW and weak. It worked fine but it took considerably longer to upload our pictures. We would absolutely stay here again, without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: mustangz5
Reviews.Content: Overall this property is really nice, but the rooms are fairly standard as Westins go. I stayed here for five nights for my honeymoon. I talked with the hotel a few weeks before my arrival to let them know I was coming for my honeymoon, so I figured this paired with my SPG platinum status, we would get some nice perks...I was wrong. The hotel did provide their standard free bottle of champaigne and a computer written note, but it was not delivered until hours after check in, so we entered a room with nothing special, nothing to make us feel welcome - our stay was just the same as the guest in the room next to us. I had booked an ocean view room, so I assumed an upgrade from this level would be pretty sweet, but it was just another standard room in a bigger building - once again, nothing to make us feel special. Since this was the first hotel of our honeymoon, it really started things off on the wrong foot. Overall service was okay - during busy check in times, they take away their spg gold/platinum checkin line. Hotel is in a good location, especially with the Lahaiana area nearby for food and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort with lots of fun activites!”
Reviews.Author: marissacocores
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Westin Villas, but took the shuttle over to the Westin Resort and Spa to get a massage and see what the resort had to offer. The grounds were definitely the most beautiful of all the places we visited. There are great little shops, but expensive. The pool was amazing. There are watersides, waterfalls, and a little grotto pool. There are lots of activites available and there was surf right in front of the hotel. The only negatives I would say was the horrible expensive drinks we got from the main bar (the upstairs pool bar was great) and the spa was very small. We got an beachside cabana massage and the massage was amazing, but the cabana is right next to the pool seating. It's a little hard to fulling relax when you hear kids playing and screaming.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and beach”
Reviews.Author: AmyNitrate
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Westin Resort. The rooms are small, but they were clean and the beds were very comfortable. All the people that work at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful. Every day we rented an umbrella and chairs on the beach. I think that is the best deal. They also have cabanas that you can rent, but those are set back farther from the beach, and they just didn't seem to be worth the extra money. The beach is probably the most beautiful beach I've ever been on, but if you want to surf or boogie board, this beach is not for you. The waves are gentle...it's purely a relaxation spot, but there are places to snorkel within walking distance. We were with our 11 year old and teenage son, and they both enjoyed the vacation. The kids were very happy that they could play video games and connect to the internet. The 11 year old loved to divide his time between the beach and the pool, which had a great water slide.

Reviews.Title: “Worry Free Relaxing by the Pool”
Reviews.Author: WRS0
Reviews.Content: If you have Starwood points and are tired of the cold this is the place to go and chill and relax. The staff are good and freindly. This place gets busy, sometimes you can't find 4 chairs together (by the pools) to relax. Go for a ride on the Catamaran. Its worth the $100 a person. Great whale watching. Try your hand at surfing just down the path at the point. Try the restaurants around the corner at Whalers Village. Great desert places for a late stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Continue to go back! This place is amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Correen B
Reviews.Content: From the time you check in to the time you leave, everyone is fab here at this resort. Now be prepared to pay for the food and drinks, they are not cheap...but you are on vacation right! We have been four times now in four years. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Westin Maui Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2travel2011_11
Reviews.Content: On April 29th, 2011 my husband and I were married at the Aloha Pavilion of the Westin Maui Resort and Spa on Ka'anapali Beach and it was truly amazing! I would first like to send out my highest of compliments to the staff at this resort, and more specifically to my wedding coordinator Bonnie Stolp. During the year leading up to our wedding Bonnie tirelessly answered the hundreds of questions I sent her way. Her suggestions and recommendations for everything from music to photographers were absolute perfection. The level of organization and professionalism executed by Bonnie and all other staff members working at our wedding ensured that our special day was absolute perfection. Us girls started our day at the Heavenly Spa where the staff were fun, upbeat and accommodating. They did a fantastic job on my makeup which held up for the entire celebration which isn't an easy achievement in the warm tropical weather Maui has to offer. Following the spa we continued our wedding preparations up in the Halawai Lounge that we had reserved specifically for us girls (I highly recommend any bridal party rent this room as it gives tons of space to get ready in with a spectacular view of the entire resort, beach and mountains). Our wedding was presided over by the Reverend Pia Aluli who, with his gentle nature, delivered a beautiful ceremony that we will never forget. Our photographer, Caprice Nicole, captured our special day in the most beautiful pictures without ever overtaking any part of the celebration, allowing us to maintain the fun and relaxing atmosphere that we had strived for on our wedding day. Bonnie and her staff set up the ceremony and dinner venues so beautifully that it exceeded all expectations. The dinner was exceptionally delicious and received rave reviews from all of our guests. Following the buffet, us and our 47 guests enjoyed a fantastic chocolate fondue for dessert topped up by a delicious 3 tier wedding cake that was so good that it disappeared completely before the night was out! Following the toasts, we moved into an indoor venue on the property where the DJ (another recommendation of Bonnie's) kept everyone on the dance floor into the morning hours. He was a ton of fun and entertained every request that was made! For all couples interested in getting married on the island of Maui, my husband and I highly recommend the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. Every part of our wedding exceeded our very high expectations and we truly could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice hotel, dirty rooms, awesome pool/location.”
Reviews.Author: kalani4real
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stood at the Westin August 26-29. Pool is awesome, rooms somewhat dirty, you can hear EVERYTHING your neighbor is doing! Beach is nice, breakfast buffet is yummy. Make sure to utilize free shuttle. Overall good experience. Would stay again, just for pool! ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in this Westin property.”
Reviews.Author: chingala
Reviews.Content: There was just a lack of enthusiasm from everyone at this property. I reserved a room 6 months ago and asked for an upper floor with an ocean view. When I checked in a got the 3rd floor overlooking the parking lot. Yes, there was an ocean but it was unacceptable. After a lot of complaining I got the same location on the 9th floor. The restaurant was good...very good early bird and late 3 course special. Other than that there was nothing special at all about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Concrete and Noise”
Reviews.Author: ramon i
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the Costco Buyers Choice. I would fire the buyer for that recommendation. The grounds of the hotel is a 1970s concrete nightmare. There are huge fake rock mounds with deafening water falls. Find a hotel that actually has some grass and not those stupid water falls. We visited the Honua Kai while we were there because it is rated #1. It had 10x the space and was far more beautiful. Attention Westin: Demo the stupid fake rock mounds and waterfalls. Just have pools and grass in your small common space.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: lane t
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to continue vacation revolved around a wedding here at the hotel - which was beautiful by the way - spent first week at the Westin Villas down the road. Here we were not phoned daily to hear about the timeshare offerings which was a nice break. The beds are very comfy at both and the rooms, while older, are nicely kept up and amenities are nice. Coffee supplied daily and small fridge helpful. The grounds are lovely and the caged birds are great to watch with nice seating all around lobby and bar areas. The Starbucks kiosk is a nice plus too. The location on Kaanapali is the best - easy to walk to Sheraton for cliff diving event in the evening - Hula Grill next door - Whalers Village - beachwalk and other lovely resorts. We have stayed at several resorts along this stretch and this one is very comfortable and convenient to everything - the parking is a pain if you can find it, but they also have that great shuttle to several locations around. I was happier here than at their Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jimkellster
Reviews.Content: The beach is beautiful and the proximity to Lahaina opens up lots of dining and shopping opportunities in addition to those at or near the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and eager to accommodate all requests. Though we were a couple traveling without children, we thought that this would be a great place for families to stay. We loved the open-air spaces and the sense of tranquility that we felt; we were just very comfortable there. The room were nothing out of the ordinary, but comfortable and clean and deserve no complaints. The beds were great; better pillows would have made them more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of Westins better properties 3.7”
Reviews.Author: kelly h
Reviews.Content: The property is nice but, overall not as nice as some starwood hotels. I would have liked to have seen more flowers. The bed is awesome and the furniture is somewhat new but, getting to show its age. The bathroom area is very dated and brings down the rating of this room. For an extra mandated $25 a day you get free internet in your room, access to the gym (which is really crowded by 6:30 am) and parking so that is not bad- I'm not sure why the price of the room does not include all of that. If you are by the pool expecting service you prob. wont get it because I only saw 1 girl walking around but, access to the bars and restaurants isn't that far of a walk. 2 main restaurants on site but, nothing above average. I would stay at a Westin again but, in Maui if i come back I would personally try another hotel. I would splurge a liitle more- like they always say you get what you pay for so in Maui $399 a night- gets you a descent ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous986
Reviews.Content: I will not return to this hotel--throughout our whole stay, the elevator was broken, the phone in our room was broken, and the Internet (which you are required to pay for each day) did not work. When I tried to bring this to the attention of the staff, at first it took 10 minutes for them to even answer the phone, and then they never fixed the problem. They did not seem to care about the guests at all here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but feels small, crowded and busy!”
Reviews.Author: war1today
Reviews.Content: First, we stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas for a week prior to staying at Westin Maui Resort and Spa. The Villas property is literally about a mile or two north of the Resort and Spa, sharing the same beach but a different part of it. Having stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas first, unfortunately all the other properties we stayed at afterwards were not as good - the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas was our best hotel experience in Hawaii. We decided to stay one night at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa just so the kids could enjoy the pseudo water park with slides. Unfortunately, there is really only one genuine slide at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa and for some reason we were thinking there are several. There is a second smaller slide about 10 to 12 feet long but more for the baby set. The primary slide is pretty good for kids and adults. There are two hot tubs but kids are not allowed in them much to the sadness of my kids! The pool area is very busy and loud which is not a problem for us because we live in a world of loud with three boys ages 8, 8 and 11. If you are a couple looking for a quiet time or prefer not to be around kids - this is not the property for you, We found the overall layout of the resort to be confining - felt small relative to the number of people there. The resort rooms surround the pool area on three sides, the fourth side opens to the beach and ocean, The pool area is the center and where most of the activity is. The first room we were given felt like a cage - very small for a family of five or even four. But, again, we were spoiled by the large villas at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas. We asked for an upgrade and the resort was nice enough to give us a room a little bit larger. Both rooms were clean. The whole property was well maintained. The beach in front of the resort is nice, sandy bottom, but not the best for snorkeling. If you walk about a half mile up the beach (there is a sidewalk that goes along the beach)you can reach Black Rock, by the Sheraton, which offers decent snorkeling, as well as amazing cliff diving. You will also walk by a mall en-route to Black Rock which offers fast food dining options and shopping. There are several restaurants along this walk as well. All in all, we just felt like we were at a typical resort with small rooms and a nice pool area - but too many guests. We felt cramped and got the feeling the Westin tried to put as many rooms as possible in the resort, cramming them in with a pool area in the middle. At the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas we felt the opposite - lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JanLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Maui in Aug 2011 to celebrate an anniversary. We couldn't be happier about picking Westin. After talking to a lot of people who have been to Maui, we decided that we wanted to stay on the Ka'anapali Beach. And if you want to stay on Ka'anapali you could not go wrong with the Westin. They have the best beach and pool. I am not kidding. The beach outside the Westin was a lot nicer for swimming than the beach outside the hotel next door. One day we decided to snorkel and were just floating, not taking any effort to paddle. The current pulled us over to the beach next door and it was so rough! And the pools are absolutely glorious - with waterfalls, a hidden whirlpool and slides. My favorite was the adults pool which has a bar that can serve drinks right to the pool. The towel deck place sells inflatable tubes and mats and there is a pump to fill them up too. The hotel staff were very warm and welcoming. They knew we were celebrating an anniversary and sent us champagne to our room. Another day they gave us a box of chocolates. The people at the concierge desk were helpful in giving us directions and suggestions for activities. One of them even recommended we cancel a hike we booked because she said that we could do that on our own. They did try and talk us to attending a timeshare presentation but there was never any pressure and they understood when we said that we were there only for a week and didn't want to spend any time attending timeshare presentations. We stayed in a Mountain view room which had a great view. The first day I was upset when I saw the room because it was a small room. But overall I give Westin Maui 5 stars. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service and dirty room - expected more!”
Reviews.Author: PrazYhwh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are here right now, just checked in. We're here for our 3rd anniversary - were supposed to have 1 king bed.. well the room we're in (716 in the beach tower) has 2 small beds, and on top of that the room is not clean! Um I thought we were going to see a major difference in room cleanliness and guest services than our normal hotel of choice (Kaanapali Shores) - but looks like we should have just stayed there!! :( SOOO Dissapointed. Called the front desk and they gave me the whole "We don't guarantee what you request" - UM WE ARE ON OUR ANNIVERSARY and now looks like we have to squeeze on one small bed. She then told us that they are all sold out and she can't move us to a new room... yea right! They promised to move us tomorrow - but this blows, our first night on the beautiful island of maui and it starts like this. Westin I had spoken so highy of you before. Not good. Gave two stars because they have free pulmeria flowers in the Lobby... OH - and let's not forget that cleanliness thing - i can wipe my finger over the night stand and see my streak through the dust...the bed spread has brownish red stains on it too... don't want to know what that's from!!! :(

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing going for this property”
Reviews.Author: Traveler66
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa and it probably will be the last. We generally like the Westin hotel chain and were hopeful for a good experience, but we were sadly disappointed. We reserved and were placed in a mountain view room, which is a lovely setting in itself. However, you can really enjoy the view too much while sitting in the plastic covered, deflated cushions available on the deck furniture. The table is dusty and the overall deck is old-fashioned, cast iron railings with stained cement floors. Back inside the room, we were treated to scratched and chipped furniture and thread-bare carpet. The bathroom is so small and dated; the door barely clears the toilet. The painted, plywood closet on the bathroom wall (intended to store the ironing board closet) is so classy. Of course, we didn't have need for the closet because we could never get the ironing board to collapse after use. And, the shower heads thrust the water with such force, they were anything but "heavenly" as advertised. When we first laid down after our six hour trip from the mainland, we immediately noticed dozens of miniscule ants crawling all over the pillows and bedding up near the headboard. We immediately called "Service Express" (which we couldn't get to work from the cordless phone) and they told us to leave the pillows in the hallway and they would replace them. We immediately vacated the room and walked around the property, which is admittedly beautiful. When we returned an hour later, we had new pillows and pillow cases. We never did see any more ants...must have been a bad load of laundry. The parking situation is worth a mention. The "self-park" option is included in the $25 a day "resort fee," (which also includes wifi.) However, when we would return between 8:30 and 9:00 PM, the "self-park" was full. This required us to valet park "at no additional charge." However, as decent travelers, we always tip the parking attendants who are extremely efficient and victims of this parking scheme. When we picked up our car the next morning or afternoon from the valet, they would hustle to get our vehicle, but we would have to wait and of course, tip. The parking situation is a pain to say the least and I wish the Westin management would address it so the customers who elect to "self park" can do so without having to tip throughout the week. We thoroughly enjoyed the pools, water slide, ample beach towel availability and on-site beach and snack shop. We had lunch a few days at the poolside restaurant Ono Bar and Grill. The access to Kaanapali Beach, Whaler's Village and Black Rock for snorkeling was a major factor in our completing our stay at the hotel. The activities staff is especially friendly and made suggestions to see the Cirque Polynesia performance and snorkel charter on the Gemini. These were both winners!! We will go back to Maui, but will look at hotel alternatives unless we receive positive information that the Westin has either renovated or upgraded their guests' experience.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: joerunner
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived here I was a bit tired due to the onset of an upper respiratory infection. Then when we entered our room we found it to be much smaller then what we anticipated. My mother in law and sister in law were joining us in the evening and we needed a bigger accommodations to handle the total party of 4. So we did what any self respecting native New York er would do we went to the front desk and talked our way into a bigger room. By the evening the good people of the front desk helped us out and we were placed in a bigger room with a balcony. The young lady at the front desk, Cherine Delanux, really went out of her way to help us and we tipped her accordingly. The room was great with all the necessities of home. Dishwasher, fridge, stove. We went to the supermarket and bought plenty of food for our week stay. The beach is lovely, the sands are easy on the bare feet, the grounds are immaculate and the staff is exceptionally pleasant. I am an avid runner and fitness fanatic do I ran everyday(even with a cold) and used the gym and sauna a few times. All the high end equipment was available for use , while it may not be my home gym it sufficed for my week stay. The pool was well maintained and the slide was a lot of fun even for an old timer like me. This resort caters to families however couples will feel just as welcomed as the family of 5 and will probably enjoy the resort much more because children have their own pool to enjoy. I really enjoy Westin resorts and I would highly recommend this to any of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: What made our stay so great was the staff, especially Donne at the Ono Bar! Big, big, thanks to Donne!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for meetings and we recommend it for pleasure also”
Reviews.Author: Alliesfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a professional meeting. The venue location was great. We could walk to restaurants and the beach, and rarely used our car. The beachwalk is a great way to stroll along the ocean front without getting your feet wet! All the restaurants along the beachwalk are awesome. The only issue we had was that the hotel pools were small and often too crowded, so we spent the majority of time at the beach. All rooms have a balcony. Hotel restaurants have good food and the staff was very accommodating. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Stayed here 10 yrs ago on our honeymoon, and this time it was just as wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: bjamboli
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Has everything you could ask for, and great location. Probably less than 10 min. drive to Lahaina. Best hotel on Kaanapali beach in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Three great days.”
Reviews.Author: BigScooter
Reviews.Content: Staff and service are friendly and helpful, nice ocean view room, pool and beach were great. You have to get up early to claim pool chairs under the few umbrellas. The adult pool worked well for my wife and I. And this resort would be great for families with kids. Two problems - despite being a non-smoking hotel, guests were frequently smoking outside on their decks and the smoke would enter our room. Not to be able to enjoy our hotel room and deck without inhaling second hand cigarette smoke is a big negative. And it was annoying to frequently call the front desk to complain. The other negative was only one elevator in our tower was working for the duration of our stay. I'm generally not a fan of big resorts, however, this was a pleasant place to stay and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Veny P
Reviews.Content: We arrived at a late time on Sunday, when all the most desirable rooms were taken. We were really frustred, as this was a family trip that was planned long ago and my mom was with us for a special trip. At registration, when Mylin Ballesteros saw my disappointment, she worked literally for over an hour trying to find us better room (she told us to go settle in in the meantime). When I came back, she asked us to stay in our room for one night and promised she had a room with nice view the next day. She absolutely delivered a terrific experience for us, and as a result of her, our trip has changed from "just average" to absolutely fabulous - we were able to enjoy beautiful views from our balcony, and my mom stated that "it was a trip of her liftetime." Thank you Mylin, and thank you Westin for another fabulous vacation!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Winner”
Reviews.Author: PCOMND
Reviews.Content: Totally LOVED the room, cleanliness, location. While there weren't any hard sells for the villa properties, I wouldn't have minded a 5 minute talk, upon arrival, about the amenities of the hotel and surrounding amenities. I kept having to call the concierge for advice. I would also recommend an extra jacuzzi. I only saw one jacuzzi on the outside and it was ALWAYS packed.

Reviews.Title: “Still reminisceâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Gl0balTraveller45
Reviews.Content: It has been a long time since we were at the Westin but it is one of our best hotel stays ever. The fact that I forgot my work laptop, combined with Westinâ€™s â€œHeavenly Bedsâ€� may have helped!

Reviews.Title: “Plastic, Smelly, Loud--the opposite of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: trav422
Reviews.Content: I will start this review by saying that I was expecting something completely different when I booked my vacation here based on the other reviews. This hotel is extremely large and I felt that it has perfected the art of nickel and diming its customers to death. Want a beach chair? Pay money. Want to park or use the internet? Resort fee. etc., etc. First, the pros: The beds are soft and the beach towels are surprisingly soft. The location has a decent view when you're standing on the beach. After all, you are on a beach. A couple of the staff were friendly. You can call to complain via 1-800 number at 6:00 AM. The cons that I encountered far exceeded the pros: Most importantly, all three of the rooms I checked in to had defects or noise issues. The first room was a mountain view. Mostly, I saw and heard the parking lot, including slamming of car doors and car alarms. The shower in that room barley functioned. The second room was a garden view (an upgrade for our dissatisfaction) and it smelled like moldy carpet. The carpet was pulling away from the door. The front desk attendant suggested that I simply, "keep the door to the room open," to rid the room of the smell. He said they often have problems with humidity causing mold or mildew smells. The room feels damp and soggy. The third room, also a garden view, was also quite noisy. My husband and I elected to stay in the smelly room instead of the other noisy room. No other rooms were offered to us, possibly due to availability. We are canceling the remainder of our stay and transferring to another hotel. Additional things that were off-putting to me: The staff was rude or off putting most of the time. The food is overpriced for the relative quality, especially the breakfast. Parking is a nightmare after 6:00 PM. Lines to the front desk are long. Some elevators were out during our stay. Another thing that stands out is the aggressive sales pitches the concierges forced us through when we wanted to ask a question. Overall, the stay wasn't great. It isn't romantic and when you're here, you'll feel like you just stepped into an artificial environment. If you like shopping malls and enjoy large swimming pools, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Vschoening
Reviews.Content: The Westin is located right on the beach next to Whalers Village Shopping Center. We had an Ocean Front View room overlooking the pools with a beautiful view of the ocean. I loved sitting on the Lanai while I enjoyed my coffee in the morning. The pools were great, but somewhat crowded. In order to get a decent lounge chair by the pool I had to claim our spot by 7:30am before the pool was even open. I was dismayed to learn that everyone was claiming thier spot by leaving towels on the chairs so early in the morning. Even though the pools are closed after dark, there were children swimming in the pools which could be heard at 10pm from our 11th floor balcony. We stayed in a condo north of the Westin for the first week of our trip and decided to treat ourselves to 3 nights at the Westin. It was a major disappointment for the $459 per night we paid. I expected to walk into a plush room, but instead it was drab, the carpet was worn, wet and lumpy. My first impression was the feeling of being in a cheap hotel room until I looked outside and saw the view. That was my only compensation. Everything at the resort was over priced. Even though we paid a daily $25 resort fee we still had to pay for beach chairs and umbrellas at $35 per day. The self-parking lot was not large enough to accomodate all the guests. If you left to go sight-seeing when you returned there were no available parking spots which meant costly valet parking. Over all I think the Westin is over-priced and not a good value. We will stay in a condo or at the Sheraton on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tamvab
Reviews.Content: After 6 years of staying here annually with our 4 young children, we are done!!! Summary....GREAT Location and wonderful walking ammenities. If the weather is great, you can leave the car parked your entire stay. Right next to Whalers Village,ABC store and shops there is cheap shopping and nightly entertainment for free....BUT disgusting rooms, small, run down, and this year...vomit in the hallway that took several complaints for management to clean, paid for 2 adjoing rooms (on SPG points) and could barely fit the stroller in the entrance. THE POOL is so freakin cold the kids could barely stand it...... Going Back again in December and we will be staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Outstanding Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ScarletKnight_9
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maui this year for our 10-Year anniversary and chose the Westin Maui as our primary hotel destination. I can't say enough about what an outstanding experience it was. The hotel is tough to beat in the area when it comes to quality, value, and proximity to the beach, Black Rock, local snorkeling destinations, and shopping. The grounds were meticulously kept and pools provided both relaxation (quiet at the adult pool) and fun (at the main pool with water slides, volleyball, activities, etc.). This hotel really does have it all. But I have to say that, without question, it was the service that stood out for us. "Exceptional" doesn't seem to be an adequate word. The staff was accommodating to all of our needs, and made us feel right at home. We had some dietary restrictions heading into this trip, and we actually considered postponing our vacation as a result. I am so happy we didn't. The staff was so unbelievably accommodating that it turned our current inconvenience into a truly remarkable and memorable time. While there is no doubt there were many people who helped us out that we never met, we loved how invested the following people were into making us feel special and at home: John King: Thank you for coordinating this special culinary experience. You actually took time out of your own well deserved vacation to follow up with us and make sure ours was special. That is service at it's absolute finest! Michael Wong and Garret Fujieda: Thank you for following through with the amazing food and service that John had promised! Your crew is well run and performed flawlessly. Eric Waddell: Thank you for really making us feel at home during our stay! Your personal approach is unmistakably first class and represents you, the Tropica, and the Westin in the highest light. And on another note: your snorkeling location tip turned out to be our best snorkeling experience while on the island! We snorkeled with about 50 spinner dolphins jumping out of the water, giant schools of fish, Moray eels, Octopus, turtles, and on and on. Wow! Ikaika Manaku: What an incredible chef you are! Your creations, with such limited restrictions to play with, were simply amazing! I can't say enough about how impressed we were with you and your skills! The fact that you came out to meet with us every night while having thought out, and planned for, our dining experience ahead of each night made us feel like celebrities. Very special indeed, as are you. Jimmy (Exceptional server at Tropica): Your smile is undeniably infectious. Your service is first class, fitting of the highest establishments anywhere in the world! Alex (Bartender extraordinaire): Thank you for going out of your way to provide us with exceptional service. No request was too big for you to tackle and we appreciate you taking care of us while relaxing poolside. Finally, Gigi....you da bomb! THANK YOU! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Justin W
Reviews.Content: Location was suitable for our needs. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: cyager
Reviews.Content: We had read some questionable reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. The Westin staff was wonderful super friendly and very helpful. Our room was clean, and although right next the elevator quiet. The pools are nice and so is the beach. Our only complaint: the "adult" pool and hot tub are not well watched and there were several times the hot tub was full of kids. Over all we really enjoyed our stay and definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary vacation at Westin Maui!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a Maui vacation for our 23rd wedding anniversary. We stayed for 7 days at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa and we LOVED it!! The hotel staff was very friendly and professional from the moment we arrived until the time we left. Our room was clean and comfortable, although slightly tired. However, the view and balcony from our room ( 10th floor Ocean tower) made it totally worth it! Unbelievable, beautiful 180 degree views of the ocean and beach and pools. Truly, off the chart views! It's worth the extra money to have that room. We could sleep with our curtains open, slider open to hear the ocean and no one could see in our room. Also, they were doing some rennovations on our floor which concerned me, but we NEVER heard any noise, ever and the hotel was very good about it not affecting our stay. We were somewhat concerned as to a few less favorable reviews, however we found the staff to be fantastic. We absolutely love the Westin's beach area and pool area. They are beautiful, clean and never felt crowded. We had arranged to rent beach chairs and an umbrella for several days and met an employee by the name of Kurrent. He is a charming young man who went out of his way to make us feel special. We wanted an umbrella on the end (for more privacy) and he did his best to accomodate us as well as helping us out with the info for the best areas for my husband to surf. He was very knowlegable, friendly and he greeted us every time he saw us at the pool or beach. This personalized attention made The Westin stand out as a hotel that truly puts an emphasis on its employees to make the customers feel welcome and comfortable. We will definitely stay at The Westin again and we will let our friends know about the exceptional service we received!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KamauSVP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I shared in a belated honeymoon (12 years belated!) and stayed at the Westin Maui. I prefer the Westin brand and this hotel lives up to the Westin name. The lobby is beautiful (and I don't normally care about lobbies), with a inner sitting pond complete with beautiful fish and swans. The people were courteous and the hotel assigned a personal Conceirge to us. Bonny was very professional and very helpful. When we left (too soon) after four days, we felt like family. We highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Christy S
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were informed our reservation had been upgraded. They did not tell us it was next to a noisy elevator that runs all night. After a sleepless night, we asked to be downgraded to a room away from the elevator and preferably with 2 double beds that we had requested instead of the king and rollaway we had been upgraded to. We were told it was not possible and basically they did not care. I expected a Westin to be more luxurious instead the rooms were outdated and worn. As our 10 year-old observed, they spent all the money on the lobby and pools and none on the rooms. Pool area is great, especially for kids and the views are wonderful. We just expected more from a Westin than an outdated hotel with poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a BLAST !!!”
Reviews.Author: Eric K
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Westin the last 2 wks. of July. It had always been her dream to go to Hawaii. When she fell ill in Sept. of 2010, She was told to think of something to look forward to, because she was going to go through a bit of a rough time for 7 or 8 months. Well, she chose a trip to Hawaii. What a GREAT choice. It was our 30th anniversary, and, we were going to renew our wedding vows !! When we told Eva, and Katie what our plans were, well, they just went into OVERDRIVE !!! Words cannot describe what they did for us. All I can say is, THANK YOU !!!! Everything was GREAT !!! My sincerest THANKS to - Eva, Katie, Lindsey, Michael, George, and, Eric, for the best time EVER !!! And, making my wifes Dream come True.!!!!! Thank you ALL Eric K.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: jh1223
Reviews.Content: We just had our six night stay at Westin Maui Hotel and Spa. Kids had a blast playing in the pool area and on the beach. We booked a deluxe ocean view and got upgraded to a premium ocean view This is probably our fifth time staying at Westin and still had a great time. The breakfast buffet is a bit pricy but is always great. The room is spacious and it was nice to have a refrigerator in it. Westin has a pretty decent gym so I was happy to take care of my workout all six days. The gym had great air conditioning and TV screen on each machine. Iced cold water dispenser, disinfecting wipes and free head sets. Can't complain. My only complain is that the spa area is very run down so be aware. The ceiling paint in the shower was peeling off, the locker area had torn carpet, very rusty, nasty air vent covers and the robes had stains. The whirlpool and the steam room did not work properly. Quite disappointing. Watch out for the self parking area. The spaces are limited and very very small. Overall we had a great time and would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on earth”
Reviews.Author: Karen K
Reviews.Content: This trip to Maui was a dream come true. What really made it so wonderful was the staff at the Westin. I was renewing my vows there and Eva and Katie couldn't have been more accommodating. Their thoughtfulness and unexpected extra touches made me and my husband feel like royalty. They also made reservations at the resort's top restaurant . The food was excellent the service to die for. Eric the manager could not have been nicer. He came to our table several times to make sure everything was perfect. the staff here at the Westin all went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. They are now considered part of our family. I cannot wait to go back .This resort is the only resort for us. So if you want Heaven on earth go to the WESTIN RESORT AND SPA and visit my friends they will take great care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bluvpugs
Reviews.Content: Overall major disappointment! Came to celebrate 15 year anniversary, booked almost a year in advance. Booked ocean view room, top floor. Got a small window of ocean and a terrific view and sound of the mall parking lot next door. When booked was food we would get "special" treatment for our milestone....that didn't happen. Broken airconditioner, carpet that was disgusting, broken elevators and the constant sound of the food court delivery trucks unloading at the mall. Not what you expect when paying almost $500 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Anne877
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Expedia and have a Starwoods membership. Upon arrival I was told there were no double beds for my ocean view room citing my having booked via Expedia. Evidently although my reservations showed double beds, this is not honored. I asked to speak with the Manager and ended up having to move rooms 3 times. The first room was a disaster; could have sworn I was in a cheap hotel - the table has a visible layer of dust, TV was not positioned in front of the bed, view did have some ocean but you had to search for it beyond the large cement slabs that appeared to be an unused section of the hotel, and furniture/accessories in the room were chipped and worn. We were not the only ones unhappy. Day two there was a long line with only one customer rep. Never did the manager, or anyone else come out to check on status or assist. One individual got out of line thinking he was going to be able to address his check-out and when he tried to get back in line, there was heated dialogue and what looked to be a fight in the making. Oh yes -- then there was check-out; from all indications you could do it on-line but when it did not work, I was told by the front desk that this was known and I needed to check out direct with them (aha another wait in line). And even the kiosk/computer for boarding passes did not work.
