Again, from all indication it did and only after trying several times and asking the conceirge about it was I told, matter-of-factly, that Hawaiin Airlines did not allow the connection and it had not worked for a month. When I mentioned this at check-out, the front desk person indicated she had no awareness of this problem. Lastly, I was quite surprised to find only one small jacuzzi on the grounds and it was for adults only. Mmmmm, where is this on the write-up about this resort? While there were some nice things, the string of poor customer service was glaring. We won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities for families!”
Reviews.Author: Travelforlife8
Reviews.Content: If you have a young family like us, it's perfect!!! We spent a week there during spring break. First we were offered an upgraded room with a very nice ocean view. The location is superb - you could walk to the Whaler's Villiage which has nice shopping and a food court, and it's an easy drive to Lahaina. The kids club was acceptable. Snorkeling was great at the near by Sheraton beach. But here were the down sides: the room was pretty dated and could really use a face lift. The sales person that pitched the timeshare was downright rude! And although the food was decent, it's pricy. The Easter Egg hunt event was poorly planned due to significantly underestimated the number of guests and appropriate numbers of supporting staff for the event. This is not as "luxury" as you might be led to believe, but it's comfortable and VERY convenient. I would recommend families to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, and enjoyed our stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Gizm0_88
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa, and we enjoyed our stay here. I am an SPG gold member, and had booked a garden view room using points for our entire stay here. Unfortunately the front desk does not have a Starwood Gold/Platinum check-in counter, so I can see it can be annoying if you have to wait on the long lines for the front desk, but we had checked-in late at night and checked-out early in the morning. There is a $25 resort fee each day, which includes internet and parking fees if you have a car. We did have a rental car, and every night the lot was completely full, so we ended up using the valet service, which was very fast and efficient. The room we stayed in was on the Starwood Preferred floor, and had a balcony with the view of the gardens/mountain and a bit of the parking lot. Our room had a king size bed, a table with two chairs, a fridge, coffee maker, and we had 2 bottles of water that was replenished each day. The first day we arrived, there was some sand in the bathroom that wasn't cleaned well, but for the rest of the stay they cleaned the room fine. One day, housekeeping had missed our room, and after calling the front desk, they came and cleaned our room right away. I made an appointment for a massage at the spa, which was wonderful and relaxing. The pools are nice and had 2 water slides. When you get your towels, they will give you a wristband and record your room and when you return them. We found a lot more children playing at the pool this time as compared to our February stay, but that was probably due to the summer time as school is out. Outside of the Westin, the beach is beautiful with the sunsets and has a nice walkway that you can walk all the way to the Sheraton and Black Rock. Next to the Westin is the Whaler's Village with shops and other restaurants, so if you don't have a car, there are other places to eat. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Westin both times, and if we came back to Maui, we probably would use SPG cash and points or points to book our rooms here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Setting”
Reviews.Author: JBearit
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui has an amazing lagoon setting that extends into the lobby. You instantly feel you've entered into a lush tropical world. Several swimming pools on different levels mesh well with the setting and allow ample opportunity for you to find the one for you. We never felt the pool area was overcrowded. If the beach is more your thing, the ocean is only steps away. A sidewalk along the beach takes you to other nearby resorts, restaurants, and an open air mall. The room we stayed in had was nicely appointed but not lavish with a balcony overlooking the lagoon and the ocean beyond. There seemed to be activities every day and my wife took a lei making lesson. The only real negative was the breakfast buffet. There were a number of food options and the food seemed well prepared but it was outside and attracted a constant horde of birds who regularly landed on the tables and attacked the buffet whenever they thought they could get away with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with all the trimmings”
Reviews.Author: Jules_JW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited The Westin Maui for our honeymoon before moving onto Waikiki for a few more days. This hotel was stunning and we received nothing but impeccable service during what I would image to be its busiest period - August. The service at all the restaurants was great, breakfast buffet was amazing and the view from our ocean-view room was of the mountains and the ocean - gorgeous. Well worth the extra money as we spent quite a few nights sipping pre dinner drinks on the balcony. Also loved the fact that it had an adults only pool for when you wanted to escape the families. When we wanted to act like kids, the waterslide was great fun. We visited a number of other hotels in the area and thought ours was definately the best. We had a couples massage when we arrived and it was just what the doctor ordered! Great service. We would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expected more from this independently-owned Westin”
Reviews.Author: JesusIsForReal
Reviews.Content: Actually the worst check-in wait ever at a Starwood property - no Starwood Gold/Platinum check in, not enough people working the desk, permanently kept their heads down vs smiling and making eye contact We were delayed arriving by a day due to flight delay - they wanted to charge us for the night anyways (as a Platinum Starwood member!) Ridiculously expensive breakfast buffet (to be expected) Nice evening entertainment music Nice gift of box of chocolates Nice champagne in room to celebrate our anniversary Pools were on the cold side They made you wear a wrist band to get a towel and tracked checking them in/out Nice Sunday church service at a next door Whalers Village restaurant - whales surfacing in the background, hula dances to songs... Snorkeled and swam with sea turtles right off the beach (and at black rock down the beach) They obviously wanted to promote their timeshares - but they were not pushy As a platinum Starwood member, was "upgraded" to a view of the Whaler's Village shopping/restaurant complex and trash bins - give me a break, we changed rooms the next day Overall, did not appreciate the tone of the management from the moment we checked in, did not feel appreciated, expected more of the hotel to match the beautiful location. If we are lucky enough to get back to Maui, I think we'll try the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Mother/Daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: adventurelori9
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I always wanted to take a girls trip to Hawaii and we finally got our chance this summer. I'm glad we decided on the Westin because it was mid-range price wise and right in the middle of everything. It was next door to Whalers Village with great restaurants and shops that we visited often. All the other big hotels were just a beach path stroll away so it was easy to experience their restaurants and activities as well. The lobby was breath-taking and had a rain forest like lagoon with amazing fish and tropical birds. Even though we did not splurge for an ocean view room, it was good sized, clean and had everything we needed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Ronald, who helped us with our bags, was so nice and gave a lot of advice on fun things to do. The only negative things I could say would be that the pool does get crowded early. There were a lot of families with kids that stayed here so around the pool is not the most relaxing environment. We opted to rent chairs and umbrellas down by the beach most days. Definitely call and reserve these in advance. The beach out front is amazing and not too crowded at all. Very peaceful and the water is perfect! The food and activities are a little on the pricey side, but all the resorts seem to be like this. All in all, this was the best vacation I've ever had and hope to come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Our birthday vacation”
Reviews.Author: Autumn814
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the westin was nice. I was a little concerned after seeing some of the reviews. The hotel is nicely located. The rooms can use some updating. We walked around to other hotels in the area they seemed a lot more outdated with less nicer properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: RmdGolfers
Reviews.Content: We - family of 4 with 14 and 16 year old boys - stayed at the Westin Maui Resort for a week's vacation, booked last minute - a month in advance. It was our first visit to Maui and we loved it! Pluses: - beautiful open air lobby - nice pool area, although a bit cold on a couple of days, nice when cooling off - great proximity to beach, Whaler's village, golf - shuttles between properties and to Lahaina were fantastic! - fitness centre is nice with view of pools We were in the Beach Tower - rooms are larger there which is nice. I would say that this hotel is great if you have kids, but perhaps would not be my first choice if I was coming to Maui for a honeymoon. Hotel was fully booked during our stay, but did not feel too crowded. Snorkeling down at Black Rock is fantastic and well worth it. We went to the Sheraton Luau and really enjoyed it. Food is average, but they were really good at moving things along and keeping everyone entertained. Golf in Maui is absolutely stunning. Beautiful holes, wind to challenge you and treacherous greens. Great deals for Juniors can be found. The hotel was great, nice staff, always able to get in the restaurant for meals, room service was speedy, and the location was the very best on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Pools, Attention to Detail was Lacking by the Mgmt.”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: This place was perfectly situated on the Kahanpalli Beach. The hotel was very nice, but was certainly not an upscale resort. It was a very nice mid-priced resort. The check in was frustrating,considering we arrived at 4:30. We had to wait for 45 minutes. Check-in was suppose to be at 3:00PM. The resort property was very well maintained for an older resort. The pools were very nice, but they were not very family friendly if you have small kids. There was no lifeguards and the depth was mostly 4 feet. Saw many kids having to wear life jackets, so their parents could relax a little. The breakfast buffet was good, but it did not change at all the entire week. The food at the resort was what you would expect, overpriced average food. The drinks were quite expensive, except for the happy hour specials. I would highly recommend the sunset cruise on the Gemini boat, the Road to Hana( Especially if you take the mountain road back around Kapalua), Going down to Lahainna for Dinner. The biggest disappointment was the Luau at the Westin. It was overpriced and the food was not very good. You can save your money here and watch it from the adult pool deck for free! The Free Internet is about the Speed of Dial-Up, so have patience. Maui is an amazing island and you can have a good time almost anywhere you go!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: kbdfl
Reviews.Content: The Westin Ka'anapali was not up to regular Westin/ Starwood standards. If you are looking for a cool, sophisticated, upscale hotel - DO NOT book this hotel. My experience at this hotel REALLY makes me question the validity of the other reviews on this hotel OR perhaps the other guests arrived with really low expectations. I am a Starwood Gold Member, I arrived at the hotel at 4pm, stood in a LONG line to check in (did not have a special line for Starwood Preferred Guests), even with a 3pm check in, our room was not ready. We had to wait in the bar for an hour, wouldn't have been so bad if we hadn't flown in from Florida. The hotel is VERY, VERY, VERY crowded. The rooms are sub par, reminded me of a Holiday Inn. Nothing special, certainly nothing luxurious. In addition to the room, I called the Spa several times to make an appt, left messages, however, no one ever called me back. All of this could have been ok (I mean we were in Hawaii) but our room was on the 10th floor with an Oceanview (which of course we paid more for) we were literally in the middles of a CONSTRUCTION ZONE. RIght next to our room was MAJOR Construction, hammering, drilling, walls were coming down, etc. The Hotel Manager was completely non accommodating to me and only offered to move us to a different room (twin Garden view) after my husband called. The fact they put ANYONE in that room OR even on the 10th floor is unbelievable and unacceptable. They also turned off the water due to the construction. They finally moved us to 7 and you could still hear the construction. I understand construction happens but do NOT put guests next to it. Due to the fact they put us in that room and how management's unaccommodating and unprofessional way of handling the situation, I will NEVER stay at Starwood again. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Vacations in Hawaii.”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: The first time I was at The Westin Hotel I was very surprise I knew it was going to be good but not that good, even if the housekepping was a little pain on the *** every single morning so early even when you hang the dont disturb signal you still can heard them in the hallway going up and going down. Besides that everything else was great and wonderful the tours & activities people were so help ful specially Stevie and Kathy thet were awesome and very nice to talk to. One of the things I miss the most is Natalie thats the way I named her, the beautiful black swan swiming on the main and huge pond along with the flamencos. The restaurants were really good the ono bar was just fine going to very good and the other one was almost excellent the pools were pretty good too involve with all those palm trees just like in a jungle and the ocean view room I had was just awsome. Not a perfect hotel but was really and very enjoyable experience to be the very first time to vist Maui, I wouldnt mind at all to come back here pretty soon for my next hawaiian vacation but next time it will be Kauai I'll probably check The Westin Princeville after my experience at the Westin Maui. Mahalo and Aloha!!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, just fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LisaMS_1966
Reviews.Content: First time to Hawaii, started in Honolulu and ended here at this fabulous resort in Maui. It was just perfect. The grounds are fabulous, gorgeous swimming pools, everything is kept clean, manicured, polished. Several different options for breakfast, which was nice. Same for dinner, went to the upscale restaurant one night and had the best fish ever! The rooms were perfect - love the Westin beds. Very nice spa, on-site photographer was also great. Leisurely walks in the evenings, close to Whaler's Shopping Center and other restaurants nearby. The only downside was that we didn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scuba_Dude08_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui from 7/19/11 thru 7/28/11. Overall, I would say it is a great place to stay if you have kids with you. Our 7-year old daughter loved the pool! The location of the hotel is great...right on Ka'anapali Beach, next to great restaurants and the popular Whalers Village. In terms of service, I would say it was good. I'm not one to complain, but there were a few blunders with housekeeping, but nothing to get excited about. My only complaint is the daily $25.00 Resort Fee! They tell you that the fee includes all of these "benefits", but when you really break it all down, it primarily goes towards 2 daily bottles of water. Would we go back?? Yes, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Vini_00_10
Reviews.Content: Okay so its Maui, Hawaii so you dream about luxury, and exactly thats what you get from this resort. Its the best resort we ever stayed at. Now I have travelled a lot, Europe, USA so I know what I am talking about. First thing is the view, amazing. we had the interior view but it was amazing. I was sitting at the window looking outside as soon as we got there. I was there with my son and he absolutely loved the small kiddie pool area they have. We went to the beach in the morning and it was so calm. The resort has very nice restaurants and amazing pools. We were in the pool even in the night and the weather was perfect, They put movie outside on one night. They had kids programs too where you can leave the kids for a few hrs to have your own time. They had shuttle service which was very nice as it dropped us to nearby beach. We had little kitchen area which was useful for us, as we like to cook our own food. Absolutely clean hotel, the bath & shower was so nice. Bed was comfortable. An absolutely amazing trip starts with a good room is what we beleive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kaanapali Beach Front, good hotel & amenities”
Reviews.Author: WABob
Reviews.Content: You go to Maui for the beach, and the Westin has the best beach front on Kaanapali. Other hotels fronting Kaanapali have rough surf areas, and some hotels (the Hyatt) have nothing but a rocky shoreline that is not suitable for swimming. The Westin is centrally located on the beach, so you can easily walk to any other location on Kaanapali. It is just a few minutes down to Black Rock for great snorkeling, which is in front of the Sheraton, and you are just steps away from Whaler's Village for restaurants and shopping. The hotel has a great pool, there are 5 different sections, with water falls, a great water slide, an adult pool, and a cave with a jetted tub. Our kids loved it. Poolside lunch and drink service was great, very friendly waitresses, always making the rounds and service was quick even though the pool area always was quite full. Some of the reviews have noted that the hotel may be quite tired. This is an older property but it is well maintained and the service is very responsive. Rooms are small, but we are a family of four, with a 15 and 18 year old, and the fact is, we were never really in the room anyway, We showered and slept there, and that was about it ( we stayed 7 nights). We did have an ocean view room and I would recommend that type of room. Even for the short amount of time we spent in the room during the day it was still nice to sit on the balcony and look out at the ocean and the islands of Lanai and Molokai. Everything considered, this is an excellent choice for a great beach vacation in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: BevTampaBay_Florida
Reviews.Content: We Love it here!! The service is amazing! It is extremely clean and beautiful!!!! The grounds and pools are very well kept. We espically love the top floor, ocean view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exterior of hotel was beautiful but rooms and service was not up to par”
Reviews.Author: The_World_Travelr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Westin Maui resort last month. I want to start by saying that the exterior of the resort was beautiful. I went with my teenage kids and they loved the beach, pool and water slide as did I. In fact, in my opinion the Westin had the best beach and pool of all the hotels in the area. The service was mixed. The pool side food service and housekeeping were fantastic. However, the front desk was poor. We booked two hotel rooms through a local travel agent. We requested connecting rooms. The travel agent assured me she me such a request in writing. The Westin clearly knew we had minor children because their ages were on the confirmation voucher. Nevertheless, the when we checked in, I was told by the receptionist that we never requested connecting rooms (a fact my travel agent confirmed was untrue) and even if we did the Westin cannot guaratee connecting rooms unless we paid extra. I never heard of a "pay extra" option from any hotel and is clearly not on the hotel's wbsite. Not only did we not get connecting rooms but the rooms on each side of the hallway with 25 to 30 rooms between them (even though I was assured by the clerk before we checked in that it was less than 10 rooms). After much discussion for approximately an hour, the hotel discovered a "cancellation" and was able to accomodate adjoining but not connecting rooms. The interior of the hotel was somewhat aged. The carpeting was stained, the walls were marked. In other words it looked like the carpets were not replaced for awhile and walls had not recently been painted. The rooms themselves looked aged. One of the rooms "heavenly bed" was over soft compared with the other rooms' beds, the air conditioning did not work properly and we had a wonderful view of the dumpster. The reply from the front desk was we are sorry and will note the same. Not a very satisfactory reply. Overall, I would recommend the hotel for the pool and beach but would be sure to investigate the location of the room. One of our rooms was a "higher tier" room and that seemed to be much better in all respects than the room with a dumpster view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, family friendly and the kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gride777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and had a wonderful time. Some of the bigger highlights included the pools and the close proximity of the places to eat. The kids had fun with the slides, both the big and small. The food onsite was tasty and was reasonably priced, with the bonus being my daughter (3) ate for free and we only had to pay half for my son (6). Lastly, it was nice to have a very nice golf course near by. Although it was difficult playing in such breezy conditions I still had a blast. I recommend this place to all families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, subpar service. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: stemar09
Reviews.Content: Location is magnificent. Rooms and facilities are good. Service is really poor and subpar when compare d to Westin standards. As a platinum guest i often stay at starwood properties there including several Westins and only rarely have I found such an unfriendly staff. I wanted to discuss this with the manager on duty tonight. She really did not care (which largely explains the poor service). Avoid the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Family fun and super Luau”
Reviews.Author: bigelow5
Reviews.Content: Very good for family, kids and yet adults can enjoy. The laua is a must see and spend the extra money to get a table in the front rows. Make reservations early to do this even before you arrive on the island! a true "taste" of Hawaii meal and entertainment. Be sure to be in your seat at the end of the show as thats the best. Clean and modern rooms but like all of Hawaii nothing good is cheap. If you want cheap stay 3 blocks of the beach someplace. Easy walk and great views as you do this at sunset, to more restaurants and the whalers shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Maui Luau is Amazing - especially Marla and Moana”
Reviews.Author: drneilneimark
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Westin Maui in Kanapali and just attended a fantastic luau at the hotel. It was a great show, lots of fun and we had FANTASTIC service. Marla ad Moana were fantastic at making our nght special with great service and really friendly personal attention. Thank you Marla, thank you Mana! We loved our evening.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Bron-Yr-Aur
Reviews.Content: To the honeymooning couple seeking an stellar vacation to celebrate your marriage, look no further... I spent a great deal of thought and time planning our honeymoon, and I've got to pat myself on the back for choosing correctly. The Westin was top notch. From the moment we stepped through the door into the open lobby, with waterfalls and flamingos surrounding us, my wife was beaming, and didn't stop until we checked out. I booked via Expedia and was happy with my price (heads up to Starwood Preferred Guest members, expedia bookings don't earn you any points). Nevertheless, it paid to have joined Starwood. Upon check-in at about 5pm, I encountered a pleasant staff member who, upon mentioning it was our honeymoon (do this often!), offered us a bottle of champagne and upgraded us from a 3rd floor room all the way to the 9th (top) floor! Was this due to the honeymoon or SPG membership? Not sure, but my money is on SPG... Its free to join so do it! Room was clean, bed was comfy. View from balcony... INCREDIBLE! Pool complex below you, then white sand, & Molokai on horizon to the right, Lanai to the left. The pools were really fun, five of them linked via waterfalls, waterslides, etc. Also a Grotto area, always fun. Maybe a little cool but it takes, oh, about 6 seconds to acclimate, and feels great in the warm Maui sun. Plenty of lounge chairs to go around, in shade or sun. Actually didn't use the beach that much, our one regret. Ate dinner on the night of our arrival at the poolside bar. Its a bar, not a restaurant, but i was perfectly pleased with the burger I ordered. Didn't eat there for any other meals so cant comment on the other restaurants. Room has a small fridge; we bought bagels and snacks to save money on breakfast and lunch, and made our romantic dinners count! Took advantage of the offer of a free photo session; of course they push you to buy, we politely declined and took our freebie which was very nice. A few pointers on island activities: - Snorkeling in Maui is obviously excellent. We rented gear from Boss Frogs in Lahaina, as well as an underwater camera, & were happy with what we got. The Black Rock is about a 10 min walk down the beach (@ the Sheraton) and offers some great, convenient snorkeling in calm water. Also snorkeled at Molokini on a catamaran trip booked thru Boss Frogs. Molokini was great, Turtle Town was a bit of a letdown, only saw two turtles. Oh well. - The Road to Hana is well worth it. Get the banana bread (we loved Aunt Sandy's on Keanae Rd in Haiku), and the Kalua pork tacos at Up In Smoke BBQ, about 10-15 min before you arrive in Hana. Honokalani Black Sand Beach is a nice place to relax before the drive back. We skipped the Haleakala sunrise, maybe next time around. - Luau: We went to the Sheraton's. The Old Lahaina luau is supposedly the highest rated, but its "authenticity" means no fireknife dancers. We wanted fireknives, so chose the Sheraton. The Kalua pork was incredible, the drinks were maybe a little weak, but plenty of them. A great time overall! - Dining: Mama's Fish House. Just go, its your honeymoon. Make your reservation early, maybe even before you fly to Hawaii. Our only regret was that we ate too late, didn't have a view of the ocean due to darkness. - Beaches: Kaanapali beach can't be beat... white sand, soft lapping waves, snorkeling. What more do you need? Big Beach in southern Maui was also nice. For the daring, Little Beach is right next to Big Beach. Get the *skinny* on this beach from locals or fellow vacationers, you'll get the *bare* truth if you ask around. Overall, I would return to the Westin in a heartbeat, and would urge anyone I know or who may read this to do the same. Honeymooners, book without fear, you'll remember every moment of the trip. Spend the extra on the ocean view room, they sunset here is breathtaking?

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrible hotel. Old, broken down furniture and smelly rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Casavvy1
Reviews.Content: We were suppose to stay at this hotel for five nights using points for two of the five nights. The first night they put us in a room right by the elevator and all night long we heard the elevator going up and down. The room smelled like a 20 year old smoky hotel room. The customer service is horrible. We received no welcome Leigh at time of check-in. Was moved the second night to another room that also smelled and the pillow case was stained with rust spots.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews here were on target!”
Reviews.Author: grayfish4
Reviews.Content: I'm a hotel snob..I admit it and I had been reading reviews for this hotel for almost a year now. I do have to say that for the most part, the reviews have all be correct. I am an avg person wanting a great deal for a family vacation..we don't stay at the most luxurious places, but I want space for my family of 4 and some place nice! The overall facilty is gorgeous! When you walk in to the beautiful and open lobby to the pool/restaurant area, it's breathtaking! The service for check in was NOT a problem and we were ready to roll when we got up to the room and met our bellman. We were on the 9th floor with a mountain view. Absolutely gorgeous!! We enjoyed our week visit in Maui and we really didn't stay in our room for long. Thank goodness...it really was SMALL and we had to take shifts to use the bathroom area. We are a family of 4 with a teenage girl and a 10 year old..so it can get crowded! The bathrooms, like I had read before, were NOT very nice. Very on the low end on everything. So it was a tad dissapointing. There is a construction crew working on the rooms somewhere it the noise was HORRIBLE!! We were so happy we didn't have a small child sleeping or we'd have to move to a different room! It was unbelievable! Overall the service was great, pricey meals at the restaurants, but here's a TIP...get the CHOCOHOLIC dessert at the Ono grill..bring some towels and GO TO THE BEACH and look at the stars!! Noone will be out there and it's always a beautiful STARRY night!! We did that a few times...memory maker!! This was our first time here ever...and we truly loved the visit! Would I stay here? Not sure..but only if possibly could upgrade to a bigger room! You'll love it and you'll be outside for the most part..so enjoy!! I did get a massage and it was wonderful...a July special for $99! Great deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will come back to Maui, but not to the Westin”
Reviews.Author: ItalianainLA
Reviews.Content: The beach is splendid, spacious, not crowded. Location of the hotel could not be better, very close to the Whaler mall where there are restaurants and shops. And that is all. Front Desk employees are overloaded . That is why they are not only unhelpfull, but unhospitable (and I could say even hostil). We arrived at 12 m after a very long flight and asked if maybe our rooms were available. The answer of the guy in the front desk was short and dry: "Check-in time is 3pm". Of course we knew that!. He acted like if he were doing us a great favor. He offered two rooms which were inconvenient for us because they were in different floors.We said we would wait. An hour and a half later he gave us one room. At 3 pm the second room was not ready. He told us "You refused the rooms I offered earlier. You should wait". At 4 pm our second room was not ready yet. Nobody in the hotel had told the housekeeper to clean that room. Employees of the concierge are not different. I had read the reviews which said that they were more interested in selling the Westin Villas time sharing plans than helping guest with information and reservations, and I tought the writers were exagerating. What we experienced is exactly the same. The ladies had long, long talkings with the prospective buyers, and people who just wanted a restaurant reservation had to wait and wait. I am not in the hotel business, but I have common sense: the management of the Westin makes a big mistake in giving two completely different tasks to one employee. The concierge must help guest. He is not there to sell anything. So, for information and reservation it is easier and faster to look in internet and to call directly. That provided you are lucky with the speed of internet. The service included in the "resort fee" is so slow, that you have to be very patient or pay more for the faster one. The rooms we got ("mountain view") were ok, but too small for a resort beach. The beds were very good. Renting a chair and an umbrella at the beach is almost impossible. You have to make a reservation two or three days in advance. Later we found out that the reason is a Maui regulation that impose on each hotel a limit of chairs they can put in the beach. Westin has a quote of just 15 umbrellas! If we have known that before, we would have bought them at a store. The gym was pretty well equiped. The problem is that treadmills were in use all the time. We did not stay at the pools, so the only thing we can comment about it is that they looked very crowded at all times. We realized that the best experiencies of our stay in Maui were outside this hotel. The first one, as I said, is the incredible beach. The second one was the snorkeling tour with Trilogy, and the third one was our dinner at Hula grill restaurant. Maui is a lovely place, but the Westin Hotel is definitely not. This hotel almost spoiled our vacation. I would not recomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, The Westin Maui Resort is the best”
Reviews.Author: andysmom
Reviews.Content: Wow, the Westin Maui is a spectacular place for the family. From the amazing ocean front room, to the bottle of champagne delivered to our door, to the outstanding service and activities, we wished that we had been able to stay two weeks instead of one. This hotel has it all, and the service, especially the concierges, were wonderful. This hote features a nice water slide and large pool for the kids. It also has two adults only pools as well. We bought a vacation package from Pleasant Holidays and including airfare for the 3 of us, with trip insurance, the price was $4600 for a week. I had indicated that it was our anniversary, and upon check-in, a bottle of nice champagne with 2 flutes was delivered to our room. Our room, by the way, was in the beach tower, and it was nothing short of spectacular. A spacious room and bathroom, directly looking out at the ocean. Doesn't get any better than that. We enjoyed being right in the middle of the action; restaurants next door, the boardwalk and the activities counter where you can arrange site seeing or parasailing trips. If you elect to not have your room cleaned, you receive a 20% discount at the hotel's restaurants. That's a bonus. We did tour the Westin timeshare property one day and while we're not interested in spending $70K on a condo, they did treat us nicely and we came away with a $100 gift card and several boxes of chocolate macadamia nut candies. It was worth the 2 hours for sure...and I might even consider renting one of those units next time. Our son, who is 10, was able to go from beach to pool safely and he had a ton of fun being somewhat independent. You do need to rent the beach chairs and umbrellas...never mind, you're not vacation and it was worth it. There's a Starbucks in the lobby with lots of breakfast food so every morning, we just had coffee and a breakfast sandwich instead of going to a restaurant. Our room had a small frig and we stocked it with juice, grapes and a couple of beers. The Westin is a Starwood property and I'm convinced they are the best hotel brand out there. What a great time! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Would Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Holly040
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Maui and we really enjoyed our stay here. Nice pool and vicinity to the beach. Short drive to shops, restaurants and grocery stores. We had access to handicap parking, but if we hadn't, I could see potential issues with parking availability. You may have to pay extra for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely peaceful and amazing!”
Reviews.Author: cali1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so amazing! Worth every penny! We stayed at a timeshare location for a week and then came to this hotel for a few days. As soon as I got there I said to myself... "now this is what a vacation should be!" The grounds were beautiful and relaxing. They was a coffee bar in the lobby as well as fish, parrots, swans, and flamingos. The front desk has fresh flowers for you to put in your hair. We spent most of our time at the pool because my daughter (5yrs old) couldn't get enough of the water slide and grottos. It's definitely a place you can truly relax and enjoy the beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ski-angel1592
Reviews.Content: My family of four, including two teenagers, recently stayed at the Westin Maui. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The main reason for my review is because of the negative reviews I have seen about this hotel. Unless you are an extreme snob please do not pay attention to the negative reviews!! The rooms could use a little updating but who stays in their room?? We used our room for sleeping and showers and it was great!! Yes the pools are cold but they feel wonderful after being in the sun!! If you want warmer water then swim in the beautiful pacific ocean that is steps away from the pools! The staff is very friendly and the grounds are beautful. This hotel is in the perfect location. You have Whalers Village right next door with shops and many dining options. You are also only a 10 minute drive from Lahaina. The only change I would ask the management to make was the time of the Luau. It is literally impossible to see what is going on at the stage because the sun is directly in your eyes until it finally goes down when the show is almost over. Otherwise, it was a perfect vacation and we will definately be back!! Maholo to the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: Travelchixs
Reviews.Content: Great place, but more beds and umbrellas needed at the pool. Resort facilities were good and the staff were very friendly. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Toronto215
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews on tripadvisor my wife and I decided to stay at the Westin for 6 nights. We enjoyed our stay and we would stay at the Westin again. The entrance, with the waterfall and flamingos, is absolutely beautiful. The pools are so nice, although they were way too cold for the first 2 days that we didn't bother going back in until the last day. At some point along the way the water did warm up to a very comfortable temperature. We stayed at the adult only pool which was extremely relaxing and enjoyable. We had poolside lunch service a few times and the service was good, the food was enjoyable, and although we've seen complaints about the price of the food, we didn't find it to be out of line; remember - you are at a resort and getting food delivered to you poolside so don't expect an $8 lunch! We went to the Luau. It was on site and convenient. The food was as expected at a Luau, and the show was ok (not that I have been to any others to compare). There may be better Luau's to see for a better price, but for me it was just an item on my checklist of things to do, and we enjoyed it. We went on the Gemini for the snorkel and lunch sail. We really enjoyed it; swam with the turtles and saw all as expected. The surprise was the lunch which was much better than we expected. As far as the hotel goes, the staff were very friendly and willing to help, especially the concierge (who actually aren't part of the hotel staff but American Express staff). Our room was as described by others; dated. We knew this going into it, and we were fine with it. We overlooked the parking and the mountain and could see a rainbow almost every afternoon on the mountain. We really weren't in our room that much, so it was fine. The sink was outside the toilet/shower area, but that didn't bother us. Yes - the carpet and furniture could use an upgrade but again - not an issue for us. I read many complaints about the parking spaces in the self park and unless you are there to see it yourself, you can't believe it. We had a Mustang convertible, which seemed to be the average size of rental car. There are many families with vans and SUV's as well. The parking spaces are pretty much the same width as our car, allowing for a few inches to open the door at most. I always had to let my wife out before pulling into the spot as we couldn't possibly both open our doors. What are they thinking!!! The good news is that the lot was often full (luckily) so they would valet the car for no extra charge. By the way, if there are two (at most) travelling, I highly recommend getting a convertible. The location is great, the beach is great, Maui far exceeded our expectations. Here's some info for when you are off the property; We really enjoyed walking around Wailers Village. Hula Grill was very enjoyable; the food and bev's were very good, but the atmosphere was awesome! Leilani's was good - we ate at the dining part - not the casual beach part. Make sure you walk around Lahaina (Front St.) and see the shops & try some restaurants. We ate at Mala and loved it. We also at at Kimo's. The food was average - just try to get a table with a decent view. We also had dinner at The Plantation House which was about 20 minutes north. We got there early and got the best table with a spectacular view of the sunset. The food was great. I hope you find this info helpful, and you love your stay in Maui as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Special time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: SusieRussell
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui Resort was very nice. It is only a few steps to the water. Beautiful Hawaiian music in the hotel lobby, so peaceful. The rooms were pretty clean, the sofa and chairs had spots on them. Lovely facility, pools. I'd go again. I did have to ask for a cleaner room -- which was given to us...but still.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texasgal240
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a week here in June and loved it! The lobby and grounds are gorgeous, our mountain-view room was very nice, the pool was incredible, and the beach was great. The staff were courteous and attentive. The only downside was the parking lot. The spaces were very small and the lot was often full. The hotel would offer free valet service in those instances, but it was somewhat inconvenient. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a MAKE-OVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irish964
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by telling all of you that Platinum Member and SVO (Starwood Vacation Owner) and I travel all over the world staying at SPG brands. I read all the reviews on this property and am not sure if people were just blind or just happy to be in Maui but here is what we experienced. The only positive remark on the property I will make is that the pool and landscaping were nice. That is where it stops!!!!!!!! I booked this hotel many months in advance and had to book 2 rooms so my family of 5 could be together. When I booked the Resort the hotel would not guarantee me a suite with a connector room which is why we had to book 2 ocean view rooms. SO, we arrive at the Westin and upon check-in there was no one to greet us with lei's or welcome us with the exception of the bell man. We checked into our room of which only 1 was ready at that time so this is not a big deal. The lady at the desk, who was very nice, checked us in and said we had a double upgrade (more on this later). Hmmmm, this is okay I thought to myself. Anyway our room was not ready as I said so we decided to have a late lunch. We went to the hostess stand and were given a table. The entire area where the restaurant is located (outdoors) which also connects to the pool area is flagstone. EVERYWHERE and I mean EVERYWHERE there were ants on the flagstone which we found a bit concerning and we even had the wait staff move us to a different area which still had the same issue but not as concentrated. So we ordered a couple of Mai Tai's which were horrible!! Whoever mixed the drinks needs to stick to pouring only water and soda. Sorry to be harsh but this is a factual statement. After finishing up our late lunch we were able to get into our room. All we wanted to do was drop off our things and head to the pool and see what else was around the Resort. We entered into our room (remember the supposedly double upgrade) and our jaws dropped!! Literally, I thought to myself this is just a tad upgrade from the Days Inn or Holiday Inn but with a view. This is definitely not what a WESTIN room looks like or smells like for that matter. Again, we had 2 rooms now that connected. Oddly, 1 room had a mildew order and the other was ok. WHY? No excuse for this to happen!! I looked at my wife after we dropped our stuff off and said, "What happened to the double upgrade the front desk lady said we had?" Disappointment not only had sunk in with me but my wife too at this point. We went downstairs to walk around the Resort and then find a spot to lay down at the pool. One side of the Resort by the KIDS CLUB and down towards where they have the Luau had the same foul mildew smell we experienced in our room. NOT GOOD!!! I got everyone settled in by the pool and went to the front desk and spoke to Michael, who was the Customer Service Manager. He was very polite and nice and I want to make that clear as it is only right to give him the proper credit he deserves. I explained how we were very unhappy with the room and property and asked him to see about a SUITE or move us to the Westin Villas (part of SVO a mile or so down the road from the Westin) if that was an option. I was also willing to pay more points and/or money if need be to upgrade to the Suite too which I was willing to do many months prior to arriving in Maui. Well, the Suite was not available and Michael said he would follow up with me on the Villas. Not an issue I told him and I went back to the pool area and told my wife the update. Now, it was getting late in the afternoon and we were all starting to get tired. We are from the East Coast so a 6 hour timezone change is a bit of a transition. When we got back to our room and got our children settled in Michael called and said he could make the change happen to the Villas and we could go either today or tomorrow. We made the move the next day and I will close with saying to EVERYONE that this was the best decision we made on our trip!! Go to the VILLAS!!! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “have a sunset picnic by the beach/pool”
Reviews.Author: JavaAlii
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort. The beach fronting the resort is excellent. There is good snorkeling just right of the resort. Seen turtles, eels, corals(further out), plenty of fish. Clean, friendly, free parking. Use one of the grill by the pool during sunset. It is wonderful. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “A treat to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: elainedi
Reviews.Content: We loved it here, but you have to be willing to part with some dollars.... We had a decently packaged price but upon arrival, got a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the back of a restaurant, complete with dumpsters... Not really our version of paradise. Upon asking at the front desk if we could change rooms, we were told we would have to upgrade to an ocean-view room at somewhere around $100 a night more!! We actually decided to do it and were very glad - the higher up, nicer room had magnificent views and we loved sitting on the balcony looking over the ocean. We traveled with 3 kids and they had a great time. The rooms in the tower section are large enough to accommodate a rollaway The pool is amazing and even has a little cave built in. The only real downside at the Westin is that to get a chair by the pool (especially a rare spot under an umbrella), you DO have to set your alarm, get up early, and stake out a spot; that was disappointing. But overall, we had a wonderful experience. Having Whaler's Village next door was great for shopping needs, souveniers, a snack or meal, or just something different to do. If you want to swim with sea turtles, walk up to Black Rock where you can see them fairly often. (There is a little bit of a current off the far end, but closer in is great for kids wanting to see the turtles.) We thought the Westin was a great property and we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Great Food! Great Rooms! What More Do You Want?”
Reviews.Author: jkifarkis
Reviews.Content: I am so glad i did not pay any attention to the negative reviews as my friend did. My friend had many concerns and wanted to switch hotels after reading some of the negative reviews. Here's our story; check-in was real fast and easy. We are part of the spg rewards and were automatically upgrade. I think the people who were complaining of not getting upgrades did not have pay for the room and used their points-so why complaint!!! The hotel is very beautiful and clean. They have the best staff members that really care about their guests. My daughter injured her finger by slamming the car door on her pinky by our third day!! While we waited to see someone from the security (which was within a couple of minutes) each employee that walked by stopped to make sure my daughter was ok and if we needed anything and were trying to comfort her! I forgot the security guys name but he was amazing!!! He calmed her down, cleaned and gave me proper supplies to keep her pinky cleaned and protected, and escorted us back to our room and waited to make sure my daughter felt comfortable about her pinky before leaving. I was real nervous that it may have been broken or might need stitches but he reassured me that it was fine. While we were relaxing our room, my daughter received this huge banana split ice cream by another staff member that did not leave my side until the security guy came along (she saw how nervous and scared i was). Wow, amazing staff!!! The rooms are very clean and the food was delicious. Although, the pool felt a little cold it wasn't as bad as the reviews made it seem. By 10 it was nice and warm. However, you do need to get towels on the chairs by 6:30 especially if you want to sit under an umbrella. Whalers village is just around the corner and the shops are great and reasonable! You really have to eat at the yogurt place, it's unbelievable!!!! Also, they have many activities for the kids so just make sure to check the schedule and to sign up as soon as you arrive because the time slots fill up fast! Overall, we really had an amazing time staying at the Westin! Staff was great! Food was great! Rooms were great! What more do you want? Thank you Westin Maui Resort and Spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Started our honeymoon off with a BANG!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: irin997
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for 5 nights for our honeymoon and we absolutely loved it! Our package was for an ocean view room and our first room was ocean view, but with a great view of the roof. We spoke with the front desk regarding our room and they were able to give us a fantastic room at the other end of the tower with a view of the pool and ocean. The accommodations were wonderful. Very spacious with lots of storage and plenty of bathroom space as well. There were fridges in the room that were replenished with 2 bottles of complimentary water daily - so be sure to take advantage. One evening I could even see the hotel's luau from our room. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous although we didn't use the pool much. The beach is wonderful and there is awesome snorkeling right in front of the hotel but i recommend getting your gear from the place in Whaler's Village. Better quality and a better price. The location is wonderful and we enjoyed being right next to Whaler's Village and the restauarnt Leilani's on the Beach. We ate there several times on their beachfront patio. The drinks are good and the fish tacos are spectacular! We ate the fish tacos three times. :) Our package came with breakfast coupons for the buffet daily and the buffet is excellent. LOTS of choices and it was all excellently prepared. Beware of the crazy birds though that are dying for your food scraps. :) They were quite comical. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel as there were several options just wandering down the beach walk. We would ABSOLUTELY come back in a heartbeat. I loved Maui and absolutely LOVED the Westin Maui. I would recommend to anyone vacationing in Maui. **Quick tip - don't do what I did and order a bottle of wine from room service. Go downstairs to the hotel gift shop and they have several types of wine and beer to purchase for decent prices. There's an ABC store in Whaler's Village as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: TexasTourist44
Reviews.Content: Paradise. Our balcony view of the resort's pools and islands of Lana'i and Molokai'i beyond were fabulous. We stayed in the middle of the Ocean Tower for 6 nights and had a great time. The hotel was busy, but it was a great place to be. Our family of 4 loved the scuba diving training in the pool and then the dive just off shore from the hotel - we were inked by an octopus and we visited with a sea turtle. The grounds are beautiful and relaxing. There's a family photographer on site and the restaurants are great. Get an ocean view in the ocean tower and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: ohmymy
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time at Maui and first at Westin. hotel ground are beautiful. but very unfriendly staff Specially if you booked by an agency such as travelocity(which we did and love them) .They gave us room on second floor garage view!(our reservation said Garden/mountain view) but they moved us to 5th floor as soon as we walked back to the front desk . They did not gave us a tote bag unless we asked, no Robe, no shower cap.no vanity pack unless you ask. also they gave you $5 coupon if you don't want your room clean daily, but coupon is worthless (several restriction no alcoholic drink,...) parking is packed so you are forced to do valet and obligated to tip,... It was Ok not 4-5star hotel I recommend this hotel for families with Kids ( great pool).If you are on a budget and still want to stay at nice Kanapali hotel(great beach) stay at Royal Lahaina(room are about same size,but remodel and new,clean,pool is very small) aslo walk to black rock for the best snorkeling take a bag of frozen green peas and feed the fish.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose a different place next time!”
Reviews.Author: Stephieseeds
Reviews.Content: First time visit to Hawaii! Room smelled moldy/mildew like. Hotel grounds beautiful. Restaurants expensive!! I would get an ocean view...otherwise you will watch parking lot and cloudy mountain. I just won't stay again. :(

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very average service. Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Hugescoot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in an ocean view room in theueach tower. The room was great, and the location next to whalers village is amazing. Service was poor. The concierge were only interested in selling timeshare, to the point where we gave up asking for anything and foud better luck using google. The staff at the valet and the bar were often surly. My car got blocked in, which was irritation, with no apology from the staff. We waited 40 mins at the restaurant after being sat before we had our order taken; which I. Think reflected the disorganized nature of resortanagrnent more than anything else. Also, if you don't claim a lounger by the pool before 6am you don't stand a chance. Even though it doesn't open until 7am the pool staff doothing to prevent people from just throwing their stuff over loungers and walking away for the day. I complained to the manager - who seemed fairly disinterested in our feedback. I wouldn't stay here again, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's too crowded and the service is average at best.

Reviews.Title: “This place is for families with Children Only”
Reviews.Author: mholi
Reviews.Content: I visited this place for 3 days for business. I rated this hotel as very good because if I had kids this would have a been a good spot although it was expensive and not worth the fees. The hotel is beautiful and the grounds are well kept. Checkin was easy and the staff was very friendly. I was located in an ocean view room which was nice and had a beautiful balcony. Ask for a higher flood to really get a nice view of the property. Note: If you want to see the Luau without the food. Ask for a balcony room near the stage. You will hear the Luau from whatever ocean view room you are in. So if you want to hear AND see the Luau why not. Food: I travel all the time and avoid hotel food at all costs. However, the food in the hotel is really good although it is pricey. Five thai wings for an appetizer will cost you $11. Property: The hotel has a pond with ducks, flamingos, and fish. There are water features throughout the property and several pools. People put towels on the chairs early near the pool. The property is loud and kids are EVERYWHERE. You can hear them in their rooms from the hall, running up and down the hall, and running near the pool. I'm guessing the spa is one of the few places you can get quiet or in your room in the day time while they are at the pool. The property has a nice ocean fron location. The Westin was pricey and I was thrilled to be spending another 3 days renting an oceanfront condo for over half the price and no noise. Being at the Westin is like being a kindergarten teacher. You are either cut out for the noise or you're not. The $25 a day resort fee is killer and not necessary. The internest is slow. You can not even watch Netflix. To get the higher speed you have to pay another $25 which was ridulous. If you don't use the gym or the pool it's just ridiculous. Location: The location is good. It is about 40 minutes from the airport. I would suggest just using the shuttle although I did enjoy my rental car. SPa: Didn't get to go. The place was booked during their two hour special times. It is pricey so if you're trying to save money call ahead for the specials and book before you get there. TIPS on saving money in Maui 1. Get the circulars at the airport that have coupons. The hotel may have some also. 2. Go to the farmers markets and try the grocery stores the Kona coffee is reasonable around $10 for 100% Kona. Be ready for sticker shock at the prices but there are also some good deals to be had. I shopped mostly at Foodland which is like a cheaper Whole Foods. 3, Longs Drugs - This is a really good place to get your souveneirs, chocolates are cheap and on sale. If you want quality stick with Maui Lona. The other chocolates may be cheaper but they lack the quality. Water, etc.. are also cheaper. 4. Go To Costco right near the airport - they sell the Maui Gold pineapples for $3. Everywhere else sells it by the pound and you will pay almost 5 bucks for it. The airport is ridiculous. Pineapples are the only fruit you can bring home. Also, Costco has things like Teriyaki Ribs and the HI candies are cheaper and in bulk to be bring people back gifts and the Mai Tai mixes are a steal. On some items this Costco is expensive just because of HI prices but you will not get better prices for the size. 5. If you're on a budget there are two shopping centers right on the Honopillani Highway and you can spend less around $10 bucks for a meal. If you want local food try L&L Hawaiian and you will get hooked on the Kalbi ribs. I would try Aloha plate. I wanted to go there and heard nothing but good reviews. They serve Hawaiian food but are a few dollars more than L&L. 6. Rent a condo for the week. You can get Oceanfront and get more rooms and a fully equipped kitchen for 1/2 the price of the Westin. The peace and quiet was well worth it. 7. You will get so many fees tacked onto the rental car that you may want to think twice. When I returned by business car to get my personal car the attendant asked me where did I fill up the car. That's odd. I'm thinking it has a full tank of gas why does it matter. Well in Maui, if you don't fill up in Kihei they will add extra fees like 4 or 10 dollars depending on the location. UNREAL! I rented a car for three days and spent over $50 in fees. If you are expecting upgrades because of your status with Avis First, etc... be aware they have something I have found no where else in the US. They have 2 classes of Full Size cars. So don't be surprised when your upgrade gives you a car that is basically smaller than what it would be anywhere else. The people in HI are great!!! The prices ridiculous! The views gorgeous! Finally, the end of this review which I hope save you some money. Priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, please read tips to make your stay wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Tmusic
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just stayed here for July 4th, 2011 for a week. This hotel is perfect for families and especially kids. TIPS: 1. Get to the pool early. AND I mean EARLY. I got there at 600 AM and reserved my "spot" for my family and I wasn't alone. All the chairs were taken at all the pools by 630/700 AM. There is an attendant that comes by and marks your chairs at 730, then comes back by at 830 to make sure you are there, so basically by 830 you have to be at your spot to not lose it. But if you do NOT get to the pool by 630 AM and lay down towels and a shirt or two, you will not get a lounge chair at all, until maybe 3 pm. 2. The Cabanas can be reserved prior to your stay. I tried to get one and they were reserved WEEKS in advance. you can always reserve one and then cancel by 9 am the same day. So better to have one, then not if this is your choice. However, cabanas do not have TV's or even a radio. And there are very few of them. 3. Westin Kids Club, FILLS UP FAST. and only allows a certain amount of kids per counselor. Reserve in advance, you can always cancel. My daughter had a great time here and didn't want to leave. They also do it at night from 6-10. It is kinda pricey, $60 for half day and $80 for full. Only for kids 5 and up. There was babysitting services available. 4. This property is located right next to a shopping area known as the WHALERS Village. Inside this shopping area is an little grocery store called ABC store. You can purchase beer, wine, milk, chips, whatever you need really for at very reasonable prices. We got beer and wine and just stored it in the fridge in our room and drank that by the pool. $7 for a six pack beats $7 A BEER. The hotel drinks are VERY expensive. and I am talking $12 for a pina colada. 5. Next door at the cool Lailani's restaurant is an awesome happy hour every day from 3-5 PM. THey have $4 Mai Tai's, Margaritas and Beer. Also awesome food. I recommend this over the hotel bar/restaurant grill ONO. Which by the way, the hotel food was BAD. only the beach side food was ok. The restaurant TROPICA-AVOID. It was awful. 6. For breakfast and lunch, next door to the hotel near the Whalers Village was Cane and Toro-or named something like this, had INCREDIBLE breakfast. There is also a MCDONALDS in the Whalers Village. Also a SUB shop known as MR. SUB which looked like a hole in the wall, but actually had good Salads and Wraps. I liked the Chicken Ranch wrap and the Greek Chicken Salad. 7. SHUTTLE for Hotel, also services 3 other properties. You are the last to get picked up to head to town, LAHAINA, meaning you don't have to go to any other properties so you get to town quick.... but on the way back to the hotel from your night on the town, they drop everyone else off to the Sheraton, Westin Villas and one other stop prior to the Westin hotel. So, keep in mind the trip on the way back is longer to the hotel then on the way into town. Overall the property was a great location and near lots of shops and restaurants. Would stay here again, but might try Grand Wailea just to switch it up.

Reviews.Title: “Garden view?”
Reviews.Author: truthbtoldNyc
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay, but I wouldn't go back. It was more geared to families than honeymooners or couples looking for a relaxing, romantic weekend. The "GARDEN VIEW" hotel rooms overlook the PARKING LOT. There was an adult pool which was very nice, but spots were hard to find unless you throw a towel on one in the morning - something that reminded me more of an all-inclusive hotel rather than a luxury hotel. Drinks were amazing and hard not to have just one. There was a small fridge in the rooms with bottled water. The shower had a dual shower head, but the tub clogged a bit. Expect extra daily fees and taxes on the hotel bill. I recommend a cabana by the beach ($55 for 2 people) which has drink service and shade if you want it. Also, snorkeling gear can be found next to the hotel for around $8 per day and the snorkeling trips that leave from right next to the Westin are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice”
Reviews.Author: Amberlove21
Reviews.Content: Dont listen to the negative reviews this hotel is awesome and they have flamingos and a black swan! When I first checked in I was a little nervous because the person who checked me in made me feel like I wasn't worthy to stay there because I wanted to use a debit card but negative feelings aside he checked me out and was super nice! The hotel rooms are small but gorgeous, the mountain view is a view of a parking lot but who cares you are a 3 min walk to a beautiful beach! There breakfast buffet is awesome (and btw its a resort so there is no included breakfast, its a resort thing). But they have good selection of foods and it is all good! There resturant Tropica is also AWESOME but its really expensive its a nice splurge for one night there. (Try the tasting menu if they have it, I LOVED it) All and all this was a great long weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Curress02
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Westin and had a wonderful stay. The property was gorgeous and the adult only pool was so relaxing. We would definitely recommend this hotel for family trips or for romantic vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: scoop72Seattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very average. The lobby was dark and not very bright even though it was an "open" area. The valet guys are not very professional... i understand its hawaii and everyone is "hang loose" and all that jazz, but at least be professional and courteous while you are at work. Pool was nice, but very very cramped and so hard to find a place to sit. They also charge you $25 to reserve two beach chairs and a beach umbrella on the beach... Really??!! I thought that was ridiculous. The rooms need to be updated, especially the bathroom. If you like big crowded hotels and don't mind running into people while your walking around the place then this hotel is for you. All in all it was just "okay". We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the "wow" factor”
Reviews.Author: MelissaTX
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel but the wow factor was missing for me. The lobby was beautiful with a huge waterfall. We checked in to two rooms. They were identical in size and shape but one room had a huge table with two chairs blocking most of the entrance to the balcony. I'm sorry I didn't photograph it, because it was just so out of place and awkward. My room didn't have the huge table, but it did have a desk with no chair. I called several times asking that a chair be brought for the desk (see photo), as I had work to do on my computer but the chair was never delivered. Our shower didn't drain and my first shower ended up being a foot bath. We called and maintenance fixed the problem quickly. The room was comfortable enough. Our room was centrally located and therefore we were right above the large waterfall. You can hear the waterfall even with your balcony doors shut and the curtains drawn. It's not a problem, just surprising. The first morning there I was privy to my neighbors VERY loud cell phone conversation he was having on his balcony. It was inconsiderate of him to be so loud before 8am on his balcony, but I also think the hotel could do a better job of sound proofing. The pools were nice but very crowded. There were tons of people walking all over the place all the time. It was Christmas (we checked in on Christmas Eve) so it was a very busy time of year. It was just all a little chaotic for me. We ate twice at the hotel restaurant. Both times it was good. I did appreciate that when we arrived with our car both nights, the self park lot was full so they valet parked us for free. The valet and bell boys were very nice. I didn't chose this hotel, but I don't think I'd stay here again. I gave them 3 stars because I think it is a pretty hotel in a good location (Whaler's village area). I just really prefer the Westin Ocean Villas in the Ka'anapali area. It's much more relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service. Rooms need update.”
Reviews.Author: KJSJJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6/19-6/27. We stayed on the 10th floor in the Beach Tower in a room with an oceanview. The location was perfect with great access to the beach and Whaler's Village. The service was great. Everyone was very nice and accommodating. There was champagne waiting in our room when we arrived. My husband called the week before we left to ensure we had a king bed and mentioned it was our anniversary. It was very nice. The room was not great. The rooms are small which isn't really the issue. It is the furniture. There was a table and chairs in front of the TV armoire. Took up a lot of space. The rooms need updating. Wallpaper peeling, water stains, and damaged tiles were seen in our room. But we were there for the view and were only in the room for sleep. Overall it was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort, great service, very impressive!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beautifulthingsxox
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and based on some of the reviews were a little dubious on whether it would meet our expectations. The resort was spectacular, beautiful pool, gorgeous waterfall with koi and flamingo and sensational location. The room was lovely, very clean and the bed was sensational. We were greeted with a lovely bottle of champagne when the staff learnt we were were celebrating a special occasion and everyone we dealt with was helpful and attentive. The free shuttle is handy but the restaurant is great or there are plenty of other options close by. We'll definately be returning and would highly recommend it to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: scholarma
Reviews.Content: No doubt it's close to the beach, and the water slide is a blast; however, the hot tub is small, poolside lounge chairs are difficult to find, and the rooms could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to go back again”
Reviews.Author: valegill
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Maui to celebration her graduation from college in May 2011. My sister had been to the Westin a few years ago and highly recommended it. I'm glad she did. We thoroughly enjoyed the room--premium deluxe ocean view. The beds as advertised were wonderful and the view of the huge pool complex and ocean was breathtaking. The hotel staff was very responsive to requests. We also enjoyed a daily breakfast buffet that was fabulous. The only drawback was the $25 per day resort fee. Because this was an expensive trip to an unknown area, I used the assistance of a travel agent, Kay Ryan with Maui Vacation Consultants (www.mauikay.com). She arranged a fabulous package that included hotel, flight, and rental car. She also made arrangements for special events prior to our arrival (Lanai Luau), and met us at the hotel when we arrived to help us set up other excursions. When I had problems with flight schedules and checking in, she was able to smooth the way. I would highly recommend using Kay for anyone traveling to Maui. Valerie and Chelsea

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveler_dave_11
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The grounds are very well kept and our room seemed brand new. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: sanmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week long stay at the Westin Maui. We decided to go to Kaanapali this year instead of the Grand Wailea because our children are now young adults and need the shore side entertainment and varied restaurants that the Lahaina side of the island provides. We were not disappointed. The Westin Maui was perfect for our vacation. The staff was incredibly helpful, especially the pool and cabana staff. The rooms were not as luxurious but we do not spend much time in the rooms and so this did not matter to us as much. We enjoyed ourselves very much with all of the close by amenities and activities. We recommend this hotel for location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the WESTIN Maui”
Reviews.Author: Familyof07
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum SPG member and was on a seven nite stay w/my family of five children (5-11) using my Starpoints. I booked the Maui Westin Villas for the first time expecting a remarkable one bedroom ocean front suite. Not only did I get a mediocre room w/no view, the hotel is in North Kaanapali located w/nothing around it (nice free shuttle though). We eat all our meals out, so the time share atmosphere wasn't very appealing. For 30,000pts/nite suffice it to say...I wasn't impressed. I'd take the Marriott for time share. So, I got my 180,000 Starpoints refunded! That same day I shot over to the Westin Resort Hotel, spoke to the SPG counter hostess, Dawn, who spent 20 mins filing thru the locked suites to get Suite room #488 using only 12,000pts/nite getting a Plat upgrade. Huge ocean front corner suite; I believe in the Ocean Tower and overlooking the pool. Can't promise she can do the same for you, but I gave her a generous tip for her time & great choice in rooms; it made our seven nite biennial trip the best yet. We used the fold out couch and our own blow up mattress for the children. Our children always love the pool waterslide (best on island), the lounge chairs w/permanent umbrellas for shade and the pool food for lunches. Starbucks and breakfast items are great in the morning. If you can negotiate a good room (suite) w/view...this is the resort. Also, next door to Whaler's Village; ie. Hula Grill (drinks, music & sunset views...food just ok). Best burgers in Lahaina: Cool Cat Cafe. Sunsets: Kimo's. Kapalua rest: Pineapple Grill (get table near window) and best dessert, upside down pineapple cake w/ice cream. Best breakfast: Aloha Mixed Plate (omlettes & Hawaiian French toast) or another view, Napili Kai Beach House Rest. overlooking nice snorkling/small wave beach cove. Best new rest in Lahaina for food & sunsets: Mala Ocean Tavern. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxed location!”
Reviews.Author: Formytwogirls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We just love the westin Properties and now, we love Hawaii! I just have three negative comments and then I will praise the resort for our stay. First, upon check-in, as Starwood Preferred guests, we were reserved a room with a free upgrade from a deluxe oceanview. We were told there was no upgrade available. A little disappointing. We had a partial oceanview room facing the Whaler's village. It overlooks the parking lot, which is a very busy, noisy, truck polluted area, especially in the mornings. My second complaint is that the resort, surrounding resorts and the Whaler's village, close VERY early...10pm. Not that we are late party animals, but seemed a little early to have the resort cleared out and so quiet at that time. My third complaint was the self-parking lot. We rented a Ford Mustang convertible, along with probably 30 other hotel guests. The partkingspaces are painted VERY small! Hard to find spots and fit is a suv or car parked line to line. I suggest they repaint the lines to accomodate other vehicles rather than compact cars. I really don't think many people who visit Hawaii rent compact cars. The resort is absolutely beautiful. They do have a resort fee. Resort fee always seems silly to me but just make sure you drink your two bottles of water. Housekeeping was always good, staff was very friendly. Our room included a buffet breakfast which was great every morning. The Whaler's village next door was a nice little shopping center with a McDonalds and a good frozen yogurt shop. We always found chairs at the pools and didn't have a problem getiing a waitress at the pool. They do have a shuttle service to a couple locations as well as the other Starwood propeties, which is nice. Located right on the beach with great access. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back & telling everyone that "this is the place"!”
Reviews.Author: Utefanfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8 nights the first week of June. We loved it! Pools were great. The best beach location of all the nearby properties. Beds were heavenly. Housekeeping was very thorough & all staff very helpful always such as Wayne at the front desk. Our personal consierge Sarah Craig was awesome & gave us great info!

Reviews.Title: “Forced ambiance and brusque staff”
Reviews.Author: PepperGoGators
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, our experience at the Westin Maui didnâ€™t come close to matching the stay we had a competitorâ€™s hotel in Kauai. Instead of a relaxing resort feel, we were met by loud children at the pool and loud birds in the lobby that create a forced ambiance. We could get over this though if the staff would have been more helpful or friendly. Staff members were curt and never went above and beyond what was required to help you out or make you feel welcome. Valet isnâ€™t fully staffed so plan on delays getting your car; self-parking lot fills up fast. Never enough towels or waters in the rooms. Plus side? Good location to Front Street and David Paulâ€™s Restaurant (a welcome break from the Westin experience).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice location...”
Reviews.Author: Maxximus99
Reviews.Content: It is a beach location in area called Kaanapali...Its perfect for golfers as well, as there is a golf court just across the street from the hotel. The beach in front of the hotel is nice, and there are plenty things to do as well, from renting a kayak to scubadive in the ocean. small shopping mall is next to the hotel, as well few of the restaurants (Hula grill, Barefoot bar etc.)....Overall the hotel is nice. If you want a higer class hotel, I would recommend Ritz Carlton - little bit further away from everything...or Waldorf Astoria - very class hotel on the other side of the island.....

Reviews.Title: “mostly wonderful - except for small rooms”
Reviews.Author: mblip
Reviews.Content: The ground and lobby are spectacular with koi ponds and exotic birds - altho the trees kept dropping seeds which made some of the common areas appear untended . From the road, and photos, it might appear that this is a new luxury high rise. In fact Westin took over and did some cosmetic refurbishing of an old hotel, and there was little they could do to bring these tiny rooms and bath rooms up to modern standards, and that was a disappointment.
