The hotel sits on a busy strip in Lahaina and is convenient to golf courses and fine restaurants. A bit of a hoof to get to the airport. Since we used Starwood points - I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: juniperjennifer
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The location- beautiful beach, walking distance to shopping, restaurants and Black Rock. Great Location. The room- It was very spacious and clean and had a huge bathroom. The view was amazing. We also liked the wireless internet and comfy beds! The Lobby area- amazingly beautiful with a lagoon and coffee shop and koi fish. It was a great spot to relax with a cup of coffee in the morning. The pool- It was HUGE, there were plenty of chairs available and place to swim without being on top of other people. The waterfalls were so pretty and my husband loved the water slide lol It is a wonderful property with a very warm and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stuart in Recreation gave us the best service we've ever had!!”
Reviews.Author: KymTracey
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I took a family trip to Maui this past February. We have been staying with Westin for about 25 years because of the quality of the hotel, the location, and quality of service. I felt compelled to write this review so everyone else may take advantage of a level of service that we had never experienced until this past February. I want to introduce you to Stuart. He works in Recreation. This is my families experience that he was responsible for creating. We like to spend all our time at the beach. My son and I boogie board and my wife lays in the son. I went down to the beach early one morning and I was immediately greeted by a smiling, personable, and well spoken young man. He introduced himself and welcomed me and my family to the hotel. He then asked how he could help me? I told him that I wanted to rent an umbrella and chairs which he was happy to help with. He was very helpful in explaining how the rental process works and then took the time to point out which spots were available and those spots that he felt were the best. I chose a spot and he immediately grabbed an umbrella and two chairs and RAN them to the spot I chose. He set it up and then asked if it was to my liking. I told him I would be back later with my family. Before I left, Stuart told me that he could set up the rental for as many days as I wanted to reserve it for. I told him I wanted it all week and he made the proper notations and told the appropriate people. I returned 40 minutes later with my family and we arrived at our chairs which Stuart had already placed towels on for us from the head to foot of each chair. Note: this is not a standard thing that I've seen done before. We had a great day and Stuart came by a few times and aksed if we were having a good time at the resort. We chatted a while and mentioned that we were going to Hana the next day so we would not be there. So...we arrived back at the beach the day after the trip to Hana to find that Stuart had again set up our chaisr with towels and had made towel pillows for us based upon his observation of how we roll our towels during the day. He set us up in the same spot that we had chosen for the week. He came by after we were at the beach about 20 minutes and asked how our trip to Hana was and about how dinner was at a local restaurant. I was shocked that he had remembered details that I had shared two days before and thought enough to ask about it. Stuart's service was ultra-high-quality the entire time we were at the Westin. Stuart is courteous, concerned, compassionate, respectful, and detailed. He takes the opportunity to personalize his service in all that he does. Here is the kicker...The last day we were there we did a whale watching cruise. Stuart knew we went on it that day. When we returned we were heading back to our beach chair when I noticed Stuart running in the distance away from the chairs toward his desk area. I ran to catch him and tell him how impressed I was with his service and to show my gratuity to him $$$. I asked where he was running to and he said he was going to get something he had prepared for my wife, son, and I. He stood and gave me a bag of freshly cut pineapple and 3 ice-cold bottles of water. I asked what it was for, he replied because we had just got off the boat and it was hot day. I told him I was headed to my room and he offered to deliver the bag to my wife for me. He stayed late that day and allowed my wife and I to use our umbrella until the very last possilble minute. We had the only umbrella on the beach and Stuart made us feel like royalty as we sipped our champagne, ate our crackers with our cheese and (pineapple Stuart had provide)d. I felt bad about him staying so long but he insisted that we soak it all up since it was our last day. I took good care of Stuart on our way back to our room and told him I hope he is there the next time we visit the Westin. You wont' believe what happened next. We went out to dinner after having our champagne at the beach. When we got back to our hotel room we found a chilled bottle of champagne with a thank you card from Stuart. Bottom line, Stuart is phenomenal. Make sure to rent a beach umbrella and chairs at the Westin Kaanapali Resort and Spa. Be sure to ask for Stuart in Recreation. You will have the trip of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Husband loved his 50th birthday celebration !!!”
Reviews.Author: rosecitysweethearts
Reviews.Content: We love the Wesitn so much we go back every year! This year my husband celebrated his 50th birthday in Maui and we took my brother and his wife. We stayed one night prior to going to the Westin Villa North and then came back to the resort for our last 3 nights. Our rooms were amazing as usual! Nothing beats the heavenly beds !! We had some fabulous food and drinks at night and enjoyed wonderful company from Freddie and Tommy (bartenders at Tropica!!) (make sure and try the Dragon Berry Bomb !!) Relaxed by the pool all day and visited Whalers village for some shopping. We look forward to planning our next vacation at Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very impressive resort everything you can want :-)”
Reviews.Author: amicsMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our honeymoon for 9 nights the resort is excellent adults pool and bar :-) then a massive kids and family pools rooms are great, food is good. The shops are nearby. Scuba diving , excellent beach , swimming etc. Restaurants are good. Even when the car park was full we got free valet. Excellent impressive. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is a little slice of paradise, the Westin is right in the heart of it!”
Reviews.Author: jtjems
Reviews.Content: As Starwood preferred members, we were able to stay with our 2 adult children in connecting ocean view rooms. The view is spectacular, the beach is fabulous, one of the world's finest. The facilities at the Westin are spectacular! Waterfalls abound and you are surrounded by the lush greenery that you imagine Hawaii to be!! I would go again in a heartbeat! That's the upside. Not unlike being on a cruise ship, there are a lot of additional costs you must be ready for. There is a $25 per day per room "resort charge". The food, beverages, snacks, etc. are outrageously expensive. You expect to pay a premium at a Hawaiian resort, but $3 for a bag of chips? $7 for a hot dog? A hot dog? Muffins and coffee in the morning.....$50. There is a Safeway in Lahaina, go there, stock up on beer, wine, muffins etc. Many people do. You won't be the oddball. All in all, we still managed to rack up nearly an additional $1000 in expenses in 5 days.($200 for dinner at tropica one night to be fair). Just be prepared! We did the whale watching on the Gemini, well worth it. Book online in advance direct and save over booking through the hotel. We brought snorkel gear and walked up the beach to the rocks by the Sheraton, fabulous! Skip the cost of the catamaran. We did 2 luaus, the old Lahaina luau and the one at the Westin. Do the old Lahaina, the Westin's was way more pricey, and in comparison, kind of cheesy. The hotel has a posted policy about not leaving you towels all day on the chairs at the pool, but never enforces it. If you wish to sit by the pool, you better have your towels out really early in the morning. In the 5 days we were there, I never went to the pool. In part, there is no where to sit because all the towels are sunning themselves, but more because we were on the beach. We rented the umbrella and 2 chaises everyday at the beach. ($40 per day) Will we go again? Oh, no doubt! Stay at the Westin? You bet! Bring a wheelbarrow full of cash? Of course! It's just a reality of vacation that the last memory is the bill under the door!! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Good location on Ka'anapali coast”
Reviews.Author: podrozniczka60
Reviews.Content: Nice beachfront location. Not as impressive as some of the top Ka'anapali hotels. Rooms clean and nice. Great swimming pools including adults-only swimming pool. Good landscaping with area allowing for walks. Helpful concierge but gives impression of preoccupied with time share sales. Nice spa, adequate gym. Restaurant offer rather limited but breakfast buffet was very good. Located next door to many restaurants and local seaside mall offering hula for free. Walkway along the beach extends through the entire Ka'anapali hotel zone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and walking distance to everything near by shops,surf,and great restaurants.Tropica catch of the day *****”
Reviews.Author: Jms808
Reviews.Content: Overall had a great stay and experience. Great location, and walking distance to everything near by shops,surf,and great restaurants. Tropica catch of the day *****

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: fulch747
Reviews.Content: If you're SPG and stay only a couple of days when they're not busy, they'll upgrade you. We had a suite on the 8th floor with wrap around views.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise....absolute Paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AngieK_75
Reviews.Content: For my niece's 14th birthday I decided to take her on a special trip to Maui. We did some extensive research online and decided that the Westin Maui Resort and Spa was where we wanted to stay. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed and gives you that island feel from the moment you walk in. We came just in time for Easter which is definitely a popular time in Hawaii. There were definitely a lot of people staying at the hotel. It was still easy to find seating at the restaurants and in-room dining service was quick and efficient. We found it difficult to find pool deck chairs during Easter weekend but that resolved once Easter was over. The pools at this hotel are phenomenal!!! The waterslides, volleyball net and grotto areas were our favorite to spend hours and hours in. The beach is pristine and playing in the surf was so much fun - sometimes I would have to drag my niece in to eat because she was having so much fun. We used the valet parking service but self parking is cheaper and easy to do. I definitely recommend renting a car when you are in Maui - it's easy to find your way on the island and fun to tour around on your own timetable. The staff here are warm and friendly and greeted us whenever they saw us. The houskeeper for our floor would check in with us every morning even if we indicated that our room did not need cleaning. In the interest of the environment this hotel offers a $5 restaurant credit for each day that you do not need housekeeping. We definitely appreciated this perk and were able to save up the vouchers and use them all at once. We had a great time on our special holiday and it is definitely one that my niece and I will remember! I will definitely stay here again when I return to Maui with my nephew for his 14th birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very clean, awesome customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: laurenp03
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Maui for our 2nd anniversary. This was our first trip to any part of Hawaii. I found the westin by looking on trip advisor and was impressed by the awesome pics and location. From the minute we walked in, we were greeted with the best customer service EVER, to the time we left. The whole staff including maintenance, maids, pool staff, to the concierge were so pleasent and helpful for anything we needed, even if it was just a friendly smile passing. The concierge Natalie was soooo nice and extra helpful to us, always there to assist. The grounds of this resort was absolutely beautiful! The placement of the pools were well planned with the sound of waterfalls to block the sounds from other pools and excellent views of the beach from almost any chair! You never had to worry about getting a chair, there was plenty for everyone. We loved the adult pool, and relaxed up there every afternoon. The landscape around the pools looked very natural and upkept. A++ on the outdoor pool area!! The entrance to the hotel was so welcoming and i lovedddd watching the beautiful flamingos and koi fish. The location of the resort was awesome. Me and my husband loved going to Old Lahaina Town, which is a old downtown area right on the beach. It is only about 5 mins away from the resort, and you can use the complimentary shuttles the resort offers. Awesome shopping and food there!! You have to try out Kimos if you go there, awesome food!! Also right beside the resort, is a very cute shopping center, Whalers village. You just walk about 10 steps outside the resort and you are there! The best meal we had the whole trip was HULA GIRL in the village. If you stay at the westin, Hula Girl is a must and you have to try the hula pie for dessert!! We also went to the spa when we were there, and both got massages. They were both very good! I would def. recommend the spa!! After the treatment you can sit and overlook the ocean.....very relaxing. If you have facebook, I would "like" this westin, you can see any specials and events going on!! Although this was our first trip to Maui, it def. wont be our last trip to this Westin!!! We would highly recommend it to anyone trying to decide where to stay!!! Hope this is helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: mlbbaseballtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and it met every expectation that we had. We had no complaints and the concierge and check in was great! Our room was excellent with the most comfortable beds. The shower was amazing as well as the size of the room. The first two days we were surprised with champagne, flutes, flowers and a thank you card. The luau was good, but kind of expensive. Don't know that it is really worth $100 per person, but was glad we went and experienced a luau. The spa was also exceptional. The ladies that work there are great at what they do. I had a facial and it was the best that I've ever had. The pools and beach front are amazing. The drinks were expensive at the hotel, but we came knowing that everything in Maui was expensive. The restaurants at the hotel were excellent and loved the all you can eat breakfast. Highly recommended! It was awesome eating breakfast outside by the ocean. We can't wait to go back! They say, Maui is the closest thing to heaven on earth and they aren't kidding!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: BeachLoverMass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui in May 2011 for 9 nights. I am so glad we chose this hotel! Our stay was wonderful but way too SHORT. As a new Starwoods preferred guest member, I was surprised and delighted to receive an upgrade from my ocean front king to an ocean front suite in the Beach Tower. The room was terrific and large. The suite had 4 sets of sliders, 2 sets in the living room area, 1 set in the bedroom, and 1 set in the large bathroom. The rooms were large, clean and nicely decorated. Housekeeping was good and very helpful. The bellmen and valet staff were also good. We loved dealing with Al in Tours and Activities!! The least friendly staff we encountered were at the front desk. We loved the location right on Ka'anapali Beach. We were in walking distance to the other large resort hotels, surfing and scuba activites, and shopping right next door at Whalers Village. We checked out the other hotels on the beach, but liked the Westin the best. The sunset sail we took on the Gemini left from in front of the Westin. A word about Starwoods: my husband has been a Marriott rewards member for more than 10 years. In all that time, he has never received a room upgrade despite being a silver member (staying a minimum of 10 nights a year). Prior to this trip to Honolulu (2 nights) and Maui (9 nights), I joined Starwoods in hopes that booking 11 nights might matter to some hotel chain. Starwoods upgraded my room in both locations to a spacious suite. Now that is a way to treat your customers!

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: leannieJeff
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great environment, and beautiful scenery. First trip to Maui and loved it! Thanks, Westin Resort for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: lawfive
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here as part of a 3 hotel excursion in Hawaii. This was by far the best of the three. I'll start with criticism first, before the praise. =) The breakfast buffet is expensive. The food is decent, but you can go next door to Whaler's Village and go to the food court or even ABC Stores for much much cheaper. I did it one day, and was glad I did, because it was tasty. But probably not worth $30/day to do. If it is to you, you won't be disappointed, though. A happy medium between leaving the property and the buffet is the coffee place in the lobby. They have coffee and pastries for a reasonable price. I was able to make breakfast out of that most days. That is my biggest complaint. The rest of the trip was nothing short of spectacular. The pool is large, with 5 options for what you like to do. In most places, the pools that aren't adult pools are super crowded with annoying screaming kids, and this place is no different, HOWEVER, the layout of the pool area seems to mitigate this. It doesn't seem so bad here. There is an adult pool area, but we never went over there as we felt comfortable in the area by the water slide the whole trip. There is plenty of space to find a chair in the sun, or in the shade, or under a palm tree where you can get both sun and shade as the day progresses. Pool side service for food or drinks can be slow, but that is to be expected, I suppose. There are coolers set up pool-side for free, cold water. Worth checking out: the pool side hut/bar near the adult pool - especially after dinner. There is a hot tub up there for an evening soak, also. I would probably skip the luau here, but admittedly did not attend. But the location is right on resort property and doesn't seem very private. There are many others worth checking out off property. There is plenty to explore off the property. Blackrock is right on the beach at the Sheraton, and has amazing snorkeling. We saw turtles each time we snorkled here. It is not too far north down the beach (walking distance). Next door to the resort is Whaler's Village which has a nice selection of restaurants, an ABC store (which is great for stocking up on supplies or alcohol), and a yogurtland - which is a great late night (before 10:00) ice cream place! Great hotel for the value. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We had a beach tower room facing the pool, which is the way to go, I think. Be prepared though: if you have your balcony door open at sunset, you'll hear hundreds of birds chipping as they settle in for the night. If you normally go to sleep a few hours after sunset (which occurred at around 7:00 in late May), you'll be fine as they are quiet by the time it is dark. But if you go to bed near sunset, you may not want that pool-view room - I think you'll still hear them through a closed door. The best value in the area, though, in my opinion. This area of Maui is full of resorts, some of which are nicer than this, but WAY more expensive. Don't get me wrong, the Westin is plenty nice, which is why I think this is the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Mark42139
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply not worth it! The customer service leaves much to be desired. The room service was terrible. We didn't receive new coffee or water bottles daily. No newspaper was brought to our room. They didn't refresh the room with new towels, soap, or toiletries daily. When I went to complain, the manager was too busy (after making us wait 10 minutes). Staff was not very nice on other occassions... The location is good, and the view from the Ocean Tower is great, but the service was not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but subpar service”
Reviews.Author: BA_Peter
Reviews.Content: Good location. Next to beach and many swimming pool. Obviously the valet staff did not like my choice of self parking and they are pretty rude. Took forever to check in and it was not even busy hours. One day it took til late afternoon to clean the room. And we needed to keep reminding extra towels since we had 4 people in the room. Swimming pool is nice. Restaurant food were really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Asked for a Better Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mishottie
Reviews.Content: Being an avid traveler, I hold pretty high standards when I vacation, and I know what to expect every time I visit a Starwood property. After booking I had read some negative reviews about this particular property and was a bit weary. We had stayed at the Westin Ocean Villas prior to checking in at The Westin Maui Resort & Spa and loved every minute there. Arriving to the Westin Maui Resort and Spa, we truly felt like we were in beautiful Maui. The bell men were fast, efficient and welcoming. The front desk staff was so accommodating. Coming from the villas (where we had a full kitchen) we brought some items which needed to be refrigerated (which we were relying on our mini fridge to do) Since we attempted to check-in way earlier than normal check-in time, our rooms weren't yet available, but the front desk staff took our perishables and stored them in their fridge while we waited to check-in. The gorgeous waterfall and flamingos in the lobby were a treat to the adults and the kids. Such a gorgeous ambiance- they even had flowers out for the ladies' hair- they really had thought of everything! From the coffee shop in the lobby with the self-serve breakfast stand, to the poolside bar and restaurant- the food was all great. While all food and drinks are pricey on the island, we didn't feel like we were paying an arm and a leg for poolside dining. While the property is definitely a bit older- it's the cream of the crop when it comes to location. Conveniently located to shops and restaurants, with a gorgeous stretch of beach, this property really allows visitors to get a little bit of everything! Ready for some sand between your toes? The beach is literally steps away from the resort pool. When it came to our room- we were fortunate enough to get an amazing upgrade. Everything was exactly what you'd expect when traveling Starwood. Beautiful Heavenly Bed, nice amenities, mini-fridge, coffee maker, flat screen TVs and the best part of all- VIEWS, VIEWS, VIEWS! I'd absolutely recommend paying a bit more for an ocean view- after all, you ARE in Hawaii! Of course our room was immaculate and housekeeping was on top of it. As little as this may seem, my fiance and I couldn't believe how fast the elevators were- we never once had to wait to get back to our room. For an older property, they've made all the upgrades you'd want, while accentuating the older features that truly showcase the character of the interior and exterior architecture. From excellent customer service, a team of staff that made us feel extra special, a breathtaking upgrade, an unbeatable location and an all around beautiful and immaculate resort, we know exactly where we'll be staying when we come back to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Very over rated. No customer service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in today after booking direct a couple of months ago. Very specifically told them on numerous occasions that we were coming for our 25th anniversary. Was told that there would be a welcoming gift (Wow, a free Westin grocery tote bag!). And guess what? A beautiful 2nd floor room overlooking the parking lot! Can't wait to see what the rest of the week reveals.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, food, and ocean views!”
Reviews.Author: taddow33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected Westin Maui Resort and Spa for our 5 year anniversary. I did plenty of research before we selected the Westin. It came down to Sheraton or Westin. I preferred the location (close to Whaler's Village) and always sleep well in Westin's heavenly beds. The resort had great scenery both within the hotel and oceanside. The entrance is great and has a pond which includes koi, flamingos, and a black swan. Great attractions for smaller children. The pool area is broken up into multiple pool areas which is nice. We spent all or time in the adult pool section so I cannot comment on the other areas. Although they geared more towards families and children. Had a basketball goal and volleyball net for water games. You could have some fun if interested in those items. Guests can also elect to rent beach umbrellas or cabanas on the beach as an alternative to poolside. We elected to rent the beach umbrella on one day and preferred the pool. The umbrellas are nice until people sit in front of you, obstructing your ocean view. Not a big deal for some folks but I enjoyed our time there in the morning before the beach got crowded. Wife and I preferred the adult pool for the majority of our stay. The water slide and pool side bar are both great perks at the hotel. To get away, go under the waterfall within the pool to find the hidden jet pool inside the waterfall. Great secret. The food on premises is expensive but pretty good. The restaurants are not 5 star but everything we tried was very good. This goes for everything from the poolside bar menu and snack bar to the Ono grill, breakfast buffett, and Tropica. We sampled all the food offerings and they all had good quality. Food in general is expensive in Maui if you haven't been. Unless you intend on eating McDonald's every day your meals will run $15 per person and up regardless of where you eat. The Westin is no exception but worth the premium if you don't want to venture off premises for good food. Just next door is the Whalers Village. This is a great spot for dining and shopping. I pity the guests that have to walk from hotels further away, it is literally a stone throw away from the Westin. You have Hula Grill, Leilani's, Cane Taro, among others as alternatives to eating at the hotel. The pricing is similar to the hotel and the quality is about the same. The shopping is also pretty good within the village. Although the area isn't that big so after a few trips through for shopping you have seen everything. My wife and I visited a few times and never returned. The room accommodations vary widely. When I booked this trip I elected to upgrade to the ocean view rooms. Upon arrival they told us all available rooms included two double beds not a king bed. After insisting on a king since this was our anniversary they were able to find one. The room was right next to the elevator and the view was obstructed by the beach tower which holds the deluxe rooms. If this had not been our anniversary we could have lived with the view. The room was small (450 sq. ft) so I went down to the front desk the following morning and explained our displeasure with the room. After explaining our view was not satisfactory and the room was small the front desk representative offered to research options and leave us a message in our room within a few hours. Upon returning to our room after some time in the sun, to our delight, we had a new room booked. The hotel staff moved our stuff (with our permission of course) to the beach tower the next day. The room we had for the rest of our stay was great. 9th floor in the beach tower was superb. The beach towers are 11 floors tall and from 9 to 11 are reserved for Starwood Preferred Guests, so if you are SPG make sure you get these rooms. They are wonderful, fantastic views. I think our room was the deluxe ocean view room. TIP: Over the course of our stay it was evident you get the best front desk service early in the morning. The front desk service tapers off in the afternoon once the "B" team shift starts. TIP: If you haven't booked your room, upgrade to the Beach Tower, the rooms are bigger and you have higher probability that your ocean views will be unobstructed. The common areas of the hotel were always clean. The pool area was always kept clear of trash. I could not find anything to complain about during our stay. The shuttles to Lahaina were definitely a huge perk. As you can imagine everything in Hawaii is expensive, including taxi. So taking advantage of a free shuttle to Lahaina gives you numerous dining options for lunch and/or dinner without the expense of renting a car or paying for cabs. The shuttle picks up promptly every hour at a designated spot. Very easy to plan your day and rely on the shuttle for transportation. The much discussed RESORT FEE. I don't think the resort fee is that big of a deal. You get 2 bottled waters, which in Hawaii is about a $10 per day value. The fee also includes free parking and internet access. The internet access is somewhat on the slow side for most people but the parking seemed to be sufficient. We rented a car for 24 hours to drive to Hana ourselves and the one night we parked lot had space at around 4:30pm. The exception was about 9:30pm when we returned from dinner in Lahaina that same night. The hotel staff greeted us and parked our car in valet complimentary since the lot was full. Overall the Westin Maui Resort was a great value. Nothing in Maui is cheap. If you agree with the phrase, "you get what you pay for", then take a serious look at the Westin. Perfect balance between price and amenities, providing great value to vistors of West Maui. We had a great time in Maui and our stay at the Westin was very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY / THAT WHICH MEETS OR EXCEEDS THE CONSUMERS EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: bruceBraceville
Reviews.Content: Seven night stay 05 MAY 11 thru 07 MAY 11. Good central location on Maui on Kannapali Drive, Resort has good (free) parking. The lobby is that which captures the essence of Hawaii, take a long moment to savor the moment. Check-in effortless and pleasant. Westin "Heavenly bed and bath" meets ones needs entirely. Our mountain view room was pleasant, I enjoy the sunrise from this perspective. The HVAC unit operated transparently, as well as the other room amenities. I like the room design which segregates the make-up area from shower area, no condensation on the dressing mirror as well a nicer environment to prepare for the days event. The pool(s) at this Westin resort are unsurpassed! The variety of pools available and the calming environs which they create are very memorable. Breakfast, lunch and dinner options are costlier than a mainlander would expect. Bottom line, The Westin is at the top of my list for a re-visit. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Late Review- Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: LaLa61111
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this resort in late June/ early July of 2010 with family. The resort is very beautiful, from the front desk up to the room. I loved the open air lobby! At night the lobby is nice and quiet and they serve coffee for those who can't get on the Hawaii time clock. I spent several nights in a cozy chair, sipping on coffee and looking at the stars. They also provide daily flowers for your hair in a basket at check in as well as shell lei's for the gentlemen. It was a nice touch! We had originally requested and paid for an ocean front view room. At check in, we were told they did not have our room available and we were moved to a mountain view room. We were very upset...until we got to the room and saw the view! Knowing what I do now, I would not waste money on an ocean view. Waking up every morning and sitting on the balcony watching the morning storms pass over the mountains was HEAVEN! The poor folks on the ocean view side were stuck in direct sunlight and the sounds of screaming children below them in the pool. No thanks! Speaking of children...they were everywhere. While I was vacationing with older folks in my party, I was on a family vacation- so children did not bug me. However- I would not suggest this hotel to a honeymooning couple or anyone looking for a quiet and relaxing time. It's possible that it was due to summer time travel, but even the pool was very appealing to the "family with children" crowd, so I am assuming they typically have children on the property. The pools were beautiful! I even went down the waterslide a few times just for kicks. The lifeguard was not paying too much attention to who was getting on the slide- therefore, several people walking the beach that were not staying at the hotel were using the pool. The adult pool was not enforced as adult only during my stay. I had several children splashing around in the hot tub and the pool the few times I attempted to visit it. Also, it's not secluded from the family pool, so you won't find much relaxation here. The onsite restaurantsâ€™ were pretty good. I forget the name already, but we dined at the restaurant in front of the spa the night they opened it after renovations. The food and service was pretty good, but as you can expect- was overpriced. Breakfast in the lobby was pretty good and a decent price. The room itself was quite small, but very clean and comfortable. As we did not spend too much time in the room, this was not a major issue. I loved the lotions/shampoo/soaps that the hotel places in your room. The best I've ever seen at a resort! I spent a day in the spa and had a massage by the ocean. Please note- the oceanside massage is under a cabana at the pool. I could barely hear the waves- mostly just heard children screaming. The massage itself was not bad, but I have had better at Massage Envy! Next time, I would take a pass on this. My favorite part of the spa was sitting inside the calm room, munching on the dried pineapple, almonds and drinking the lavender lemonade that came complimentary with your spa services. It was the quietest spot I found all week and I gladly spent a few hours relaxing there. The staff was a bit lacking as far as customer service goes. I never experienced anything horrible, but even more so- never experienced anything great. They seemed pretty understaffed all week and were pretty short with customers. I found this unfortunate considering everywhere else I went- I had the BEST customer service. I just loved how friendly the Hawaiian people were during my stay. The beach was unforgettable. Great swimming, perfect temperature and nice soft sand. Renting a chair or an umbrella costs an arm and a leg as you would expect, so not much lounging happening on the beach. If you are looking to paddleboard, head about ten minutes south of the resort to rent your board. The rentals at this resort are WAY overpriced. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay! The proximity to Whalers Village and the beautiful modern amenities of this resort were well worth what we paid. If I was to travel to Hawaii with children, I would bring them here.

Reviews.Title: “Almost any place but here”
Reviews.Author: kstar54
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the resort for a little more than a week after Christmas and into January. We are SPG owners and requested 2 rooms near each other on the "owners" floors. We checked in and were placed on the 7th floor (lower floor) in a room the size of a closet (I was told by the staff all the rooms would be the same). Given we were getting in at 12am, I decided to let it go and went to the concierge desk the next day. I especially wanted to change rooms because a huge tree outside our room was home to literally hundreds of very loud birds each morning. The concierge directed me to the front desk person who was alone on the desk and clearly overwhelmed by the line of people checking in/out and wanting changes. When I got to her and explained our original request, she said there weren't any owner's floors (though the upper floors had signs indicating such) and that all rooms were the same. I asked again about changing both rooms and she slapped a map of the resort on the counter and said, "Well, you tell me where you want to move because I certainly don't know what you want." Hello? Service with a smile? I explained again, very politely, that we wanted to be on an upper floor, not near the elevator, and that the reservations had been made in August, and we appreciated her help. She went on the computer for a while and found two rooms on an upper floor that would be available later in the day. I thanked her, we packed our bags to be moved when the rooms were available, and went on our way. When we returned, we went to our rooms and found one room was directly across from the elevator and the room was very dirty (e.g., hair on the bathroom floor, damage to the walls, etc.). The elevator is very old and the whole night we could hear it grinding up and down the building, stopping at every floor. We decided not to try again, but looked forward to leaving as soon as we could. I will say the grounds are beautiful and the breakfast buffet was sufficient (would be nice to have different items every once in a while). The service throughout the property was not good- people didn't help those of us staying there or each other (often heard arguments among the staff and blatant sabotage of each other). We did enjoy the fitness room and very much appreciated the use of workout clothing. I do not recommend this resort. On the basis of this stay, we are now selling our Starwood units and staying as often as possible at Fairmont properties.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are old”
Reviews.Author: Dacqaroo
Reviews.Content: The lobby is the nicest part of this resort. The rooms are old & small. Not that house keeping really did anything except put new towels and pull the blankets up on the bed. the pools and waterslides are average.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again, but would at least try to book elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: AztecsU2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights, this past week. Overall we thought it was ok. Let me start off by saying, do NOT waste your money booking the "Deluxe Ocean View". As other reviewers have stated (and I wish I had actually taken their advice), this room ONLY faces Whalers Village. The room is a great size, but it's loud. Period. We switched to the Ocean Tower and although the room was smaller, we actually thought the view was MUCH better and the room much quieter and, therefore, thought we got better value for our money. The main con about this room is, like others have said, the sink is outside the bathroom. The light switch for the toilet/shower is next to the sink so these two factors make it a bit awkward in the middle of the night. Who cares that the room is a bit small. It's the size of most normal standard rooms and we, personally, don't need a huge room. Three most important things about it: GREAT view... the only noises you really hear are the sounds of the waterfalls at the pool (a good white noise) and the beds are very comfortable. Think about it... all those other factors like the food, etc.... you're going to eat around town anyway right? I do agree with others that it might be time for a little "spruce up" of at least part of the property. Don't bother with the breakfast deal. The food is fine but I think most people enjoy trying different places. The staff was nice and accommodating. Maybe they're not the warmest people on Earth, but they do their jobs and are polite. I think some other reviews might be a little unfair towards the staff. Overall, the place gets a solid "good" rating from us. If you're reading this and still not 100% set on going to Maui, might I (highly) recommend the Koa Kea Resort in Kauai. I forgot to write a review after our honeymoon there last year. Now THAT'S close to perfect! Two great restaurant recommendations: Lahaina Grill (in town) and Merriman's (near the Ritz) You won't be disappointed! Activity recommendation: Haleakala Crater horseback riding tour thru Pony Express. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AlsRbe
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Maui for our Honeymoon since neither of us had been before. I will rate this hotel first and then Maui. We had a Premium Delux Ocean view room in the Beach Tower on the 8th floor, and far away from the elevators; the room faced the Ocean with a panoramic view and overlooked the Pool area as well. This is the most expensive room they offer, aside from a Suite. There are 11 floors and I think this room type is floor 5 or higher. We stayed on a Starwood Friends and Family rate which was half the rack rate. So, we don't have any room to complain given the enormous discount. Pros - Our room was in the perfect location and the view was wonderful. The heavenly beds are awesome! Cons - the room was a bit small and so was the little patio. Not a big deal though. The bathroom had 2 sinks and a nice shower. What we didn't like was that the room would not get cold enough. We like to sleep with it really cold. We set the air on 65 (as low as it will go) but we were still hot. We even had a large floor fan sent up to our room, but it didn't help all that much. Maybe it was just our room, who knows. Okay, whatever you do, do not stay in the Ocean Tower or you will be very dissapointed. We spoke to other guests at the pool staying in that tower (which is older) and they said the rooms were tiny and the sink was in the bedroom, not the bathroom. I had read this before we booked and made sure we were in the Beach Tower. The Premuim Delux Oceanview rooms are only located in the Beach Tower, so if you book that, you are safe. There are a ton of rooms that face the parking lot in the Ocean Tower. There are also a ton of rooms in the Beach Tower that face the side where Whalers Village is (opposite side of pool area). That side is no good because it's very loud in the mornings with trucks delivering things. I do think the Westin is the nicest hotel and has the best width sand on this stretch of Kna'anapali Beach. We walked down to Blackrock at the other end and thought those hotels looked dirty and old. There is one on top of Black Rock that looked nice but we couldn't really see it. I think it may be the Sheridan. Also, if you have snorkeled in the Carribean, don't waste your time in Maui. It was pitiful. We snorkeled at Black Rock and on an all day excursion to Molikini. There is nothing to see except a few fish and large turtles. We drove over to the Ritz to check it out...amazing! If you can afford to stay there it seemed wonderful. We didn't walk down to the beach so I don't know what it's like there. The pools at the Westin are all very nice and we had no trouble at all getting chairs to lay in. I don't think it was busy when we were there May 2nd - 10th. If you want an umbrella and chairs on the beach it is $35/day. We did that one day to be close to the ocean. The grounds are well kept and very pretty. Don't waste your money eating at the Westin unless you have bkfst included in your room rate. It's such a rip off and you will find MUCH better food next door at Whalers Village. There is a Coffee Stand at the Westin that serves Starbck Coffee (a large is $8) and all sorts of cerials, fruit, pastries, oatmeal, smoothies etc. It is so expensive though. We went to Safeway and bought coffee, milk, coffee, cream, cerial, bananas, beer, peanut butter, chips, salsa etc. We were so happy we had our own food. We made coffee in the mornings, sat on the little patio, then made a simple bkfst. That way we could spend our money on other things. We even ate at McDonalds a few mornings for pancakes and sausage. For lunch and dinner, Hula Grill in Whalers Village was our absolute favorite restuarant in Maui based on quality, price, and service. We ate there 5 times. Leilanai's is right next to it; we ate there for dinner once and thought it was good too. Cane and Taro is behind Hula Grill. They had great Sushi Rolls and I had one of the best Lamb Shanks I've ever had. If you have a car, drive to Plantation House (close to the Ritz) for dinner around 6:00. The view i& sunset is breathtaking and the food was good. I would call and make a reservation for one of the tables by the windows. You won't be dissapointed. Do not waste your money on Mama's Fish House in Paia. We paid $50 for stuffed Mahi and it was fine, but seriously. We had hear so many people rave about it but we thought Hula Grill was way better. We went to the Spa for massages twice. Both times we had a wonderful experience. As far as Maui goes, the weather wasn't great while we were there so we were sad about that. The scenery is beautiful with the mountains and ocean. However, it was cloudy most of our trip. We went to Turks and Caicos last year and once we were in Maui, we wished we had gone back there. I'm sure the weather contributed to this, but our other reason is that if you are going to the beach the whole point for us is to enjoy the sand and water. The water in Maui was very cold and the waves were constantly coming in. We only got in the water once. It's also not that beautiful clear Carribean water where you can see everthing. In Turks, we were in the water the whole time and you could snorkel right in front of your hotel...amazing snorkeling and diving. It was so calm there, we laid out on rafts in the water. Also, you have to pay $35 to lay on the beach at the Westin and we just weren't going to do that every day. In Turks, they set up 2 chairs and an umbrella just for us every day right on the beach....no charge. Back to Maui - we did the drive up Haleakala to see the sun rise. But, it was so rainy & cloudy we didn't see anything. If you plan to do this, do it soon after you get there when your sleep is still of kilter because they pick you up at 2:30 a.m. Also, bring jeans, sweats, jacket etc. It was in the 40's up there at 10,000 ft. We biked down the mountain and that was pretty cool. I'd reccomend this. I hope this was helpful. I reviewed Trip Advisor for months on end trying to decide where to go. All in all, stay at the Westin if you can afford the Premium Delux Ocean View Room or at least a room guaranteed in the Beach Tower facing the pool side.. Maui is very expensive so be prepared to spend some money while you are there. It's better to rent a car and go to Safeway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Aman-India
Reviews.Content: Had a tough choice to make between the 2 Westins, Kannapali , Royal Lahaini... But glad we made the choice to stay with Westin Maui..Beautiful hotel, perfect landscaping around the pools, great views of the beach and great service. Food is not that expensive either as recommended by other tripadvisors. The ambience and feel of the restaurant "tropical" is just outstanding...with the tables in the ground overlooking the ocean. Attached is the fisherman's wharf - a very popular place in Maui. Free shuttles to the Lahaina boulevard is a good gesture from the hotel. Negative - 1) The glasses are not tinted and one can see the (not so required) view of the other rooms. 2) Hotel should provide shuttles from the Kahului airport also.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed......”
Reviews.Author: Tessie215
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru Travelocity with deluxe ocean view and king bed. When checking in we were offered a double bed no king beds were available.and we were told those are reserved for bookings directly through Westin.. We voiced our opinion to manager and she put us in a smaller room with king bed for one night. I was so disappointed as we took so much time booking the perfect hotel...bed, view, etc. We moved the next day to the room we originally booked. Very inconvenient as they would not accommodate after 12hrs of flying. Very noisy hotel even with windows shut.This is an old property and it is over due for a total renovation of their rooms. Bathroom shower curtain reaked like mold and I have had sinus issues since I arrived there. There was black mold in the shower area and I have pictures for anyone that would like to see them.If you want a spa I wouldn't recommend Spa Heavenly. Very small locker area.I asked for plastic for my wet bathing suit, and was told they no longer offer them since they have cut back. The gal was nice and got a plastic bag out of trash that I used. Blow drying my hair they had no brushes. Massage about a 5 and seemed rushed Overpriced for what you get. Great breakfast buffet and great comfy bed. Staff very friendly.Nice lobby and parrots were a nice touch, but rooms are not 5 star maybe a one. We travel to Maui often and will not return to Westin Resort & Spa nor recommend it to family or friends. So many other newer hotels to choose from...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: venusian07
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a wonderful time when we visited Maui last week. The hotel has a good class & style and is located right at the shore of Kaanapali beach. The spa here is also good. We ordered room service for breakfast for the 2 days that we were here, it was a good service and good food though a little over priced. Overall it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our pre deployment Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LaLouGoodyear_AZ
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest vacations I've been on. We actually stayed with our kids and another family as well. We went for a little R&R before my husbands 16 deployment to Iraq in 2006. So it's been awhile but I'm sure the staff and atmosphere haven't changed much. The pool is within close proximity to the Ocean, what a dream, it's just unbelievably beautiful. Give it a ten. I would highly suggest the lahina luau well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool, nice for families, but very crowded”
Reviews.Author: Portland456
Reviews.Content: We've been to Maui many times and this was our first stay at the Westin. The hotel was beautiful, the pools were very nice (the kids loved them), and the beach right in front of the hotel was great. We had a garden view room on the 2nd floor, but because of the landscaping, our back patio was right at ground level--it was very quiet and private. The pros: Clean room/good maid service Bell hop hooked us up with free stuff left by previous guests (boogeyboards, beach mats, etc.) There are plenty of freebies to be had, so I would check at the hotel before I bought any sorts of water toys. Beautiful grounds Helpful and friendly staff Nice, central location Breakfast buffet was included and was pretty good . .. well stocked, clean, and consistent day-to-day. Complimentary valet parking when self-park was full (all but one time this was the case) The cons: VERY crowded (all but two of our eight day stay, if you were not sitting in a poolside chair by 7:30am, you were not going to have a chair that day). They were actively "bouncing" people from holding chairs, and you still needed to be down there early to claim a chair. Two different days we unknowingly sat in chairs that had been reserved by someone prior to 6:00am. The staff had confiscated their items before we got there, but that did not stop them from harassing us about it and try to bully us into giving up our seats. I really did not appreciate the stress and tension that the chair situation brought on--I was there to relax! Workout room was very warm and crowded. I think the temp was due to the number of people in there. Most days all of the treadmills were taken each time we looked. On the quiet days I was able to get in there and get a treadmill and it was cooled down a bit. This resort just seemed to be overcrowded in all facilities. We never received this complimentary tote bag that everyone is talking about. We saw people with them, but never got one. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to have. The kids eat half price is a joke. Part of the reason we picked the Westin is we were sold a package including kids eating half price. All it means is that the Westin has a kids menu . .. they call it half-size, for half-price or something like that. It was typical bar food/kids menu items, and anyone walking in off the street could get those same prices (just don't pay extra for this). We finally wandered over to the mini food court at Whaler's village and were able to find a decent salad and sandwiches on whole wheat (we wished we would have tried this sooner--but were not expecting anything very good out of a mini foodcourt). The beds are standardly outfitted with down comforters and feather pillows. Being allergic to down/feathers, I requested that they make up one bed non-down, which they nicely did. The only problem was that every night I would be sitting in bed and start coughing . . .turns out the maid would mix pillows/covers up between the beds. Every night we had to sort through all the bedding so that I could get a non-feather bed. Again, not a huge deal, but if you are allergic this is not fun! I've experienced similar problems at other Westins . . .I think they have a corporate misunderstanding of guests with allergies. We started using our breakfast buffet vouchers at the Sheraton. It was so nice that we had the ability to do this. The staff there was friendly and welcoming. The food was equally good to that of the Westin (though a bit different in offerings) and it was SO much quieter. We enjoyed the peace and quiet and noticed that this hotel was MUCH less crowded. All in all, it was a great vacation. This is a nice property, and great for kids. If the price were the same, I would stay at the Sheraton or Hyatt, given the choice. We visited the other resorts just to compare and the Westin was far and away more crowded than the other two. I don't want this review to sound too negative, but I also wish I had been more prepared for what we got. I'm used to Hawaii being relaxed and low-key and this resort is not that . . .it's packed full and buzzing with activity.

Reviews.Title: “What a trip!!! Service, grounds, spa, pool, view - all first class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: mcloonan
Reviews.Content: Afer a long flight to Maui, the Westin Ka'anapali was a beautiful drive from the airport where we arrived to a breath-takingl lobby to start off a wonderful week. The view from our room was unbelievable.....not only could we see the ocean but we also saw the mountains. Spending time at the pool was great.........and the beach in front of the hotel was great. Just down the beach is Black Rock - a great snorkel site. Spending time in the spa was a highlight of our tour. The staff was friendly and professional.......making sure that your every need/want was met. The quiet room overlooks the beach and puts you in a most relaxed state of mind - just sitting. The Westin Kaanapali far exceeded our expectations for our trip.....what a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious family friendly hotel on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: mnvailwa
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds. Modern decor. Lots of kids. Great pools with cool swim through grotto and fun water slide. Hotel Can be crowded. Self parking can fill up quickly (valet available at extra charge). Resort fee includes a reusable tote bag (thumbs up) and REALLY slow wi-fi (thumbs down). Convenient location with stores and restaurants at Whalers Village next door. Be aware that Kaanapali is a haul from some of Maui's attractions like Haleakala and Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: ligmv
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids (ages 8 and 6) just spent a week at The Westin and it exceeded our expectations. The pool is a beautiful aquatic playground and its proximity to the beach is great. We spent several days just going from the beach to the pool all day. We walked the entire boardwalk to take a look at the other resorts and none of them compared (including the Hyatt which was more expensive). The location, view and lush, tropical surroundings can't be beat. We can't wait to come back. The only criticism I can think of is that my husband and kids thought the pool was a little chilly - which has been stated on this site quite a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home....”
Reviews.Author: kabhawaii
Reviews.Content: The Westin is our favorite resort on Maui. We love it there! The staff treats you like you are family. We have been staying at the Westin for over 20 years, and it nice to see familiar faces every year. They have bent over backwards to make each stay incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: scottl1300
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at here for a week as part of a 3 island package booked with Pleasant Holidays. I must admit we truly enjoyed our time here. We had a deluxe ocean view room on the 6th floor with a king sized bed. When the time came, we did not want to leave! Things we liked - 1. The lobby and public areas are wonderful. Waterfalls, flamingos, koi, etc. 2. The beach - Just fantastic. 3. The pools - Beautiful, but a little cold. 4. The bed - Very comfortable. 5. Complimentary champagne - Unexpected, for our anniversary. 6. Housekeeping staff - Very nice and attentive. They learned our routine, so the room was always ready. 7. The fridge - stocked up on beer and wine at Wal-mart and saved a lot of green. 8. The bottled water - Used every day. Things we didn't like - 1. Noise from delivery trucks in the morning to Whalers Village. Should have booked the "premium" deluxe ocean view room and would have faced the pool instead of Whalers Village. 2. Room was clean, but starting to get dated. 3. The elevators - Yuck! 3. Parking - I've never seen such small spots. I'm glad I was in a rental car because it was impossible to open the door without hitting the car next to you. It was so tight, I had to let my wife get out before pulling into a spot. Discovered if you came back after 9:00 PM, you received complementary valet parking because the lot was always full. 4. The day before our departure, I asked about availability of a late checkout since our flight home was the red eye. Was told to call back the next morning. The next morning, I was told that since the hotel was fully booked, I could not have a late checkout. Why could they not have told me that the day before? 5. The $25 daily resort fee - Why not just add it to the price of the room? Would I stay here again? Probably, but I would look at other properties on the same beach. No resort is perfect and the good definitely outweighed the bad. Our vacation was wonderful, but for the money, you may do better. It's time for Westin to spend some money upgrading the rooms. Don't get me wrong, I didn't dislike my room. It was sizable and clean, but the style was dated.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Poor cleaning practices”
Reviews.Author: jcjoslin
Reviews.Content: â€œI hope they provided complimentary hazmat suitsâ€� is what a friend of mine said after seeing the photos I posted online. As you read this review please see the photos Iâ€™ve posted as well. Or just have a look at the photos, I think they tell most of the story. The room my wife and I checked into had a horrible dirty bathroom, thatâ€™s not to say the rest of the room was clean, it was also pretty dirty. But the bathroom was really bad, a lot of the surfaces hadnâ€™t been wiped down in probably *weeks* and the floor was so disgusting that we didnâ€™t dare walk around on it barefoot. Iâ€™d seen frat house bathrooms that were cleaner then the one in room 287. I took pictures of the dirty surfaces and raised the issue with the front desk manager. She agreed that it was in an unacceptable condition and promised to have it cleaned as soon as we left for the day. When we returned that evening the room had been â€œmade upâ€� but the bathroom was still in the same condition! Surfaces that could have been cleaned by simply running a wet towel over them were still dirty. On top of that no one from the hotel had bothered to follow up with me about the condition of my room. No note, no phone call or voice message, it was like I was completely forgotten about. I went back down to the front desk and complained about our bathroom again. The manager apologized and offered to give my room a â€œVIPâ€� cleaning like she was doing me some sort of favor. I asked that the housekeeping supervisor meet me in my room so he could explain the condition of my bathroom to my wife and me. When he arrived he looked around and said it was due to a â€œtraining issue.â€� Really? How hard is it to wipe down dirty/dusty surfaces? He also offered to give my room a â€œVIPâ€� cleaning but I said I was tired of dealing with it and just wanted to be moved to a better room. About 10 minutes later the front desk manager called and offered to waive our resort fee ($25/day) for the duration of our stay and to credit us $100. This was the first time we had been offered any sort of compensation for having to deal with this issue. We left for dinner and they came in to â€œVIPâ€� clean our room. When we got back from dinner the spots I had photographed were wiped down and the entire room had been cleaned again. BUT it was hardly a VIP cleaning. There was still dirt/grime on the shower fixture (which I wiped off myself) along with built up scum on the shower control which would have come off had they been serious about cleaning the room. I took more photos and we just went to bed, it had been a long day. The next day my wife complained to me about not sleeping well because her sinuses were irritated. We didnâ€™t complain to the front desk that morning because we were in a hurry to leave and it felt like it would have been a waste of our time. When we came back that evening my wife starting complaining about not feeling well again and we began to wonder if something in the room was bothering her. Looking around we found some black mold like substance in the crown molding above the bed (on the wall that divided the bathroom and sleeping area). That was it, we werenâ€™t staying another night in that room. We went down to the front desk and demanded to be moved to a different room. The hotel was near capacity and only had 2 rooms for us to choose from. Both rooms came with a parking lot view (we had an ocean/Black Rock view before) and were smaller than what we currently had. But there was no way my wife was spending another night in our initial room so we opted for the higher floor (with 2 double beds nonetheless) and moved our stuff over. We didnâ€™t sleep well that night either. All night long we heard road noise from the highway, random car alarms going off in the parking lot and the friendly garbage truck with its beep-beep-beep in the morning. The bathroom in the new room wasnâ€™t much cleaner either. Again there was a lot of built up dirt/dust from weeks of neglect (I took more photos). Keep in mind that this room is on a different floor (2 vs. 8) in a different tower so itâ€™s not likely the result of the same cleaning person with the â€œtraining issueâ€�. We ended up being contacted by the General Managerâ€™s executive assistant because the GM was out for the week. She was a very helpful woman and easily the nicest member of the hotel staff we had encountered. She tried to get our room upgraded but there was nothing available. She also took care of our charges for the first 3 nights we had to endure in room 287 and gave us some additional SPG points. Finally she treated us to a luau at the Sheraton with premier seating. All nice gestures that we appreciated but the damage had been done by that point. Overall I canâ€™t recommend anyone stay at this Westin. However, if you do choose to spend your time here check the condition of your room and stay away from anything by the parking lot. Despite what they tell you itâ€™s not quiet, we didnâ€™t get one good nightâ€™s sleep while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Room a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Songbird811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the beginning of March, moving from the Ritz to be closer to the town of Lahaina. The lobby is very pretty, although I'd rather not see Pink Flamingos there with clipped wings. Let them stay in Florida where they can fly and be free. We were on the "preferred guest" or whatever it's called floor. Not happy with room. Thin walls. Could hear people next door quite plainly. Rooms need updating big time. Bathrooms are small and dated. A big plus was the free hourly shuttle to and from the town of Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is a little slice of paradise, the Westin is right in the heart of it!”
Reviews.Author: jtjems
Reviews.Content: As Starwood preferred members, we were able to stay with our 2 adult children in connecting ocean view rooms. The view is spectacular, the beach is fabulous, one of the world's finest. The facilities at the Westin are spectacular! Waterfalls abound and you are surrounded by the lush greenery that you imagine Hawaii to be!! I would go again in a heartbeat! That's the upside. Not unlike being on a cruise ship, there are a lot of additional costs you must be ready for. There is a $25 per day per room "resort charge". The food, beverages, snacks, etc. are outrageously expensive. You expect to pay a premium at a Hawaiian resort, but $3 for a bag of chips? $7 for a hot dog? A hot dog? Muffins and coffee in the morning.....$50. There is a Safeway in Lahaina, go there, stock up on beer, wine, muffins etc. Many people do. You won't be the oddball. All in all, we still managed to rack up nearly an additional $1000 in expenses in 5 days.($200 for dinner at tropica one night to be fair). Just be prepared! We did the whale watching on the Gemini, well worth it. Book online in advance direct and save over booking through the hotel. We brought snorkel gear and walked up the beach to the rocks by the Sheraton, fabulous! Skip the cost of the catamaran. We did 2 luaus, the old Lahaina luau and the one at the Westin. Do the old Lahaina, the Westin's was way more pricey, and in comparison, kind of cheesy. The hotel has a posted policy about not leaving you towels all day on the chairs at the pool, but never enforces it. If you wish to sit by the pool, you better have your towels out really early in the morning. In the 5 days we were there, I never went to the pool. In part, there is no where to sit because all the towels are sunning themselves, but more because we were on the beach. We rented the umbrella and 2 chaises everyday at the beach. ($40 per day) Will we go again? Oh, no doubt! Stay at the Westin? You bet! Bring a wheelbarrow full of cash? Of course! It's just a reality of vacation that the last memory is the bill under the door!! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for your honeymoon we ended up with double beds; otherwise great.”
Reviews.Author: Dutch318
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to come and love starwood properties! However when we arrived we were given double beds with the assurance on day two wewould get a king bed. Day two came and we were told because we booked with a third party they don't guarantee a bed type and because we were staying for so long (10 days) it would be difficult to accomodate us. We are on day 3 three and and have 3 more days before they can move our room. The double beds are small and not how you want to spend your honeymoon. The front desk has not been compassionate or understanding of our frustration and sadness. The concierage is awesome especially Sheryl and Sara. The buffet breakfast is great. And Karen in the executive office is so sweet.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: Happy2gether92
Reviews.Content: After much research I booked the Westin due to it's beach walk offering, many pools and close location to the Whalers village which promised restaurants and luxury shopping. We've just completed a week long stay and have experienced the perfect vacation. Yes - I was concerned due to the mixed reviews the Westin had recieved however decided to take a risk because we've always enjoyed Westins and the location of this hotel looked perfect. I'm glad we did. I have to admit the hotel is looking a little tired in places (elevators) but overall the hotel is wonderful, offering all the amenity choices we love. Every morning we'd wake up and not being lovers of heavy breakfasts, we immediately fell in love with the Starbucks cafe in the hotel lobby situated alongside a pool with parrotts and flamingos! Pasteries, bagels and fruit were on offer with a Starbucks coffee - heaven. Then off to the pool where we never had any issues with finding sunbeds. The adult pool is fabulous - quiet and has it's own pool bar. Then off to lunch at the Whalers village and always to the Hulu Grill which offered entertainment and fabulous food overlooking the ocean. The hotel offers a free shuttle serivce to Lahaina every hour from the hotel (5 mins drive) which we took most evenings and the town is full of art and gifts shops and many restaurants. We booked the Lahaina Luau through the hotel tour operators and it was one of our best nights. A five course meals full of maui delights, endless wine/cocktails and hawaian entertainment - a simply wonderful romantic night. We also took the Gemini trip (again booked with the hotel) to whale watch and finally also experienced the helicopter ride looking at the waterfalls. Yes we splurged but it was a much anticipated holiday and enjoyment was our goal. The only small disappointment occured when we checked into the hotel and our initial room had the tinest bathroom ever! So we immediately asked for a different room and were moved to the Beach tower and full size bathroom with two twin basins - perfect. I would recommend this hotel and location. It's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MauiTrips
Reviews.Content: Had 2 delux ocean view rooms for 9 days. The good -bell and valet staff, they were excellent spa was good, workout room nice and the grounds beautiful. Now the bad - front desk slow, rude and even after complaints would not get manager to speak with numerous upset customers. Rooms very dirty, small, scuff marks, slow drains, bad beds,screens worn and broken, carpet dirty, bathrooms ugly and old, wait staff slow and rude and the pool attendants were not friendly. I went to they Hyatt in Nov had 2 ocean front rooms and it is not even close, the Hyatt wins hands down in almost every category. Value for your money at Westin Maui is horrible, I am sorry to say. It was so very disappointing, Westin should be embarrassed. It was so bad it moved me to purchase at Marriott's Ocean Club so the next time in Maui I could count on a nice size room with modern, clean facilities and friendly staff or at least a management team that cared....

Reviews.Title: “Dreams Come True in Blue Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: TKZimagine
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9-year old son, and I spent a week-long stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. It was my first time to Hawaii, so I wanted to stay at the kind of place I'd pictured in my mind whenever I thought about Hawaii... beautiful blue pools, waterfalls, palm trees and the sunset on the beach. We were not disappointed! In fact, it was everything we imagined and more! The grounds are absolutely gorgeous, and we could literally have spent all seven days enjoying the pools and beach, had there not been so many other things to do. An unexpected highlight was the housekeeper of our room. Her name was Virginia Galinato. The first day, she left us a note to be sure we shut our door, as we had left it slightly ajar. We continued to correspond back and forth each day by notes... everything I requested of her, she attended to, and left us little notes back to "Have a great day!" etc. She was one of the reasons our stay with so wonderful. On our day of departure, she came to thank us in person! Virginia is a genuine gift to the Westin Maui Resort! We were blessed, and I found out "Dreams do come true in Blue Hawaii!" Blessings, TKZimagine

Reviews.Title: “BEST FAMILY VACATION EVER”
Reviews.Author: Oneluckystarfish
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. Pool was awesome and you are steps from the beach. Would stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: 2FlyTogether
Reviews.Content: Like the flamingos at San Juan Capistrano, we return at least annually to this Maui gem. I find it amusing that so many have taken such decided positions to this long-standing favorite on the pristine miles of sand that are Ka'anapali. What is even more interesting is that so many of them are SPG gold members complaining about the upgrade they didn't get. They seem to have forgotten that as gold members, we aren't entitled to an upgrade. Moreover, it is disturbing to the rest of us when these self-important individuals cause a scene about all they didn't get, while we are trying to enjoy the aloha Maui spirit. Ad always, we were ex tied to see favorites like Jazzie (guest services) and long-time front desk pillar Grace. As always, Lupe and Matt by the pool. And without fail, Gia continues to be the guest services manager with answers and solutions wrapped in poise and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpartanTravelers
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel in mid February. I tend to over analyze these things before I book, and was somewhat worried about some of the lower rated reviews I read. Staying here reaffirmed that some people are just too hard to please. The hotel grounds are beautiful, especially the fantastic pool complex. Yes, the hotel needs a policy to stop people from putting stuff on a pool chair to claim it all day, without actually ever sitting on it. Annoying. However, at least when we were there we never had a problem getting a decent spot. We had a wonderful stay. We'd go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Popernik
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Westin Maui from 3/18-3/25 and had an amazing time. My husband and I were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary, so this was our second trip to Maui, and the kids' first (ages 13 and 10). I strongly recommend this hotel - following is a listing of highlights: * Pools. Probably the #1 thing we consider when choosing a hotel - and they were fantastic. The water was sometimes a bit cooler than I would like (admittedly, I prefer bath-type warmth!), but the kids had a blast. We played water volleyball almost every day (sadly, the girls did not win). * Staff. The entire staff was attentive, thoughtful, and friendly. I'd like to especially acknowledge Gigi, Assistant to the hotel's GM. When we arrived in our room, a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were waiting for us, and cookies/milk for the kids. Really, really thoughtful. Anytime we had questions, Gigi or one of the other friendly staffers was there to help. In fact, one time, our Mustang convertible needed its battery jumped in the parking lot, and one of the valet staffers quickly saved the day. * Food. We loved the buffet breakfast - it had something for everyone, ranging from eggs benedict, to custom-created omlets, waffles, french toast, various types of sausages, bacon, lots of fruit, and more. What a great way to kick-start the day (and a great view of the ocean to boot!). The kids also loved Tropica for dinner (beef satay appetizer was great for them). * Location. Perfect in every way... Short walk to Black Rock for amazing snorkeling (our second day, we saw 4 beautiful green sea turtles), plus great boogie boarding if you walk to the left toward where the surfers hang out. Proximity to Whaler's Village was another huge plus. We LOVED Yogurtland and truly enjoyed our dinner at Hula Grill and Leilani's. * Ambiance. Natural ponds with koi were beautiful, and the parrots were fun to watch (my husband's favorite was "Bob" - the blue one... he liked to sit on my husband's shoulder and take his hat off with his beak!). They also have two gorgeous black swans: Kramer and Newman (you'll have to look to find one of them, he likes to hang out near the adult pool). To address some of the negative reviews... you can't please everyone all of the time. Our thoughts: * Condo pitch: Only got it once, and the concierge was extremely nice and respectful when we said we were not interested. Totally not a hard sell whatsoever. * Internet: Worked fine for us! * Pool chairs: We never really had an issue. Some days, we got up early (7a) and were easily able to find four chairs right upfront. Other days, we were out and about, returning in the afternoon - and again, had no issues finding chairs. We had such wonderful memories from this trip and can't speak highly enough about our experience at the Westin. Hope you found this review helpful!

Reviews.Title: “The only place you should stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: May32611
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went to Maui for our honeymoon. We booked the Westin Maui Resort and Spa because we thought it looked nice on the web site, and we had friends who stayed a few years ago. We knew it would be nice, but we had no idea just how GREAT everything would be. The lobby, the rooms, the grounds were all SO clean and well-kept. The staff - from the valet to our waiter's - were so kind and helpful. Everyone was accomodating. Any time we would walk out to the car in the morning, even if we hadn't done valet parking, the valets would ask if we needed towels for the day, ask where we were off to, and give us directions to make sure we knew where we were going. The view from our room was breathtaking, and there are so many pools, none were every really crowded. We got a couple's massage one day in the spa. Again, increadibly clean, great staff, wonderful experience. The locker rooms in the spa were equipped with private lockers for personal items, products for your use on the counter (mouth wash, hair spray, lotions, etc,), sauna, steam room, hot tub, and showers. The hotel is in an excellent location, and is connected by a pathway to other hotels, giving guests easy access to many restaurants along the beach. We could not have asked for a better honeymoon experience, and we credit most of that to the Westin Maui Resort and Spa and their wonderful staff. We are looking forward to our next trip to Maui and our next stay at the Westin. Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Danene05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in 99 and we were very impressed-then! I probably will not go back even though they are in a great location next to whalers village etc. We are starwood plus preferred but the best they could give us was a parking lot view with a lanai balcony that had left over beer cans on the table. There were several different bugs in the room and as I left the room on the second morning I found a HUGE cockroach scampering outside my door.
