Forget getting a pool chair unless you are up at 5:30 am. The cleanliness of the room was extremely bad with hair on top of the toilet seat cover and generally outdated dirty rooms. I will probably stay at the Hyatt and just pay instead of using my starwood points on this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort on Kaanapali.”
Reviews.Author: gdptraveler
Reviews.Content: We flew in all the way from Indiana (17 hours of traveling) and arrived at the resort at almost 10pm. We were met by warm staff who valeted our car for free. The check in was smooth(and empty), with the staff offering an upgrade to a suite. We are SPG members, and turned down the offer. We had a Luxury Ocean Front room, on the 2nd floor of the Beach Tower. We could listen to the ocean at night, and whale-watch in the morning. The breakfast buffet was huge, and we especially appreciated Elana, aka 4, for being cool at breakfast. In addition, we would like to thank Rey for paying for our meal on the last morning. The pool set up is amazing, and there is plenty to do. There are 2 waterslides, the big one requires a wristband to get into. There is an adult pool, but there were a few older kids in it a couple of times. In the one of the pools, there is a cave with a "warm tub" inside. Additionally, we would like to thank Steve for the amazing dives with Kaanapali Dive Co. We only had a couple of problems with the resort. 1.) Finding good lounge chairs in the afternoon. and 2.) Paying for lounge chairs on the beach. Almost everyday we could see whales offshore, and the Gemini whale watch was great. Finally, the location next to Whaler's Village is excellent. We had to walk over for Yogurt Land almost everyday! Overall, after walking the whole beach, and through the resorts, the only resort that might compare would be the Hyatt and maybe the Sheraton. In conclusion, The Westin Maui has friendly staff, amazing pools, and amazing beach, and an amazing location. The Westin Maui may just be the best resort on Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: amyguldner
Reviews.Content: I was admittedly a bit nervous about the mixed reviews and after spending 7 days here in March to celebrate our 10th anniversary, I'm still quite puzzled about the negative reviews. We had a fabulous experience. We had booked a luxury oceanfront room because I knew I wanted a really nice ocean view - upon checking in and without any prompting by us (other than our AAA travel agent noting on our reservation that we were celebrating our 10th anniversary), we were upgraded to a BEAUTIFUL suite on the 8th floor. The views were to die for and we relaxed on the living room sofa to watch the sunset 5 of the 7 nights there. A complimentary bottle of champage was delivered to our room shortly after our arrival and we had GREAT service all around. We were always able to find pool chairs...even when we started looking in the afternoon. We had no problems with the parking lot. The restaurants, spa and workout room were great too. We used the complimentary shuttle to downtown Lahaina twice - very convenient. We would highly recommend the Maui Westin!

Reviews.Title: “amateur hour plus nickle and dime time”
Reviews.Author: nikalseyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on Maui for some 5 days in early December, 2010 after a week on the big island. Maui is much more into the tourist trade, but staying at this resort was a big mistake!! The first thing they did was to hit us with a $25 per day "resort" fee which my travel agent neglected to warn about and which I also missed, sad to say. Then we signed up for their luau at something over $200. What a waste of money!! The performers were a bunch of amateurs jumping around on in an attempt to impress us with natives ability to leap high into the air, apparently and the meal we paid good money for was almost inedible. We had 8 people at our table and the only one who could eat at least a small portion of the goop was myself. The others went without. Everyone was waiting for the dessert. That would be edible, right? Wrong. The dessert was the same. Luckily we had a bag of potato chips in the room. My advice is to go avoid this resort and go somewhere else. A major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 on the beach”
Reviews.Author: CraigIVes
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the hotel. We are SPG Gold, however it is not even acknowledged by the staff. Staff at check in are just plain rude. Told us they would call us when ourroo. Was ready. Never did. Our 'prrsonal' concierge keeps calling and leaving messages about gifts and personalized service. I have bben here before so I know what that means - timeshare pitch. Rooms are dated and tired. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MrBodeen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Westin for the past ten years. I even got married on the grounds in 2007 so I'm very familiar with this hotel. This was by far the worst I have ever seen it. I'm a Starwood Gold member so I have come to expect a little more out of a Starwood Hotels. First the good: Shuttle- We flew in to West Maui instead of Kahului and were picked up at the airport by a free shuttle that I had prearranged. Pool Staff- Hard workers and very polite. Pool- Beautiful as well as the grounds. Location- excellent. Right in the heart of Kaanapali Beach. Rooms: Clean but dated. Now lets get to the bad: Check in: As a Starwood Gold member I used to not have to wait in line at this Westin to check in. There was a seperate line for Gold and Platinum memebers. Not any more. I was told to go stand in line with everyone else. Clerk was rude. Told her I was over there for our anniversary and that we got married at the hotel and she never even looked at me or spoke a word. Upgrade: The hotel was at 75% capacity when I was there. We were upgraded to Ocean view but had to get a room with two double beds. A room here with two beds is very tight. Not much room to move. (Found out from another gueast who isn't a Starwood member that he got upgraded to an oceanview with a king sized bed, and he booked it within a week through Orbitz. He also got a bottle of champagne because the check in clerk asked him if he was there for a special occasion and he said it was his anniversary). Internet: Terrible. Worse than dial up. You are paying for high speed internet through the resort fee. Breakfast: Wasn't able to get breakfast included by booking through Starwood but other people we talked to who booked through Apple Vacations and who were not Starwood members were able to get it. Pool Bar: The upper pool bar used to have a thing called Unwind. It was between 5pm and 6pm every night and they had someone singing Hawaiian songs and a girl hula dancing. That was done away with. Now all that is offered is the same surfing videoes I have seen for the past 10 years and Stevie Ray Vaughan music blaring over the speakers. Doesn't really set the mood for Maui. Happy Hour doesn't start there until 8pm. If you are from the East Coast, you are pretty much ready for bed by then. If you want something nice, walk up the beach to the Sheraton. They have Happy Hour from 4-6 and they have a singer every day. Puts you more into the island feel than the Westin. Coupons; We used to be given free drink or appetizer coupons from the pool staff. Those days are gone. It's obvious that the Westin has cut back on everything. Consierge: You will get hounded about getting in on a time share. It's happened to me there for the past 5 or 6 years and it still happens. You will get the same box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts though if you stop and see them. Tsunami: We were there during the tsunami. We were on the 8th floor so I guess no one figured we needed to know of the coming tsunami. We were never notified of anything. The sirens were going off but you couldn't hear them with the door shut and the AC on. Would have slept right through it if our family wouldn't have called our cell phone. The next morning we bought breakfast from a very limited menu. Friends of ours who were staying at the Grand Wailea said that they all got a free continental breakfast and everyone in the hotel was notified of the tsunami. There was a hand written sign in the lobby stating that the road was closed but if I wouldn't have walked past it, I would never have known anything about the tsunami from hotel staff. I addressed my concerns with the manager. I told her that it was obvious to me that the Westin is cutting costs in every area. I explained that I was a Starwood Gold Member and have been treated better in the past. I explained that we got married there, and we come back every year and stay with them and no one acknowledges that fact. She was sympathetic and apologized. When I explained that I didn't even have a car there and I wasn't happy about paying the resort fee for which parking is included, she agreed to waive it. Next year I will look at which hotel gives me the most for my money. I will no longer be loyal to the Westin as I can see which direction this hotel is going. I will look to the Sheraton or Hyatt Regency or possibly stay in Wailea. The Maui feel is no longer at the Westin. It has now just become a bunch of pushy tourists and grumpy staff members. Not my idea of a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali - yes, Westin- no!”
Reviews.Author: AniaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We spend the week with our teenage kids. Ka'anapali beach is beautiful, about a mile long from Sheraton going south. Westin is right in the middle. i say any hotel you pick is close to everything and the beach. that beeing said, I dont think Wewill stay here again. Customer service- NONE! Nice pools layout, but super overcrowded. Food super average. now the deal breaker for me was when I wanted to rent beach umbrella that comes with two chairs for 35 dollars a day, they said they were out. what bothered me a little was the fact that Westin charges for things that should be included . What made me mad was the fact that they had about 20 umbrellas for over 750 rooms! Are you Westin for real? !!!

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way.”
Reviews.Author: ladytisme
Reviews.Content: Our concierge, Sarah Craig, was like our little angel she helped us from day one with restaurants to planning our activities. From the time you turn into the drive way of the hotel till the time you leave you are in total luxury. The beds are so comfortable you forget you are not at home with your favorite pillow. We loved our stay so much that we booked our trip for next year while we were still at the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: 22trvl
Reviews.Content: Being a Starwood member and having stayed at this property twice before, we were extremely disappointed and felt "duped" by the outrageous rate of $439 per night, not including a room tax of 9.25% per night, a 4.16% sales tax per night AND a resort fee of $26.04 per night. All this for a DELUXE OCEAN VIEW room on the third floor overlooking Whaler's Village rooftops and indeed listening to trucks backing up on the street below. It was impossible to enjoy our "private lanai," basically a small balcony with two chairs, because of the noise. After waiting until 4:15 pm to check in to the room, we were horrified, but remained polite in calling the front desk and subsequently speaking to the manager on duty, to try to get a room change. Nothing could be done. We asked that they keep us in mind if a room should open up during the five night stay. We left a message with the manager two days later and never received a follow up call. The concierge we asked to make dinner reservations wasted no time in trying to get us to consider a timeshare presentation. At that point we were never going to stay at a Westin again! The poolside food service was grumpy, the breakfast buffet overpriced. We did learn by accident that we could request an ocean view for breakfast and that was a delight. We stayed mid-February. Had it not been for the whales and the weather, the money we spent would have proven to be an even bigger disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to come back home!”
Reviews.Author: MadforMaui
Reviews.Content: We are very happy our travel agent (Kay Ryan - [--]) suggested the Westin it is a beautiful place to stay. The staff is friendly and efficient. One of the nicest beaches in Maui - right by Black Rock for snorkeling and the Whaler's Village right next door for shopping. Lahaina is within walking distance. The breakfast buffet is huge and will fill you up until dinner time. Our houskeeper was fantastic and the restaurant staff go out of their way to make every day special for you. The pools were beautiful (although we only used them once - we like swimming in the ocean) and the pond with the flamingos and koy fish and waterfall was really nice. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds we've had and the view was fantastic. The only criticsm we had was that the room did not have a microwave, but did have a mini fridge. Also the room was worn and could use new carpet, but who cares with a view like that!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be our favorite place...”
Reviews.Author: MauiBoy22
Reviews.Content: We have been here 13 times in 10 years. We've always loved it here but the past couple of years its been lacking. This last trip was the worst. I have always been upgraded when I arrive but this year the front desk clerk said she couldn't do that since I bought a package through Orbitz. Normally they are very nice but this woman was pretty rude. So, let me see if I got this. They put room packages out there to lure guests. Then when someone purchases that, you treat them poorly? They call every morning to tell you that you have a personal concierge but what that person really is trying to do is set up a condo sale for you. They seem more interested in selling condos than taking care of guests. Pretty tacky for a Westin property. Our Orbitz package included the breakfast buffet everyday. After 4 days we got tired of it... Poor quality. We ended up walking to the Sheraton everyday after that. Excellent food there. One of our biggest disapointments was the pool. It was so cold you could hardly stand to be in it. Even the kids couldn't stand it. The towel guy said the heater's been broke for 6 months. The pool waitress said its always this cold. The manager said when its cold outside like this, the heaters can't keep up. (We had 14 days of 82 degrees and virtually no wind). There is also little to no security. Some local kids stole some of our stuff while we were in the pool. One night, 6 local surfers and their new girl friends stage a soft core porn show in the hot tub. No security... so we ended up going to our room for the night. Our tub/shower drain wouldn't work so you had to stand in a foot of water when showering. The maintenance worker showed up 5 days after we called for help. He only came because the unit above or below us was backing up into our room. The business center closed for good the second day we were there. Now you have to sit at the coffee shop and use a very slow computer. Like I said in the beginning. We've always loved it here but I would stay away for now. They clearly have cut back due to the economy. My wife is heartbroken about it but we are looking at a new hotel for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mlattimer
Reviews.Content: The service here is terrible, the pool is very crowded with limited pool chairs available. You must pay a resort fee but that does not allow you to sit on a chair at the beach. If you want a chair plan on paying for it. The food is okay but nothing fanastic the flank steak is extremely tough and chewy. If you are planning on a luau don't book it through the hotel as they don't provide you the right information and forget to tell you everything. At 6pm the pools closeup. The walls are paper thin and the maid service starts at 8am so don't plan on sleeping in. Checking in can and does take awhile, beware if you room is not ready when you arrive you maybe waiting several hours. The deluxe ocean view is a joke. We called room service for over 30 minutes and finally had to walk downstairs to the front desk to get our order in.

Reviews.Title: “Had everything we were hoping to find on Ka'anapali!”
Reviews.Author: buddybutler
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay at Ka'anapali, we explored the area, and of all the resorts there we're convinced the Westin has the most going for it. We certainly thought it has the best location, an easy walk to Whaler's Village shopping, restaurants, and right on the beach with great views! Close enough to whale-watch from your hotel room (they provide binoculars!). The pool areas were super -- the hotel was full but we had no trouble reserving nice chairs at the adult pool every day. Poolside service was excellent (with delicious fish tacos!). Our room was a seventh floor deluxe ocean view (Beach Tower) on the Whaler's Village side, so although we saw the shoppers we also saw a quiet, scenic stretch of beach from our room. The room was spotlessly clean and very quiet. Fridge, HDTV on all channels, plenty of space for all our bags. We enjoyed a sunset meal at Tropica and our server (Lorain) was attentive, very friendly and delivered some of the freshest ahi we've ever tasted. I was also personally impressed by one of the bellmen (Bobby) who let me park the car for a while at the front porte cochere as we were preparing to check out. I gave him a tip that I thought was three singles, but I accidentally gave him a $10 bill wrapped with the singles. He actually left that ten dollar bill at the bell desk for me when I picked up the car keys!! A very classy thing to do. I made sure the hotel manager found out about it. We were also grateful that the hotel arranged for a special shuttle for the guests who had tickets to the Elton John concerts the week we were there. It wasn't free but it was VERY reasonable! I had no issues at all with self-parking (included with the resort fee) -- only once was the self-parking lot full, and when that happened they valet parked the car, free. We took a whale watching cruise (remarkable!) and I even got a free ukelele lesson. The Westin met all our expectations and then some. I'm picking dates now for our next visit! We can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Most Disappointing Westin We've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: bobboyen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for a 5-day trip. We were nervous about staying here based on past reviews and in the end, we were disappointed with the hotel. It's not horrible mind you, just not up to the Westin standards that we've become accustomed to. We've stayed at probably 10 Westin's around the world in the last several years and this was by far the most disappointing. The goods - housekeeping - solid, what more could you ask for? We asked for a few more amenities and they provided them. - the lobby & grounds - very nice. Not so spectacular and serene, but solid nonetheless. You can walk out to the beach quickly, and walk down the path along the beach either way for a leisurely walk. - the pool - good enough for us, we enjoyed it and spent a fair amount of time there. - refrigerator - glad to have one as we bought water, etc. before we arrived and it came in handy - parking - when the self-parking fills up, they valet for free. Expected, but a nice touch. - workout room - it's open 24 hours and has a great view, although a bit small The bads - check-in - the process itself wasn't so painful but the "attitude" was. We are gold members and are used to being upgraded. Upon arrival, we were told that everything was sold out and that there wasn't anything they could do. That's fine, that's understandable. But they didn't seem to want to help at all or make it seem like they were trying. We checked online and saw that some upgrade rooms were available. When we checked in subsequent days if upgrades were available, one of the front desk staff actually got into a debate with us as to how many Starpoints it costs to stay at the property. I'm not exactly sure how it got to this as my wife was the one who had the conversation, but to me it just showed that they weren't trying to help, and were instead trying to justify themselves. Even if you aren't going to help, at least act like it. This really hurt our impression of the hotel and of Westin. - the rooms - they are just dated, plain & simple. There are rust marks in several places, the shower is just really old. - no bath gel - they don't offer bath gel standard in the rooms, I've never seen that as a Westin. Alot of things at this property just reeked of "cost savings." Given that the hotel was packed (we also think there was some kind of convention there), maybe they feel that they don't need to go above & beyond to operate this hotel. Too bad, we really used to love Westins. On our several walks down the path, we went to the Hyatt and had a few meals there. We would stay at the Hyatt next time, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelJeanMpls
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with a great pool area, The Westin Resort & Spa has one of the best on Maui. The hotel is right in the middle of the Ka'anapali Beach resort area. The staff was very friendly. It's right next to Whaler's Village, which has some GREAT shopping. The breakfast buffet is good--lots of fresh fruit (we stuffed ourselves with pineapple!), an omlet bar and usually a couple of unique island offerings to sample. One note, book your hotel room directly through their website or make sure your travel agent does. We booked our vacation package through American Airlines, and we didn't get the room we expected (we had a double room instead of a King). They transferred us to a different room halfway through our stay. They made the transistion easy by moving our things for us. Self parking is usually full in the evenings, but once it is full, the valet will park your car for you for free. Check your hotel info folder in your room, and be sure to check your phone messages. We received a couple of "extras" from the concierge this way. Also, be sure to take advantage of the photo session included in your $25/day resort fee. The photographer was excellent--I think we have our Christmas card photo for this year! Overall, if you plan to spend a lot of time lounging on the beach and around the hotel, this place is worth it. If you're out exploring (as we were), you may find an equally spectacular resort for a little less money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding personal service and attention”
Reviews.Author: PeggyHuff
Reviews.Content: I brought my 92 year old Grandfather here as it was his life long dream. The experience I had working with the staff prior to an during my stay was outstanding in every way. They helped me to make sure Papa was safe and secure, provided personal transportation from the local airport, put medical staff on stand-by should I have needed it, and even found local elder care facilities if I would have needed that. My Papa quietly enjoyed the beautiful views, the gorgeous grounds and the delicious food. I must mention the manager, who was most instrumental in making this journey even possible for us. Her name is Gigi Gaea. She blessed us in so many ways. Also, a young man who works in Security named Cole went on his off hours to the Apple store to buy me a power cord for my computer. He did so without my even asking, and had it to me by the next day. That is real employee dedication and service. I highly recommend this beautiful resort, not only for it's incredible amenities, but for the extraordinarily high standards, kindness and generosity of their staff, all the way down to the room service lady named Ivy who always knew exactly what we wanted and how we wanted it, all from memory. Wow...what an amazing staff experience. I hope to return here one day. Thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mbegan58
Reviews.Content: I want to comment a particular person at the front desk who went out of her way to help accomodate us with our room. Her name is Grace Difranco and she helped make our stay wonderful. we'll be returning to this hotel on Feb.9th 2012 because of people like her. The hotel is beautiful and we enjoy staying on the Kannapalli strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, unusal room configuration”
Reviews.Author: ERdoc911
Reviews.Content: The lobby has a nice fountain but it's a little dirty. The beach/pool is very nice and it's not too busy. The restaurant is ok. The room we got had a desk that took up too much space and a "breakfast bar" between the vanity and the room. a little weird. I like sheraton better than the westin

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin standards.”
Reviews.Author: chernd00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui from 2/16 â€“ 2/19/2011. I stayed at Westin frequently when on business travel, and used the â€œcash and pointsâ€� option from Starwood in Maui. Beware that in addition to the cash and points, there is also a $25 per day resort fee. It includes 2 small waters, slow internet, self-parking, a Westin tote bag (worth $1?), and admission to the workout room. These are â€œamentitiesâ€� that would likely be included in any other Westin in the US. To sit in a chair on the beach it is $5/day. For 2 chairs and an umbrella it was $25. Wouldnâ€™t you think that might be included in the resort fee? Also, the self-parking fills up every night at 8:30pm, but the valets will park your car at no charge. The valets are actually the nicest, friendliest workers in the hotel. NOTE: when you use the Starwood cash and points option, they give you what is probably the worst room in the hotel. Great way to reward brand loyalty, right? We got a second floor, tiny â€œTerrace Roomâ€� with two double beds (asked for a King, but was denied). We had a great view of the parking lot. Also, the sprinklers flooded our lanai/balcony each morning, so we couldnâ€™t even sit out there to eat breakfast. We found kids in the adults only pool (and had to ask staff to kick them out). The place is crowded with children everywhere. Head to the beach (or better yet, to other beaches around Maui) for a quieter setting. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel once. It is very expensive. Rent a car and go to some of the many great restaurants in the area (Paradise Found Creperie, Royâ€™s, Sansei , Cheeseburger in Paradise, Lahaina Pizza, etc). Front St. in Lahaina has plenty of restaurants to choose from. The location of the hotel in Kaanapali is great â€“ there is much more to do, see, and eat than in Wailea. We did the snorkel trip to Molokini, which was well worth it, seeing whales and sea turtles, lots of coral and fish. There is also great snorkeling at the end of the Kaanapali beach by the Sheraton at black rock. Rent snorkel equipment at Maui dive shop or Boss Frog's for cheap. We had a great vacation despite the Westin. This hotel was just not up to Westin standards. Iâ€™ve stayed at a Westin in New Jersey that was far cleaner, more modern, quieter, more elegant, and with a better view!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Maui does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel206
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Westin Maui for 8 years now! And we can't wait to go back next year. The hospitality and warm welcome here are fantastic! The rooms are fantastic, clean and it's nice to get one with an ocean view so you can watch whales from your window. Make sure you have the breakfast buffet and incredible way to start the day --- and you can watch the whales jumping from your table! We spent our days on one of the world's best beaches -- Kaanapali, snorkeling at Black Rock ( a 10 minute walk on the beach), swimming in the pool, racing on the water slide and lunching by the pool. My kids (10 and 12) loved the activities --- henna tattos, learn to paddle board (standing), eyelash leis, candy leis....Jack Stone and his staff did a GREAT job! You can buy Maui Gold pineapples and have them shipped at the resort. The spa here is great --- love the coffeeberry facial and massages by the beach! This year we tried SNUBA on a trip on the Trilogy -- but the best was the whale watch on the Gemini -- Dirk Younkerman (a whale enthusiast) is part of the crew and knows an incredible amoung about whales. We say a pod of competitive males --- must have been about 12 whales! Also we took a trip on Gemini to Olawahu (snorkeling with the turtles!). See Eline or Victor at the American Express Activities desk -- they can hook you up!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: CJV_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to relax and feel refreshed, this may not be the hotel of choice. My husband and I stayed at the hotel in October and did not anticipate the number of kids and people in general! It was very crowded and loud. They also placed us in a hotel room right next to the elevator, so not only could we hear everyone waiting for the elevator, but could also hear the elevator whenever it went by! Luckily they were able to switch us out of the room the very next day, which was appreciated. In general the rooms are very small and indifferent. Also, the beach is not the best for swimming as there is a drop off. We headed down to black rock in front of the Sheraton and took off to see other parts of the island, which was great! The hotel's location next to the shops was nice though! We loved Maui and really enjoyed our time there, but we would not stay at the Weston again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a shame that tyhis nice resort has avoidable flaws”
Reviews.Author: ecblisa
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for four days befor moving on to our Westin timeshare resort at Princeville, Kauai, which we rate very highly. It is a well located hotel (on the beach at Kaanapali), and we could see whales from the beachside breakfast terrace. The landscaping is lovely, and the pools are very nice. Now for the negatives. We checked in at 5:30 after flying out to Maui. We had to wait 15 minutes for a room that had been cleaned (that was 5:30 PM, not AM, and we are "gold" level guests). The next night we found out why that was the case -- after a hard day driving around, we were in be at 9 PM and got woken up by the cleaning staff talking loudly on their walkie-talkies in the hall after that. We also had repeated problems with getting access to the best elevator for our room because conventioneers were gathered and greeting each other in the small elevator lobby, and were very rude about letting regular hotel guests through. This was within sight of the front desk, but nothing was done. We just started using another elevator. Parking is another problem. The self-park lot fills up early, and if you eat dinner outside the area within walking distance of the hotel, you have to valet-park your car, and the car will be parked blocking other cars. If you want one of the blocked cars in the morning, you have to ask the valet to move the blocking car. We avoided the mess by always returning before dinner, parking at the far end of the self-park lot, and walking to a place to eat. This could be a very nice hotel if more attention were given to keeping up standards of service expected of a Westin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a contradiction....”
Reviews.Author: Jack90
Reviews.Content: We had a good time. Maui is beautiful. You could easily see the whales from the very nice beach. The weather was great. We avoided the rush for pool chairs by paying $50ish for a beach cabana daily (for us, it was worth it). The hotel is lovely and very well located (if you don't mind a lot of people milling about). The staff were all very nice and helpful and yet.... I feel ripped off. The hotel has 2 towers. The Ocean tower is old and the rooms are small. The beach tower is newer, the rooms are larger and it was in pretty good shape. So, after doing my usual thorough research, we booked a deluxe ocean view room (beach tower). For those of you looking to book this hotel, you know that this is a pricey room category. So what did we get? The daily sound of trucks backing up from as early as 4:05am and more typically 6am. When I think "Deluxe Ocean View" this is not what comes to mind. This room category is adjacent to the Whaler's village and is compromised due to the continual unacceptable noise level, yet the Westin only sells rooms at this hotel based on tower and view (I know because I asked). This means that the noise level is not something they think should be considered when pricing their rooms. I phoned to complain and was told that we could voluntarily downgrade to the Ocean tower for no credit (they were full). But the manager said we probably shouldn't do that since those rooms are small and in need of renovation. I then asked if we could be moved to another starwood property in the area. I was told that they couldn't move us and, if we leave early, they charge a one night penalty - but that they would wave it for me. As if they were doing my a favor. The room was not ready until 1.5 hours after check in time and another day, the room wasn't cleaned at all. Even when they did clean it, the room wasn't that clean, left over hair from the last guests, an odd smell in the bathroom (like an old mop), coffee pot not cleaned. Our shower wasn't cleaned once in 9 nights. It would have to be fairly bad for me to notice. Please, Westin management, do not tack a patronizing comment to this review about how you are glad that I enjoyed Maui and that you take your customer feedback seriously . Its not going to do me any good now. If I returned to this area of Maui, I would choose either the Marriott vacation club or maybe the Hyatt. The Westin has a lot of good things going for it, but the bad outweighed it for us. We wouldn't return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, fantastic breakfast, beware of certain rooms”
Reviews.Author: AstrosFan53
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel grounds were beautiful, featuring cascading waterfalls and exotic birds. The pools were great, including something for everyone (water slides, adult-only pool and hot tub, etc.) The beds were comfy and we appreciated the mini-frig. We really enjoyed the buffet breakfast (included in our package - a $30 value) which offered a wide variety of well-prepared foods, including fish and made-to-order omelettes. Ask for ocean view seating so that you can whale watch while you enjoy breakfast. Cons: The rooms are a little small and in need of updating. Unless you enjoy the sound of truck back-up alarms at 6am, request a room that does not face Whaler's Village. Fortunately, the hotel was able to accommodate our request to switch rooms on Day 3 of 9. (The sounds of flowing waterfalls and chirping birds were oh so much more pleasant!) All in all, we enjoyed our stay very much and hope to return soon - the sooner the better!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chinatrip
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Walking distance to great snorkeling. One of the best beaches in the world. Could see whales from the beach. Pools are great fun. Great vendors in lobby selling local Hawaiian ware. The housekeeping was reliable and trustworthy. Our housekeeper was Fely V. and she was outstanding. Very welcoming and helpful. Couldn't ask for more. Everything is close by, so you could stay at the hotel and be entertained your entire trip. There were Hawaiian shows, parrots in the lobby, flamingos, 5 pools, the beach, snorkeling and many activities that come right to the hotel to get you. The hotel has shuttle service to Lahina which is great fun and lots of great restaurants. O'no restaurant in teh lobby is great also. I highly recommend driving to Star Noodle for a meal. The price is reasonable and the food is outstanding. My family did not want to go so far on this trip, but when it was time to go home, nobody wanted to leave. Can't wait to get back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Whale Watching at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Sandi06
Reviews.Content: We were on the 10th floor with an ocean view and were able to watch whale swim by at all times of the day. Our housekeeper, Virginia Galinuto, was so sweet and helpful, it made our stay even more special. When we left, she came in to give us a hug.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: stacyfletcher
Reviews.Content: I am well-traveled, domestically and internationally. I stay in all types of hotels and resorts -- Fairfield Inn to Four Seasons. I'm not overly picky but my rule of thumb for a hotel is: "at least as clean as my home". The Westin Maui Resort & Spa would qualify in most public areas but failed in the guest room, corridors and some public rest rooms. ROOM- Our room in the Ocean Tower was crowded with furniture. An armoire was necessary due to the lack of a closet. This, plus a desk, a nightstand and two double beds made the room a bit tight and we are only 2 adults and a 7-year-old. The Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Bath were very nice amenities but did not mask the dated bathroom, fixtures, tiles, beat-up doors, etc. The in-room safe was large enough to hold our laptop and the mini fridge was ample and quite handy. I can overlook "dated" if the room is very clean but dated and dusty is harder to accept. The lamps and shades in the guest room and the corridors were covered with dust-- a lot of dust. 7 nights and they were never touched. Overall the room was much less than expected and certainly did not resemble the guest room shown on the website. SERVICE- the service in general was average. There were a few cases with the parking Valet, the towel desk, Sea Dogs and in Ono (the main restaurant) where we experienced "good" to "very good" service but, generally "just okay." LOCATION- was very good. Adjacent to Whaler's Village (shopping area) on a beautiful section of Kaanapali beach. The swimming pool was a highlight for our 7-year-old and we enjoyed it as well. The real bugger was that if you did not go out before breakfast and claim a pool chair (which is NOT "permitted" but totally ignored and not enforced at all) you were out of luck by mid-morning. I literally could not find a single chair (just for me ....not a group of chairs for my family...just one chair) by 10/10:30am on several days. There were towels and more towels drapped everywhere on every chair. No belongings, no people. Didn't dare touch/move those towels or someone would think you were trying to take them (becuse you sign them in/out on your room and face a $25 charge if you lose/fail to return it) If you want a beach chair, you can rent it but that's not convenient to the pool. Bringing the chair reserving situation to a staff member's attention earns an apology but no real resolution. The resort fee (mandatory) includes high-speed internet, self-parking and two bottles of water each day. In my opinion, a good value except for the chaotic parking situation. Every time you'd come back to the hotel it was a race around the small parking lot to find an available spot. Often you'd have to drive back to the resort entrance and the valet would park it. Guess where they park it? If you were lucky enough to grab a spot in the self parking lot.... great....until you try to get your car out and find the valet has someone else's car (the guy who couldn't find a spot) blocking you in and you have to hike back to the hotel entrance and wait for the valet to come move that car so you can get out. Overall the problem seems to be that the hotel has outgrown itself. In my opinion, It seems like they've added more and more rooms/towers but the pool, beach and parking lot are quite overcrowded. LIKED BEST: The breakfast buffet in Ono was excellent, the grounds are beautiful and the beach and location are super. LIKED LEAST: the guest room and the self parking lot issues and less-than-expected service.

Reviews.Title: “It isn't cheap, but wow it is worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: pjh84
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about this resort. The pool is incredible. Enjoy the elevated all adult pool looking out at the ocean, or rent umbrellas and chairs (25dollars) on the beach for the day. Make sure you swim through the waterfalls inside the center of the pool area to find the hidden hot tub. The food was amazing. We had our 25th anniversary dinner there, and it was well worth the $150 price tag. Room was clean and large for a hotel room. We are used to condo's so it felt a little small, but overall I have no complaints about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good but prefer the Hyatt at Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerya
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel worth 4 stars, but there were a few experiences that could have made it better. Upon arrival we were checked into a room right beside the elevator, so of course we called down to see if they could change it. They said they didn't have a single empty room, nor did they offer to change our room as soon as a room became available. Of course it was very noisy all night long. One of the mornings, we left at 4am to see the sunrise at Haleakala crater, we got to our Jeep only to realize the valet had double parked us. We had to wait for someone to find a valet to move the Jeep. It takes 2 hours to get to the Haleakala crater, and we only just got there in time. We were also double parked the morning we planned to do our whale watch. There is no kids pool, all the pools are 4 feet deep so there are other hotels on Kaanapali that have wonderful kids pools like the Hyatt. And lastly the restaurant prices are very high, kids eat free at Ono, but drinks are $4 each.

Reviews.Title: “Employee of the month”
Reviews.Author: tom2maui
Reviews.Content: It's really hard to pick just one person who truly makes a vacation when a resort has so many good caring people working for it. Which this all comes down from the top Mr. Anderson thank you. The 1 person this year who truly stood out would have to be Carlos Rocha the shuttle driver who is always in a great mood plus really enjoys people and makes the ride to Lahaina and between the properties enjoyable and honestly was glad to see us return, this also being true for most all the drivers and Westin Maui staff who have grown to know us. It's truly a large resort with a small family resort feel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - 9 months later and still a vacation to remember”
Reviews.Author: sglubka
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness was incredible. Workers polishing railings and cleaning grills daily. Rooms showed same level care. Location was great. Views fantastic. Snorkling (no experience) - came easy and realized the location was really incredible after visiting a few of the other locations nearby - more experienced folks may differ opinions. Lahaina was a shuttle trip was 10 minutes and complimentary. This was a daily trip. Family of four - daughters 14 and 11. Girls really enjoyed the pools as well. Breakfast was included and taken advantage of. Found best dinner values at Lahaina. Also, seemed to have most restaurant choices there, but again easy shuttle service provided there.

Reviews.Title: “The best on Maui”
Reviews.Author: janew_2254
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa so much that I feel homesick and can't wait to come back again. I'm normally a Marriott girl and have stayed at every Marriott on the island but I'm out of points so made plans through Costco Travel to stay at the Westin for 3 weeks. Cannot say enough about the aloha feel and ambience of the hotel. It was beautiful with pink flamingos, birds, black swans, fish and a cat that has adopted the bell staff so the animal lover in me was happy. Everyone we encounted there was helpful, happy and seemed appreciative that we were vacationing at their hotel. In short, the property is beautiful, comfortable, calming and well staffed with nice people. It's a very very short walk to Whaler's Village where you can find everything from great restaurants to the ABC store for suntan lotion. AND, you can see humpback whales while enjoying the best buffet breakfast on the island. Cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous as usual”
Reviews.Author: hootstir
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 8 weeks total (4 trips) in the last 12 months so we must love it. Great hotel, views, pools and staff. Virginia Galinato, house keeper, Grace at the front desk, Alison and Lupe cocktail waitresses around the pool all make you feel at home. Couldn't recommend it more highly. see you again in another 3 months or so.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service experience in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: sayersnet
Reviews.Content: Having vacationed at the Marriott Kauai three times previously (and having a fantastic service experience), my wife and I thought we'd venture out to one of the other islands to see more of Hawaii. The Westin Maui Resort was an absolute horror. Service was slow bordering on rude. The food wasn't refrigerated properly - which led to my wife contracting food poisoning on the second day. It took over an hour to book an excursion. And the bar staff was more interested in polishing their beer taps than actually pouring a drink. Fortunately, we went to the Whaler's Village and had a completely different service experience at every restaurant and venue there. Even without reservations, we didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes for a table. Bar service was instantaneous. The wait staff at Hula and Lelaini's was friendly, fast and the food was great. We're really surprised and disappointed with the Westin. You'd think with such a prime location and beautiful facility, they'd have their pick of the best-of-the-best in hotel management. Sadly, at the Westin Maui, that is definitely not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: vcl77
Reviews.Content: The minute we walked into the lobby and saw the waterfall and flamingos, I knew we were in for a fantastic stay. The hotel had the usual professional Westin customer service. The girl at the check-in counter spent time checking to see if there were any upgrades available to a larger room with an ocean view and luckily there was. Our room was extremely spacious and we were able to see the ocean from the balcony. No complaints at all except that the hotel was charging for beach umbrellas (~$20 for the day!). Loved the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: MMSoCal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week long vacation at this property, and had a fabulous time. Restaurant and bar staff were outstanding - cheerful and attentive. Food and drinks in the restaurants were also quite good, especially the oceanfront restaurant Tropica. While the rooms are a bit on the small side and the carpet in our room was probably close to being due for replacement, neither of these negatively impacted the quality of our experience in the least. The location is outstanding - right in the middle of Ka'anapali beach, which is in our opinion, the nicest location on Maui. We have stayed in Wailea before and were disappointed by the too- small beaches. Views here of neighboring islands Lanai and Molokai make for outstanding scenery, as did the numerous breaching whales, some of which came to within a few hundred feet of the shoreline! The pools and surrounding areas are also outstanding, as is the food and beverage service in the pool areas. Chris, the night time bartender at the pool bar deserves special mention, for his outstanding service and engaging personality. If you enjoy surfing, Chris plays some outstanding big wave surf videos on the bar TVs. This bar also featured a night time happy hour which was a very good value. The hotel also does an excellent job of managing children at the pool areas, having separate family and adults-only pools for whatever your circumstances dictate. I've been disappointed recently by the lack of enforcement of "adults-only" pools by other name brand hotels. If you're concerned at all about this issue, I would recommend staying away from the neighboring resorts (the exception being the Sheraton) which all seemed to be overrun by children.

Reviews.Title: “WOW What a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Scooter74
Reviews.Content: We are about done with our trip to Maui and I must say that staying here was worth it! The staff was wonderful and most everyone was extremely helpful and friendly! My wife and I loved it. We were given a room with 2 twin beds as due to the high occupency and our late arrival (thanks delta). We wanted a Kind but hell we are in Hawaii, who stays all day in the room. The grounds are magnificant and well kept. The rooms are clean and nice, I have been to better Westins as far as the room goes, but they are still very nice. The restaurants on the resort are great but like most in Maui very pricey. The Drinks are strong but those add up too! With our February arrival, the whales are in the area. My wife and I planned to book a whale watching boat trip but after getting here we realized it wouldn't be needed. You see them clearly all day (though they seem more active in the evening and morning) for the beach or even the pool. I couldn't believe how easy it was to spot them. I feel badly for the man who reviewed this location poorly. If you want a clear view of the ocean in hawaii, your need an "Ocean Front" room. "Ocean view" means just that, you can see the ocean from your room. I loved every minute of this trip, and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, unbelievable lobby, and employees top notch.”
Reviews.Author: rbb36
Reviews.Content: We arrived late afternoon and were immediately greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The Lobby is fabulous, complete with birds, waterfalls, and lovely Hawaiian music. The front desk staff went above and beyond to welcome us and answer all our questions. Maui is Paradise on Earth, and I would recommend it in a heartbeat. We ate fresh fish everyday and felt safe wherever we went. It truly was a vacation of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jck1225
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, great customer service, friendly staff. The Pool/Beach area is very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here...our regular hotel was booked”
Reviews.Author: AlohafromKapolei
Reviews.Content: Great location, great ocean view, hotel employees were so courteous, concerned and helpful. Clean, beautiful grounds and fantastic pool with a slide. Right next door to shopping and more dining. Stay here...you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if travelingwith children.”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_Omaha
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the beach. Don't expect fancy digs. The kids will love the access to the pool and beach. Although you expect to pay more during the holidays, an extra $50 night per room to guarantee adjoining rooms was a bit much. The surf school was excellent. I suggest the better Marriott activity center next door for scuba and other activities. Speaking of water activities, check out Aqua Adventures at mauisnorkelsnuba.com for a great snorkel and snuba trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: Defender09
Reviews.Content: This is where I would come back to in a heart beat. I booked two nights the day of as I had left open the option to stay at the four seasons on lanai or go over to wailea. Instead, decided to take the ferry to lanai only for the day and stayed here. First, I booked with points and was STILL upgraded. I asked for the executive suite and she said none were available. (700 sq ft.) HOWEVER, she said the luxury suite was available for $200 more. So, for $200, I got a 1300 square foot room with an ocean view. UNBELIEVABLE! I booked the second night with cash and points and the same room, which would have cost $1300 a night, cost me only another $290 for the second night. Then, the service and food was fantastic. Full glasses of wine and strong drinks. The bellmen, the concierge, the front desk staff - ALL friendly. NEVER had an incident where I was told to wait or treated rudely despite the great deal they gave me. My daughter loved the giant waterslide here at this hotel the best of the Sheraton and the Westin Villas. She also loved the birds in the lobby and the flamingos. My favorite and we are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel, run from the spa”
Reviews.Author: 1esquire1
Reviews.Content: The plus side of this hotel, although old, is very beautiful, bright sunny with lush Hawaiian tropical grounds. The staff are very warm, helpful and friendly. Then you enter the dungeon........I decided as I always do to treat myself to a massage. I entered what looked like a salon or was at one time and took a seat. I could hear a pin drop as I was the only soul in there. After about 5 minutes, I decided this wasn't for me and got up to leave. Out of nowhere came a genteman who directed me to the front desk. As I entered a very dark room, three zombie like receptionists were waiting there. Very creepy to say the least. I changed into my robe, upon exiting the locker room I heard a laughing roar, the receptionists were joking about their "B**ch Boss!!" Next I was led down a long dark corridor and into my massage room. The Masseuse was pleasant. I told about what I had over heard, her response was due to budget cuts a "less than stellar" management team was brought in and low morale was the result. Too much information for my relaxing massage if you ask me. I didn't let this ruin my vacation as my family and I found a great, bright, friendly spa at the Hyatt, with in walking distance. Again, the rest of the hotel was fabulous, but the spa needs some serious evaluating.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU LIKE CROWDS, THIS IS THE PLACE !”
Reviews.Author: KATYGIRLMichigan
Reviews.Content: First of all I must say that although I personally would not stay at this hotel again, its not that bad of a place.... but, it is not for everybody. On the plus side, it has a beautiful fantasy lobby with a huge waterfall upon entrance. The most impressive area is the chain of pools outside with its meandering surrounding streams and some fish, flamingos,a few swans and a some tropical birds. Our room was a garden view overlooking the huge fountain,and we could still see a sliver of the pool and ocean, quite beautiful. We were afraid the room would be really small as some have reported, but we found it was just fine and had plenty of space for all our things. The maid service was very good. You could tell this was a renovated older room, but it was clean,the decor was neutral...our only complaint would be the carpet should be replaced and the screen door seemed dated with its aluminum frame. We choose this hotel because of the price. The last time we were in Kaanapali we stayed at the Hyatt ,but we just did not want to pay those prices this time. Here are some of my complaints,which I realize not everyone will agree with... but the hotel is still expensive and its a long way to Maui for most people,so hopefully my review will help some of you decide if this hotel is the right fit for you................... This hotel and the immediate surrounding area is crowded beyond belief ! We arrived around dinner time and we tried to eat at the hotels restaurant Tropica,but we could not get in because a convention group booked the entire room. So,all you have to do is walk outside the hotel towards the ocean and immediatly towards the right is the entrance to Whalers village(a rather generic open air mall) and there are three restaurants,Hula grill,Leilanis and Cane & Taro. All three restaurants had a min. 1 to 2 hour wait. What was worse was the crowd around there... it was like a shopping mall on Christmas eve,bumper to bumper people ! Fortunately, we walked a few blocks to the left and got away from the crowd and ate at an excellent restaurant called Longboards, with nice entertainment too! Now for the pool area....although quite expansive,it still felt a bit claustraphobic. The lounge chairs are no more than 6 inches from each other,so if every chair is being used,you are elbow to elbow with your neighbor. There is a long row of shrubs and a sidewalk that separates the pool area from the beach and ocean, so you really are kind of corralled in that pool area. Lucky for us, the hotel was not booked to capacity and we always managed to find a lounge chair. There are two kind of hotels....one where parents bring their kids, and one where kids bring their parents...this hotel is the latter. Kids were running around wild everywhere ! Even at the breakfast buffet. Lots of strollers too (watch your ankles). Never mind the adult pool,it seemed more shaded than other areas,and the sunny spots were always taken. Some kids in the pool had floats with honking horns on them, for hours you heard honking amongst the screaming..yuk ! Now,this is probably a great place to bring your kids, the parents seemed to love it. We spent more time at the Sheraton black rock on the far end of the beach, an easy walk. Although there were lots of people there also, it felt much more open and you felt like you still had your own space. I could go on and on, and gee, I have! Bottom line is, we had a rental car and had a great time on Maui. Its our fourth time to Hawaii, we've been to all the islands and love them all,they each have there own unique qualities. If you already booked this place and how I described it doesnt seem like its for you, dont panic...its a beautiful hotel anyway,you just have to work a bit at finding your space here. And for a local restaurant,just walk away to the left or right a few blocks and the crowd thins out. I agree with some others that this hotel does not have a strong Hawaiian feel, but hopefully you dont spend all your time at the hotel,get out and really see Maui,its beautiful ! Hope this helps,Aloha !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Maui is beautiful, wonderful.....”
Reviews.Author: Tarb03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa for my husbands business Convention (the men worked, the women didn't!), and it was simply awesome. The best trip we have had to date. We have been blessed enough to have been to a few nice places, and this was by far the best yet. We landed late in the evening, so we were shuttled to the hotel in the dark and we knew that the ocean was on our left and that's all we were aware of. So, arriving and walking into the hotel was extra special because it's just beautiful ... to the open air lobby, to the waterfalls, to the gentlemen offering the traditional leis for you to wear, to the gracious ladies and gentlemen at the front desk, to the fish in the pond, to the parrots perched in different places around the lobby/sitting area. The place is big, so there us a lot to take in. But there will be a smile on your face as you head to the elevators to take you to your room. When we arrived in our rooms we were pleased. They were clean and comfy. As I mentioned - we travelled in the dark - so we didn't really get to see what the ocean/resort truly looked like yet. However, when we woke up the next morning and pulled the drapes back, opened the sliding glass door and stepped out on our patio - we were blown away. It was the most surprising and beautiful sight we have seen. Blue, blue ocean, outlines of the other islands in the distance, palm trees and the maze of pools in the middle of the resort. It was breathtaking! Needless to say, we were really quite pleased. Oh, and I must tell you that most days you can see the blow holes from the whales out in the ocean from your room. Sometimes not very far off. They also liked to jump out of the water in front of our hotel to show off. It was ridiculous how close they were and how often you saw them. Just an awesome sight to see! The hotel food and service were quite good and the pool staff were great. Always smiling, saying hi and eager to get a volleyball game going in one of the many many beautiful pools (there's waterfalls, hidden hot tub and a slide as well). There is also a shopping centre called Whalers a mere 3 minute walk away. You can buy everything and anything there. We rented a car for a day and took a drive around Maui, and again it was breathtaking. There is beaches all along the highway. You can literally pull off to the right at most times and hit a beach. I highly recommend renting a car. Most islands you visit will generally have the poorer area that you have to go through to get where your going - but it's not like this in Maui. This really is just a wonderful place. The whole vibe of the island is not anything like you've experienced before, there is so much beauty to see, the people are super friendly and you could actually seriously see yourself living there! Bottom line, Maui is a place that everyone must go to at least once in their lives. It's a trip of a lifetime and we pray that someday we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: shesmiles_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec 27 and left on Jan 8, 2011. Upon arrival I thought wow, what a great place and the lobby and the pool areas are amazing. The hallways and rooms however are ugly. The hallways, very dated and dark and seem dirty. The room we had was tiny with wall paper starting to come off the walls in spots and dirty stuff on the wall in few places, very gross. The bathroom was dull, tiny, and very outdated...no character or feeling of luxruy! The beds sagged slightly in the middle but other than that they were lovely. The two PLASTIC water bottles were a nice touch, but not enviromentaly friendly, although they did have a recyclying bin in the room by the garbage can. We arrived late, hungry and as it was just past 11pm were unable to get any kind of food. Room service should be 24 hour in a place this expensive. We had a coffee ring on the counter for 4 days (I left it to see how long it would take for them to clean it, shouldn't all surfaces be cleaned daily?) I think it actually just got worn off from towels and stuff being put on top when we got back to the room. No impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.”
Reviews.Author: LeshTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Starwood Owners and we stayed here for our anniversary. September is a great time to go to Maui because it wasn't very crowded but the weather was ideal. This hotel is nice, but the rooms are a bit tired and the cleanliness is less than par. The carpet in the room we stayed in was separated from the tile in the bathroom and you could see the pad under the carpet. The bathroom was average and not as clean as I would like. The service was good after they found out we were owners. The check in guy wasn't the nicest, but once we got inside, everything was okay. The food is good, and if you go, get the breakfast package because it is delicious! They have a large buffet with a big selection of food. The pools are fabulous, the ocean and beach access is great, and the location couldn't be better! You are right next to Whalers Village, which is one of the cutest little shopping malls. The pool was a big hit with all the kids. The view from our room was excellent! We had an ocean front room. I would stay here again and recommend it to a friend, but I hope they renovate it soon. If you go, do the sailboat trip on the Gemini. The desk to do it is right near the pool area and it was one of the best experiences! You won't regret it! They feed you a great lunch, the staff is friendly, and the snorkeling is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Starwood's mega resort on Maui”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: Despite being a monster of a resort, we had a wonderful time. The hotel was very full with a convention but we were upgraded to a corner suite as Platinum SPG members. There are so many bars and restaurants that there was literally a happy hour going on somewhere all day (dangerous!). The rooms were standard Westin fare. The beach and pools are beautiful. The lobby with its waterfalls and tropical birds is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for sure”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiVistor_11
Reviews.Content: Booked in the Westin Maui for a week over the holidays. What this place has going for it is its location on the beachwalk which is adjacent to Whalers Village, with good shopping and restaurants. The beach in front of the hotel is a very nice spot as well. BUT know what you are paying for----notably, tiny, dark, dusty, outdated guest rooms; beds that are anything but Heavenly; and very crowded pool area where there is a daily competiton to claim seats with towels at the crack of dawn. We ended up finding a similarly priced beautiful one-bedroom condo down the beach at the Marriott that was 100% better than the Westin, and moved there after a few days. Just be aware that there are so many options around the area and that for the same price as the Westin you could be getting a lot more value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice hospitality, nice location, and nice grounds! Needs some updating.”
Reviews.Author: emanon256
Reviews.Content: We were quite excited to return to the Westin Maui for our second stay. This time we were even upgraded to an ocean view room for free! Though I am not sure how as they told us they were at 100% occupancy since we stayed over X-Mas. Our room had a nice entertainment center and the amazing Westin Heavenly Bed. The bathroom products were nice as well, and the hotel always had that subtle Westin green tea scent they put in all their hotels. I do have to mention that the bathroom part of the room was outdated. It needs an overhaul. Fortunately, nothing was dirty as some people have mentioned, just older. They also had a fridge in our bathroom ? and magically two water bottles appeared every day. Great touch! The pools were quite crowded, everyone grabs a chair at 6am and keeps stuff on it all day, so its hard to find a spot. We did manage to always finds chairs, but it took some work. The pools were nice, clean, and fun, though they were quite crowded and a lot of children, I would not recommend it for someone who doesn't like kids. But we didn't mind. The pool service was amazing, very attentive, and some of the best tasting Pina Colodas ever! Way to go! The prices on food throughout the resort were excruciatingly high. We were shocked, $10 for 1/2 a papaya at the restaurant. Poolside food service was expensive. Everything was expensive. The food and drinks were substantially more than they were at the other hotel we stayed at which was a Waldorf Astoria, that shocked me. However, the quality of the food was really good. Not the typical fried rubbish food a lot of beach resorts serve. We got Nachos one day and they had real cheese, not that weird liquid cheese. Also the pool side service was amazingly fast, and constantly refilling our water, and bringing us free pineapple. We used the gym and spa. I have to say the gym was too small for the amount of people there, and we were never able to take any spinning classes, they fill up days in advance. However the facility was nice, perhaps not staying during X-mas would alleviate this issue. The location is great, you can walk down the beach to Whalers Village and go shopping, and there are quite a few better priced restaurants there. The grounds were nice, there is a walk through waterfall, and paths and pools, and a cute little gazebo. I would stay here again, but really hope they update the bathrooms in the rooms first.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: veronk3
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay at this hotel. we paid a great deal to stay here for our honeymoon. We even paid to stay in a nicer room and i signed up for the star reward program. the westin hotel are known for being a good quality hotel but this one falls short. We stayed in cheaper hotels with average rating and had a much better experience. When we got there they put us in their star reward suite floor. this was s suite and it was disgusting. the room was not well cleaned. the hotel needs to be fixed up. the wall paper was falling off the walls. the carpet was dirty. the staff was not helpful. we end up having to complain to see if we could get money back. after a few room changes we ended up in an ok room which was their best room. the room itself was not very clean. the shower had mold on it. the bed was the best though. we did not a great view most of the views face into the court yard so you only get a side view of the ocean. the breakfast was awful. many days we waited an hour or so for a wait staff to even come over and give us water. at the end of our trip we decided to eat out b/c the service was so bad. we had free vouchers for the breakfast too. it wasnt worth it to us at the end of the week. They ended up being construction in the suite next to us so it was not relaxing. we were not even notified of this. it was one of the worst hotels i ever stayed at. the elevators smelt like beer and sweat. there seemed to be alot of spring breakers which surprised me. the elevator broke down a few times. Our water was cut off by the construction without us being notified. I was even surprised that the pools didnt even seem to be cleaned. there was always alot of stuff floating in the pools which disgusted me. How much time does it take to skim the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Convenient Location.”
Reviews.Author: kallijo001
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying a bad hotel will come just short of ruining my trip...it doesn't need to be a 5 star resort, but it does need to be clean, modern, well appointed and with friendly staff. This hotel had all of these things. The room was nice, clean and well put together. The staff was incredibly friendly, from the restaurants to the spa to the housekeeping...everyone was great. We stayed for 6 days and I would definitely stay here again. I only have two complaints...the first being no vending. I couldn't find a soda at 4am to save my life and I was starting to feel like my life depended on it. In room coffee makers are great, but for those of us who don't drink coffee...vending would be a wonderful addition. The second complaint was that the walls seemed thin. In fact, if standing in a quiet hallway, you could hear a pin drop inside a guest room...and I'll just leave it at that. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: MNurse
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. The great aspect of sheraton is being part of starwood - you can also visit the westin villas and the other sheraton property to use their facilities as well and the great diversity of restaurants. There is a free shuttle between the hotels. My kids loved the pool at this hotel with water slides, etc. Breakfast was fantastic too. My kids cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin - very good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: cac258
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 nights at the Westin booked with Starwood Points, so keep in mind I didn't pay anything for my room. I have been Starwood Platinum/Gold for 10 years and have stayed at many Westin's, Sheraton's and St. Regis Hotels. The Westin Maui's biggest problem is that it is 40 years old. Back in 1970 it must have been truly incredible, in 2010 it does not really compare to some of the other more modern resorts on Maui. Whether you should stay here depends on several things, here are the pros and cons: Pros: Great location right in the middle of Kaanapali Beach 2 minute walk to Whaler's Village which has 3 nice restaurants, shops and a great yogurt shop Best pool on Kaanapali Beach? (my 10 yr old loved it) Good service Good buffet breakfast (though pricey, would be great if your room rate included the buffet) Pretty nice rooms (though small), comfortable beds Short drive to Lahaina and Kapalua Never had trouble parking (don't need to spend extra on Valet) Cons: Small rooms Older hotel (but holding up pretty well) Pool chairs - you have to get up at 7am and put down a magazine & sunscreen (or other similar object) to reserve chairs. If you go down at 10am you will not get a chair when the hotel is near or at capacity Lot's of kids, families and people (not a con if you are one of those families) $25 per day resort fee (includes self parking, fitness center, Internet (their connection was very slow) and 2 bottles of water per day Bottom line, if you want a deluxe 5 star resort, go to the Ritz Carlton, Grand Wailea or Four Seasons. If you want a 3-4 star bustling, kid friendly resort with decent rooms and pretty good service, the Westin is great. If you want it a bit quieter, go to the Sheraton or Hyatt, they are at opposite ends of the beach and get less traffic, they are also a longer walk to restaurants and shops at Whaler's village. If you want beach chairs, reserve them in advance, as they do get booked up. Some people complained that they have to pay for them, but they are not expensive (I think it is $20 a day for 2 chairs and an umbrella), it is supply and demand as they limit the number allowed. If you want pool chairs, send someone down at 7am and reserve some chairs. Several days we went out for the day and got back to the pool at 3pm and had no trouble getting chairs when we got back.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent from NY Review”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl427
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I stayed at the Westin Maui for 7 nights with my Fiance. This was my first time to Hawaii and I am so happy that I chose this hotel to stay at. The lobby was beautiful with a waterfall and a pond filled with fish. The pools were great, there were so many to chose from with or without slides and my favorite was that they had an adults only pool. The rooms were beautiful. I stayed in the Luxury Suite and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD AMAZING !!!! I did see the other rooms and they were just as nice just smaller of course. The restaurants on property were good , expensive but good. I loved the location because you were right next door to Whalers Village which had tons of shopping and restaurants which was really great. I really would recommend this hotel to all types ex: families , honeymooners , singles etc .. Stop reading reviews and just book it already !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but needs renovation!”
Reviews.Author: spidergirl13
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our trip. The bulk of the hotel is great! pool is awesome! lobby is pretty. Rooms are small, old and not very clean. The "heavenly beds "were not so heavenly.They felt wobbly and too mushy. I think they need replacing. Food at this resort is just average as is most of the food on the island. Staff is very friendly except for the lady in the coffee bar. I would stay here again but I would bring cleaning supplies. Also, the room size is about the size of a large closet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great location”
Reviews.Author: KarenHEncinitas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin Maui. The staff at the hotel are amazingly helpful and courteous. The concierge staff was fantastic in helping us make dinner reservations and providing recommendations during a busy week. Whenever we had any requests for assistance with our room, it was taken care of in a matter of minutes. Restaurant staff was great. The location is wonderful- close to everything. The beautiful common areas in the lobby are really lovely. The rooms are a bit small for the level of hotel and we were surprised we had to pay a fee to rent chairs for the beach- not things you would expect for a hotel of the Westin caiber. However, overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, a bit run-down but still very clean, and right on the beach...”
Reviews.Author: Pootunui
Reviews.Content: Overall, I liked this hotel - it was very comfortable and clean. The staff were efficient and very friendly. I especially liked the check-in personnel, two locals who were helpful and made me feel welcomed. I also like that the hotel has local art crafters selling their beautiful artwork in the lobby area. It's important to bring locals into a Hawaii resort/hotel - we need to share and support our local artists, many who make a humble living selling their artwork. I think tourists appreciate this also - and wouldn't most people want to buy local instead of made in China and Indonesia? The only complain I have is minor, as the hotel is a bit run-down, but it was clean and comfortable with a small refrigerator and extra counter which was nice, as well as convenient to the active tourist-type beaches, shopping and restaurants - very resorty but not too fancy, still comfortable and not too pricey for most people (keeping in mind that this is Maui!). But, don't think I'd stay here again as there are many better options for the price in Ka'anapali - depends on the rate you get. I was lucky to get a decent rate due to a family member's employee discount - but don't think I'd pay full rate, although it is nice that they offer a "kama'aina" (local resident) rate. Vacation rental condos sound like a better value though if you're going to stay more than three days. But like I said, overall this hotel was comfortable and although I was a solo traveler, it seemed to cater to a variety of client age-groups, as well as appeared to be family oriented, and I felt very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky, vulgar hotel with clueless management”
Reviews.Author: NYCBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Found hotel tacky and vulgar, with clueless management - hotel tries to be upscale, but fails. Noisy - very loud schlocky luau show on Tuesdays and Thursday. Decor very corporate Westin - no resort feel - and hotel feels very old. Horrible water pressure in bathrooms. Lots of midmarket tourists - forget any elegance - but that is Kaanapali. Only good part of the hotel was the valet staff - friendly, proactive and helpful. Only stay here on Starpoints - even cash and points at $90 is pushing the value envelope here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, relaxing, ...”
Reviews.Author: KHZSO
Reviews.Content: This was one of our most relaxing trips. We had a great time. We also want to compliment Gigi. Sometimes everything does not work out in a stay - no matter how hard a hotel tries to be perfect, perfection is not always achievable. But, the mark of a class operation is how the problems are handled. Gigi went above and beyond our expectations when we had an issue. Her actions really enhanced our confidence in the Westin brand.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Spa Experience”
Reviews.Author: LisaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the adjacent Westin Ocean Villas which were great - no complaints. We were there for my sister's wedding. Had all of our appts at the spa for mani/pedi/hair for bridal party. First thing said to the bride upon arrival at the spa was "what happened to Sunday? I'm coming in on my day off for you! What happened to the make-up appointments on Sunday?" We had cancelled the make-up a month earlier (their cancellation policy is 1 day.) She then wouldn't say a word to the bride as she did her trial hair up-do. The style was not quite what the bride had envisioned but the stylist refused to change it unless we paid for an entire second up-do fee! What is the point of a trial bridal hair do if you can't modify it at least once?? We were appalled at the rude service and we will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: sginmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for a week for our 10 year anniversary. Loved the Westin!!!
