The lobby is just amazing - I could have sat there for the entire time and just watched the beautiful scenery. Our room was ocean front and we had a fantastic view. The service at the front desk was great. The room was always clean and was spacious enough for us and all of our luggage. The location was also great - easy access to the beach. The pools were also nice - we usualy hung out at the adult pool. If you are planning on being at the pool for the duration of the day - get there early to claim a chair. Usually by 730-8am they were all taken. I did see staff walking around marking chairs that were empty - if no one was back at that chair within an hour, I believe the belongings were removed. We never had a problem getting a chair but the selection was scarce. There is a small cafe in the lobby where you can get Starbucks coffee, smoothies (very good!!) and small breakfast items. If you want a sit down breakfast, you can eat at the restaurant. I wasn't overly impressed with the restaurant food or service. We did order room service our first day there and that was very good. My husband surprised me with a private sunrise breakfast for our anniversary which was absolutely amazing!!! The food and champagne was non-stop! Our table faced the ocean, it was so romantic and beautiful. I would absolutely recommend that for anyone celebrating a romantic occasion at The Westin. The only complaint I had about the hotel is that the parking spaces are extremely small. You can self-park your vehicle. If the self-park is full, they will valet it for free. Other than that small detail I loved this hotel and would absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: k2kelley
Reviews.Content: Dec. 2010, very friendly check-in, including bottle of Champagne delivered later as she overheard us talking about our honeymoon on maui (but not their hotel) 22 years earlier. Upgraded to ocean view with points (room 1015) 10th floor overlooking pools. Rooms comfortable, beach nice, but best part is the ADULTS ONLY POOL! No screamers and bar close by. Resort charge ($25 day) covers parking, internet and gym, which was great for me. Property is showing some age in floors and walls, but grounds nice.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Days in a Dream”
Reviews.Author: hendrixokc
Reviews.Content: We recently spent seven days and eight nights at this beautiful hotel. The staff was so welcoming and prompt to solve any problem. I'm a picky customer and can't sleep without a fan. We arrived late and it was after midnight when I made a request for an electric fan. Promptly a 4 foot free standing fan was at my bedside. One thing, be advised that you must request hangers and robes. These also arrived promptly per our request. The view from our balcony room was breathtaking. This is not an inexpensive hotel and they provide two bottles of Hawaiian purified water daily. I requested more and they were provided, as many as I wanted and at no extra charge. Not sure about other folks. As you can tell, I like my water and lots of it. Migumi, the Japanese guest hostess was wonderful. She went out of her way to make our stay memorable. Arlyn, the special events coordinator also helped us host the luau event for our wedding party and she handled the seating arrangements and made everything come off great. Rarely do I make these reviews, but this hotel deserved this one. I don't know if the management is so good or the Hawaiians are naturally this nice, but whatever, this was one wonderful vacation/marriage. As beautiful as Maui is, I really believe you could stay at this hotel for the whole week and never leave it and still have a fantastic week in Maui. John and Family from Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “I'm a hotel snob and I loved it.....”
Reviews.Author: robranz
Reviews.Content: I'm normally a Marriott guy but the wife and I booked a Delta Vacations special and the Westin appeared to be a better choice than either of the Marriott's on the Island. I was bummed of course because I wouldn't be getting my points as well as I've come to expect high quality from most of the Marriott hotels. I had never stayed at a Westin prior to this. First let me say that I was a little concerned after reading the reviews on here. Even mentally geared myself up for an argument at check in hahaha :) We arrived around 6:30 or so on a Friday evening without our bags due to a short connection in Oahu after arriving late due to weather in Minneapolis. Check in went smooth as silk. They had the correct room and didn't bug us about upgrades or try to sell anything more. When our bags finally arrived we were left a message (fell asleep from the long flight) and they were delivered to our room within 10 minutes of calling down. The staff at this hotel is fantastic. Nothing but smiles and helpful attitudes that I experienced. As for the rooms, our was just fine. We had a delux ocean view room in the ocean tower (I think). Nice view of the beach from the balcony or lying in bed even. It could have been better directly facing but let's face it, not every room is going to have a perfect view :) If you want that, then book it. Just don't complain about the cost. Supply and demand people...supply and demand :) The hotels location is a huge asset. Without a doubt, it's at the best spot on the beach. On the extreme north end of the beach is a Sheraton (part of this chain) with a nice beach as well. Just a little more crowded than I like. Our beach was probably the widest stretch along the beach. Smooth soft sand and various waves throughtout the day. Just be careful wading in. It's got a little more of a drop off than you might expect about 20 feet out. Nothing dangerous, just might catch you off guard :) We walked the entire beach length and as you move south on the beach, by about 3 more hotels, the beach gets very narrow and even rocky. I'm extremely happy we went with the westin instead of the hyatt. The hyatt had almost no beach to speak off (althought the property looked fabulous). Pools are incredible here. Nice water slide (one for the kids as well). Water vollyeball net, water basketball, groto with jacuzzi and waterfalls. Even has an adult pool to get away from the kids. Crowd was mixed here. Not a rowdy crowd or party type place (which I liked) but had a good mix of young and old, familes and couples. Even saw a few singles there. Very respectful group of people. One of the nicest things was that all of the things you might do in Maui happen right here on this beach. Parasailing, snorkle and scuba excursions, whale watch boat trips, etc. The catamarans pull right up on the beach and off you go. The only exception would be kayaking. You'd have to walk down about two properties (not far at all) to rent some kayaks or jet skis. Everything else is right here. Now let me address some of the negatives that I read and spooked me a bit: Resort fees: Every property on the island charges the same fee....deal with it....it's the cost of going to a resort. If you don't like it, don't go to a resort.....I hear Denver has some nice hotels this time of year :) Rooms: The rooms were fine. Nice couch, reasonbly comfy beds, fridge so that you can stock some drinks yourself, good tv channel selection, clean and spacious bathrooms, very attentive housekeeping staff. Anytime I asked for anything, it was in the room within 10 minutes of me hanging up the phone. Cost: There are cheaper places and there are more expensive places. Do what's right for you budget. I found it to be very reasonably priced for the quality of the grounds, amenities and the great attiudes of the staff members. Don't be afraid to book a mountain view room to save some bucks if you need to. You shouldn't be spending that much time in your room at a place like this anyway :) Parking: This one had me spooked. I expected parking hell. I never had a single problem parking. Always had plenty of empty spaces and it's very easy and convenient to park. Don't waste your money on valet.....the lot is 200 ft from the front entrance. Pool and lounge chairs: This one I just can't believe someone complained about. There was neveeeeer and issue getting pool chairs. I don't think I ever even saw the pool busy enough to keep me from going....and I hate people hahahaha. Tons and tons of pool chairs easily available. Pool is open until 10 and most people are finished with it by 5 p.m. so it's almost a private pool at that point. Good seperation between the different parts too. Beach chairs: Rent the beach chairs...well worth the whopping 5 bucks for the ENTIRE day......you can get 2 chairs AND and umbrella for 30 bucks for the whole day......well worth it. If you can handle the sun without the umbrella, you're into it for 10 bucks for two people to have 2 nice comfy chairs placed on the beach for you. I saw some complaints about cobana rental prices??? Not even sure why you would rent one of these....they're not even on the beach. Although they do have some mini cabana type things kinda on the beach......but they were all right next to each other......and as I mentioned...I hate people hahaha Short of it is rent a couple of chairs and maybe an umbrella...you'll love it. Ohhhh...I almost forgot.....if you've got the inclination, they may offer you a tour of one of their time share properties up the beach. Doesn't matter if you're interested in it or not, if you can handle loosing 90 minutes of your day it's well worth it. They'll give you a $100 credit at the hotel AND a coupon (I think it's a coupon) for 50% off of your next stay at a starwood property!!! We got busy and never made it and I'm sort of kicking myself for that. 50% off of any hotel stay is fantastic....... Overall, definitely one of my favorite hotel expereinces so far. Good for young or old, couples or families.....just bring sunscreen :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Hotel with amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Jeanjavert
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine. Our room was deluxe ocean view with a great view. We could hear the elevator and the carpet had a few bumps in it but who cares? The lanai door did a good job soundproofing the trucks at Whalers Village. Nice to be next door to it. We got every 3rd night free and free breakfast. The parking does have small slots BUT the last two rows by the tennis courts are a good size so just use them. The beach is AWESOME. So are the pools. If you have kids this is a huge plus. The hamburgers at ONO are great.Â  Yes they hit you up for a timeshare presentation but they are very polite about it. Just say no and that's the end of it. The luau was a lot of fun. It is table service. They bring a course and put it on a lazy Susan. The show was very good. We had a premium table which was nice. We never had problems with the staff. They were nice to us. If I may? Treat them like people, not staff. Ask them how they are, smile! Also, you came to Hawaii. Learn to run on Hawaii time. I think this is huge. Go with the flow and you'll be fine. RELAX. This is a family hotel. Lots of kids. Know this up front and make your decision accordingly. We were there over Thanksgiving and we just never had this problem with no lounge chairs or Lineups at the buffet. Yes it is busier towards 9 or 10 but it's not a crisis. See above about relaxing. The resort fee is what it is. Nobody likes it, every hotel seems to have it. Load up on the waters and coffees and shampoos in your room. You paid for them! Wireless Internet is a little slow and spotty. Are things pricey? Duh, this is Maui. Maui is pricey. Load up on Costco and K mart goodies. The Resort Aspect? There is an activity hut by Ono restaurant and activities are posted in the lobby. Your kids can feed the koi fish in the lobby. Just ask about it. Honestly the pool, waterfall and slides and beach do a great job amusing kids of all ages. Shout out to specific staff: The 10th floor cleaning staff always asked for my room key when they were cleaning my room and I came in. THANK YOU. I appreciate the security. Carlito, Alex and Melinda at Ono were awesome. So good to my son. Carlito fixed our wobbly table without being asked. Thanks! Brandy at the front desk lent me scissors and tape. Mahalo! Another lent me an ink pad. The older gentleman at the Koa store was very friendly and kind. Danny from the bell staff volunteered to take our picture for us. That was a huge deal for us. Small kindnesses are everything. I am sure the front desk staff has heard the same questions a thousand times. Their job however, is to act like they have never heard it before and help us without making us feel silly for asking us which one of them did. I will refrain from naming the individual. To sum up? Get a deal, ask for the Beach Tower on a high floor away from the elevator. RELAX. Be nice to people. Be aware this is a hotel that is big with families. The pools are great for kids. Park in the last two rows for a bigger spot. if there's a problem don't freak out and just try and get it dealt with. I will stay here again. I have read all the bad reviews for the past two years but I just didn't experience them. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Consultant35
Reviews.Content: So, we spent 8 nights at The Westin Resort and Spa and had a great time. Although the room was smaller than expected, our view was amazing on the top floor of the Ocean Tower. We did not think the breakfast was anything special after trying it the first day, but with The Whaler's Village next door, that really wasn't a problem. The Concierge staff was very helpful as was the AmEx travel desk in the lobby. They helped us plan day trips around the island (drive up Haleakala, Road to Hana) as well as with anything that needed booking (Helicopter tour, spa, dinner reservations, etc). The pool area is beautiful and the adults only pool area was nice, although could have had better enforcement. We stayed from Nov 25th - Dec 3rd and loved that the crowds died after Thanksgiving weekend passed. The hotel has "free internet and parking", but, as with most resorts these days, those are "free" because you pay a resort fee (here includes parking, internet, gym, 2 bottles of water/day, etc.) of $25/day.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Passingthorugh
Reviews.Content: In addition to the great service, spectacular grounds, and great sightseeing, the Westin provides a free astronomy viewing class along the beach walk every Wed night from 8 to 9:30 pm. Look for Becky "The Star Lady" along the beach path with her computer and 8 inch telescope. Very friendly, knowledgeable and outgoing. You are able to look into the telescope and track planets and the moon, etc. AND IT's FREE!. This is offered by Westin but is free to anyone walking by. During the day you have 5 pools with waterfalls, slides and beautiful landscape to stroll about. No reason to leave the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere if you are over 5 years old.”
Reviews.Author: deckgirl
Reviews.Content: Oh my, what a tired hotel. The accent is on HOTEL. The rooms were terrible, dark, small and rather dirty - not resort caliber at all - just "hotel." Nothing in the room spoke of Hawaii - it could have been a room anywhere, in any city. We had connecting rooms (one King, the other double Queen w/ a pull out sofa, ocean view (IF you turned your head to the right). Three teenagers in one room. Pity my poor baby on the horrible pull-out bed. Stinks to be #3. Looking out of window was shocking - our view was of the other wings of the hotel. It is institutional, blocky, dated, and very unattractive. We were in a room that did not have a view of either sunrise or sunset. Looking down was a great view of the huge and lush pool area. Excellent pool. The lobby, restaurant, common areas, and pool grounds were fantastic. RUN to the adult pool if you do not have kids. Coming from the East coast - I could not sleep the first morning and crawled out onto the lanai (aka teeny tiny terrace) at 5:45 AM. I was SHOCKED to see numerous people and MANY little children making their way to pool lounges. (My kids are in late teens and met no one - most here are under 10). I decided I had better go and stake a claim for my family of 5. All chairs were filled by 7:30 AM. Hello? This is a vacation? That was my daily ritual, get up early to get a group of chairs together at the adult pool, hopefully w/ a sliver of shade. I stayed at the chairs for an early coffee and a chance to read quietly. My family showed around 8 or 9. EVERY DAY I noticed chairs that were "reserved" by 6 AM (people put towels, magazines & books on lounges to hold a spot), but the people did not show until NOON - or later! Once or twice, hotel employees placed little cards on the unoccupied but "reserved" chairs asking them not to do this, but they did nothing concrete to stop this annoying practice. Daily, I witnessed hapless couples wandering to the pool area around 9 or 10 to have absolutely no place to sit as half the lounges were "reserved" yet unoccupied. The looks on the faces of the honeymoon couples were tragic. There were very few lounges on the beach (due to local laws, not hotel rules), so I stood in the morning queue to get towels and try to reserve a beach chair. I asked on Sunday and could not get one until THURSDAY! And they charge for them, and the umbrellas. This really is a pool hotel, not a beach resort. But do visit the beach, it is lovely and far better than the beaches at the other resorts, which are sometimes non-existent, and the water is warmer than the pool water. Be prepared for lines everywhere - to check in/out, for coffee, for towels, even in the morning for the breakfast - when there plenty of open tables. I did a lot of research on Luaus. Wanted the full experience, but not the cheesy, junky kind. The one at the hotel was pretty good. Good music, great dancing, excellent fire show and not embarrassing at all. Food was not terrible and it was table service, not buffet. We were told we could get more of anything we wanted, but it didn't work like that. The meal was rushed, waitstaff hard to find. Drinks were so watered down that the waitstaff would give you two if you asked for one! Be prepared for the aggressive photographer as you walk in. I was literally grabbed and man-handled into place for the obligatory family shot in front of the lovely backdrop. Hotel is within walking distance of a few decent restaurants and a good shopping "mall" with an expensive but convenient mini-mart type store. The concierges were terrific. Bartenders were crabby and wine by the glass was terrible. Hawaii is fantastic. This hotel is not. Westins are really mid-market hotels, despite the cost. Do not expect a "high-end" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: VanTraveller85
Reviews.Content: We loved our time here. The location is unbeatable, on a gorgeous beach and walking distance to Whalers Village. We had connecting rooms which worked well for a big family. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've ever had. Great service which is hard to find in the island. Not a day goes by where I don't wish I was sitting at this hotel by the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management oversight - go elsewhere for the money”
Reviews.Author: hapickard
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to visiting this hotel and used a package offered through my SPG membership. However, I left disappointed and knowing I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. While the room had a great view, it was "old" looking and smaller than anticipated. Too many little things went wrong: when we checked in we were given a room but when we entered, a repair man was IN THE ROOM removing a cabinet door (which freaked my daughter out to open the door and some man was in there), then it took a couple of requests to get the daybed made up correctly. the next morning, my appt at the spa was incorrect - I received a regular massage not the stone massage (money was deducted, but I did not get what I had ordered), they didn't have one of the products used that I liked therefore I couldn't purchase it and the staff didn't seem to care - no options given for how to purchase it.. one of my guests pedicures wore off completely by the evening (at $65 - not acceptable! ), the "free breakfast" at the OnO grill: every time I ate there I ended up with stomach cramps and diarrhea for hours...finally stopped eating there after 3 tries... I was not told of the wristband "rules" for the slide at check-in, so my kids didn't ever get to go (they were always out of bands, once I figured out how it worked...), there was no directory in the room explaining the hours of facilities, restaurants, or the pool rules, the luau was Okay (worst of three I've been to on the islands), but there were a lot of spectators on the sidewalk who got the show for Free while I had to pay hundreds... little things which had only one happened I probably would have ignored it, but put all together and it was not a good experience at all. Very disappointed. The two good things? My concierge Nicki was AWESOME! she saved the day, and quite possibly the entire vacation experience. And the restaurant Tropica was amazing for Thanksgiving dinner - kudos to the chef. I regret spending my time and money here instead of another location.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Inamuraj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights over Thanksgiving with family of 4 (2 boys ages 8 and 11). A number of things I was concerned about from reading reviews were NOT problems! Although the hotel was sold out, we had no trouble getting chairs by the pool at whatever hour we wished. That said, we rarely did that since the boys mostly wanted to play in the ocean. Our room was fairly small, but that wasn't an issue either. We were very comfortable for 5 nights, and even ate breakfast in our room most mornings. (the fridge is great!). Other pros include the location near so many great restaurants, etc., in Lahaina and points between, and the great snorkeling off the beach. We rented equipment incl boogie boards from Maui Dive and Surf and it was great. There are two reasons I can only give it a four. First, the next night we stayed at Hotel Hana Maui, and there's no way they can both be fives. There's no comparison. Second, check in was a bit rough. We waited (at 9pm but 2am according to our bodies!) for more than 30 minutes while they finished getting our room ready, and the front desk person was not very nice about it. But, it wasnt that big a deal. We had a great time despite that and the fact that we probably had the worst room at the hotel (3rd floor overlooking the entrance). We just didn't spend enough time in the room for it to matter.

Reviews.Title: “Check-In Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: djkrun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending Thanksgiving week at the Westin Maui. We have stayed at this resort a number of times and always loved it. It is still a beautiful resort, great location, great buffet breakfast, great pool and water slide. However... Our reservation was for an Ocean View room. We arrived at 4:00 PM and were told that all of the rooms overlooking the pool and ocean were taken and that we would be put in a room on the end of the building, where we would be able to see the ocean. We expressed our displeasure but agreed to go look at the room (Room 854). The balcony of the room looked directly at the Kaanapali Alii resort, about 50 yards away. The ocean was off to the right. However, the right side of the balcony is a solid wall from floor to ceiling all the way to the railing. So, if you leaned over the railing, and looked over the rooftops, you could see the ocean from the balcony. We returned to the lobby and told the woman at the desk that we were not taking that room. She explained to us that the room was considered Ocean View in her computer, as if that somehow made the view spectacular. We asked that she or a manager come up to the room with us, stand on the balocny, look us in the eye, and tell us that it was an Ocean View. That didn't work. We asked to speak to a manager and were told that there were none available. Then, she tried again to talk us into taking the same room. We explained that we would sleep in the lobby until they found us an Ocean View room. Then, a manager magically was available. He began the conversation by saying, "We are 100% full", as if that somehow relieved them of their commitment to give us an Ocean View room. We repeated that we would sleep in the lobby until they found us an Ocean View room, either at the Westin or at one of the other resorts. Then, within a minute, we were given a real Ocean View room. So, for one hour they claimed that there were no Ocean View rooms available and then, amazingly, there WAS an Ocean View room available. Of course, the $25 resort fee is unconscionable, but that is a whole other story...

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, service deteriorated over the last few years”
Reviews.Author: albert333
Reviews.Content: Times have changed. Much of the staff are from the mainland. They have implemented processes that make it less intimate. Its too bad. Was a great place just a couple of years ago. Watch out for the pool attendants. Clearly just a job. With over booking and guests that compete for the lounge chairs and daily complaints, they can be terse. Time to find a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Vacayshon
Reviews.Content: The Westin Resort and Spa was a very nice place to stay at in Maui, HI. The staff was friendly from the moment you enter the door. The waterfall in the lobby is gorgeous, and the flamingos are a surprising touch. Gigi, the housekeeper, for most of our stay was so nice! We were amazed that she greeted us by our names. What could be more personalized service than that. The resort's pool was excellent. Our son loved the kids slide. I also love that you can rent the beach towels. Furthermore, I really liked the location of the hotel. It's next to Whaler's Village, but it's also a short drive to all the local shops and Safeway grocery store in Lahaina. We would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazeballs”
Reviews.Author: ranegrrll
Reviews.Content: Overall- a great place. We booked with a Westin deal for every other night free so the price wasn't too bad. We probably would have stayed somewhere else otherwise. The pools were amazing and not too crowded. The beach was great but renting an umbrella/cabana was incredibly expensive. Being able to walk down the beach to blackrock to snorkel was by far the best part. Food was ok but just a little bit overpriced and the staff were friendly. The concierge was helpful and booked restaurants for us each night. A lot of great things within walking distance so you don't feel trapped on the resort property. But it didn't feel like the resort was in the middle of a busy area. Rooms were nice but a few stains on the carpet and some of the A/C equipment was loud out on the balcony. Views from the oceanside rooms were incredible. The gym was nice. We talk all the time about what a great trip this was.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and Family Friendly, too!”
Reviews.Author: katiethelady3
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Westin Maui (the first was our honeymoon) -- but this one was very different. We had our 5 month old with us! We were a little worried about the hotel experience with a baby, but the Westin was awesome. They provided a crib and stroller, free of charge. They gave us a nice quiet room and everyone was so accommodating at the restaurant (high chairs -- prime buffet location). It really couldn't have been better, we had such an excellent stay! Try to get a rate that includes breakfast, because the buffet is pricey but sooo worth it. There is a kids pool and also activities for older kids. It was very interesting to have 2 very opposite experiences, just because of our different stages in life. Both great, though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Napa_neighbor
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference at the Westin Maui Resort. The experience was very good overall. We were on the Starwood Preferred 9th floor in a mountain view room in the Ocean Tower. It was on the small side. Had a king bed and enough room to set up our daughter's inflatable mattress on the floor (which we packed in a duffle bag). The room was comfortable but crowded with the three of us, but we were hardly in the room except to sleep and eat lunch a few times. The LCD TV had excellent picture quality. The armoire and dessers were sufficient for all our clothes. The bathroom was with the sink open mostly to the room and toilet and tub/shower in a private room, which made noise for my family when I was up early getting ready shaving. The housekeepers were very friendly and accommodated requests for blankets and sheets for the inflatable mattress. They even left us about 5 extra towels each day without our asking and that was appreciated. The rooms were actually fairly quiet except one night the wind was howling throught the closed sliding door when it was particularly windy. The elevators were quick and we hardly waited more than a minute each time. The pools were great, We barely went to the beach as my daughter preferred to swim in the pools. We loved the waterslides. The beach had a strong undercurrent in the water, so we were fine with staying in the pool. No problems getting a chair at the pool, but I hardly used that either. The pool water was on the cooler side but definitely was heated as I could feel warm water coming out of the filters. The poolside service was expensive but the food and drinks were good. The same menu was at the bar and my daughter could eat with us for free there. We thought the breakfast buffet was enjoyable too, And fortunately it was included in our room rate. The staff throughout the hotel were always friendly and helpful,especially the housekeepers and the pool attendants.. The concierge did try to sell a time share preview, which we declined. The parking lot fills up after dinner and the hotel puts up a sign that valet parking will be complimentary and it was mostly except for twice they still put the charge $15 on our bill, but they did correct it when I asked the front desk clerk to do so. We bought some supplies at Safeway in Lahaina, about 5 minutes away by car and used the mini-firdge to the max. This helped save money on lunches. Dinners were at restaurants. We liked them all: Duke's, Hula Grill, the old Lahaina Luau, Kobe Grill, Maha (great sunset dining in Lahaina), even the chinese restaurant next door at Whaler's Village. Having the Whaler's Village next door was a huge asset with shopping and the ABC store nearby for more sunscreen and clothing and a few gifts. I would definitely return, but would probably splurge for a bit larger room if possible next time. We chose the King room over the 2 doubles because who wants to sleep in a double on vacation for a week?! And my 4 year-old does not care if she sleeps on an inflatable mattress. This hotel has a great location with lots of nearby activities and right on the beach. I don't think we could have done any better anywhere else. Thank you, Westin Maui!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: MelissaDay
Reviews.Content: Put simply - the most beautiful hotel grounds/service & gorgeous room I have ever stayed in. We have had a wonderful time & hope to be able to visit again on eday.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: bigkid
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed at the Westin on the 10th.We arrived at 11 P.M. and check in was smooth.just us.We asked for an upgrade and with a smile was told no problem.Beach view,straight on. The grounds are very pretty ,with waterfalls,flamingos,Koi fish.Just a nice place all around.The pool has a great waterslide too. The staff was friendly and always had a smile and " aloha " for us. The beach in front is great,no rocks and not much in the way of waves.The hotel was even nice enough to send a bottle of champagne to our room on our anniversary. The rooms are nothing special.Our family of 4 was cramped as far as not having enough closet space. For 2 people I think it would be fine.The beds are just beds,average ,not hard or soft .The room has a balcony and 2 chairs and also has a refrigerator which was nice for waters and soda. my wife and i will be back in 5 years for another anniversary here. The Westin does it right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Friendly & Helpful staff-Needs more umbrellas”
Reviews.Author: Nicole222
Reviews.Content: We recently returned home from our first trip to Maui. We stayed at the Westin Resort & Spa and I was very happy with our choice. It is a very pretty hotel, the grounds are beautiful. It is very quiet and peaceful, I would definitely stay there again. There are a nice selection of restaurants, as well as a shopping area, Whaler's Village right next to the hotel. Everything is very pricey-but it is Hawaii, this has nothing to do with the property itself. A hot dog is $7 at the pool but again, you will pay that everywhere you go in Hawaii. The rooms were very clean, ours was a tad small, but you do not spend much time in the room at all. You can walk down the beach to black rock and have great snorkling. The only two things that I was dissapointed in was that the hotel only has 8 beach umbrellas and two were broken, so that left 6 available, with probably 1500 or more people staying at the hotel? I would suggest buying an umbrella and taking it with you if you wanted to have shade on the beach. Also, the pool water is so cold, that you can't be in longer than a few minutes. It is pretty much like ice. I would say it was too cold to be refreshing-it was almost painful. All in all, though a great hotel. You really can't go wrong in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST VACATION”
Reviews.Author: mmoin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Oahu and Waikoloa and lived for a while on both islands and visited the others however no resorts even the Fourseason on Big Island can match the service and experience that we had in this resort. From the driver who picked us up at the airport to the Bell Lady who dropped off our luggage, the front desk agent, the room attendants and the restaurant hostesses, every one were impeccable. My son loved not only the pool but the beach and he just could not get enough. thank you Mr. Anderson for running such a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Super Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cusevisitor
Reviews.Content: Came here for a week for our 25th wedding anniversary--we had mentioned that when we booked and were constantly wished happy anniversary by the various staff members we encountered. The staff was friendly, knowlegable and helpful-- the concierges were great in giving us tips on the area, booking reservations, etc. The room was a bit small, but renovated and very clean-- the Starwood "Heavenly Bed" was just that-- heavenly. The public areas were all very nice and the pool area with ample lounge chairs, five pools, waterfalls, etc. was the best of all that we saw among the resorts on Ka'anapali. Full amenties including spa-- fitness equipt. need some updating. Access to the beach and other resorts along an oceanfront walkway was great. Only two (very good) full-service restaurants on property-- but Whalers Village Mall next door offers three more great places plus good shopping. If you go to the Luau, the entertainment was great-- but don't expect much from the food. Pricing for food and beverage was about what you'd expect at a resort like this-- not cheap, but not outrageous. There is $25/day resort charge added to your bill that covers internet and other amenties-- but expect to be charged for beachfront chair/cabana rentals. There is a free bus that will take you to the nearby town of Lahaina, which is full of shops and great restaurants. We got asked to attend timeshare presentations 2-3 times, but they weren't pushy about it. We recommend it highly and would love to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: scholar_girl
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews have said it all: great rooms, beautiful grounds, fabulous pool. I just want to add that the Westin has it all and more. Pparrots, and flamingos AND a black swan! Loved it! From the unspoiled beach, to great snorkeling right off the hotel's beach, a friendly and helpful staff, it lacks nothing. One thing I really loved was that the hotel brings in local artists everyday (different artists each day) to showcase their crafts and artwork. If you are a beach person (I am, I can sit by a pool at home) go ahead and spring for a cabana and Robert will bring you pineapple and ice water. Housekeeping is prompt and keeps the rooms nice and tidy. The valets helped us get the top of our jeep down. In short, this place has fantastic customer service. If I had to bring up one criticism, it would be the self-parking lot. Management might want to have the parking lines re-painted so guests won't park over them, creating a parking nightmare. We managed to park just fine except for one evening when the lot was full and the hotel comped the valet service. Seriously, this place was fantastic. We also attended the luau at the hotel, with fire-knife throwers, hula dancers, and a complete luau dinner. This was fabulous and a wonderful meal and show. You won't be disappointed with the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhhh...The Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: me11860
Reviews.Content: Our room was spectacular, the view was perfect. The Heavenly Bed....made it hard to get up as it was so comfortable. The pools were lovely...The pool waitresses were quick, efficient and nice. OUr room service food was delicious and hot when served....both for breakfast and for dinner. The towels were in abundance....The shower was hot, strong and clean. The shampoo and conditioner smelled lovely. The slide in the pool was so fun..so fast and enjoyed by all. The fitness center was clean, cool and adequately stocked. We extended our stay an extra night...cuz we didnt want to leave.....would I go back.....aaaahhhhhhhhhhh of course!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: juliem81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and very well maintained. The rooms are clean. We traveled with a small child and the hotel is very kid friendly! The pool is awesome. When going back to Maui I would stay here again in a second. Just wish it was a little more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “It's a lovely oasis in a beautiful setting, staffed with professionals who are filled with Aloha!”
Reviews.Author: KoloaFlip
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived--offered an early check-in until I departed, with a lovely late check-out, I was treated with kindness, professionalism and had the most enjoyable time one person could have. The food was yummy, staff personable and I could have stayed forever! Not to mention the manta rays just 10 feet away in the surf of Kaanapali beach, surfing back and forth. The view was incredible, the view from my room was stunning and I had the best time ever! A not to miss resort that offers the best pool I've ever played in!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: sharonalyse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in October 2010. The hotel is steps from the beach, and the lobby and grounds are gorgeous. It is everything you expect from a Westin and then some. The spa was clean, relaxing and the prices were reasonable Dining choices were limited and pricey (but not expected for a resort). The luau was fun, but not a must see. The room was a bit small, and I was surprised there was no turndown service. Internet access was spotty as well. Expect a $100 cab ride from the main airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Bring your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: LWood2277
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. The rooms were great, the pool is amazing, and the staff was very friendly. (with the exception of one hostess at Ono who tried to kick us off our table during the football games on Sun. We just ignored her though.) I would recommend this hotel in a second. My only complaint would be the way they nickle and dime you. There is a $25 a day resort fee charge which we knew about ahead of time, so it's not like we were shocked. Our complaint was why not add that fee to the price of the room ahead of time instaed of hitting you with it at the end of your trip. After paying $10 a drink all week it just kind of sucks. Escpeccially when they tell you the charge is for a bunch of services you don't even use. It's hard not to resent the charge. That being said, it really is a beautiful hotel in a great location. If you can't relax here, it's your own fault. lol It's a five min walk to snorkel at black rock. Amazing snorkeling. We saw 5 sea turtles out there one morning. Tons of fish. Just gorgeous. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in 3 isalnds. Disregard all negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: jay781boston
Reviews.Content: I was on my second island in 8 days, staying at the hyatt in kauai, (great hotel, boring island) if you are under 40 do, maui or oahu, I would say maui has all the pros of both islands, beauty of kaui and attitude of oahu. I was getting prepared to leave the hyatt and decided to read the reviews on trip advis about the westin in maui. I began to get very sad and mad, we had such a good time at the hilton in oahu and we relaxed and were board at the hyatt in kaui, however hyatt 5 star resort in my opinion.we were gonna wrap up our honeymoon at the westin, maui, I was so disapointed that I said I'd rather come home, based on these ridiculous reviews. First off, I walked in the front of the westin and was blown away by the pond and waterfall in the front loby. Got to my room, beach front ocean view, best view by far all 3 hotels and yes we had ocean view at all 3. Rooms were large, with a couch, your going to hawaii, spend the extra cash on the good rooms. Less than 1 nights dinner to upgrade. Loves the view the room, by far the best room of all 3 hotels. The atmosphere is awesome. I am writing this as I watch the sun set from my balcony. That is how upset I am that I let these tasteless people, almost ruin my honeymoon. I say westin and maui are hands down the place I wish I spent my entire honeynmoon. Do not I repeat do not lsiten to anyone elses opinion, form your own. I think u will be super happy. I will be back...westin in maui, p.s hilton waikiki was a blast as well. I am sorry for any typos, I am on my blackberry and have big hands lol jay from boston. And maybe one day maui. Shaka

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel. SPG Platinums get raked by $25 Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives. The pool area is gorgeous though not as nice as the Marriott down the beach. But it is nice and the pool staff are quick and efficient even though the drinks are lacking. Also the location is wonderful. Any hotel you pick on Kaanapali Beach wins in the category of great location. Now for the rest of my thoughts. No suite upgrade for this Platinum member. I asked and it was flatly denied. Furthermore, what do I get for the mandatory $25 resort fee? Is it the in room internet which I get for free, based on my status, at any Starwood property? Is it the two bottles of water or the local paper? Those too are standard at Starwood properties with my status. Maybe the value is in getting to use the workout facility which is also a benefit of being a platinum member. I did benefit from free self parking, so that is one benefit I received. In a nutshell, I think most guests and especially the Platinum members who are already receiving most of the mentioned benefits are getting a good screwing from Starwood. It's all about money folks. When you check in the agent will open a map of the property and then show you the automatic $25 resort fee that will be added to your bill. It states, "In a world where life is sometimes too complicated, we are making things a little easier. In response to suggestions from our guests, Westin Resorts has eliminated several incidental charges in favor of a single resort charge." Hogwash. How stupid do they think their guests are? Do they think we buy this crap? Just admit it Starwood. Your revenue goals for Hawaii are down. In this economy guests arrive at your resorts but they don't spend as much as they did previously and rather than increasing the room charge which would cause occupancy to possibly fall further, you institute this "resort charge". Lucky me, I'm staying on a 1/2 price hotel offer so I only have to pay $255 plus taxes to stay in a very dated hotel, the former Maui Surf that is at least 30 years old. I believe $255 is more than a fair charge for the quality of room I received. And now I get to pay a resort charge for a bunch of "amenities" that are already comped to me as a Platinum SPG member. If you want to know what I mean when I say "dated" you need only read the other guests reviews. This will be my last trip to Hawaii where I stay in a Starwood property with a mandatory resort fee. I'm not biting. And I'm not stupid. I don't need the extra check-ins for my Platinum status and as a traveler who spends over 100 nights each year in various hotel properties my standards are somewhat different than the Maui Westin. That said, it will be fun to challenge myself and find properties in Hawaii that don't charge the resort fee. Many properties are jumping on the bandwagon to bump up revenues and to me it's insulting. See ya Starwood, this Platinum member isn't going to get raped by silly add on fees with cutesy verbage written by your marketing department.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much better!”
Reviews.Author: NoFun69
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were shocked when the lady in front of us asked for a postcard of the hotel. The female clerk rummaged through one of her drawers and came out with 1 post card and told the lady "this is the last one I have". The lady accepted the post card with a nice "Thank you" and walked away. At this point a male clerk leaned over and said "what do you mean that was the last one you had, you have lots of those". The female clerk leaned over to him and whispered, "I know but I save them for my Japanese guests". Needless to say this kind of set the mood of our visit from minute one. It seemed everyday my wife had call the front desk to ask for coffee or soap or something they failed to replenish in our room. The room seemed to be outdated except for the HD television, although we didn't get any movie or premium channels. We stayed for 6 nights and either the fire alarm was going off and we were evacuated from our room or something else happened every day to minimize our fun. I can't say enough negative about this hotel or it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JessiCat77
Reviews.Content: Leonora in housekeeping on the 9th floor....all you can say is wow! not only is she so nice and so polite, but when she is talking to you you feel that she is genuinely interested in helping you be the most comfortable you can be. her warmth was the highlight on our mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Did Not Receive Promised Room, & Other Challenges”
Reviews.Author: SilkyRichmond
Reviews.Content: Overview: * Pro`s - Great pool with good poolside service, nice lobby and tropical setting with flamingos and koi ponds, convenient location beside Whaler Village. * Con`s - Failed to deliver promised upgrade or even our booked room type, challenges in finding space at pool, parking challenges, small rooms, feels like Vegas in Hawaii. Booking: * We booked a promo that entitled us to a 3rd night free, daily buffet breakfast, and a room upgrade (if available). We wanted an ocean view room and after contacting Starwood were advised to book the partial ocean view as October would not be too busy and we would have no problem being upgraded to ocean view at check-in. Check-In: * Arrived at the hotel mid-afternoon and it was a bit of a zoo out front and at the check-in. My initial impression was, "Nice hotel and lobby, but I feel like I am in Vegas, not Maui". Especially after already spending 10 days previously at other locations with more hawaiian feel to them. * Waited in check-in line for 15 mins and was advised we were in a partial ocean view on 10th floor of ocean tower. Asked about our upgrade and was told it was not possible as hotel is fully booked. Asked her to show me where our room would be and was advised it was a side facing room looking out to the ocean. Room #1: * Went to our room and we were on the 10th floor looking out over the parking lot facing the hills. Was it partial ocean view? Sure, if you went out on the little deck, looked around to the right over the golf course and some other hotels, there about a mile away was the ocean down by the Hyatt. Same story as others have complained about with this hotel. Room #2: * Called the front desk and asked for a manager. A very helpful lady did find us a room on the 4th floor facing inward. However, the room directly faced a very large tree. But we did have a nice little sliver of ocean view between the tree and the other tower. Ahh, $420 a night well spent in paradise! * Each morning and evening around sunset we also were able to have an interesting experience with the local wildlife. What sounded like hundreds of birds would swoop into the big tree and have a little party. While extremely annoying, it was kind of an interesting phenomenon. Pool: * The pool is probably the best thing about this hotel. It is fabulous and winds around the tropical grounds. Despite our challenges, we still enjoyed lounging around the adult pool every day. Ask what the drink special of the day is and you can save $3-$4 off the regular price. Service around the pool was always very good. * It can be challenging to find space at the pool, especially the locations with umbrellas or close to the pool. You just have to be patient and keep working your way closer as spots open up. This can take some time though as there are typically lots of great spots just sitting there idle as people have reserved them with towels. This is not allowed, but there is no enforcement, so it happens pretty regularly. Spa Services: * Wife enjoyed a very nice massage at an outdoor setup near the pool. Rates were reasonable and she also was able to enjoy the spa inside after for awhile. Parking: * After reading prior reviews, I was expecting some very tiny parking spots. However, it wasn't too bad. Yes spots are tight, but if you back in, it is not too tough to get in there. * Finding a space is another thing though as they go very quickly (as early as the aftenoon). But they will valet for free when this happens. * It's also very easy to get blocked in as the valets will double park behind you. I had a tee time one morning for 7 up at kapalua and let them know in advance I would be leaving my spot # early and didn't want to be blocked. I was assured it would be no problem, but sure enough I wen't out there and was blocked in. Not a big deal, but i had to waste 10 minutes or so trying to get them to move the car in my way. Breakfast: * Buffet is a nice to have if it comes as part of your package. Lots of variety and a great omelette station. But I wouldn't want to pay the $33 per person or whatever the ridiculous amount is. We stayed at the Hotel Wailea earlier in our trip and missed the simple continental breakfast they offered. Conclusion: * We still had a good time and enjoyed the pool, but we won't be returning to the Westin. We were concerned by some of the poor experiences expressed by other reviewers and unfortunately we also had similar problems. * While management did try to resolve our room issue, in the end we did not receive what we were promised. This is especially annoying given I expressed this concern when booking and was assured it would not be an issue. * I cannot recommend this hotel as there are simply better values out there. ** Check out my other reviews for Hotel Wailea and Fairmont Kea Lani for comparatives.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: utbeef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on two separate occaisions. The first time here was in 2005, and again in February 2009. We absolutely love the resort's location, amenities, pools, restaurants, and super friendly staff. The only problem (and I consider it a huge one), came after our third night there. We awoke that morning, and I noticed something scurrying across our mattress. I got up and switched on the lights while my wife kept her eyes on it. I had seen news programs that spoke about the growing problem of bed bugs in the hotel industry, and I immediately suspected the worse. I then grabbed a Ziploc bag, and corralled the bug into it. I took the bug with me downstairs to the lobby. I feared that if I simply showed management the bug, they'd try to argue that it was not a bed bug. So instead, I went to the hotel's computer room, and googled bed bugs. I printed the photos of bed bugs which totally matched the one in my Ziploc. I then spoke to management while showing them our bug. To my surprise, they did not act defensively about it. They acknowledged that bed bugs are a growing problem, and their hotel was not immune. They agreed to launder all of our clothing, and moved us to an upgraded room. I don't know of anything else they could have done, however I suffered insomnia for the remainder of our stay. Every time I would lie down at night, I constantly felt like something was crawling on my skin. I know my mind was playing tricks on me, but considering the circumstances, it is understandable. After leaving Maui, we went to the big island and stayed at the Royal Kona resort; which was a separate nightmare in its own right. Thanks to our uninvited roommates at the Westin Kaanapali Resort, I can no longer stay in hotel beds without the thought of bed bugs racing thru my thoughts. I would still recommend this hotel to someone due to the fact that I realize some things are out of their control. Before this incident, this resort was one of our all-time favorite places to stay. My wishes for those reading this is for you to enjoy this place in paradise as much as we did before.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort whose flaws are not enough to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rodi2008
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is one of Starwood's better properties, clearly a cut above the Sheraton and Hyatt. Having said that, yes, there are some annoying flaws. But rather than turn a 5 star review into a negative tirade, I would rather mention them all later in the review and focus on the what makes this an excellent resort. Let me say right up front that the best value is clearly using Costco vacations. Buffet breakfast, rental car and an upgrade to the next class of room is included and you will not want to pay extra for any of that as Hawaii is already insanely overpriced (well, it is still America after all). 7 nights in mid October on the 5th floor of the nicer (ocean view) wing ran us about $2450 (more on the rooms to follow) Although the brochures claim an abundance of activities on Maui, should you choose to get your money's worth out of the resort, there is little need to spend more than a day or two away from the area. There's an awesome paved path that runs from one end of the resort area to the other. The beach itself is uncrowded since most people opt for the pool area for their relaxation . For easy snorkeling and very personal encounters with large sea turtles, you can walk 5 minutes to Black Rock Beach located by the cliffs opposite the Sheraton. The picturesque (albeit touristy) town of Lahinna can be reached by shuttle all day or by an easy 7 minute drive. Lahainna features some excellent but pricey restaurants with spectacular oceanside sunset seating, a lot of art galleries and jewelry stores and a banyan tree like you've never seen before. Possibly worth a trip, but all your shopping and food needs can be had right next door at the Whalers Village Shopping Complex. (fast food at the food court is the only inexpensive option-if you want cheap, vacation somewhere else or hit Costco and stock up as soon as you get out of the airport). Although the "5 star" resorts are located on the snobby south side of the island next to the gated communities and Rodeo Drive style shops, Kaanapali Beach is easily the nicest stretch of beachfront property on the island. The hotel grounds are beautiful and feature 5 separate pools, including an adults only area which makes this hotel an excellent choice for both couples and families. Not once during our stay was there a shortage of chaises (Keep in mind we were here in October but the hotel was still full due to the 10-10-10 weddings). There is a beach bar with typically overpriced but good drinks and they constantly come around to all pool areas taking food and drink orders. Be warned; the relaxation factor can add up. The down side would be the ridiculously small 7 person Jacuzzi where you will find the younger couples huddled every night discussing how they packed every possible minute of the trip with activities. A fun place to spend the last hour of the evening. The facilities include a very beautiful spa (we didn't get a treatment so can't comment on it-prices are typically expensive) and a spacious gym with more than ample exercise equipment (We don't do that on vacation otherwise it wouldn't be called vacation). There are 3 loud parrots, some koi and a very lonely but adorable black swan that are resident pets. The buffet breakfast is served in the restaurant next to the pools and you are given the opportunity to eat at Tropica, the restaurant overlooking the ocean, if there is space. Coffee is typically weak; bring Starbucks Via's from home or pay 5 bucks for "Kona Blend" at the kiosk. More on specifics: ROOMS: We had the whole family together but they all opted for either pool facing (garden view)or parking lot facing rooms due to cost issues.There is an enormous comfort difference. The ocean view rooms are 450 sq feet with large double sink bathrooms and enough room to fell like home for a week. The showers have double heads and they provide 2 free bottled waters every day as well as extra small touches like double Starbucks style cups for the average but adequate Kona coffee that is brought to the room every day. Furnishings are contemporary and modern with nice Hawaiian pictures, a full size desk, couch and balcony with an idyllic view (see pictures). Go out at sunrise and enjoy the birds. Only downside: ocean view rooms face Whalers Village and you will hear delivery trucks in the overnight and early AM; however, the soundproof factor is excellent- we heard zero neighbor noise from next door, outside or above with the balcony door closed. Apparently, you can cut some of the resort fee by requesting every other day maid service but we don't stay at hotels to come back to a smelly unkempt mess. Beds are VERY comfortable, but pillows could be firmer. LG flat screen TV's are excellent; safe size is big enough for large laptops; Wi-Fi connection is average speed and you need to log on each time, kind of annoying. But for the rip-off resort fee, you should try to get something out of it. We visited the parents rooms- smaller rooms are tasteful ,but too claustrophobic for me; feels like a Super 8 that charges Plaza Hotel rates. PARKING: Is a disaster and the worst part of the resort-Small self-park lot with room for about 20% of hotel capacity. When there are no spots, (almost always) you give it to the valet. They claim it's free, but CHECK YOUR FOLIO BEFORE checking out- We were charged $14 a day but they reversed the chagres with no problem. They should invest in an expansion-the frustration is ridiculous after a long day of island hopping. SERVICE: All staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly; much different than Kauai; mostly white staff that seem to work to a higher standard than other islands. They do give you a "free gift" (tote bag) and try to interest you in standard timeshare crap but unlike Mexican all-inclusives, it's not mandatory to attend any sessions. Just ignore it. An additional unknown charge on our bill was removed promptly and request for coffee, pillows etc immediately acknowledged. BUFFET BREAKFAST & DINING OPTIONS: Buffet is good but nothing spectacular; paying for it individually every day would be insane (almost 30 bucks per person). Standard fare of eggs, pastries, French toast/waffles, cereal, fruit (could be better considering it's Hawaii) and bacon/sausage/hash brwons (all greasy and tasteless). Omelet station and fresh smoked salmon are the standouts. Didn't eat at hotel restaurants but prices are typically overpriced. If you get the Costco package, your vouchers allow you to eat at any of 5 different resorts. DO NOT TRY THE SHERATON-the difference is night and day and it shows-their staff is overweight and barely speaks English, the food is cold and stale, you wait almost 15 minutes and the clientele that stays at the hotel is clearly a social class below the Westin crowd. Dinner choices: We ate at Roy's, 5 minutes north of resort; excellent but expensive- also ate at Cane and Taro's in Whaler's Village- hint: 20% off entree if you order before 6 PM (but then they tack on 18% tip which is more than they deserve for the good but unspectacular service) Excellent fresh fish through all the pricey restaurants. Make reservations for any trendy place after 5:30. We also tried Hula Grill, pan-Asian -2 minutes away -with entire family. Again, excellent macadamia crusted fish but expect to pay almost $80 for 2 if you have alcohol and appetizer. Same goes for most Lahiana restaurants-try Aloha Mixed Plate for basic but average island fare ("plate lunch" which means a bit of the cheapest cut of pork or ribs, 2 scoops of white rice and an island delicacy known as "mac-potato salad"- at least it's cheap) EXCURSIONS: Try Gemini Charters; they leave right from the pool area-We did a sunset cruise with snacks-better than most, food is catered from the Westin the staff is very attentive. Day snorkel and fishing trips are very pricey and that's why I liked Kauai better for self day-tripping. Refused to get up at 2 AM to see the sunrise on Haleakala but highly recommend a drive to the summit-takes about 90 minutes and well worth it. Didn't see the need to drive to Hana when paying so much for the resort and will take an entire 12 hours to do properly. Skip the Kona Botanical Gardens, they charge $10 and my back yard is nicer. Other choices include a Sugar Museum, Plantation Tour and local Winery, none of which struck me as spectacular. I beg to differ with the brochures that rave about how many great things there are to do other than the beauty of the resort area. I tried Zip lining- $187.50 per person for EXACTLY 4 1/2 minutes. The other 3 plus hours are spent carrying your line, watching others come down and chatting with the guides about how they love Hawaii but all have to work 3 jobs to live there. Fun but IMHO, an absolute waste of money Instead, do it in Costa Rica or Panama for $40. Drove one day to "Big Beach" on the south part of the island. Touted as one of the nicest, this beach is nothing spectacular and looks like any California coast beach. Drive to the end of the road and take an awesome short hike on lava rocks instead (about an hour from the resort). Maui roads are very well paved and drivers are not like in Maine (or Kauai)- they drive the limit or faster. Wind is absoultely unbearable in the central part of the island so don't be discouraged when you get off the plane. Some days are better than others. We had 2 windstorm but warm days followed by 5 perfect 82 degree days and no rain. RESORT FEE: Absolute BS but every major chain hotel now charges it. Feels like robbery and you get absolutely nothing; Wi-fi is free at most Best Westerns, parking is a joke anyway and those that use the gym on vacation, well, all the power to ya. $25 a day PLUS tax; only good part: Hawaii state tax is low at under 5%. But not worth looking elsewhere because they all do it now. LUAU: Although usually cheesy, "Drums of the Pacific" nightly at the Hyatt, was very entertaining; only a 7 minute walk. Food is better than expected- typical fare of salads, kalua pork, fish and chicken. For an extra 10 or 12 bucks, you can opt for "Preferred Seating" which means you go in after the "VIP Seating", (which is a total rip-off and all you get is to be 3 feet closer to the stage and eat 5 minutes sooner for 12 bucks more). Professional production company makes the show kind of like Cirque DuSoleil for the Islands. The fire-juggling will entice the kids and everyone had a good time; watered down drinks suck (of course) but are included for the approximate 90 dollar cost so go crazy. 3 of the other options are the same company anyway so I recommend this one. SUMMARY: Only the "W" chain ranks higher than Westin on Starwood's hierarchy. At this Westin, you get the extra 1/2 star without having to stay at the most expensive resort on the island. Overall, an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need a face lift”
Reviews.Author: lawman007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for honeymoon and experience was ok. Starting with the positive. Great location near shops and surrounding area. Pool and beach great. Ambeiance good. Bad-food very overpriced for quality. To be honest some of the food was gross. Everytime you ask a concierge for information they tried to sell you into a ti e share presentation, very annoying ! Room needs updating. Unknown kinda stains found on lamp shade. A/c made room damp and put off a mildew smell. Room was often not cleaned, only bed made. Had to call front desk to have room cleaned. Over all ok place but next time I'll save more and stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ilovecupcakes2010
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel in a beautiful location. the beach was nice. the restaurants within the hotel were great. very relaxing atmosphere. will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel environment, but parking was pathetic”
Reviews.Author: CPharm
Reviews.Content: The resort was in an excellent location in Maui. The entire hotel had beautiful environment. However, the $25 per night resort fee plus tax was a rip off, which included internet only as WiFi connection, otherwise they charged $10 per 30 minutes to use their computers. The air conditioning in room was not functioning properly and had to be reset as it kept shutting down. There was a bee in the room and complained to woman in reception, she replied "this is tropical place and should be expected." The worst part about it was the parking, the spots were very close together and if you were out past 9 pm you were out of luck and your car was parked by valet parking behind the other cars in lot. Therefore, you have expense each time to tip valet attendants. The parking lot is too small for the number of guests as October is the low season!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon paradise”
Reviews.Author: jhefele
Reviews.Content: The Westin was one of a string of high-end hotels along the shore. There were 5 pools all beautifully landscaped. Bordering the pools was the beautiful beach. The rooms were clean and bright, the staff all friendly and helpful. Since the hotels were all connected by a beach-walk it made it very easy to dine at a different hotel each night Although the food was delicious, it was a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: travelyankee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location. Beautiful grounds. But way overpriced. 30 bucks per person for breakfast buffet, 25 bucks to get an umbrella and 2 chairs on the beach, 10 bucks for a watered down Mai Tai. We'd been here before, and knew that we'd get ripped off with all the "incidentals", including a mandatory 25 dollar resort fee for "free internet", a "free" local paper, and the shuttle between here and Lahaina, which we've used once, but were amazed this time over how we felt ripped off. This is also probably one of the loudest hotels I've ever stayed at, there is no sound proofing between the rooms, which is why the first thing I ask for is a fan to be brought up to our room to act as a "noise maker" . The rooms are getting dated, showing their age. However the beds are very comfortable. We've been coming to Ka'anapoli for over 25 years, and will probably stay at the newly renovated Sheraton our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, very relaxing, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: rblw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights with our 7 year old. We had a great time and only left the resort a couple of times for dinner. Accommodation was clean and room spacious. We requested a rollaway bed prior to arriving and this was provided free of charge. Great gym and spa treatments. Great food options for lunch and dinner within hotel and also next door at Whaler's Village. The only thing we couldn't find was good coffee! Concierge team were friendly and helpful. We will definitley be back.

Reviews.Title: “Located on the best side of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Petgill
Reviews.Content: Sunsets are amazing from this resort. After having driven much of the island (which I highly recommend), we all much preferred the beach in Kaanapali. Had great wide beaches, boardwalks to walk along, and Black rock to snorkel at. The Westin was great as usual but the staff was amazing. Always went that extra to ensure our trip went smoothly ie directions with helpful tips. Great shopping in nearby Lahaina. Shuttle to Lahaina came in handy when some of us wanted to go shopping while some of us wanted to go for a ride. Someone even proposed through a message from the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Grounds/Pools, Good Room .. almost ideal”
Reviews.Author: TmanSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Westin Maui resort on Kaanapali Beach. The hotel is very impressive, from the entrance and foyer with waterfall and live flamingoes, to the 4 swimming pools and water slide. Plus the beach is right out the front of the resort. We stayed in the tower that is closer and sideways to the beach in the second highest floor facing the pools, fantastic view (see photos). The room was large and well appointed nice bathroom and twin head shower. The kids slept on the sofa bed which is OK for young kids, but not good enough for adults. It is worth noting that the room is looking old in some areas; the carpet is a bit stained and baggy, and the sofa bed had a few stains. Not as good as a hotel of this class should have. The location is really unmatched, nicely in the middle of the beach and only a 5min walk to the 'blackrock'. This is honestly one of the highlights. Blackrock is a rocky point that goes out to see in front of the Sheraton and the snorkelling around it is excellent, we saw a turtle there which was amazing. We had breakfast included, and the buffet was very good. However the bottom line is that this is an expensive hotel. We got the 4th night free but at it is still is very expensive, plus they charge a resort fee of $25 per day, taxes etc, you can add another $80+ per day If you don't care about the price, it's very hard to beat ... unfortunately the room age will be frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service but beware of these problems...”
Reviews.Author: ViaggioUSA1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here between 2 Oct - 9 Oct 2010 for our 10th Anniversary along with our 7 year old boy. The pool, waterfalls, ponds, streams, and ground floor facilities are impeccable and the customer service here is top notch. The pool/beach services tent folks are very friendly. The coffee shop is well stocked and open 5:30 am - 3:30 pm. And the best part of the Westin was the Signature beds -- there's nothing like sleeping in their beds. Unfortunately, there are a few significant problems: -- the Tropica Restaurant food: we ate there one evening and all three of our dishes were, without exaggerating, awful. My lamb was way overcooked, my wife's pasta was bland, and the Lobster Chowder was the quality and consistency of canned tomato soup. We eat out alot and have been around -- the Tropica was seriously the pits and what made it worse was we paid over $100 for the meal. I recommend avoiding this restaurant -- it's sorely in need of a new chef. The sad fact is that our anniversary dinner at Ruths' Chris Steakhouse in Lahaina was both cheaper (ironically) and magnitudes better than our experience at the Tropica. -- the rooms and the main tower facility is looking a bit tired and dated -- there was grime in the bathroom tile (I stayed at the Sheraton Maui this week as well and it was meticulous compared to the Westin). -- the room service charges are usury. I'm used to room service charges, but the Westin was outrageous. A 20% gratuity auto-added to the bill in addition to a $7 delivery charge. Even the smallest room service order (a dessert for one or two) can't be had for less than $40 and a dinner for one is on average over $65. Very nice place and superb staff (hence I will recommend it), but there are issues to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “It is beautiful, but dont be a mainlander!”
Reviews.Author: johnnydell
Reviews.Content: This trip was a christmas gift to my family from me, so the expectations were high. However, when we first arrived, it felt as if we were not welcome. Information was not forth coming, and we spent the entire week trying to discover things that the island had to offer. It always felt as if we just missed an event that we had no idea was going on. If you wanted to do something, it felt as though you had to book it before you were in Hawaii. The resturants within the resort were overpriced and unfriendly. We had to always ask for our room to be cleaned, and many times we were stepped over to cater to someone of Japanese decent. I will come back to Hawaii but not to the Westin Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the beauty of Maui without the need of a rental car!”
Reviews.Author: M0mmyOfThree
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise that we plan on re-visiting in years to come. The rooms are very clean with uuber-comfortable beds. The grounds are amazing with flamingos, swans, parrots and loads of fish the kiddos can feed every morning. The pools are family friendly and the waterslide was a huge hit. Plus you are steps from the beautiful ocean and plenty of shopping next door at Whaler's Village. And when you tire of that you can get away to the relaxing spa. This was a great place and we can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Bali East, open air lobby, waterfall and vegetation-reminds me of Bali”
Reviews.Author: RVMillman
Reviews.Content: Pretty, clean and soothing to the eyes, relaxation abounds. Breakfast buffet is excellent, along with the adult pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven Service”
Reviews.Author: fv007
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful. The level of service and friendliness of staff was inconsistent throughout our stay, however. It was not necessary for the pool staff to insist that my 12 and 16 yr old boys could not stay in the "adult" pool with me. We were not making a sound, and there was NO ONE else in the pool. -There is only one hot tub. It is located in the adult pool area. The pool staff will eject your kids, even if they are with an adult. -Janet, at the Starbucks counter was downright NASTY. -Registration staff could be more welcoming upon arrival. -i didn't appreciate the threatening signs at the pool counter (IF YOU DO NOT RETURN ALL TOWELS BY 4:00 YOU WILL BE CHARGED A FEE) Can't they say "Your cooperation in returning beach towels is greatly appreciated" ? I don't like being harassed (pool staff at adult pool), scolded and threatened (beach towel signs), and blatantly ignored (Starbucks- Janet) when I am paying to stay at a resort to relax. I can go elsewhere, thank you very much. Positive- The Westin Luau was well worth it. The crowd was only 150 people, 8-10 at a table. The food and drinks were very good. The Fitness Center was open 24 hrs- and very clean. Overall, the hotel staff does not appear properly trained The friendly, welcoming, relaxed, island atmosphere that you expect, was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “felt like being in heaven”
Reviews.Author: poupeeNorthridge_Ca
Reviews.Content: We took full use of the resort. We didn't do any tours or anything. The resort is fantastic, it was a family vacation, my mother, sister, mother in law, husband and 4 year old son. The rooms were fantastic and everyone there is soooo nice. From the maids to the waiters to the cabana people. It was relaxing everyday. We got a great ocean front view, really fantastic. Woke up each day, got umbrellas and chairs for the beach set up, when back and forth to the pool for the slides for my son who had a blast. Had breakfast each morning, we to the breakfast buffet included. For lunch we'd usually order at the bar and eat on the beach. Then for dinner we'd walk over to whaler's village or took a short 10 minute drive to Lahaina. We did this everyday and it felt like a real vacation. Everyone who works at the resort is supernice and super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - one of the best in Maui”
Reviews.Author: swegs
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat the value vs the quality of the overall experience. In my mind, the pool is second only to the Grand Wailea but I struggle with paying the premium for the difference. Overall, one of the better places to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Concierge”
Reviews.Author: nihaomomma
Reviews.Content: We experienced top notch service and care from Sarah Craig at The Westin Maui Resort and Spa. We had a question and she clearly went above and beyond to help us find the answer. We wish that all our experiences with concierge's were as friendly and helpful as Sarah.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Rooms Need Renovating”
Reviews.Author: travelmasterhi
Reviews.Content: This was our favorite place to stay on Maui. Unfortunately, they have deferred the proper maintenance of this property and the rooms show it. Everyday of our stay something needed to be fixed. One afternoon we retuned to shower and found that they had removed our showerhead and not replaced it. Another afternoon we returned and they had fixed one thing and broken another. It was incredibly frustrating and we got tired of hearing how sorry they were. And, we got tired of waiting for the â€œengineerâ€� to fix the broken items when we would have rather been relaxing. The room had a horrible smell to it and it never felt clean. The bed linens were dirty, the mattress pad had hair on it, and the mattress had stains on it. Room Service leftovers would stay in the hallway all day long until I would finally get disgusted and call to ask for removal (it was not from our room). The Internet never worked properly in our room and we were â€œhandedâ€� a router to use that barely received a signal after 4 hours and 2 calls for assistance. We really hope that the Westin addresses the deferred maintenance in the rooms, as we would like to return in the future. Itâ€™s a great location with fantastic pools (but COLD) and good employees that are trying to please guests when they encounter numerous problems.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: amospurs
