Reviews.Content: had a great time here at the westin. no real complaints. the rooms could be a bit more spacious with famil and it would be nicer to have larger pool. but i would be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on westin--substandard brand representation”
Reviews.Author: tw0thirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early October for two nights in the ocean tower with a full ocean view. Even though the room was free using SPG points, my wife and I still feel ripped off. The few positives include: - easy access to lahaina with free shuttle access. The shuttle driver is one of the few employees that actually provided good service - next door to whalers village. We love the poke tacos at hula grill! Everything else about the hotel was a disappointment including: - paper thin walls. I could hear the neighbor snoring all night - the hotel is very understaffed. It took 15+ minutes to buy a cup of coffee, we did not get a lei greeting upon arrival, and the front desk would take over a minute to answer the phone - the rooms are small, dirty and in disrepair. Stains are all over the room, our balcony table was cracked, the bed resembled a canoe and the ac constantly cycles on and off every minute. - poor treatment for spg members. This is the first westin that has denied a late checkout request even though it is one of our gold benefits. In summary, if you are used to a high quality westin experience stay away less you will be disappointed. . -

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Mats13
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! First room we were told that had a good view was very very small. We ended up taking the free upgrade through my gold points to another building. Much bigger rooms and nice views!! Amazing buffet breakfast!! Nice staff. Great pool and fun waterslide. Great beachfront except for all of the cigarettes butts on the beach (the hotel has a no smoking policy which is nice but they should have some ashtrays or something for the smokers.) Can't go wrong with any of the restaurants surrounding the hotel. A little pricey but really great views and amazing food! We had a wonderful vacation. The only little black spot was my purchase at Maui Rainbows in Whalers Village. I bought a ring for $52.00 (the clerk said it was a half price sale). I know..gullable! I found it in Lahaina (sp) at 2 different places for $18.00. When I returned to Maui Rainbows the sweet person I bought from turned mean very quickly. She said only in store exchanges and the reason they overcharge so much is because they need to pay $30,000 in rent a month. Turned her back to us and started to windex the counter. I told her I would be telling people about my experience and she responded with "who cares"! They have pretty things but are sooooo overpriced!!!! Lesson learned for me I guess. Other than this little blemish it was a fabulous hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location...mediocre service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdventurist
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay and had a room on a top floor facing the pools and ocean...a million dollar view!! Here are the pros and cons of this hotel: Pros: -Location, location, location! It's right in the middle of the major resorts and has a good size beach front. We walked past the Marriott and Hyatt where the beach was almost non-existent. -It's next to Whaler's Village shopping center which has 3 restaurants and a tiny food court for those who don't want to eat only at the hotel. (Avoid Cane & Taro, overpriced and the food wasn't even tasty). We didn't have a car and were glad not to have rented one. -The outdoor space is well maintained (lobby, pool area, and restaurant). -Great breakfast buffet if included in your hotel package, otherwise it's way overpriced at around $27 per person. Cons: -The rooms need renovating already (I believe it was last renovated in 2007) and are the tiniest rooms I've seen. -Horrible musty/stale smell when you walk into the room due to the a/c. We actually thought the room was a smoking room. -The tub has a slow drain...better call engineering right away. -Service was spotty from completely indifferent (front desk) to helpful (some of the restaurant servers). -The front desk needs an attitude adjustment, it's as if you're bothering them when you go there. They're definitely lacking customer service skills. They have one person dedicated to the Japanese tourists who refused to wait on the person in front of me (even though there was 3 of us in line and only 1 other receptionist). When another receptionist finally showed up, she looked irritated that we asked for another person to come out. -Concierges were only interested in getting you to go see their time share since that must be where their biggest commissions come from. -$25 daily resort fee covers beach towels, internet and only 2 (yes that's right, 2) average sized bottles of water per day. Overall, I would still stay here again for the pool, beach and location. However, for the price, it's sad that service isn't one of the reasons for staying here.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jlhut8
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maui for the Maui invite and stayed here. This hotel was amazing! Amazing accomodations, view, and service. I highly recommend it and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SB_maui
Reviews.Content: Waterfalls, flamingos, parrots, fish, swans and numerous pools contribute to the ambience of this hotel. The rooms are clean and the bed is comfortable. We come back every year and the staff are friendly; making us feel like we are coming back home. If there are ever any problems, they are taken care of immediately. If you are lucky, you will be greeted by Jasmine Orini, who always made us feel welcome and appreciated for staying at the hotel. Jasmine demonstrated the aloha spirit and is an example of how everyone should treat other people. We also had excellent maid service by Leonora. Everyday she greeted us with a smile in the morning and did an excellent job cleaning the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience: I would never stay at any other Maui hotel”
Reviews.Author: leahfree
Reviews.Content: I came to Maui to run the 2010 marathon and chose this hotel, which was rather pricey. I got a free upgrade to the Premium Delux Ocean View Room through using my American Express Points. Joven at the front desk was great in helping me choose just the right room that faced directly toward the ocean. It was perfect except I wasn't able to get a King Bed. But the two Queen Beds worked fine. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. The ocean front is readily accessible through the hotel gardens, pool areas, restaurants etc. I was there during an off season and there were very few children. The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. I got several spa services over a two day period and the spa was clean, with all the amentities and the staff were great. The beach area is pristine and there's a lot to do in the area. Shopping at Whalers Village and Front Street in Lahaina was fine for my needs. The restaurants at the hotel, along the board walk and in Lahainai were great. What else can I say? I loved, loved, loved this place. I hope to return to Maui and if I do, I won't even bother to investigate other hotels. I will save my money and stay at the Westin. It was very pricey and that is the biggest downside, but I had a ton of AmEx points so I didn't have to come out of my pocket for most of it. Nevertheless, whatever the cost in the future, I'll stay here again. Believe me, it is worth it. As a female traveling alone I felt very comfortable at the Westin. I hadn't been a member of the Starwood Program, but I was so impressed with the Westin that I joined during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AVOID this hotel, unless you enjoy hearing your neighbor snore”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiansherpa
Reviews.Content: There is no way this hotel deserves to carry the Westin name. First of all, the room descriptions are fraudulent. I reserved the partial ocean view room thinking we would have a decent view for our one of our honeymoon stays. Instead, we were stuck in a room facing the road with a balcony overlooking the parking lot. The only "ocean view" about it was a fraction of a glimpse of the water stuck between two buildings only after walking to the very edge of the balcony and straining your neck around a 90 degree turn. After complaining to the front desk, we were told that this was what they considered a partial ocean view, but after explaining what the term "fraud" meant, they promptly gave us another room. Problem solved? Not even close. The new room looked clean, but after we unpacked, we discovered that the toilet was completely soiled. Since we were so tired from moving around, we just called the front desk to clean the room again. When we got back to the room, we discovered the a/c had a hideous mildewy smell. That wasn't a problem, thanks to the fact that the thermostat broke after being on for only a few hours. Although the hotel engineer came in and fixed it, he said all the rooms have the same nasty smell from the a/c. We got another treat the next morning when we discovered the shower drain was nearly completely clogged. Standing in stagnant hotel drainage is nothing fun let me assure you. By far, however, the worst part of the stay was the paper thin walls. I am not kidding when I say you will hear every single conversation from both rooms next door. Thanks to the poor insulation and connecting room doors, we were up all night from crying kids on one side and obnoxious partiers on the other. When I complained to the front desk, all they said was to call again when it happens, and security would knock on their door. After explaining that one of the rooms was from a crying baby, she happily reported that they were checking out that day. What about the other side? Thanks alot. Overall, this was by far the worst experience we had of the 3 hotels we stayed at while on our honeymoon. The pool, shops, and restaurants in no way make up for the nightmare room experience. I would suggest any serious traveler avoid this hotel and go up the road to Kapalua. If you have to stay in Kaanapali, avoid this overpriced glorified holiday inn. Trust me, you will thank me later.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Maui Resort and Spa is Paradise as a result of how you are treated by the staff.”
Reviews.Author: HaleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Hawaii twice a year and we always stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa when visiting Maui. We were there 9/17-9/22/2010 and again, the staff make this our Paradise away from home. Grace DeFranco made our stay absolutely perfect in that she wanted to ensure we loved our room, the view, and that our stay was special!!! She always has a smile and makes every effort possible to make sure her guests are happy with their stay which really means a lot to guests like us who return year after year. Her ability to make us feel special is exceptional!! In all fo the years we have been going to the Westin, it is because of the staff, Amy Petersen and Grace DiFranco who have made it so special that we cannot think of staying anywhere else when visiting Maui . We have sent many friends and family to the Westin Maui who have had the same wonderful experience staying there as we have and it is the result of how they are treated by the staff. The Resort is perfectly located next to the Whalers Village, has wonderful pools to enjoy by the ocean, the Tropica Resturant and Ono Bar have fabulous food and the view from the Tropica is fantastic as well as the view from the hotel looking out to the water and the islands of Lani and Molokai. There are great golf courses and the town of Lahaina is within minutes of the resort. I highly recommend staying at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. It is not just the place you stay that makes it a nice experience, it is the Westin staff who make your stay!!! This Resort is exceptional and truly heavenly!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected for the money”
Reviews.Author: TheRodes
Reviews.Content: The rooms were outdated and just not as nice as we expected for a Westin and for what we paid. I would try another place if I went again. The lobby, pool, and beach were great though.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: meme13aby21
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went to Maui for our honeymoon. From the minute we walked into the resort we were blown away. You are greeted by waterfalls and an open air lobby. Within the lobby there are flamingos, koi fish, parrots and swans. Its amazing. The service was very good. We asked if there were any upgrades available and were upgraded to an ocean view room, free of charge. The room was always kept clean despite all the sand that must be tracked in. The pool and water slide area are def. one of the resorts selling points. The pool is immaculate and the water slide is awesome despite anyones age. The restaurants were ok, we found better and more affordable options elsewhere. The spa was very relaxing but expensive. You begin to just expect the high price tags everywhere though! Before we went we read a lot of negative reviews about parking. The parking was tight but we got a spot everynight except once. If the lot is full, they valet your car free of charge except for a tip. Honestly, I would recommend this resort to anyone. I had the most amazing time while in Maui. The only problem is that you have to leave to go home! I will def. stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Apiece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: jgzjkiwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in Oct 09 and are returning Oct 10. We were very happy with the property and the friendliness of the staff. When I mentioned it was my wife's birthday we returned to our room that afternoon to find a complimentary cake with some chocolates and a birthday card, thank you very much Gia Kaiwi. There was never a problem finding longers around the pool. The children were fascinated by the parrots and flamingos. Very handy to Whalers Village.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Pools, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla27
Reviews.Content: With its gorgeous ocean views, delicious food, and picturesque grounds, I would find it difficult to find many complaints about the Maui Westin. For me, the hotel's true highlight is its massive pool - complete with volleyball nets, waterfalls, and a giant waterslide. We had the fortune of visiting in May (before school is out) so the pool was relatively empty and there were always plenty of chairs. From the lush tropical vegetation to the flamingos lounging in the hotel lobby pond, the hotel grounds truly transported you to a picturesque getaway spot. The bathroom interior was perhaps a bit outdated, but otherwise our room was decently sized, clean, and had a gorgeous ocean view. The patios provided the perfect opportunity to kick off your shoes and enjoy the sunset and luau show below (which, I'm told, is one of Maui's best). My one main complaint was the service, which was at times spotty and indifferent. We encountered a few staff members who seemed bored or occasionally even irked by asking them questions or even to have our order taken at one restaurant. This does not apply to the whole staff, but I would mention that I seemed to encounter the annoyed-employee on more than one occasion. Service aside, the location is great, the pool fantastic, and the food good. Yes there's a $25 resort fee but the Westin doesn't nickel-and-dime you more than any of the other Maui hotels. Overall, we were very pleased with the Maui Westin and would definitely return on our next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and great hospitality!!!!”
Reviews.Author: csing74
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin Maui, and was greatly helped by one of the Front Desk Managers by the name of Giadee Kaiwi. She knew very well about the services and the accomodations that were available at this wonderful resort. She didn't hesitate to show us and guide us through the hotel and we were always greeted with a smile and left with a "Have a great day." I can not agree more with you if you gave her some sort of incentive for her awesome hospitality. I will not pick any other hotel to stay at when I visit Maui, because I enjoyed the hospitality that I have recieved and got to know from being assisted by Giadee Kaiwi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Full of Kids”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for 6 nights and then the Four Seasons Maui for one night. The Westin Maui is a very good hotel choice, but of course comes no where close to the luxury and experience of the Four Seasons. The best part of the hotel is its location next to Whaler's Village. Whaler's Village has many affordable food options. There are also good happy hours at the restaurants there and at the Westin. The beach by the Westin is also very nice. Unlike the beaches in South Maui, the water here is calm in the afternoon making it better for swimming. The Westin, like all of Maui is crowded. The chairs at the pool were always full, but you can usually find seats in the early morning or late afternoon. The worst part of the hotel is all of the kids. They are everywhere. If you want a romantic stay, this is not the place to stay. The lobby and the outside areas are really nice. Like other reviewers have said, the rooms are small. I couldn't imagine staying in a room that size with more than two people, but for us it was fine. If you want a room where you can relax for a good part of the vacation you may find the rooms too small.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic84
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui has a great open air lobby, beautiful koi pond with flamingos and swans, and an energetic, lively pool area. However the rooms left much to be desired. LIke other reviewers mentioned, the rooms are tiny and dated. The tile in the bathroom area was cracked and the furniture was scratched up and quite worn. If we weren't on our honeymoon and expecting a quiet, relaxing, luxurious retreat, we may have better enjoyed the Westin Maui and all it had to offer. We did enjoy the sunset dinners at Tropica several times! The bouillabaisse was amazing and the catch of the day never disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families on a First Trip to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: NEOGVM
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort last minute after I found a great deal online. It had been recommended by a family member due to it's location close to Whalers Village and Lahaina town which gave us better options for dining. First of all, the resort is old - I recommend staying in the Beach Tower, where the rooms are newer and larger. When we checked in, we found our initial room had not even been cleaned, so we had to wait 2 hours for another one. The manager said he "upgraded" us - basically our next room was a better view, same size, in the Beach Tower. We did receive shell lais upon our arrival, and the lobby area is beautiful with flamingos and waterfalls. Our kids, ages 15, 12, and 5, loved the pool and beach areas. Black Rock was quite close with good snorkeling. As others have said, you do need to claim a chaise by the pool early ( we fortunately could do this since we stayed on East coast time). We ate one meal at the poolside bar and grill which was ok and expensive. Most of the time, we dined next door at Whalers Village (Hula Grill or the food court which was perfect for kids). I recommend buying snacks,drinks, and sunscreen at Walmart near the airport prior to driving to the hotel. We also found a Whole Foods near the airport which had great sushi! Also, there is no need to rent or buy boogie boards, ice coolers, or beach chairs - we were able to get all these items at the bell desk from other families that had left them there! Also, rather than spending $10 per drink at the hotel, we bought liquor and wine in Whalers Village at the ABC store. The fitness area was quite standard, and I did not have any spa treatments. My sons enjoyed the surfing and scuba lessons offerred through the hotel. The Westin overall was good as a "home base" for a first trip to Hawaii - not meant for those looking for the luxury Maui resort. Next time we will book a resort in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Westin are you listening?”
Reviews.Author: funseekers88
Reviews.Content: What a shame the Westin is big, beautiful and in a such nice location but due to poor management of it's staffing it has no exclusive resort "feel" or "atmosphere". For instance, the view at the breakfast buffet is beautiful but the service is poor and the food is pretty much the same everyday (yawn) including watery juice. The rooms are average (we looked at 3) and a little run down, (stained furniture, dirty walls) they need to be spruced up again. The pool is lovely, not overly busy when we were there but every time the server at the pool came around she looked at me and said "you're ok right" - really? thank's but how about asking "can I get you anything?" like maybe a DRINK!!! - no drinks were purchased at this pool. The staff at the Westin's spa were indifferent when I went to preview the facility so I spent 5 hours and a lot of $ at the spa at the Ritz instead, (who by the way had no long appointments available so they brought in extra staff to accommodate my wishes - now that's great service!). The parking - THERE IS NOT ENOUGH and THE STALLS ARE TOO SMALL!!!! how many people have to point this out? Westin management seriously needs to improve the presence and quality of it's staffing to bring it up to the standard of excellence one expects from a Starwood property. My family will probably not stay here again and at this time would not recommend it to others, for about the same $$ I would recommend the Sheraton, Hyatt or better yet the Ritz Carleton instead. With so many lacklustre reviews on this web page I wonder... are you listening Westin?

Reviews.Title: “An incredible and memorable stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: anandswaminathan
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful time and it was made possible because of great service from all the staff members, the wonderful room, and the great help from each staff member. We absolutely will return to the Westin Maui for our next trip to Hawaii. In particular, my thanks to the staff who did an outstanding job taking care of us throughout our stay: â€¢ Giadee Kaiwi (guest relations manager) â€¢ Evelyn (Housekeeping)â€¦ and the other members of the housekeeping staff who serviced our room morning and evening â€¢ Bonnie and Katie for organizing a spectacular private dinner for us at the poolside cabana â€¢ Gloria and Yvonne at Concierge who were very helpful on multiple occasions â€¢ The bell desk staffâ€¦ they were always incredibly courteous and so helpful â€¢ The chef at Tropica who prepared great meals for us â€¢ The wait staff at Ono Grill who were always so patient with us given all the kids and mayhem â€¢ The laundry manager for accommodating our special request â€¢ And the front desk staff who were also very helpful Bottom line is that the Westin Maui provided us with amazing service and it really helped make our stay so very special. I appreciate everything you did for us as wellâ€¦ THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lvelez250
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2010 and i am still thinking about this hotel. everything was perfect, staff was super friendly and helpful, great food, beautiful rooms you name it. the only challenge we had was trying to get pool chairs, which i read from other travelers reviews was an issue also. The staff did their best of removing towels that had been left by other guests to "hold" chairs for hours but sometimes it was a bit disappointing to not be able to find a chair. The beach is amazing also, unfortunately you have to pay for chairs out there and there is a limited amount of chairs you can rent so you have to rent them in advance. Since our young daughter wanted to stay at the pool anyway we would just go back and forth to the ocean. The views from this hotel are breathtaking, i can still picture them in my head as i type this! Also, there are some activities right out on the beach such as banaba boat rides, parasailing and snorkeling cruises which is very convenient. You can also walk down to the Sheraton via a lovely boardwalk past some nice shops and have a cocktail, charge it back to your room and watch the cliff divers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on the beach; below average Westin”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two young children (8 and 5 years old) here over the Labor Day weekend. We have been to Maui 6 times in past 7 years, usually staying in Wailea. We picked the Westin in Ka'anapali primarily because it is a Starwood property and I used SPG rewards to book the room. Overall, this is a a slightly below average Westin. It has above average common areas, the pool area and the location. It is mostly below average on service, more like a Sheraton than a Westin. First the positives: 1. Good location in the middle of Ka'anapali that is next door (walking distance) to the Whaler's Village shopping center, with a complimentary shuttle to local shopping and the other Starwood properties in the area. 2. The pool area with multiple rocks and waterfalls is impressive, with 4 or 5 interconnected pools and a water slide for the kids. Its not as impressive as the Hyatt or the Grand Wailea, but its a highlight especially for children. There is also a koi pond with probably the biggest well-fed koi fish I have ever seen (some of these fish are scary large) -- every morning they hand out fish food to the kids to feed the fish, which is a hit. 3. The O'no restaurant next to the pool is convenient and serves decent food, including the option of smaller dishes. The pork sliders are very good. 4. Nice boardwalk along the beach that extends in both directions. 5. Pool side chairs were not difficult to get.at most times throughout the day. 6. The small refrigerator in the unit (one of those personal sized refrigerators that you see in college dorms) is convenient for storing left overs. Now, the negatives: 1. Checkin left a lot to be desired. When I arrived at 2:15 pm, there were 16-20 people in front of me in line, which was at least a 20 minute wait, and rather ridiculous. They need to add more checkin help when the line gets long. Also, when I asked at checkin whether any upgrades were available, as I am an SPG elite, she responded that I would have to wait until 3 pm to get upgraded (it was 2:45 pm at time!). Are you kidding me? I was not going to go back into that long line. This is the type of thing they would take care of at most Westins I have been to. 2. The rooms are comfortable but small for a Westin. The bathrooms are tiny. 3. I tried to reserve a beach umbrella and chair as soon as I checked in. I was told none were available and I could be put on a "wait list." It turns out they only have 14 umbrellas available for the entire hotel. This falls within the "what in the world are they thinking?" category. This is supposed to be a beach resort, and there is plenty of space on the beach, why not offer more umbrellas? Its pretty unbelievable. The staff at the towel desk was pretty unhelpful the entire time: They will not call you if a space opens up, you have to keep calling down there to check if anything opens up. I never got off the "wait list" during my entire stay. This was probably the single worst part of my experience as we traveled several thousand miles to come to a "beach resort" that does not even offer sufficient beach chairs and umbrellas to its guests. 4. The self parking lot is packed and too small for the number of guests, and the parking spaces themselves are all compact-sized, so if you have a typical mid-size rental car, you will have a difficult time parking if you can get a spot in the first place. To the hotel's credit, the valet offered to park out car for "free" because the lot was full (I say "free" because you actually pay $25 a day for parking when you are charged for the resort fee). 5. The high speed internet is very very slow. 6. The pool itself is not heated very warmly. During the afternoon, the beach water was actually warmer than the pool. Also, there is no jacuzzi area open for families. 7. At the beach, there is a very steep drop off only 15 feet or so out from the edge of the water, which is much different than Wailea. Its also windier than Wailea. We also took the Westin shuttle one night to have dinner a Pulehu, which is located at the Westin Ocean Villas (a timeshare property). That dinner was a highlight - good food and decent wine list.

Reviews.Title: “â€œVery dissapointing hotel - Avoid itâ€�”
Reviews.Author: JoeMetry
Reviews.Content: This is a great disappointing hotel that don't even care about their guests properly. Why do people go to Maui? to enjoy Maui's fabulous nature? if so, then you're making the wrong choice to stay in a resort in the first place because what you can see at these places is artificial beauty. The real beauty in Maui is in the south of this fabulous island on the way to Hana and beyond. So, why I have stayed in such expensive supposedly one of the best resorts over there on my honeymoon? Nothing more than to be indulged and feel the luxurious peace of mind. Simply, I didn't feel any of these for the following reasons: - Over priced compared to the service you receive (not a value of money at all) - Their service level cannot be categorized as luxurious, but fairly acceptable. - You may have paid a lot of money to stay at this hotel or even paid the triple the price to have an ocean front like I did to enjoy the sunset during my honeymoon stay but don't expect too much. You just paid for your bed and the use of the lift to your room. Everything else has to be paid as extra (same concept as cheap rated hotels). Even for any service that you pay for, there are two categories, the cheap and the expensive one. High class luxurious hotels never charge you extra or categories their services because they assume delivering the best service ever which is not the case in this poor hotel. - The hotel fees that you'll be charged for are nothing more than just using you and trying to milk your pocket. - I was really astonished after traveling 30 hours from my homeland to this resort to stay by the sunset and the beach to still need and paying the most expensive package available at that time, that I still need to pay extra for my shade on the beach!!! ... This is just ridicules. Add this to the bad behavior of the beach chairs' attendant, even after escalation to the management, you receive nothing but simply s**t treatment. I don't know what is the difference between accessing a public beach which normally have have chairs and tables for the public for free and this $475 room per night resort's beach? guess what? you still need to pay an extra $55 for your shade and chair :)). - $25 hotel feel per room per night! For what?? To have high speed internet access in your room, park your car, free bag, free photograph per couple per stay. As if any single star hotel anywhere in the US doesn't provide all these services already for free. This is what you really get. VERY VERY VERY slow free internet access in your room that get's you bored while you're supposed to spend this valuable time at the beach or enjoying the island or simply relaxing! If you want to have a high the real high speed internet you have to pay $10 per day!! ... so why the hell I am paying those $25 hotel feels in the first place??? ... You're allowed to self park your car for free in the self park area where the market car lots are not sufficient for any mid size car to fit it. Even if fits, you can't open the car doors without hitting the car next to you. expect the same to be done to your own car as well. Don't want to risk scratching your car? then valet park it for $15 per day! .. wow .... did I mention that you're entitled for a free photograph??? Guess what, you're entitled just to see this photograph on the computer screen but you have to pay for the print out :))) ... yeah, you've started hitting my ba**ls hard baby :) ... Where is my free bag that was included in the $25 hotel fees??? You'll find a plastic bag (can be used for your garbage) in your room. Although you pay for these $25 hotel fees daily but you'll receive this garbage bag once per stay. - Basic requirements like bath scale, bath slippers .. etc has to be ordered from the room service. exactly like any other cheap hotel. Thank God that I have planed my honeymoon on 3 parts ... I have enjoyed the other 2 plus Maui as an Island. My next visit will not be in a hotel. Or I will choose the cheapest as not to have high expectations that I wont get anyway. By the way escalation process of management is very poor, bear the staff as they have nothing to do with the hotel policies. They hear these bad words everyday from a lot of people like me and you'll do. At the end they have nice beds in outdated old rooms and fabulous view and location by the sunset ... anything else is not even worth mentioning. I highly urge Westin's management to leave this nice location to another chain like Ritz-Carlton, Fairmont or Four Seasons to take care of tourists visiting this area.

Reviews.Title: “Dawn was amazing”
Reviews.Author: MotivationMan
Reviews.Content: We travel a ton for business and pleasure, and are a part of the SPG Platinum Preferred membership program. As such we ususllyget upgraded to a suite at SPG hotels. Sometimes they are booked solid. this trip was one of those times. Enter Dawn at the front desk. She refused to take no for an answer and spent a considerable amount of time moving people from room to room (prior to their check in of course) and made it happen. We were upgraded to a suite for our entire (wonderful) stay at the hotel Thanks Dawn! P.S. The only complaint I have about the hotel is that the internet access is beyond terrible... Access yes... bandwidth, not on your life! I ended up using my verizon internet service the whole time...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: silvercitykid
Reviews.Content: Hotel is obviously priced a higher than several hotel/resorts in the area, but the value of the experience definitely outweighs this. I was in Maui attending a wedding in Lahaina and was able to see several other hotels around the area as I visited other friends and family members. Rooms were typical Westin rooms. It is the ambiance that sets this property ahead of some of the others in the area. The shuttle between the other starwood hotels was very useful. Had a very late flight back on my departure date and was able to use a room for no charge hours after check out to clean up before we flew back to the mainland. This gave us an extra day to enjoy the private beach. Found that the rates dropped around 2 to 3 months out and would consider this to be the best time to book this region.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: dnsmcklr
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried since several reviews the week before we were going were negative. I contacted the hotel and they tried put my fears at ease. I found a staff that was incredibly responsive to any requests. Despite the reviews about the pool being crowded with not enough chairs, I think this is misleading. I found that if you were looking for 2 chairs together, there was never a problem. The problem is when a family of 2 adults and 3 small kids expect to find 5 seats together. Do you really need 5 seats with 3 kids? No, I found that 2 chairs did just fine for the 4 of us since the kids were in the pool most of the time. The property is beautiful. Yes, the rooms are small, but how much time do you really spend in the room when you're in paradise? (unless you are a honeymooner). The buffet breakfast was fabulous and there was never a wait. Top notch hotel, location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent for a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: EDeNat08
Reviews.Content: I went with my fiancee in early August. This hotel is very nice; our room was facing the hills instead of the ocean, but even in Hawaii the hills are better than on the mainland! The staff was very friendly; the cleaning ladies gave us extra Kona coffee and towels every day. I love that the fridge is in the room; we went to Costco and just kept it stocked with beer every day. (don't buy beer f/ the waitresses at the pool...it will run you $8 for a Miller Lite!) For those who are not bringing children and want to get away from all the families, I recommend renting a cabana...it was $50 / day, but so worth it. It was quiet, and had a great view of the ocean. That way you don't have to fight people for a chair by the pool. The restaurants at the hotel were ok, pretty standard for what you get in a hotel, I suppose. We mostly went to Lahaina each night for food and atmosphere. We did attend the luau, which was amazing...the fire-throwers are something to behold. One other random thing-I really liked the fitness center, and I especially liked the fact that we didn't have to pay for it! I hate it when you pay a ton of money for a resort vacation, only to have to pay $10 every time you want to use the gym. Overall, I would recommend it...it's Hawaii, it's hard to go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WAISTE YOUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: Natalsz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful! The rooms were dirty and outdated, the service was bad and the breakfast buffet was toooooooooooo crowded. Also, if you donâ€™t mind paying $55.00 per day for a lounge char and some shade then go ahead, otherwise you will be sitting on the ground in the sun! Best bet, stay at the Hyatt up the way, it is MUCH better!

Reviews.Title: “Probably will not stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: beckyeck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July 2010 for five nights using Starwood points. He is Starwood Gold, Marriott Plat, we own a Marriott timeshare in Hawaii.... needless to say we both stay at a lot of hotels around the world for business and pleasure. We were both very disappointed in this hotel and will probably not stay here again. The rooms are very average and just not up to Westin standards. They are outdated with very few amenities. My biggest complaint about this hotel is the pool/beach situation. You can read plenty of reviews on here about that so I'm just echoing the frustration. Be sure to call the hotel weeks in advance to reserve a chair or cabana on the beach. Otherwise, once you get there, it will all be sold out. They offer very few chairs on the beach which I don't really understand. They could easily add more chairs so there are more options. Beach cabanas are a complete joke for what you pay. They are all right next to each other so there is no privacy. We had a cabana next to the one of the end (#2 I think). A family of 6 had rented the cabana so they were all sharing it and sat there and talked the whole time. Annoying. Also, the cabana staff will not take your food order so do not expect any service for your fee. The only thing they would do is keep bringing you tap water and some chopped pineapple. We were there during peak season and the staff informed me that they were understaffed which is why they wouldn't take our lunch order but the waiter could bring us water. Huh? We had to walk to the bar to order lunch. Again, annoying. The good thing about this hotel is its location. It is walkable to many restaurant and entertainment options which was very convenient. It was enjoyable because well, hey, you are in Maui. But next time we'll probably stay at the Sheraton or the other Westin property which I've read is much newer and less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “in need of maintaince and remodel”
Reviews.Author: 78ronnie
Reviews.Content: Our room had an airconditioner that didn't work. It said the temp.was 32 and would turn on and say that its off. The carpet was wet and the safe didn't work. There was no remote in the room. After calling the front desk twice. I finally went to them and told them I wanted another room. The room they gave us was nice and there was not a problem with it. The outside and pool area was very nice but the rooms are in need of new carpet and some TLC. We spoke to 4 different guests and they said that they as well had to switch rooms for some reason or another as well. We were told one price for parking and internet and the priced was doulbe at check out time.

Reviews.Title: “A serene magical enviroment where all wants and needs were taken care of far beyond expectation.”
Reviews.Author: Maddog2727
Reviews.Content: The service was fabulous . We were warmly greeted when we first arrived at the entrance and the people checking us in were very helpful and made us feel welcomed especially after such a long day of travel....true Aloha spirit. The hosts and hostesses we met at The Tropica and Ona were always pleasant as were our servers who seemed to anticipate our needs and answered all our questions to our satisfaction. I was impressed with the entire staff we encountered, even in passing, how professional and dare I say, happy, they appeared to be working at The Westin! Refeshing....definitely adding to a stress-free enviroment. I did happen to meet Kate Fruean who gave us some great tips on a couple of adventures we had planned which made our experience even more enjoyable. The room was spectacular with the ocean/pool views and I will never forget the sumptious bed and bedding....delightful. Spending time in the lobby with the water features and birds was actually one of my favorite things to do! The spa and staff there were excellent...another favorite. The beach was fantastic as were the pools and waterfalls and landscaping. Everything was well maintained and super clean. What can I say....it was Disney-like "La-la Land "at The Westin Resort. I know it is not reality....but that's how a vacation should be. There was nothing I liked least.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon bummer”
Reviews.Author: brau0294
Reviews.Content: First, I need to start by saying that this is the second time I have stayed here at the Westin Maui Resort and after expressing how much I loved the resort the last time was completely disappointed. My husband and I booked over a year ago to spend a week of our honeymoon in Maui at the Westin with a double upgrade from a partial ocean view. We were very disappointed to find that the staff placed us in a room over looking the parking lot and the backs of restaurants with a partial ocean view that they claimed was an "ocean view." After speaking with the front desk staff we found out this was one of the least desirable rooms in our building. We were very disappointed to hear this and after speaking with the front desk further decided to try and change rooms the next day. We were told they would move our luggage to a smaller ocean view room the next day by noon. The next day at three we got a call to come to the front desk and received news that the occupants in the room we were supposed to get had decided to stay another night. We were moved into a room slightly further away from the parking lot with more of a partial ocean view room than our first night. My husband and I just decided to accept our fate and stay in the second room. We just want everyone to hear our experience as we were deeply disappointed this happened on our honeymoon and hopes no one else gets a ocean view of the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very clean, and very busy”
Reviews.Author: NoVAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in early/mid August. Check-in was fast and efficient and the desk staff were very friendly. Overall I found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful - what you would expect. Our room was nice, clean, had a nice view, and had a mini-refrigerator - which was nice. The room was small, especially considering we have two teenagers but at least we had two queen beds and we really did not spend too much time in the room anyway. The balcony was also nice but small. We had to pay a $25 resort fee that covered parking and internet. It seemed a bit pricey but at least they were up front about it. And when the lot was full later in the evening they did not charge extra for the valet service. As we got there late in the afternoon we decided to eat dinner at the restaurant by the pool. The food was ok, what you typically expect from a hotel restaurant. The hotel grounds themselves were impressive - from the lagoon with the flamingos to the many pools and the water slide. We had great poolside service for lunch and drinks and though it gets very crowded we must have been lucky as we did not seem to have a problem getting chairs. I will admit the pool area does get very crowded, there is definitely an issue with people "reserving" chairs and not using them, and the pool water is cold. The location on the beach is great and I liked how close it was to Whaler's Village. We did some shopping there and had a few meals, even at the less expensive fast food places. What was also nice was how close the Maui Dive shop was. We rented snorkeling gear for 2-weeks and at the end dropped it off at another Maui Dive Shop closer to the other hotel where we were staying later in our vacation. We did the Westin's version of the luau. It was very entertaining, the food was good (though not great), and it was expensive. For the price of the luau they could have included the picture they took upon entry instead of charging another $20. As a Starwood member I did get a 10% discount on the luau. The highlight was the fire dancing. The one complaint I had was how aggressive the concierge was in trying to push timeshares at their sister Westin down the street. It got to the point were it was obnoxious. Otherwise, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good thing hotel is beautiful...It made up for the lack of service”
Reviews.Author: JulyBride2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for the last three nights of our honeymoon. Checking in we were greeted by an amazing woman who I think was named Monica who willingly upgraded us and sent us up a bottle of champagne with a congratulatory message. Our room was much bigger than we anticipated and our view was amazing. We were able to sit out on our balcony and listen to the live music being played in the Whalers Village. Unfortuneatly, we weren't able to sit out on our balcony as much as we would have liked because our room was next to a chain smoking woman, and when we called the front desk to complain, nothing ever happened and if it did it didn't change this womans behavior. Looking around the grounds of the hotel we felt as if we were staying in paradise, the flamingoes and fish in the lobby, the pools, everything was very clean and a sight to see. Upon checking in we asked about our free 4x6 picture and were told where we could sign up for it. When we got to the sign up book we saw that the only day available was the day that we were due to come home, which wouldn't work because you had to wait a day to get the picture and if we wanted it shipped to us it would have cost us $15. We opted to have another guest take our picture in the lobby for FREE. If you would really like to take advantage of the free picture do it as soon as you check in and you MIGHT be lucky enough to get s time slot. We ate lunch one day (shared a plate of $16 dollar nachos) in the poolside restaurant that took up an hour and a half of our time. We sat at our table for a good 20 minutes before we were acknowledged, waited another 10 for our drinks after we ordered them, and another 15 minutes waiting to get a bill so that we could leave. We could have taken that time, walked to the Whalers Village and ate and stopped at the ABC store and bought some drinks and wasted less time. I understand that the attitude in Hawaii is laid back, but come on! You could tell that the servers didn't really care whether or not they did their job well. Apparently they don't work for tips. We also had breakfast buffet coupons as part of our stay. The buffet lines were short, and tables were open but it still took 10 minutes to get sat. The only time that I can say I was truly impressed with the service on the food and beverage end was the Sunday that we were there and there was a Build your own Caipirinha station set up. Those guys were having fun and were genuinely interesting in making our visit a positive experience. Like many others have said the pool areas were amazing, but if you wanted to sit by them you had to fight the crowds at 6:30 in the morning to reserve a chair. There were signs posted saying that it was something that was monitered, but I never saw it enforced. One morning a girl was walking around tagging chairs but nothing was ever moved. Hanging out in the pool wouldn't have been an issue if the pools weren't freezing. Its a good thing we enjoyed the beach! The parking attendants were very pleasant and waived the valet fee when we came back each night which was nice. There is a business center but its more of a kinkos. If you want to use the computer located outside of it you have to pay for the minutes you are online. They don't even allow you to check in for flights for free, you would think that the resort fee would cover that. Overall I would say that it's a beautiful place to stay, but if you are looking for a resort that makes you feel pampered...look elsewhere, service is not the Westins strong point.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay in paradise with everything and everyone available to you!”
Reviews.Author: smiling_60
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this resort during their very busy season, and yet everything was excellent. The views from the room were breath taking, the beds were extrememly comfortable,the amenties were fabulous, and the staff was superb! In particular, the guest relations manager, Sean Ganhinhin, and conference service manage, Katie Fruean were professional, efficient, accomodating and congenial. We had an opportunity to try the spa during a "girls' night" promotion, and we were so impressed. Not only did we have a choice of three mini treatments for an unbelievable price, but the Westin provided appetizers and wine! A note about the amenities: A Westin shuttle took us to all the Starwood Resorts on Kaanapali Beach as well as several shopping locations. In addition there was an ocean boardwalk with many fine restaurants that you could walk along to exercise, eat , or enjoy this beautiful beach. Finally the Wailele Polynesian Luau @ the Westin, provided a feast, with an excellent performance!! Everything was right there!

Reviews.Title: “ONLY A FEW THINGS BAD...”
Reviews.Author: mrbernal
Reviews.Content: location is almost perfect. i'd say the sheraton maui has a better location with the black rock. better snorkeling opportunities and the ocean was a little bit more calmer, on that side. however they do have shuttle services between the hotels if you're too lazy to walk. sheraton maui did look like they had more ocean front rooms, but im still glad i stayed at the Westin. westin pool was beautiful and staff was excellent. i got the standard room. i immediately went out to the balcony and was disappointed not with the view, but the balcony itself. chairs, table, and fence appeared to be outdated. the 25 dollar MANDATORY resort fee was also, unnecessary in my opinion. it was supposed to cover parking, internet, and gym, gym is nice and clean, and updated, with 24 hour access. but who wants to workout??? the parking spot in the lot are made for super compact cars. the parking lot was also in proximity to our room, and we would occasionally hear car alarms from our room at night. at the end of the night, the parking lot becomes full, at which point a sign is erected and valet parks your car for free, or $2 tip. if you choose to do valet throughout the whole day, its 15$ on top of the 25$ resort fee. the "complimentary" internet is terribly slow and at time, i was unable to connect several times as the server was very slow. the room was cramped. very small. there was a table inside of the room and two chairs which i felt like i wanted to remove. the king bed was highly comfortable. another thing regarding the room was that i saw my daughter, 2.5 years old ended up peeling some wallpaper off of the wall, which had already been loose and dangling. otherwise, great hotel minus the minor things.... eat at STAR NOODLE also...excellent spot.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: calgary15
Reviews.Content: We were dissapointed in the quality of the room for the price of almost $400.00 a night, we found the rooms musty smelling and dirty. We stayed here for a week and the sheets were never changed. The pool area is very nice and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to the islands"”
Reviews.Author: onetake2
Reviews.Content: Just want to give a great shout out to Fely Villano, our room attendant! She was the best, taking care of us with extra towels and amenities! Room was small for family of 4, but it was great to at least have a fridge! Wish we didn't have to get up at the crack of dawn to hog some lounge chairs by the pool though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!!”
Reviews.Author: LuanaDallasTX
Reviews.Content: We love, love this property b/c it was busy, had activities for our grandson if we wanted, and has fabulous pools. There is one pool specifically for adults which is great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and a special shout out to Teresa in Valet who lent us a boogie board and some mats that had been left behind. Eat poolside for b'fast and enjoy the view. Also the walk to other property's is wonderful and you can snorkel at Black Beach in front of the Sheraton. The rooms are a bit small but if you're organized, and busy you won't care. We had the mountain view and were fine with it. Concierge's are wonderful with the island activities, and be sure to take north drive around the island for the best views in the world. You can take a day trip to Lanai, and don't forget Haleakala. We would go back here!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a family vacation, not for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: sstitely
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel in mid-August, with mixed experiences. We arrived to the hotel late afternoon to find the self parking lot completely full. My concern was alleviated when we were comped all valet fees for any nights when self-parking was full. Westin was very good about this, and I appreciated it. When we checked in, service was quick, friendly and easy - kudos again for a nice job, especially during a busy afternoon check-in. Our first night was uneventful, we enjoyed a nice evening in the happening Ka'anapali area. Our bed was pretty comfortable, but frankly nothing special. We are Starwood Preferred members and paid for "Partial Ocean View" which meant we got a 2nd floor corner unit that overlooked the A/C unit of another building, with a big drain in front of our balcony that collected fallen bathing suits/underwear (lots of it), etc. On our first morning, we exited the elevator at 7:30am (on our way to breakfast) to find people scrambling to throw beach towels on pool chairs, which immediately angered me. There has GOT to be a better way than this. As other reviews state, pool chairs are cramped and hard to find (unlike other reviewers, I have no problem with them being in the sun - you're in Hawaii for crying out loud). You basically have to stalk folks that look like they're leaving their chairs to get one. Often times you can only get one chair for two people, then just hang out in the pool. Terrible. Next, we go to breakfast, to find a line of approximately 20 people to sit down for the buffet breakfast. The hostess was working by herself and had lots of writing to do for each party, thus the line. It took 10 minutes to get seated in the breakfast area that was basically empty at the time. Not good service. The view from the Tropica area was a nice touch at breakfast, we thoroughly enjoyed this every morning. Around lunchtime on our first day (a Sunday), we went to the pool and stalked until we got chairs, only to realize we were in front of a DJ who was BLASTING rap/dance music that could be heard from my brother's house in Washington, DC. Seriously, WAY too loud. We moved to the beach to try to avoid this, but still felt the vibration of the music. Had this occurred every day, we would have switched hotels in a heartbeat. I'm a late 20's professional who enjoys to party on occasion, but in my opinion, this type of thing should not be done in a resort that caters to families and honeymooners. My advice - avoid this place on Sundays in the summer (apparently that's when they do this). Maid service staff was amazing, and very personable. She left a great impression in that area and was sure to get us whatever we needed. We really appreciated that. The only time we visited the concierge was to pick up our "free gift" - a tacky coffee cup, which was really just bait to get us to the desk so they could try to sell us a timeshare. Seriously, we're on our honeymoon, and you know this, we didn't come there to be sold on timeshares. Overall, a nice hotel with a lot of problems to solve (in our opinion). There are many other hotels in the area that I'd try before returning to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE BEST RESORT I HAVE EVER STAYED AT.”
Reviews.Author: mrbbman
Reviews.Content: When we walked up to the counter at Starwood Resort, the front desk clerk greeted us with a great smile and said welcome to paradise. She was so friendly and helpful. When hotels have employees like Dawn Jacinto working for them, it makes your vacation get off to a great start. This hotel has the best lush grounds plus 5 pools one pool has slide.this hotel is close to Whalers Village shopping center and lots of restaurants within walking distance. The restaurants at the Westin Hotel are excellant.

Reviews.Title: “For the money I was expecting some nice service. I was wrong!”
Reviews.Author: GrantOdell
Reviews.Content: You would think for 400 dollars per night I could get a chair by the pool. I was way wrong. If you need some shade it's an extra 20.00. They will rent you an umbrella. I finally found a seat. WOW!!! THANK YOU. Now can I get this chair moved to the adult pool? Should I pick it up and move it myself? NO. Cant do that. I asked two different people to help. Neither was able to do anything. It may seem such a small problem but to me it ruined my day. Had to give up my seat and go somewhere else. I need some shade. I came here to get away from my kids for a few days and had to deal with 100 other ones. You should put more chairs or police the area better. Towels on all chairs for hours at a time with no people. Do people come down put towels out and never come back? I will not come back for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sal1811
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us, 2 adults, and kids 19, 18, 17 and 15. We had two rooms and stayed for 12 nights at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. Everything was very nice. We stayed there in April of 2003 and also enjoyed our stay. The rooms are nice, but be sure to clarify when booking your room what "partial ocean view" means. When we checked in we were given two rooms located over the front entrance and when you looked to the very far right you could you see slivers of the ocean between two other hotels. We asked the front desk to be moved to "partial ocean view" rooms and were told that these were. However, they did move us to two rooms the next day that overlooked the inside garden/waterfall area and had a much better partial ocean view. The food was very good, but expensive, but it's that way every where on Maui. The staff was all very friendly. We took the scuba lesson in the pool and did the intro dive at black rock--very fun. My husband, myself, daughter and niece had massages in the outdoor cabanas that were very relaxing. We parasailed w/IUFO which is very convenient from the Westin. We enjoy staying in the Kaanapali area with our children because of all the activities and really enjoyed our stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: bchall5
Reviews.Content: My wife were very excited to be staying at this property for the second half of our 5th anniversary trip to Hawaii. We stayed at a budget condo for the first half and were looking forward to pampering ourselves a little bit and this nice resort. While we did really enjoy ourselves, there were some ways in which the resort did not meet our expectations. First, I will list the high points followed by areas in which I think the resort could and should improve. Pros: *Beautiful lobby with flamingos, fish, waterfalls, etc. A great please to just take it all in. *Pool area- Wow! Enormous and diverse with something for everyone. Seats were hard to get, but it you were flexible, we were able to get to 2 chairs and bring them next to each other and any point of the day. I don't think it was as bad as many make it seem, although they may have had large parties. *Location- 5 minutes to Lahaina on beautiful Ka'anapali beach. It really was a prefect location. *Food- the quality of the food we had at "Ono Bar and Grill" as well as "Tropica" was very good. I recommend the "Macadamia-nut Encrusted Chicken. I got it twice! *Spa- this was beautiful and Paris does a fantastic deep-tissue massage. One of the best I have ever had. *Room Size- I thought the size of our room (in the Beach Tower) was a good size. The Ocean Tower rooms were smaller. *Westin Bed/Bath- very nice, as advertised. Cons: *Front Desk- When I checked in (and prior to arrival on the phone) I let the Front Desk know that we were on a anniversary trip and asked for any possible upgrade. The woman who checked us in was cold and uninterested about it all and said that she upgraded us to a "Golf Course View." We proceded to our room on the 6th floor of the Ocean Tower. I didn't see any nice green golf course, just parking lot and highway. I was a bit sad to start our experience this way. (We had booked a garden view and would prefer that to the supposed "upgrade" of the parking lot.) After returning to the desk we were directed to a woman who was working the Japanese Guest Services counter. She was very friendly, nice and understanding. She worked for a few minutes to change our room to 284 in the Beach Tower. While it was a lower floor room, the view was great of the pool and gardens. When you came out onto the balcony you could see the ocean. *"Concierge"- I put the word concierge in quotes because they are annoyed when you ask any questions about directions, reservations and recommendations. The really aren't concierge at all. They are timeshare sales people. They are very pushy and leave you notes to come get free gifts. When you show up for the free gift but aren't interested in the timeshare they are upset. In fact, one woman said, "Well, OK, I guess you can have your gift." Bluntly put, I paid too much money to be offered a free gift and then be lectured about time share sales. It was offensive and Westin should know better. Housekeeping- Housekeeping was poor. The room was barely cleaned. Nail clippings from a previous guest were on the floor upon arrival and remained there throughout our stay. We were not always given our daily waters and service was inconsistant. We caught a cockroach on the last morning too. I wouldn't expect this at a Westin Resort. Parking Lot- the self parking lot is ridiculous. The spots are the smallest I have ever seen. It is dangerous and is begging for dents and scratches. Resort Fee- I know about this fee upfront, but have to say. $25 a day to be able to use the gym, self park and for 2 bottles of water a day, internet and 1 4X6 photo is crazy. The gym, internet and parking should be included in the already high room rate and the water and photo should be for sale like everything else. Service Express- Service Express is a button on your phone that you call for pretty much any of your needs. I had to call it twice. Once because we were not given the water that we were supposed to receive each day and another because I needed a nail file and it was listed as in item that could be provided if needed. Let me say this clearly, there is nothing express about service express. The water took over 2 hours and the nail file took 1 and a half hours. Someone could have told me there was a file in the vanity kit that was already in the bathroom. Restaurant Service- We dined at both Tropica and Ono. While the food was good, the service was slow. Donna, in the Ono, was both slow, uninterested and inattentive. Donald was a better. I hate to be so negative, but I think that if the management and staff were to change some of these things, the resort really would be worth the high cost. It is beautiful and a great place for families with fantastic pools. I do recommend it, but can't do so enthusiastically or highly because of the above concerns.

Reviews.Title: “4th time was not the charm...”
Reviews.Author: Mattman08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 times in the past 2 years and have loved it. I am not sure what the problem was this time but it was a major disappointment all around. The room was dirty, cleaning staff was horrid ( I use to be a maid in a large hotel) and had total attitude. We asked the woman to come back because our son was napping, she got annoyed and said she had to leave at 3 pm. I said ok then leave... I mean really how is that my problem. The next day we had a do not disturb card in the door (again napping child) and she knocked on the door. I was livid. Then she did a terrible job cleaning. The carpets were nasty sticky. The restaurant staff was so slow we sat there for 6 minutes and asked someone to get our waitress who had Been standing at the bar waiting for her drinks for at least 3 minutes, she looked right at us and did not move... We waited another minute and walked out. We walked out of the bar 3 times from lousy service. One day the bellman Aaron literally stuck his empty cart in our elevator as the doors were closing even though there was another one right across the way open and empty. It was a snotty rude move. I don't know what has happened there, it just felt like the staff are all cranky and unhappy. Lastly, getting a seat at the pool is going into mortal combat. Good luck with that. We have loved this hotel and have been repeat guests for a long time but our experience was so bad all around we will be trying a new spot. Oh, one good spot, the spa, best pedicure ever. The restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: rc_wtsn
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and admit I must be spoiled. I knew when I booked this hotel that the rooms would be tight. (Two double beds) We had 4 adults in our room and it was stressful to say the least. No place to put anything, and we constantly had to pick up just so we could relax. I don't think it was possible to fit a rollaway in the room so my two adult children took turns sleeping on the floor. As it was, we payed $500/night for the room. Thank God we had a balcony overlooking the parking lot (mountain view). It was the only peace and quiet we found at the hotel the entire week. The rooms overlooking the pool/ocean had to be loud and had no privacy at all. Honestly I thought summer was a slow time to visit (off season) and I thought the crowds would be light. I was seriously wrong on this one. Someone mentioned the parking lot. I prayed everytime we pulled in that the lot was full so the valet could park the jeep for free, as the spaces were barely large enough for the smallest of vehicles. I did figure out if you want a bunch of extra towels just go down to the left of the valet area. They have a huge supply of them and gave them away freely. This was great for going to the beaches or day trips and of course when we returned we swapped them for clean ones as we constantly ran out of them in our room. If you wanted to relax by the pool you had to get down there by 7 AM to place a towel out there. What a joke. Good thing I didn't care about lying by a pool when the South Pacific was perfect and beckoning!! We met a lovely family the first day that gave us their boogie boards as they were flying home that day. We assured them we would pass them on to another family when we left as well, and it was fun choosing whom we would gift them to that last day:) Everything at the hotel felt like a scam to sell you something. No I am not interested in going to a presentation for your property so I could get a credit for the hotel. The free photo I was promised was a scam to get us to buy a package. The hotel is beautiful so take your own photo and save the time and hassle. The food is very overpriced but then again this is Hawaii and everything is overpriced. I did find a great place in downtown Lahaina called Boss Frogs that rented everything you could use on your trip for less than half the cost of most everything they try to sell you on Kaanapali beach. (Rentals of surfboards, snorkel equipment, golf clubs, etc.) This was the best deal in town. The spa was overpriced and nothing to write home about. Lovely as it was, it was the low point of our trip. Kind of a let down. We had massages in cabanas by the beach. It was unnerving having hundreds of people walking by you while you are half dressed getting a massage... For some reason I had envisioned considerably more privacy than what we encountered... We are gold members and were told we would get upgraded when we arrived if available, but nothing was available. Figures. No lei greeting either, but we got some shell leis another day so no big deal. All in all I would say the front desk was virtually no help whatsoever during our trip. I get better service out of hotels that only charge you $100/night. They must not be hurting for business... Overall, my adult children enjoyed the trip and the hotel so I would say it was a nice vacation. However, I would never give my business to this hotel again. I prefer to be more catered to instead of looked at as one of the masses. It reminded me of Disney during peak season. It lost its appeal because it was so crowded you got no attention, and at the prices we paid I would expect a lot more. Anyone can come to the pool, even though I'm sure it is frowned upon. No one was checking to see if you were a hotel guest or not. I did get a wristband one day but it annoyed me and I removed it immediately. Nobody noticed or cared. I used the slides a few times with no wristband and they never checked. If I come back to Hawaii, I will do things completely different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chrish574
Reviews.Content: Amazing Location! Gorgeous Lobby! The pools are fantastic and the slides are SO FUN! Caution: The pool area was crowded. Reserve your chair by 7am if you want one. Great dining located next door at the Whaler's Village. (Cane and Taro has 50% off EVERYTHING on certain days- highly recommend!) Walk down to the Blackrock for incredible snorkling. We loved it at the Westin! For those traveling with strollers- the Westin's free shuttle into Lahaina does not allow strollers unless they are ultra basic umbrella strollers. The city bus leaves from next door Whaler's Village and has the same route for $1 per person and it allows strollers... much cheaper than renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “too big, insensitive, impossible pool situation, crowds galore”
Reviews.Author: terrence1955
Reviews.Content: we are here right now, first time this westin. and we are preferred starwood members and go westin always. not here, never again. preferred guests with ocean view? what a joke that is. our preferred room is next to an elevator, the ocean to the extreme right. the personal concierge emailed in advance to introduce himself and make himself available to our needs, and then never responded - disappeared for 4 days, re-emerging to call us in the room at 6 in the morning. he likes to surf and has been the source of never ending jokes about when the surf must be up. nice touch, twice in a row the early calls awaking us. we hung up on him and he called back at that early hour. impossible to get a seat at a pool unless you are out there to reserve at 7 in the morning. there is no shade to speak of---everything is in the sun. the adult pool away from the kids totally reserved up--ppl leave towels to reserve then go somewhere else i suppose--impossible to seek any shade. and just too many people. despite 5 pools, no shade--this is really hard to believe. it is like the word 'cabana' is not in their vocabulary. also the lounge chairs are all about 6 inches apart from each other. they are crammed in together as if designed to eliminate privacy--everywhere--this is not the place to have a relaxing, comfortable time at poolside. we still have a few days here, and we will stay for the rest of it. the beds are nice as advertised, room service nice, service acceptable. all fees like everywhere is added on---these ppl must have seen the spirit airlines commercials, because they have taken their marketing cues to heart. i have lots of nice memories from past hawaiian trips, but not this one. will not be returning to this westin.

Reviews.Title: “If you are Starwood Elite- good property to miss”
Reviews.Author: miloMaui
Reviews.Content: The standards, training of staff are so far below what a Starwood Elite memebre will expect. Therre asre no ameneties nor services for Platinum memebers. Rooms are tiny, cramped and there is no place to put any clothes unless you have come for justa few nights. Beach chairs have to be booked in adavnace and are rented by the week- no spontanaity here. Not very large facilities compared to size of the resort or sooms thay have.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: glow16
Reviews.Content: We were put in a dirty room facing the parking lot. The windows were so dirty we could not see out of them. The beds were HORRIBLE. My one son slept on the pull out couch, it was so uncomfortable and made so much noise when he turned it kept us up all night. My other son slept on a cot that was as hard as a rock. The pool was so crowded thre was no place to sit. We had to pay $10.00 for a chair just to sit on the beach. We were not allowed to bring cocktails on the beach. The only bar by the pool is very uninviting. The place does not have a good feeling at all. We took our 2 teenage boys, not a great place for them, nothing to do. We travel quit a bit and we would never return here. It's funny that the resort wanted us to purchase a unit yet they stuck us in a studio facing a parking lot, bad sell job. I read all the reviews and did a lot of research, I can't figure out why this place gets such great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kiet2010
Reviews.Content: You feel like you are in paradise at the westin. A must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service & Warm and Friendly Staff-Thank you Dawn!!”
Reviews.Author: SusanSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Dawn Jacinto at the Westin Maui Resort was very helpful with recommendations for our hotel accommodations so we could book the rooms that would be most suitable for our family and helped to make our stay most memorable! We very much appreciated the warm service from Dawn and all of the staff at the Westin Maui Resort!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Westin!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PattersonPark2005
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. great rooms, & great service! A must is the pool, great for kids. Also eating at Tropica was the best. Benny who plays there made dinner that much better. We are booking our return stay for Spring break & can't wait. This hotel is a 10!

Reviews.Title: “prime location”
Reviews.Author: mos505
Reviews.Content: This hotel's main asset is its location right on a prime stretch of Ka'anapali beach. I find the buildings' layout, surrounding an extensive pool system, to be successful in creating a resort atmosphere avoiding geometric concrete shapes. The open lobby with waterfall creates the right atmosphere upon arrival. The rooms are on the small side, but appear to have been renovated not long ago. Ocean-view rooms are obviously a big part of the experience in Maui, but the premium is not negligible. Since the rooms are not this hotel's strong point, spending more time in its above-average public areas may be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui Resort & Spa is a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jec77043
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui. The Westin was perfect! Kaanapali Beach was an ideal location, and the Westin is right in the middle of a long row of hotels and condos. The Sheraton, which has a very family friendly beach for swimming and snorkeling, is only a short walk away. The neat thing about the Westin is that the Whaler's Village shopping center is right next door. We went there for a quick and inexpensive breakfast almost every day. On the weekend we were there, they also offered free entertainment (hula show, music, etc.). The Westin itself is fabulous. Although the front of the hotel looks dated (the hotel was built in 1971), the hotel was renovated in 2007 and looks terrific. When you walk into the main lobby, there is a wonderful waterfall to greet you. Everything there on the first floor is open air, including the front desk. My kids loved the pools, including the big water slide. The poolside restaurant had excellent service and the food was delicious. The interesting town of Lahaina was only 3 short miles away. The only negatives for the Westin are the smallish rooms and the parking. Regarding the latter, the spaces were extremely narrow and required my family to exit the car while I pulled into the space. Worse, there weren't enough spaces to go around, so we saw a lot of double parking each morning. Good thing we never got stuck behind somebody. We learned to park in the furthest rows to avoid that possibility. But don't let those negatives dissuade you from staying here. We wanted a posh resort hotel, and the Westin does not disappoint. The landscaping is beautiful, and the hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. We would heartily recommend this hotel to our friends. Since we wanted to visit other parts of the island, we were concerned that Kaanapali was too far away, but that was not the case. It is a short drive (19 miles) from the Westin to the middle of the island where the airport is and where the various turnoffs to go to Haleakala, Hana, and the South Shore are located. In Lahaina, we enjoyed the Old Lahaina Luau and Aloha Mixed Plate. All in all, we loved our trip to Maui, and the Westin was the perfect place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFour
Reviews.Content: Visited the Westin Resort and Spa late July 2010. The weather was perfect and the hotel is great for kids/teenagers. There are 5 pools(1 adult only) and 3 slides. However, the chaise lounge situation leaves plenty to be desired. Guests are up before 7am saving chairs with towels and belongings. When the towel desk opens at 7 it is almost impossible to get a shady chair. Come down to the pool after 8am and don't even think of getting a chair.
