Also, ony one hot tub for a resort this size doesn't cut it. The beach in front of the hotel is perfect, warm water, soft sand and a few waves. A few feet down you can rent kayaks and paddle surf boards. My kids loved the stand uip paddle surfing! Buffet breakfast has a large variety and is constantly being replenished. The token smoothie shot glass is delicious, but don't order a whole glass. It is not included and is $8.00. No coffeee or tea to take back to your chair or for a walk on the beach. The exercise room has a variety of cardio machines, but gets very crowded in the morning. Hard to find a spot to stretch. No locker rooms or amenities. Overall, this is a beautiful, clean property in a great location. However, they need to revamp the pool/chair situation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, location, and facility.”
Reviews.Author: SonoranDesertDad
Reviews.Content: Right from our arrival we were impressed. Our bellhop was not only prompt, but gave us all sorts of useful insights into things to do, places to see and tips on getting around easily on the island. The front desk staff went to great lengths to get us the room we wanted, even though the hotel was basically 100% booked. The housekeeping staff really took the cake; our keeper, Ms. Violet N., found two rooms next to each other so that we could have an adjoining room next to our kids. Perfect! She then went on to make sure we liked the views, that we had everything we wanted in our rooms, and even made sure we had extra towels (she has teens, too!). What a great experience, and our deepest thanks to Violet, Dawn and Wayne at the front desk, and the entire staff at the Westin Resort and Spa in Maui. They really made our vacation special. We will definitely be back! Oh, I forgot to mention - They have 5 connected pools on the grounds, and the most wonderful fine sandy beach right in front of the hotel. It's a 5 star Hawaiian vacation dream.

Reviews.Title: “The gorgeous Westin Maui is the best hotel on Maui with fantastic service and an unparalleled location.”
Reviews.Author: JenAnn28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Westin Maui for our anniversary. The hotel grounds were absolutely stunning and unparalleled. It's the best hotel on Maui! Every spot was gorgeous, from the waterfall lagoon to the many pools. There are beautiful waterfalls everywhere. It's in the perfect location too! The hotel sits right in front of the Kaanapali beach and is right next to the Whaler's Village where there are several great shops and restaurants, all within walking distance. The pools are amazing. There are several large pools with a few water slides and water falls. But there is also an adult pool which is so serene and quiet. I loved that we could walk from the ocean right to the hotel pool. The hotel staff is amazing. They fulfilled every request we had, including recreating the top tier of our wedding cake. The hotel staff (PR staff) really made us feel special! The front desk staff was really helpful and friendly. My husband and I really enjoyed being able to workout at the gym every morning too. It was never crowded. I loved the different options of dining as well, from the coffee stand to the buffet brunch, to the sit down dinners...all very delicious. I hope we are able to celebrate many more anniversaries at the Westin! I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: peasmakr18
Reviews.Content: We are coming to the end of our vacation in Maui, staying at the Westin Resort and Spa. We stayed here from July 24th for five nights on our 10 yr anniversary. The hotel is top notch. We stayed at a discounted rate thru the friends and family program. We stayed in an ocean view room in the ocean tower, room 443. Our room was on the fourth floor, kind of low if you want to truly see the beach. We stayed overlooking the adult pool and my wife loved that you could hear the waterfalls at night. Our room was very nice and big. We had one issue with the toilet seat and while we were out it was fixed. The concierge desk was awsome. We spoke to Nikki who was extremely helpful in setting up dinners, excursions and giving us some pointers around town. We went snorkiling at Black Rock and Airport Beach by the Westin Villas. We also went zip lining and on a dinner cruise. If you would like our feedback on that please send me an email and I will be more that happy to give you the details. We also ate at the Hula Grill, Sanseis and the Lahaina Grill. I played golf at Ka'anapali royal course while the wife sat in a beach front gazeebo for 2 ($55). Tomorrow we are going to the Grand Wailea to try there spa. We also went to a small strip mall spa called Zensations. Read me review it was the best massages my wife and I have ever recieved. Our stay was wonderful and we do not have any regrets or complaints. The hotel grounds are great along with the staff. I will definately return in the future with the kids. You will not be disappointed by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: jstork
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome 10 day stay at the Westin Maui Resort! The hotel was beautiful and it was in a great location! We were in the newer tower, and the rooms were great. Plenty of space for 2 of us, and a gorgeous view. You can easily walk to Whalers Village for food and shopping, or down the beach strip to the other hotels. Black rock is just a 2 minute walk down the beach. Lahiana is just a 10 minute shuttle ride, and another great location. We had great service from just about everyone at the hotel. It seemed to be a smooth running operation, which is appreciated at such a busy and family friendly resort. The spa was great too, although smaller than I would have expected. Staff in all departments were friendly and accomodating. We were pleasantly surprised with a room upgrade, and a VIP escort to our room. Nice touch. During our entire stay we only ran into one staff member who may be employed by the Villas, who was unfriendly. Beware of the shuttle driver! His name is Maunalani (I think??) and he is a bit crabby and rude. He told one family that if their stroller didnt fit in the compartment that they would have to leave it on the street. Really? He stood out since everyone else had the "ALOHA SPIRIT". It didn't change our mind about the resort. We really loved it, and cant wait to go back. The food is great and pretty well priced in comparison to some neighboring restaurants. Will definately recommend this hotel to a couple and/or family. We thought it was great! A few tips for travelers: 1. Get to the pool early as can be expected, chairs go really really fast. If you can afford it, get a cabana. They are $50-$100 depending on each one, and they are worth it! But you have to reserve those early as well. 2. if you book your vacation through a package... GET THE BREAKFAST. The buffet is awesome, but $30.00 per person if you buy it when you get there. We had gotten our breakfast included in our package, and it really was a great deal. Our only real complaint was not about the hotel, but about the family in the room next to ours. They had children who would not stop screaming... and then of course the parents would start screaming at them. Seriously parents, I know you love your kids, but screaming kids at all hours of the day and night can really ruin other peoples trip. You aren't at home, you share a wall with someone who might want to relax on their vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Maui”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow34
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Ka'anapali and our first stay at The Westin. We chose this hotel not only for it's excellent location, but for the pools and the Westin quality. I was however quite surprised not to receive the traditional hawaiian welcome lei on arrival. It's the little things that make a stay sometimes. It is expensive here but then this is Hawaii so we weren't surprised. The hotel grounds are just beautiful and very relaxing, but the smell from the flamingo's/pond takes a bit of getting used to. The buffet breakfast is good although again overpriced. They were running a kids meal plan for under 12's for $15 per day which was a great deal, but it ended at the end of June. This could be something they could do more often to encourage families to eat at the hotel. The rooms here are average in size with a small bathroom. We had a mountain view room with amazing views and comfortable beds. The cleaning in the bathroom area could be improved around the tile/grout but on the whole housekeeping were good. We only had one night where it appeared there was a party going on next door to us, but the front desk addressed it immediately and said there wouldn't be any more issues with the people there. We were told the next day that the people were only staying 1 night and were attempting to crowd into one room, not what we expect at The Westin at all. Hopefully they will decline guests in the future wanting to stay 1 night since it obviously attracts people who can't really afford to stay there! All in all, this is a nice hotel in a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “we love it here.”
Reviews.Author: zeus1186grgod
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort in paradise. The people who work at the Westin Maui are very nice, especially our room attendant Virginia Galinato. Virginia is a wonderful person and she made sure our stay was extra special. She is an asset to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for kids, Couples should think twice”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelDoc
Reviews.Content: I took my whole family for a 7 day anniversary trip. Both children are under 5 years. Getting to the hotel is easy, 35-40 minute drive from airport. When we arrived they had two connecting rooms waiting for us as requested (major props for Westin). Rooms were clean but definitely showing their age (carpet was awful, beds fantastic). I give the rooms a = B-. What makes this hotel great is the pool and beach area. Attendants across the board were excellent without exceptions, beach was kid friendly, restaurants ample selection of meals at usually hotel prices and throughout the day many activities to get involved with to keep young children happy and busy. Pool, activities and food= A My only major complaint is their time share push upon arrival. I find this to be irritating and a waste of time. This just isn't my thing. They sales team was nice and intelligent but vacations need to be fun without any outside pressure. Avoid unless you are genuilnely interested in this kind of investment. I highly recommend watching Penn and Teller video on time shares (very informing). Time share = D Overall great trip for a family and this is the place to stay in that setting. Couples may have more fun in Kapalua or Wilea.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: KauaiKid100
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 9 days in Maui and had a wonderful time, staying at the Maui Westin on Ka'anapali Beach. This was my fourth time on Maui and this hotel was by far my favorite and best visit. The hotel is very conveniently located right next to Whaler's Village, so you are close to shops and restaurants. The beach in front of the Westin is one of the best parts of this location. It's a lovely stretch of ocean and was never crowded. The pools are nice too-I really only hung out at the adults pool and almost always was able to get a chair at any hour of the day. They even have an air hose for easy raft inflating. Very convenient. The hotel has a nice gym and I squeezed in some cardio a few days. The breakfast buffet was quite filling-lots to choose from and everything tasted great. I don't have kids but I noticed that there were a lot of activities for kids during the day. All in all, it was a great selection and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a really special time in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done a lot worse the first time in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: kanda4
Reviews.Content: Quality and Services: Check in was smooth with no issues. Dealing with the concierge personnel was a whole different story however. We found them exceptionally rude and misinformed about most of the available excursions. We booked a dinner cruise on the harbor in Lahaina which turned into a total disaster (overcrowded, terrible food, and awful scary boat employees). Room service was minimal but okay. Never left enough towels in the room. We have four of us in the room and they would only leave two towels every time! The parking lot was a big hassle every time. When you did find a parking space it was too narrow to park in! Found myself having to valet one night, but they were very nice about it and did not charge me for it. Overall though, this hotel is very clean and impressive and has a very high-end feel. The pool was very nice (which is why we picked this place) but impossible to find a chair unless you woke up at 6am andreserved it with a towel. Most of the people were very nice though and worked very hard. Dining: For a resort hotel it's size, it lacks great dining choices. We ate the breakfast buffet the first morning there and found out that was a big mistake. We ate the rest of our breakfast meals next door in Whaler's Village (a very nice little mall by the way). The snack bar at the pool was nice though and the people very friendly. I won't even mention the "upscale" restaurant and bar attached to the hotel facing the beach-what a joke! Warning! - Rooms are very small here and don't have room to store clothes, so we ended up living out of our suitcases quite a bit. Don't bring a lot of clothes or suitcases if you are going to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: trish97
Reviews.Content: Great stay here, would LOVE to come back and stay here again. We spent a lot of time here or walking a short distance to black rock. The pools are fun-for adults too! I'm surprised I didn't see anything about the birds, they start at 3 AM, I put earplugs in and was fine. Wonderful and great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff with special thanks to Corey!”
Reviews.Author: TX4613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui last month and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel staff were so friendly, helpful and just wonderful. Our 6-year boy accidently cut his leg open and while my husband had to run to get some medical aid, the hotel security stayed with our son and made sure he was taken good care of. Many, many thanks to Corey (in Security Department) for being a great kid-entertainer and distracting our son from the fear of the eventual stitches needed. We would love to nominate Corey "EMPLOYEE OF THE MONTH"

Reviews.Title: “Have visited this hotel 2-3 times per year for 6-8 years now; going again soon!”
Reviews.Author: CMartinson
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin-Maui is perfect for Island activities for all ages. The hotel staff (waiters, bartenders, spa & pool attendants, etc) have always been extremly friendly & helpful; and of course in my opinion your vacation experience often begins at check-in, and the Westin-Maui's front desk staff is as efficeint, thorough and friendly as you'll ever find. If you visit this hotle say hi to Dawn at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: WendyWN
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred Guest member and got the AAA rate for garden view (just above the terrace room level) for $247/night not including the additional $25 resort fee, which they might as well just add it into the hotel price. We stayed 3 days in Westin maui and then 3 days in Four Seasons. The room was adequate size, not very huge but okay for price we paid. My view wasn't bad and partially overlooked the water area where the flamingos/koi fish were so for that price, it was great. When we arrived, there were only 2 people at the desk with 5 other customers on line so it was a bit of a wait when we arrived at 5 PM to check in. Nothing special about check in. Flowers were on toothpick left out on the counter to take. Shell leis were hanging on a rack to take but no one to greet and pass them out. Rooms were clean and had the basics of coffeemaker/coffee/tea/sugar and small refrig and safe were convenient - made and ate simple bkft in the mornings. Loved their cute leaf shaped soaps and their shampoos/conditioners. They try to be eco friendly here. Beds were okay, not sure I'd call them Heavenly - a bit softer than I'd like it. Food at poolside which is same food at the Ono grill were pretty good. Didn't try Tropica restaurant. Whaler's village just right next door. Pool was nice and if you got there by 8 AM, there were still seats. Can't really hold and reserve seats without being there so it's good and bad depending on how you see it. The slide was cool and fun. We sought out our free 4x6 photo that was included in our resort fee - they don't remind you to sign up for a photo session, of course our pictures were so nice, we ended up paying the $100 package for the CD. The koi, flamingos and swan in the ponds/water were beautiful although sometimes smelled too strong of algae. Made wonderful background for photos. My son also went to the free stargazing and liked that as they looked through telescope. Didn't try any of the lei making sessions for small fees. Location overall was very nice and it was good value for what we got. They also had complimentary limited computer access for printing boarding passes if needed. Didn't take advantage of their complimentary shuttle into Lahaina, since there was free self parking so easy to come and go as we please. Would highly recommend and stay here again. Service could be better, but I'm used to taking care of many things myself - it didn't matter as much to me - whereas when we stayed at the Four Seasons it was definitely excellent service and large rooms but then you pay so much more for that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiitraveler24
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the ninth floor with an ocean view room with a king size bed. The room was nice; it had a flat screen TV, table, refrigerator, and bar area. The bed was very comfortable and we always got a good nightâ€™s sleep. The room was quite. We only hear noise if someone was talking right outside of our room. The pool was nice it had multiple pools with waterfalls, a hidden pool in a cave, and two water slides. You need to reserve your spot at the pool early because the lounge chairs fill up fast. If you want a place to sit on the beach they charge you to rent lounge chairs, umbrellas, or cabanas. Make sure you reserve them a day before because they always sell out early. They only have a limited number of them. Another thing that the only have a limited number of is parking spaces. They donâ€™t have enough spaces for the hotel. If you return back to the hotel after 8:30pm your chance of being able to Self Park are slim. If the lot is full, they will valet park your car for free, which is nice. Also, if you want to save some money on lunch, the Whalers Village shopping center has a food court on the lower level. They are right next to the hotel. The food was good and they had some of the same items that the hotel offered for $2.00 less. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel and will choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TMAC-MO
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 7 and 10 year old and the pools/waterslides were great. Beach is also very good. Front desk upgraded us to very nice room for nominal charge for which we were grateful as ended up with a view was of pool and ocean. Carpet could have used updating but was okay. Grounds are kept in excellent shape. Did not eat in restaurants as too expensive. Go to the ABC store located adjacent in the whalers village for breakfast and snacks. Overall, an excellent stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsWilliams1995
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter this resort you will be impressed. The Flamingos and Koi pond are awesome additions. The rooms are average sized, but if you get an ocean front view you will not be disappointed. The hotel is family oriented and you never have to leave the resort. Free Wi-Fi in your room and a gym. The location is second to none. Whaler's Village is walking distance as are many wonderful restaraunts such as Leilani's and Hula Grill. You will not be disappointed with your stay. The front desk also responds quickly to concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMM10000
Reviews.Content: Beach had beautiful, smooth sand and great swimming. Walked to snorkel at Black Rock. Next door to restaurants at Whaler's Village. Housekeeper, Gigi, added extra personal touches to make us feel very welcome. Room was small for the money, but clean, and enough space for what we needed. Pools are great, but claim your chairs early as they fill up fast. Excellent breakfast buffet (included in our package). Hotel is nonsmoking, however the people below us were smoking on their balcony. The smell was so bad that we couldn't sit on our balcony or leave our sliding glass door open. Complained to front desk 3 times to no avail. Management needs to penalize people for smoking, considering the room rates they charge. Was very disappointed that that mgmt. did not take this issure more seriously. Other downside was the $25 daily hotel fee.

Reviews.Title: “Miscommunication on Maui”
Reviews.Author: gradeschoolmom
Reviews.Content: I am the type of person who calls and does internet searches constantly, so Iâ€™m not usually caught off guard on vacations. Everything started with a room mishap. I was told I would get a â€œKing Suiteâ€� room from the 800 reservations operator, but when we arrived at noon on our scheduled day of arrival, we were given a single room with a king bed. That wasnâ€™t going to work for our family of four so after talking with the front desk, we were moved to a room with two doubles and a single sofa bed. I have a boy and a girl and they are too old to be sleeping together so my daughter got stuck with the sofa bed that was literally 24 inches wide and 5â€™8â€� long (we measured). There is no way an adult could sleep on this. We asked for another comforter to make the â€œbedâ€� more comfortable and were told there would be a $300 deposit required that they would refund if we didnâ€™t take it home with us. What? I didnâ€™t have to put a deposit down on the other two bedsâ€¦ After finally tracking down the night manager, at 9pm, we were told that they would fix our room situation the next day. Surprisingly, they did and we were VERY pleased! Still there was a lack of service and a lack of information that haunted us our entire stay. When I called a week prior and talked directly with the concierge, I was told that we would receive a lei greeting upon arrival. We didnâ€™t get our 59Â¢ shell leis until our second check-in day. A bummer for my daughter who was so looking forward to that Hawaiian custom. (You can order flower leis, but that is extra.) On my last trip to Maui (at another hotel), we were greeted with cool wash cloths and a glass of POG. I guess those days are over. There are beautiful waterfalls and flamingos and lots of beautiful places to take a family photo at the resort. You are even given one photo freeâ€¦ if you sign up the minute you arrive. The front desk never told us this and by the time we figured it out, it was too late and there were no more slots available during our stay. We got a shot with our own camera, but we were ready and willing to spend money on this for a professional photo. While at the pool, I was wondering why so many parents were ordering their kids $8 PB&J sandwiches. Is everyone here rich or do they have a secret? Yup, another feature that we missed. There is a new feature called the SPG Kids Pass. It is only $15 a day and includes breakfast at the â€˜Ono buffet ($30), lunch from the â€˜Ono Bar & Grill, Sea Dogs or â€˜Ono Poolside and then dinner from â€˜Ono (with dessert) as well. We figured we spent at least an extra $100 on our daughter that we didnâ€™t have to, in addition to wasting several of our free breakfast passes on her at the buffet. No one told us about this until our breakfast server did on our last day at the resort. Overall, we had a great time in Maui. How can you not enjoy paradise? It just would have been that much better if we could have enjoyed our resort even more. Here are a few tips on how to make your stay at the Westin Maui a great one: â€¢ Write down the exact room type you are to receive and call the front desk in Hawaii to confirm even after you receive your written confirmation. Donâ€™t rely on the 800 number as it isnâ€™t in Hawaii. Make sure they match. â€¢ Print it out the exact rate plan or promotion code that you are applying to your room and take it with you. There are so many different codes and discounts available. Our front desk agent had trouble with ours. â€¢ Ask about any kids discounts or programs that may be available. â€¢ Call the American Express Activities Center at the resort and have them email you a list of activities available before your arrival. This is not on the website. We worked with Stevie and she was wonderful. She made sure to remind us to pick up our forms early so we didnâ€™t lose our reservations for scuba and parasailing. â€¢ If you have curly hair, bring your own hair dryer. The ones provided donâ€™t have a low cycle, just high and higher. â€¢ Be aware that there is a $25 resort fee that is charged daily. This covers the self parking (valet is extra), the internet ($10 extra if you want higher speed), the gym, your free photo (if you can get on the list in time), two bottles of water in your room, etc. They should use this extra money to heat their pools and jaccuzi...brrrr. â€¢ Be prepared for the BIG sales push to buy into the Westin Villas up the road. Yes, the Westin needs some updating and maybe some better customer service, but we enjoyed ourselvesâ€¦itâ€™s Hawaii after all!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Isca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. To top it all off we used our points at this hotel so we actually stayed for "free". The service at the reception was friendly and efficient. We requested for an upgrade using our SPG points and there was no problem at all. Our room was on the 5th floor and had a wonderful view of the gazebo and waterfall .We also had a partial ocean view and a balcony. The room itself is your average-size resort room with amenities. Overall we enjoyed our room. The employees were very helpful and friendly. The location is great (next door to Whaler's wharf shopping center and not far from Lahaina). We had buffet breakfast everyday, made sure we are under an umbrella, and had fun watching the birds beg for or steal food left over from the plate. The servers sometimes are not fast enough cleaning the table. We would rate the selection and taste as average resort fare. We dined out so I cannot rate their restaurants. You know you have a very good hotel when you enjoy being in the hotel. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: kodySydney
Reviews.Content: This was the first time for me to Maui. Let me tell you it was not disappointing. When we got to check in I had booked a Premier Ocean View room with 2 double beds which was upgraded to a suite. I was a bit upset that it only had a King Bed as I was travelling with my daughter but they put in a rollaway which my daughter said was very comfortable. The housekeeping in the morning always greeted us with a smile. The pool areas are just beautiful. They have a adult only pool which I loved as it was so peaceful. Breakfast was amazing. When you book make sure you book the Beach Tower as rooms as bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great pool”
Reviews.Author: rdeharte
Reviews.Content: The room attendant Lenora really rocked. She seemed to always be aware of when we were out of the room and would always greet us with a smile. Each day our suite felt like we had just arrived. We enjoyed our visit and spent each day by the pool. The fish tacos poolside are the best! Only steps away is the beautiful beach for morning walks or a late in the day swim. The kids stayed at home this trip, but this would have been a great hotel for them. We hung out at the adult pool and the other pools were always full of action. Hats off to the Westin. We really enjoy Maui and look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: cosvas
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience staying in the hotel but especially because of our lovely and kind housekeeper Virginia Galinato who made great efforts to comfort us and take care of our needs. Thanks Virginia!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooner's Beware! Needs Major Renovations!”
Reviews.Author: Paradise114
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the Westin Maui in late June 2010 to celebrate our Honeymoon. First off, I must say this hotel has a very nice staff. Everyone was very pleasant during the duration of our 5-night stay. However, having said that I must say that this hotel is in need of improvement in many areas!!! We flew in on a Monday morning and arrived at the hotel at around 11:30 am and were told that the check in was not until 3pm. There were no spare rooms to refresh us after a couple long flights,. This was a slight annoyance but we got over it quickly and just let it go. The lobby area was very beautiful, had a beautiful waterfall, and it had a very warm inviting feel. When we finally got our room we were upgraded from a king/terrace view to a partial ocean view. Unfortunately however I was told that the room they selected for me had two twin beds. I unwillingly had to accept considering that this was a special occasion so I relented and just â€œwent with itâ€�. Now an issue I defiantly have is that this room was COMPLETELY outdated. The first giveaway is the acoustic â€œpopcornâ€� ceilings that are found in the hallways and room; I mean most places stopped using this type of ceiling back in the mid 1980â€™s! The room we stayed in had no closet; instead they put an armoire in the room, which shrinks the room considerably. The wallpaper in the sink area was peeling, the fire sprinklers were rusted, the balcony needed new paint, and the balcony table had cracked glass. It was just so disappointing! Even the elevator up to the room felt very dated and old. They added some paint to the doors to try and update it, but it still feels out of date. Overall, I mean this is Maui! Iâ€™m paying a lot of money to stay at a Westin Resort & Spa. I should have gone down to complain but my bride just told me to let it go, weâ€™re on our Honeymoon and only staying for five nights. I even earlier asked the very nice lady at concierge which tower was the more updated one, and she responded that they both were recently renovated. This was absolutely nothing that I noticed anyways. Another thing, I know that this hotel gets A LOT of honeymoon couples and thatâ€™s great. I mean Maui has always been HUGE for Honeymoon couples, I know that. But if this Resort could put in any effort in showing appreciation, it would go a long way. They did nothing to let us know that they were glad we decided to spend our honeymoon staying in their hotel. I had to ask the receptionist if they did any kind of flower lei greeting when we arrived. She went into the backroom and came back and handed us two shell leis, which was pretty nice. When I went to the room I asked the express service line if they had any kind of special honeymoon stuff that they do, like champagne or rose pedals on the bed. Later that evening I was surprised with a nice bottle of Champagne, so I thought WOW how nice is that! I thought this bottle would be a great way to celebrate my wifeâ€™s birthday, which was on Wednesday the 23rd. So I went and made dinner reservations at the hotel's Pacifica Restaurant for Wednesday at 6:30pm, just in time to eat dinner watching the sunset. Unfortunately though when I brought the bottle of champagne to the hotel restaurant I was told due to Maui liquor laws I couldnâ€™t drink it there, we had to drink it in our room. Now that is fine and all, I can be pretty understanding in regards to state liquor laws, but I wasnâ€™t offered any kind of alternative to the situation. The manager simply gave us a no, and the restaurant had to take it back to our room for us, we couldn't even take it with us. They then proceeded to show us their wine list and since we cant drink our honeymoon champagne for dinner, we can now instead buy some drinks! The waiter was very nice, but we decided to go to Cane & Taro which is next door in Whaler's Village, where we had a great dinner! Last, The $25 charge they make you pay is a complete rip-off. Now I know most hotels are using this â€œresort chargeâ€� these days, but itâ€™s a complete racket and Iâ€™m surprised some hotels havenâ€™t removed it yet as a courtesy. Among the things you are given for this charge are two small bottles of water per day and 1 photo session with a 4x6 image (more up sell opportunities for them to make more money) and I got to say for $25 a night the photographic company that takes the photos should call you to schedule an appointment â€œHi, my name is __________ we noticed that you recently checked in today and would like to know if you would like to schedule an appointment today for your photo session.â€� When we did go to make an appointment we were told they didnt have any openings until the following week! In closing, the pool was beautiful, and the staff was extremely nice, but this Starwood property needs some major updating! The nickel and diming of guests needs to stop somewhere. Instead of having multiple concierge associates, re-assign some of them to a specific task like following up with guests that are staying there for a special event! This is Maui, not some downtown slum! Show up the other resorts Westin! I know Iâ€™ve been pretty critical, but Iâ€™m pointing this stuff out so that they can learn and improve! Guestâ€™s who are traveling to Maui have a lot of options to choose from, and Westin is on prime real estate on Kaanapali beach! If they completely gut and renovate the property, it will be unbelievable! Until then I cant recommend this property to anyone, and will be sending people to the Hyatt, Marriott, or Four Seasons in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: sunshineseeker717
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui was probably one of the best hotel stays I've ever experienced. If you like being spoiled, this is the place to go on Maui. Upon entering, the open air lobby is breathtaking. There is a waterfall in the lobby, with a koi fish pond, flamingos & parrots all grazing about. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly, and the concierge was a great resource during our stay. The pool area was perfect for relaxing, and even had mini lockers to put your wallet, cell phone and key cards in while you swim (totally free). The food was delicious, the waves were a fun escape, and it was right in the middle of the resort area in Ka'anapali

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: mklai0526
Reviews.Content: Our son was married on the beach. Sheryl was wonderful in helping our son and daughter with the necessary arrangements for their wedding. The housekeeping staff was so pleasant and helpful also--GiGi was terrific. The staff at the Ono and Tropica Restauranst were also very accommodating and the food was terrific! We held the rehearsal dinner and wedding reception right there at the hotel. I would definitely recommend the Westin Maui Resort and Spa to anyone going to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: HaleyAK
Reviews.Content: I have been to this facility before on business, and I chose to return to the Westin this month primarily because of its Spa, gym, and its exercise classes. Most importantly, there is a daily spin class at 7 am on the outside patio. The spin instructors are great, and it is good to sign up the day before class in order to reserve a bike (you sign up at the Spa, which does not seem to be well-advertised). Spin instructor Lysha is particularly good. The gym is incredibly clean and has a full range of equipment, mats, balls, bars and weights, and the view from the gym is through floor to ceiling glass walls that overlook the pool area. Other positives: this facility works for teenagers because of the gym, the spa, the pools and the beach. Plus, Ka'anapali is centrally located for good day trips, such as ziplining. Lahaina is fun as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: ocdmartin
Reviews.Content: Wow. That's how I felt throughout our stay from the welcome we received from the valet service. A young gentlemen named Mandy greeted us with a huge smile and was very attentive to our needs. My wife needed a wheelchair and he immediately got one for us and then escorted us to the front desk instead of having us wait in line he had us sit in front of the beautiful pond area and then he introduced us to the manager Kehaulani who then got our keys and then to our surprise she helped me with my wife and took us to our room. The entire time we stayed at the resort everyone made us feel so special they really treated us like VIP. When we would come to the front Mandy greeted us by name and also helped us with directions he even offered suggestions for shopping and eateries. The restaurants in the hotel we really good too. All the accommodations were very nice too. Wonderful experience we will be back again next year

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with varied service”
Reviews.Author: michellef16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel as part of a Westin deal on its website. We are so glad we didn't pay full price. The reviews are correct in that the common space - including the pool and gym areas are great. We especially appreciated the adults only pool. The one common area that wasn't great was the parking lot. The spaces were too small and tight to fit all the cars. Since you have to pay a resort charge for all these my expectations were a little higher. Our room and the service was overall average. The room had been redone but there was too much furniture in there - making it feel crowded. Besides the people giving towels, the service was below average. The concierge wasn't only not helpful but rude when asking for help on printing out boarding passes (even though she wasn't busy). Please note all these comments have already been given to Westin. As a starwood rewards member, I will continue to look at Westins but won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is really a Westin?”
Reviews.Author: KBandMB
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that Starwood has dressed up like a Westin, but itâ€™s only superficial. The public areas are gorgeous, and the property has heavenly beds & showers, white tea bath products, and the â€œsuperfoodsâ€� menu. Beyond that, donâ€™t think of this as a Westin. Our 1st room was in the Ocean Towerâ€”this is the oldest section of the hotel, although we heard that some of the mountain view rooms had been renovated. Our ocean view room had awful lighting, dilapidated furniture, worn carpet, black stains in the grout, and no closets. The layout was very poor with too much furniture crammed in, which is probably why most people say the rooms are too small. Some reviewers have noted that the rooms are dirty, but it seems more like years of crud built up in various places that housekeeping just canâ€™t remove. One thing we noticed was sprinkler heads, of all things. One was completely rusted out and the other was so caked with dust & dirt that it was barely recognizable. Would they have worked in a fire? Maybe, but their condition shows a total lack of regard for guests. On day 2 we went to the front desk and started describing the issues with our room. Before we got halfway through the list, the clerk was already moving us to a room in the Beach Tower. This room was MUCH better, although the couch looked like something they had found on the side of the road. It was filthy. We were warned there might be noise from Whalerâ€™s Village, but this was not a problem. The staff was pleasant, even though they were usually overwhelmed. Day after day there was a line at the front desk and the phone rang off the hook as 1 or 2 clerks worked diligently. Meanwhile, 6 or 7 concierges (a.k.a. timeshare salespeople) stood around chatting together. Either hire more desk staff or train those concierges to help out. There is no SPG member check-in. Bottom line is that this place needs a major overhaul. Maybe the Beach Tower can do with just a sprucing upâ€”new carpet & tile, fresh paint, furniture replacement, etc. The Ocean Tower needs to be gutted and modernized. Either that or Starwood needs to re-brand this property as something lower than a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, not so great for couples”
Reviews.Author: phenom74
Reviews.Content: Just finished up a stay at the Westin Maui for 5 nights. As an SPG Gold member, I was able to redeem some points for this hotel. The pools and lobby area are beautiful. The rooms are decent. There is a little fridge which is helpful. We went to Safeway and Walmart to save on snacks and drinks. We were put on the 2nd floor facing the parking lot so it was pretty noisy in the morning. I've stayed at Starwood hotels all over the world and this was the most crowded resort by far. As mentioned by other reviews, there are lots and lots of kids running around. On our first day, it was so crowded that we couldn't get a chair at the pool. It was around 11am. The trip did get better and the surrounding area is nice and you could walk to a lot of places like Whalers Village. If you decide to go to Maui I would recommend checking out Front st. This area is a 6-8 minute drive from the hotel and has cool shops and restaurants that are right on the beach. We ate at Kimo's and Lahaina Fish Co. If you make reservations, you will most likely get a table with a great ocean view. We watched the sunset from Lahaina Fish Co. and the view was PHENOMENAL. The food and prices at Kimo's and Lahaina FIsh Co. are decent. Also on Front St. was Ululani's Hawaiian Shave Ice. This was the best shaved ice we had in Maui. You could tell they take great pride and care into making each shaved ice creation. Do not get a shaved ice at the snack bar at the Westin, it immediately turned into a solid piece of ice and was difficult to eat. So in conclusion, the Westin Maui would be more appropriate for families or for people looking for an active vacation (snorkeling, surfing, etc.). This is a decent hotel but for the points and prices I've seen, I don't think it's a great value. From a Starwood points perspective, I think the Le Meridien Cancun or Westin Cancun gives you a better value. If you were looking for a more romantic or relaxing place, don't go here. I would recommend Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and beautiful location! Perfect in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: GWENCO
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, we requested an upgrade and they gave us ocean view rooms! We were traveling with my son and his family so we had two separate rooms. This hotel is right on the beach and offers an array of various activities throughout the day. The restaurant offers a buffet breakfast which you can dine with an ocean view and is excellent! Two weddings were held in the two days we were there. They even have a special gazebo for such events! 4 pools including an adult only pool. It is just a perfect place! Although it offers a shuttle service, we never used it since it only goes as far as Hilo Hatties on Front St so if you wish to hike it, they have a schedule. The resort (along with most Sheraton/Westin's) charge a daily $25 resort fee which includes your parking. The lot was full both nights we came back and they valeted the van free of charge. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: dallasw0rldtraveller
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were at the Westin for 6 days the first week of June...I found the hotel through trip advisor. Its a beautiful resort from the moment you get to the lobby. A lot of people on here will say how the rooms are small but those are the people who are staying in a room with their kids so obviously it would be too small for them. It definitely was not too small for the two of us. The hotel is a 3 star hotel so I find it rather ridiculous when people complain about the rooms when at the time they booked they already knew the star rating of the hotel. This is Maui people, expect to pay more for less. IN EVERYTHING!!. Now the resort is beautiful...We only slept in our room and for that reason we got a terrace view/golf course/mountain view...(its a parking lot view)...No need to pay for an ocean view if you do not plan to ever be in the room...you could use that extra money for breakfast or something else..The pools are awesome - loved them...their is an adults only pool with a bar and we lay out their if we weren't in the ocean...if you are a couple without kids, then these place may drive yu nuts..I think for us the fact that the 1st week of June is still low season was why we decided on the place. If I was travelling during peak season without kids I would not stay their...I am telling you...lots and lots of kids!!! The beach is gorgeous...the hotel happens to have the best beach I have seen in a long time...Lots of beach area and the sand is amazing... Food is very expensive at the hotel...whaler's village is close by but if you are dining its also expensive, if you are just eating normal junk well thats cheap...your better off going into the town of Lahaina...Their are lots of places with ocean front views in Lahaina to eat at... If you get a chance got to Mama's fish house in Paia...UNBELIEVABLE FOOD...YUMMY!!!... We really had a great time but my husband and I are very adventorous and we did so many activities...I recommend the helicopter tour with Blue Hawaiian...By far the highlight of our trip.. Despite our good time we will prolly never return...We spent almost $7K on the entire trip for a whole week (hotel, flights, car, activities, food, drink). We prolly could have spent less had we not indulged so much but our reasoning was "This is a one time deal!!" The bottom line is we could go to Jamaica or another carribean island, spend half of that and had much better service and an ocean front room with all food and drinks inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jodes727
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a honeymoon we had! We arrived late the first night at the Westin and were greeted by employees and had our bags brought up to our room for us. From the first night that we were there we had nothing but great service! The breakfast buffet each morning was delicious which we usually followed by a walk on the beach. Following our walk we would head to the pool or out to the beach. Both of those locations were great and relaxing. There were several pools and we found one which was 'adults only' and was very relaxing; however we did enjoy going down the water slide in another pool too :) The food at the Westin was very good. We ate at Tropica one night and it was wonderful. Another night we had tapas at Ono and that too was fantastic. We also visited the spa at the Westin and had wonderful massages and the whole spa was great! Overall, we couldn't have asked for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Overall the best resort we have stayed at in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Beery_10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, facility and amenities. The grounds were beautiful, all the facilities were clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and the service was very good. We had the breakfast buffet each day and it was outstanding. The pools were awesome! You are just steps away from other good restaraunts and shopping. Ka'anapali beach and the views are amazing. Concierge staff was helpful, there is a photographer on the property who took some great photos for us. We went to their luau, which was entertaining and the food was very, very good. The only minorly irritating thing was our "personal concierge" who left several messages for us to come for our personal consultation and gift (translated to trying to sell vacation time share), but this was easily avoided. My wife, 10 year old son and I had a truly fantastic stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Maui, Only place I didnt want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Anh-voi-Em
Reviews.Content: The Westin sits on prime beach In Ka anapali. Its located south of Black Rock right by whalers villiage. We stayed there 2 weeks and loved every minute of it. The beds were awesome the staff friendly and the resturaunts on hand were good. The shuttles take you to its sister resort north of black rock which had good snokling. Lahina is also 10-15 minutes away with shuttle and they run all the time. MOvies and entertainment at night were laid back and welcoming. We did sit in on the sales pitch for a fractional ownership of the "westin villas" decided not our deal but they were never pushy. I would only say this to wouldbe visitors. Prepare to spend some money for an extended stay here as its over $500 a night for beach view on the newer wing. Oh I would also prefer the north wing its newer and your beach view doesnt consist of the 5 pools they have on site. If you go make sure to have one of their sausage egg sandwhiches in the colonade for breakfeast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good location, great pools and beach”
Reviews.Author: worksuckstravelmore
Reviews.Content: We spent part of our honeymoon here. Let me first say that we got a great package for 6 nights here through Costco, which included room charge and resort fee, daily breakfast buffet for 2 (and what a buffet it was!), some credits ($100) towards meals at the hotel, and a rental car for our entire stay. We paid a little more to get pool and ocean views, it came out to app. $300/night. I would have loved to stay at the Four Seasons but this was wayy more affordable, and the staff met all of our needs. The pools and our room were clean the entire stay, no issues. The stretch of beach behind the hotel is one of the busiest in Maui, but it was never overly crowded. Of course you should go find the secluded beaches on the island too. I can't wait to go back!! Oh we enjoyed the spa too which was also clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, and over priced!!!!”
Reviews.Author: olliefied
Reviews.Content: The rooms are okay. The only good thing about the hotel is the location on the beach. The pool is very small and crowded with small children. The restaurants are very over priced and below average. I ordered prawns that cost $10 dollars, and received 2 of the most pitaful sized shrimp, Yes 2 shrimp!!!!! The drinks are the worst on the island. My wife and I ordered two Mai Tais @ $9.75 a piece and they were the served in something a little bigger than a shot glass. Over all this resort will suck your money fast.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, WOW, WOW - ABSOLUETLY AMAZING STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: peacelovetravelNh
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing but GOOD things to say about the Westin in Maui. Put it this way - everywhere I travel now, I always compare it to my stay at the Westin. Thus farm nothing beats it! The rooms are so clean, the staff is very friendly, and the atmosphere will make you forget all your troubles. I plan on going back again and again (well... when I have saved up enough money - it is not a cheap place to stay). If you are looking for a relaxing, clean, and amazing place to stay in Maui.... THIS IS IT! KUDOS WESTIN!

Reviews.Title: “One word that describes Westin......Perfection”
Reviews.Author: mauil0ve
Reviews.Content: Fell in love with the Westin as soon as I stepped foot into the lobby. Seeing the flamingos just put a smile on my face. Although we didn't get greeted with a shell lei we still got a warm welcome from the front desk. After reading all the reviews of course I was worried about the state our room was going to be in when we walked in. We got up to our room (939) and were beyond thrilled to see a spotless and upgraded room. The room overlooked the pool and ocean. Magnificent grounds and rooms. I wouldn't say the rooms were small. I would describe them as Cozy. At about 7 am i would step out on the balcony and see people starting to reserve their chairs for the day. Even though there were reserved chairs we never had a hard time finding lounge chairs. The ones that seemed to go the fastest were the ones under the Tiki Umbrellas. The pool was always clean and the water was perfect. The one thing that I was alittle dissappointed with was that the "Family" pool is meant for people who are there with children, and the "Adult" pools is meant for people there with no children. I noticed alot of people who were there without children overtook the family pool. I am pretty sure that if I took my 5 year old to the adults only pool I would have been asked to leave. One day after coming back from a sunrise tour I was ready for a realxing massage. I called the spa to ask if I could get an appointment that day. I was pleasantly surprised they asked if I could come down in an hour. YES YES and YES I said. the locker room was fantastic and I could have stayed in there all day. But as I walked into the waiting area I thought I stepped onto a movie set. All the chairs are facing what seemed like a glass wall overlooking the ocean. AWESOME place to kick back and have some Mommytime. I had the BEST massage from Paris and the most Amazing facial from Maria. I hope when I make it to Maui again they both will still be there. I walked out feeling like a million bucks. MAHALO to the whole spa staff !! If you are searching for a place to stay in Maui. Look no further ! Westin is a fabulous place to stay for your Hawaii getaway. Not only is it gorgeous, but it is close to everything. Stay at the Westin you will not be disappointed ! ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: babykurt06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the westin in May 2010 I was so shocked to read the Bad reviews that people wrote. This resort was absolutely gorgeous. I don't even understand why people are saying the rooms are small its not a condo. I thought the rooms were the perfect size for my husband and myself. We had what I believe was the best view, we could see the ocean , mall and the black rock trust me it doesn't get any better than that. The elevators are fast that's also a plus. Our room was always cleaned really well by the house keepers. The breakfast bar is really good , my husband is the pickiest eater around and he loved it. I would recommend this hotel and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Just about the best thing in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ilovebeingadad
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip and it did not disappoint. The beach, the pool, the ambience of the place just make it a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: The Westin continues to be a great resort. The resort location is perfect. Whalers Village is right next door, so there is easy access to plenty of shopping and dining options. Within walking distance to Black Rock. You can room-charge the snorkel gear at the Sheraton - so it does not get any easier. We saw to largest sea turtle there just about 10 feet out from the beach! We did get a free upgrade that included a pullout sofa and two doubles. It was very comfortable. The internet worked great. A previous post noted you were limited to one wifi connection - we did not have that problem as we had (2) laptops going. There is a refrigerator in the room- which was very convenient for drinks. The staff was great - no problem with a late check out (2pm). The parking lot has always been a little small and we had to valet one night since it was full. There was no charge for the valet. The pools are still great with the best waterslide ever! I can not think of anything that could have made our stay better.

Reviews.Title: “Gigi took care of our room extremely...”
Reviews.Author: MixmasterSamir
Reviews.Content: Gigi took care of our room extremely well, she was a pleasure to have and we are happy with her service. Scott was also amazing in helping us organize our week of activities right from the start. He always followed up and catered to our preferences. The hotel made us decide to forfeit all future vacations and only come here every few years because it's PARADISE. The food, location, view, friendly staff, everything was just outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: aggieamy5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Hawaii on May 1 to 13, 2010 and spent 3 nights on Oahu, 4 nights on Kauai, 3 nights on Maui, and 2 nights on the Big Island of Hawaii. We stayed at the Westin on May 8 to 11, 2010. We are a young couple in our late 20â€™s and fell in love with this hotel! We arrived at the Westin around 2 pm and were able to check into our room early. We booked an ocean view room and were assigned to the 11th floor in the Beach Tower. Upon arrival, the Westin gives each of their guests a shell lei which I thought was a nice touch. (None of the other hotels we stayed at while in Hawaii gave out any type of lei.) The view from out room was absolutely perfect. Some on Trip Advisor have complained about the Westinâ€™s small rooms, but we have nothing to complain about. Yes, the rooms are a little smaller than a typical hotel room, but we felt like we still had plenty of room. The beds at the Westin are very comfortable, and we always got a very good nightâ€™s sleep while we were there! The hotelâ€™s grounds are immaculate and quite beautiful. There are waterfalls everywhere in and around their five pools. The pools are large and only about 2 or 3 people were in each one at any given time. One of the pools has a water slide. The Westin has a lagoon with several flamingos and two swans. They also have parrots and a cockatiel. We stayed at Atlantis Resort in the Bahamas a few years ago and the Westin reminded me of a small slice of Atlantis. The Westin is in a perfect location on Kaâ€™anapali Beach and only a short walk to the Whalerâ€™s Village. There are several restaurants around the Whalerâ€™s Village and there is also some nice shops there. The Westin is also about a five minute walk along Kaâ€™anapali Beach to Black Rock. My husband and I loved Kaâ€™anapali Beach. In fact, it is one of our favorite beaches in all of Hawaii! There were always plenty of chairs by the pool, but the hotel does not offer free chairs for the beach like our hotel on Kauai did. Also, we never felt like the beach, pools, or hotel was overrun with kids as some have said. We only saw about 3 kids the whole time we were there. This may have been due to the fact that we were there in May and school was not out yet. The only complaint we have about the hotel is the size of the parking spaces. Although there were always plenty of parking spaces to choose from for self-parking, the spaces were super small. My husband usually had to back the car out for me so I could get inside and I am a small person! One time, someone parked too close to my husband, and they only way he could get into the car to drive it was from the passengerâ€™s side! If I remember correctly, the self parking at the hotel was free but Iâ€™m sure you are paying for it in the $25 per night â€œresort feeâ€� they charge! Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Westin and would definitely stay there again the next time

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: jacampbell1963
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel with a large group from our company. It was great for all as some of the group brought their families. There was plenty for the kids to do with the pools and beach nearby. Food was great at all of the restaurants and the service was the best I've had in Maui. I will be coming back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay, but come prepared”
Reviews.Author: WBMart
Reviews.Content: I am part of the Starwood program, used points, and got a room upgrade to a suite. So yes, the room was nice and the view was great. I stayed in the main part of the hotel and really have no complaints. The rooms were just like Westin rooms at other properties. If Ocean view is important to you, call ahead or make sure that your room is an ocean view room. The hotel itself is nice appointed and decorated in an asian style. The koi pond and waterfall that greet you in the lobby are very nice and soothing. The pool area is impressive and very kid friendly. I have a 10 year old and we just turned him loose on the pool. No need for kids club. If you do not have kids, beeline for the adult pool. The biggest stress of the day was getting chairs by the pool. It is first come first serve, so you need to be down there before 6:00 AM if you want anything. You can also reserve chairs on the beach or beach cabanas for a fee but you need to call at least one day in advance to guarantee. Pleanty of charter companies for activities (sailing, snorkeling, scuba, whale watch, etc.) I recommend walking down to the Sheraton and snorkling black rock. Very friendly waters and cool fish. If you can get breakfast included in your rate, that is the way to go. The buffet is $28 ($15 for kids), really good, but can blow your budget up. The poolside restaurant is good as well. Was not impressed with the bar. Specialty drinks were not good. There is an attempt to get you to see the timeshare property, but they asked me once and then left me alone. We also did the Luau and were disappointed. It was basically an average dinner with a show. Seating is first come first serve. Being in a chronically late family, we sat in the back. I have been to luaus before, and this deviates from traditional elements. It was easy for a family, but not the experience I wanted. All in all, I recommend the hotel We enjoyed it and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Maui_Napa_Vegas
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is perfection for us. We absolutely love this hotel for many reasons, friendly staff, spacious rooms, sparkling pools and a soft sandy beach. We've been staying at the Westin Maui for the past 4 years, always during the Feb/Mar timeframe. It's the perfect break from the Chicago winters. A great vacation starts with a great room with a great view. The hotel has a range of rooms: mountain view, ocean view, deluxe ocean view and premium deluxe ocean view. We've stayed in all of them over the years, but have found the premium deluxe ocean views rooms are the best value. Believe me, paying the incremental cost to get the premium deluxe room is well worth it. The room is larger with a couch, larger lanai with beautiful views of the pool and beach. The Westin offered a great promotion, pay for 2 nights, get one free, including daily breakfast buffet. Take advantage of this offer (if available). The morning breakfast buffet exceeds expectations, it includes all of the standard breakfast greats, plus a made to order omlette station. It's a great way to start the day. We alternated our days between the adult pool and the beach cabana. Definitely rent the beach cabana for a day ($55), but make a reservation the day before because they are in demand. The cabana attendant brings you waters throughout the day and freshcut pinnapple for a light snack. The cabanas are much quieter than the pool, steps from the ocean and perfect location to watch the whales in the distance. On the days we spent at the pool, we took advantage of the "drink of the day", always something tasty and refreshing, especially the mai tai! For those who like to hit the gym on vacation, the Westin offers a plenty, lots of machines and free weights. It's next to the Spa, overlooking the pool. I always have a deal with my girlfriend, when I go play golf, she gets to go to the spa. She always love the treatments. For golfers, the Kaanapali course behind the hotel is perfect, you could walk to the clubhouse or the valet guys will drive you over. Ask about the 2 and 4 round specials. In the evening, you cannot beat sitting out on the lanai, watching the sunset, and enjoying a cocktail. The Westin is close to Lahaina (5 mins) with lots of great restaurant options, Lahaina Grill, I/O, Pacifico, and Mala, all offering fantastic seafood dishes. Talk to the Westin conceirge to book the reservations. On our day of departure, the Westin helped us maximize our final day of pool time by accomdating us with a late checkout and access to a courtesy guest room to freshen up before the long overnight flight. We can't wait to return next March for another wonderful trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Maui !”
Reviews.Author: srrak8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa last month to celebrate our 33rd anniversary and used a combination of points and cash for the room. The hotel was everything we hoped it would be and more! As a Starwood Platinum member, they upgraded us to a top floor, ocean front suite that included a living room and separate bedroom. The rooms were beautifully designed with a contemporary feel that included a wet bar, 2 balconies, and a Bose sound system. Upon our arrival, Craig Anderson, the General Manager, sent us complimentary champagne and delicious local chocolates. The beach and pools were amazing with other activities and shopping within easy walking distance next door at Whalers Village. The charming town of Lahaina is close by and offers a variety of restaurants and shopping. Weâ€™ve previously stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani, which is also a beautiful property; however, the location in Wailea is not as convenient and we preferred being closer to Lahaina. We dined at three outstanding restaurants during our stay including the Plantation House Restaurant in Kapalua, Mamaâ€™s Fish House in Paia and the Lahaina Grill. Kudos to Craig Anderson for creating a world class resort in a perfect setting!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: MattL70
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights on a business/family vacation. Traveling across time zones with two small children and staying in a hotel room is always a challenge, but we were impressed with the staff's friendliness and attention to us and our kids. The pool is great and the beach was wonderful. Our only niggling complaint was that the restaurant could offer more little kid friendly offerings for dinner. The business conference facilities were well managed and the operations were invisible, allowing us to focus on the meetings. Service and food were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: TinaTSeattle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Maui Westin with a friend of mine for a "girls vacation". The room was lovely and very comfortable. The hotel staff was fabulous, incredibly helpful and responsive. I loved the pools and beach and spent several days just "hanging" out, drinking fru fru drinks and walking on the beach. There are a ton of activities to do as well, very close to the hotel. I also used several spa services (heavenly facial) which was great, very relaxing. I was feeling a little guilty though as it's also a great place to take the family, I was starting to miss my kids!

Reviews.Title: “If you have to go corporate, you'll be happy here...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: If I am not a lover of corporate chains, just why am I hanging out at the Westin in Ka'anapali??? I'm tagging along (AKA "mooching") with my husband at his company's annual corporate recognition event! Thank God I'm in Maui... I'll start with location. The resort's location in Ka'anapali is what resulted in a one-star reduction. It isn't the Westin's specific location...it's Ka'anapali in general. If you don't mind eating mediocre food three times a day and seeing nothing of the native culture, you can add the star back on. In order to have a plethora of 5-star experiences - in both food and activities - you have to drive a lot, pretty much a minimum of 20 minutes one way. Our room...well, well, well. This is where corporate shines. My husband arrived a few days before me...and prepared me. I knew it was going to be great when this normally sedate man called me and told me to prepare myself for the room...he was actually kind of embarrassed. When we're footing the bill, we stay in glorified closets. On the corporate dole, our "room" was the size of a small apartment and over looked both the pool and the ocean. We had four balconies. The bath "room" was just that...a room (about the size of my bedroom at home). We also had a living room, office area, dining room, bedroom, and guest bath (that never saw a tush). The decor was...mmmm, corporate (completely lacking in personality), but I am surely not complaining. The pool...we hid in the adult pool section, away from the squealing kids sliding down (and up) the water slides. If our kids had been with us, I have no doubt that they would have never left the kids' pool. In the adult sanctuary, you will find two quiet pools with lots of lounge chairs (never had to look farther than a few feet for an empty one), a small jacuzzi, and an adult bar with roving server (ahhhh...perfect for those poolside lava flows). Service...mostly impeccable, starting with the porters at the front door and ending with the room service ladies. (If you don't want a.m. and afternoon nap wake-up service, you need to make good use of the "Do Not Disturb" placard.) The exception was the restaurant staff...plan on repeating yourself a lot, waiting patiently for things to arrive (i.e., menus, food, checks, etc.), and - if you're lucky - you might get to see the hostess sleep standing up. Tips...the poolside restaurant is not too overpriced and serves a decent lunch. You'll go broke if you eat there for breakfast (or at the walk-up snack stand where I paid $17 for a bagel, tea and pineapple). The porter who brought me up to my room gave me a great tip cementing my philosophy that you never miss an opportunity to ask a local for advice. (I brought him a cream puff from the island's best local bakery later in repayment...he then called me "Cream Puff". This is what life is all about.) Talk to Bob, the local macaw...Bob is funny. Would I stay here again? Sure...if someone else pays the tab. If it's on me, I'd take my usual un-corporate path...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rooster0306
Reviews.Content: Our family had an enjoyable stay at the Westin Maui. The kids loved the pool area and especially the slide. My 7 year old son said the slide was "awesome". Enjoyed this hotel for the location of Kaanapali and the all the great benefits the Kaanapali area has to offer. We enjoyed are stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: TonyG51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Maui 4 times in the last 2 years. We used to debate which hotel was better on Kaanapali beach, the Westin or the Hyatt. Our past opinion was that the great pool and location of the westin made up for it's tiny rooms. Not anymore. I don't know what has happened to the Westin in the last year since our last stay but it looks like it has been ridden hard and put away wet. The housekeeping was terrible. We complained about it 2x to the manager and nothing was done. Our bathroom floor was not cleaned one time during our 8 night stay. We had to ask the maid to vacum our floor. Even the public areas are dirty now at this hotel, the elevators, the hallway carpets, all the flagstone. The management of the westin has got to know that their rooms are way too small.... so guess what, they better be spick and span to make up for it. They are not even close. Take your money down the beach to the Hyatt. It has a smaller pool and not as good of a location but everything else is better there for the same price. If you are someone who has high expectations for your 3500 dollars on a trip, you will be dissapointed with the Westin. I'm embarassed that we reccomended the westin to our relatives who went to Maui 2 months ago. We will not be staying at the Westin anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jfhall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 9 nights at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa which we booked through Expedia one year ago in May of 2009. We went on our honeymoon and had the vacation of our dreams! We arrived at the hotel at about 7:30 in the evening and the check-in was quick and efficient. When we went up to our room, champagne was waiting for us with a card congratulating us on our marriage. After unpacking we walked around the resort grounds for a while, taking in the gorgeous open-air lobby â€“ flamingoes, ducks and parrots that call the resort ponds and trees their home. Our 9th floor premium deluxe oceanview room was the perfect size for the two of us, it included a king bed (which really is heavenly!), a sofa, a dresser, a refrigerator stocked with 2 bottles of water (which was re-stocked every day), a coffeemaker and a desk. The room was very quiet, we never heard our neighbors. The lanai was furnished with two chairs and a table and was also the perfect size for the two of us to relax with books or watch the sunset. Our last night in Maui, we ordered room service (which was very reasonably priced!) and wheeled the cart onto the lanai and had a beautiful dinner under the stars overlooking the resort and ocean with the sound of waves crashing in the distance, it was fabulous! Our vacation package included breakfast for two every morning, so each morning we enjoyed the breakfast buffet (a huge selection of food, absolutely DELICIOUS, especially the omelets and smoothies) overlooking Kaâ€™anapali beach and the ocean. We spent quite a few days lounging around the adult pool, a very quiet and spacious pool thatâ€™s elevated from the others (so you can relax easier without kids running around you) with lava flows and a private bar. The pool was surrounded on all sides with lounge chairs, and as others have said there were lots of lounge chairs that were being reserved with towels, however we could usually find two lounge chairs side by side. We also took advantage of renting covered beach lounge chairs through the resort which was fantastic! The beach right outside the resort is also great â€“ incredibly soft sand, gently waves, and plenty of room to lay out a towel. We loved that the Westin was so close to the shopping center next door â€“ a great place to grab some ice cream or purchase some Maui souvenirs for your family back home. Thereâ€™s also a food court with a McDonaldâ€™s for a cheap meal if you would prefer. There are a few restaurants located on the boardwalk. None of them are as good as the restaurants in downtown Lahaina though (in my opinion), so if youâ€™re looking for a good place to eat or great night life then definitely head out to downtown Lahaina for the evening. Lahaina has local restaurants along with chain restaurants (such as Bubba Gumps and Red Lobster) and they range from cheap to expensive and everything in between, so thereâ€™s something for everyone. Just a side note â€“ best burgers weâ€™ve ever had was at Cool Cat CafÃ© in downtown Lahaina! There is a $25 resort fee charge per day which includes use of the gym, parking lot, wireless internet, bottles of water and other little things like pool towels. We knew about it before we got there so we were expecting it and it seemed reasonable. Especially since we used the internet so much while we were there. Other than the beautiful grounds, delicious breakfasts, spacious rooms (with truly heavenly beds), some other pluses: we could always find parking even in the evening with the exception of once when we had to valet because the lot was full, the location is perfect, and the resort is large enough that even if all the rooms were filled it still wouldnâ€™t feel crowded, and the snorkeling available at Black Rock is a huge plus. There are tons of activities that the resort offers (snorkeling, surf lessons, para-sailing, scuba lessons, crafts, and many more) all with an extra cost, but fun stuff for all ages. You cannot go wrong with choosing the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. Mahalo, West Maui, for giving us the honeymoon of our dreams! We hope to return for our 5-year anniversary :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: scrata052010
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were pleasantly surprised by the Westin on Kaanapali beach. The hotel not only had friendly staff, but was very clean. We stayed in a terrace view room and it was very clean and spacious. It overlooked the mountains/golf course and had a hint of a view of the ocean in the distance. The lobby area had a beautiful waterfall, koi pond, and multiple tropical birds (flamingos and parrots) making it delightful. The pools were connected, but they had separate pools also for the kids and the adults. The beach was easily accessible and was kept very clean. In all, the hotel was wonderful, peaceful, clean, and beautiful. The only negative would be the cost in the restaurants, but all the resorts restaurants are pricey. If you walk down the path along the beach, there are a few restaurants that serve happy hour drinks and food items. Also, if you're looking for nightlife, there wasn't any. I suggest driving down to Front street were there are a few places to people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away...”
Reviews.Author: RESTISBEST
Reviews.Content: Checked in - large purple stain on rug - bedspread stained - room not dusted (dustballs) - fingerprints everywhere - white loveseat was gray and black and stained - bathroom smelled like urine and mildew - receive lifted on phone had black bugs crawling in and out. I was stuck on a group vacation in Maui at this hotel. The resort looks nice when you walk in...the rooms are filthy. I took another room - downgraded to two doubles from a king - bathroom did not smell like urine but the filth was everywhere. The second room had sugar spilled by the coffee maker. The sugar did not get cleaned up the entire week we were there. The floor had potato chip crumbs that were also not cleaned up the entire week we were there. I used a towel to hold the hairdryer as that too was very dirty. I cried the entire first night I was there. Slept with the lights on every night and kept my suitcases zipped for fear of what crawled around. The staff will only recommend trips/tours if they do business with the company. I suggest researching things to do before arriving in Maui. The hotel is dirty but I do have to say the staff is friendly. If you go here - you are stuck until your plane leaves. Don't ruin your trip. Maui is not cheap to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation in Maui”
Reviews.Author: RunnerJac
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I spent 4.5 days at the Westin Maui hotel, which we very much enjoyed. Upon arrival at the airport we realised that a taxi would cost us $100 whilst a shuttle (which according to the hotel we should have pre-booked) would have cost us $60; therefore we picked up a car from Avis for $153. The hotel staff were very nice and our room was ready upon our arrival at 2pm. We had a view of the ocean and the balcony was perfect for sipping champagne while watching sunset.
