The room which contained two double beds was somewhat small although we appreciated the fridge. Two things - make sure you ask for the ocean tower and I'd ask for a floor in the upper level so you can see the beach as well; it was a little limited from the 4th floor! The gym and 5 pools were great; particularly the adult pool. The food was fabulous as well. We chilled out and read books by the pool and then snorkeled at Black Rock at the Sheraton. Our only criticism is we found the food to be very expensive; not so much the poolside food but rather breakfast options and dinner. If you are looking for sushi - try Genki Sushi at the shopping center next to Lehaina Farms (the Westin shuttle drops off and picks up passengers which will also allow you to buy water, soft drinks etc for your room). Overall though, a very relaxing experience and I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandHeather222
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon. 10 days total. We are the "picky" type couple, and we scrutinize easily, especially when it comes to services, hotels, etc. Let me just say that we were very pleased, and some with this resort. First off when you arrive you walk in and its like a rain forest, opens to big trees with a surrounding pool filled with big koi fish, pink flamingos and native birds. The decor is asian themed, which is pretty cool. samurais and chinese artwork and sculptures. This was nice instead of the cheesy touristy hawaaian print everywhere. We got an "ocean view" room. We were on the 3rd floor facing whalers village, our view was amazing. it was not ocean FRONT, but ocean view, meaning a view of the ocean. since we were near the front we had an awesome view of kaanapali beach and up to black rock. there was a parking lot below us and at times in the early morning you can hear the beer trucks and delivery trucks backing up, unloading, etc. but once the morning rush is over, who cares, the view of the ocean and the sunsets is 100 times better. We were perfectly located centrally. being directly next to whalers village was a HUGE plus because there are cheaper restraunts at the food court, AND an ABC store, which basically has every and anything you need. The staff are very professional and good at what they do. always smiling, always willing to help. the host for breakfast even remembered our names, which was impressive given all the people they see on a daily basis. the room was very spacious, large king bed, huge dresser. big desk and workspace, a couch, and huge bathroom. AND the shower, wow, best ever. the water pressure was very very powerful, felt so good after a day on the beach and the pool. we got massages in the morning, but was a little overpriced at 145 bucks for 50 minutes, for 2 thats 300 dollars, which looking back would be better spent on shopping or nice dinners and drinks. DRINKS at the hotel are expensive. 11 dollars for mai tais and daquiris, so prepare. ALSO, take the 25 bus to lahaina mall and go food shopping and get drinks, sodas, snacks, meats and cheeses. It is VERY expensive to eat in Maui, VERY. TIP: if available purchase the program that offers free breakfast buffett. it was WELL worth it considering eggs and bacon is 18 dollars per person, not including beverages. we ate breakfast at the hotel every morning, check wtih your booking agent about upgrading to a room offering free breakfast. snorkeling out front is amazing, directly out front of hotel. black rock was cool just to say you snorkeled there and take some pics, but its crowded and visibility is bad due to all the people and kids kicking up sand and debris. housekeeping was of course very professional and courteous as expected. we thought the sheets were a little weird on the bed, took a few nights to get used to them, you will see what I mean. we loved sitting on our balcony at night just watching the waves roll in and the activity along the ocean front. beautful mountain views to the right ocean to the left and front. cant beat it. THE POOL by faaaaaaaaaaaaaaarrr the best pool on kaanapali beach. we walked to all the other resort/hotels on the strip there and nothing even came close to the westin pool. this pool area is huuuuge, like a freakin small waterpark, slides for the kids, and a pool just for adults up top. sitting at the pool and in all the waterfalls you look out to the most amazing view in maui, the view of lanai and mollakai. doesnt get better. There is a 25 dollar per day room charge. which sounds like a lot, but it covers parking if you have a car, unlimited wifi in your room for internet, AND you also get a free photo from a photographer on staff. should you have any more questions about your upcoming trip to Maui, please feel free to email me, ill answer questions and give insight. i know how much I appreciated all the tips from others prior to our departure, i want to do the same for you. ALOHA and Mahalo! chris ------@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Irshana
Reviews.Content: Amazing!.... First class all the way. Beautiful views, adult pool, excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jtdevinny
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a friend and family. Was a beautiful hotel, beaches were fantastic. Snorkeling available right outside the hotel beach. Spent a lot of time at the pool, sneaking coronas out of a little cooler. Pool was nice, made more for kids with the small water slide. There was a nice poolside bar for lunch and such. For dinner we usually went out to eat as there are so many restaurants to experience outside of the hotel. Would recommend scuba diving! Rooms were very clean, beds were comfy (sleep number), and the grounds we perfect for people watching! Fairly expensive, I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, if you're prepared to pay”
Reviews.Author: hgarrett7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights in late April. The purpose of our trip was to celebrate his birthday. We are in our late 20's early 30's. We don't take many vacations so when we do we like to splurge. This hotel is definitely the right place for that. We booked our room (and flight and car) through Costco travel. They were fantastic and I have no complaints. We checked in around 3 o'clock and it was very quick. They gave us shell lei's (flowers cost extra :( ) and also sent a yummy cake up to the room for bf's birthday) We were given a partial-ocean view room on the 5th floor of the beach tower (room 521). It was great, even though directly across from the elevator I never heard it once. The view was a combination of the waterfall and ponds in the hotel lobby, pool area, beach and ocean. We both enjoyed leaving the glass door open at night and falling asleep to the sound of the waterfall. The room was clean, and adequate. The bed was very comfortable. It's true, room service did come a bit late but we were barely in the room anyway so it wasn't a hassle. The part of the service that truly impressed me the most (and this is partially Hawaiian airlines doing as well) was due to a late flight off the mainland one of our bags was lost. We filled out the necessary paperwork and were on our way. Once we got to the hotel we let the bellman know and then headed out to check out the northern end of Ka'anapali beach. By the time we got back to our room (no more than 2 1/2 hours) our bag was waiting for us in our room! I was amazed; their attentiveness saved me loads of stress. I had called a month ahead of time to reserve a cabana for the day after my bf's birthday. When I called the towel desk had only been open for an hour and someone had already booked the cabana I wanted! So if you want to do this you need to call ASAP. We rented the cabana near the adult pool, between bar and the ocean; it had very cozy lounge chairs and had the most amazing view of the ocean. The cabana boy regularly brought us ice water and pineapple and our waitress Keisha brought us everything else. It was such a relief to have this area to ourselves and not have to worry about walking away and losing our spots or having to carry all our stuff around if we wanted to take a dip in the ocean. We invited some people we met the day before to join us, otherwise it would have been way too big for just two people. Iâ€™ll post pictures so you can see. We also rented a small two person cabana the next day because I was sunburn and wanted to stay out of the sun. It also had great service but the view wasn't as good. I was able to use the gym and the spa during our stay. The elliptical on the far left was a bit jarring, so I moved to the far right and it was much better. All the machines have large TV's mounted at eye-level. This is great if you want to watch TV, however I would have preferred to look at the view behind the TV, besides I brought my iPod and like listening to my music while working out. It would have been nice if you had the option of lowering the TV so youâ€™re not forced to stare at the blank screen. The spa was beautiful, and my lomi lomi massage was very relaxing. Part of our package was the free breakfast buffet. Neither my bf nor I are really breakfast people but we tried it a few times. The food was always decent, and displayed nicely. My only complaint might be the birds. I understand that we're eating outside and it comes with the territory but some of the birds were actually sitting in the vase that the serving utensils were put in (in front of the chafing dish), that was a little too close for comfort. We also were given a free portrait sitting, you basically walk around the lobby with their professional photographer and he takes a bunch of pictures. Then you go back to his desk and pick your favorite picture and he prints it out for free. You can buy a disc with all the shots for $100!? That was my biggest shocker of the trip. It only took him 5 minutes to take the photos and it costs next to nothing to transfer them to a disc, I just cannot justify where the cost of $100 comes from. Overall, if you prepare yourself before for all the little extra costs then you will have an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Week”
Reviews.Author: Sbroadhog
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable time the week before on Kauai and were extending our time to visit Maui. We had purchased this portion of our trip from an non profit organization called Points of Light, through an auction. When we arrived the hotel was packed and the only ocean side room was a terrace on ground level. The room would not have been bad had it been acceptable cleanliness wise. A call to the front desk, and a visit by the manager on duty, got us a very nice Ocean Front room on the end of the hotel with uninterrupted views. It is a large hotel so you have to be prepared for a lot of people around the pool, there music you may not like but the scenery in Maui is great. I often wonder what resort fees cover if you have to pay an additional charge for beach cabanas, boogie board and kayaks.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent traveler... had medium expectations... Left with mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Sar31
Reviews.Content: (FYI: We stayed on the 11th floor of the ocean tower) After spending WEEKS before our trip reading reviews... I was slightly worried about this place being, well, dated and dirty. To be honest, we must have had a great maid (Roxalinda) because we didn't have that problem. We had a late check in due to a late flight and weren't greeted with a lei.. which bummed me out-but I got over it. I'm an adult! But check in was smooth--could have been because we arrived at 5pm. Arrived to the room and were happy with the quality. I will say that it is a small room... but being that my boyfriend and I are average sized and traveled without children, it was perfect for us. Bathroom was separate from vanity, which some people may hate, but I'm adjust easily. Here's my biggest complaint of all.... THE VIEW. We paid in advance for an upgrade to a "partial ocean view" and feel we got screwed. I've traveled all though out the world, in all types of hotels, motels, ocean views and partials... and this was BY FAR the worst "partial" ocean view I've ever stayed at. I'd rename it to the Mountain and Golf course/parking lot view... because that's what it was. ((I bet the regular view was probably on the 5-6th floor, and partial ocean was up on the 10th and 11th of the ocean tower.)) I guess its because the building was on an angle, but either way, I was not happy waking up to car alarms on a regular basis. Next to that, we were the lucky couple that got placed right next to the elevator. We stayed, and I didn't complain to the front desk only because we weren't in the room too much. But after 3 nights of being woken up by it, it got frustrating. So word to the wise, if you get placed there... ask to relocate immediately. Now I have to note about the pool--since I'm sure you all want to know.. It's an awesome pool and you can ask for as many towels as you'd like. There adult pool is a great quiet kid-free zone for those that aren't looking for loud pool recreation. For those of you that have young kids, it does not have a lot of places that are shallow enough for kids exploring the water, but the perk is that they let you have water toys/rafts in the pool... so maybe you could bring. those for your child. My only complaint about the pool is that people would go down to the pool and reserve the good spots under umbrellas at 7am, then leave for breakfast. So people like me that looked for a spot at 8-9am, went looking for a spot amongst a sea of towels... that's not right. We were shocked too that they closed down a majority of the pool for some private event ALL DAY Sunday. That's not fair to regular guests of the hotel. Listen, its clear to anyone traveling to Maui that its expensive and you can't avoid resort fees. Once you get over that-its easy to have a good time. Save some money by grabbing some snacks/booze from the ABC store, hit up happy hour and eat at the food court in Whalers Village if you want to save money, but most of all, rent a car and travel around Maui--- its worth it because its beautiful! Good: Location, staff was friendly, shops on site, beach, pool, lava flow drinks!, the spa, Internet was fine for me on my iphone, happy hour specials, if parking is unavailable the valet will park for you free, Bad: the view, Tropica restaurant, old chairs for beach, late check out = $50, people saving chairs at pool, Tia Juanas restaurant down the block, things shut down after 10:30pm

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views but rooms lacked......”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom20102010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 4 nights during mid April 2010. We are a family of 4 and enjoyed the Westin and our experience- here are a list of the good and the bad- The good- * Location is great- right on the beach, next to the Whaler's village for shopping and restaurants- the boardwalk in front of the hotel was a great place to walk/run in the morning. * We were in an ocean front room-the view was awesome and amazing. We saw whales daily playing right in front of the hotel and it was great to leave the screen door open each night and fall asleep to the sounds of the ocean. * The pools were great for our kids and they loved the water slides as well as the different activities in and around the pool each day. There seemed to be plenty of chairs around the pool and we had no trouble finding a spot. We went and did activities during the morning in would wind up at the pool early afternoon and never had trouble getting chairs. We were not there during a major holiday or spring break. * The lobby is very pretty- little walk ways to go through and birds throughout the lobby made the kids happy to explore. * The staff was friendly and we never had a bad experience with anyone working in the hotel. * They offer fun activites for the kids daily- most are free, our kids loved feeding the birds in the morning- but the best activity was the star gazing with Becky- she was great and showed our family all the different plants/stars. We were the only people at the star gazing on the night we went so we had a private lesson. We were not able to look through the telescope due to the mist but even without the telescope we learned and saw many new things. Now the Bad- * The rooms are small- which is no big deal since you don't really spend too much time in the room to begin with- However- our room was not very clean when we checked in. I thankfully had wipes in my bag so I was able to wipe down surfaces. The bathroom looked like no one had wet mopped the floor in months-hair, sticky, a make up spot on the tile etc... The dressers and vanities were not clean, cup stains, finger prints and just plain dirty and there was a splattered on the wall above the coffee maker that looked like it had been there for months- The switch plates were flithy and the temperture gages on the thermostat were almost black with finger prints. It was pretty bad! Since we loved the view from the room we did not ask to change rooms, I just spent some time wiping things down and removing stains. But it does make you wonder how clean the room is between vistors- this is pretty basic stuff- I am not asking for 2x daily cleanings etc.. just some basic wiping down of floors and vanities. Bring your wipes and plan on doing some cleaning if this stuff bothers you- I'm not a Kate Gosselin who freaks out about cleaning etc...- it was just basically dirty! * The rooms need to be updated- they have a very 80's-ish feel and could stand some updating. * If you are staying there for any length of time and like your room serviced before 3:30-4:00 you need to call housekeeping and ask to have it done early- they seem to be a little under staffed and there were days when we came back to the room at 4:00 and they still hadn't gotten to our room yet. * We had the breakfast buffet a few days and asked at one point to have a to-go container to take back bagels that the kids had not eaten etc.... and we were told that you are not allowed to use to go containers at the buffet. While I understand this theory, and they are trying to prevent people from scamming the buffet and paying for 1 person to have breakfast then stock piling food for other people who did not pay, it seems a bit ridiculous when all 4 us had paid for the buffet and we were just trying to take bagels that were already on the kids plates out of the restaurant. We wound up carrying them with the cream cheese and all out of the restaurant in our hands. Give me a break! We have been to many hotel buffets all over the country and this has never been an issue- if you paid for the buffet you should be able to take things with you to some degree!! * I was also told, very politely, that you are not allowed to have coolers at the pool- again I understand this rule in theory-preventing people from bringing large amounts of alchol to the pool to consume etc.... however my cooler was filled with water and juice boxes for my kids. When I told/showed the staff member what was in my cooler to prove that I was just a Mom providing drinks to her kids, he told me that I had to hide the cooler in my bag and not bring it out if I wanted to keep it at the pool. I think the hotel needs to be a little more flexible on some of the rules that they enforce, especially for families traveling with small kids. If I was guzzling beers from my cooler all day then I think I should be spoken to but when the cooler is filled with water and jouce boxes I think the staff might what to pick their battles. I would come back to this hotel if I could stay in the an ocean front room again. The good out weighs the bad in my eyes and would recommend this hotel to a friends- I am just planning on having some cleaning products on hand to take care of the things that housekeeping missed, some plastic bags to carry my left overs in from the buffet and a larger beach bag to hide my juice box cooler in on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and expected”
Reviews.Author: plum0411
Reviews.Content: Writing this review while staying here right now (got here yesterday, leaving in 5 days). The resort is breathtaking, flamingos, black swans and parrots greet you in a in-lobby open-air lagoon. The room's were small, as i find most westin basic rooms to be (we're cheap). Liked the bed because it was super-soft (if you like soft) . I'm five months pregnant & hungry at odd hours, so i was happy to see a small fridge which can actually hold more than a pint of milk (the in-fridge freezer can hold only the size of an ice tray unfortunately). I actually managed to fit in milk, apple juice, three bottles of water, three apples and two mangos, so i was happy. Beach is a step away, i don't know why people complain about the towels and how, if lost, we owe them $25. Just don't lose the towels, how hard is that? no big deal i think. Service is average, nothing special.It's not like they remember my name or anything (walked up to the same front-desk person and she didn't recall me at all i think), considering i checked in yesterday, but then again this is a BIG hotel, so understandable. Our room view kinda blows (we're on the third floor overlooking the parking lot (called "Mountain view" i think) but at least it's away from the elevator. we were given the option to "upgrade" to pretty much the same view, except higher up, but we declined becuase it would have been two double beds instead of king bed (i need all the room i can get with my expanding belly!). It's interesting how they spin it as an upgrade since it's still a view of the parking lot! Tried to see if any rooms were available today for a "complimentary upgrade" with a king bed a day later, but no go, seems like the offer is only for when you get there first. Oh well, you get what you pay for and can't expect a hotel to just spend its resources giving you everything :) Anyway, having a good time so far desite Maui being quite windy, but am missing Riviera Maya (mexico) lots for some reason (probably cuz I stayed at an AWESOME all-inclusive, the Excellence Cancun).

Reviews.Title: “we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: 2dbeach2
Reviews.Content: I thought the property was fantastic with real flamingos, beautiful waterfalls and best location. it's convienantly located to the shops just a few steps away where you can purchase clothes but you can also go to the liquor store there to purchase sundries if you would like to have some snacks in your hotel room. This is especially helpful when traveling with kids. The oceanfront view was spectacular, we booked the sunset cruise through the hotel tour operator, Amex who were great. There is a beach grill which is great snack food.

Reviews.Title: “great place for families”
Reviews.Author: jacktripperCanada
Reviews.Content: we stayed with our 2 kids (9 & 11) in a studio, we got the king they pulled out the sofa bed and found it to be very comfortable. If you got money to burn, everything is pretty much there. if you are on a budjet, then i suggest to get your own groceries cause there is a kitchen units and bbq spots to do your own thing. you can get groceries there or at costco or the safeway in nearby Lahiena (yes your safeway clubcard will work there, can or usa). you'll find it more windy and rainy there, but is refreshing. If you want relentless heat go to nearby lahiena, have a car , so you can loop the island, its a great adventure. people will tell you its to dangerous ,but we didn't find it that bad. there's lots to explore and see. we snorkeled all over the place, but to be honest with ya, the best snorkeling is right out front of the resort. don't waste yuor money on tours to snorkel. I would strongley recomend this hotel to families

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: texand
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days/4 nights in a pool/ocean view room. The view was great and the room was clean. It would be nice if the refrigerator was bigger. It barely held a quart of milk and believe me, you want to eat as much as you can outside of the resturants to save money. We only ate the breakfast buffet once and, although it was very good with a wide selection, it cost $60 for 2 adults and 1 five year old. it would help if they made an allowance for children. The resort is convenient to shopping and offers a free shuttle to Lahaina and the Old Lahaina Luau. My daughter really liked the childrens day and night camp.

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: NellyC76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first week of our honeymoon here in Maui, every day since returning home we have said to each other "I wish I was in Maui still". It has that effect on you. The lobby of the hotel is incredible. Such a beautiful place to sit and relax, looking at the flamingos and other exotic birds. Our room wasn't over the top with furnishings, but was very comfortable. The large king size bed was divine! We had a mountain view room and whilst it looked over the car park, it was still a nice view particularly at sunrise. The pools at this hotel are probably the biggest selling point. So many different pools, not to mention a few hidden ones. The adult pool was a nice quiet option if you wanted to get away from the noisier family/children's pool area. The location is ideal, Whaler's Village is a small stroll away. The free shuttle up to Lahaina every hour was very efficient. There are a few things to be aware of though: * If you get a message from the concierge welcoming you and wishing to give you a gift, beware! They also want to sign you up to a 90 minute timeshare demonstration (not appreciated whilst on our honeymoon!) * There is a daily $25 resort fee, which supposedly covers wireless internet, parking and a couple of other small things (which I believe should already be included in your costing!) * This is not a quiet resort, there are people everywhere and it's often hard to find a nice quiet place around the pools. With all that said, we would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Totally addicted to the Westin Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: jamiegrl24
Reviews.Content: Okay, where do I even start?! My husband and I came here for our honeymoon and we were absolutely blown away. Out first room we hot overlooked a dumpster area and when we asked for another room, they not only gave us a better room, but an upgrade!! Amazing . The restaurants are all wonderful but nothing beats their pools. Especially the adults only pool!! Absolutely brathtaking with cocktail service and peace and quiet. My husband and I dream about being there. In fact we loved it so much, we went back for our one year anniversary and are in the process of saving for our next trip back! Westin Maui... We adore you!

Reviews.Title: “a bit of a disappointment for the kids”
Reviews.Author: grizman-btm
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui has a beautiful lobby and grounds. Its a very dramatic open air lobby with towering water falls and tropical landscaping. The pools also appear very nice, and there is even waterslide for the kids. However, the water isn't very warm and there is no hot pool for the kids to use. In fact, there is only one small hot pool on the entire property and its adult only, and they enforce that rule. My kids were really disappointed about that and even felt discriminated by this. Bottom line, the pools are not very kid friendly. The slide looks like a weak attempt to find attract famlies, but in our case we wish we had stayed somewhere else. The rooms really aren't that great either. We stayed on the 9th floor. Its a typical hotel room with two beds and a bathroom. The room was very small compared to most hotels, two people could not pass each other without one having to step behind a bed.. The beds were doubles, not queens, so it was not very spacious sleeping arrangements. You could tell this was an older hotel. Our cost was$325 per night with tax. For that price, I had much higher expectations.Food was very pricey as well. We were there over Easter sunday. Their breakfast buffet was priced at $55 per person. I found that pretty shocking.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: fungirl025
Reviews.Content: Husband and I chose the Westin due to it's proximity to Whaler's Village and the amazing pool area. During our 6 night stay we were never disappointed. From check-in to our time of departure everythign was flawless. The lobby was absolutely breathtaking! From the cockatoo who greets you with ALOHA everytime you walk by to the amazing staff we encountered everywhere we always felt welcomed. Breakfast each mornign at the buffet was good. We never had to wait more than 3 minutes to be seated no matter how busy. The food was always warm, plentiful and fresh. Our ocean view room was beautifully appointed and the beds were oh so comfy. We had a spa appointment (couples 80 minute massage) on our 3rd day of our stay. We enjoyed it so much that we booked another before even leaving the spa! :) The beach area in front of the hotel was perfect. It was never too busy or crowded. My husband and I had the amazing pleasure of ending several nights at the Tropica Bar with the wonderful bartenders there. They introduced us to drinks I never thought to try and were super friendly! The pool and pool bar (adult area) were simply amazing! My husband and I were honestly not disappointed in any aspect of our stay at the Westin. We just returned home less than two weeks ago and are returning in 2 months with our 3 boys!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui...Right in the Middle of Where You Want to Be”
Reviews.Author: FavPlaceMaui
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! We arrived at the Westin Maui Resort after spending our first few days on the island at the 'Grand Grab You Wallet'...I mean Grand Wailea. The Westin was far less expensive than the Grand Wailea and the service at the Westin was FAR superior to the Grand Wailea. The Westin is situated in the best part of the beach area. The close proximity to the beach, shops and best restaruants in the area makes for a fun stay. It was whale season and we could see dozens of whales breaching right off the beach from the hotel. The hotel provides you with binoculars but you won't need them. This is THE whale watching spot. You won't need your car because there is a great deal to keep you busy with in steps of the hotel. The staff is cheerful, helpful and friendly. The hotel is busy but very clean and attentive. It is both a child and teen friendly environment. It is not posh but it is vibrant and fun. I HIGHLY recommend the Westin Maui Resort.

Reviews.Title: “overcrowded !”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVagabonds
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 teen sons stayed here during spring break. we found our 2 Ocean Tower rooms tiny, worn and dirty. Both bathrooms had cracked tiles, missing and dirty grout. The mirrors and balcony doors were smudged , the electric outlets and switches and walls were covered with fingerprints of prior guests.. The beds are comfortable and the views great. The resort was jammed resulting in long lines for breakfast,,crowded walkways and shortages of lounge chairs and parking spaces. Our stay was not relaxed as we were constantly fighting lines and crowds. The staff is competent but impersonal .Next time we will stay at the Sheraton about one block away where it is less congested and more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “This was paradise!”
Reviews.Author: crazy4maui015
Reviews.Content: We haven't taken many vacations so Maui was a big deal and we wanted to make sure we picked the right Hotel. We were looking for a place that had a nice pool and lots of activities for our kids. The best were a surprise.. I was not prepared for how WONDERFULLY comfortable they are. We had such a wonderful time with no complaints. I don't understand why other people are complaining about their room and the service and the $25 resort is very standard anywhere you that is a resort you are going to be charged that.. Even I know that and as I have stated I don't take very many vacations. The service was wonderful.. I don't need to be treated like a VIP at the expense of other people and I never felt like I was ignored either. Thank you Westin for making our vacation wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: danielleybelle
Reviews.Content: I went to the Westin Maui during spring break with friends and we could not have been happier. From the moment that we walked through the doors we were greeted with the true Aloha spirit. The resort was absolutely beautiful, it was impossible to forget that you were in Hawaii (and why would you want to?). The staff was friendly, genuine, and kind- helpful with any questions we had. The resort is right on the beach which is fabulous and it's right next to Whaler's Village which is a fun place to wander around. And there are plenty of places to eat all over but both restaurants in the hotel are incredible. And although I didn't make it to the luau, my friends did and they said that it was the best one- much more intimate than some of the others, like a real luau should be. There is always something going on at the hotel from ukulele lessons to coconut demonstrations. Right in front of the hotel there are also surf lessons and rentals, paddle-boarding lessons and rentals, and kayaking rentals. I definitely recommend the stand-up paddle boarding. And right down the beach is black rock which is an incredible snorkel spot. But if you want to get away from the resort area, the Westin offers a free shuttle that will take you into Lahaina. If I am on Maui again, this is definitely my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Priced; Bad Service; Not worth the Cost”
Reviews.Author: davidshaf
Reviews.Content: After a long and hard research process, I thought that this hotel was going to be a true 4 star...boy was I wrong. Way tooooo over priced....Front desk service sucks.... We were on our honeymoon and they gave us a "special terrace" view. Well, that just means a parking lot view. We asked to be upgraded since it was our honeymoon and they just gave us an attitude like we had done something wrong. For $200 a night we would expect a little more. The pool is nice but you pay a nice $25 resort fee per day. Much better choices out there. Keep looking

Reviews.Title: “Escape to Paradise as soon as you check-in!”
Reviews.Author: cindyc640
Reviews.Content: The beautiful Westin Maui Property will amaze you as soon as you are greeted by the warm Hawaiian welcome from all of the staff, Hawaiian shell leis, and a beautiful lobby that brings the outdoor beauty indoors---you will find a waterfall, fish, parrots, and even pink flamingos! As soon as my friends and I arrived at the property, we decided to go to the beach, which is conveniently a walking distance from the hotel! Don't even worry about bringing beach towels because the staff also offers them for free as part of being a guest. My friends and I also enjoyed some delicious and innovative sandwiches at OnO Bar and Grill. I had a Portabello mushroom sandwich with stir fry vegetables on wheat bread and a side salad. It was delicious and satisfying! Westin also offers water activities, such as surfing, snorkeling, and paddle boarding. On my last day, I signed up for paddle-boarding and received an amazing lesson from the friendly staff at the recreation booth. It was an experience of a lifetime! and I recommend it to everyone. There a lot of other cultural activities put together by the staff. On another day, my friends and I watched one of the natives make coconut milk and had some delicious haupia to try right away. The Luau was my favorite part of the trip, nonetheless! Unlike other large Luaus to which my friends had been, the Luau at the Westin was very intimate (8 people per table) and the food quality was impeccable. I had the best ahi appetizer there and pineapple dessert. The beef was cooked just right, and the pork and fish were very flavorful. The show was very entertaining--from the hula girls to the fire dancers who closed the show with lots of cheering from the crowd. Westin Maui definitely left an impression on me. The property and staff truly embrace the Aloha spirit!

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: mrpond2u
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you'd expect from a massive oceanfront resort in Ka'anapali. Excellent location. Solid, clean, relatively small rooms...nothing to write home about...but you shouldn't be in the room anyway except to sleep. The bed was nice...but the pillows were wimpy...and I didn't care because I was in Maui. I wasn't there to sit in my hotel. The pool/grounds are awesome. No problems. I'll say this again, because I've said it before in other reviews I've written. DO NOT go to Maui if you're on a budget. DO NOT go to Maui if you're cheapy cheap and you want crazy deals. It's the antithesis of budget traveling. You will be charged exorbitant amounts for everything. Smile and pay. Don't complain. Go to Mexico if you want cheap. The Westin - Maui is rock solid...if you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: Honey808
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Westin Maui several times and each time, it was a wonderful experience. I've eaten at the Ono Bar and Grill and the name definitely lives up. The food was delicious. They offered an interesting selection of dishes and I enjoyed each one that I ordered. The staff was also very friendly and and gave great service. I also had th chance to try their Spa. It was so relaxing. The place looked very clean and immaculate. The staff there was also very kind and made sure that I was well taken care of. I really enjoyed their sauna steam room. The Westin Maui is a very beautiful place. It has an amazing view of the ocean. The staff there are very helpful, warm, and full of the aloha spirit. I would highly recommend the Westin Maui to anyone who be travelling there. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “wow.”
Reviews.Author: jrobba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Maui for our honeymoon in 2007. We were nothing but impressed with the hotel. The hotel is a vacation just by itself, and I have to say I almost felt bad about not spending enough time at the hotel! Maui has so many things to see that we had to make time just to enjoy the hotel! The hotel boasts this immaculate pool system, its almost like going to a waterpark! There are 5 pools, each with slides, waterfalls, and an adult pool where you can just relax. The rooms were also great. We stayed in a standard mountain view room, where the bathrooms had a double shower head, and even though you couldn't see the ocean, you could always see a beautiful rainbow over the mountainside. The room also had the heavenly bed, which is amazing if you've never got to sleep in one. The hotel has its own luau which was very enjoyable, along with shops in the hotel and within walking distance. If you order anything from the menu, the Thai chicken wings are simply the best. Kaanapali is a beautiful beach, and you're just minutes from Lahaina which is one of the best spots on Maui to shop. my absolute favorite part about the hotel was the waterfall in the lobby. It's such an awesome way to be introduced to the hotel. I hope to be back there soon, and I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Maui in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its name”
Reviews.Author: MVP70
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is mediocre. The rooms and halls are fairly tired and need to be refreshed, it feels old and stale. The resort itself is quite beautiful, pools etc are nice. Some experiences we had were that our room didn't get cleaned one day, there were more than the average amount of bugs in the room (I know Hawaii is tropical, but there were lots), the balcony was dirty (railing, floor, furniture etc). Just overall it's not worth the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly different than the Grand Wailea, but enjoyable in its own right”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Darren
Reviews.Content: So it's not what we remembered from 7 years ago, and it could certainly use a facelift....but...the central location to Kaanapali resorts, restaurants and shopping is fun nonetheless. This was definitely a "class" contrast from the Grand Wailea, but the staff here was FAR friendlier and accomodating, and the incindental prices were 20% lower. The pools and slide are still the best in the Kaanapali area from what we know. A Deluxe Ocean View room is worth it ...we spent time while in the room on the lanai watching whales, beautiful sunsets, listening to hawaiin music from the Tropica restaurant below, and simple people watching along the "boardwalk". So it is what it is...and after a few days we just fell into place with the routine and really enjoyed our stay. Walked 10min to Black Rock for snorkeling, 15min the other direction to the Hyatt. Most appreciated was Whalers Village shops and restaurants right next door. Hula Grill and Leilanis was perfect for lunches and dinners. Lahina is 10min drive. We would stay again...and yes, we would also look for a deal. I may not stay there on busy holidays or high traffic season as I imagine if overcrowded, some of the pleasantries we experienced may be harder to realize.

Reviews.Title: “If you have young children - do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: famtravelca
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19 month old daughter, and I just got back from our trip to Maui. I booked 8 nights on points (3 nights at the Hyatt and 5 nights at the Westin). We choose the Westin because of the location to Whalers Village. After spending a day at the Hyatt pool, we drove over to check-in at the Westin. We pulled up and no one greeted us. My husband and I pulled our luggage out of the trunk and still no one offered to help - The bellmen just looked as us. Eventually, we just asked for their assistance. It was really very odd. The initial experience seemed to have summarized the customer service at the hotel. If you are interested in a time share, you will be treated much better. From the concierge, to the front desk, to the bell desk - it was the worse service i have ever seen at a hotel. The rooms were very small, but they used the space well. The pools are a big liability waiting to happen. If you have young children, do not stay here! The Hyatt and Marriott are much better suited for young kids. Even the Westin timeshae property would have been better. The tile was slippery on the ledge of the pool and there is no shallow area for kids to play in. Even the lounge area was very anti-children with just cement. If it were my husband and I laying around the pool all day, it would have been lovely. With the red flag warnings at the beach daily, it didn't leave us many options for water play for our daughter. Overall, we were in Maui and stayed for free. If I were booking the trip and paying with cash, I would pick the Hyatt hands down. The Hyatt was AMAZING and I would gladly pay more for their facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not even a 2 star resort”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisShirt
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with this hotel at all. The rooms were nothing special and the service was terrible. There was a $25.00 a day resort fee which I am not opposed to if there was something we could have used at the 'resort'. Everything was extra. Even the steam room. Not sure what the $25.00 extra charge was actually for. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely tourist factory”
Reviews.Author: SaddlebillStork
Reviews.Content: A blogger said it best - this hotel is a factory. But it's really a lovely one despite its huge size and full occupancy. When our flight was cancelled and our arrival delayed two days, they adjusted our dates without a fee. When I called and asked for a high floor room just because we were so bummed about missing two days of the trip, they assigned us a lovely room top floor and center, even though I'm not a Starwood quadruple platinum whatever. The staff was uniformly pleasant and even when they wouldn't give me things I wanted (late checkout, umbrella reservation, etc), they did it so pleasantly that it was impossible to mind. The only crazy thing is that you have to reserve the beach umbrellas well in advance and pay handsomely for them (despite the daily resort fee which does not include beach umbrellas or chairs). But to quote the blogger again - this does serve as excellent crowd control and if you think of it as such, it's worth the cost of the rental. The rooms are on the small side but the rates are excellent for a beachfront hotel. The lobby is the most beautiful hotel lobby I've ever seen anywhere. The fountains in the pool area provide a wall of white noise that drowns out the human noise (and the sound of the surf) very well. The self park was usually full and then they give you valet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to imagine this is 4 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: UtterDisbelief
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Westin was quite mixed. First the positive: Very friendly helpful staff, nice beach and pools, convenient to Lahaina restaurants and shopping, and part of a very reasonable package through Pleasant Holidays. The negative: Small, outdated room badly in need of a facelift. The room was not as clean as it should have been. There were hairs in the bathtub, blood stains on the linens, and we discovered a cockroach crawling from under the coffee maker. The $25/day resort fee for self-parking and internet seems a little excessive. There was construction in the lobby area which included hours of ear-shattering jackhammering. We had to leave the hotel just to escape the noise. We would prefer a newer or more recently remodeled hotel for our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Westin was a very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: midsouthbuckeyes
Reviews.Content: We chose the Maui Westin through a Costco Travel deal. It was s special on the back of one of their mailers. The trip included 6 nights with breakfast, one dinner, and a rental car for $750 per person. The Westin is beautifully located on beach. The scenery was just as I imagined Hawaii would be. The hotel pools were beautiful. Their landscaping was pristine. This was a celebratory trip (bday and anniversary) and we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and an awesome cake. They were very over the top trying to sell time shares which was kind of annoying, but all those people were nice. The breakfast buffet was to die for. Fresh fruit, made to order omlettes, and fresh juice were delicious. Probably would not have gotten it every day if it were not included in our package as it was very expensive. Dinner was very good. The pool service and bars really made every effort to recoup $$. Very expensive. Surfing lessons and other beach services were available right outside the hotel on the beach. Great workout facility. Bottom line is that we will go back to the area, but will be watching for deals. However for this trip without the kids it rocked!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ozgirlmb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in February and we found it to be fantastic! Although the first night there were only 2 double beds- which after trying to stay in one bed was way too small (more like a king single) and we are very small people! The staff the next day were happy to change our room. The room was great, nice and clean, the staff were very friendly and it has a perfect location right next to the whalers village which is full of restaurants. We dined frequently at Leilana's. We will definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok at best”
Reviews.Author: SirTravelAL0t
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is very nice. The amenties are great, and the location is one of the best on Maui. My husband and I got a great deal otherwise we would have never picked to stay here. The actual rate of the hotel is outrageous for what it is. They need to cut their rates in half. Never pay full price for this place. The customer service there was horrible. We were never a priority and we had to ask about things several times before they were fulfulled. The pool area LOOKS very nice, but packed with children and sunscreen. The pools actually looked dirty to me. The finally complaint was on the last day we of course had an evening flight out, so we asked about a hospitality suite for a shower later in the day. We were able to book it to use. But the room was nasty and smelly, and there was no A/C. Nothing like showering without AC and sitting on a plane for almost 24 hours. Not a great impression to leave your guests with.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Hotel Maui is all that is wrong with resort hotels”
Reviews.Author: travelingman1968
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui Hotel and Spa are on a great beach with great activities but the hotel is a perfect example of poor management. Check in and check out took greater than 10 minutes with only one person helping the long line of guests. Front desk staff who could have helped just ignored the line and went on breaks. The workout area is a joke most home gyms have more equipment. The gym had several cardio machines but only had eight different weight stations for a greater than 400 room hotel. The television in my room would turn on great sound no picture. Each nigh I had to call maintenance to fix the television. They would work on it for 10 minutes and eventually get a picture(a suggestion to Westin change the television or fix the problem). I would definitely not recommend this hotel. Lastly Starwood packages internet into the resort fee but you can opt for higher speed(don't it is no faster than the resort packaged internet but costs $4.99 per day)

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: There are several choices on Ka'anapali Beach in Maui and we made the right one. I was especially torn between the Sheraton down the beach and the Westin Maui. As a Starwoods Gold member staying on cash & points, everything I read online told me the chance for an upgrade was better at the Sheraton. But with young kids, I opted for the better pool figuring that we would spend little time in whatever room we received anyway. Surprisingly, we ended up being upgraded - twice. From the mountain side of the Ocean Tower to the oceanview side and then again to the Beach Tower facing north towards the Sheraton and Black Rock (overlooking Whalers Village). Obviously, not everyone can be upgraded but if you are given the option of either the Beach Tower or the Ocean Tower, go for the Beach Tower, which has newer and larger rooms. It also has lighter and brighter halls and public areas. Each floor is designated a "Starwood Preferred Guest" floor, I guess owing to the new-ness of the building itself. Only the top few floors in the Ocean Tower are given that designation. Because the rooms are larger, our standard room also had a twin-sized overstuffed chair with pull-out bed which gave our family of four some extra sleeping space. We also had a bathroom with dual sinks, a refrigerator, safe, etc. The only problem with the room was we had smokers next door out on the lanai. When I called the front desk to see about moving to another room (maybe another upgrade?), I was informed that smoking wasn't allowed in the rooms or on the lanais and only in designated areas on the property. The front desk manager told me security would be dispatched to the offending party's room immediately. Yikes! Not only was security there within minutes (I heard them knock), the couple next door checked out the next day. The $25 resort fee does seem a little exhorbinant at first but when I thought about it, it really wasn't that bad. In the age of hotels and air carriers nickel and diming for everything, paying $25 each day for parking, internet access, gym access and two bottles of water daily seemed like a good deal. On a recent trip to San Francisco, I paid $35 per day to park my car, $12.95 for daily internet access, $10 per day for the gym but opted to bring my own water. If you don't plan on using these amenities then yes, it's kind of ridiculous but you can always try to take it up with management. The parking is close by and secure, the internet access realtively fast, the gym very well equipped, and the water welcome. Plus you get the free shuttles to the other Starwood properties and to Lahaina. The grounds and pools were all lovely. We never had trouble finding two lounge chairs together among the several pool decks. The kids loved the water slide and the activties including the lei making, henna tattoos, and ukulele lessons. They didn't visit the Kids Club but it looked like it had several great programs. One night, the hotel staff set up a large movie screen on the pool deck and we watched "Beverly Hills Chihuahua." Since it started at dinner time, I ran next door to the food court at Whaler's Village and brought back dinner to eat on the lounge chairs as the kids watched the movie. Another night, the staff brought in an amateur astronomer and telescope and we did a little stargazing. We rented a beach umbrella and chairs for a full day for $25 and it was well worth having a reserved spot under cover although there is plenty of room on the beach. The items are yours for the entire day and we didn't have any problem leaving for lunch and returning later. Other resorts down the beach that we visited (Hyatt & Marriott) don't allow these items on their short beaches, only on the grass lawns above them. I have to admit that we didn't have any meals on property during our four nights. As many reviewers have suggested the food was quite expensive. We chose to eat next door at Whaler's Village for almost every meal when we weren't visiting Lahaina. The restaurants are diverse and the food court offers several options including a McDonald's. All in all, it was a great experience, helped along by the upgrade, but since we spent very little time in the room anyway, I think I would have rated the hotel high anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Will Stay again”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with your two girls (4 and 5), stayed at the Westin Maui last week and had a fantastic time. We've stayed at this hotel several times in the past and have always been impressed by their service, food quality, location and overall hospitality. Our kids loved the large waterslide, the pool was a hit and the beach is probably the best in the area. The waves were a bit large one day but we were still able to go in the water and have fun. The hotel's location is fantastic - short walk (2 min) to Whaler's village is fantastic where there are a variety of restaurants, fast food type places and an ABC store. I highly recommend the fish sandwich at Nikki's (lower level of the shopping area near the McD's - best $7.95 sandwich I've ever had). As for luau, we didn't go but we did watch the fire dance from the sidewalk that runs right in front. For kids - the Westin is great - from free fish feeding every morning, to "kids eat free", to the water slide, to the beach, to the warm, friendly staff, this is a great hotel. Our room - somewhat small but clean and the bed is fantastic. Also nice to have a refrig in the room and stocked bottled water (no charge) every day. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Over-crowded pool patio. Poor service.”
Reviews.Author: cortney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Westin last week. We had a wonderful time in Maui despite our disappointing stay at the Westin. The pool area was over crowded: all the chaises are lined up elbow to elbow, and one day we couldn't even find two seats anywhere. If you're a couple without kids looking for a quite romantic hotel, this is not the place for you (or us!) All the elegance of the "Westin" brand was lost here. Meanwhile, the service was shoddy: from the front desk to the waiters. We had one very helpful conceirge who went above and beyond for us, but of the 5 different concierge desks, we could never figure out where to find someone when we needed help. Meanwhile, it wasnt until Day 3 of our visit that we learned the hotel offered an entire "Activities Calendar" for yoga, spinning, etc. I guess the person who checked us in decided that we didn't need to know about those activities? The gym was lacking in enough equipment even for me, and the stationary bicycle shook like it was about to fall apart. I often stay at a Westin in Cincinnati for work, and i was disappointed to find our room here was no nicer than that one (at $80/night!). We reserved the "Ocean Tower" at the recommendation of a friend who said its the newer building. I cant imagine what the older building looks like because we were not impressed with the room. The view from our balcony was fabulous, and probably the best part of our visit!

Reviews.Title: “About what we expected. . .”
Reviews.Author: SCABob
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading these comments before traveling. However, I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised after we arrived. True, the rooms are small and this did color our view of this property. The small size was further complicated by the fact that they had placed a table and 2 chairs in front of a desk - which meant that the desk was unusable. The table and chairs made it somewhat difficult to move around. The prices are high but this seems to be the case in Hawaii. High prices for food and drink are not unique to this property. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We did use the Concierge but be aware that another purpose of this desk is to get you to attend a time share presentation. Self parking was somewhat of an issue if you returned at night. The spaces are very small and not all drivers seem to be capable of parking straight, in between the lines, in these small spaces. As a result, many parking spaces were simply not usable. We used the American Express travel desk, located on-site, and the staff was very knowledgeable and very helpful. As other properties seem to do, this property charges a $25/day 'Resort Fee'. This fee gives you internet access and self-parking (plus a few other things). I am not a big fan of these 'fees'. We would return to this property in the future but we would also check out other properties in the area. Our room was also located in the center of the 9th floor and we had a fantastic view of the ocean. However, the size of the room. . . We would recommend this property to a friend as long as they understood the room and parking issues.

Reviews.Title: “If you are using points, better to stay at the Villas. Don't go to the Luau!”
Reviews.Author: cberenguer
Reviews.Content: If you are using points to stay at this hotel, you are better off staying at the Westin Villas instead. Cost the same points per night, Have a lot more room, not as busy. Newer. Don't recommend the Luau. Would probably have preferred the buffet-style ones as opposed to this "family style" served at the table. Offers an open bar, but its pretty limited, especially for those looking for virgin cocktails....

Reviews.Title: “Smelly small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lvsunnyskies
Reviews.Content: The location and grounds are beautiful, but the rooms were small and tired. The smell every time I walked into our room almost knocked me over. Smelt musty or like cat urine. Actually woke me up at night. I complained to the front desk and they sent up an ionizer to clear the smell. They said it would be 3 hours to clear it, but my husband went to the room and they were removing the machine after only 1 hour. The smell was slightly better, but still stunk for the rest of our trip. We had been to this hotel 8 years before and remember the rooms being much nicer and cleaner. Definitely needs and overhaul. Friends of ours needed to be moved because they found cockroaches on their walls at night. The hotel was full, so they could not move us. Spent most of our time outside, so decided I would tolerate the smell. Other friends had a flood when their shower backed up smelly sewer water. The hotel didn't want to move them as they told them they were full. They threw a towel over the water, and after much complaining they managed to find my friends another room - hmmmm. Being right next door to Whaler's Village was a bonus, but as others have mentioned food prices and drinks at the hotel were expensive. $10 for a glass of wine, I bought a bottle of the same wine next door at ABC for $14. They do nickel and dime you for everything. You want a towel you need to get a wrist band and a big sign saying if you don't return your towels there is a $25 charge. To have a lounge chair on the beach is $5 each per day plus more for an umbrella. The first day there were absolutely no chairs around the pool to be had. I asked for one of the many beach loungers they had behind them to be brought to the beach and they said no they had rented out all the chairs they were renting for the day. So my first day was spent shopping at Whaler's because every time I checked around the pool all the chairs were occupied or has towels reserving them. You pay enough to stay at the hotel, there should be somewhere to sit and enjoy the pool or ocean. We had a great trip, despite the smell in the room and lack of space around the pool, and would probably stay close by there the next time, but would be tempted to check our their villas or The Sheraton. Whale watching at breakfast and on the beach was wonderful. The Hyatt looked beautiful and seemed to have plenty of chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay-Beautiful view -Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: polin001
Reviews.Content: Loved the Westin Maui. Stayed for six days and was upgraded to a beautiful room with a wonderful view. The staff were very friendly and made us very welcome. Will go back to this hotel again and again. The only complaint was that in spite of the resort fee, you had to pay for beach chairs and umbrellas and it seemed towards the end of the stay they were hard to come by unless you reserved chairs and an umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: TaijTaij
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights last spring. We stopped at 3 hotels over the course of our time on the islands and this was by far our favorite. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, the pools area was immaculate, the location allowed us a short drive to most everywhere we wanted to be on the island. Our room wasn't huge, but the view was spectacular (facing the hills of Maui) and it was clean. I'd recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Lobby - Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: denajennell
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Westin and seeing the gorgeous lobby - I had high hopes for our partial ocean-view room. However, it was just OK. Clean but on the small side. The Heavenly Shower and Bed were nice though I have to admit. One thing I DID NOT LIKE was that you pay $25/day for a resort fee that includes (among other things) parking and free wi-fi. HOWEVER, the free wi-fi is SUPER slow, but you can upgrade to faster wi-fi for $5 day!! I hate paying a ton of money and then still getting nickel and dimed, ya know? Just give me the fast Wi-Fi. Thankfully, when I booked I received two free breakfast buffets every day... looked at the menu and they charge $29 for this per person. Yikes. Drink prices are not any better! Super high. Head down the ocean "boardwalk" to leilanis and they have $3 mai tais and ritas during happy hour! Overall, good stay, might check out another resort if I go back though. No major complaints though.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointment in a Westin!”
Reviews.Author: Carmelout
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is not like most Westin hotels. Very unfriendly staff and they do not try to make things better. Our room did not have air several times and instead of changing our room they knew we were single women but they said they fixed it and just kept sending someone back. (not thinking that next time we would bring our husbands). First disappointment was that we booked with Apple Vacations and you do not get points with the Starwood points program. Second, I have traveled all over the world and I don't mind paying resort prices but a simple glass of chardonnay was $12.50 a little too pricey. But walk 100 feet next door to Hula Grill and the same glass of wine was $6.50. The pool had very rude servers and very limited hours. They need to look at different time zones and schedule servers. If you are there 5 days you don't want to live a 5 hour time difference. The hotel staff worked when they wanted to and did not take in consideration your vacation time. The fitness center was excellent.! The breakfast buffet was great if you got the ocean front view. But plan to wait on your vacation for this. The coffee bar early AM was nice but really slow. And don't purchase the pineapples in the lobby to take back they get broken during during travel. Ask to ship instead. The Econ Tours (Ask for Eric) Travel Rain Forest 5 mile hike was the fabulous and the Snorkel trip with the Pride of Maui was excellent! Also, the Hula Grill next door has wonderful food & drinks. And Duke's restaurnat ( 3 minute tax ride) is the best dinner I have every had. Try the seared rare ahi tuna, to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but kinda pricy”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: We love staying on Kaanapali Beach when we go to Maui, so a hotel right on the beach is important to us. The property is VERY nice and backs right onto Kaanapali Beach. Service is excellent too. Highly recommend staying here with kids. Only downside is pricing. We paid $365/night for a garden view room which is alot for what we got. Oh, and we were automatically charged a $25 "resort" fee to cover parking and two free bottles of water every day (kinda sneaky how they charged this). And don't eat at the restaurant - very poor value and the food wasn't that good (breakfast buffet was $27pp).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Flip-Flop84
Reviews.Content: We found an amazing deal online and booked the Westin Maui for our honeymoon in Paradise, and that is exactly what it was.. Paradise! We arrived late at night, tired and exhausted from our long trip. When we checked in, we were given free buffet breakfast vouchers as a honeymoon upgrade.( This saved us close to $500.00) The staff were very kind and welcoming. As we walked in the room, we were amazed at how nice it was, and our view was absolutely breathtaking. (We had read many negative reviews about the rooms, but were very pleased with ours). The grounds are lush and tropical! We would eat our breakfast and head to the beach every morning, the sunset on the beach is beautiful. The resort is in an excellent location, in the middle of everything. Somedays we would walk to Whalers village to see some night shows and shop, other days we would take drives and stop along different beaches. It is only a 5 minute drive to Lahaina where there are lots of fun shops and great prices for food and souvenirs. The meals at the hotel can be pricey, but as for drinks, my husband and I would find out happy hour times and go to the bars at this time to save money. We would also eat a large breakfast at the hotel, snack on things during the day and go out for a nice dinner at a restaurant. The restaurants next to the hotel are great, nice atmosphere and fun music playing at the barefoot grill. It really depends on what you want to spend, there are restaurants that are very expensive and others that are a fairly good price. When going to Maui we were told about how expensive everything is, but we found that we did not go overboard on spending. The Westin has free parking, although the parking spots are very small. When the lot if full, the would valet park for us. Definitely rent a small vehicle if possible, it is also a good idea to rent a smaller vehicle for the road to Hana.. very narrow road. The Westin was an excellent choice for our honeymoon and my husband and I are alreayd planning an anniversary trip to the Westin. We both loved it and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start to a magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels89
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin at 8am - tired, hungry and a little agitated from a long trip. Due to airline cancellations we didn't make our first night. Thinking as we had prepaid in full that our room would be ready we were dismayed to learn they had given it away! We had emailed them to advise of our delay - only to be sent a no-reply email telling us to call the hotel (which we couldn't). We were given another room which we were promised was exactly like the originally booked one......once up in the Part Ocean Room - we were devastated to find it wasn't cleaned from the previous tenants........ A couple of phone calls later to reception we were upgraded to a beautiful Ocean View Suite......it was magical. So - we may have had a rocky start but our 2 day stay was magical. Clean, large suite with breathtaking views. The lobby is impressive with waterfalls, exotic birds include flamingoes, parrots. Breakfast in the poolside restaurant was excellent. The pools were fabulous - great for all ages. There is an adults-only pool with bar, then the waterslides for the children are great. The village next door is easy to get to with a beachfront stroll. There is an array of designer shops and more affordable ones as well. There is a huge selection of food in outdoor restaurants. We love it so much - we plan on returning for a week next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mega Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OscarpupBoston
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife and boys ages 5 and 4 at the time. This resort is huge and was extremely busy when we went. It is right on an wonderful beach (thought the waves were very large with a strong undertow). Food was good, not great. It was expensive but this was the case for all food in Hawaii. Room was nice and clean, but a bit small. Next door was a little shoping village which was fun to attend and a great source for meals (including McDonalds). We found a great Chicago style pizza joint in the main town nearby, and loved Cheeseburgers in Paradise (neat the pizza joint). Pools were great with a waterslide. Was a fine stay with no real complaints, but we did find ourselves wishing we stayed somewhere a little less chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return - Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: terryk7777
Reviews.Content: As I write this review I am sitting in my room looking that the ocean...will not want to leave when the last day comes. In making the decision to stay here we looked at various hotel options and read many reviews. We chose this hotel due to its brand name, location and value. It has exceeded our expectations. Some of the somewhat negative reviews that we read that made us hesitate choosing this hotel focused on wear and tear (scratches and scuffs on the elevator doors and hallways) and non caring staff. Yes, there is some minor wear and tear but if you can look past that it is a great hotel. Staff have been very helpful (albeit the front desk is understaffed-a sign of the recession). I wanted to upgrade my room and front desk staff went the extra mile to accommodate my request. Hotel is clean and rooms have been updated. Pool area is great, no problems getting lounges at this time of year. The hotel is one of the best locations in the area and its proximity to Lahaina is great (4 miles) with a hotel shuttle bus if you don't have a rental car. There are many food choices...you can spend as much as $50 per meal (higher end spots around the hotel or in Lahaina) or as little as $8 per meal (food court in Whalers Village next door and fast food around Lahaina). Drinks in the hotel a bit pricey at $9.75 but you can always go to the ABC and buy your hard liquor and mix and have it in your room if you don't want to pay the price. I am 6 days into a 13 day vacation and am very happy with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “THE LOBBY ALONE IS UNBELIEVABLE....!”
Reviews.Author: Sam1734
Reviews.Content: having had 4 rubbish nights at the Ourigger Royal Kahana you can imagine our faces when we arrived at the Westin! the lobby is absolutely stunning with parrots...flamingos...tropical fish...Waterfall etc all around the seating area My only complaint was it was New Years weekend so you can imagine.....crazy crazy busy We got to the pool at 9am and I sware there was not a spare sunbed in the place...i was in shock. Instead of standing around like a lemon like 20 other people i could see i went on a hunt for a pool guy who immediately found me 2 empty beds an moved them for us to the sunny area of the people. It is a huge pool area and im sure on a normal week it would be chilled and relaxed so i guess its not the Westins fault you couldt move!!! The slides are great fun for all...and for sure keep the kids busy The room was not huge but very nice...modern etc and no complaints there....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RvanDijk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Nice pool, nice beach, close to Black Rock. And the better one of all the hotels in Ka'anapali. Service is good, happy hours at the bars, but still expensive. It is next to the Whalers Village, so a lot of possibilities out there.

Reviews.Title: “Noooo-this can not be a Westin!”
Reviews.Author: DrDoctor3
Reviews.Content: Westins--Love them. this Westin--HATE it. The reviews that say that the hotel needs help, are all correct. I know I know, I should not have visited there during the week of Christmas, but we decided at the last minute to pop over to Maui for the holiday weekend. Here is a list of things to hate at this hotel: Front dest staff are down right rude. I am the type who approach the desk always with a smile and usually have wonderful staff to assist you, or answer a quick question. Here I was glared at and told to step aside! They only care about selling time shares here. Yep--there are other comments on this, and it is true. I was approached three times in the first 24 hours and almost scheduled without consent to a tour of the property and a presentation. If you are a GOLD member--EXPECT NOTHING from this hotel. No room upgrade, no late check out, no newspaper, No bottles of water,no seperate check in desk to speed things along when they are 15 people deep at check in and they only have 1 person working the desk, while the other one hides from time to time in the back. But you can expect a room with a view of the garbage cans(that has not been cleaned), or low level room overlooking the rooftop for the front of the hotel--and a view of all the garbage that is on that low level roof. was actually told while I was at the front desk--"we are a resort hotel and therefore we do not have to provide any of the upgrades or amenities of the SPG program" "we are a destination hotel and have a certain group of people who come back every year for the holidays and that is who we give our best service to" Did I mention they allow dogs? sure thing--had a giant poodle sit next to me on a lounge chair and later walk over and drink from the pool. and yes-I kid you not, hike its leg on the nearest rock next to the pool. (I was horrified) STAY AWAY from this hotel. there are several other hotels on this beach with better staff, newer facilities, and you wont be treated like cattle.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Renovations”
Reviews.Author: AnnaGAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel lobby and pool areas are beautiful however upon checking in, our rooms are old and tired looking, old carpets, old bathroom everything is clean but old. They charge an additional 25.00 per night for the use of some facilities but used none we even didn't every recieve the gift bag promised. The walls are paper thin and you can hear outside noises we were put next door the to the lift and generator and that kept me up all night but when we ask to be moved they took all day to organise another room. Would return when I hear its being up graded as it was very expensive to stay. Most hotels in Hawaii bring you towels and set up for you in the pool area but here " its do it yourself"

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLuvMaui
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip back to Maui, and each time we returned to the Westin Maui. Why? Best beach on the strip, numerous shallow pools (we dont' swim), great food, good location, and friendly people. We stayed in the Beach Tower in an ocean front suite. More than enough room. Only suggestion is that the bathroom which is big, is divided into small areas. Toilet is enclosed in a small room. Shower is small, and the double heads have no water pressure. But vacations are not about the bathroom. The views are great, but the lanai is on the side overlooking a restaurant and parking lot. Yes, you see the ocean front for miles, but I would rather have the lanai overlooking the Tropica Restaurant and ocean. The rooms next to the suites have the smaller lanai facing that way. But that's a small complaint. I would recommend this hotel time and time again. We will return there. After 4 times being here, I feel like we're going home. The walkway up and down the oceanwalk let's you visit each of the other hotels and restaurants. Being next door to Whaler's Village is another plus. Great restaurants. The hotel offers a free shuttle into Lahaina. We never rent a car. Don't need one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MAC3844
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the room was a little less clean than we had hoped and the view was not great. We asked if it was possible to move and they accomodated us within hours. Shuttle to the golf course was timely. They had a party one night and parking wasn't available. However, they immediately valet parked the car for no charge. Service in restaurants (Ono Grill) was very good. Breakfast buffet was included in our Costco package and was excellent. I wish Westin would consider partnering with Costco again; we would go back for two weeks instead of one next year.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Suntoyfull
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui right on Kanapali beach is a great location for some good times. The hotel is excellent with great service and amenities. The best part is the location, right at the edge of Kanapali beach.... Beautiful! Great swimming, surfing and diving. Right next door is the Hula Lounge which is a great eating spot, drinks and some entertainment. The hotel rooms are ok, nothing really great, but you wont be spending too much time in your room anyway. The decor is good, modernish and recently redone. Rooms are smallish, but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: JRwisconsin
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is dramatically situated on Kaanapali Beach with a huge pool complex complete with flamingos and swans in the pool off the lobby. The pool complex and beach are lovely and the staff hardworking and helpful. My critique relates to the rooms. I stayed there for five days with my husband who was at a scientific convention. Our room, which supposedly had a "mountain view", actually overlooked a busy parking lot. It was so noisy that we kept the door to the balcony closed day and night and used airconditioning even though the temperatures were pleasant. Our room had with two "full" sized beds, and not queens which we are used to, so my husband and I slept in separate beds as each bed was too narrow for two people.
