The bedding resembled that of an Austrian ski resort instead of a tropical resort with heavy comforters and a down blanket between two sheets, so warm we had to take the covers off the beds in order to be able to sleep. So we never really enjoyed being in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing with foam pillows, no HBO or Showtime, no newspapers, etc.”
Reviews.Author: tdeloache
Reviews.Content: I was expecting luxury and so far have been disappointed. The "heavenly" beds promised have lumpy foam pillows. I ALWAYS bring my own down pillow but relied on this promise so I brought only a small boudoir pillow and I'm glad I did that. We are supposed to stay another 10 nights here but we are thinking of moving to the Sheraton or another island if they can't do better than what we've seen so far. Our happy hour margaritas were excellent as were the tappas plates recommended by the female bartenders at the Ono Bar and Grille, which also has three or four televisions to watch your favorite sports. Room service this morning was brought quickly but the french toast was lukewarm and dull. They also forgot the jam that I requested be served with it. Our "personal concierge" was more interested in promoting their timeshares and activities than anything else. We got several mesages to stop by to visit her to pick up our special free gift, which was a wall calendar and some discount coupons. Please! I'm going to complain today about everything to see if they can make our stay more enjoyable but so far, my fond memories of past stays at the Hyatt Regency make this place seem like a dive.

Reviews.Title: “What a great resort start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Gailanna
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through Costco, which I had never done before, and I must say I was very pleased. The quality and value for the price was outstanding! The pool was tropical and relaxing and I really appreciated that there was a kids pool. The beach front was perfect. We did not have to leave the resort for much. My husband surfs and he was able to do that right outside our hotel. We had all types of water sports available, shopping within walking distance and a large variety of restaurants. However, the best thing about the hotel was the service. It was top notch and I am picky. Dawn at the front desk went above and beyond in service upgrading us to a beautiful deluxe ocean view room. Everyone was pleasant and helpful and I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... excellent experience at Westin Resort Maui (beach/pool)”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Sandy-Parker
Reviews.Content: We booked 6 months in advance thru Costco travel (like many of the guests there). Incredible package value including rental car, room, "resort fees", breakfasts, 1 dinner, 2 bottles of water/day, self-parking, spa entries, $200 resort credit from travel agency. We read so-so reviews and didn't get our hopes up. We arrived Black Friday (day after Thanksgiving), and requested an upgrade to full Ocean View room - we got it ! (no additional cost) Very friendly service at front desk... plus they hand out little Leis (made of shells) to guests checking in - nice touch. Room was older, but pretty well updated - no problems. Bathroom was a little small, but worked great. Small refrig. and Coffee Maker in room (plus a safe, storage for food, etc). Beds were typ. Westin - heavenly (so, so comfy). View from room was jaw-dropping: approx. 160 degree view of lushly landscaped pool areas - then whitewater views of the deep blue Pacific Ocean. Ahhh, just need a glass of wine to complete the picture. Smallish lanai (patio area), but nice. Some people smoking on their lanais detracted from the pleasure. Suggest Snorkeling a few hundred yards north at "Black Rock" (in front of Sheraton hotel) - saw colorful fish, 2 Squid, and a large (3-4 foot diameter) Sea Turtle just cruising around near the shore. Wonderful. Snorkeling in front of Westin is OK (lots of "Humu" fish and other fish feeding in coral reefs a few feet offshore). Also great snorkeling at mile marker 14 about 7-8 miles South of the hotel. The afternoon was great for hanging out at the pool areas.... this was a very lush area with multiple pools (incl. "Adults only pools") and a decent waterslide for kids (and adults!). Uncrowded at this time of year (despite 83F temperatures - warm & sunny). Good drinks and sushi there also. Lots of waterfalls (all over the place) give a nice aura - and drown out most ambient noise. We ate breakfasts and 1 dinner at "Ono Grill" at Westin. Great outdoor seating, food was good (not great), prices were pretty high ($28 each for breakfast buffet), but ours was included with the travel package (whew). Ate a lot of pretty good food right at the hotel. Gym is very nice - 2nd floor overlooking the dining/pool areas. Concierges were very helpful to arrange stuff for us: (1) Parasailing... very fun, they launch you from the boat and let you out 600' or 1200' (depending on cost), and reel you in - you get a little wet... approx $100/person, I think. (2) Snorkel trip to Molikini on a Catamaran... too windy that day, and they docked very near the snorkel place we found near mile marker 19 south of Lahaina... I was prepared to be disappointed, but it was great ! "Four Winds" was the boat, I think... very friendly crew, OK breakfast (bagel & juice), good boat ride, great to just dive off the boat to snorkel, tons of colorful fish (and 1 smaller Sea Turtle) near the boat. GREAT BBQ lunch (burgers, chicken, beer, wine) About $100/person, but very enjoyable. We saw "breach" of 2 Humpback Whales in the channel. Cool. (3) Zip-lining... place near CJs deli nearby hotel, short drive up hills, strap on a harness, and zip down 8 cables (lengths of 300' to 1200') for about $160/person.... pretty exhilirating. One note: Self-Parking gets full at night (one night I snuck my rental car into the valet parking area). Westin is right next door to Whalers Village (outdoor mall) with shops and restaurants. Leilanis was OK (good Ono fish tacos). A small walk south to Hyatt Regency, we ate at Umalu restaurant on the beach - surprisingly great upscale pizza, burgers, salads - costly but good food quality. Recommend Roys Kahana Grill restaurant (7 miles North) - great service, FRESH fish, great ribs, and good Chocolate Souffle. Do not recommend "I/O" restaurant in Lahaina... highly rated in a travel book I had, but poor service and bland food and high prices made it a poor value (just my humble opinion). CJs deli (Kamaa street - above golf course) has great food for cheap (for Maui). Hotel has 2 internet terminals at coffee stand - no fee (nice feature). Also: no fee to check-in and print boarding passes in hotel lobby (near elevators) - another nice touch. We bought our own alcoholic beverages and snacks (plus souvenirs) at Costco and WalMart near the airport - to save money. We forgot we were stocking up on "Black Friday" (crowded)...oops. Negatives: I can't think of any (actually: we found the magnetic key cards get de-programmed every 2-3 days - a minor inconvenience). Westin performed very, very well ! We will return (if we can get the same type of package price) in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is declining”
Reviews.Author: sailndayz
Reviews.Content: What a difference a year makes. One year earlier nice orchid leis at the entry, now cheap made-in China tiny sea shell necklaces. Now you stand in check-in line for over an hour. Hotel Maintenance has suffered greatly. What a shame, this was once a decent property. Won't be back for a long time, if ever. At least the flamingos are still alive. Nearby Leilani's and the Hula Grill are still great food (and drinks). Be sure to catch Leilani's Early Bird dinners (upstairs). Onsite buffet breakfast still good, but waaayyy overpriced. Pool remains a touch on the cold side (colder than prior year?). Parasailing with UFO Parasailing on the beach near the front of the hotel, remains very reasonable, fun and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Its fine”
Reviews.Author: grevo77
Reviews.Content: If you want my true opinion listen to this. Maui is so beautiful so whatever hotel you will be you will have a good time because the island is amazing. Now about this Westin: I would never choose such type of hotel for myself (to expensive). However, while on a business trip, I stayed 6 nights for free. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. The hotel is luxurious. Flamingos, parrots, multi-colored fishes are swimming along a small like just next to the lobby. Pool is nice and the beach in front the hotel is nice also. Next to hotel is a mall were you can do all your basic shopping. Plenty of restaurants are also there. Be aware however that after 10 pm it is a dead place. Nothing to eat or to drink. The hotel; has no vending machines either. So if you are out of water you have to wait until the next day...The hotel has a free shuttle (every hour) that brings you in 35 min in Lahaina - the major city closest to the hotel. A cab from the airport to there costs about $85 without tip. In summary, if I had to pay out of my pocket I would not stay there. Maui is so beautiful so why the hell I should pay so much money to stray in a place like this? I mean in places like Mai you jut need a bed to sleep. Nothing else. Anyway, if you budget allows I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebarney
Reviews.Content: I am a Westin gold member. This is by far the least nice Westin I have ever stayed in....and the most expensive. It is an old, ill kept, unclean hotel inside the rooms with none of the quality of typical Westins. I could not be more disappointed. The pools and beach are nice for your kids --but so are the pools and beaches at other hotels with better prices or better values. This feels like a tourist rip-off. Don't waste your money or points here!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: MikeDelaware
Reviews.Content: Have to give some props to Yvonne at concierge who didn't lead us wrong on viewing a great Westin Vacation property in Maui. She was great and pleasant to work with on this important project in our like.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: annfg2
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the islands and this was our favorite place of all. Staff was friendly and made our visit quit pleasurable, from dining to swimming in their many pools. A must place to stay if you are planning a trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui Vacation”
Reviews.Author: brcunn
Reviews.Content: We booked through Costco Travel. Great package! Covered $25 daily resort fee, a rental car, buffet breakfast every day, $100 food credit at Ono Grill & $200 credit for resort services (I used the spa which also had a 25% discount). When we checked out the $200 had been applied to the spa, drinks & food we had charged to the room. Picked up our rent car (Chrysler Sebring convertible) at airport. Drove about 10 miles & had a flat tire. Called Roadside Asistance who said they would come change the flat for a $48 fee. While my husband was speaking with them a car stopped to check on us. It happened to be the General Mgr. for airport parking. He called and had them send a wrecker for the car and to bring us a new Mustang convertible. We sat on the side of the road for almost 2 hours, but got a nice new car. When we checked into the hotel we were upgraded from a partial ocean view to an ocean front room in the Beach Tower which has 30% larger rooms. The hotel is not brand new, but the upkeep is good. All hotel employees were very friendly and helpful from the valet parking attendants, to the housekeepers (especially Edna) to the wait staff (especially Donna in Ono's Grill). We did the usual tourist things - snorkeled at Black Rock, took the Road to Hana, upcountry winery tour, ate at lots of local restaurants. Very enjoyable and relaxing. Husband golfed 2 mornings while I enjoyed the pool and the spa. We would definitely stay at the Westin again on a future trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: Logge
Reviews.Content: The Westin was definitely the most luxurious hotel we stayed at during our time on Maui, the lobby is truly amazing with lots of fish and flamingos. We got a nice room with a beautiful view over the hotel grounds with the ocean in the background. The bed was heavenly as promised, although for the first night, we didn't get a king bed even though we asked for this when we booked, eight months earlier. Restaurants in the area are quite pricey and filled up quickly even though we stayed here during low season. We ended up eating most of our meals at the hotel grill, Ono. The beach is really nice and down by the black rock, we saw turtles while snorkeling (we would end up seeing a lot more on the Big Island). While staying in Hawaii we did a lot of traveling and tried different activities nearly every day, it was very relaxing to spend a few days here and just enjoy what the hotel had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, provided you get a good room.”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTraveller92
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to Hawaii, and spent 6 nights at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa. We had originally booked a Mountain View room, and were disappointed when we arrived at our room, to find it had a very musty smell, and air con that was not working properly. Aside from this, our room was located directly above the dumpster/rubbish area for the hotel, so not a great outlook! We decided to ask about upgrading, and paid extra to upgrade for an ocean view - where we had great view of the ocean plus pools area of the hotel. We were happy with our new room, and the rest of our stay was great. The hotel also has a compulsory $25USD resort charge that is added per day to your room charges. This covers parking, fitness centre, shuttle bus to Lahaina etc etc. The only service we used was the shuttle to Lahaina, but a return taxi would cost probably about $25 if not more for this journey. Beware if your room opens out onto the pool area, hundreds of bird flock to a certain tree at about 5am and again in the evening - it is very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “A Second Memorable Trip”
Reviews.Author: GiselleSanRafael_CA
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time my husband and I stayed at the Westin in Kaanapali and we were pleased with both stays. The accommodations were adequate (not exceptional) but the personnel and location make up for it. Our housekeepers were great - nice personalities. I would like to recognize them by name - Virgie Galinato and Virginia Trinidad. Being centrally located on the "strip", you have access to tropical activities and shopping. Really gives you a "Hawaiian" feeling! In addition, the pool and garden area is absolutely beautiful. You have access to full sun or shade around the pool and there is an adult pool as well as children waterslides and activities. The hotel provides activites for children and adults alike giving you a "cruise ship" type of feel. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed... at all.”
Reviews.Author: kbaick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui for 4 nights during our Hawaiian vacation. I had high expectations for this hotel, since we are regulars at Westin's around the US and have always been pleased the level of cleanliness and service. At first glance, the resort is beautiful. The entrance is grand and the pool is quite nice. At check in, we were greeted by a very friendly woman who congratulated us on our new marriage and tried her best to give us a King room, since there were only doubles available. She graciously found us one. When we entered our room, we were overpowered by the smell of dry urine. The carpets were stained, there was hair on the bathroom floor, dried up toothpaste in the sink. Unacceptable. I returned to the front desk and told the woman that we wouldn't mind having a room with double beds, since I had no intention on staying in the room she gave us... ironically... suddenly more King rooms were available. How convenient! The second room they gave us was better than the first, but definitely not the "Heavenly" experience that the Westin constantly advertises. I decided to treat my husband and I to a couples massage, he had never had one, and with the "Heavenly Spa" I expected to be satisfied with the services provided. My husband said that his massage was "nice", although he didn't have much to compare it to, but my massage therapist was rough and rushed. Not enjoyable at all. We came towards closing time, and following our massage were rushed out the door. The only plus I have to comment about is the Westin Pool. Definitely a pleasant place to relax... but definitely not worth the price per night. We definitely loved Maui and will return... however have no intentions of staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel33
Reviews.Content: We want to thank the staff at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa for a memorable vacation. It was all we had heard about, from friends that had stayed there, and more. It started from the Front Desk staff right through Housekeeping. The Front Desk Staff gave us the "Aloha Spirit" with their kindness and their appearance. The Hotel was beautiful and everyone we met was helpful and went out of their way to see that we had a great time including the Housekeepers. The Housekeepers had an eye for detail and were very friendly. This is something I truly appreciate. I will reccommend the Westin Maui resort and Spa to all my family and friends. We will definately stay there again. Thanks Again!!!

Reviews.Title: “past , present and future maui dreams come true”
Reviews.Author: vobrskyfet
Reviews.Content: Over the course of 25 years, we as a family have been enjoying the Westin Maui. Our ninth visit to Maui again found us at Kaanapali, now with college and post graduate children...and still loving the Westin. As an entity of the Starwood group, we have always enjoyed both the Westin Maui and the Sheraton Mauiproperties. The location is prime, with safe, extremely clean beaches. We love whale watching from the balcony, as well as the lighting of the dusk torch on black rock. The food is outstanding, not to mention the pristine, quintessential Hawaiian environment. The staff treat you as honored guests as represented by the general housekeeeping all the way to management. Thank You Westin Maui and Sheraton Maui (Starwood) for offering a truly beautiful experience...repeatedly!!!...not only to us as parents but to my children; then teens, now young adults who certainly know know the value of pure quality in accommodations. Thank you for a generation of precious memories!

Reviews.Title: “A stay that exceeded our expectations in everyway (especially after some curious reviews on this site)”
Reviews.Author: cameroncrazy309
Reviews.Content: Was concerned given the mixed reviews we had seen on the site prior to traveling. No issues with check in ( the representative could not have been more accommodating), the pool water temperature was fine (the kids were in through out the day), no issue with charges for towels (we headed the comments here and were sure to return our towels when leaving the pool area), no occurrences of other charges on our bill, and maid service was timely each day. That being said ... This hotel was wonderful. Top features: 1. The overall grounds and pool area were fantastic (and well maintained) 2. Rooms were great - had ocean view from beach towers 3. For those traveling with family, note that this was the one hotel we could find that allowed us to book five into a room (me, wife, 15 year old and 12 year old twins). If you want to save $, the room had a king bed and pull out queen sofa. More than enough room for us. 4. Top beach - quite sand, fun waves, water is beautiful 5. Location - promenade provides easy walking access to whalers village next store and up through the Sheraton (lots of shopping and eating options within easy walking) Consider: 1. Free internet at the hotel coffee hut - available 24/7 (great diversion when awake at 2 am your first morning and every one else is still asleep) 2. Check out the stand next to the coffee hut - great value on postcard idea. Small wooden surf board that kids could decorate and write brief message. $10 with postage. A great keepsake (we send one to ourselves as well). Also send pinneapples home from hear. 3. Check out the ABC store in whalers village to stock up on supplies 4. Rent snorkel gear for the length of your stay at whalers village. We kept in the car and found a number of places to put in during our travels. Dont miss honolua bay in west maui. Went back a second day - great fish count, good visibility. Spent a lot on cruise to molokini but saw 100x the fish here. 5. If you have kids, you will see all of the green and pink inner tubes in the pool. Available at pool stand a great value ($4 at time of our stay). We brought all three home and used them all summer in the pool there. 6. Casual hotel restraunt was much better than the two next store at whalers village. We waited for over an hour at hula grill, had lousy service and mediocre food. Do yourself a favor and stay onsite if you are only looking for casual dinner that can accommodate the kids. 7. Pizza at whalers village was tasty and a good value 8. Leave time on your trip to hana - at black sand beach before reaching hana, there are fresh water caves. The highlight for all three kids - leave yourself time earlier so you do not feel rushed here. A lot to see and do at this park. 9. If your daughter is looking for hula lessons (priority one for ours), there are free lessons on selected afternoons at whalers village. 10. If you have a late return flight, request use of courtesy room to shower and change prior to leaving for the airport. This allowed us to snorkel, use the pool, etc. all day and still be able to regroup prior to a 930 pm flight home

Reviews.Title: “Serene”
Reviews.Author: j_s8o8
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort. Beautiful in and out. I enjoy the service that the staff has provided with us. One notable employee that i would like to mention is "Donna" from Ono's. An employee of the restaurant they have on the resort provided wonderful service. Her pleasant voice and kind attitude topped off our evening dinner. Thanks Donna! Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: sdloa
Reviews.Content: We got married here in September and would have decided on somewhere else had we known we would have been treated so poorly. One would think that the bride and groom would be treated with some decency. We booked 7 nights for ourselves and 30 nights total through our friends and family. We checked in on Monday and saw that our room was sharing 2 walls with 2 elevators. Thinking that we could sleep through it, we didn't bring it to the attention of the front desk to change. Well...we couldn't sleep through it so asked the front desk around noon the following day if we could change rooms. We were told that they were sold out that night so we couldn't change rooms. So, because it never hurts to ask, we asked if an upgrade was available seeing as how we were getting married there in 4 days. The front desk manager said flatly, "No." I asked if it was because they were at capacity or because it was simply out of the question. He replied that it was "simply out of the question" and then informed me that other people actually pay for the rooms. Now we may not have actually paid for the upgraded room, but we DID bring several tens of thousands of dollars to the hotel from the wedding and room blocks. He offered no other options and no apologies. Because they were sold out that night, we stayed in the room by the elevators another night. We found out just recently that one of our wedding guests was given a room near an elevator that same day (a few hours later). THEY were upgraded. The property gets 2 stars just because it's beautiful. We travel to Maui once a year and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Next to the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: ACALIFNative
Reviews.Content: We stayed further up the beach at the Sheraton for this vacation, but we dropped by the Westin to have breakfast. We made our own menu selections rather than the buffet. We were seated on their beach patio. Straight ahead was the ocean and just below was the large koi pond. It was the best location and wonderful service. My husband had eggs benedict and he said it was fantastic. I had the macadamia nut pancakes and they were to die for. My husband had to help me with the large portion, but we both admitted they were the best pancakes we have ever had! We looked around the hotel after breakfast and we were very happy that we chose the Sheraton for our stay as the Westin had a lot of people everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GN2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui for 10 days on our honeymoon. We booked it through the Hawaii Travel Bureau and saved lots of $$. They upgraded us for free to a full ocean view room with a king size bed. The lobby and grounds were spectacular as well as the service and amenities within the resort. The breakfast buffet was plentiful but costly at $28 USD per person (this was included in our room rate). But Whalers Village is only a few minutes away by foot and also has breakfast options including McDonalds. We had lunch at Ono's on the resort which also served healthy and tasty food (a sandwich lunch with salad will run you $18). But again Whalers Village and the ABC store is only a few minutes away where you can buy a sandwich for $5. We never had dinner on the resort as there are tonnes of dinner options in Lahaina to select from. There were adult as well as kid pools which gave us the option of having a quiet, relaxing day or a day filled with kids splashing and running around. There is also an activities desk right on the grounds to book outdoor activities or sunset dinner cruises and things like that. The beach in front of the hotel was clean and inviting. You can rent beach chairs for $5 each and umbrellas for $10 each. There is amazing snorkelling with green sea turtles at Black Rock at the Sheraton about a 10 minute walk away. There are tonnes of places to rent snorkel gear. At night the lobby was scented with aloe white tea incense which the hotel spa sells and it smelled amazing! There is free parking for cars but if the lot gets full then they valet park your car for free. There is a $25 per day resort fee which covers 2 free bottles of water per day, unlimited internet in your room and parking. There are also numerous concierge desks which help you plan excursions, dinners, tours etc. But be careful because they convinced us to attend a timeshare presentation and we wasted 2 hours doing it but they gave us $100 resort credit in return. I debated on booking this resort versus the Grand Wailea and the Marriott in Wailea but we took a drive down there and there was not much around. I am super happy that we chose Ka'anapali Beach and the Westin Maui!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again.”
Reviews.Author: nursielulu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot, and to say the least we would not stay here at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa ever again. It had been our third wedding anniversary. We had such great time in Oahu and Kauai for our second wedding anniversary we decided we wanted to go back to Hawaii! We were supposed to receive a partial ocean view for ten nights and it was more like a full parking lot view in the back of the hotel. We felt that we were misled. We needed binoculars to view the ocean. We immediately switched rooms only to have the same problem. Our third and final room's view wasn't all that great either which were obscured with palms trees blocking the ocean view overlooking their lagoon of flamingos and and waterfalls on the property. The front desk staff was not that friendly and seemed to us they didn't want to be there or would not go out of their way to help you out , nor make eye contact. The maids did not clean thoroughly and we would even tip them every so often. We have to say the Spa there was nice, although my massage with Zyla was disappointing as well. Needless to say my husband and I had a very fun and nice time in Maui itself because of the beauty of Maui and the company of each other. We did a lot of things in Maui. The beaches there are wonderful a pretty. You have to walk down to the Black Rock Beach at the Sheraton Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Westin is very convienient and great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansNative01
Reviews.Content: Ok folks. I've read these reviews for quite some time in preparation for my recent trip to Maui. I honeymooned there three years ago and stayed at the Hyatt. We had a great time and really looked forward to going back. When we were pricing this recent trip, the Westin came in at over $1200 CHEAPER than the Hyatt. So we took a risk and stayed there, especially after reading some of the earlier reviews about cleanliness, service, etc. I was very pleased with the overall stay and would go back again, but dollar for dollar, the Hyatt is still our favorite. The Westin is definitely an older hotel that has been renovated but likely needs a few finishing touches. We stayed on the 9th floor of the ocean tower with a beautiful oceanfront room. The balconies are very close together but there is enough room to spread things out to dry and still sit down. The view is AMAZING. The room was clean with some wear showing on the wallpaper and in the bathroom. We brought cleaning supplies to wipe everything down but we were pleased with the overall cleanliness of the room. The best perks of the Westin is its location right next to Whalers Village. We saved so much money on food by eating there throughout our stay. The new Cane and Taro restaurant was also very well priced for the large selection that you could choose from. We did do the breakfast buffet at the Westin and were pleased with the quality and the selection. It is comparable to the Hyatt. The pools at the Westin are large, but not as spread out than at the Hyatt. Also there isn't a swim up bar at the Westin which would have been a nice feature. All in all, the grounds at the Westin were nicely kept and good towel service. What does separate the Westin from the Hyatt is the Westin's beach. There is no beach at the Hyatt, the actual cabana chairs are now on the grass to rent as the beach has more or less washed away (except at the very edge of the property on the Lahaina side). The Westin beach is beautiful sand that is spread out with a very easy walk to Black Rock at the Sheraton. We snorkeled and saw sea turtles and several different species of fish. Wow, it was really nice to walk out and jump in the water with such a large beach. That was a big bonus. I would highly recommend taking a helicopter flight around the island if it fits your budget and itinerary. We flew Blue Hawaii and were very pleased with the trip. The guide Chris was very nice, funny and well informed of the island. It was a once in a lifetime experience. I would also recommend the magic show Warren and Annabelle's on Front street. It was VERY FUNNY and a great way to wrap up the trip. The food was also very good at the show and the cocktails were spot on. This show would be great for people of all ages. We met a couple that has been there 14 times!!! Warren is hilarious!!! All in all, we had a very nice stay at the Westin. The service was good, rooms were clean with a little updating needed, pools and grounds were clean, and the food was good. It was an awesome price that we were able to book a package (air, hotel, and car) through Expedia that gave us the freedom to do lots of other things like helicopter and see some shows/nice dinners out. That itself along with location is reason enough to stay at the Westin. They even brought us a bottle of Champagne for our special occasion. I thought that was truly a personal touch. I would stay there again without hesitation (as long as the price was right.) When comparing the Hyatt to the Westin, I'm not sure that a fair comparison can be made. The Hyatt has recently remodeled its outside bar/restaurant area (Umalu) and the overall grounds are more spread out with newer finishes throughout. There is no beach there so that's defintely a downside. For a honeymoon though or anyone really wanting a lot of private time, I would still recommend the Hyatt. Its quieter, more spread out, and has less kids (the Westin had lots of kids). But for the discount we booked the Westin for, I would go back in a heartbeat!!!!. it was truly an awesome vacation and gave us the freedom to do the things we couldn't do before. Either way, a vacation to Maui should be on everyone's bucket list, regardless of where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Westin”
Reviews.Author: Golpher
Reviews.Content: Just spent 9 days at The Westin and didn't want to come home. had a Premium Deluxe Oceanview room in the Beach tower. Tenth floor overlooking the pool area. Usually I don't like to stay in the room that long, but sitting out on the lanai and watching the pool and the ocean activities was enough to keep me occupied for a while. Whalers Village is a big plus being next door as well as having two golf courses within walking distance. I'll attach some photos to show off the place. This was our 3rd stay at The Westin in 5 years. We will be back. The end of September is a great time to visit. No problem finding a place to sit at the pool as well as very few children.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CMADORL
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Westin to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary, and it was wonderful! After reading some of the negative reviews, we were a bit concerned, but as soon as we arrived, it was clear those postings were unfounded. From the time we arrived & for the duration of our stay, the staff was nothing but friendly and helpful, and went out of their was to ensure we were had a great time. The room was wonderful, and we were able to get an upgrade to the 10th floor upon check in with a beautiful view of the ocean! Yes, the bathroom and room are average size, but our plans were to experience of Maui, not the room. The proximity of the hotel to Whalers Village was incredible and being able to walk there to eat or shop was so convenient. It's also close to Lahaina & Kapalua for great dining or shopping. Highly recommend Leilani's at Whalers Village for lunch/dinner and Sansei in Kapalua for sushi which was amazing. Would also recommend Cilantro in Lahaina for a great lunch or dinner. Awesome Mexican food with great prices! The spa was incredible! Great relaxation room with an ocean view and amenities. We also took a morning yoga class which was a great! We visited Maui 5 years ago and stayed at the Hyatt, but will definitely choose the Westin when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Heading back for the 7th time!”
Reviews.Author: Alison5280
Reviews.Content: We just booked ourselves into the Westin Maui for the 7th time in as many years. We last stayed there in Feb 2008, and, as usual, it was perfect. We are Starwood members and so have always received great rooms. Our favorite rooms are in the main part of the hotel, although the ones in the spa tower are also fantastic. We love their pool, the spa, everything! There have, on occasion been small customer service issues, but each time it was taken care of by the staff in an efficient and friendly manner. We have always felt as if they APPRECIATED us being there, and wanted us to enjoy our stay. From the valets who greet you when you arrive to the folks around the pool, we always feel like we are being treated like royalty. Although it has always been busy while we were there, it was never over-run or obnoxious. There is an adult-only pool where you can be removed from the hustle and bustle of families. Honestly, other than ordering food or drink around the pool, we haven't eaten in their restaurants much. We just love walking down the beach to the Whaler's Village for dinner on the ocean. However, the meals we have had at the Westin restaurants were all terrific, if a bit pricey. The location of this hotel is ideal. You can walk to Whaler's Village for cheap food court meals and snacks, as well as shopping. You can walk to several great ocean side restaurants, walk to Blackrock for snorkeling, and walk to a few other resorts. Lahaina is a short drive away, as is the grocery store. Kapalua is also a short drive away, where you can find a fabulous sushi place (Sensi). There is also great sushi to be had at the Ritz. We LOVE LOVE LOVE the Westin Maui and can't wait to be back there in a few short months!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: japoinase
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Westin Maui for our honeymoon and it was fabulous. Location is great, hotel beautiful and staff very friendly and helpful. We purchased the honeymoon package. It was definitely worth it because the package included welcome champagne with strawberries, a couple's massage, a dinner at the Tropica restaurant on the beach and a catamaran sunset cruise. The stay there was expensive, but the vacation was great. Two years later we stayed at the remodeled Sheraton down the beach from the Westin. It was nice, but the Westin is the superior hotel. After two trips, we'd stay at the Westin again if/when we're in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: pumpsat10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to the Westin Maui for our 10th year anniversary. After reading a few of the negative reviews I was a little nervous about our stay but after 7 nights I would highly recommend this hotel. Some of the reviews on this site are very accurate; others may be a little picky. Here is a short list of the some of the highlights and minor issues we ran into. The property around the pool is amazing, there is one poolside cabana that we rented three of our 7 days, its up on a deck at the far side of the pool furthest from the building, the only two person cabana not on the "stageâ€�, its facing the Ocean, it was amazing, very private, sat above the regular pool deck and has a priceless view of the ocean $50 a day and worth every bit of that. Don't bother pre -ordering anything to be placed in room upon arrival - I ordered rose pedals, chocolate strawberries, a flower arrangement and we were supposed to get the free bottle of champagne - everything came eventually but it was all disjointed and really didnâ€™t provide the romantic effect at arrival - having to call down to see where rose pedals are in front of your wife kind of kills the surprise! If you get a regular ocean front room it may face Whalers Village and the Ocean will be off to the left, the view is amazing looking out but not so wonderful looking down. Not a big deal, just be prepared. The proximity of the hotel to the town of Lahiana, Kapalua and having whalersâ€™ village next door makes it the perfect location. Blackrock is a short walk away and offers good snorkeling. Couples massage at the spa was the best I have ever had. Wish I could remember her name for you guys. Get a car, parking is easy, if the lot is full vallet is free, drive around, we had such a great time jumping in the car to finds local breakfast joints and just cruising around. Kids -this hotel is perfect for families, we will be back with our two kids, however if you are there for a romantic getaway the hotel is perfect as well. The adult only areas make it possible to have both. The walls are thin, but itâ€™s a hotel, get up and go see Maui. Some other reviews complained about the concierge trying to sell time shares, if you donâ€™t want the sales pitch donâ€™t go get the free gift that is offered. No one ever approached us. Eat at: Lahiana Grill, Plantation House In Kapalua, Sensei in Kapalua, Merrimans Kapalua, Pioneer Inn, Lahiana for breakfast I canâ€™t say enough about Sensei, Merrimans and The Lahiana Grill - and the million dollar view the plantation house for a $10 breakfast.....unbelievable. This was one of those experiences that was so good that I would be afraid to go anywhere else for fear it wouldnt offer the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui is Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Yancipu
Reviews.Content: I love my vacations at the Westin Maui. It is the highlight of my year. Relaxing, pampering and completely relaxing. I love the pools, the beach, the resort. I wish I could live there.

Reviews.Title: “Except for the birds...”
Reviews.Author: DELAustin
Reviews.Content: Everything was exceptional at this hotel. Great for families too, although we left our little one at home to get some much needed R&R. The only real complaint we had was the wake up call by the birds congregating outside our window each morning at 4 am. But, you don't go to Maui to sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the midst of Maui”
Reviews.Author: uwhusky91
Reviews.Content: The Westin resort was a great hotel and hangout for my wife during our trip to Maui. Terrific swimming pools and restaurants, ideally located close to many tourist spots. The beach was beautiful, and it's only a few minutes' drive to many of our favorite spots. The hotel was so nice, and the atmosphere so relaxing, that it could be a vacation locale in and of itself. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Westin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pvtan
Reviews.Content: Came here for our honeymoon. It was definitely not cheap but we thought we would splurge a bit since it was our honeymoon. The service was excellent. We kindly asked the receptionist if we can get upgraded from a garden view room to an ocean view room, and they did! The hotel had a very nice lobby and pool area with slides that are great for adults and kids. The rooms were a bit dated and especially the washrooms, which didn't impress us. But overall, it was a good stay. The location was excellent especially since we were right at the beach! Not sure if we would stay here again unless there's a really good deal since it is quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time, not great time, Hawaii is Hawaii, Hotel was good.”
Reviews.Author: Sweetjimmy
Reviews.Content: We went to the Westin on one of those time share deals. However, this was one our friends who own a time share there signed us up for. The location is great. It's in Kaanapalli, close to a lot fo restaurants. We were happy that it is next to a little shopping center with places to buy stuff and food. This way you don't have to spend all your money on food at the hotel, which can be a little pricey. Parking there is tough. The spaces are extremely small, luckily we had a rental, so I didn't care too much, but still a little annoyed that you have to squeeze your way out of the car. The rooms are a little old. The balconies that face the front of the hotel are very close together, you can totally see what the room next door is "hanging to dry." The pool was nice, it has a slide for the smaller kids, and a big one for older kids and adults. Overall, I would recommend to someone, but don't expect four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...but 70% positive”
Reviews.Author: DevMarc
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews before my stay, I was confused by the widely differing opinions, but now I understand, having just returned. On the positive side, the location is the best on the beach, the pool area is fabulous (we didn't have a problem getting chairs), and the lobby is lovely. We had an Ocean View Room in the Ocean Tower, on the top floor (11) with a view of both the ocean and the pools. I'd highly recommend the Ocean Tower over the Beach Tower. Our room was nice, but the air conditioning made a very loud noise, and although we complained, no one came to fix it. Also, when we first got there, there was an old piece of soap still sitting in the soap holder in the shower. The rooms are configured very strangely. The toilet and bathtub/shower are behind a door in a room with no mirror, and the sink is out in the open, so there's no privacy when brushing teeth, putting on makeup, shaving, whatever. I heard that all the rooms were configured like this, as it's an old property. The hotel is more like a 3 and 1/2 star than a 4 star, and it's definitely not a 5 star, except for the location. Don't pay the $3.75 for a small coffee in the lobby area...go to Whalers Village next door and go to Sir Wilfred's, where you can get a fabulous cinnamon bun and a large coffee for $3.75. The Hula Grill next to the hotel has a great atmosphere both for drinks and food. And don't bother ordering room service after midnight...all they have are prepackaged sandwiches at that time. There were no robes in the room...you have to ask for them. I went to the Westin Villas for the time-share pitch just to get $100 off my bill, and that property is lovely and very upscale...I've heard you can get a room there for a comparable price...I would recommend it. Over the past 2 years I stayed at the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons, and this property is not up to their standards, however, if you want to be in a more lively place (the hotel provides a shuttle into Lahaina), and in the very best location, I would still recommend this hotel...just don't expect 5-star service. And if you go into Lahaina, I recommend the Pioneer Inn for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Package”
Reviews.Author: shinshinati
Reviews.Content: Westin Maui is where you can go and forget about everything else. It has everything you would need for your Maui trip. Pools, Spa, Restaurants, and great proximity to the beach and shopping. Customer service is great, and staff is nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great resort in maui”
Reviews.Author: itaykadosh
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were on an honeymoon in this hotel among 5 hotels in the three bigest hawaiin islands, and this hotel was just great - very good value for the 195 USD per night that we payed. the pools were very well disgned, the beach shore of the hotel was very wide and turkiz. i took adiving from the hotel instructer and it was completely terrific (we swam with sea turtels and grabed octupus. also the hotel is near the "black rock" a famus diving and snorkeling resort. the hotel facilities were very highend (cooled shampnigon to the room, great gym, very nice spa and etc). the only problem that we were suffered from - was that when we checked in to the room, the door was closed - and after few seconds a prior hotel guest come out from the room- after she was checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal!”
Reviews.Author: ajs414
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for our honeymoon. It was an awesome resort. There were three pools. One pool for kids, one for adults, and a large one for everyone. The one thing I don't recommend is the cafe at the hotel. I don't think they are good at all for the money that you spend on it. You are better off just eating at the restaurants around there. The location of the resort is great! Very close to Lahaina and there are little shops down there and also you are walking distance to the mall that they have there. If you like sushi there is an awesome sushi place called Sansei and it is very good! Overall it was a great honeymoon spot!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing heaven”
Reviews.Author: iuliaxu
Reviews.Content: i've spent 5-day vacation in Maui last month, stayed in westin hotel. really a fantastic vacation. love blue sky, blue beach and beautiful scene! highly recommend to go!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and great location.”
Reviews.Author: slp317
Reviews.Content: The conceirges were always very helpful and patient. Nice room, great housekeeping service. We did see a cockroach on our balcony 2 nights. Very nice pools with a fun waterslide, however it was difficult to find lounge chairs unless you reserved them with a towel early in the morning. Great location...5 minute walk to outdoor shopping mall and 5 minute drive to Lahaina, which is full of shopping. Parking is tight and staff double parks cars in the evening which caused a problem for us one morning when we had to leave early.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ajkingis
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. September is a wonderful month to visit if you are traveling with your spouse/partner, being that all the kids are back in school. The resort itself is in a great location and beautiful grounds. It's close to lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Perfect if you don't feel like driving. Out of all the nearby resorts that we visited, we truly felt that the Westin had the nicest pool area and the most inviting atmosphere. The hotel staff was very nice; the concierge was most helpful in assisting us with planning our activities and giving helpful advice for sightseeing and restaurants. A BIG perk is the free shuttle that the Westin provides their guests for traveling into Lahaina. The free shuttle alone really helps in cutting down parking fees in Lahaina. The Westin Resort is an older resort. Therefore, everything is not as up to date or brand new as we would like it. But because, everything was clean and well kept, we were very happy with our stay. We would definately consider going back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Personal attantion that never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Bill Wood
Reviews.Content: We keep returning to this hotel for a reason. The people are so friendly and yet manage to provide a level of service that is hard to beat. They make you feel like an old friend come to visit. The rooms are kept clean and tidy, the grounds are immaculate, and the location on the beach is simply wonderful. With Whaler's Village right next door, the shopping is enough to satisfy anyone, and the food options are excellent. Numerous catamarans depart from the immediate area, but it's hard to beat Gemini; and it leaves from the beach right in front of the hotel. The "adult" pool (while not a topless area) is a great retreat from the activity of the kids pools and slides - something for everyone. We're already planning our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great trip, but maybe better for those who can afford nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: ABlueOtter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful lobby area with waterfall and parrots, comfy couches to sit on. That was a big plus for us as we did not have a sitting area on our room, and we would hang out down in the lobby and read in the afternoons. The pool was great. A little cold and always busy and active. When booking this package on Expedia, it was between this hotel and its sister hotel down at the end of the beach right next to Black Rock, the Sheraton. The Sheraton prices run a little less than the Westin, but I went Westin as they had a waterslide and I had teenagers. During the evening the Sheraton always has a torch lighting ceremony, and a diver jumsp into the ocean. We would often walk down there to catch that. We slipped into their pool one morning ... much warmer than ours. No waterslide, but I liked their lagoon like pathways. They often would have a hula dancer by the pool in the evening, grassy lawns, more laid back pace than at the Westin which was no focus around pool, and more focus on bar areas, drinks and dinners. Don't get me wrong, the Westin was VERY nice, and the service was great. But when we return, we will most likely book into the Sheraton. We liked the laid back feel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cheerijo
Reviews.Content: The room was tastefully designed. The bed was very comfortable. The grounds were beautiful and very well kept. The pools were wonderful and enjoyable. Various places to sit around the pools. There are 5 pools but only one hot tub. The pools had waterfalls among rocks and beautiful lush green trees and grass. There were also two slides into one of the pools. They greeted you at the hotel door with Hawaiian leis when you check in. The location was great, a short walk down the beach path to Whalers Village (restaurants, bars and shops) and next to the Hyatt where we attended a luau and went to their nightclub (Spatts).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Shoshana143
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa from 9/24 to 10/3 for a much needed vacation with relaxation. Check-In: We checked in at 6pm it was hassle-free. We we opted to self-park instead of paying $15 per day. However, there was really never any parking after 7pm, so they valet the car for free most nights. They explained there was a $25 resort fee that included water, gym and free internet access. We were aware of this when booking our trip so it was no problem. We started with a partial ocean view in the Beach Tower and we didnâ€™t have the greatest view, however half way through our vacation we decided to talk to the front desk about an upgrade. We got lucky and we moved to the Ocean Tower and had a room on the 7th floor and boy did we have a spectacular view of the resort and ocean. The room could use some work, wallpaper bubbling and small bathrooms, but we spent time relaxing on the balcony listening to the waves and enjoying the magnificent sunsets. The sunsets were to die for. Beach Tower v. Ocean Tower- The room in the Beach Tower was much larger; bathroom had double sinks, but did not have the best views. Everyone recommended the Beach Tower so I asked for this when we checked in. When we moved to the Ocean Tower, we could tell it was an older building with much smaller rooms and bathrooms, but the views were spectacular. So, it just depends what you really want for your vacation. We didnâ€™t mind the smaller room because we barely spent anytime indoors. Food: Donâ€™t bother purchasing food at the hotel. The buffet was $28 per person for breakfast and I didnâ€™t hear very good things about the hotel restaurants. We even went into Whalerâ€™s Village to get coffee every morning ($2) and it tasted better than the $4.18 cup of coffee from the coffee bar at the Westin. I also recommend going to Safeway and picking up some groceries for your room. The beach was beautiful and we rented a cabaÃ±a at the Sheraton at Black Rock to snorkel for a day. We stayed there two years ago for our honeymoon and enjoyed that resort a lot too. It was well worth it. The snorkeling was superb and we saw many large sea turtles and colorful fish right next to black rock. The Westin pools were relaxing and not too crowded this time of year. We spent most of our time at the adult only pool. The nearby town of Lahaina is very active, full of tourists, and a fun place to visit. I wish we were still there. Take time to look in the art galleries and eat at Kimoâ€™s. I also recommend making the drive to Paia and eating at Mamaâ€™s Fish House because it is well worth the drive and the money. The staff at the hotel were helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but don't know if I'd return to this resort”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1959
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Westin resorts before and selected Maui Westin based on my past Westin experiences....Grounds were lovely! Staff was courteous. Our first room smelled of must/mildew and we asked to be moved...Staff accommodated our request immediately with no problem. Wonderful beds and pillows! Eat breakfast off property up in Kapalua (The Gazebo is fantastic and worth the wait!) Westin's buffet is extremely expensive and food was not very good. Drinks during happy hour are well priced, but off happy hour pricing is expensive. We ate at the Westin's Tropica restaurant one night - the food and service were excellent - ask concierge for 20% off coupons to restaurant! Overall, I feel this hotel is very nice, but not worth the extra money I spent. Furnishings need to updated as some rooms are showing wear and tear. FYI Parking is tight on weekends and the resort overall was much busier over the weekend vs during the week. There is a $5 charge for beach chairs and also a $30 fee if you'd like an umbrella. Big gym with nice view and spinning and yoga classes available for a $12 fee.

Reviews.Title: “From what I remember it was a great location but the hotel looked shabby in some areas”
Reviews.Author: NamasteKnitter
Reviews.Content: We were there on Labor Day wknd a couple years back and it was pretty nuts. The pool was always crowded but my husband loved the slide. I liked that it was right next to some convenient shopping but I was disappointed that some areas like the elevator and the hallways looked really beat up, like lotsa scratches and dents. I can't remember much about the room but it was nice at night to walk around and always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Sep 14-18 and had a great vacation. The location was perfect - right in the middle of the Ka'anapali beach walk, sandy beach (no coral and not rocky), next to Whaler's Village for convenient shopping. I had reserved a terrace view room (which means parking lot view) but it was on the 7th floor and did have a slight peek-a-boo view of the ocean between a few of the other hotels. The room itself was pretty small but met my needs. It just felt like an older hotel - you could tell it had many coats of paint, the baseboards were all scuffed, the bathroom was extremely small but there was a good amount of counter space outside the bathroom by the sink (just a tub and toilet inside the actual bathroom). The bed was comfortable. The walls were pretty thin - I could hear a baby crying and kids playing the first two days but luckily nothing too annoying. The hotel's wi-fi network was awful - felt like a dial up connection, would suddenly become disconnected, and wasn't strong enough for me to download anything from iTunes. The pool was great although there are few spots in the shade and they were always taken (I got very sunburned the first day so wanted to stay in the shade the next couple of days). It was convenient that I could check out snorkel gear at the Sheraton and charge to my Westin room so I could snorkle at Blackrock ($8 for an hour seemed like a bargain). Pool service was good - drinks were brought pretty quickly after being ordered. Had a great burger in Ono but overcooked fish there for another meal (I think my order was forgotten under the warmer as several others received their food who arrived after me). Ate a plain but decent caesar salad ($9) at the Sea Dog poolside snack bar and enjoyed a nice dinner at Tropica. I didn't rent a car so no comments about parking, but I appreciated the free hourly shuttle into Lahaina. The spa service was good and included a coed quiet lounge overlooking the ocean but the whirlpool/sauna/steam room area was tiny. Overall my stay was pleasant but having stayed in many business class resort hotels (e.g., Westin, Sheraton, Hyatt, Marriott) this one was just average in terms of the hotel interior.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel, Food is rip, Rooms are small, Parking is a joke”
Reviews.Author: scootertexas
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, right on the Kaanapali strip. Nice beaches and pools. I am guessing that most of the hotels on the Kaanapali strip are older, the Westin doens't look terrible, it just could use a fresh coat of paint. It looks like an old hotel. Food is very expensive and so/so in terms of quality. $28 for the brealfast buffet, $4.50 for a sprite in a small plastic cup poolside. Rooms are small, though I love the Westin beds. Bathroom plumbing is old and shows it. Anti-smokers will be happy with the hotel, 100% non-smoking, not on your balcony, not at the pool, not on the beach. I like the location and will try a different hotel on that strip next time in Maui. Parking is interesting. Valet or free, your choice, but bottom line is that they do not have enough space. When the lot fills up they will valet for you for free, but sometimes you have to drive around the lot and verify that it is full first. Where it gets real interesting is in the morning, valet double parks all over the place and you will most likely be blocked in and will have to wait as they rearrange cars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, expensive bad food”
Reviews.Author: CDTDOT
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights during our stop on Maui. Being a Westin the rooms were great but this resort has really terrible service in their restaurant, 'Ono'. The waitress was ridiculously slow, it took us forever just to order two drinks and an appy and it was so expensive after all that. That said, their luau was incredible! Spend the extra $20 and get the premium seats and advance seating so you can swig some drinks ahead of time. The food is out of this world, and the best meal we had on our entire two week journey through 3 different islands of Hawaii. It's a great hotel, just go eat in town or at one of the local restaurants. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: grannieof4
Reviews.Content: This resort is old and needs to be updated, the so called heavenly 10 beds as soon warn that you sleep in holes in the mattress and the pillows that are suppose to be down we had to stack 3 pillows just to sleep. Maid service is lacking everyday of our 19 days that we stayed at this resort we had one problem or another, towels not in room, air cond. not working, no coffee etc., etc., As far as friendlyness if it wasn't for the birds we would have never heard the word Aloha, bell men never greeted you or ask if we needs any kind of help. I could go on and on but am litited to 50 words. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY YOU WILL BE SORRY AS WE WERE.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: athomas146
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa from August 16-20. We enjoyed every day at this hotel. The reception was very helpful and well informed of the surrounding area. I booked a room with an Ocean Front View. I had read that it was very likely that we could reserve a room with a lower rate and get bumped up to the Ocean Front, but I didnâ€™t want to chance it since it was our honeymoon and I wanted to be sure we would get the view. I recommend that anyone that would like to stay here to register at spg.com to receive a discounted rate. The membership is free and it adds points towards future stays at various SPG Hotels. We did eat one of the restaurants at the hotel and didnâ€™t enjoy it. I found that their prices were quite high and the food was lacking in quality. The Westin has a huge pool dedicated for everyone and a nice size pool for adults only. The view from our room was amazing. The beach is less crowded than the ones on Oahu but also very windy. The water was so blue and so warm. I found the water to be less salty at here than Waikiki Beach on Oahu. Overall, this is a great place with great service. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: greencountry
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Singapore for five years, I have stayed at many tropical resorts. Although not at the top of my favorites list, the Westin Maui compares well, and is a great place to stay in Maui if you want the resort experience. We must have arrived just after all the kids had gone back to school, because it was not "overrun" with kids as some of the other postings mentioned. Even so, we spent our pool time at the adult pool and staked out a shady area because the afternoon sun was very hot. Bring lots of sunscreen! They have a great system now to identify guests (and therefore non-guests. When you get your towels you are given a bracelet. Staff also will remove items from chairs if no one has been there for awhile; this allows space for everyone. The beach is clean (not always the case in other countries) although a bit narrower than expected, but it did not feel crowded. The hotel had only 5 beach umbrellas the first day we were there; they had ordered additional ones that arrived before we left. Again, if you are going to spend all day on the beach, you might want to consider renting the chairs and umbrella to have the option of shade. We decided on a mountain view room as were not going to spend any time in the room. Room size was ok; you are really paying for the rest of the resort. The bathroom was clean, no mildew or odor issues as some of the other posters found. Although the room overlooked the parking lot, the view of the mountain side in the morning was lovely. Housekeeping could step it up a bit; we found bits of old food on the floor and also asked them to come back and dust. Some of the staff were outstanding (the Loss Prevention officer who helped with a lost and found issue) some were humorous (the young man at the activities center by the beach that was more interested in talking to his surfing buddies than the guests) and some were puzzling (the concierge that did not want to bother with us??) Overall, pleasant and mostly helpful staff. Our rental car got dinged pretty good while under valet care, but we did not notice until we had been driving around for the day. As other posters have noted, parking at the hotel is challenging and the slots are very narrow. Be sure you know exactly what your car and homeowners insurance covers before renting a car. I did not take out the extra insurance but had no problems with my personal insurance covering the damage. In hindsight, I would have taken the shuttle to the hotel (~$50) and rented a car in Lahaina for the day we wanted one. On a side note, we had great excursions. We did the Sunset Sail and the Snorkel Sail with Gemini Charters. They sail a 64' catamaran that loads at the Westin beach. Great and knowledgeable crew that loves to sail! Captain David, a naturalist, was marvelous. Book online and save 10%. Both trips were well worth the money. We also did a day trip with Ekahi Tours. Our guide, Charlie, graduated from Hana High School. The small group of 12 adults was just right for us. The tour had lots of stops including the winery, Charles Lindberg's grave, the Pools of Ohe'o, Hana, all enhanced with a running commentary of the islands. Enjoyed someone else driving the Hana Highway! Again, book on line and save some $$. Would certainly consider staying at the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL!”
Reviews.Author: tsmahalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about one week....after reading some reviews on Expedia as well as TripAdvisor I was somewhat worried. BUT...I figured, "...hey..that was their experience...i've also read great reviews as well on the westin in lahaina...so I might as well try it..." SO GLAD i stayed there!!!!! Once I entered the property I was greeted warmly with open arms....they made me feel SO welcome..from the valet to the front desk staff, to the restaurant staff as well as grounds and housekeeping. I have to say that this Westin's customer service was AWESOME!!! The property itself is huge, beautiful and breathtaking! The views of the beach were great from my room. I stayed in an Ocean deluxe room in the Beach tower which overlooked the ocean as well as the resort and its beautiful tropical settings downstairs...it was breathtaking! I know some people have complained in their reviews about not having a full front ocean view...I didn't have a problem with my room at all! I got to see the beach, ocean and the resort downstairs! Besides, I rarely stayed in my room in the first place...I was always out and about doing activities on the island and doing my solo exploration! My room was clean and I was always greeted by all staff...housekeeping would even ask me what room I was in when they would see me in the halls as I left my room,....they wanted to know so they can clean my room immediately.....GREAT GREAT customer service! The pool was a bit crowded...but once again...I RARELY stayed at the hotel....the resort is wonderful, but i wanted to stay on the beach and explore....other reviewers mentioned that the beach chairs were difficult to get, etc. etc.....I have to say that this issue didn't bother me at all, since I'd rather just throw over a beach blanket on the beach and lay there watching the ocean instead of sitting on a beach chair or underneath a beach umbrella, but hey that's just me and my personal preference. My room looked EXACTLY as it did online in the westin's photos and it was big enough for me....it was modern and looked amazing! I was definitely pleased and will stay at this westin if I'm in the area again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: cradlemom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took advantage of a killer deal on the internet for 6 nights, a car, room upgrade and breakfast. Prior to checking in I made peace with the probability of getting a room facing whaler's village. Nice surprise to find our room faced the pool and ocean on the 8th floor. Our view resembled the picture on the brochure. We had a lovely time. The staff were efficient, the grounds clean and we had no trouble finding pool chairs. The hotel has stepped up its efforts to discourage those nitwits who would "reserve" 4 chairs for 4 hours without getting the towel wet. Staff were present to leave warnings to obviously vacant chairs, and if no one showed up in an hour their stuff was taken off. It made for some interesting evesdropping when the former "Owners" came back! We did a fantastic catamaran snorkel trip right off Kaanapali beach through Trilogy. We went to Honolua Bay, up around the north end of Maui. I have taken many such trips to snorkel, and this was hands down the best snorkeling I've ever done, plus we didnt have to leave the hotel at 5:00am to drive to Maalea Harbor....The weather was consistently warm and sunny, and the ocean was warmer than the pools. The first few days we thought the pools were pretty brisk, but by friday they were much warmer. Maybe they turned on the heaters. This was our second stay at this hotel, the first being 5 years ago. I dont think you can beat the location or the beach. If you can get one of the package deals going, it just makes it that much better!!!I do think that when you go to a resort like this you have to bring your sense of humor with you. There will always be little things that could irk you if you let them. I say that a "bad day" in Maui will always be better that a great day where I live (I know, I probably need to move!!) I would again recommend this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: SourPatch33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin as part of our 2 week vacation to Hawaii. (We also stayed on Oahu and visited the Big Island and Kauai.) Overall this hotel was good but not great. The rooms were decent size and had all the normal Westin signature amenities (Heavenly towels, shower, bed, etc.). The room did have a fridge which was nice and available for use, not one of those that is always fully stocked and you can't move any of the food items or they automatically charge you. Our bathroom was very small and did have some mildew issues. It was not terrible but could have used a good cleaning. The bed was comfy as all "heavenly beds" are and the wireless internet was a plus. Housekeeping did seem to start ultra early (like before 8 am), not bad for us since we were up around 6 am most days (still adjusted to East coast time) but could be a negative from some people. The pools were nice with lots of waterfalls and 2 slides. There was definitely a "family resort" feel. The majority of guests seemed to be families with small children. So if you don't enjoy being around kids this is not the resort for you. The adult only pool was a lifesaver for us. Our only complaint about the pools was that the water was very cold. They were definitely not heated. I guess they expected the hot Hawaii sun to heat them up. But they definitely remained chilly throughout the entire day. Food at the hotel itself was pretty expensive. We did eat breakfast there most mornings just out of sheer convenience (~$12 per person for a muffin and a breakfast wrap). Drinks around the pool are pricey compared to the mainland, but really pretty much on par for most of Hawaii. ($6+ for beer, $9+ for cocktail). Lunch and dinner at the hotel restaurants was just too much for us. We ate Whaler's Village or took the free shuttle to Lahaina to eat instead. The resort really is in a great location. It is a 2 minute walk to Whaler's Village where you can get just about anything you need. It has a great beach. The surf is relatively calm, it is in great shape, and very clean. The only downside is that they charge you $30 to rent 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella for a day. They also offer the free shuttle to Lahaina. This is a great service because unless you are really lucky and get one of the curb side parking spots, parking cost $10 a night in Lahaina. It is worth the $10 just to take the shuttle and not deal with the parking. Overall, I would rate this resort as good but not great. The location is awesome. The pools are nice but cold. The room was "OK". The food is expensive but you are in Hawaii, what do you expect. I wouldn't be opposed to staying here again, but would probably search out something else first.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peaches321
Reviews.Content: My husband and had some concerns about the Westin Resort after reading many reviews on Tripadvisor. Last year we stayed at the Hyatt Regency, and had a great time. This year we took advantage of an amazing vacation package offered by Costco Travel at the Westin. So we decided to go to Maui again and stay at the Westin. Boy are glad we did. To put it succinctly, the reviews in general do not do justice to the Westin. Many people might be confused about the layout of the hotel. Let me explain as best I can. The best rooms are located at the Beach Tower. Located closest to the beach. In the beach tower the best room are premium ocean deluxe rooms. Most of these rooms face the pool and have a great view of the beach and the ocean. These are even numbered rooms. The ocean deluxe rooms are good rooms but they face Whalers Village and they tend to be nosier. The main building is called the Ocean Tower. The mountain view rooms face the parking lot and highway 30. These have the worst views. The Garden Views rooms are the lower level rooms and your view is aobstructed by the beautiful landscaping on the property. The ocean view rooms face the pool and the ocean but they are located quite a distance from the beach. The beds are very comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The shuttle provided by the hotel is awesome. It takes you to Lahaina. This is great when you've had a few libations.The shuttle also takes you to the Sheraton, and the Westin Villas. (The shuttle is not offered by the Hyatt). The buffet is a pro, although expensive, it was free to us everyday as part of the Costco package. I would not pay the charge of $28.00 for it. The gym is a nice feature free to the guests. The machines face the ocean. Also, the Westin has five pools. One is an adult pool. We never had a problem finding lounge chairs. The beach in front of the hotel is the best. The sand is soft and the ocean is clean. Whalers Village with its restaurants and shops,is located right next door. The have a food court with reasonable prices. The Westin also have happy hours at different locations. Take advantage and get all the free Maui magazines and brochures. They are extremely helpful finding deals throughout the island. As far as negatives, they gave us a handicap room when we first arrived and it smelled like dirty gym socks. When I complained the next morning they happily moved us to a top level non handicap room. Another negative is the parking. Don't get rent a large vehicle. The spaces to park are extremely small, and parking fills up fast. A postive thing is that when the lot is full, they will valet your car for free. The biggest negative is the thin walls. You can hear your neighbors making plans for the day. Getting off the topic of the Westin, here are some tips to enjoy Maui. We enjoyed eating at Ruth's Chris. They have a special for 39.95 and 49.95. Salad, side and steak. One entree order is plenty for two people. The restaurant is located in Lahaina right across from the ocean. Make sure that Joe is your waiter. He provided excellent service. We also enjoyed Teppan Dan at the Sheraton. The food was delicious. We will return to the Westin again in some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “awesome, awesome, awesome”
Reviews.Author: wookiemomo
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had a deluxe ov room overlooking black rock and whalers village. This Hotel was very expensive for us at 400.00 a night but we can say we did it once, this did not include taxes and the kids club. At first we were scared from the reviews, but let me assure you this place is awesome. I think when the people complain thats just who they are. The room was average size with a couch that turned into a bed for our young son. We could see the ocean from the bed... we were on the 10 floor again just awesome. We celebrated my birthday there and they sent us a cake which was waiting when we came home that night. People complained about the walk to blackrock and the other hotels along the beach, its really not that bad. I mean i guess they are not used to walking a couple of blocks ( beautiful views along the walk) My only complaints is that the slide closes too early and the food and drinks are really expensive, ex: 2 mai tais were 24.00 with tip, but at the hula grill they have happy hour at 3pm to 5pm for half price (5.75) and they are very good. In Lahaina there was a resturant with views of the ocean with mai tais for 2.95 during happy hour starting at 11 am and they were good too. When you arrive in maui get all the free books and brochures that are offered at the airport, lots of great deals... we ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise (good), Freds mexican resturant in Kihei (great Fajitas, Ok drinks), Eskimo Candy in Kihei (very good) but not open on the weekends, and having a condo we cooked there sometimes. Go to Costco when you leave the airport, they also have a food court if you are hungry when you arrive. Hilo Hatties has great coupons in those books so use them. We did a few excursions, We went to the Drums of the Pacific Luau at the Hyatt, the food is just ok the kaula pork taste just like carnitas, and stay away from the poi...lol, but the show was really great. We went to Molokini (we used the Four Winds and it takes an hour to get there then when we arrived the water was too rough so they took us to Coral Gardens and it took another 45 min, so we arrived we were the first in the water because we did snuba and they give 30 minutes of snuba after we got back in the boat we ate a hamburger and got back in the water after 15 minutes they said its time too leave. Try a different company, that cost us for 2 Adults and 1 child almost 400.00 with snuba for less than a hour and lunch). We did road to Hana (very beautiful) take mosquito repellent i got bitten several times and didn't know until the next day. We drove up to Haleakula during the day ( wow now we know were they get the pictures for Mars...lol. We snorkled at Black Rock, we saw alot of fish and even a turtle came right by us, I never dreamed they were that big, awesome.
