We visited the Maui Ocean Center, its nice and most of the fish you see there , you will see when snorkling, but i personally think the Monterey Bay Aquarium in California is the best by far Now if you have children the Westin has a kids club which we found to be a great thing and don't be fooled by the way it reads (first come, first serve) they were not that busy and at times maybe 10 kids in the half day program and two in the full day progarm which we took full advantage of using them for the first 3 days on a 12 day trip. My son (9) loved it and didn't want to leave, they are very good about playing with your child and making projects. Do make reservations just in case they have a rush of kids. Mahalo to Jennifer our Concierge at the Westin for meeting our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Not so heavenly..”
Reviews.Author: Seek7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Maui for our 2nd honeymoon. I booked this resort because after reading all the nice reviews and seeing pictures online made me feel like this was the best resort to book! However first day we check in..parking was a problem! We drove around for 10 minutes trying to find a parking! Don't get me wrong..workers @ Westin are very friendly and very helpful. But the rooms are small!! We booked an ocean view room and when I went to look at our view.. It was nothing but palm trees!! I wad pretty bummed!! The sheets are not fully clean.. There are little bugs crawling around. My husband was getting btten by those little critters! Our toilet was broken! The fridge kept leaking..the pillows weren't comfy. Every morning I would wake up with neck pains. All I know is we are definitely not staying here ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations... A resort that is truely mimics Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: brigmix
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I am in the travel industry. I have taken so many vacations that I cannot count them. I consider myself picky when it comes to traveling, which is having my expectations met based on what type of hotel I am staying in. I require a very clean appearing and smelling room. I will not stay at a place if there are odors. To me the odors are representative of the quality of the housecleaning and managements goals. The people MUST be friendly. I am on vacation and want to be treated that way. Last, there are the conveniences. I think you must have them available on sight or the hotel should make it easy for you to access them (like a shuttle). The Westin Spa and Resort - Kaanapali, exceeded all of these expectations. Upon arrival, my family and I were approached by a staff member before we could even check in. He presented each of my family members with a necklace made from shells (a nice touch and welcome). Upon check in they upgraded us free to the top floor Mountain View room (we had chosen garden level, since we are on a budget). For the first three days we had a message that there was a gift waiting for us. The gift was a box of macadamia nut chocolates. Though it was small a very nice gesture I may add. The room was well appointed, very clean and the beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in (which includes the beds at home). The sheets were luxurious and we had thick down comforters and plenty of pillows soft and firm to choose from. The room is not spacious but was plenty of room for a family of four. My husband and I spent each morning on the balcony (each room has one), and had a beautiful view of the picturesque mountains where the clouds just hang over the mountains makes the rising of the moon a beautiful backdrop. We could see the ocean from our chairs without having to move. The one thing that a prior posting mentioned is that this side faced the parking and you can imagine how loud it is, well that was not the case for us. I never heard anything. So my suggestion is that if you ask for the Mountain View, which is cheaper and a very pleasant experience make sure you are on the upper floors. Each day our room was tended to. We had such a pleasant woman who we saw each day. She fulfilled each request we had with a smile. We were given four bottles of complimentary water each day which was great for the pool stays or road trips we took. Halls were quiet though the elevator was often very full. But that was o.k. going to and from the lobby. It is a resort, what would you expect. The lobby was a beautiful and leisurely place to gather and visit with other people, let alone walk through. The impression I got was that there would be tons of people roaming around making it difficult to traverse your way through the lobby and people area (using a freeway as an example). We were there in the highth of the summer travel season. The lobby is a large (very large) open area, with plenty of outcropping with seating to enjoy the very large pond that extends the entire length of the lobby area. There were many Koi, ducks, swans and flamingos present. My kids loved seeing the fish and flamingos! They lobby was also absolutely gorgeous and well appointed. We spent a portion of each day sitting and visiting down there. They had comfortable seating and views of the large pond and waterfalls. The pools were great for the whole family. The 5 pools are situated at different locations but are all interconnected by small lagoons and channels. One is designed so that you swim through a cave, which is actually a spa area with jets etc. They had an adultâ€™s only pool which is nice for the couples or for you to get away from kids. We read on some postings that you had to get out by the pool at 9:00 to grab a lounge chair, well we were out there at all times of the day except mornings, throughout the length of our trip and always got four lounge chairs, next to each other, without difficulty for us to use poolside. So I am not sure what the problem was with the others. They had waiters tend to you while you were poolside; bring food and drinks when you needed them. The beach is literally 25 feet from the pool. So it is very convenient for us to play, swim and walk the boardwalk (especially during sunset). We never ate in the restaurants, we never needed to. We were always away from the hotel sightseeing so that was never a concern. When you travel to Hawaii, why would you want to eat in the hotel restaurants? There are so many local restaurants to choose from. Lahina is where the nightlife, shopping and restaurants are. There is a couple of restaurants right around the hotel that are popular and recognizable. Once again, why would you eat at or by your hotel with all that is available in Lahina? The hotels in Kaanapali offer a free shuttle bus that takes you to different places in Kaanapali (beaches and snorkeling spots). Whalers Village is right next door, which offers a little shopping for those die hard shoppers. Ah, now we will speak of the parking that is so unduly noted in almost every posting. The parking is free (well sort of since you do pay a $25 guest fee each day). I cannot tell you how many resorts charge for their parking at outrageous rates. Parking during the day is quick and easy and a short walk to the hotel. At night when you arrive past 7 pm you WILL encounter a line of traffic to find parking. But as another individual noted and I will verify, the parking is then done by valet... free of charge. You pull up to the entrance sometimes three lanes wide, leave your keys in the car and they park it for you. Then the next morning you have them bring your car around, and I must say quickly and efficiently. The valets also offer to get you towels for the beach if you need them or anything else that will make your car trip more comfortable. So I actually think that the parking is a plus... free valet! Now that we are home in California, my family has not stopped talking about their stay at the Westin. This is our third time to Hawaii (other islands) and was by far the most pleasant and enjoyable hotel stay we have had. I must also state that the Westin is top notch and highly rated. I do not believe anyone could be disappointed. The staff was all exceedingly friendly, as well as helpful and were willing to resolve any issue we had quickly and to our satisfaction. We even had one instance where there was a perceived safety issue and the hotel manager himself called us to help resolve the issue. Take my advice, we will definitly stay again here when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Maid turned in missing wallet - enough said”
Reviews.Author: heatherleannthomas
Reviews.Content: I was thinking during our trip that I should write on Tripadvisor all of the wonderful things that we did on Maui - driving north through Kalahui and into the Ioa Valley to see 'The Needle', then on to the road to Hana, eating at Mama's Fish House (like something out of an old Elvis movie - awesome place), scuba diving with Lahaina Dive School and seeing a white tip shark, eatting at the Lahaina Grill, hiking down the trail to Honolulu Bay and dodging mangoes and coconuts occasionally falling from the trees...and last by not least, driving up to Haleakala Crater....what a beautiful drive and place. All the while, not knowing that my husband would leave his wallet on the counter in the hotel room when we packed up and left for home. I called the hotel and not only did the maid turn it in and they had it, but they are mailing it to us at no charge. You can't buy honesty in this day and age like that. I will keep Westin Resorts at the top of my list when I go places precisely because of this experience. Thank you again Westing Kaanapali Maui Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely met our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: shiloh803nj
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews of this resort prior to booking and was a little concerned about how our experience would compare. Weâ€™re the type to completely research a place before we visit. The hotel definitely met the expectations my husband and I had for our trip. We did have the discounted $225 a night rate. The lobby and grounds are beautiful, the room was large enough for both of us, and the staff was very pleasant. We did receive one postcard under our room door about a free gift but thanks to the posts here I knew to ignore it since we didnâ€™t want the time share spiel. Since we had booked most of our activities and restaurants we didnâ€™t need to ever see the concierge. We had a mountain/golf course view room in the older Ocean Tower. Since we were very high up and near the end of the hall, we didnâ€™t experience any of the â€œnoiseâ€� that others had commented on. While this wasnâ€™t the most immaculate room weâ€™ve ever stayed in, I think people forget it is a beach resort hotel. I found it to be pretty clean considering we ourselves tracked in various sand, dirt and other debris from our various island excursions. We only ate lunch once at the hotel, but the food seemed very good- and yes it is expensive but most of the food on the island is and it wasnâ€™t the most expensive food menu weâ€™ve ever seen. Iâ€™d say itâ€™s comparable to most cities. We stopped at the COSTCO by the airport and bought Vitamin water, snacks, bagels and fruit which we kept in the fridge. The pool area did seem to be pretty full and with a number of families, but Maui in general seemed to be a family destination. If you want seclusion and privacy Lanai or perhaps the Makena area (which reminded us of West Palm in Florida) is a better bet. The best feature of this hotel is the location. Itâ€™s not only located on the what we consider the best beach in Maui (and yes we did drive the whole island- and see almost every beach) and is at the widest part of the beach, but within walking distance to the black rock (pretty good snorkeling- we saw many sea turtles when we went in), the Whalerâ€™s Village complex and near Lahania. The only strike against the hotel in my opinion is the parking. I didnâ€™t mind the 25 a day resort fee (for those who do I hope you donâ€™t travel with a vehicle in any major city/ high cost of living area because trust me 25 a day to park, use the gym, the internet, and for two bottles of water is good deal), but they should just forgo the valet service and open those lots for regular parking and the issue would be solved. This was our first trip to Maui and we were more interested in seeing the island, hiking Haleakala and the rain forests, and the lava fields, driving to Hana, snorkeling and kayaking and swimming in the warm ocean, visiting the towns (Paia is a hidden gem), and going to the best (and local) restaurants (Mamaâ€™s Fish house, the Paia Fish Market and Kimoâ€™s were the best). We didnâ€™t fly 11 hours to sit by a quiet pretty pool all day (we could get that much closer in the Caribbean ), perhaps for those who just wanted that had a different experience. One last tip- If you plan on touring the island (especially the road to and past Hana) rent a Jeep. We were torn between a convertible and Jeep and with the conditions of the road (many passes only fit one vehicle, and some of it isnâ€™t even paved) and to add to the sight line the Jeep was indispensable.â€¨

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but crowded, noisy and average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Georgeamazing
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying that the expectations placed on this hotel by us were very high to begin with. This is because of the price of the hotel. We took the 225 dollar a night deal that Starwood was offering for this hotel. Usually it can be from 400-800 USD a night. We arrived in Maui through an independent shuttle bus service from Kahului airport. Our first impressions of the hotel made it seem like paradise. The lobby was magnificent and probably the best part of the hotel. It was just like nothing you have ever seen before. Unbelievable and the designer of the lobby should get 5 stars for this alone. We checked in with the front desk who were friendly throughout our entire trip and were upgraded from a garden view to a mountain view (not much of an upgrade - but nonetheless got a better room). We were placed on the top floor in the older ocean tower. This showed in the elevators we took up which were well below average. The hallway seemed decent enough but as soon as we got in our rooms we were appalled. The room itself was small, the washrooms had a horrible odor and most of all they gave us a connecting room. We could hear the couple next door having a normal conversation. Can't complain - you can't really fault someone for talking. So we asked for a room change in which we were denied because they were full. So we stuck it out and tried to fall asleep when the couple next door was out - this worked for the days we were here and we had otherwise no problems making it through the night. Facilities: Great pool area and fantastic location right on the beach. The pool was large and amazing for pictures and just pure enjoyment. We spent a lot of time here. The only downside is that if you hate kids, you will hate this place. Kids everywhere, running from pool to pool. To receive some tranquility, we had to head out to beach which was way more peaceful and less kids due to the fact that the water gets deep FAST. Beach chairs were always signed out so you had to get one early. Amenities: Free wireless high speed internet in the room kept us connected and a free shuttle to Lahaina town (which has a ton of shops for souvenir shopping and restaurants for dinner) was very much appreciated although it was full a lot of the time (so you had to wait for the next one). It came every hour. The restaurants were extremely pricey (what did you expect - comparable to a resort of this caliber) but the food was delicious. Free shopping bag, free 4x6 portrait taken professionally and 2 free bottles of water are all included in a 25 dollar/day resort fee. Location: Perfect - on the beach and right next to Whaler's village, a small shopping plaza that was enjoyable. We walked through this at least 8 times as sometimes this was the only place to get stuff. Lahaina town is about 10 minutes by shuttle and is also a nice little town with a wide variety of shopping. Overall, nice staff, great lobby, and definitely paradise when you are out of your room. When you are in your room, you feel like this is a 100 USD lower end hotel. Will return to Maui, but will not return to this hotel. Can get a better room for a lower price, but probably will not have the great pool area available here at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice pool (but not enough shade), disappointing staff...”
Reviews.Author: AdrianVanzulli
Reviews.Content: Stay: July 29 - August 4, 2009 Room: Terrace Room - Garden Room Upgrades (?): Room (from a Terrace Room - but next to an elevator), Late Checkout (but not without a fight through some lies) Comments: We had some friends who were getting married in Maui, and it happened to be right after my birthday, so we (wife, 6 month old daughter and I) to turn it into one big vacation. Unfortunately, this property is now on my "never return" list. Everything was great until we got there. The concierge desk (NOT the Timeshare "personal" concierge) was extremely helpful and provided us with menus of restaurants and put us in touch with activities beforehand. They were a pleasure to deal with. Unfortunately, the "personal" concierge even went as far as to contact me on my cell phone to let me know of the great package they had for me if I would only come downstairs to see her. If you want to email me, leave me a note in the room (which they did, twice), or leave a message on my room phone, that is all fine by me. It is just something about receiving a call on your phone that is a little irksome. But I digress... The hotel grounds are very nice. Very open, very expansive. Everything is very nicely appointed and well-maintained. There was very little litter to be found anywhere. There are several pools and many lounge chairs, but very little in terms of shade. If you come out to the pool after 7am, you will have no luck in finding shade, and a difficult time finding a chair at all. However, the pool does empty in the afternoons, and starting about 3pm you will have no problems at all. You have to get a wrist-band to get towels, and are told that each unreturned towel will result in a $25 charge. This is essentially unenforceable however, as once they close the towel shack in the early afternoon, you can take and leave towels as you please. The pools are unheated, which I was not expecting. The ocean water actually felt a tad bit warmer. Later in the day (since the hotel blocks the sun from the east until about mid-day) the water will warm up a bit. We also had room service a few times, most of the food being the same as the 'Ono menu. It was slightly more expensive in some instances, but as SPG Platinum you receive 20% off room service (but not at the restaurant itself) so if you want to eat in the room it will actually be cheaper than going downstairs. There are other discounts Golds and Platinums receive (spa, etc.), but we only used the room service one. Now on to the stay...unfortunately it did not live up to expectations...I put in our reservation notes and contacted the hotel directly before our stay, letting them know that I was there in part for my birthday and in part for a wedding, travelling with my wife and our six month old daughter, and that I would appreciate any accommodations they would be able to provide us. Unfortunately, that seemed to have meant putting us in a room directly adjacent to an elevator. This does not bode well when you have a six month old infant. I am not one to return and complain, especially after I gave ample opportunity to take care of us right the first time. Strike one. Being a destination wedding, I was able to convince one of my friends who would also be out in Maui to stay at the Westin as well. He is a taller person, and pre-paid for a room with a King-sized bed. We he arrived it was about 45 minutes before typical check-in time (2:15 or so), so after the desk agent took all of his information, she asked for his cell phone number so that they could call him since his room was not ready and let him know when it would be. Over 3 hours passed by and there was no phone call. He returned to check-in and was given no explanation. He entered his room to find it was two doubles, not the King like he had already pre-paid. He was unable to switch rooms. Strike two. I mention this story about my friend because he will now most likely not give Starwood another chance, and my recommendation did not live up to expectations. The individual who took my friend's phone number and failed to call at check-in also had a rather unfortunate experience with us on our last day as well. I went down in the morning of our last day to request a late check-out. As always, when I know that I will need a late check-out in advance, I will mention it at check-in as a sign of courtesy. The agent informed me that it wouldn't be a problem and that worst case I would have to change rooms. Our departure flight was later in the evening, and our daughter needed to take a nap. When I asked the individual who dealt with my friend about a possibly late check-out, I was immediately told that the hotel was sold out and that I had to check-out at noon. Unfortunately for her, I also have the SPG application on my iPhone and just minutes earlier verified that there were in fact several rooms available. I let her know of this, to which she asked for my room number and said that my room was blocked for an arriving honeymoon. I then asked if I could change rooms, as per the check-in agent, but was told that I would incur a charge. My response to this was that I would in fact not incur a charge because I was a Platinum SPG member and late check-out, if available, was one of my benefits. Her immediate reply to this was that I was not Platinum. I asked why she would presume such a thing, to which she replied that I was not marked as a Platinum. Again, I knew this was incorrect as I had not only made the reservation as a Platinum (so my reservation did not need to be refreshed), but I also put it in my reservation notes, in the email I sent to the hotel directly (to which I received a confirmation of receipt by a reservation agent), but when I checked in I was given my Platinum amenity. I let her know that she was incorrect, reiterated our need for a 4pm late check-out because our infant daughter needed to take a nap, and to please check again. She excused herself to the back area, came back a few minutes later, and presented me with a key to another room. Strike Three. Going in, do I really expect a sweet upgrade? When the hotel is empty, yes I do. I will tell you that we will definitely return to the Sheraton Hacienda in Cabo because of the upgrade and how we were treated. The Westin was fairly full, but a room next to an elevator? That's where I'd imagine you put people who booked via Priceline. I'd recommend staying at the Sheraton (on Black Rock) or the Westin Villas if you want to be near Ka'anapali, so what if their pools don't have a slide?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: L0vedGreece
Reviews.Content: THE ROOMS. The rooms each have a flat-screen television, an in-room safe, a refrigerator, an iron and ironing board, a good hairdryer and wired and wireless internet. The rooms were very clean and the beds â€œheavenly.â€� The size of the room can be an issue. My parents had a room on the sixth floor and it was pretty cramped. There were maybe five feet between the foot of the bed and the dresser. My wife and I were on the second floor with a garden view room. These rooms were probably five feet wider than the sixth floor room. It made a big difference. Thus, I would recommend that you spend the extra money if you are going to be spending time in the room or if there are more than two people to a room. THE POOLS. The slides, the tunnel, and the waterfalls are excellent. The two north pools, however, are noticeably colder than the two southern pools. Unfortunately for the children, these two pools are where all the children congregate due to the kiddie slide, the basket ball hoop and the volleyball net. So after about an hour in the pool, our blue-lipped, chattering-toothed monsters had to get out to warm up. It is that cold. On the positive side, the Westin has a policy that prohibits the guests from going to the pool early, laying a towel and a sacrificial magazine on the lounger, and calling it yours for the rest of the day. Pool staff will place a notice on the lounger warning you of the policy. After an hour the staff will remove your items if they are still unaccompanied. We applaud this policy. We felt compelled to go stake our claim on the first day. After we learned of the policy, however, it freed us up from having to go to the pool earlier than we would have otherwise wanted. Many of the chairs are in the sun, at least part of the day. They do have covered chairs and cabanas available for rent ($55 for two covered chairs, $90 for large cabana that fit 8). We rented a cabana one day and it was the best decision we made all day -- we should have called in advance of our trip and reserved a cabana for our entire stay. You have padded lounge chairs, plenty of towels and a cooler which they supply with water and ice (we put our snacks in their as well). You also get much better service. More importantly, you get a break from the sun to reapply sunscreen, give the kids a rest, etc. The sun is bright, hot and scorching -- despite putting on sunscreen throughout the day, we all burned. THE SERVICE. There were a couple of experiences we had with the staff that were troublesome. We reserved and paid for (in advance) a "Garden View" room. Upon check-in, we were told that we had been upgraded to a mountain view room on a higher floor. When we got to our room, it was clear that it was not an upgrade -- the room was small, with two double beds (we requested a king) and had a parking lot view. We went back to the front desk to request our original (non-upgraded) reservation, and were told that they were full. So, the truth came out. It wasn't an upgrade -- it was what they had available. In fairness, we stayed in the (non-upgraded) room for one night and the next day they moved our stuff into the originally reserved room. Interestingly, when we asked for a late checkout on the day of departure, we were told that we couldn't have one because the hotel was sold out for the evening and guests were guaranteed check-in at 3 pm. Query why this policy didn't work in our favor when we were checking in. We went to the poolside restaurant and had a seat. Three waitpersons passed us by without giving us a second look. We managed to flag down a fourth waitperson who was wearing a uniform, nametag and apron. We asked if he could get us a couple of drinks. His response was that he was â€œoff.â€� Thatâ€™s it. Not â€œI am off right now, but let me get someone over her to help youâ€� or â€œI will tell your waiter and your order will be out shortly.â€� This attitude may result from the sheer number of guests at the hotel. If you are looking for a hotel that will cater to your needs on your hard-earned vacation, your may have to step it up a notch. For example, we went to the Four Seasons for lunch. At least three different waitpersons visited our table, each with a polite smile. Our glasses never ran dry. The second incident came at the poolside towel cabana. Inside the cabana there are several pool accessories available for sale. My father asked the attendant the price of an item and was shrilly told, â€œItâ€™s on the back.â€� Now the attendant could not have known that my father is blind in one eye and has poor vision in the other. It does not matter. There is no excuse for not being polite. Why not give a polite response or just answer the question. THE FOOD. Of the Westin's restaurants, we only ate at Ono. They have a pool or beachside brunch for ~$30 per person, which was fairly good. We are not big eaters so we certainly didn't eat $30 worth of food, but everything in Maui (including cereal purchased at the grocery store, which was $7 per box) is more expensive than on the mainland. There are certainly cheaper places to eat for breakfast -- one that we tried and thought was comperable was the Kanapali Resort (next door to Westin), which had an all you can eat brunch for $18. After that, EAT NOTHING ELSE AT ONO. You may be tempted because of the convenience, but if you want food that actually tastes good, get off your lounge chair and walk down the beach to one of the other nearby beach-side restaurants. Don't get me wrong, the food is not down right nasty, but it's not good (on a scale of 1-10, I rate it a 4-5) and it's expensive. The burgers were OK and the kids liked their tripple-decker PBJ sandwiches (of course). The lava flows are delicious (one of the better we had), so if you do eat at Ono, order a lava flow to wash it down and you won't care nearly as much! THE SPA. The spa was nice. Upon arrival, you're given a robe and slippers to change into and then escorted to a waiting lounge with an assortment of hot tea, fresh squeezed lemonade, water w/ cucumber and lime and various dried fruits and almonds to nibble on. You can also order lunch in between services, but we didn't do so. I had the 80 min. heavenly massage, and I was glad I paid for the extra 30 min. The masseuse was nice and had good pressure, but at times I felt her strokes were too fast, as though she was in a hurry. On a scale of 1-10, I rate my massage a 7. I had no problem making my reservation the day before, which was nice. Moreover, my mother-in-law, father-in-law and three sisters-in-law were able to make appointments for their treatments at the same time (all of us booked the day before). They thoroughly enjoyed their treatments (wraps, facials and massages) and we enjoyed sitting in the lounge and chatting in between treatments. The chairs in the lounge were not the most plush and relaxing I've ever had, but they were comfortable. Overall, our spa experience was relaxing and fun -- which is what we were looking for. OVERALL. This is a great place to stay if you have kids. There are scheduled activities for them all day long, day and evening "kids camps" so the parents can get a break and many large pools with fun slides, waterfalls, etc. The rooms are nice, and the beds and showers are indeed "heavenly" (at least as compared to the usual hotel beat-down). If you don't have kids or are looking for something a little quieter, this is not the place for you. Overall, we felt the resort was nice, and a good place to entertain the monsters, but quiet and relaxing do not describe the overall atmosphere. If I were traveling without kids, I'd have preferred the Four Seasons (in fairness, we've never stayed there with or without kids, but when we were there for lunch, I was sorry we hadn't made our reservation there).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for 1st timers to Maui”
Reviews.Author: Ciscoho
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews about the Westin Maui Resort & Spa before going and most of the pros and cons turned out to be very accurate. On the con side, the rooms were rather small and a bit dated. If you have young children, you would appreciate a larger bathroom with newer amenities for bathing the kids. The parking lot was always quite full and finding an available parking space was challenging but they did offer free valet service to guests when spaces were hard to find. The drawback was that you felt obligated to tip the valets for something you were not at fault for having to do. Other small items which does make a difference were the very dated and small refridgerator provided in each room and a pretty clunky microwave oven that was provided to us. Lastly, the Heavenly beds is more of a marketing gimmick than anything as I found the beds and linen to be average. Certainly did not meet the expectations that was built up from the advertising. In fact, the amount of linen was actually rather more cumbersome than comfortable. Overall, I would rate the rooms to be 3 stars only but the entire complex would be 4 stars. On the good side, the resort had lots of pools and activities which is great for young families who do not wish to venture out every day. Our kids aged 2 and 7 loved it. There were plenty of exotic wildlife which fascinated the kids. Whaler's Village was right next door and offered good shopping. As well, Lahaina was less than 10 minutes away which was convenient for grocery shopping at the local Safeway for breakfast and brunch foods. After a couple of days we got a little tired of the local restaurants (Ono, Tropica, Leilani's etc.) so we ventured out to Lahaina and outlying areas for meals. You can find more reasonable restaurants around so eating does not have to be expensive as everyone says. The staff overall was very friendly and helpful. You don't need to spend money joining the snorkeling tours as there is decent snorkeling just off the beach in front of the hotel. Also, just a couple of miles down the road at Black Rock is very good snorkeling for free as well and you can even see the sea turtles there. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay as the hotel location was very convenient and the pools and facilities were great for for kids. I would definitely go back without hesitation but wouldn't mind exploring for some similar alternatives first. A Happy Canadian Vancouver BC

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, with some quibbles”
Reviews.Author: wdl
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin for 6 nights, end of July, for a family of 4 (2 small children). We booked through Expedia, using one of their 24 hour sales, with an absolute great rate hotel + car. Booking through Expedia vacation (hotel + car) won't get you any points if you are a SPG member (it's wholesale price), so look how deep are the discounts before booking through a third part. We thought that a wholesale rate would put us in the worst room of the hotel. Actually, we got a good upgrade when we get there, a room with ocean view (a direct view of black rock and the Whaler's village, which is right beside the hotel), with a king size bed and a sofa bed (the sofa bed was actually quite comfortable, and I don't really like to sleep on them). One of the reviewers complained about noise at the Whaler's village (and also construction noise). We really did not have a problem with that, in fact, we haven't heard any noise at all, although it is also true that we tended to wake up earlier to have breakfast and go to the beach (we were rarely in our rooms after 9am, especially in the first days of the vacation, where we tend to get up even earlier, due to the time difference between mainland US and Hawaii. The room was quite nice. A little stain on the carpet - no big deal. It had a flat screen tv, a fridge, and safe, plus a desk with various connections for your computer and various outlets (very convenient if you have things to charge: cameras, cell phones, portable dvd players). We didn't bring our laptop, but I think we would be able to plug a laptop to the room's flat screen. Based on some reviews, we thought the rooms would be tiny but our room was not too bad (although not too spacious either). No problem at all with service and reception - everybody was quite helpful and friendly. The highlight of the hotel was the grounds (beautiful, well manicured) and the swimming pool. There are 5 swimming pool (one adult only). The "adult" area has the pool, a bar, and a hot tub. The other 4 pools are interconnected. 2 of them are interconnected through a passage where you swim through two waterfalls and where there is a hidden whirlpool. There is a small kid slide, and also a very fun water slide (you need to be able to swim and cannot wear floating devices). Great for kids. Some reviewer mentioned some fine for not returning the towels. We didn't find any problem with that - they actually did not count how many towels you check and return (but ask for your room number when checking in). I wonder how they would charge for not returning the towels with this lax control. We did, however, had some problem finding a free pool chair (so we were never by the pool at peak time). There are several restaurants at the premises (we haven't used them, they were quite expensive, in our opinion). There is an artificial lake, with waterfalls, flamingos, ducks, swans, and (giant) colored fish. Great location at Kaanapali beach. Whaler's village is right beside the hotel. Best way to get there is through the beach walk. The stretch of beach in front of the Westin is pretty decent, although the best part of the beach, in my opinion, is the area close to Black Rock, a short walk from the Westin. I think the highest point for the Westin is that it is in a terrific location to watch the sunset on the sea. Make sure you are at the hotel for the sunset, it is incredible. The Westin charges $25 of resort fee, that includes the parking (see comment below), 2 bottles of water per day, and free internet (which we didn't use). It's mandatory, so consider the fee when comparing hotel rates (BTW, all resorts charge fees of ~$20. Now, some quibbles: - parking lot, as some reviewers mentioned, is quite small. The spots are narrow, and there aren't to many of them. The good news is that if the lot fills up, they start to valet park your car without charges (if you want valet all day, you'll have to pay another $10 in addition to the resort fee). However, most of the time, you feel like in a crowded mall, when you look for incoming people leaving to grab their spot. It can be annoying, if you enter and exit the lot a couple of times, and also a waste of time. - eating inside the hotel is quite expensive, even the breakfast. You walk to the Whaler's village for breakfast, but they don't open until 7:30am (bad for early birds who haven't yet adjusted to the Hawaiian time). And to go anywhere else, you need to drive (and deal with the parking problem). - hotel feels a bit crowded. We've heard that the hotel was not completely full, due to the economy woes, so I wonder how it would look like at full capacity. - no microwave oven - it would be very useful. - check if resort is for you. We've learned that staying in a resort may not be worth the extra bucks if you spend most of time elsewhere - the pool may get a bit old after a while. All in all, you can really go wrong with the hotel, especially if you have kids, but I would not stay here if it were not for the deep discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a rate with breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: christens02
Reviews.Content: We had a rate of $290 per night. That included the breakfast buffet for 2 each day. If you're planning to spend the day out and eat the big breakfast anyway, you may be able to find a rate like this. I don't know that I would pay more than that for this room. The rooms were generally nice. There was a large bar area in our room that seemed to take up a lot of space, but over the 4 days we were there, I came to appreciate the extra space. For some reason, I didn't feel like the bed was as comfortable as other beds I have had at other hotels, particularly Sheraton/Westins. I can't put my finger on why. The resort fee includes many things, including high speed internet. They have the wired connection in the room, but I think they only have wireless now. Neither I nor my sister could get the wired connection working at any time. Drinks were "only" $9 here. That's less than many other hotels in Hawaii, but by the time I got here, I was basically sick of fruity drinks. I did enjoy my chocolate-coconut-pineapple smoothie for $6 just as much. Also, I really liked the triple decker PBJ from the kids menu, which they let me order. We really liked the Ono restaurant. It's listed as a tapas type place, but one item is really enough. Or one and split a salad. There is a dessert there that I think is called the chocoholic.. It's a GIANT dessert. Two of us couldn't finish it. It was so big that I made up a story about it to tell my niece for story time that night. Our favorites were probably the grilled cheese, the greens salad, and the ahi sandwich. LOVED the pool and the slide. Note that when it's windy, it's very cold to stand in line for the slide. The sand on the beach is suboptimal for sandcastles, so if you're a serious sandcastle maker, don't waste your money on the sand toys. You're better off with a single bucket from the dollar store (I brought mine from home). Note that it's usually windy and that inflatables have a tendency to blow away. We almost lost our beach ball several times. There is a pool under the waterfalls between two of the pools. It looks like a whirlpool, but it's not heated like one. It does provide a pool out of the wind, which is where we went to play with our beach ball eventually. You do need to go to the towel desk and get a wrist band before they'll let you down the slide. The lobby includes a waterfall, large pond with koi, swans, and flamingos. Do go down and feed the fish. They let grown adults do it too. Took my surf lesson here. It was $70 for a group 2 hour lesson. I had 23 people in my lesson group, which seemed like too many. However, I was glad I had the rest between times paddling out. I understand that the 8 am group is usually smaller and that there are usually better waves. I had a nice time with the 11 am group. There is also a 2 pm group, but I don't know anything about that one. The people taking private lessons seemed to be having a nice time as well, but I don't know about that cost. I do want to ding them for a couple of things. First, we requested late check out (which we were entitled to as gold members), as our plane wasn't until 5 pm. We had to argue until finally they let us keep one of our two adjoining rooms until 1 pm. The adjoining door was open, and they didn't clean that room during the time that we were there, so I don't know why they insisted on only letting us have one of them. Also, it seemed like the housekeeping staff was on the verge of greatness, but couldn't get everything together. One time they remembered everything except leaving water. The next time, they forgot to leave coffee, the next time cups, the next time towels. I don't know what the problem was. It wasn't a huge deal, but it was aggravating to have to call down every day to get something. They always brought it promptly, however. We stayed in a mountain view room, and it was very nice. Note that you'll be facing east, so close your curtains if you want to sleep later than 6 and you want it to be dark. Overall, a nice time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Deluxe Ocean View room!”
Reviews.Author: firecapwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 kids (9 & 12) the first week of July. The room: We upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View and yes, you could see the ocean to the left, but directly in front of us were the rooftops of Whaler's Village. I don't usually care what I'm looking at since I don't spend that much time on the balcony, but the noise was awful! The first morning we awoke at 5am to construction going on at Whaler's! Besides that, there are delivery trucks bringing food to the hotel at that hour! Every morning, we could hear the trucks beeping and the big steel doors opening and closing! There is also a parking lot there, so we often heard motorcycles starting up at all hours. I complained to the front desk, but of course they told me that they were booked and could not change our room. I talked to the manager and he said he had other complaints about the construction noise, so the hotel talked to them and they said they wouldn't start until 9am. It didn't matter at that point because the food delivery trucks and parking lot noise wasn't going to change. The room was fine, nothing special. The bathroom was dull, but at least the toilet was separate. The lobby: Nice, but the pond had an unpleasant smell when you walked by. The pool: Nice pool with a great waterslide (the main reason we chose to stay there). The downside was having to get to the pool early enough to get lounge chairs! Even though there were 4 of us, we would only take 2 chairs because we aren't selfish jerks like some people! My kids didn't need lounge chairs because they spent most of the time in the pool. When they would get out to eat lunch, we would just have them sit at the foot of our chairs and eat. No reason to take up chairs for other adults. I can't tell you how many people would have 4 or 5 chairs saved with towels and toys and they would never be used! Just because you have 3 kids with you, you don't need 3 chairs for their toys to sit on! We put our unused pool toys under our lounges, and rafts behind our chairs. It's really simple people! One day, we came down to the pool at 8am, and there were 2 chairs saved with towels already, so we took the 2 empty ones next to them, and a few hours later there were still no people. Finally, someone asked me if they were being used. I told them that they had been sitting unused for hours. So they got the pool staff to remove the belongings. Around 3pm, a couple shows up and starts looking around those chairs for their stuff! They asked me if I had seen their stuff, and when I told them, they acted annoyed that their stuff was moved! Seriously!!!?? You saved your chairs from 8am-3pm and expected your stuff to still be there!? They really need a better system at the pool. 4th of July was a joke at the pool! I think the locals get a room for next to nothing and then they invite all their friends and family to join them at the pool! All you have to do is give them a room number/name and you get a wristband to get you in the pool. We had a family of approx. 20 next to us! They had the lounge chairs facing all different directions and they had all their stuff strewn everywhere! It was nuts! They acted as if they were in their own backyard! The drinks at the pool were just ok. Not good enough for $12 for a "Westin" Mai Tai! They have a regular Mai Tai for a little less, but it sucks! It was bitter and gross. I had a horrible margarita there too. The food at the pool was pretty good though! After many pool days, we decided to get chairs on the beach one day. I stood in line for about 20 minutes to have the guy say he only had 2 more chairs left. I was the 3rd person in line, so I left and got chairs at the pool again. Bummer. Overall, it was a nice place, but we probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Holiday Inn on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: OhioHawaiiguy
Reviews.Content: On a return trip to Maui in March 2009, my wife and I were looking forward to staying in the Beach Tower at the Westin Maui. Knowing the history of the hotel - it was not originally built as a Westin property - we thought that the Beach Tower, built after Westin acquired the property some years back, would reflect the best of Westin - particularly given its location on Kaanapali Beach. We couldn't have been more wrong. The room was just like staying in a Holiday Inn. The room came with none of the standard amenities that would be found in a Marriott in any state. We had to call the front desk for the basics. The heavenly bed advertised by Westin also wasn't. Additionally, the quality of the food at the breakfast buffet - expensive by any mainland standards - was poor. It was like eating at Denny's next to a pool. Yes, the pool area and surrounding grounds are very nice, but in the end you are paying dearly for the Westin name and getting the equivalent of a Holiday Inn on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...Family Friendly...but it could have been more.”
Reviews.Author: PocketKKings
Reviews.Content: First off, we were charged a "Resort Fee" for things we didn't use- such as the gym, extra water, and a shuttle van (because we had a rental car). We would have rathered that the fee included things we could have used- lounge chairs/umbrellas on the beach ($15/day). On the plus side, we enjoyed the pools, which were interconnected and included a keiki slide and a large water slide, waterfalls, and a hidden jacuzzi under a waterfall. The resort also had an "adult only" pool. In addition, the resort is located (as were others) right on the beach. It made it easy with the kids to transition from the pool to the beach. It was also located adjacent to two excellent restaurants (both in price and quality of food) as well as The Whaler "mall" that had a McDs, an ABC store, and other local wares. They also had parrots and koi fish (that the kids were able to feed in the morning) as well as a "Wii tournament" with changing games every day. There were arts and crafts for the kids (my two didn't participate in this or the Wii because they were in love with the water slide.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good resort”
Reviews.Author: vickie116
Reviews.Content: My BF and I stayed here for 5 nights on the week of July 4th. Considering that this was a very busy week for the resort, I don't think I entirely agree with some of the negative reviews here. Right when we walked in, we instantly fell in love with the tropical-themed lobby filled with waterfalls, flamingoes, swans, and giant koi. Check-in was quick and the people at the reception were friendly. When we finally arrived in our Deluxe Ocean View room in the Beach Tower (the newer tower), we were pleasantly surprised by the modern furnishings and the decent-sized bathroom. The view was breathtaking!! My only gripe is that it we could hear the sound of the fans coming from the restaurants in Whaler Village so try to get a room facing the pool folks! Yes, there were a lot of children around especially since this is a family-oriented resort and it is the middle of summer io the week of July 4th. But I did not think there were screaming children everywhere. Most kids actually behaved pretty well and my BF and I do not recall getting annoyed. The pool does get filled up pretty quickly but we spent most of our time at the beach and came back to the pool towards the end of the day (3-4pm) and were able to find chairs easily. We did get a beachside cabana one day which was nice but came with a hefty $60 pricetag. A huge negative with the pool area is that theres only ONE teeeeny tiny hot tub in the adult pool area. That thing can probably fit 4 or 5 people max at a time which is unacceptable!! Build a new hot tub!!! The beach here is great as well compared to the other hotels, when you get to the Hyatt side you can definitely see the erosion of the beach during high tide. Food is expensive at the resort but its expensive everywhere in Maui unless you really do some research and try to hit up some local spots. The breakfast buffet was pretty good but I really enjoyed the fruits (pineapple, mangoes, papaya) the most. On a side note (not related to the Westin), I just want to quickly add that you should probably skip Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina because its totally overrated!! Overall, we had a lovely time at the Westin Maui. I don't really have too many complaints about the place but would like to stay at other resorts when i return to Maui. Not because I disliked the Westin but because there are many other choices around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Honeymoon made magical by westin”
Reviews.Author: oblivion6
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I checked into this hotel a bit concerned with some of the reviews, but that wasnt a worry at all after only 10 minutes. Check in was superb and really personal as we got congratulations of the reception staff and told some hawaiin traditions for newly weds, like which side to wear your flowers :) When we went up to the room we were amazed!, we had been upgraded to one of the luxury rooms with a superb almost 360 view of the ocean over the whalers village. The room was superbly decorated and looked very fresh. The bathroom was amazing and had a large selection of free toiletries which my wife became addicted to :D But the number one thing about the room had to be the bed! it was so comfortable and huge and from lying in it you could look right out at the pacific and hear it lapping against the shore. Within 10 minutes of being in our room we were brought a complimentary bottle of champagne and flowers from reception as a gift for our honeymoon along with a loverly personalised note wishing us all the best. The layout of the hotel is amazing, just walking around at night and listening to the birds and taking in the breathtaking sunsets is something that will stay in our minds forever. Food wise the place is expensive, but then that seems to be the case with everywhere in Maui but you wont be dissapointed, the tapas style is lovely and the breakfast turkey wraps are the nicest breakfast we ever tried period! All in all this hotel is in an absolutely superb location with superb staff, views, rooms and facilities. We never experienced any rudeness or screaming children or anything resembling what a few people here have mentioned. A lot of the time I reckon it depends upon the reviewer and if one small thing occurs they may let this affect their entire holiday. One final mention has to go to the diving school that operate in the hotel, the training lesson is superb and the diver is so professional and makes sure you get a good session and see some amazing things. Remembering hearing whales talk while diving will always make smile. A+

Reviews.Title: “Overall Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMaree
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin has been our worst & most disappointing in several years. Checking in was cold & very impersonnel. First time a hotel wasn't prepared to accept my Visa card as it was a debit card. In the end they did as it was that or nothing. The receptionist ignored us and spoke in another language to another person in the queue behind us. That was our introduction to the Westin & it just went downhill from there. Rooms tired, small, our first room was noisy as it was next to the lift & sounded like an electric sander was being used in our room, in the end we were given a room with 2 double beds - small double beds - not something we expected for the our anniversary. Air cond was noisy, a repair man arrived to fix it even though we never reported the problem, phone continually flashed as if it had a message but it didn't, safe was not working when we arrived, carpet dirty, worn & stretched, furniture worn. Lifts were frequently out of order. Booked for the Luau with a warning that we would be charged if we didn't go to the show but after queuing for over 40 minutes we were advised our name hadn't been included on the list. After speaking to a manager it was sorted out., with numerous apologises. We left very tired not at all relaxed as their ads would suggest. Never before were we ready to leave in a bid to get a comfortable nights sleep. We've stayed in a lot of hotels & this would be one of our poorest experiences. Choose elsewhere if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Just back this morning - loved the location”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveldallas
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time. This was a trip from my husband to celebrate me turning 50 and being a five year cancer survivor. Yes it is an average resort. We stayed here knowing that this was an older resort. He choose a premium ocean view room. We had a great view of the pool and the ocean. He booked directly on line and got a fair price considering it is Maui. The location is incredible and we found most of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Extra towels, water, shampoo, pillows - no problem. Yes the parking is tight, however we always found a space and if you can't they will valet your car. We choose the adult pool every day and only had a hard time finding chairs on July 4th and we found them with minimal effort. The staff was monitering those who left and did not return within an hour. We left to get breakfast and came back with a note on our chair. They would have picked up our towels and books 25 minutes later. We never experienced any issues with children. Even in the elevators the children were very well behaved. Is the food expensive - yes. However, there is both a Costco and Safeway on the way to the resort and a refrigerator in the room. There is also an ABC store next door to the resort. Along with a food court. We bought some items at ABC that were very reasonable. Once again, since this was a treat we indulged within reason. We ate the breakfast buffet once and then decided to split an omelet on other days. Ask for the ocean view side. We ate at Barefoot Bar ( food ok - sunset magnificent) and then other places on the island the rest of the meals. We did a sunset cruise on both the Teralini and Gemini. They both were on the beach outside of the Westin. The Gemini is recommended by the Westin. We knew they had internet specials and both honored the discounted prices even though we called instead of booking on line. We preferred going direct instead of using the hotel conceirge. I would highly recommend this for the location and the beach. We walked up and down and found that the Westin has the best beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - Rooms are the worst I've ever seen for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: DMAttorney
Reviews.Content: I was paying $400 per night at Westin, so I was expecting it to be like other Westins - great. It was nice. The standard rooms were more than just "standard," they were rooms that I would not pay more than $150 for it. Small, dirty, and awful bathroom. On the brighter side, the spa was EXCELLENT. Lots of pools, right on the beach. Though, I can get pools and beach for a lot less. Overall, I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Pierry
Reviews.Content: My daughter graduated with honors from high school and did not want a party or any kind of celebration for her graduation present. Instead she chose a 10 day trip to Hawaii. I have been fortunate to have trveled to many places in the world and Hawaii was one place I never had much interest in visiting. I was pleasantly surprised by the natural beauty of the place and by the incredible volcanos. The Westin was perfect for this type of trip. Friends recommended the Four Seasons and I felt as if this was a little too romantic for me and my teenage daughter. The Westin was great because it was luxurious, on the beach and was in a perfect location. My daughter and I are foodies and we found so many incredible restaurants nearby. We rented a car and went to Lahaina, many memorable restaurants, one of which was the Plantation Restaurant in Kapalua. The fish tacos at Lelani's were wonderful for lunch and the Hula Grill (same owner) was a favorite too. Both are steps away from the Westin. Make sure you ask for the robes at the Westin. Be advised that the Westin charges $25 per day for the amenities. Personally, this charge should be included in the room charge. I don't think the added charge makes any sense because you have to pay it. A little trick is there are only 10 beach umbrellas so if you want to sit on the beach under an umbrella get to the desk by the beach by 8 AM and they open it up at 8:30 AM. There are always 10 people there by 8:30 AM so get there early. The food at the Westin is pricey for the quality and there are so many great nearby restaurants that I would highly recommend venturing out. The beds are super comfortable and we had a room with a golf mountain view. We hardly were in our room and we paid much less for this splendid view. It was beautiful. We also booked a sunset cruise at the Westin and loved it. It was a wonderful stay and we loved the talking birds while enjoying our morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: donguanellala
Reviews.Content: If you have a family with children, you're going to love this hotel. There's a slide at the pool and birds & fish in the lobby. If you're a childless couple looking for a quiet, relaxing getaway -- this hotel is not for you. We were so unable to relax, we left mid-stay and went to the Four Seasons in Wilelia. Some details: The pool area is a zoo. It's a free-for-all when it comes to finding chairs; most people head down by 8am to stake claim for their family for the entire day. There's no pool-side staff to help you find chairs or enforce "vacant" chairs. What's remaining (if anything) are undesirable chairs, in the bright sun, next to screaming children. The pool area is also a mess; there's service items and old towels strewn everywhere. It smelled like urine one day. There is an adult-only pool, but there are so few chairs that there's never anything open. The sounds of screaming children permeate this area as well. You also need to check-in and check-out towels from a towel shack -- with the threat of being charged if you don't check-in your towels at the end of the day. Huh? You can get a somewhat relaxing experience by getting a beach cabana. It's not really a cabana -- it's a two seat deck chair with a retractable awning. Unfortunately, they're $60 for the day, and guess what: there's always a screaming kid nearby. You can snag a chair & umbrella on the beach for $15, but they're first-come first-serve, and are filled-up by breakfast. The food at the poolside restaurant & the main hotel restaurant Tropica were average to below average. The spa facilities were clean and above average, but the actual services (stone massage) were below average. The Beach Tower room was passably clean, but not actually clean. Felt like it needed a spring cleaning. The front desk staff was hit or miss. When you got a nice person, they were terrific. When you got a cranky one, boy were they cranky. Free parking wasn't free at all: the cost was headaches and not enough spaces. I conceded to $15/day valet to not stress over this. All in all, this hotel was what you'd expect for a Westin that was adjacent to a Convention Center or a business district in a city: decent and dependable. But when you plant it beachfront in Maui, and price & market it like a five star resort -- it adds up to an underwhelming experience.

Reviews.Title: “Totally depends on the room.....”
Reviews.Author: CLBNSC
Reviews.Content: Definitely love the location have stayed here 4 times over the years. However really it comes down to the room you get. The newer tower is the Ocean Tower and the rooms are significantly larger (I'd approximate by 30%) over the older tower. FYI: The older tower is the building with the main entrance. Ocean view rooms are better in the older tower fro noise purposes these have even numbered room numbers. Odd numbers face the parking lot and the NOISE of people coming and going and car alarms etc. I've lucked out with rooms and really have only continued to stay here because the staff has been gracious and willing to swap rooms etc. to help me minimize noise issues. Kudos Westin Maui Team! Anyway a few other tips..the resort fee (currently $25) is a deal given it includes internet access, self parking, the gym and two bottle of water each day. So at first i was a bit miffed at this fee but given what it includes think it's fair. The Ocean Tower can suck if you have a room facing away from the pool towards Whaler's village (odd numbered rooms) as you get the restaurant "smell" - think sizzling steak aroma. So long story short (OK too late for that) don't get an ODD numbered room at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: roynpatty
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Expedia and were expecting a Premium Deluxe Room with ocean view. We expected to be over the pool area in the Beach Tower but were surprised to get room 890 at the end of the building which had a fabulous full view of the beach from the spacious and very private lanai. The room was spacious for the two of us and was very clean every day. It had a hide-a-bed and could have easily accomodated two more people. The staff were all very friendly and helpful at all times. We really enjoyed the location of the hotel next to Whaler's Village and several restaurants. The beach walk was very nice for late evening strolls. We loved the adult pool area with the bar and quieter atmosphere. We rarely had problems finding lounge chairs at the pool. No, we didn't go save a chair at 4 am either. Our package came with the buffet breakfast which was excellent. Get the ocean view seating, it's beautiful! The grounds were always clean as well as the lobby. In the afternoon they put a dispenser with ice water and lemons in the lobby area which is very refreshing in the heat. Parking is tight, but we had little to no problem finding a spot. It would be helpful if the people with the Chargers and Mustangs would put some effort in parking straight, but we managed with our little PT Cruiser. The beach is great, very clean and the water is unbelievably beautiful. Don't hesitate to stay here. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Suite Oasis”
Reviews.Author: seatwa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 588 in the Beach Tower June 12 - 26. We had a wonderful view of the pool and the ocean. The room was a luxury suite with a hudge bathroom and a wonderful hot tub inside. I would definitely recommend upgrading to a suite if you are staying for a week or longer. We saw a regular room in the Beach Tower and it was not big enough. With the economy being in a slump, the Westin will work with you on an upgrade. The room service was average at best, altough they did clean the suite daily.We had a package with the breakfast buffet and it saved us $50.00 per day and the food was excellent. We dined at both of the hotel's restaurants and the food was very good. I do recommend the restaurants in Whalers Village, which is located next to the Hotel. No matter which reastaurant you choose, with dinner and a coulple of drinks be prepared to spend $100.00. The location at the Westin is unbeatable. You have easy access to a wonderful Beach and great shopping at Whaler's Village. I am so glad we chose the Westin over the Hyatt and Sheraton. For a convienence matter, the other hotels should not be an option. The pool at the Westin is definitely colder than the average pool, although it sure felt great after a hot long day. There are a bunch of kids and families that stay at this Hotel. You will see small children every direction you turn around, which did not bother us much because we love kids. The best experience was defintely the lovely suite. We did not really have a bad experience, although service was average at best. We would definitely recommend the Westin due to it's location and vibrant atmosphere. Parking was not an issue like a lot of other reviews stated. In two weeks we never had to use valet or park elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: Familyof07
Reviews.Content: This review is geared for SPG members w/young children. I booked the Kanaapali Sheraton on pts. but when checking in I was stuck w/a garden view for my full stay of six nites. I should've spent xtra pts for an ocean view (prefer Bldg 3). This hotel is never sold out the week after school gets out mid-June, but they had a promo during this recession which explained my dilemna. Quickly called Starwood Platinum and booked on pts the Westin and rec'd a full credit from the Sheraton. Two ocean view rooms for my five children, wife and nanny. They were almost sold out too. Prior to securing the two rooms w/Starwood, the Reception said they were sold out. Starwood said they had two ocean view rooms for six nites. Got two rooms on 9th of 11 floors. Last two nites got the upgrade to nice sweet and nearby room on the 11th (SPG Floor). We were in the Ocean Tower not Beach. The rooms are rather small but manageable. Free close parking. WiFi free in room. Resort next to Whaler's Village. Enjoyed the Hula Grill (happy hr 3-5pm). Favorite rest. was Pineapple Grill (Austr. lamb chops and Alaskan king crab, seared Ahi app). Kimo's is always fun in Lahaina. Best burgers in Lahaina is Cool Cat Cafe (lunch). Always enjoy hitting the Napili Kai Resort at the Sea House Restaurant for breakfast overlooking the beach and then hitting the beach. Wesin's pool was better for the kids than the Sheraton. Great waterslide and pool. They hand out towels at 7am. Save them for next day to reserve lounges say 4am to 6am (no worries if you're still on CA time). Get 2-4 lounges under huge umbrellas at base of waterslide to view your children. Pick the two off to the far right. Doesn't matter if you get to the pool at noon if you save the lounge chairs w/towels and stuff. They fill up quick otherwise. Maui is always fun....enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort but pools close too early”
Reviews.Author: N1cky24
Reviews.Content: First off we travelled here on a promotional rate so got the room for peanuts, so my value 5* is based on what I payed not the published rate. The lobby area of the hotel, pools and bar area are lovely. The area is spotlessly clean, service excellent and the staff were all very friendly. We go on holiday to see the sights not sit on the beach or by the pool, so we tend to get to the pool with our 7 year old at the earliest at 4.00pm, often when we are on vacation its between 8.00-10.00pm. Unfortunately, the big slide closes at 4.30 and the smaller slides between 5.30 and 6.00. I don't know why they do this as there are no lifeguards on duty anyway. You also can't get towels after 5.00pm. The rooms are small, we just about coped with the 3 of us, and we only had 2 cases with us. Views are wonderful though. Food at the grill was good but a little expensive. Breakfast at the self serve for 2x croisants, 1x bagel, 1x box of cereal and 2xcoffee will set you back $30 a day. Westin beds are the best in the business without a doubt. Location next to The Whalers is handy and a short drive into Lahaina. Overall we had a fantastic stay, but not sure I would have been as happy if I had been paying the advertised $400 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, but comfortable for a week exploring Maui.”
Reviews.Author: joymoot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Westin Maui. I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews, but generally found it convenient for a short trip. Our room was passably clean. It could probably use a real deep scrub, and it seemed like some surfaces weren't wiped down since the last guest - I swear they had not changed the hand towels - yuck, but we received new towels the next morning, so we didn't really care. With the size of the Westin, and the high turnover rate, I actually don't expect sparkling clean rooms could be realized with this economy and low room rates. The rental for the umbrella and chairs on the beach is 15 bucks, and well spent if it's moderately windy, as it keeps the sand from whipping across you. It's too bad it isn't covered in the resort fee, though. One comment on the parking...please, "midlife crisis man in the convertable Mustang" - just park it straight!!! The lot would have at least five more spots available if people in their ridiculous rentals would just park between the lines!!!!!!! All in all, I'd stay here again, it was similar to the Sheraton down the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: flmd1234
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this Westin and it was fabulous. Prior to going, I read the reviews about the problem with getting chairs in the pool area; however, we never once had a problem. The staff by the pool and inside the hotel could not have been nicer. The pools/grounds were beautiful, as was the view rom the beach. The location is great as you can walk to the shops and restaurants at the Whaler's Village, plus the town of Lahaina is only a few miles away with great shops and restaurants. Although we had a rental car, we did notice the Westin had a shuttle that would take people back and forth to Lahaina. It was nice having a small refrigerator in the room as we stopped at the grocery store in Lahaina and purchased soft drinks and fruit. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found For Our Family”
Reviews.Author: SittingBull1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights at the amazing Westin Maui Resort and couldn't wait to type this review. We have stayed at the Ritz Kapalua and the Hyatt Maui before and this resort was the best fit yet for my family of five (kids 4, 9 and 13). I use TripAdvisor extensively when planning vacations and admit some of the mixed reviews of this property had me worried. If you have kids or are tolerant of families let me put your mind at ease- the resort is awesome. Expensive, but awesome. We requested the Ocean Tower with the slightly larger rooms and were glad we did. It's indeed closest to the beach and both the breakfast buffet and the best of the five pools are literally steps from elevator. Ignore the complaints about the distance from the lobby- it's a two minute walk past waterfalls, koi ponds, flamingos and parrots that delighted my kids, ages 4,9 and 13- every time we passed. Rooms were crisp, clean and modern- typical Westin. The well-used bed and linens were a touch less "heavenly" than what I've expereinced elsewhere but still above average. The resort is lush and beautiful, We brought flashlights and had fun and productive nightly "gecko hunts." Every morning they have timed races on the big waterslide- an activity that even made my teenage daughter break character and act like a kid again! Much has been written about the pool chair situation. We read the reviews, fell in line, and made sure we ate early and were at the pool before 9am every morning. No problems. We never reserved more than three chairs, because we're cool. Most people are considerate but there are tools at any resort that can spoil the "aloha." Don't blame the resort or generalize about the class of people around you. Negotiate for the free daily breakfast buffet package- the food is great and it helps defray the bloated cost of the everything else you eat/drink on property or in Maui. Also stop at Safeway or Costco and use the in-room fridges for saved $ on drinks and snacks. The Hula Grill right next door was the best food/value/view we encountered. Self-parking is tight but no worse than the other Kaanapali resorts. Rent the smallest car you can. We had a great time and hope to be back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the beach---bring $$ for chairs and umbrella--get up early”
Reviews.Author: dandkc
Reviews.Content: Check in a breeze. Got to room, our Deluxe Ocean View room was over the Whaler Village parking lot. Room not clean, first indication was the door was totally covered in a large number of greasy fingerprints. Inside no better. I am not a clean freak, but you would have to be in the dark not to see what was not clean. Talked to the front desk and with ALOT of discussion they finally decided to move us the NEXT day after a very noisy evening. But, we would have to come down four levels and our view then would be through palm trees. Of course no credit given to our bill. And the next morning another surprise. You must pay $$$$ to sit on the beach on a chair with an umbrella, and be the first ten to get one. We travel alot and this was a first to pay for beach chair/umbrella. We won't be returning to this hotel. Food poor, parking limited, watch you bill close. Also, one last comment on the parking. Watch out for "extra" Valet charges.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here...Do Not Stay Here...Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Colorado30
Reviews.Content: I write this review in my Westin hotel room as I just came upstairs from arguing with a very pompous man over pool chairs. If you find that relaxing, this is the place for you! You will spend your entire time at the pool fighting for chairs. Let me start by saying this is my first review of a hotel ever. My husband and I travel frequently and typically stay at Westin, Marriott, JW Marriott, etc. In the past two years, we have been to Hawaii twice, Los Cabos, Puerto Vallarta, along with several smaller trips. I am by no means a "high maintenance" woman. I am a low-maintenance type athlete gal and have never been to a spa, had my nails done, etc., so this is not coming from some woman who expects everything to be at her beckon call. Check in was smooth. The lobby is very nice, but deceptive to what you will find in the rest of the hotel. We went to our room and it is exactly as other reviewers on here stated. I have never seen such a tiny room with such low ceilings and for some reason, they have decided to see exactly how much furniture they can cram into the room. You can barely move. The rooms are very worn, old, and crusty - certainly not up to typical "Westin" standards. It was one of those hotels that you wanted to have your shoes on whenever walking on the flooring because it was so disgusting. Basically, they have tried to gloss over a very outdated, old hotel. You can hear EVERYTHING your neighbors say, every time a door closes, a toilet flushes, etc. I cannot recall a hotel that I have been in that had such thin walls. The same dirty room service food would be left in the hallways for you to walk past for the entire day, sometimes multiple days. What topped everything off and made me decide I needed to write a review was today's event at the pool. My husband and I approached two completely empty pool chairs with absolutely nothing around them, which is a rare occasion to find at this hotel. You have to "hunt" chairs like you are an animal because people place towels on the chairs at sunrise and then don't use them the entire day. We placed our items on the chairs and some guy swam across the pool to very rudely state that those were his chairs even though nothing was on or near the chairs. I am typically a rather shy person and I actually ended up in a heated argument with this guy until I finally walked away and decided he was not worth it. For the most part, the crowd here has their nose in the air in an attempt to pretend they are something they certainly are not. The crowd is a bunch of wanna-bes trying to pretend like they are "high-rollers". I have never seen people so obnoxious and stuck on themselves. Staff is not much friendlier - certainly not the "Aloha" spirit you expect when in Hawaii. In general, this place is an absolute zoo. It is chaotic , crowded, and far from relaxing. Do not go here if you are looking to relax and have a stress free vacation! I wish I had went with my gut after reading other reviews on here and stayed away from this place. Parking - every evening when you return the self-park area is full and you are forced to valet your car. You have no choice. They are very "generous" and do not charge you extra to valet your car, but they stand there and stand there and stand there waiting for their tip. Now, if I choose to valet a car, I certainly leave a tip because that is an expected protocol of using the valet. I do not expect to tip someone everytime I want to go somewhere because I was forced to valet because the self-park lot is ridiculously small. There are numerous other items that made this hotel less than stellar, but I have already typed a book. I would never stay here again and this hotel has certainly made me think twice about staying at a Starwood properties again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but watch out for traps”
Reviews.Author: iloveloveseaotters
