Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and found it to be a beautiful hotel. Gorgeous open lobby area with a koi fish stream, black swans and flamingos basking in the warm Hawaiian sun. Our room was in the Beach Tower, which was quite a walk from the hotel front desk. We paid for an ocean view, but the ocean was really out the side of our balcony and the room actually faced the Whalers Village outdoor shopping mall (Great shopping, by the way... just steps from the hotel). Room was nice; comfy bed and very nice furnishings. Breakfast was nice; buffet style out doors by the pool. We were told that we could use our free breakfast coupons at three different restaurants, so we chose to go to the Sheraton the second day. I was really disappointed in the food and service there, so we ate at the Westin's buffet the third day, as we did on the first. However, we were under the impression that the third restaurant was a ways a way from the Westin. Turns out that if you go into this other restaurant area (which looks like a doorway for the servers), it leads to a beautiful area with a waterfall and overlooks the beach. I was disappointed that we didn't know about this area sooner. I only went to check it out because I saw people walking through the doorway and wondered where they were going. Unfortunately the hotel didn't tell us about this area. It would have been nice as a change of scenery. The pools were great; very relaxing. The main pool has two areas; one with a mini slide for kids to use and the other area has a large twist slide that even adults can use (I tried it once and that was enough fun for me!). Lots of waterfalls that splash into the pool. Behind that area is another pool exclusively for adults. Absolute Heaven! There is a "cave"-like structure that you can swim under and inside you'll find a hot tub. Very romantic! Plus, as the main pools close at 9pm, the adult pools are open til 10pm. One word of warning; when we arrived, we were told that there was a welcome gift for us at the front desk. We went to get it and it turned out to be a bunch of coupons. The Westin has condo properties and the staff tried to rope us into scheduling a tour of their property in exchange for a $100 voucher. We almost fell for it, until I read the fine print. We had no intention of going to their tour, but the catch is that if you DON'T go on the tour, you will be BILLED for the $100. They never actually gave us the voucher, but it caused us a lot of worry because we were afraid we would be charged anyway. Just be aware and always read the fine print! I was really disappointed that they would do something like that and it lowered my opinion of the hotel somewhat. There's no real business center that I could find but the pool bar has free internet computers for use. The fitness center was excellent, with every kind of machine you can imagine. I wish we could have used it more. Plus, it's open 24 hours a day, which is really cool. Parking, as others have said, is TERRIBLE! Very small spots and people don't know how to park in the designated parking spots, so one night we came back and had to use valet parking, since our mid-size car wouldn't fit without smashing into someone's car. Unfortunately there is a fee for valet, so again we were afraid we would be charged for something we had no control over. I noticed that there seem to be MANY more valet spots than there were self-parking. Ridiculous parking situation for a hotel this big. Every night we had problems finding a space. All in all, a nice hotel, right on Kaanapali Beach. However, make sure you don't get roped into sitting through a sales pitch and be sure and check your bill for any hidden charges at the end of your stay. Fortunately, we didn't find any, which is fortunate for the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to forget all your worries!”
Reviews.Author: Tuuzik
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 10:30pm after our inter-island flight was delayed 90 minutes and were given complimentary valet since the self service lot was full which was very nice of the hotel. Then we proceeded to check-in where we were helped by Joven who probably has some of the worst customer service skills I've ever experienced. First he tells me our reservation was cancelled since I did not 'confirm' the reservation in April (when I put my credit card down for a deposit I was never told I would need to and I had just stayed at the Moana, another Westin resort, the days prior and had no such issues) then he tells me that I should not have received the discount that I was getting, although I had a letter stating I would be using said discount. After informing him that I had no such issues at the Moana a few days earlier he relented and began to check us in which he did in such a harried manner you would think there were 20+ people in line behind us, it being almost 11pm there was no one, and a many minutes later we were unceremoniously presented with our keys and mumbled directions to our room. (We did walk by the check in desk another day and saw him helping another couple with the same rushed attitude, so maybe that's just how he was). Both my boyfriend and I discussed asking for his manager but decided that since we were getting such a great deal, and it being late at night we would let it go unless we had some other issues with him. Thankfully we did not and the rest of our stay was magnificent. We spent hours by the pool, which is great since there are 5 separate pools including an adults only pool so none of the pools ever felt really crowded, and at the beach, walking to Whalers Village and exploring the hotel and surrounding area. Our room was spacious and the 'free' wi-fi and daily water were a nice touch. (I say 'free' because they charge all guests a $25 daily fee for these things, no ifs, ands or buts). All in all we would definitely stay at this hotel again but we would most certainly try not to deal with Joven again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Views and Pool”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBusymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui the end of May. We had come from Honolulu. We stayed in the Ocean Tower and had a view of a large tree and the parking lot. It was okay, everything else made up for it. There is a Costco as you come out of the airport at Kahului. We stopped there after we picked up our rental car. The place was packed. As we were staying at the Westin for 4 days, we did not want to eat breakfast out every day because we knew prices would be expensive, so we picked up a large fruit bowl and some muffins at Costco and some soda. The Westin has small frigerators for some food and drinks. Checkin was a breeze. After we checked in, we walked around the property before heading toward the swimming pool. They have a very nice sundry shop on property for snacks, sodas, buying t-shirts, macadamia nuts, etc. A lovely waterfall is right outside the lobby and has flamingos, swans (I think they were swans), and large koi. The swimming pool is terrific. They have a large waterslide for "older" children. They have waterfalls whereby the water from the fall empties into the pool. We did notice that the water was colder when you were near the waterfalls. The pools are interconnected, and there is one pool with a tunnel that my son just loved. If you take a walk you can go up the stairs up behind all the pools and see the most amazing views. There are small geckos running around on the stairs. There is a wedding gazebo up at the top. There is an adult only pool with a bar. My husband immediately wanted to start building tiki-style huts in our backyard when we returned home-haha!! We tended not to eat on property as it was too expensive. The breakfast buffett was over $27. We tended to eat off property. Whaler's Village is right next door. Down in the lower level of Whaler's Village is a food court where you can get McDonald's, chinese food, pizza, and ice cream. We ate there a few times in the evening. The food was reasonably priced. We also ate one evening at Lelani's on the Beach (it's also right next door), but again it's kind of pricey. CJ's Deli and Diner is about 1/2 mile away, and there are several restaurants in Lahaina. We ate at Cilantro's and Cheeseburger in Paradise. I will say the Westin Maui makes the best Pina Colada I've ever had--and at happy hour drinks are 1/2 price. There is also an ABC store at Whaler's Village for purchasing small items. There is a daily charge of $25 that is added to your room. With this fee, you get 2 bottles of water, access to the fitness center, internet service, and I can't think of what else--maybe parking? Oh, another thing I wanted to add is that their beds are amazing--I think it's called the heavenly bed--I really would love to purchase one for our home. You just sink into it. The beach is only a few minutes from your room. We found the waves to be a little rougher than the ones at Waikiki. There is also a nice walking path that goes along the resorts in West Maui. It is very nice to get up early in the morning and take a stroll. You can get some beautiful pictures. Also, you will be able to see the islands of Lanai and Molokai from West Maui. The Westin Maui really is a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Stylersheart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort May 25th thru June 1st for our anniversary/birthdays. We stayed in a garden view room on the 3rd floor. We had a great view of the garden, massage cabana, pool and ocean. The room was very comfortable, clean, quite and always well stocked with towels and water. Nice balcony with 2 chairs and table which we sat in the evenings enjoying the nice weather. The room had a safe that held our laptop computer which is very convenient. Coffee maker and refrigerator came in handy as well. Pool was excellent - we went to the adult pool almost every day - and there was always plenty of room. We had most of our meals by the pool since I was there on an employee rate and we would get a discount at the pool bar and Ono's. The food was very good and the servers were very polite. I asked my husband if he wanted to share a sandwich with me and when it came the server had it split up for us already - very nice! We ate at Ono's several times for lunch and breakfast. We did get the breakfast buffet only because I did get the food discount...$28 for a breakfast buffet in my opinion is way too much - the food was good but not worth $28! We also had dinner at the Hula Grill and Leilani's next door at Whalers Village which was also very good. We totally took advantage of the shuttle into Lahaina almost everyday. Moose McGuillicudy's, Lahaina Fish Co., Mala's, Bubba Gumps all had great food and service. My favorite is Mala's near the Lahaina Cannery Mall (a must)! I did get a massage at the cabana one day and they did have a 10% discount. Almost fell to sleep it was so great. We also rented the beach chairs and umbrella at the beach one day which I thought was a great deal for $25 a day - would do that again. Overall this resort is great and I would definitly go there again! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mmedhurs
Reviews.Content: I am a total Westin girl and after reading some negative reviews, I had my doubts about staying here. Let me put your minds to rest, this place is fabulous! The pools are remarkable and were just the right temperture. Our room, in the ocean tower, was great. The bathroom was a little small but who cares? The beach out front was great as was the service. We only had 1 meal on site because we chose to drive into town and eat. As previously mentioned, the drinks and food were expensive. Really expensive. But everything was pricey. The "drink of the day" was always a hit, and for $6.50 have 3 or 4! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing...worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: BrittniL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for our honeymoon in May and we couldn't have been happier. I don't know how people could've had bad experiences, because ours was just wonderful. The moment we got there, we had champagne in our room waiting for us! We were in the beach tower in a deluxe ocean view room, and the room was really nice, with flat screen tvs, a king bed, and a nice size bathroom. The pool complex is unbelievable! There's a lot of people that stay there, seeing as it's a big resort, but you would never know there were so many people! The pools were spread out, and so was everyone at the hotel. We hung by the adult pool and the one right by it and there weren't many kids at all. The other two pools by the Ono restaurant had a lot of kids. The drinks at the hotel were expensive, but overall the food wasn't that expensive, but it was reallllly good! We ate at Leilani's, Longboards and Hula Grill which are right on the beach and they were all excellent! We also ate at Bubba Gump's and Hard Rock Cafe in Lahaina...they were really good! We also went to the Old Lahaina Luau, which was amazing!! Overall, the Westin is worth every penny! We had a fabulous time there, and really felt like were in a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: b11811
Reviews.Content: We were staying a at a extremely discounted rate, so I had no expectations, but even if I had paid full price I would have been content. We had an ocean front room on the 3rd floor, in the tower closest to the beach. It was amazing because we could leave the door open and fall asleep to the sound of waves. The hotel is in a great location on Kaanapali beach. We were only staying two days so we didn't get in a lot of hotel time as we were out sight seeing mostly. The bed was wonderful and I appreciated the double shower heads in the bathroom. The restaurants right next door are less expensive than the hotels, and the abc store will save you some money. My only complaint was the spa and adult pool bar close around 10pm, but thats Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: Cabunny
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the Westin. We stayed here 6 days in May 2009 and had a blast. They have 7 pools a huge waterslide, a private "adult pool" and spa with a bar that stays open extra late. Food is great, room service too. We went there last year for our anniversary as well as this year. Their gym over looks the pool and ocean. Spectacular view! As with most hotels, you want to get to the pool early to be able to get seating easily...otherwise it's a take-what-you-can-get situation. Their restaurant has great food...but expect to pay at least $50 for breakfast for 2. Parking hasn't been an issue this time, but I remember last year we had trouble find a spot on some days. Their macadamia nut pan cakes are to die for! And their pineapple coconut smoothies are super amazing too! They also have daily events going on and put out a schedule each morning. They have slide races to see who can get the fastest time, surfing lessons, lei making lessons, etc!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs a major powerwash”
Reviews.Author: JPRCoquitlam
Reviews.Content: Four of us recently travelled to Maui and were initially impressed with the hotel. We arrived at midnight so it was dark , we were tired and we didn't see too much until the next morning. The hotel itself has beautiful grounds but the guest rooms , while adequate, leave a lot to be desired for cleanliness. Our floors were dirty, there were cobwebs and dust on the dressers/consoles, sticky stuff on the floor, finger prints on the mirrors and glass balacony doors . We could not use the chairs and table on the balcony either as they were filthy with dust and bird droppings. I don't think the balcony table had ever been cleaned. We were not in our room other than to sleep but wore our shoes the whole time as we did not feel comfortable walking around in bare feet. The staff were friendly , food was "OK" but very expensive and not really worth the price. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlight206
Reviews.Content: Just completed our third stay at the Westin Maui over the years. Had another great experience. People whine about the size of the rooms in the Ocean Tower. My thoughts? If your traveling as a couple you'll have plenty of space. If you are traveling as a family you're going to be crammed into any standard hotel room regardless of whether its 360 or 450 square feet. The Ocean Tower rooms have very classy furniture, nice big balconies (ALL views on the ocean side of the building are nice - even if you are on a lower floor and can't actually see the beach), and our room was very clean. We've also stayed in the Beach Tower and can tell you I'm fairly indifferent between the two. The people were friendly as ever, and the hotel (keeping in mind it's over 20 years old and parts are like 35 years old) looked great. The pool is the best in West Maui, and the slide is fun for all ages. You can't beat the beach location, again, the best in West Maui. We found the food expensive but very very yummy - especially the breakfast buffet. I'd ALMOST pay $28 for it at home every once in awhile... The resort fee is a bit of nuisance but you'll find it at all Hawaii resorts, and at least at the Westin it includes some items of real value, we used the water bottles everyday and the wireless internet (also included) was great. Considering Internet alone is costing $12-13 a day at mainland hotels, and parking is easily $10 at most places, $25 isn't that bad. We actually relocated to the Westin Maui from the Westin Villas up the road a bit... we're glad we did. The Westin Villas are a nice facility, too, but the service there (especially the front desk) is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “First Time....Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: AVIDAT
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay in this hotel and it was great. We had a room overlooking the swimming pools and the ocean and this was excellent. The room was expensive (due to currency conversion) but the experience was amazing. Thanks to great staff and wonderful service it was a very special holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money..or your points”
Reviews.Author: Dragonmom
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to begin. We have a home on Oahu so we travel to Hawaii a couple of times a year. We decided to visit Maui and I cashed in 60,000 Starwood points for 3 nights. My friend accompanied us and paid $350 a night for the same room, but with a view of the parking lot. We at least got a mountain view. As is typical for all Hawaii hotels, the lobby is gorgeous. The front desk personnel are pleasant. Then you get on the elevator. Somebody mentioned it was dirty but I think it was incredibly worn. It looked like a fleabag hotel elevator. I can't tell you how shocked we were. Then we get to the room. It was nice enough but I don't think I have ever stayed in such a small hotel room, except maybe London. Even New York City has larger hotel rooms. No closet, no place to put our one small suitcase. We had 2 double beds. I can't believe that Starwood would have a hotel property with double beds. My friend had a King bed so she had a bit more walking around room but not worth $350 a night. Of course you need to pay for internet, the "resort" fee, breakfast, etc. The restaurants were okay. You have to watch the birds though. They were helping themselves to the food on the breakfast buffet. There was a coffee bar/breakfast area that some people thought was complimentary. Nothing is ever complimentary at the "high-end" hotels but some people had to be told to pay and others just took what they wanted and walked away. It was so weird and unprofessional. The pool was a nightmare. There was an adults only pool which we couldn't use. The family pool was huge but too deep for our kids to stand up in. People reserved their chairs at like 6:00 in the morning but at 9:00, after we had been swimming for 2 hours they still had not made an appearance. It left people like us who actually were in the pool with no place to put our things but the grass. There were only 4 or 5 people in the pool the whole time we were there but the chairs were always empty with towels on them. They have this system where you get a towel but if you don't turn it back in you get charged $20. And supposedly they will pick up your towel if it sits on a chair for half an hour. They only went around putting warning notes on a couple of times in the two days we used the pool But we actually witnessed two fights where people thought their chairs had been stolen and some guy was getting dinged for the towel because the pool attendants collected them. He tried to take some other people's towel. It was really ugly. I've thought about what the hotel could do to have a more pleasant hotel experience. Maybe it is just the class of people this hotel attracts but "reserving" a chair while you are in your room for 4 hours is rude and I think the hotel needs to address this. If you are already paying $350 a night for a room you should try the Hyatt or stretch a bit for the Ritz-Carlton. A much classier hotel. If you are cashing in your Starwood points go to Thailand. For half the points you get 3 times the room for twice as long. I regret wasting so many points at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big fan of Westins until now...”
Reviews.Author: gfgb78
Reviews.Content: Before I go into the details of my stay I have to say I am usually a big fan of Westin hotels (Starwood Preferred Gold). I read some of the negative reviews and decided to stay at the Westin anyway since I have never had a bad experience at a Westin property. My wife and I recently traveled to Maui and decided to stay at the Westin using a combination of points and cash. When we arrived at the hotel we were impressed with the beautiful lobby. We then checked into the hotel were told that we were be upgraded to a Mountain View room on the 10th floor. So far so good. We then got into the elevator which set the tone for the overall cleanliness of the hotel. The elevator looked as though it had not been wiped down since it was originally installed. As we walked down the hallway to our room we noticed a couple of dirty room service trays sitting on the ground. Throughout our stay we found this was a par for the course. We would see the same dirty trays and trash sit in the hallways for several hours. At one point I noted the time we first saw a couple of trays in the hallways, six hours later the trays were still sitting in the same place. In that time someone from room service had come through the hallway at least twice and never bothered to clean up. When the trays were finally picked up trash that was sitting on the side of one of the trays was left there. That trash sat in the same place for another day before it was picked up. The room itself was very small and had limited space to put our clothes (no real closet). The bed had the Heavenly pillow top mattress which helped but was not to the same standard as other Westins I have stayed at in the past. The pillow top mattress was not able to make up for the old box spring and mattress. The room had a balcony with a small table and two chairs. The view of the mountains was very nice. However, when you looked down you there was the self parking lot. The problem with the parking lot is that the noise from the horns honking was unbearable Every time someone locked their car doors their horn would honk. The only thing more annoying was those times when the lock button was mistaken for the panic button and we got to hear the car alarm go off. The worst part of the stay was the service provided by Service Express and the front desk. I stopped by the front desk to see if they had a room that was not directly on top of the parking lot and was told I could pay extra for an ocean view room. I then called later to talk with a manager and was told she would note my complaint in the system but she could not help me. This is not say that certain individuals did not go above and beyond to try and make the stay enjoyable. The staff in the restaurants and the valet parking attendants were always very friendly and helpful. The location was incredible. The pool was very nice. However, the poor service from the front desk and service express, the lack of cleanliness, and poorly maintained rooms make the Hyatt a better choice for the money. I have stayed at the Hyatt and Ritz-Carlton several times and how found the experience at these hotels to be much better. I paid $90 per night, plus $25 resort fee, and 4,600 Starwood points per night for this stay. Despite paying a little over $100 per night for hotel that charges $300 per night I feel like I was robbed. The experience I had at the Westin might have been bearable if it was free. I would have been much more upset if I would have paid the over $300 per night the hotel was charging for now award rooms during my stay. I would recommend the Hyatt as a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mgilles_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary here and had a wonderful time. The only negative experience we had with the hotel was we had booked a terrace/garden room and were placed in a room in the Ocean tower overlooking most of the parking lot. We were able to upgrade to a view of the pool and beautiful grounds and part of the ocean for $35.00 extra per night. We had to wait for our room to be cleaned and after waiting in the lobby for an hour, we were told the room still wasn't ready yet. We were very tired and had a long flight and almost said the heck with it and leave the hotel . Thank goodness the clerk found a beautiful ocean view room that was ready to move into and she did not charge extra for the expensive room. We also got a free bottle of champagne delivered to our room and a nice canvas hawaii shopping bag. Soo...after we got settled in , we had a great time. The boardwalk was great to walk to the shops and restaurant. Our room was very clean and the grounds were well kept up. The pool was great and warm enough. The drinks at the bar were wonderful also.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Maui..our last stay at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: mandmeplus3
Reviews.Content: While we loved Maui and plan to return we will never return to the Westin Maui . The rooms are very small (we stayed in the Beach Tower) and the service left much to be desired. Our first night we ordered coffee and dessert from room service. after a few sips of my coffee I looked down to see three segmented insects swimming in my coffee. After a call to room service the hotel manager called to say that he had removed the coffee from our bill! One of our children had an upset stomach and threw up on the carpet. After repeated requests to have it cleaned or something to absorb the odor we gave up. A few other notes: Mold in the shower, dirty carpet in the rooms , and the pool is uncomfortably cold.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed...”
Reviews.Author: amh1769
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before we left for our 6 night/7 day vacation and didn't have extremely high expecations so wasn't too disappointed when I got to the Westin. I experienced the same things a lot of other people have. I felt that for a Westin, which I view as a higher ended brand in the Starwood Family, it was below par. We were not greeted by anyone when we pulled up at 8 pm on a Friday night. We had to figure out how to get into the self parking, which was full and we finally found a valet to help us park our car but no one offered to help us with our bags. Check in was okay and the gentlemen behind the desk said we were upgraded to a full "ocean view" in the Ocean Tower. I should have right there requested a Beach Tower after reading the reviews, but figured it would be okay. The elevators are old and need to be cleaned or something - I understand that salt air/water will erode metal, but I think a Clorox Bleach wipe would have done a world of good. We were on the 5th floor so really couldn't see the ocean through the palm trees - so much for the "ocean view". Our room didn't have to two complimentary bottles of water when we got to our room, nor did we get them consistantly everyday. And the wireless was hit or miss with signal strength in the room - for $25 a day as part of the resort fee, I would expect at least Westin could deliver on that. I am a "preferred" Starwood member and got a message that the concierge had a welcome gift for me, but when I went down, she just said that she was happy to tell me I was getting Starwood points for my stay - what? That's not a gift, that's part of being in the Starwood program. The pool was crazy - it was crowded when we were there and the "chair hogs" were down at 7 am saving chairs that they wouldn't come sit on for hours later. Westin's policy is if a chair hasn't been occupied for over an hour, they'll move the stuff, but I never saw that happen. We chose to just stay on the beach, which was nice and not too crowded. The location is great - Whaler's Village is right next store - I would highly recommend swinging by the ABC store in Whaler's Village to stock up on snacks, lunch items and such vs. eating at the Westin. The breakfast buffet was below average for the price - had it not been included in our package, we would have passed on eating at the Westin all together. The restaurants that are in Whalers Village are great and reasonably priced considering it is Hawaii - Lelani's and Hula Grille are great and fantastic at sunset! Black rock is a great location to snorkel at - if you are thinking about a boating snorkel trip - save your money and just visit Black Rock - lots of fish to see, sea turtles, etc. All in all our stay was average - I probably wouldn't go back to the Westin - would definately stay in Ka'anapali area, but I would head down the beach to the Hyatt or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Ka'anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Westin and we were very happy with our choice once again. What makes this hotel the best on Ka'anapali is its location and the quality of rooms and amenities. Having stayed in different parts of the hotel we'd recommend the Beach Tower which has larger rooms and is closer to the pools and beach front. All rooms have recently been renovated with new furnishings and feature the Heavenly Bed which is simply divine. The hotel has a great pool scene with several pools to choose from but the property does lack a kiddie pool for kids that cannot swim. You should also know that the hotel does charge a daily resort fee of $26 so be sure to account for this as you budget for your stay. The fee covers wireless internet access, two bottles of water (daily), newspaper, parking, and access to a great workout facility. Hotel food prices are expensive but is to be expected -- fortunately the food is very good and they have several healthy options. If your looking to save money I'd recommend utilizing the refrigerator in the room by buying breakfast items at the local grocery store (Safeway or ABC) instead of the $25 per person breakfast buffet. In addition, the hotel is located next to Whalers Village which has great restaurants and shopping including the Hawaii chain store " ABC" (equivalent to CVS) which has great prices for things like snacks and gifts. Lastly the hotel offers a great spa (complimentary for SPG Gold/Platinum members) that features a quite room with great views of the ocean and complimentary water and snacks. While no hotel is perfect we'd definitely recommend the Westin. Its worth every penny and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, pools not so much”
Reviews.Author: caseyWhitewater
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights March 20 - 27. The staff was friendly, (bellman brought us a microwave after bringing up our bags) and efficient. The room was nothing to write home about, but no complaints either. The biggest complaint that I do have is the pools. They are cold and there is no depth less than 1.2 meters (47.25 inches) in any of them. My 40 inch son could only play in the pool with someone to hold him. We ate at Ono while there and our opinion was similar to that of the room - it was ok. Really enjoyed my first Melona pop at the pool snack bar but the hotel store sells them for less than 1/2 that price. I would recommend for families with older children but I would choose somewhere else if traveling with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: endsun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and modern. We had a room with a king bed, shower, tub, refrigerator, dishwasher and microwave and it was very spacious... There was also a little balcony we spent a lot of time on! The facilities I had a fantastic massage at the SPA. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Drinks on the property are pretty expensive, even at happy hour, but it's Maui, so it's to be expected. It was a little windy on the resort in January - it usually picked up at the end of the day. The beach was amazing - you basically fall into the water and can see fish. Very cool! You can also find many crabs along the beach if you stay still and look for them. A great choice for a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missjulykitten
Reviews.Content: The airport is about a 45 minute drive from the airport because of the curvy road, but a beautiful drive along the coast. We stayed at the Westin Maui with friends from Oct 17th-Oct 22nd. I was looking forward to the traditional Lai upon arrival, sadly we didn't receive so much as a hello much less a lai. Because this was a dream vacation I blew it off because of it being so late at night when we checked in. I am a gold Starwood member and booked a fantastic rate on their website. At the reception desk there is a Starwood Preferred Line, however no one was there so we waited in the normal line. The young guy that checked us in, was horrible. I had to ask him for the upgrade, if that is what you want to call it. ( I will get to that later) While in the process of getting our keys, our friends arrived with Lai;s around their necks. They are also Starwood Gold members. I asked where they got the Lei's, they answered at the entrance to the hotel. Someone magically appeared at the Starwood desk and checked them in with a fabulous upgrade and full explanation of benefits they could enjoy as Starwood Members at the hotel. We went to our designated rooms. The room is large and comfortable, very clean. Big bathroom, lots of room to spread out for the week. I went to the balcony to see what are upgraded view looked like. To my surprise we were upgraded to a view of either the trash containers or the top of lobby roof. If we walked out on the roof far enough we could see the pool. (Stay away from the 2nd floor, it is labeled as a Starwood member floor) This was totally unacceptable, I left a message for the hotel manager and requested a phone call the next day. The manager called the next day and offered me an oceanfront premium room with her apology, Our friends were on the 8th floor, so we accepted an Oceanview premium instead to be closer to them. We ate breakfast at the buffet one morning. Beautiful presentation and so many food choices. Excellent buffet, but not worth it to us at 25.00 per head per day. Westin offers rates that include breakfast, but we did not select one. Our room came with a frig, which we filled up with groceries from the local market. Food is very expensive in Hawaii, be it at a restaurant or at the market. This worked well for us, as we spent a lot of our time at the pool or at the beach, so we would run up to the room for sandwich or snack. There is a mall next door and a food court. (IE: McDonalds) There are lots of great restaurants to pick from as we did each night for dinner. Pool: Huge Pool area, Kids Pool and an adult only Pool. Waterslide. Great fun for everyone. The water is cold. Didn't make sense since the temp was high. Every morning the staff fills the pool with freezeing cold water, so be prepared. The spa is wonderful but pricey, so bring extra monies. Staff is wonderful. Several evenings we would arrive back late after going out for dinner. If the self parking is full they will Valet for free. We enjoyed that several evenings. Overall the Westin Maui is wonderful and I still rank it overall as VG. ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay ... after all, we were on Maui”
Reviews.Author: JasminedogLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Westin Maui is located in the heart of Kaâ€™anapali Beach on Maui. The public areas are beautiful and impressive, with a design intended to take advantage of vistas of the impressive swimming pools, swan ponds, rock formations, and man-made waterfalls, as well as being wide open to the tropical breezes of Maui. The Hyatt Regency Maui is probably three times as impressive and beautiful, but also more expensive than the Westin. For a family of 2 adults and 2 teens, 5 nights at the Westin was more than sufficient, as the room itself is small. If we were to stay here again, then we would try to book two connecting rooms instead. We were in the Ocean Tower (the larger of the 2 tower options available) and while the room itself was furnished fairly comfortably (great bed, flat screen TV, built in armoire), we would not consider it resort luxury. For that, stay at the Grand Wailea instead but be prepared to pay the price for luxury too. The bathroom had a small sink area outside of the bathroom (which was simply functional but nothing luxurious). There was a convenient empty refrigerator and a safe under a cabinet in the sink area itself. Overall, while the public areas are gorgeous and well kept, the hotel rooms are just too small to really enjoy and relax in (if that is what you intend to do â€¦ which our family likes to do after a busy day of sightseeing/swimming). Overall, the Ocean Tower is a bit tired and outdated for 21st century resort expectations and should probably be imploded and constructed brand new. But the location is excellent, the public areas are beautiful and impressive, and the swimming pools and beach convenience were great. The resort fee we were charged everyday gave us parking in the very narrow parking spaces of the self parking lot. Plus you got Internet access, fitness room access and 2 bottles of water daily. On weekends, the self parking lot will likely be full and spaces hard to come by. The resort fee is a joke and should be eliminated since you really arenâ€™t given a â€œchoiceâ€� to accept or decline it anyway. When the Westin was upgraded in the late 1970â€™s, the hotel constructed five swimming pools, complete with waterfalls and a cave Jacuzzi. And of course the hotel fronts Kaâ€™anapali Beach itself. The beach has great wave action â€¦ not too mild and not too strong. But it can become deep after only a few feet into the ocean, so little ones must be watched carefully. Not great for any snorkeling, so we walked about 15 minutes towards Black Rock and found some nice areas to snorkel from the beach. Plus there were some tourist teens diving from the Black Rock cliff into the ocean. We played in the four family friendly pools nearly every day of our stay, but these close at sunset. As others have noted, the pool water is initially cold and while your body will eventually get used to it, I wished they had turned up the thermostat on the pools. The adult pool and spa (the fifth of the five pools) is open until 10:30 PM, but not for children. We had no problems finding loungers at any of the pools or at the beach. The work out fitness room overlooked the pool and casual restaurant through floor to ceiling windows. Although the modern design was very cool and impressive, there were only a handful of work out machines (but plenty of cardio options). The upside was that the fitness room was open 24/7. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet offered in the casual restaurant â€œColonnade Cafeâ€� overlooking the swimming pool area. Great selection of fresh fruit, eggs cooked to order, pastries, cereals, Japanese breakfast options, and plenty of meats and other cholesterol choices. But if you donâ€™t mind a short walk to the buffet stations, then ask to be seated in the adjoining â€œTropicaâ€� restaurant for a smack-on ocean view from your table. We didnâ€™t realize this until after our second breakfast there. Dinner choices abound in Kaâ€™anapali and we had one dinner in the Colonnade CafÃ©, which was seldom busy. The Westin is adjacent to the Whalers Village shopping plaza where the Hula Grill and Leilaniâ€™s were always packed with tourists and the menus were expensive â€¦ but great locations on the beach, so if that is your thing then go for it as many people seemed to eat at both places. There are some inexpensive options such as the nearby CJâ€™s CafÃ© (in the Fairway Shops section of Kaâ€™anapali â€“ serving breakfast, lunch and dinner at very local prices) and the Aloha Mixed Plate restaurant in nearby Lahaina. We unexpectedly came across LuLuâ€™s at the Lahaina Cannery Mall and got a 50% discount off everything on their menu (if you ordered between 5 and 6 PM). Excellent deal. One can also pick up breakfast at McDonalds in the Whalers Village food court. Would we stay at the Westin Maui again? As a family, only if we could book 2 adjoining rooms at a deeply discounted rate. For a couple, the standard room is fine. Loved Kaâ€™anapali because you are totally wrapped up in the beauty of the island, but would consider trying some of the other hotels and timeshare resorts available there.

Reviews.Title: “Never Been so relaxed”
Reviews.Author: dsecord
Reviews.Content: When we first got there, they told us our room was next to the elevator and we would be switched (if we so choose) the next night to a better room. We couldn't even hear the elevator but decided to change room anyways. They put us on the top floor over-looking the beach, which was incredible. The resort was large but you wouldn't know it has 900 rooms. Pool area can be crowded, but there's a beach with white sand 50 steps away! Location couldn't be better; next to whalers village and Hula grill. If you're wanting to see Whales, and want to go snorkeling, I suggest just go on a snorkeling trip. We saw more Whales on our snorkeling trip then our Whale excursion. Every time we went under water while snorkeling, we could hear the Whales! Black rock is right down the beach, and one of the best places to snorkel. If you want some waves, go to DT Flemming beach (North about 5 - 10 miles). Another good snorkeling place is Ahihi bay, which has an underwater preserve. That is located near Grand Wailea (South of resort). The Westin has a great staff that can tell you where all the locations are, plus set up trips for you. That makes life even more relaxing, you just show up. You'll pay good money for everything you do, so budget before hand, or it can get out of control. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Pool Area But otherwise Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DReese
Reviews.Content: Families come here to dump their children on the hotel staff to babysit. I landed in the hospital after being hit in the with a nerf football while laying poolside in my lounge. The hotel does nothing to control the routiness. The guests bring their anger, egos and hateful attitudes with them to this paradise. Their ever so happy to dump on the other guests and staff. People move around this hotel every year in wheelchairs and crutches. I have had many conversations with management here to limit the ball throwing and rough pool behavior. It's not safe for small children are anyone smaller than a NFL quarterback. SO BEWARE!!! The hotel and staff are very friendly and helpful it's a beautiful place. If you can stay away from the pool area. The massage people are resort quality. If you know what I Mean? We go every year with a large group at Christmas. So we tolerate a lot to see our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for North West coast of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Pippo3000
Reviews.Content: Yes, Ka'anapelli might not be the most sophisticated region on Maui - high rise hotels like beads on a chain - but we enjoyed the Westin. We got an upgrade, first from partial ocean view in the old building to partial ocean view in the newer building with bigger rooms and then eventually another upgrade in the Beach Tower building to the eighth floor after I complained that the first upgrade is just above the Ono Restaurant. They wanted to charge me for the second upgrade 50 USD per night but in the end 'forgot' to charge me. Nice. Rooms in the new building are indeed rather big and can accomodate two cribs and we had a wonderful view. Breakfast was included. Nice, too. Beach is not very deep but nice. Pools were cool and they had no keiki pool so we went there once with our kids and then stayed rather at the beach. Booked the sunchair/umbrella package for 25 USD one day but not worthwile with kids since you keep building sand castles the whole day anyway. Again, in total a good choice but (of course) by far not as good as the Four Seasons we stayed in the second half of our trip, see my other review.

Reviews.Title: “Would not change a thing....”
Reviews.Author: Easton_PAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip at the Westin Maui from 3/8/09-3/15/09. I was traveling with a group of 14 people for my sister's wedding. I had my husband and three year old son with me . I would like to address some of the issues previous reviewers had stated. Let me just start by saying what an incredible deal we got on our room...$200 dollars per night through Orbitz. We stayed in room 1120 in the beach tower....the older tower. The arrival at the hotel was breathtaking when you see the beautiful lobby with all of the fish and birds. It makes you feel like you are in a tropical paradise. My son instantly wanted to feed the fish. Our check-in was smooth and then we went to our room. Our room was next to the elevator and overlooked the parking lot but was on the highest floor (11th) so we mostly saw the mountains and golf course. The room was just big enough for the three of us and turned out to be a very quite room. I never heard the room next door or the elevator...or anything else really. The beds were so comfortable and I am going to buy one of those heavenly shower heads. The room was also very clean and the cleaning lady was always ready to clean by 9:00a.m.. The lobby was a great meeting place for our group in the morning and to keep our son entertained. It was also a wonderful place to relax in the shade. The pool area always had a seat and the waitresses were extremely nice. There was never a problem getting towels either. The pool was clean but a bit cold. My son would not get into it until the third day because of the temperature. The pool temperature is fine once you get used to it . The drinks are pricey but there is usually a happy hour going on at one of the bars. I did not care muchfor the breakfast downstairs. My son always ate free because he was under five which made it convenient. We racked up about a $650 room bill upon check out. Some of that was the $25 resort fee and there was a lot of tropical monkeys from the bar. They are $10 dollars a piece but my husband became addicted to them. The parking spaces were small but there always was one available. Every staff member we encountered was nice and I definitely did not get the impression that the hotel had a "Disney" like feel to it. It was just a relaxing and pleasant resort that gave my family a lot of wonderful memories. I would try the resort for yourself if you can get a good deal and I think you will be just as happy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and pools tropical, rooms are ok”
Reviews.Author: StPattyMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Westin in Maui after 2 nights in Oahu and before 6 nights in Kauai. We were trying to decide between the Westin and the Hyatt (never got to see the Hyatt so not sure which one was nicer). The weather wasn't great but better than once we got to Kauai. It was very windy but most of our days we had sunshine and it was in the high 70s so even with the wind we got to spend some time at the pool. A bit too windy for the beach. We liked the lobby when you arrive as they have a lagoon with pretty waterfalls and flamingos. We were greeted with a shell lei. The package we chose on Orbitz gave us an upgrade to a mountain view. It was actually a very pretty view and we were up high enough from the parking lot where we didn't hear much noise. There is also a $25/day resort fee which covers self parking (fills up at night but they valet your car for free if it is full), 2 bottles of water per day and silly things that have always normally been included in your rate like a safe and the fitness center. The water came in handy as you have a little frig. The rooms are small and tight but fine. The beds were comfy. The shower itself seems a little dingy. I definitely didn't feel like I was staying in a room that costs $450/night. Luckily we had 2 nights for free with our orbitz package. The hallway, elevators and rooms didn't seem like they just had a renovation. Not sure what they renovated...The grounds were a different story. 5 pools including an adult only pool. 2 water slides, one for the kiddos and one for the adults. When you request pool towels and they put a wristband on you (a different color each day) - tacky! No ones checks your wristband except if you want to go down the water slide. If you want to use a chair on the beach, which I think should be included providing you are paying $25/day resort fee. That feels like nickeling and dimeing. Speaking of, they offered pilates and yoga but charged you I think $12/class which again with the resort fee thought something like this should be included. The grounds are very lush and tropical and fun pools. They have a couple waterfalls and cold "hot" tub in one of the caves. It's a little warmer than the pool but not a hot tub. They have a separate hot tub as well by the adult pool. We got breakfast included with our orbitz package and glad we did as the breakfast buffet is about $27/person. It's very good, with custom omelettes, scrambled eggs, french toast or pancakes, bacon, fruit, bagels and pastries. Includes coffee, tea and juice. I gained about 5 lbs from this vacation probably from these huge breakfasts! You could eat here at the Westin resort & spa the other Westin ocean resort villas, or sheraton. We only ate here and at the Sheraton of which the breakfast was great there too. To compare the Sheraton, the grounds were nice there too but not as nice as the westin. What the Sheraton has over the westin is the beach is much better. You can walk there from the Westin (10 minute or so walk) and snorkel although my husband is an avid scuba diver and said the snorkeling was not good at all there. He almost rented a tank, he was glad he checked it out snorkeling first. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants other than our included breakfast. Which you can sit at either of the restaurants including Tropica and have a nice ocean view while enjoying the same buffet. Most people don't know this, just go around to the ocean side where tropica is and get seated there. You won't have to wait in line either. While in Maui we did the Road to Hana, continued on after the road to Hana and went up the volcano in one day. It was an exhausting day. I would advise to break it up. A lot of the waterfalls were not that spectacular which I was surprised since it was winter time and their rainy season. We had the Maui Revealed book (which is a great book by the way) and tried to follow the stops on it. We missed many and one of the first water falls it tells you to stop at we didn't get to see since we did not feel like walking over dead animal carcasses that were probably most likely left there by the locals to keep tourists away from spots. Also you don't need a 4-wheel drive. We had a compact car and did just fine. Bring your bonine if you are prone to car sickness. Between all the curves and then the dirt road (after the road to Hana if you continue on) is very bumpy. Speaking of we rented a car from priceline and got a great deal of $12/day. People who hadn't rented cars couldn't even get one since they ran out. With the economy they have shipped out many of their cars to the mainland so better to have one secured before you leave. For the road to hana trip, we bought a styrofoam cooler and got some sandwiches at the Foodland Deli before we left our hotel area. It was nice to have a little picnic at Waianapanapa State Park. This is something to see. Once you get to Hana, you can either turn around and go back the same way you can or you can continue on. This is where we thought it was really beautiful sights of the coast but parts of the road are not paved and it is very narrow where only one car can fit through at a time but most cars are all driving from Hana. We felt it was well worth the continued drive. We then drove up the dormant volcano Haleakala which is 10,000 feet up. Boy you are high up there!! We actually drove above the clouds. It's very curvy of course driving up a volcano but it's nicely paved and plenty of room for 2 cars to get by. I'm sure on a clear day it would be quite an amazing sight. Bring a jacket it's a bit chilly. I have to say one of the best things we did was go to the magic show of Warren and Annabelle. It is an amazing show!!! And not cheesy or tacky either. We still can't figure out how Warren did the things he did. My husband and I were one of the chosen couples to help. There's no sawing a woman in half or anything like that. And it was quite neat to part of the show and not figure out how he did things when we were up so close. Not to be missed! Make sure you get your tickets ahead of time as they sell out. We went to the earlier show 5pm and it doesn't end until 9p. If you are not eating, you can show up a bit later. About an hour later and you can still get a drink or a dessert. For restaurants we went to Leilani's on the Beach, next to the Westin. We just ate downstairs which is a bit cheaper and more casual. It was good. Make sure you get the Hula Pie! It is to die for but you'll need to share. It's an oreo cookie crust with macadamia nut ice cream, hot fudge, whip cream. YUMMY! There's a chain of restaurants you can get this at. Like the Hula Grill too, same type of place next to Leilani's. Kimo's in Lahaina (just 10 minute drive south) is part of this chain. They have a lot of fish specials and they were very good. On the water as well. It was very good. I had ahi whenever I could which was often :) BJs restaurant has chicago pizza and it was very good. A bit of a cheaper dinner. The large pizza is huge and too much for the 2 of us. Across the street but up and has a view of the water but not the sunset as there is a big tree in the way at least in February there was. We also ate Pacific'o (a late lunch) and it's right on the beach. Again it was good. Got a mojito and it was VERY strong, too strong for me. Lastly we took a ride down to the Wailea area. Ate at Nick's Fishmarket at the Fairmont. VERY expensive. Entrees were mostly $40-50 if you wanted a salad it was another $14-18. It was good but not that good. The service is what they are known for but they are all on top of you when they seat you. You got one person getting your chair while another is putting the napkin on your lap and another is pouring water. And then they watch you. A bit uncomfortable. I like my service somewhere in between, not wondering where my wait person is but attentive. Fairmont grounds are nice but they aren't as lush and tropical. It's a little more "higher class' but we were looking for a fun pool and more tropical. It had a nice beach area but you couldn't walk as the other resorts and them blocked it off so it is private. I guess good that it's private but we like to walk the beaches. Also visited the grounds at the Four Seasons! And that is luxury! It's not super tropical nor does it have fun pools but it's NICE! I had booked a oceanside massage there. Which was pretty heavenly except for the weed whacking going on next door at another property. Plus construction. They made up for it by comping me since we had driven an hour down there which I thought was very nice of them. My husband golfed at the Makena Golf course down in wailea. It was very impressive and he was the only one on the course so he golfed by himself. He had planned to golf at Prince in Kauai (supposed to be the best in Kauai and some say the he best in Hawai) but we both went in the ocean and got knocked around pretty good by the waves. He landed on his shoulder and it never healed enough to play Prince :( Overall we had a great stay! Maui was our favorite island out of the 3 we visited - Oahu, kauai and Maui. We were surprised we were expecting Kauai to be but we had yucky weather in Kauai so we could have had a different view of Kauai had the weather been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller69
Reviews.Content: We had a week at the Westin Maui in the first week of March. Weather was very cold, wet and windy for the first few days, but improved a little as the week went on. We managed to score a room at the front of the Beach Tower, so we had a fantastic view looking over Kaanapali out to Lanai and Molokai. Watching the whales from our balcony was an awesome experience. So much so, that we didn't feel the need to actually go out on a boat. Room and bathroom were of very decent size and in reasonable condition (although not immaculate). We had a deal that included the breakfast buffet, which was nice, but if we had had to pay for it we certainly would have gone elsewhere - VERY expensive. Both weather and water were too cold for swimming, but the multiple pools looked great and there were some brave souls using them who seemed to be having fun. The location is great, being right next door to the Whalers Village - often ate at the Hula Grill or Leilani's. Need to get there quite early, otherwise it's a bit of a wait, but pretty reasonable prices and decent food. I know others have mentioned it, but I want to add my opinion about the compulsory resort fee they charge. OUTRAGEOUS! They claim it's for the gym, parking, etc - but shouldn't these be included in the cost of your room?!?! It's not like the Westin is some cheap flea-bitten dive - what's the point in offering 'extra' services if you're going to charge extra for them? To sum up, we got a good deal and felt we good good value (resort fee aside...) - not sure it's worth the rack rates they publish though...

Reviews.Title: “OK I guess ..... ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Nineham
Reviews.Content: Firstly I think we we're a little dissapointed mainly due to the weather. We travelled to Maui from the UK for ten days (not cheap as you can imagine). The weather whilst we we're there was poor. Very very high winds EVERY day, 30-40Mph consistently. The hotel itself is very very nice, and a lot of effort does appear to go in to keeping it that way. As usual with most hotels i've stayed at, our room did not look anything like the rooms on the Westin Maui website. It was also a lot smaller than we had expected. We had requested one king be but got two double beds (these beds really and honestly we're like two large single beds). We complained but due to the hotel being full we were not changed. It is worth bearing in mind that this is a very large hotel. We mistakenly thought it would be relativley quiet given the economic crisis and sort of out of season time. We we're very wrong. Hotel was full, people everywhere!!! A place by the pool?? NO CHANCE. Due to the high winds we had being on the beach was not much of an option either, sandblasted. The beach at the Westin is nice. A lot of people say its spectacular but I would say its far from that. If your expecting blue waters and the same beaches as you would find in say the Bahamas or Grand Cayman.... forget it. Food at the hotel is very pricey. Cost of the breakfast buffet is daylight robbery. 2 X Buffet and an ONE orange juice each $65. We had a room bill at the end of the week of over a thousand dollars. One other point, the Westin charges this daily resort fee. $25. It covers things like parking, gym, internet and some other stuff that really is worthless. The daily resort fee does irritate me at hotels as its simply another revenue earner for them. And for people which only come to relax and dont use whats included are penalized. Upon check-out, I complained I was not happy about the charge as we had used absolutly nothing that was included and the duty manager cancelled five days of charges so that was a result and good service from the Westin. Overall it is unlikely we will return to Maui at all. Far nicer places to go for the same or less cost and much much better beaches elswhere also.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This property is, simply put, ordinary. Nothing really distinguishes it from the other mega-resorts lining Kaanapali Beach. The rooms a decently sized, though there is no design feature that makes them stand out in any way. If you didn't look out of your window, you could be in Des Moines. The room felt relatively clean, but certainly not spotless. The pool area is sprawling, but even given its apparent size and the fact that Hawaii is allegedly suffering from a significant downturn in tourism, it could be hard to find open loungers if you didn't arrive early. Part of this must be due to the fact that there are no loungers on the beach, unless, of course, you want to pay extra money. As other reviewers have written, the pool is cold. In fact, we swam in the ocean rather than take a dip in the pool. The beach is nice, though it is a little narrow in the area in front of the Westin. Down by Black Rock and the Sheraton, the beach is much wider and the water calmer. As an aside, the Sheraton was more spread out and imparted a feeling of spaciousness as compared to the Westin, which tries to fit a lot of stuff into a smaller space. The service was fine, nothing special and nothing outrageously bad either. Housekeeping was prompt, which is commendable given the size of this resort, and the front desk was competent enough. The valets handed their job with aplomb. As for parking, the self-parking section of the lot filled up every evening before we returned from dinner, so we received "complimentary" valet (you still have to tip and you are paying a $25 resort fee). The gym was the cleanest and, in my opinion, the nicest part of the hotel. Spacious, immaculate and stocked with new cardio and weight equipment, it had much to recommend it. Overall, this property is fine--we used cash and points so I can't complain about value--but there is absolutely no way I would ever pay full price here. I can't imagine many people do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort if you get a deal.. Good service, comfy beds, but very cold pool!”
Reviews.Author: aspalek
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 nights last week, 2 adults,and 1 child age 9. We like Kaanapali because there is a lot to do with kids. I had always wanted to stay at the Westin because of its great location. Whaler's Village, which is a cute small open air shopping area is right next door. My son loves the Whaling Museum. Also, if you want to do a whale watch trip, they leave right from there, so it's very convenient. From previous reviews, we were prepared for the tiny rooms in the Beach Tower, and the lack of closets. But the armoire worked out fine to hang our few things that needed hanging. There was enough storage space. The non-ocean views from the upper floors were very nice - of the mountains and the other hotels. I wish the lanais had been bigger, they were very tiny. The room had a nice flat screen TV. Heavenly beds were very comfy. I had also hoped for a nicer bathroom; it was quite low-ceilinged and tiny with no ventilation fan. It was great to have a refrigerator. Our room service and other room requests came promptly, no long waits though it is a very large hotel. We also had a convention there for part of our stay; they mobbed the buffet breakfast but were otherwise not bothersome. I wished that the hot tub was not up on the upper, adult-only level. We like to go in as a family, and i noticed that down the way at the Hyatt there were no such restrictions. Others may prefer a no-kid hot tub. The kids club was very nice (Much nicer than the Hyatt's) My 9 yr old son went there one morning and would have liked to go back. Others said the pool was freezing and i agree. We moved to the Westin from another property where the pool was quite warm, and really found it difficult to tolerate. Our stay was in February, so it wasn't super hot, and a warmer pool would have been more pleasant. I had thought that my son would be on the slide all day, but I think the water was too cold for him to enjoy it. It is very easy to sit on your beach chair at the Westin and do nothing all day. The service around the pool was very good, the food and drinks were tasty, if expensive (no surprise). I'd recommend the Westin, but only if you get a good deal. (And good deals are to be had these days in Hawaii..!)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I guess”
Reviews.Author: Cassarole
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several other places and several other islands in Hawaii and this one wasn't the worst, but it was definitely not the best either. The "resort" is very small and in a very crowded area with limited beach space and the pool area is very small, especially compared to other resorts in the area. The breakfast you can get in the morning is ok, and the restaurants in the area are pretty good as well. The small shopping area a little ways down is nice too and it was interesting to walk up and down the beach and look at the other hotels. I met some really great people as well, but none of them were staying at the Westin, which maybe should have been a sign. Over all, the beach is great and the hotel it's not bad, but it's pretty boring. There are way better places you can stay than here and next time we are in Maui we'll be in staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PharmDtravelerfromGA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Westin Maui. It was wonderful. We reserved an ocean view room and it was gorgeous. We stayed in the Ocean Tower. The view was spectacular. We overlooked the pools and the beach. The pools were the best in the area. They have one pool that is just for adults. The pool area has two waterslides and several waterfalls. Many happy hour opportunities. Although, I will agree with other reviewers that the room was slightly small, but the only time we were in the room was to sleep, so no big deal. We ate at their restaurant, Tropica, and I don't recommend it. I felt like for the price, we got much better quality at other restaurants during the week. Their restaurant, OnO, was fine for lunch. We ate their twice. Expect resort prices when it comes to food, but if you're going to complain about the prices, you probably shouldn't be staying at such a high end hotel to begin with. I do recommend the two restaurants next door, Hula Grill and Leilani's. We ate lunch at both and dinner at Leilani's. Lunch was good and dinner was excellent. I also recommend their sister restaurant, Kimo's in Lahaina. We ate their twice it was so good. Don't buy anything in the gift shop. Walk next door to the Whaler's Village and stop in at the ABC store. They have everything you would need from alcohol to snacks to sunscreen. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: dzop
Reviews.Content: The pluses: (1) Kaanapali is a great beach- low, rolling surf, soft sand, great snorkeling (2) The rooms are newly renovated, clean and nice, if a little small. (3) The views from most rooms are nice, whether of the ocean or of the mountains (4) The gym was, by all accounts, lovely The minuses: (1) The hotel doesn't feel special at all- it just feels like an ordinary chain hotel. If I'd had my honeymoon here, I would have been crushed- there's just not a whit of luxury to the place (2) It's huge and often hosts conventions. We ended up there at the same time as a huge agricultural convention. Whole lot of farmers there in full conference work-mode. Wasn't exactly relaxing or romantic. (3) Kaanapali Beach is very built up. Think Florida. It doesn't feel exotic. (4) NO I AM NOT INTERESTED IN YOUR TIMESHARES PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD STOP TRYING TO SELL ME THEM. (5) The hotel....how to put this charitably....doesn't exactly attract a classy crowd. A whole lot of slightly overweight, slightly uninteresting midwesterners. Almost everyone was either there for a conference or on points. If you're an "young urban professional", you're going to feel very out of place. (6) The spa wasn't so great. (7) The pool is huge (plus) but not relative to the size of the hotel (700+ rooms!). Poolside space was at a premium when the hotel was near capacity. Note: DO NOT RENT A BIG CAR IF YOU ARE STAYING HERE. The parking spots in the self-park lot are miniscule, a tight fit even for the "compact" class car that we rented.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui-4 star thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Welltraveled38
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westi Maui b/c we knew we could count on the comfortable heavenly bed. The bed was indeed comfortable. The walls, however, were thin. I could hear the people next door through the door connection. The front desk attempted to accommodate a room change, but it was just unsure if the second room would be just as loud and we would loose the full ocean view we paid for. The pools are great-but really, who goes to HI for the pool? The snorkeling in front of the Sheraton at Black Rock is excellent. Some days it is just above average-but we definitely walked the 1/2 mile down the beach everyday to plant ourselves in front of the Sheraton for snorkeling. Watching the cliff divers here was fun too. They also had some good live music from their pool. We dined in Lahina-we know some locals and went directly to their recommended restaurants. I would return to Mala (overlooking the pier). If you visit Wailea shops be sure to eat at Tommy Bahamas cafe-good food, reasonable price, and good service. The shops are right next door to the Westin Maui and basically similar (without the very high end ones-Tiffany,Fendi etc) to the Wailea shops. Two free bottles of water a day, starbucks hot chocolate, coffee in room. $25 resort fee charged for each day of stay. Free self parking. Nice spaces, flamingos in open air lobby. Food is expensive, but is all over the island especially the resorts. Just didn't feel like paying $30 for a breakfast buffet with no view. I don't think I'd stay here again b/c the noise level when I was sleeping was disturbing-even the water features at the pool were loud and drowned out the sounds of the waves. However, the hotel room was comfortable, clean and nice. Just pray the people next door do not snore-luckily our neighbors did not!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Hoyamd
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at the Westin Maui with my wife in January '09. The hotel grounds and pools were the highlight of the hotel. We had an ocean view room but the mountain view rooms were also great and would not have been disappointed with either. We had many whale sightings from our balcony. The room was on the smaller side but for two, we did not feel cramped. The service at the pool was also great but pricey. We did not find anything enticing at the hotel's other resturants. They offer a free shuttle service to downtown Lahania but we rented a car for two days to go on the Hana road. The hotel is next to the whaler village where we ate a few times. The hotel is located on a beach with about 8-10 other hotels but it is never felt rushed. The beach in front of the hotel was usually calm despite the locals reporting that the water was cold, it was still very pleasant to swim. There is snorlking on rockey end of the beach next to the Sheraton.. The hotel seems to attract a lot of families so it may not be the ideal place if you need complete isolation although one of the pools was designated as adult only and was fairly calm. You should try to the one of the whale watching tours (We went on Triology and they come right to the hotel's beach).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Standard Westin without a Standard Location”
Reviews.Author: Grinadam
Reviews.Content: First off, I didn't pay much at all for my room. I scored a deal with a best rate guarantee and paid $135 a night. When they upgraded me to a 6th floor ocean view room with balcony i really couldn't complain. All the rooms have balconies and the rooms are very nice standard westin fare. The shower tubs are small and fine. The pool is nice and was for the most part not crowded when I was there (although on saturday it was jam packed). The beach was much less crowded - although there are much nicer beaches on maui- just up the way just north and south of the sheraton there is a much nicer stretch of beach. Also I would say that big beach down on the southern tip is spectacular and worth the drive. I was very happy with my stay at the westin. I wouldn't pay extra for the valet parking and while the economy is still down I would keep an eye on great deals. If I paid full price I might have more gripes, but I doubt it. Also the spa is very nice and the staff all around is very professional. Westin still does it right.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: Linda122
Reviews.Content: firstof all this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Not only was the staff professional and accommodating the hotel itself is absolutely beautiful and I couldn't have asked for more or should I say it was more than I had expected. The rooms were very clean and up to date and even though I thought the food was expensive it was good..The beach is to die for..Just perfect.! The open air lobby with the lagoon type scenary in front of it was so pretty. If you have complaints on this hotel you obviously expect too much..I for instance like the higher end hotels and this one fit right in.The had someone pick us up at the airport(the small one).It was a beautiful drive there. The pool was very crowded and people put towels on the chairs and then leave but the staff takes care of that by putting a paper on it with a time stamp as to when they found it vacant and after so long they move the people's stuff and allow other people to sit. There was the little village next door with all kinds of shops(expensive and inexpensive) a food court and a convenient store like place that came in handy and restaurants too I usually like to stay at a different hotel when i return to a place but this is one hotel that I plan on staying at when (and I will) return to Maui.. Just try to book far in advance and get a good rate because I didn't and the price was a little high but well worth it. Rest assured if you choose this hotel you will NOT be disappointed..

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui, Another great Maui vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: morlannet
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this year when we went to Maui...our favorite Island... The beach at Kaanapali is the bomb!, we decided to try a different hotel. This was hard because we fell in love with the Hyatt located just down the beach. The Westin Maui Resort is so similiar to the Hyatt it is hard to say which one is the best, they are so similiar. If you are deciding which one to go to I would have to say, if you have younger kids, 5 years to 7, the Hyatt is better just because they have a small kids beach/pool and slide which allows less worry. The Westin and Hyatts pools are really similiar, but I think the Hyatt has more tropical feel, but the Westin has more room around the pool area and has a better & bigger beach area. The drinks at the Westin aren't what they should be, lack size and flavor, but are still worth the money. Pina Coladas at the Hyatt are better! The breakfast buffet at the Westin is excellent and the hotel is really close to Whalers village which is great at night, you can just stroll over to one of the restaurants next door for dinner. The staff at this hotel are really nice and offer great service. The grounds are awesome here! If you are looking for a Laua,look no further, the Luau here at the Westin is one of the best. The fire show at the end is AWESOME!!! I recommend the surf school located near the Marriot down the beach. They were excellent with my older 11 year old son, I felt he was safe at all times and within walking distance from the hotel. The instructors are local Maui surfers and nice as could be. Again if you are looking for a local place to get some good breakfast, cheaper from the hotel, go to Java Jazz. Just a short drive north of the hotel located in a little shopping center. Awesome music while you have breakfast, enjoy their excellent specialty coffees or a bloody mary. If you get the pancakes, BEWARE!!, they are huge. Share! My last review of the Hyatt, I think I might have mentioned that we did not get a lei greeting or even a Aloha when we arrived, well, not the case at the Westin. We arrived and right away received a lei for a women, and the boys and I received one for guys. The greeter even told us the story behind lei's and gave us a Aloha to the island and resort. Great way to start our stay. If you are thinking of staying here, I highly recommend it, but still stay true to my other review and hope you can enjoy the Hyatt as well, they are both great Hotels on the most awesome beach in Hawaii located in Kaanapali. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: aaronr
Reviews.Content: Just got back this morning. We loved the Westin. Service was stellar, everyone was so nice and helpful. I'm a Starwood Platinum so my stay was with cash and points at 1000 Starpoints and $90.00/night which was a great value. Yes they charge $25.00 a day resort fee, but there is great high speed internet everywhere, parking is free, bottled water is free, and you can take as many towels as you need, even off property. Room was updated with flat screen tv and Starbucks (room #470 in the beach tower). Highly recommended, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing.....”
Reviews.Author: fredandterry0
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at this hotel and found it to be a little disappointing for a Westin. Pro's - Nice room layout, great to have a small fridge, LOCATION was great and convienient. Con's - Room was over the parking lot which was noisy at times and we couldn't really sit out due to the smell of fuel from cars. Our room was never cleaned till around 4PM each day and it seemed that it was an afterthought because it was never dusted, never vaccumed and the tub seemed dirty. As for the 25$ resort service charge, we were supposed to get 2 bottles of water in our room each day. Well on 4 occasions we were not given any and I had to call and have housekeeping bring it up. When they did the guy stood there and expected a tip for what I have already paid for. As for soap they would not replenish it on a frequent basis, at times were were left with a small piece that we needed to use at the sink and then in our shower.
