So I complained and was given a little attitude at the front desk. Watch your bill as they do not ask for your room # and Name when you order drinks or food by the pool. We were charged extra for food we never had. There is a coffee shop in the lobby that charges more than double of what you would normally pay for a cup of coffee elsewhere so we went to Whalers village and there is a great little coffee shop there and the price is much more reasonalble. The pool area is great but the Adult pool area is small and fills up quite fast each morning with people reserving chairs which we were told that they were not allowed to do so but no one enforced this policy. We asked the conceirge about the Sheraton's dining menu and they do not have them which I find extremely odd as they are sister hotels. They will have menu's of several other places but not their own??? We asked about the Prime Rib dinner that they were offering and they told us that we should go and no reservations are needed and that they have free valet service for hotel quests that ate at the restaurant otherwise it will be $5.. We went and had our car taken by Valet and then found out that we would have a 2 hour wait for a table. So we insisted that they honour our valet ticket and were given a little attitude. We ended up tipping to get our car back after 5 minutes. Well needless to say we were a little disappointed and we plan to return to Maui again next year but it will not be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: njlibrarian27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for six nights in Jan for our honeymoon - we found a great deal online that we couldn't pass up, but after staying there, we wished we would have shelled out a little more money for a nicer, quieter location. On the good side, the staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, the pools/beach were beautiful and not as crowded as I expected, and the hotel is right next to Whaler's Village, which has restaurants (Hula Grill is really simple and good) and shops (ABC store is like a general store - we went there a lot for water, medicine, postcards, etc). We also got upgraded from our garden view to a partial ocean view, which was nice of the hotel. Additionally, I came down with bronchitis when we first arrived and the concierge recommended a great walk-in place called Doctors on Call - they are at the Hyatt. It saved my trip! However, if you are looking for a quiet, tranquil retreat, this is not the place! We had a lot of noise issues, and while I admit I am sensitive about some of that stuff, the drilling at 9 in the morning from the floor above (drape installation) was totally annoying. Management took care of it eventually, but who even wants to have to call and complain about stuff on their vacation? Anyway, if you hate noise and/or go to bed early like us (we were still on east coast time), you might want to give up the view and stay in a room away from the pool and restaurant areas (music goes until 9, sometimes 10 pm) or stay somewhere else. Overall, I wasn't blown away by the place - it did sort of feel like a cruise or Disneyworld-ish at times as opposed to a serene, tropical getaway - I am sure for a lot of people that is not a problem at all - people with kids will have fun - but a couple looking for a quiet, romantic trip might not feel the same way. If you are that kind of couple, try the Hyatt or maybe one of the places in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy our time at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: cdn-family-of-three
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from January 4-7. We arrived at 11 am, expecting to wait by the pool for our room to be ready-in fact our lovely ocean view room on the 8th floor was ready, so we went right up. A short time later someone came to the door with a small birthday cake for me, as I had mentioned to the woman front desk that I was celebrating my 40th birthday! My daughter was so excited! We spent the next few days by the pool, receiving excellent service all day long from the hard working and very friendly servers. The poolside food service is excellent, and we even had the server ask the kitchen staff how to make the delicious coconut ranch dressing, which she did right away. The only disappointment we had this year was at Ono Restaurant. Both the food and service was way down from the same time last year, and as well, I am pretty sure they lowered the "children eat free" age to 5 from maybe ten. Last year our 7 year old ate free and this year we were expecting the same deal. Kids eat so little anyway, it just seems cheap to take that away. It is also very surprising that for such a large hotel there is only one (ADULTS ONLY) hot tub. In my opinion there should be at least one family hot tub at a hotel of this size and caliber. Regardless, we will likely stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Westin vs.Hyatt - A Comparison”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Maui for the Maui Invitational. In 2004 I had an oceanfront room at the Hyatt Regency and this time I had a mountain view room at the Westin. I must admit that on both trips I spent little time in my room - probably less than eight hours a day. There's just too much to do on the island to spend in the room. The Hyatt room was certainly bigger than the Westin and offered more room for luggage storage. Bath size was comparable but in different configuration with the Hyatt having a combo shower/toilet in one small room with the vanity/sink in another. The Westin had the traditional all-in-one. The Westin won points for its empty mini-fridge with complimentary bottled water, in-room safe, and double-headed shower. The bed was very comfortable and room nicely furnished. I did miss being able to leave sliding doors open so that I could listen to the ocean waves as I had at the Hyatt. The two things that won me over to the Westin were its location and its pool area. First, the Westin in right in the middle of Kaanapali Beach with the Hyatt on one end and the Sheraton/Black Rock on the other. Since I had activities on each end (parasailing and snorkeling) this was a central location. Then Whaler's Village adjoins the Westin and is so convenient for shopping and dining. On days by the pool and beach, I'd run over to Mickey D's or Nikki's (great Hawaiian pizza) in the Whaler Food Court and return to eat it poolside, certainly saving a few bucks over the more expensive hotel options. The Hula.Grill and Leilani"s By the Beach are great places to eat as the sun goes down and the ABC store is great for snacks and supplies without having to go to Lahaina. The Westin pool area was preferable to me as it has a separate adult pool area on a different and quieiter level than the general pool with kids. I had no problem finding a lounge chair to relax here. Since I was with a large group I had no issues with the front desk checking in or out. I did ask the concierge about processing film and she referred me to the Ritz Camera in Whaler's Village and Long's Drug in Lahaina. The Ritz Camera shop is no longer an option as it is now occupied by a T-shirt shop. No issues with housekeeping and kudos to the bar staff for great service on several occasions. Fortunately on both of my trips the hotels have not been overcrowded with tourists and the aloha spirit has prevailed. Both the Hyatt and Westin have equally attractive lobbies and common areas. But if I return in 2012, my preference overall is the Westin Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Front Desk and Service any Hotel Chain can have”
Reviews.Author: AlextheBeachBum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 8 yr old girl and 4 yr old boy stayed at this Westin from Dec 26th, 08 to Jan 2nd, 09. Upon check-in, the red-head gentleman at the front desk told me that we requested a room away from the elevator, but the room we were assigned to was exactly next to the elevator. He also told me that we would need to wait 45min - 1 hour if we want a room as requested. So...we waited for our room. Check-in time is written at 3 PM. We checked into the room at 5:15 PM. The same guy who checked us in also tried to tell us that our rate was alot higher that what we reserved the room for. We had to pull out the laptop on the spot and slapped the reservation page in his face before he agreed to change the rate to what our reservation records said. I find this to be the most disgusting tactic to rip off people who are there for a relaxing time. It is a know fact that Maui tourism dropped severely all of last year, and this must be the time for the hotel to reclaim their lost businesses. The hotel staff repeatedly said that Christmas break was a blessing for them as business filled up like the good old day, all the sudden. However, what the front desk tried to do was totally unprofessional. A few days into the vacation, we decided to order take-out lunch from O'no restaurant. The day before I ordered the take-out myself and it was fine, but the next day when my wife went to order the food, the host who took the ordered decided to charge my wife a 10 percent service fee. When asked why, the guy just simply shrugged his shoulder and said that they always do that. Another the dishonest act! Since our flight did not leave until midnight of the last day, we asked for late check out. They told us it would be $200 extra. We agreed to that, but at check out, the front desk person tried to charge us for an extra $25 resort fee for the late check-out portion in addition to the $25 resort fee we had already paid for that day!!! What the ? Watch out for your bill at the restaurant. They indicate that a child under 5 eats free with 1 paying adult. However 10 times out of 10 they would conveniently forget to deduct the child meal from the check!!! Too consistent to be called "mistakes". None of the jacuzzi had hot water. Enough is enough. I think the general manager of this hotel should rethink his/her customer service standard and ethics. All of the staff should be retrained or replaced if this hotel is to continue to try to deliver the customer service product that Westin pride itself upon. In a nut shell, we will never go back to this hotel. Afterall we do have other choices to pick in the Kaanapali area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Public areas beautiful, room and services disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelDocToronto
Reviews.Content: Following an all day Odyssey from distant Toronto, we arrived exhausted after midnight, finding no one to greet us at the door of this 5 star establishment. Hauling our own suitcases, we made our way to the front desk, where a sullen clerk checked us in efficiently, but without the slightest evidence of Hawaii's vaunted "aloha spirit." The lobby and public areas of the Westin Maui Resort are spectacular. Our room, by contrast, was disappointing and highly overpriced for its quality. It was small, and furnishings were comparable to those of a quality motel chain. Our 12th floor mountain view room was also the noisiest hotel room that we have ever endured -- not because of inconsiderate, partying guests, but because of an ill-fitting sliding balcony door that caused the wind to howl all night long! High speed LAN Internet cable was not functional, and the problem was not resolved during our stay. Slower speed wireless Internet did work most of the time, but the slow speed adversely affected our ability to conduct business during our stay. During the Christmas holidays the hotel's swimming pools were crowded beyond capacity. Every deck chair was claimed before 8 AM. Same problem with an inadequate supply of rental chairs on the beach. Yes, they had to be rented (when available), unlike the abundant, free chairs that we take for granted at good Mexican and Caribbean resorts. Food selection and quality was adequate, but overpriced. $4.50 should buy more than a half-full glass of luke warm pineapple juice in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: mdelrosario
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few Westin's and this one is not comparable. The rooms are so small, not at all enough room for 2 adults and 2 kids. The food and drinks are so over priced it forces you to eat elsewhere which is a pain. On the plus side, we didn't have any problems getting chairs by the pool at any time. The service is really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, amazing people”
Reviews.Author: MT2237
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 9 days and it was wonderful. We were supposed to be married in San Diego, we went through everything with a wedding coordinator at the Hilton Mission Bay. They were going to truck in sand, the beach was gross and it smelled bad. All I wanted was to get married in the sand with no shoes and the ocean as a back drop. My now husband and I sat down at the cafe to discuss the plans and I asked him what he thought. His response was "you don't want to know". I did want to know. He said" Let's go to Hawaii and get married". We arrived in Maui on the following Wednesday and were supposed to be married on the beach in Kihei on Friday. Due to weather it didn't happen until Sunday. The hotel staff was amazing in twice preparing our clothing. (We got dressed went over to Kihei and had to come back on Friday). The room was small but they did upgrade, at no charge, to a bigger ocean view. There were no suites available as we had virtually no planning in the trip. It was the best decision ever. The fresh fruit, flowers and champagne in room were excellent. The staff must have all gotten "the memo" because everyone was congratulating us through out the week. The proximity to Whalers Village was great. Walking distance to shopping. I would absolutely recommend walking next door The Hula Grill, say hello to Warren and have the ceviche! It is out of this world! The adult pool is a must, clean and relaxing. No noise. The grounds were well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin....It was fine....not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: TheBullBoston
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two weeks here at the Westin Resort & Spa on Ka'anapali Beach in Maui and found the hotel to be a typical Westin in all respects. Here are the good and bad in my opinion. Location is excellent. Probably the nicest stretch of Ka'anapali Beach. Some would say the Sheraton which is at one end of the Boardwalk but the Westin in in the middle. It's also directly next to the Whalers Village Shopping area so its convenient to walk around. The Boardwalk that runs along Ka'anapali beach connects all the hotel resorts so its a beautiful walk to do. My room was very nice. It was in the Beach Tower Rm 583 and was newly redone with a flat screen tv and nice bed and balcony. Maid service was ok not great. Cleaned daily but they didn't always provide lotion which is important to me after being in the sun all day. Mini fridges in the room makes it nice because you can grab a burger at the McD's in Whalers Village or food at the Safeway down the street and not pay hotel restaurant prices. The pools are very nice albeit crowded at times. The first week that I was there (mid dec) the hotel was empty and the pools/beach were perfect. The Xmas week the families and kids arrived and it was impossible to get a seat at the pool. That's not the Westins fault but warrants mentioning. Also, Leilani's Restaurant next door was being renovated (its open tho) and noise from the construction was directly under my balcony. Again, not the Westins fault. Golf courses are nice Kai and Royal albeit expensive. There are better courses to play on Maui for the money. Go to Wailea/Makena. The $25/day mandatory resort fee is a bit much to swallow. It gets you unlimited internet, use of the gym, two bottles of water daily, and free parking at the resort. I don't have a problem with them charging this, but I would just factor it into the room price beforehand. Ends up being cheesy at checkout to get another bill. Also, because I reserved this vacation package thru USAirways, I didn't get Starwood Points for this stay. Again, seems cheesy but this is why its not a 5 star place. Service. I also didn't get a lei greeting upon arrival or even see one. With all this said, its a typical Westin. Nice place. Efficient. Friendly. Clean. But it's not the Four Seasons or The Ritz. Service isn't up to that standard but then again, you aren't paying it either. As long as you realize this, it's a nice place, in a great location. Would I return, yeah probably for the right price. It looked just as nice as the Sheraton or Hyatt and the Hyatt was much more expensive. Feel free to right me if you have any specific questions on the Westin or Ka'anapali Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you book an "ocean view" room”
Reviews.Author: jp2903
Reviews.Content: We booked an "ocean view" room over ten months ago and were immediately charged over $3000. For our timeliness and the use of our money here is how the hotel treated us: We went to our "ocean view" room, looked out the window and saw an ugly high rise building on the opposite side of the Whaler's Village. Contacted the front desk and was told with a straight face to walk out on the balcony and look to the left. There is the ocean view. We recently stayed at the Moana Surfrider (also a Westin) and one of our rooms had roughly the same situation. We could see a sliver of ocean from the balcony. This was appropriately called a "partial view." We are paying over $700/night for our room. If you are willing to spend this kind of money do yourself a favor and go to a real luxury hotel and not a luxury "wannabe" with a fraudulent "ocean view" policy. I would also like to add that we are Starwood Platinum members. I believe this is the highest loyalty level for Starwood. If we have been treated this shabbily by the hotel (and remember this is not a last minute reservation) then consider how they will treat you. You have better options.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to move in!!”
Reviews.Author: perfumjnky
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Westin! We booked via Hotwire so we also got a screaming deal but the lobby area is beautiful, our room was comfortable, loved the pool! We also had a nice small refrigerator that we could store milk and bottles of wine so we didn't have to eat out for breakfast every morning and still had room for a chilled wine for night. Loved it, would definitely stay there again. They had fresh orchid Leis everytime you came back to the hotel and champagne for us on our first night.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: amv73
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and looking at many travelor pictures we decided to stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa however we wound up being somewhat disappointed. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a front desk employee who was anything but friendly. After informing us that there were no king rooms available with the full ocean view that we had booked we decided to take a room with two double beds rather than skimp on the view. The room was very small with the two beds in it and seemed like it hadn't been used in a while as everything was covered in dust. There was no complimentary champagne that we had heard so much about and the room wasn't even ready for guests i.e. no shampoo and soap, dirty, etc. The bathroom was small and could have been cleaner. Throughout our stay houskeeping left much to be desired. The bed always seemed rumpled and thrown together and the bathroom never seemed quite clean. The view from our lanai, however, was beautiful and we spent many evenings enjoying a drink there. Although the grounds and waterfalls were beautiful, we found them to be a bit noisy - completely drowning out the sound of the ocean. The pool areas were nice and always kept up. However, as mentioned in an earlier post, the hot tub was always full of kids and when we did finally venture in it, it was scalding hot. As with all resorts, the bars and restaurants were very pricey but we ventured down to Front Street for dinner most of the time. The food court at Whalers Village made for a cheaper alternative for breakfast and lunch. When inquiring about a late check out we were informed that the latest we could stay without a charge was 2:00 p.m. and after that the charge would be $200. We took advantage of the additional couple of hours and checked out at 2. We found the public areas of the hotel (the lobby, pools, etc.) to be very nice, but the room definitely left something to be desired for a four star resort. Also, we didn't find the employees to be very accomodating even though for the entire week we were in Maui all we kept hearing about was how slow things were there which would make me think that customer service would be at a high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christineb2000
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with wonderful amenities and pools. The hotel is steps away from the beach. It is conveniently located adjacent to an upscale shopping center. This means you can go shopping while your loved one stays by the pool side or the beach. Most of the rooms have a phenomenal view of the ocean. Christine Baranda

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: VancouverEnglish
Reviews.Content: We are a newly married couple ( 2 1/2 years) in our late 30's yearly 40's and very young at heart. We like to party a little but enjoy the relaxing part of life too. We went to Waikiki at the end of march of 08 and wanted to try somewhere different so we picked Maui. In march we stayed in a condo so this time we wanted to stay at a resort and WOW was this one nice. We arrived around noon and of course our room was not ready but they upgraded us to a full ocean view. We went to the casual restaurant/bar for lunch and realized that all resort amenites are over priced. We are not cheap people and i like to enjoy and shop and spend money like anyone else. I just have a hard time being over charged for anything . I understand the resort has to make money and they have a lot of things to pay for but 24 dollars for 2 double drinks is crazy !!!! Anyhow we have lunch and a few drinks and then go check into our room. Very nice and a great view. The room is not very big but good enough, you are not there that much but one thing i need is a good size bathroom and that it was not, way to small but still nice and clean. Very small fridge if you want to keep a few snacks to avoid being overcharged in the resort. So that same day we go back downstairs for a few more drinks and then decide to have a little nap and then go to dinner. Well needles to say after a few drinks and no sleep the night before because of the flight we we out cold . 1:30 am we wake up, slept over the alarm so we decide to get some room service, we were starving. The late night menu was very limited but oh well we are hungry and try to order. We then find out they have only one type of sandwich left that neither me or my husband like . There is nobody in the kitchen to make anything and we find out all the sandwiches are all pre made. We go back to sleep hungry and really upset. The next morning we go to the front desk to talk to the manager and they were very nice and gave us a free breakfast buffet, which is 30 dollars a person so that was nice of them. We then decide to go to Safeway to pick up a few things and find the cab ride 2 miles down the rode was over 30 dollars there and back so needless to say we go and rent a car for the week. You really need a car in maui to go anywhere. There is the little whalers village right beside the hotel and a few places to eat but you can not eat there the whole time. So now we are set , got the car and got some snacks up in the room. The resort is very nice and clean, the lobby is very beautiful and the pools are very nice. They have an adult only pool so that's were we hung out. The tropica restaurant was ok, didn't find lots on the menu and again over priced. All of maui is very priced. We travel a fair bit , go away twice a year and now that we have been to Hawaii twice i don't think we will go back for awhile. It is so pretty there but we way over spent. You can't go running up to your room all the time to eat and drink. I love eating out and sitting at the bar for a few drinks but man i don't like paying threw the nose for it. We work hard and do have to save for our holidays and we will be paying this one off for awhile. Front st. is not very far , 5 min drive and there is lots of pubs/ restaurants and little souvenir shops. We hung out there alot. We went to the laHina grill for a fab dinner. We went to a few malls as well, shopping is not very good in maui, either channel or real cheap stuff. We also did the road to hana. Its crazy curvy and if you get car sick easy don't go . It was a very pretty dive but you don't need to go all the way . We went about 3/4 of the way and that was enough. Leave early if you want to go , you don't want to drive that road at night. The botanical gardens are really nice and they have really beautiful parrots there too that you can get your picture with. We also went to mamas fish house, everyone says to go . Its was ok but i have never paid 16 dollars for a martini and 55 dollars for an entre!!!! Not worth it. Maui is a very quiet island, there really isn't much to do there at night unless you want to go driving all over and for us at night we like to have a few drinks and you obviously can't drink and drive. I wanted to maybe go dancing on a few nights but that's not going to happen. We were there for halloween and down on front st. is where everyone goes. Do take a cab that night. It was fun , so many people and lots of cool costumes. Black rock is a 5 min walk down the beach and you can snorkel there, we did and saw a few fish so that was cool. The beach at the hotel is very nice but be careful of the waves, they are strong and i got slammed once, hubby had to pull me up....lol We also had a couple message and that was very nice as well. good spa. Over all the trip was great and the resort was too. Maui is mellow and very expensive. Great merrories but i think for my hubby that can eat and drink a bit like all men we are going back to an all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “I would choose some place with less noise.”
Reviews.Author: golflife
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel ready and excited. I thought that being a Starwood Perfered member I would have recieved better service. But I was wrong about the service. The service at the restaurant for breakfast was less than perfect. For example, I waited about 20 minutes for the waiter to bring the bill for my meal. When I finally recieved the bill it was the wrong bill. But the food was good, not great but good. When I returned to my room after breakfast I notice that the room had been cleaned, at least on the surface. I looked in the bathroom and saw that the bathtub was still dirty and the bottles of shampoo had not been replaced, in fact the house keeping had spilled some shampoo in the tub. This happened several time during my one week stay. Some of the staff was quite helpful. But the front desk staff were not as helpful. I had to ask the front desk about three or four time to change rooms because of noise outside of the room. When I changed rooms the hotel said it would be a $200 charge to change rooms. If it location you are looking for the you have found your place to stay. The pools were not bad, but just not very clean. There were many time when I had to ask a pool staff to pickup empty glasses and plates. Many rules in the pool area were not enforced. For example, childern under the age of 16 are not allowed in the hot tub. I saw many young childern in the hot tub. The day I was leaving I ask about four time for a late check out. On the fourth time I finally recieved a answer. The hotel wanted to charge me $200 if I checked out after 2pm, it was not even a busy time for the hotel. So I had to leave the hotel early and stay four plus hours in the airport. Needless to say I would not stay in the hotel again, not even on a bet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkuchar
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at the Westin the first week of November and had a great time. Because we are Starwood Preferred Guests we were able to get a free upgrade to an ocean view room. The rooms are nicely appointed with plasma TVs and Heavenly beds. Our room was always cleaned promplty by housekeeping and we had no problems with bugs. The resort itself was beautiful. There are several waterfalls throughout as well as flamingos, parrots and fish. We hung out at the adult and non-adult pools and enjoyed both. We also went in the ocean one day and as long as you get past where the water breaks you can take out a raft and relax. If your looking for activities to do when on the island I would recommend the Road to Hana and the Old Lahania Luau.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vargas1
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and the location was beauitful. We went for our Honeymoon and stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. There was no sleep on the first night due to an elevator shaft in our room. The next morning we moved our room and each room thet showed us was smaller and smaller. At this point we ended up paying exxtra each night to be moved to a nice room with no elevator. At this point, I made a cup of coffe only to move the coffee pot and have about 8 roaches run out and scatter. We also had room service and the tray was INFESTED with ants. I called Housekeeping, but I really don't think they came to spray because there were bugs in the room for the rest of the trip. Other than those issues our trip was lovely and I think we would stay at the hotel again...just keep the bugs away from me please.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Pigacho
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a terrific resort in every respect. We travel extensively and our preference is between top end 'boutique' hotel/resorts and ones that our four year old enjoy as well as ourselves. We had our 4 year old with us this time and I couldn't rate it better for children. Note: The kids club only takes children from 5 upwards. Having said that, it also looked great for people travelling without children as there were two 'adult only' pools with cocktail bar and restaurants (both on the property and very close by) that people were having 'intimate' meals at. Pool/water area was without doubt the 'piece de la resistance'. Lagoon style that wound throught the property with lots of different pools - massive water slide that kept all happy (ourselves included!) water volleyball pool, quieter 'relaxing pool' and for the smaller ones a little water slide into a pool more suited for young children where they floated around with their blowup rings (bought from the poolside store) flying down their little slide and going under the little waterfall. Poolside service and food was great, the restaurants were good (the best hotel one we thought was the one on the beach) - breakfast has the best selection we have come across (though the positioning of the birdhouse in the middle of the breakfast restaurant was not a good idea as the birds are thieves!...). Good Spa and the gym is fine with all the usual machines - busy at times - avoid the 6.30 am start. Across the road is Golf and Tennis (too hot for us to do both but prob great in cooler season). The hotel is located on a white sand beach - you walk from the larger 'kids' pool onto the boardwalk of the beach where the hotel has loungers if you are more a beach type. It is approximately in the middle of the beach with 'Whalers Village' literally next door which has restaurants, cafes, grocery store and shops (including Louis Vuitton...). If you walk along the pretty boardwalk to the left and right there are other hotels with lots of easily accessible restaurants/cafes too. End of the beach on the right is the 'black rock' beach in front of the Sheraton which has nice snorkling (not SCUBA diving quality but great to see little fish). Note: the hotel snorkel rental was approx $15 for the day - if you're planning on snorkling a lot recommend you go to Snorkel Bob or one of the rentals in Lahaina as they are more like $15/20 for the week. Room at the Westin was lovely (bed and linen was great) with beautiful views onto the ocean - and we booked the cheaper type - I suspect we were lucky as the two or three (?) floors below us would have looked onto the foliage and waterfall - though that wouldn't have been so bad as the pink flamingoes were beautiful. Service was great. The only niggle was the resort charges which are compulsory at approx $US25 a day for free self parking, gym access and internet etc - I guess if you used none of those it would be annoying. You have to pay additionally for access to the sauna etc which is located IN the Spa which my partner was irritated by as he figured the daily charge should cover that. We rented a car - I wouldn't bother next time as the resort has a shuttle from the airport - I'm pretty sure there was a shuttle into Lahaina (if not it's certainly not far and there is a little 'bus' service outside the resort) and all the 'tour' type things will pick you up from the resort. If you feel an overwhelming urge to explore the island the resort can organise a car for you for a couple of days. Note: Maui is a windy island - which I'd forgotten. If you are planning a boat tour suggest you leave it until the day before to book as if the wind is 'up' your day out may turn into a rough one and the tours/dives are not always refundable if you choose not to go because of rough conditions. Overall we really enjoyed our stay - we weren't looking for a 'boutique' hotel this trip - this is definitely a larger hotel with all amenities but it is done very stylishly, excellent amenities and service and I would definitely recommend it. We had breakfast at the Sheraton which is part of the same group so you can do 'chargebacks' and the quality of the hotel was not nearly as high as the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “It is not the Westin used to be”
Reviews.Author: hanaSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed this hotel about 17 years ago. It was The hotel you wanted to stay.But this time, it just did not meet our "The Westin standard". We stayed 5 nights this time. We like Westin hotels, and stayed NY, Atlanta, Tokyo, Whistler(Canada), Long Beach& SF (CA), and other places, so I think we know some good things about the Westin hotels. The hotel need major renovation. It shows ages inside of elevator, hallway, and bathroom. It even look "cheap" because grass cloth wallpaper was painted. If you stay at this hotel, DO NOT rent SUV. Parking spaces are so small and tight. You will have difficult time to find a spot, and if you are lucky enought, it is difficult to open the doors of SUV. In fact The concierges adviced us to ask the vallet desk to park the car if we cannot find a parking space. This is terrible, you have to drive around the parking area wishing you can find a space. Maid service was not sufficient. Our room was not cleaned after 3pm three times during our stay. Sometimes, glasses has lipstick marks on. I was not sure they just wash glasses at the sink in the room or change used ones. Used towel was left in the bathroom a couple of times.Our robes never hung up. "Do not disturb" tag was missing when we checked in, so we used in-room order tag with hand written "Do not disturb". The 3rd day, we finally got the tag. The front agents are ... some are friendly, some are not. The concierge are friendly and knowledgeable. Hope our experience was exceptionally rare, and evryone have a good time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: WarrenShoe
Reviews.Content: Visitng Maui for the first time and celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary, we were looking for a quality resort that would take great care of us. We definitely found that experience at the Westin Maui. The grounds were beautiful; it was easy to access and relax at the beach or the pools; everyone we met on their staff was very friendly and very responsive. We didn't really dine there, but it was a great location to easily get to many of the fine restaurants we visited in Lahaina and Kapalua, as well as travel to and from the other areas and attractions on the island. Overall our experience with the Westin Maui was a real delight, and we will book it again when we return for our next visit to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Maui”
Reviews.Author: POE063
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had booked a partial ocean view room, from the 2nd - 6th October On arrival we were upgraded to a oceanfront which had a fantastic view of the ocean and all the pools. As this was our first time to Maui we spent a long time researching trip advisor and have come away very happy with our experience. There were no problems with getting seats at the pool, no matter what time of day we were able to get 3 seats quite easy. The cost of food is comparable to restaurants in the local area depending on what you want to eat. The only negative was the cost of breakfast hence we ate out, and with the location right next to Whalers Village there is plenty of choice. Restaurants to visit - definitley Plantation House is a must for breakfast sensational view and really well priced meal, only 10 minutes from the hotel. Bubba Gumps if your into shrimp... we were very disappointed in the Lahaina Fish Company very pricey and our fish was overcooked and dry.. Kimos in Lahaina is worth a visit as well. The hotel has a free shuttle several times a day into Lahaina so a rental isn't necessary... the only negative is the resort fee which we thought was excessive. Overall we were very happy with the Westin and would stay again in the future. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “What You Need to Know”
Reviews.Author: Deventer
Reviews.Content: We are in our late 40â€™s and have visited Maui many times having stayed at the Westin, Grand Wailea and Four Seasons. Given our stockpile of Starwood Points we returned to the Westin. Pros: Friendly staff, easy access to shopping, off property restaurants, short drives to Lahaina and Kapalua and a short walk to Black Rock and snorkeling. We saw turtles everyday and as many as (5) in one day in and around Black Rock. Note: Black Rock is a day excursion for the cruise ships that will port in Lahaina. When the ships are in Black Rock is a zoo. My advice â€“ go first thing in the morning. The best snorkeling is at Honolua Bay. Cons: Pool: Even in the off season the pool area can get crowded. The pool has a theme park feel. Yes there is an adult pool area but the area fills quickly. Be sure to mark your desired spot before 8:00 AM. The earlier the better. The best spots were taken by 7:00 AM. Also, some guests donâ€™t seem to understand Adult Only, to include the hot tub. To the Westins credit the staff was quick to remind parents that the area is Adult Only. Cabana Reservations: If you want to reserve one of the private cabanaâ€™s around the pool do so weeks in advance. Sunset Dinner: For the romantic the Sunset Dinner will set you back nearly $600.00 and are held in one of the Cabanas around the pool. For that reason there is little to no privacy and besidesâ€¦$600.00!? We did it anyway and were disappointed. Elevator Noise: When you check-in ask to see your room. If you are within 2-3 rooms of an elevator â€“ move. Ocean Tower or Beach Tower: Weâ€™ve stayed in both. The Ocean Tower has the same pool view but a much better sunset view. Luau: Okay if you absolutely positively must attend a Luau, attend the Old Lahaina Luau in Lahaina. Itâ€™s their core business. The so called Luau at the Westin is not worth the price of admission. Trust me on this one. Iâ€™ve attended Lauaâ€™s and from our balcony we watched three of them at the Westin. The so called Luau area is the same spot where weddings, receptions and conventions are held. Give the Old Lahaina Luau a try. As for dinner suggestions Mamas Fish House, The Plantation House and Merrimans are a must do. The Pineapple Grill in Kapalua was okay. A Sunset Dinner at Merrimans or the Plantation House will cost you $150 -$200 far less than the Westin. Give breakfast at the Gazebo Restaurant at Napili Shores a try. Itâ€™s all about the experience but get there early and I mean early. We arrived at 7:00 and were seated in 15 minutes. By 8:00 the wait was easily 45 minutes. Note of caution. When you book your trip you will receive a letter stating you have been assigned a personal concierge. Take note that the Personal Concierge will help you with dinner and excursion suggestions but first and foremost they are first line Vacation Ownership aka Timeshare sales reps. The bait is a free gift which is nothing more than a box of post cards and chocolates. Donâ€™t bother.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: CatMommyNj
Reviews.Content: We loved the Westin. Lei greeting, great staff, gorgeous view (of ocean and mountains and also pool area) The lobby has a pond with water falls, huge carp, Hawaiian coots (like swans), ducks and flamingos. Every day they bring out the parrots. Had fun feeding the ducks and carp. Water slides, one for kids and one for adults, were a blast. Multiple pools with waterfalls and a short cave like area with a hidden jacuzzi pool (not warm). We had coupons for their breakfast buffet which wasn't the biggest I've ever seen and lack variety. The restaurants are pricey and busy. Right next to Whalers village which has shopping, a food court (cheaper food), and a whale museum. Beach wasn't crowded. A nice place for a stroll is the beachwalk which is a sidewalk that goes between the back of the hotels and the ocean. I like the way the white comforter looked and the furniture was with tropical prints. And a pineapple lamp (cute). Gorgeous landscaping and flowers and interesting statues. Very close to Lahaina's Front street which is great for shopping, dining and has a harbor where many tour depart from. Overall we thought it was great and would go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: WORLDLYLADY
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui, having stayed 9 nights at the Westin! We had a wonderful time and were very pleased to have landed this hotel through Priceline. I bid for it in November 2007 since I saw that Hotwire had it for $139 a night, so I figured Priceline had it too and voila, I got it. We stayed from 9/20 until 9/29. We have been to Maui numerous times. This was our first trip to the Westin having stayed previously at the Hyatt Regency four times, the Kaanapali Alii twice, the Sheraton once and the Whaler once. After staying at the Hyatt several times and being such a fan, I expected the Westin not to live up to the Hyatt. I was wrong. Although the Hyatt is a lovely property, the beach is not very good. They are both great properties, but each has its own distinct character. We arrived at 1:15 P.M. figuring that we'd have to wait to get into our room since check-in was at 3 p.m.. To our delight, not only did they have rooms ready, but the nice lady at check-in upgraded us to a partial ocean view room on the 4th floor. She was so accommodating. I asked her where our room would be and she said the 2nd or 3rd floor facing the waterfalls, so I asked her if we could have a high floor facing the mountains. I think she thought I was nuts for requesting a mountain view, and it was she who suggested the partial ocean view. We received Room 409 which is at the far end of the older tower, and we had the greatest view of the waterfall, the gardens and could see quite a bit of the ocean off to the left. A word of warning, be careful not to get rooms 401 or 403 since you will be sitting directly on the roof top. As others have mentioned, room is quite small but adequate. Appeared to be in pretty good condition except the drapes were too short [appeared to have shrunk] and lots of dust on the dark furniture. However, the housekeeping service did such a great job overall. We would always let them know when we were leaving so they could do our room promptly and they did, except for the 2 days when we forgot to tell them we were leaving, and the room wasn't done until around 3 p.m. Just tell them you want the room cleaned early and they are happy to oblige. Parking lot does fill up if you're not back to the hotel by 8:30, but the valet service was wonderful! They were always very efficient. We had such positive experiences with all the employees there from the bellmen to the check-in to the pool desk. We rented umbrellas at the pool desk just about every morning for the beach. Two loungers and an umbrella will set you back $25 plus tip, but it was soooo worth it. Most mornings we were there when the pool desk opened at 8:00 a.m. and some mornings we even got there at 7:45 a.m. and they opened early for us. It didn't seem necessary to be there so early on several of the day, however, since they still had umbrellas for rent as late as 11 a.m. But this past weekend they were sold out by 8:30. The only beef I had with this hotel is those who run out at 7 a.m. to reserve pool chairs. I went to the pool only one morning. The pool desk opens at 7:30, yet there were towels reserving every single one of the shady lounge chairs by the adult pool, so I asked the pool attendant what that was about and they stated that they have to wait an hour and only then will they "tag" the chair. Well, it used to be a 30-minute time limit, and when I did a walk-by later in the morning, most of the loungers were still sitting empty 3 hours later, so my advice to those wanting a pool chair in the shade is to simply take it upon yourselves to remove others towels if no one is at the pool. They're not supposed to be reserving chairs anyway. You can tell the chairs that aren't being used because they had only a towel and or a magazine. We only ate at Ono for lunch. It was decent, but we preferred the restaurants next door since hamburgers were $10.95 vs. $14 at Ono. We had the $29 breakfast buffet only one morning, but it was very good and worth it to us since it filled us up for both breakfast and dinner. Other recommendations: There is a Round Table Pizza at the Fairway Shops approximately 3/10ths of a mile from the resort. Round Table will deliver, but we went and brought our pizza back. It only took them 20 minutes to cook it. Right in the same plaza is a Deli/Restaurant called CJ's and they have hearty breakfasts for a fraction of the cost of the resorts, and very good breakfasts as well as great boxed lunches for Hana, and wonderful plate lunches. We also had dinner at CJ's and enjoyed the Mango Ribs and Mochichi chicken. We would be inclined to go to the Westin again if we got a reasonable price. We would not be inclined to go there if we had to pay over $250 a night, however. Because we got such a great rate, I think that made for a fantastic experience, but if we had paid full price I think I would be more fussy about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MelG8
Reviews.Content: This resort was paradise. The pools were excellent. The staff was friendly and kind. We arrived for our honeymoon and received a lei greeting upon entering the lobby. Then we received a free bottle of champagne and box of chocolates. The bed and shower were heavenly, like the name states. There is self-parking included in your extra daily fee, but if the parking lot is full, they valet your car for free. It was great! We rented a Jeep Wrangler and the valet put the testy cover up for us overnight. They said it was standard protocol, just in case it rained. We thought that was great! The lobby was beautiful with an open air design and a waterfall. There were flamingos and parrots in view as well. The pools had waterfalls and grottoes, and a really awesome slide too! We had a great time by the pool. Everyday there is a schedule of things to do, we never took them up on the offer but were very interested that they offered Texas Hold Em, pool basketball, pool volleyball and yoga. What we did take advantage of was the timely happy hours offered throughout the hotel. When one restaurant was done with their happy hour, another one just started theirs, so you could restaurant/bar hop to get the best prices on drinks and appetizers. This was useful because the food was pricey. The quesadillas at the pool bar were delicious too. We loved that. This resort was the best and we would stay at the Westin again in a minute! We loved it and it made our honeymoon even more special than it already was.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Shabingie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from 09/09/2008 to 09/16/2008 on a promotion from Starwood hotels which included 5 nights, an AVIS rental car, plus a $75 resort credit. Pros: The resort is beautiful. 5 pools, lovely beach, great location, comfy beds, clean rooms, prompt and efficient maid service. Loved the location next to Whaler's Village and convenient walk to Black Rock for snorkeling. These two things more than made up for the cons listed below. We snorkeled twice a day at Black Rock and saw sea turtles and spotted rays, along with beautiful reefs and tropical fish. Can't stop thinking about the amazing things we saw there. It's a must do! At Whaler's Village, you must stop at Hagen Daaz and try their Big Island Dazzler sundae. There's a $1 off coupon in the Maui guide right inside Hagen Daaz. It's a scoop of coconut and pineapple ice creams, shortbread macadamia nut cookies, chocolate covered macadamia nuts and whipped cream on top for $7.50 before the coupon. We were addicted to these! Room was quiet and maid service was prompt and impeccable. Two free bottles of water per day and an empty refrigerator for your own items. Helped keep the costs down on breakfast and cocktails. Cons: Even after Labor Day, the hotel was extremely busy. Had to be up by 7 a.m. to get to the pool stand to grab beach towels to put on chairs at adult pool or you'd be out of luck trying to get a spot in the shade. Pools were freezing cold. Compared temps to pools at Sheraton and Hyatt and Westin pools were definitely much colder. Parking fills up quickly and spaces are rediculously narrow. If parking is full, they will valet for you at no extra cost, but then you're stuck waiting for car hop and tipping valet. Internet access was out for 3 of the 7 days that we were there. Only refunded $25 even though there is a $25 daily resort fee, of which part of that goes to internet access. Took the time share pitch for a $100 resort credit. Supposed to be only 90 minutes. Our gal tried to go over that time limit and we insisted we needed to go as we had no interest in buying and had met our end of the agreement. She got huffy with us if we objected to anything she said in the presentation and was huffy when we told her we were leaving. Not as low pressure as other reviewers led us to believe it would be. All in all, we would definitely stay at the Westin again if we could get a promotional rate, but not sure we'd pay the $400 per night fee that's standard. Other recommondations: Sansei restaurant is a must. We ate at their Kapalua location twice and would have eaten there every night if we had tried it sooner. Sunday and Monday nights arrive by 5 p.m. for their 25% off all food promotion until 6 p.m. Lines form early as locals get 50% off--must show a valid Hawaiian driver's license to get that deal. But 25% if still worth it. Other must do: eat breakfast at the Gazebo Restaurant in Napli. Try the macadamia nut pancakes with coconut syrup. To die for. Lines also form there every morning at opening. Best to go later at 10:30 or 11 a.m. Short line and they serve breakfast until 2 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jagladyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: California travelers We received one of the packages and booked it last year. We were there 9/11 to 9/16, 2008. It was great, we upgraded to a what we thought would be a view of the pools and it turned out to be a partial ocean view. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The location was great, shuttle service good. Food pricey but found other places to eat that we not so expensive. The location was good, shopping next door. Was apprehensive about the time share presentation. Staff were professional and not high pressure when we told them it wasn't for us. Received all gifts and promises without any pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: SeattleResorter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two boys (ages 4 and 6) stayed here on a promotional package discount for 5 nights. Overall we weren't that impressed. We've stayed at a few other Ka'anapali hotels and condos. The hotel and grounds are wonderful as is the staff (very friendly). However, it wasn't family friendly and not a good value. Why? First, the pools. All pools are 4 feet deep. Our 6 year old is tall for his age and is 3 ft 11 inches tall. There's no kid's beach or similar area as there is at other area resorts. The "kids" water slide is a joke. You're not able to even slide down it since there's no real slope and everyone sticks to the slide the whole way down. The large slide is ok. Second, the kids camp is more of an afterthought vs. a true amenity. We tried using it twice for our 6 year old and both days someone had called in sick so there were no counselors. The camp looked very small. Age limits are 5-12 years old so our 4 year old couldn't go at all. Both were looking forward to the activities presented online. I believe the State of Hawaii has just changed the lower age limit from 3 to 5 for hotel day care facilities. Third, food prices are too high. Yes, I know this is a resort and pricing will be high, but $28 for a breakfast buffet? $5.50 for a machine-made latte? The quality isn't like it is at other nearby resorts. Our first morning, we grabbed two small OJ's from the cafe and were surprised each was $6.30. We noticed there was no price tag and pointed this out. Throughout the week, there never was a price tag. Same thing for the fruit plate. Careful with your kids grabbing food without knowing the prices:)! Lastly, this doesn't have to do with family-focused travel, but we noticed that timeshare is everywhere at this hotel. It's in the lobby, it's all all the activity desks, it's out by the pool, it's in one full wing of the ground floor. These folks are focused. Part of me thinks their goal is to convert all Westin Hotel visitors into Westin timeshare owners at the other Ka'anapali resort property. That property is definitely a better fit for families and those wishing to avoid the high costs associated with resort travel. That being said, why WOULD they want to make the resort family friendly?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: blondie7197
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin the last week in August. It was our first trip to Maui and we decided on the Westin because of its location and the fact that we got a pretty good deal. We did get the lei greeting when we arrived. At check in we were upgraded to a room in the beach tower (had only booked a garden view). Our room was a spacious king with a killer view. We did have a problem where we kept hearing water run through the pipes every 1-2 minutes for the entire night - not very peaceful. The Westin rectified the situation by moving us to the exact same room at the other end of the hall. No more noise at night! The hotel was large and filled with people. There are a lot of kids which could be a drawback to some. This wasn't a big issue for us. The pools were nice - we stayed by the adult pool but it fills up quickly. You need to get to the pool by 8 or so to get chairs. Beware - the flagstone gets super hot around the pools!! Make sure you put some flip flops on before strolling around. The location was great - right next to Whaler's Village. There is a great path that runs all the way down Ka'anapali Beach. This is a good place to run early in the morning (distance of the path about 1.3 mi). I can still picture myself jogging and looking over at the ocean! There is a shuttle that takes you to Lahaina. We utilized this service often - Lahaina is a charming town. There are tons of shops and restaurants and is very laid back. The restaurants are pretty good. We had the breakfast buffet one morning. It's a little pricey, but the food was good. We had lunch at Ono's a couple of times as well - very good. The shave ice at the stand by the pool is great! What a wonderful treat when relaxing in paradise :-) True the Westin is pricey, but we were prepared for this. It's a great place to stay if you want to be in the middle of everything. There's lots of hustle and bustle and always something to do. The hotel itself is beautiful. One thing we noticed is that the staff was not wonderful. They were good and did their jobs, yet many didn't have the "aloha spirit." All in all we had a great vacation. We might try staying in south Maui for our next visit, but if we were to stay in west Maui again, we would more than likely return to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were way too high after a week at the Halekulani, but this property was very very average. I stayed here instead of Wailea (Fairmont or Four Seasons) because I wanted to be closer to Lahaina this trip. There was just nothing special or magical here, it could have been the Westin in St. Louis. The staff wasn't rude, they just weren't anything. Almost no one went out of their way especially to be helpful or friendly, except for the wait staff at the pool and the gal who cleaned our room. The restaurants were eh. The room was eh. Even the highly touted pool was eh. After going to the Napili Kai Beach Resort for breakfast I wound up wishing I had stayed there instead. There was nothing horribly bad about the hotel, but nothing "oh wow" either.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Resort but be prepared to pay”
Reviews.Author: MumnKeiki
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Westin Resort and Spa in Ka'anapali for 2 weeks in August 2008. The resort is beautiful as depicted in their photos. It is not a quiet place however. The lobby is open air with rushing waterfalls all around. Beautiful, but loud. If you are looking for a quiet, serene setting, this may not be the resort for you. The Westin adds a mandatory resort fee of $20/day to the room charges. Our room was not upgraded upon check-in (unlike many others who have reported receiving a room upgrade). I was told an upgrade to partial ocean view would cost an additional $145 per night! We were given a room with a mountain view, looking toward the golf course. Because it also looks over the parking lot, many times a day we heard sounds of car alarms and delivery trucks beeping in reverse. Our room was very small and nicely decorated, but in need of maintenance. The sliding glass door did not seal and the wind whistled through the panes all day and night. The toilet leaked every day and we had cock roaches in the room. Several light bulbs were burned out and the TV remote had a dead battery. The staff was prompt at tending to these issues when we mentioned them, but a guest should not have to point these out in a 5 star hotel. The housekeeping was very good, and supplied us daily with water, coffee and toiletries. The Heavenly beds are amazingly comfortable for sleeping, but we also had to use them for in-room dining since the room did not accommodate a table or chairs for this purpose. We spent time at the adult pool, where we had to claim a spot by 7:00am. Several guests reserved lounge chairs with towels, and would return hours later. I did witness some monitoring of the lounge chairs by resort staff, but it was not strictly enforced. The poolside service for food and beverages was great. If you prefer to swim in water above 75 degrees, I recommend the ocean because the resort pools are not heated. The resort is located on a very beautiful, clean, safe beach front. The Westin rents beach chairs and umbrellas to guests for $26+ tip per day and these also get reserved quickly so get there by 8:00am to rent an umbrella. We did not use the spa services since we had sticker shock from the prices. Instead we found Third Heaven Spa just a mile up the road and had more than 2 hours of relaxing treatments at a fraction of the cost Westin charges. The Westin is located next to Whalers Village where dining and shopping options are plentiful. Hula Grill was our favorite. They make the best Mai tai's!!! Overall, our Westin experience was good. It was not as quiet and relaxing as we hoped, but we found our Aloha spirit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoogAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We Loved our stay here. This hotel has the best location in kaanapali. Steps away from Whalers village and right smack in the middle of all the hotels on Kaanapali row. The rooms are comfy but have a small refrigerator. The pools are awesome but very cold. Even in the hot weather it was unsettling to go in. Overall we loved our stay and recommend the Westin Maui for anyone to stay here. Make sure you get your deal through other sites. The rates on westin.com are outrageous and we payed much less through hotwire. PROS: Location, Great Pools, Pretty grounds, Good Happy Hour Specials, Free Shuttle to Lahaina, Nice TV's in room, friendly staff. CONS: A lot of nickel-and-diming, $25 a day resort fee (way to high), $10 fitness class fee (spin, yoga, etc), Pool not heated, Uncomfortable pool chairs, Fees for using lawn chairs on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh - Not what I expected a Westin would be”
Reviews.Author: erin_japan
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Hawaii and the Westin was where we stayed for the first 4 nights. I'm an avid traveler and have stayed at many different types of hotels and different ranges. I'm quite disappointed with the level of service at this Westin. After a long international flight from Japan, another domestic flight to Maui and securing a rental car, we arrive at Westin where I expected it to be a high class hotel with a nice welcome. Upon arrival, the valets were too deep in conversation with each other and ignored us, there were no bell boys to help with our luggage or golf bags, the was no lei greeter (there was a rack with some leis on it by the door that I didn't notice til day 2). Now I probably wouldn't complain about all this - except that we paid over $300 a night and I've stayed at less expensive hotels that have provided amazing service! Even the Outrigger Resort Waikiki we stayed at next (for the same price) was alot better - their staff was on top of everything! We had a Garden View room w/King bed - nice view of garden, pool, and beach. However it is pretty small and I've stayed in small hotels in Japan! Even more ridiculous is the $20 per day fee they tack on for: - Admission to WestinWORKOUTÂ® - High Speed Internet Access in your guestroom and public areas - Self-Parking - Shuttle service to Kapalua West Maui Airport, upon availability - Shuttle service to Ka'anapali golf and tennis facilities upon availability - Westin Maui souvenir shopping bag - Two (2) bottles of water replenished daily - Outdoor portrait sitting and free 4 by 6 color photograph through Westin Maui Photography Give me a break - this is the Westin! It should all be included in the rate. Bottles of water are normally complimentary at other hotels. I have to pay for self-parking as a guest? And who wants a Westin souvenir shopping bag? (which by the way is a small gift bag with a picure of the hotel on it). Taxes and fees are another $30 - so remember to $50/day on top of what your rate is. Be aware that this is a very, very crowded hotel with a very very crowded pool, if that's not your thing, then this wouldn't be it for you (Check out the private & romantic Mama's Fishhouse Inn). Good things - the restaurant food was excellent, even just at the outdoor bar & restaurant by the pool, and the concierge lady we worked with was very helpful and gave good recommendations. There is also an adult only pool. The hotel is beautiful w/an indoor / outdoor feel. Overall - I will not stay here again nor would I recommend it to my friends. I can't believe we payed so much.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovemyfamily68
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. I absolutely love the waterfall in the lobby! We had our picture taken from behind the fall. Check in was swift and easy, though the attendant could have been a bit friendlier. She was not rude but I expected more. Maybe that's a southern thing. The hotel itself is very nice, clean and the rooms are great and sound proof. Soft plush bed, plenty of space in the room, lovely bathroom, made with marble tile, the view from the balcony was beautiful, even though we were over the top of one of the restaurants. To get up in the mornings to the view of the ocean was just fantastic so much so that after the first day we didn't notice the rooftop again. The pools are laid out nicely. The kiddie and family pools are seperate from the adult pool. That was VERY nice! The restaurants were expensive but we expected that. We had our morning breakfast buffet included in our package. I think the price was $25. I thought that was acceptable considering the variety of items available. I loved the guy who made our omelettes in the mornings. He was very friendly. So was all of the wait staff. One thing I LOVED about this hotel was that on the other side of the hotel was a shopping plaza. In that plaza there was a tiny Mcdonalds, a pizza eatery , mexican eatery that also made subs, and a chinese eatery. The prices were exceptional and the food was very good! Now this place is not part of the Westin but it's just around the back of the hotel. That was a welcome find because you get tired of spending $25 for a cheeseburger and fries. OH!!! the snorkeling is great right out in front of the hotel and especially about 300 yards down from the hotel. For me the only draw backs were that the parking lot would fill up very quickly BUT, BUT the valet staff would then park your car for FREE! So you can't beat that. The front desk staff were less friendly than I would have expected but the concierge were VERY friendly and knowledgable. The hotel had poker games on, I believe Tues and Friday (only 8 seats avail.) but you could only play for drink tickets. Which actually came in handy considering the drinks are from $10 to $12 each, which is typical. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: RN45
Reviews.Content: Gees im not sure where to begin- First we were greeted with a lei whick really made you feel like you were in Hawaii. We intially had a garden view room but were upgraded to ocean view room in the ocean towers for 50.00 extra per night. The room was great ,bed was so comfortable and the view spectacular. The pools are awesome love getting drinks and sipping them by the pool. Always had a lounge chair ,but by the afternoon they do fill up. This is a family oriented place with lots of kids as long as you don't get annoyed by them you will be fine and they do have an adult only pool. The ocean is the best and the beach area wonderful. Make sure to go down to Black Rock for great snorkeling. The food at the hotel was excellent and yes pricey but hey your in Maui what do you expect. There is A 20.00 resort fee which is common wherever you go. All the employees we dealt with were so nice and helpful. Room was always cleaned by at least 11am and they did a good job. The only negative i have is our flight didnt leave till 1055 at night. We had to check out of room at noon and then they offer a hospitality room to shower before your flight for 30 minutes. The first room was totally gross wet towels all over, very hot in room and shower was full of sand, we changed room and the next one was better but still had washclothes in shower and someone elses hair. They must not clean before each new person and i think they should. That is the only negative i have. This was one Amazing trip and when we come back will only return to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: yoshapman
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at the Westin for $90 + 4800 SPG points, and was very impressed. I had booked this hotel 3 months ago when the only availability was 2 double beds with a parking lot view, and I emailed the Westin letting them know that it was a special occasion and could they do anything for me and my wife. When we got there, we were upgraded to a King Bed with an ocean view, and a bottle of champagne waited for us in out room. The resort itself was very nice, with wonderful pools, a waterslide, and a great location near Whalers Village, the Sheraton, and snorkeling at Black Rock. There were parrots, koi, flamingos, and other birds on site as well. The workout room was open 24 hours and had complimentary apples, towels, etc. The room was brand new, with the amazing Westin Bed, flat screen tv, couch, and all new amenities. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants but they looked prety crowded so they must be doing something right. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Any questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.......Expensive, Expensive, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: diamondjke
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights from 8/19-8/23, @ the Westin Maui Resort after spending 4 nights in Waikiki. We booked online so our stay was paid in advance. At Check-in the receptionist claimed that the "resort fee" had increased from $20 to $25 per day. After I playfully objected she said "okay, we'll leave it at $20â€�. This hotel is perfectly located on one of the best beaches on Maui. You can walk right up the beach to Black Rock, a great snorkeling spot. There's shopping and restaurants right next door but, it's just as expensive there as it is in the hotel. You gotta remember this is Maui and everything everywhere is going to be expensive. Even McDonalds is almost twice as much here as at home. The open lobby was very picturesque with a pond that had flowing waterfalls, swans and pink flamingos. We stayed in the "Beach Tower"(deluxe ocean view). The room (#681) was a nice size, tastefully decorated and came with plush bathrobes. I'm 6ft tall though and found the robes a little on the small side. We had an awesome view of the beach right up to Black Rock with Moloka'i as a backdrop and could watch the sunset from our lanai(it wasn't the best angle but you could see it). The bathroom was large enough for a double sink, which my wife loved, and a separate toilet area. The double showerhead with massage action was also a nice touch. The "Heavenly Bed" was very comfortable the first night but, seemed to sag more and more each night. Housekeeping could have been a little better too. The room seemed to be kind of dusty when we arrived, as though it had been empty for a long time. They don't do a great job of making a bed either. On our 2nd night a water pipe burst on the 11th floor sending water down to the floors below and I'm sure spoiling the vacation of some guests. Fortunately our room wasn't affected but there was water on the floor in our hallway that cut off some rooms from the elevator. The next morning it was gone with no bad smells or any sign that it had even happened but I can't speak for those who were directly affected. The pool area overlooking the ocean is huge for a hotel but we never used it, opting instead for the beach. As we read in other reviews, you could see the towels on the pool chairs holding spots for people that werenâ€™t even there. All in all the Westin was a great part of our fabulous 10 day Hawaii vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GRico75058
Reviews.Content: I took my family to Maui on the $789 5 night 6days promotion. It included a free rental car and $85 resort credit. When we arrived at the Westin we were amazed at how beutiful the hotel was, even better than in the pictures i have seen. I was a bit worried about the room we would get on this promotion because I hhad read some reviews here that the rooms were not nice with no view with this promotion. Boy was i suprised when we recieved a mountain/golf course view. It was awesome! My 2 boys ages 7 and 9 loved the pool. My wife and i loved the beach. We then met with Melissa, our timeshare concierge. She was very nice and not pushy. She was very helpful explaining the different things to do on the island. She then gave us our $85 resort credit and then offered us another $100 resort credit and a 50% off certificate off our next westin stay if we went to the timeshare sales presentation. We took it. They were not pushy at all. Very professinal and friendly. Whalers village, next to the Westin, is a great place to shop and eat. There is a mc donalds there. Cant wait to go Back???? Little secret, Join the spg program. It does have its benifits!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME !!!!”
Reviews.Author: GRico75058
Reviews.Content: WE Went To Maui on the timeshare promotion. I was a bit nervous about the room we would recieve. When we checked in, we were given a MOUNTAIN VIEW ROOM that had a view of the golf course. I was totally happy with this room. Me , my wife and 2 boys (7,9 YRS OLD) fit just fine in the room. They are a bit small but are furnished very nicely. Between the 4 of us, we had 6 pieces of luggage . We put 2 pcs under the bed and the larger ones between the bed(CLOSEST TO THE BATHROOM AS WE HAD 2 BEDS IN OUR ROOM) and the wall. We had space to walk around just fine. The pool is AMAZING as is the beach. The staff was very polite. The TIMESHARE SALES PRESENTATION was no pressure at all. We recieved our 85.00 resort credit as soon as we saw MELISSA whom was very helpful. She offered us with an additional $100.00 resort credit to attend the TIMESHARE PRESENTATION, we took it. We never payed for valet parking as it is free when the self parking is full. We loved the resort and will be back again for sure !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: ctsnat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at the Westin Maui and stayed in an ocean view room. Overall the stay was incredible! I will say that for such a nice resort, I think the bathrooms need some TLC. I can tell that they recently renovated the rooms but the bathroom needs some more work. It wasn't necessarily dirty but dingy. Also, one morning I saw a very small roach type bug crawling on the floor. Now I'm not like most people who would just get overly upset by this because I understand it is a tropical environment and an older resort but I still felt a little let down to see it. The staff was fantastic, the pools were a ton of fun, especially the adult only section which we utilized the entire time. I was also extremely impressed with the resort's restaurants. We went and ate at one of the well known restaurants in Lahaina one night and were disappointed we left the Westin since their food was better. I would definitely stay at this resort again and in fact I can't wait to go back. It is great for honeymooners but be aware that many families also frequent this resort so it just depends on the time of year you are looking to visit.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend staying elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: famleetravelers
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to stay at the Westin for 7 days, but after 2, we left to spend the rest of our vacation at another hotel. The Westin has not done a thing to upgrade the property in the 10 years since I've last visited. And to make matters worse, their staff are now the most unfriendly people I have ever encountered at a vacation resort. A few of the issues we had: No Lei greeting (no idea why, guess they just missed us), we were not made to feel "special" in any way - more like cattle!, the resort was SO crowded! You had to get out to the pool by 7am if you wanted a good seat.; the pool was freezing (70 degrees), the food and drinks were poor quality (Ono's) and VERY overpriced (even for Maui standards), You had to pay for any seating on the beach,and the beach sloped down quite a bit making it not so great for young kids. A bigger issue: the staff was so awful - the first room they put us in was water damaged...carpet pulled back and everything, we called the front desk and after being on hold for 10 minutes, they switched us to another room. This new room wasn't as nice as the first (well, it didn't have the water damage, but it also didn't have the nice partial ocean view). They would not upgrade us nor give us another room. They couldn't have cared less. When we left early, no one asked why. This is a resort that really doesn't care about quality, it's all about quantity. By the way, we spent the rest of our week at the Four Seasons and even with the price difference, the Four Seasons was worth every dime. I have never had a better experience then we had at the 4 seasons. Making that switch saved our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Arrival Manager Jay Kincaid is the WORST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauirules
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is a great hotel. Our friends suggested that we stay there as it is family friendly and we have two small children. Loved the hotel, our room, and location, but have only one complaint- the valet/bellman manager, Jay Kincaid. He has horrible people skills, lacks compassion, and when we asked the employees that he manages they had NOTHING good to say about him. He was rude, strange, and freaked our children out whenever we were waiting for our car. He almost ruined our vacation and I would be actually hesitant to recommend The Westin while he is still working in guest relations. Just park your own car, carry your own baggage, and STAY AWAY from Jay.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui-both the good and bad!”
Reviews.Author: Akiras_Mom
Reviews.Content: We took our 7 year old son on our 12 day trip to Maui. The Westin Maui is a very family friendly resort. The Good: Incredible pool and awesome waterslide (for both kids and adults) friendly swans and flamingos that float around in the hotel pond next door to Whaler's Village and the ABC store hotel is right on the beach walking distance to a bunch of restaurants fun kids club with lots of video games The Bad: I had to get up at 6:15AM everyday to get an umbrella at the pool (no charge) I had to be in line by 7:30AM to get a beach umbrella and chairs. ( cost was $26/per umbrella plus tip, limited # of umbrellas) rooms are incredibly small with two double beds. There is NO room to walk around, no place for suitcases or pool floaties There was NO closet in our room Parking filled up everyday (included in your $25 a day resort fee), when parking was full, they required you to valet park, an additional $15 per day charge The minimum pool depth is 4 feet so if you have young kids you need to watch them every second in the pool This resort has a TERRIBLE bird problem at their restaurants especially at ONO. Birds will land on your plate and start eating your food while you are holding the plate! We got room service for breakfast after the second day because the birds were upsetting our son.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: sneakers12
Reviews.Content: Came here for one night after staying at the Westin Villas - which we also liked. Booked a garden room and was upgraded to an ocean view.
