Even better, they let us check in at 11:00 - but we could not get a late check out. Did get use of a hospitality room for a half hour. Bathroom seemed real small after being at the villas. Pool was full but fun. Liked being close to Whaler's Village and Black Rock. and the Kaanapali beach walk. My 11 year old daughter enjoyed the slide, lei making activities, birds and fitness room. Hotel staff friendly. Wife and I liked sitting by the pool, sunset at Black Rock, dinner at Hula Grill, elderly Hawaiin singers and dancers, free massage in lobby (got lucky on this one I think). About time share sales - there are many desks/offices in the lobby for this, but no one bothered us. We enjoyed are stay here after staying at the villas - which was more quiet. I agree this is not a quiet get-a-way place (I would not go here for a honeymoon), and not everything looks new and sparkling like the ritz. It is a lived in place - but fun for us and probably most families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC stay”
Reviews.Author: Sildex22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for the Maui part of our honeymoon trip and it was simply amazing. We were booked for a room with a garden view but when we got there we were upgraded (for free) to a partial ocean view room. All I can say is that if that room was "partial ocean" the full ocean view rooms must be amazing because our view of the ocean was unbelievable!! The room was very clean, had a wonderful lanai and was very spacious. The service, food, and location are top notch and we couldn't have asked for anything more. The beach front was great and we walked up and down that beach front and determined that we loved the section right in front of the resort. Our whole stay from beginning to end was dream like and we were very sad to have to go back to reality!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: redsox999
Reviews.Content: can't beat the location, right on the beach with the boardwalk connecting to the neighboring properties including the whaler's village right next door. the interconnecting pools with waterfalls, slide and grotto are fantastic. the hot tub is ridiculously small for the size of the resort. rooms were good, not great. views were fantastic. staff was cheery and helpful. we booked our boating activites at a vendor next door (for the same boat) for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey stay”
Reviews.Author: bbk3e
Reviews.Content: We didn't take advantage of the amenities because we kept an eye on our budget. There are "free" gifts from the hotel and associated vendors, but they lead to a hard sell for other goods/services (such as timeshare presentations, photography services, etc). There are "accommodation fees" that include parking, wi-fi, etc. $25/day for non-valet parking. $35/day for valet parking. The rooms were nice, we had the "deluxe golf mountain view" which overlooks the parking lot THEN to the golf course and the mountain in the background. Service is very friendly, but I got wary of the different goods/services each person would pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: guitarcali
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location. Sit in a cabana and zone out while the waves roll in.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation/Jul 31-Aug 7, 2008”
Reviews.Author: JSASanClemente
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Maui. We had a great time in spite of some of the disappointments the Westin provided. I was expecting after reading other reviews for the staff to be terrible but I only encountered one rude staff member at the front desk. She could have been the token one. All the pool staff was very friendly and the maid service was excellant. As I write this I realize anyone working for a tip was friendly! My biggest issues was the price I paid for my ocean view room and was not offered an upgrade and was given a room with a view of the roof. If you stay in the ocean tower stay in the upper floors (above 6). Do not be on an end room because the sun beats into the room and the air conditioning has a hard time keeping it cool. Also the electricity would shut off if we had the tv and the hair dryer going at the same time. The rooms are rather small and there is no closets in the ocean tower. However we only need the room to sleep so it was fine. Also a problem I had read about was the crowded pool. It was definately crowded. The only way to get a seat is to get up early. Alot of people save seats. I was not going to do this but after 4 days of being in the sun I needed shade so my son saved me a spot at 7 am, and trust me most were taken already. There is not enough shade offered around the pools. If you want to have a pleasant stay and a nice room stay in the Beach Tower my friends were upgraded for free, they arrived two days before me, also plan on getting up early for a seat by the pool. This was my fourth vacation to Maui, I definately recommend the Sheraton or the Hyatt over the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan of the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: oneterrificshopper
Reviews.Content: We were not huge fans of the Westin Maui. We had really great expectations after reading some of the reviews here, but all in all we were very disappointed with the hotel. From the moment we checked in we ran into multiple problems and rude staff. We are Gold SPG members and had hoped for an upgrade, but were not given one. There were 3 in our party, but they did not have a room with doubles so they had to give us a king room and then move us the next day. It would have been nice to unpack the first day vs having to move rooms. Plus, they told us our old keys would work on our new room - my husband dropped us off while he ran an errand and when I discovered my key did not work I went to the front desk to have them correct the problem and they would not give me another key since I did not have my drivers license with me. I appreciate their attentiveness to security and all, but they left my son and me stranded in the lobby until my husband came back because they gave me wrong information about the key working vs giving me a new key to begin with. I told them I could give them any other kind of proof, but they would not accept anything except my DL. This hotel is so caught up in their "rules" that they put that before helping a guest. The rooms are some of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in! There are no closets either so with three people, luggage all over the place, and no closet to put things in it was very cramped to say the least. The pool was always over crowded and we had lots of trouble finding chairs. The Good: The slides and pool itself were nice. The restaurants seemed to be pretty good. The location and proximity to Whalers Village was wonderful. We have stayed at the Marriott and the Sheraton on Kaanapaili Beach before and would pick either of those over the Westin any day. See my review for the Sheraton Maui that I recently posted. From what I can see, this hotel sells the package deals and they have 100's of families in and out of the hotel all the time on the cheaper packages vs the Sheraton does not have that going for them so the customer service was much much better down there. If you are a SPG member I would highly recommend the Sheraton any day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: yogab
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day stay at the Westin: Room: We loved the beautiful sunsets from our ocean front room located in the Beach Tower. Location: We liked the beach walk and convenience to restaurants, shopping, parasailing, snorkling and sunset cruise on the Gemini. Housekeeping: Excellent Activities: We enjoyed the pools (especially the adult one) and I enjoyed the Yoga classes. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotta_travel40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The pictures on their website to reflect the beauty of the hotel. Here are some points about the hotel... - The Beach - it is wide enough to play on - there are places south of this hotel where the beach is quite narrow. But, this beach was great. The hotel has lots of umbrella's available on the beach for a fee - I think it was $25 for the day. Beware that the tide is strong here and there is a drop off about 10 feet into the water - although it is still only about 4 ft deep after the drop off. Note that you cannot really surf right outside the hotel, but you can walk south along the beach for 5 minutes to find a place to surf. - The pools - beautiful. They are cool, which is great for the weather. The waterfalls and also great. There is one waterslide that is good, and the other is very short and good for little kids. - The rooms - this will be our only complaint about the hotel. Our room itself was fine - we were upgraded to a room with a view, so that was great. But, the housekeeping service was poor. I often had no decaf coffee, when I left a note specifically requesting it; we had days where we had one towel, but there were three of us in the room; shampoo/conditioner was often not replaced when emptied; water was often not provided. I called to the front desk to get some of these items fixed, but they continued to happen. - Resort fee - there is a $20 daily resort fee - it is not optional. It gets you access to their gym, 2 water bottles/day, a free 4x6 picture of your party and free self parking. - Workout facilities - these were good - a nice view of the pools from them. There is an outdoor running route that they have defined for you that is 3 miles long - be aware that it is taking you along some very busy roads. In the workout room, there is another route drawn out - takes you up a big hill, but I thought it was a better route as there was no where near the amount of traffic. - Concierge - there are many concierge desks and they were always willing to help! - Parking - often, their parking lot will fill up, but they will valet park your vehicle for free when that happens, so it's all good! Overall, our trip was great - the housekeeping service didn't spoil the hotel for us - but, being it was a Westin, I was expecting better housekeeping service. It is definitely a family oriented hotel and it is right next to the Whalers shopping center which was great for gifts and the little things you forget. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: lowyellow53
Reviews.Content: Westin Maui Resort We just returned from a stay at the Westin Maui Resort and had the time of our lives. We were there for 10 days in June and could have stayed for the whole month. During our stay we fell in love with the ammenities they have to offer and purchased a time share that same week. We plan to visit again next year and bring the entire family. Thank for allowing us to share our experience and can't wait to return next year!!! Dr Vincent Azzue

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: pgizzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Help was always available. The bellmen gave fantastic and reasonably priced resturant reccomendations. It was our honeymoon and I enjoyed every second of my stay. We had an ocean view on the 9th floor and enjoyed the sunset over the water. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jrock13
Reviews.Content: The pools and grounds were fantastic. Being a Preferred Guest, I was put on the 10th floor with a great view; the floor said SPG floor - very nice. Great location, as well. Service was awesome at the pool. We espcially enojoyed the cafe every morning - nice to have bagels and breakfast sandwiches and to watch the flamingos and birds in the morning while sitting by the water (pond?).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Haikugirl
Reviews.Content: We live on Maui and decided to stay at the Westin in Kaanapali (Maui) for a summer getaway to save on travel expenses. We were especially delighted when we found out that the Westin Hotels are Pet Friendly - We were able to bring our Chihuahua with us and that made the experience that much more wonderful. Our son and his friend had full days of playing in the pool with the waterslide and my husband and I relaxed in a cabana on the beach witih our dog, the hotel staff brought us fresh pineapple and cold water all day long. We enjoyed the room service and all of the amenities. We are definietly going to do this again very soon - We all had a great time. Mahalo to all of the staff at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ryanvf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began our stay on July 23rd and left on July 28th. I must say that we enjoyed our stay at the Maui Westin. We made sure we rented a car at the airport and kept it at the resort for day trips. We were able to keep busy around the resort for the first few days, parasailing and snorkeling around Black Rock. We also found the pool areas to be a nice way to relax. The food service around the pools is good but a little on the slow side, just don't get in a rush. We ate some great meals at Cascades on the Hyatt complex and had a couple of meals at the Hula Grill. We drove into Kapalua one night to eat at Sansei's, a great sushi restaurant. The resort was nice and clean, busy of course and I thought that the wait staff were very friendly and courteous. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hawaiian Get-away”
Reviews.Author: CLee325
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating and had everything we needed. The upgraded room we received was perfect (overlooking the ocean) and the hotel staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JustinTara
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is absolutely gorgeous. We stayed here for our honeymoon and had such a wonderful experience. The concierge was amazingly helpful for reservations and insight on the most beautiful spots to view on Maui. The pool staff always strived to make us feel special. Our honeymoon was magical and we were truly saddened to leave our stay at the Westin Maui. We both look forward to returning to the Westin Maui very soon!! Justin & Tara Brown

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at the Westin Maui (from NZ)”
Reviews.Author: TraceyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We simply had a wonderful stay at westin Maui. It was our first time to Hawaii and would highly recommend it to our friends. All of the staff were very friendly and welcoming. Resort was of a good standard, the kids loved the extended swimming pool and water slides. Great location on the beach for swimming and shopping. Resort met all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “All this and heaven too???”
Reviews.Author: hockeyhog
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been a guest at the hotel for 7 out of the past 8 years over the Fourth of July and look very forward to coming back again and again. The service at the hotel goes beyond great - they make you feel at home. Some staff members even remember our names when they see us each year and we find that so comfortable. The setting of the hotel is second to none - in fact I keep a picture taken from our room on my office desk - great motivation to work harder so we can get back as soon as possible. There is no down side to your stay at the Westin - it truly is heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: mauiwauiLV
Reviews.Content: The staff were the most professional, warm and friendly people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui is awesome”
Reviews.Author: yankeedan
Reviews.Content: The guy with the moustache who works at the door greeting people is great. Everyone we met at the hotel did a good job making us feel welcome and comfortable. I can't comment about the price or value because we booked this place using our Starwood points and got the fifth night for free. The pools are awesome, and the waterslide is cool (It's fast). The gym is great, too, although I never felt like staying inside to work out. The hotel is on one of the best beaches anywhere. The hotel has some nice bars, and if you walk down the beach to Whaler's Village, you can find a bunch of other restaurants and bars. In general, it is a great location to stay in Maui because it is close to Lahaina town but on a beautiful beach that has all of the creature comforts and isn't too busy. It is also a convenient location to catch snorkel boats and sunset boats. All in all, we would recomment this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: bbooth02
Reviews.Content: Most everything we utilized, from the concierge, to the travel desk, to the restaurants exceeded expectations. Have to be prepared for the prices, however, given the high-scale nature, I was especially impressed with the friendliness and helpful nature of the staff. The pool area is the best in the area. Also attended the Luau and enjoyed the 'sit down' more intimate feel of the show. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Westin in Maui was absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: BeachloverPaxton_MA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. We were a family of 5 and had connecting rooms with an ocean view. The rooms were clean and the beds had white comforters which I thought was rather risky but they were spotless. The maid service was done alittle later in the day because of the hotel size but they always did a great job, left free water bottles and plenty of towels. The lobby with the tropical garden and fish stream was amazing and kept clean. At the front desk you can get food to feed the fish with. The hotel has 5 may even be 6 pools that have waterfalls and slides and provided hours of fun for our boys ages 12, 14 & 16. There was an adult only pool in which young children were not allowed and it had its own seperate bar. I thought that was a wonderful idea for those that didn't have small children and wanted some quiet time. The location of the hotel was great and the staff was very intentive to our needs especially valet for parking. FYI there is a healthcare center just around the corner in case you encounter a small medical issue which is a major convenience since the main hospital is by the airport which is 45 minutes away. Restaurants in the hotel were pricey but the food was wonderful. We had breakfast daily at the buffet (price $28 Adult) but the food selection was incredible. The beach is right off of the pool area which provides a great convenience. The Westin had chairs and umbrellas for daily rental and an outside towel area to exchange wet and sanded towels. At night the Westin on selected nights had movies for the younger kids. I loved the hotel, the atmosphere and the friendlyness of the staff and if and when we return to Maui will stay at this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: mimiclee
Reviews.Content: Great services. The staff do whatever they promised. The facility was clean and a great location for a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a paradise!”
Reviews.Author: detailplanner
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were in awe. The lobby is amazing and many times we saw people just relaxing there, it was so pretty and relaxing. The service was great and the of course the beds....when you are trying to unwind and relax, the bed is so important. These Westin beds are the best around. We booked a sunset cruise through the Westin and it was the best cruise we have ever done, it was so worth it. We also booked jet skis and that was awesome and easy to book as well. The POOL is amazing-you can have a different experience every day. The beach is also great. Pool side service is great with strong drinks! I liked the non-smoking feel of the resort. We walked by other hotels on the Kaanapali "strip" that seemed more like a smoky, nasty, drunken club in the middle of the day, where the Westin seemed to be the most healthful and vibrant. The location is prime. You can go to Lahaina, stay in the resort area, shop in the mall, go up to Kapalua, do the "nature sights", and so many food choices right there at your command. All in all, wonderful!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: scarletpeach
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the marvelous resort and loved every minute of it. Our only regret was that we did not book 2 weeks. The pools were excellent: the slides offered a great diversion for our kids and the beaches at the hotel were clean and safe. The hotel itself was clean and the service fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Our Hawaii trip”
Reviews.Author: cherylerattey
Reviews.Content: They put us on the top floor in a room with a fantastic view and we appreciated it very much. We found the resort to be centrally located yet quiet at night. We'd go back. This was part of our trip by American Airlines Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “TINY hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: fitforever
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Westin hotel chains before, so I had expectations. Unfortunately, they were not met at this hotel. Upon entering the lobby, I was impressed with their lagoon with cascading waterfalls, fish pond, resident parrots and flamingos, but my impression quickly turned sour when I entered our hotel room. The hotel rooms are the smallest I've ever been in - the concierge told me that it was originally designed for Japanese tourists - (read: small). My husband, myself and 2 children (9 and 11) were very uncomfortable with our belongings strewn everywhere. The pluses: The pools were lovely and not crowded even in peak vacation season. There is also a separate pool designated for adults fand a tiny hot tub adjacent. My kids loved the winding waterslide. The property is located right on a very nice beach which had some waves for the kids' boogie boards. Their trademark "Heavenly Beds" DID live up to their hype. We all slept very well in the comfy (albeit small double) beds. We avoid eating at the hotel restaurants due to the cost, but sometimes it can't be helped. The poolside restaurant (O'no Bar & Grill) actually had some very good food (pizza, chicken sandwich, nachos) that wasn't too outrageously priced. Note! Although Westin is linked with the Sheraton chain and you can EAT there, rent sports gear there (spend money there), you CANNOT use their pool. Our concierge person neglected to tell us this which led to a very embarrassing situation when we visited the Sheraton property next door. When I returned to the Westin I spoke with the manager and she was not at all apologetic and made me feel like I'd done something wrong. Needless to say, I was not happy. Which leads me to say that the staff was not as friendly as I'd expected. One woman at the concierge desk was quite rude while assisting me with printing boarding passes. This was our third trip to Hawaii, but first time for Maui and we absolutely fell in love with it, but we will not be returning to a Westin property. Also - DO NOT go the the Hyatt's Luau (Drums of the Pacific). I was aghast at the amateurish performance of the dancers. One guy kept making mistakes and constantly looking at the other guys for guidance. One of the girls looked like she was 12 years old. The brochure said we'd be witnessing some cultural exhibits - it turned out that they had tables selling overpriced souveneirs. At the beginning of the lual, we were encouraged to have photographs taken by their photographers ($20 for a 4X6 and 8X10). This "luau" felt more like an orchestrated scheme to have visitors part with more of their money. I was so turned off. I was fortunate to get my younger child in for free, but I was still annoyed at having paid $214 for a glorified buffer dinner - at least the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - a true resort!”
Reviews.Author: tinar1212
Reviews.Content: This was the first of two hotels we had in our trip (the other was the Waikiki Marriott in Oahu) and this hotel was superior in every way. Dh travels a lot for business and stays in Westins a lot, so we had used SPG points to get an oceanview room for 6 nights. When we arrived late Sunday night we were given a not-so-nice room next to the elevator that overlooked the roof of the building below us, but after travelling over 18 hours we were in no mood to argue. The next morning we contacted the front desk manager; within a half hour the staff had us moved to a much nicer room in the same price range overlooking the pool and ocean. The room wasn't huge, but it was fine for what we needed it for, and the Westin's signature "Heavenly Bed" was just that - HEAVENLY. The staff was very nice and accomodating, especially the poolside servers. We had a few issues with housekeeping - room not cleaned in a timely manner and my "diamond' necklace disappeared - since it was a fake I didn't bother with the safe, but beware!! The pool area was magnificent, as were the hotel grounds with lots of exotic birds and sculpture nestled in. The location of the hotel was awesome: right next to Whalers' Village, with lots of shops and places to eat, and a short walk to the Sheraton, a sister hotel that allowed us to charge dinner to our Westin room. The hotel offered a complementary shuttle to neighboring hotels and into Lahaina, but you will still need a car for most activities. We had rented a car and were able to self-park (watch out - the spots are extremely small) but when the lot was full we were given free valet parking.The restaurants were very good and typically resort-expensive, especially breakfast. There was a room charge of $20/day that allowed us free bottled water, access to the above-average fitness center, and a session with the excellent photographer located in the lobby; they offered a free 4x6 as well, but of course we purchased more! I read a lot of reviews about this hotel that criticized the timeshare people - while they were omnipresent, they never harassed us or anyone else that I saw, so they were no big deal. Overall, this was a great hotel and I'd highly recommend it - hopefully I can go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Westin - here are the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: lmg11
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel -- beautiful beach in front, rooms were nice. We booked "partial ocean view" rooms and were more than satisfied with the view (behind the pool, but could see much of the ocean). Liked the fact that the hotel is in walking distance from Whaler's Village - lots of restaurants there, including a food court in the back. We cut costs by eating dinner there a couple of times - the little Mexican place has great fish tacos! Also, loved The Fish Co. in Lahaina - great food and views (to cut costs eat lunch there instead of dinner!) The cons of the Westin: unless you are one of these grabby people who "reserve" pool chairs all day for the 2 hours they will use them, forget about getting a seat by the pool. Having nowhere to sit gets old after a week, and reduces your enjoment of the property - management should do something about this (since usually, over half the chairs are "reserved" but empty). The resort is full of kids - this was fine with us, but I would not recommend this hotel for couples or honeymooners. Would not recommend the Westin luau. The food was good but the ambiance was terrible, and it was very expensive. Overall, a good experience, but next time I would probably look for a hotel that's a bit quiter and more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: SuperDave15
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 2 boys 7 and 9 yrs old) and we spent 10 days at the Westin Maui in July. I am a SPG Platinum member and was contacted in advance of our stay by the Concierge to discuss any needs I had in advance of arriving at the hotel. Upon arrival our room was ready and we were upgraded to an Ocean View room. Check-in was speedy and we were at the pool in no-time. My only real complaint about this hotel is that the rooms are a little small when you have 4 people in them (2 double beds). Other than that the rooms had been upgraded with newer bath amenities and flat screen TV's. During our stay we really enjoyed the pools and waterslides. The ocean was also great and we spent some time body surfing in there. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The waterfall in the lobby area is quite impressive and makes a stunning impact when you arrive at the hotel. We ate at Ono's and the Tropica restaurants. While the costs are a little high they are in-line with other Westin's and as expected the food is well done. We also did the Thursday night Luau and really enjoyed the food and the performance. We also used the Shuttle service frequently to go into Lahaina for dinner and found it very reliable and punctual. Throughout my stay I received excellent customer service and would definitely consider a return to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Some serious Management and Customer Service issues”
Reviews.Author: BBTRVLR
Reviews.Content: First, the good news. The Beach Tower was recently remodeled that we stayed in, and it was nicely appointed. A few cheap corners cut, like the toilet seat looked like it was from 1975, and the room was remodeled in 2008. The hotel has a nice pool, that is a bit crowded like all of the hotels in the area. The real problem is the management. Turn down service didnt even happen the first 2 nights of our 4 night stay in an oceanfront suite. when we complained, they made promises that didnt pan out. They seem to want to make the attempt at superior customer service, but just dont execute like the 4 seasons or a Fairmont property (like the Kea Lani we stayed at just prior). No less than 4 different members of managment made customer service promises about turn down service, wristbands for the pool the night prior , etc, that never happened. Really embarrassing in my opinion. This place just doesnt match up to the competition. If you want a quality experience, pay a litle bit more and stay at the Fairmont or Four Seasons, or other. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui lived up to the expectation !”
Reviews.Author: qbchiefs
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Westin Maui using the 6 day/5 night package for $749. Rental Car voucher was included for $185 and I received a $100 resort credit upon check-in. If I wanted to participate in the Westin Vacation Villa Ownership presentation (which was 2 hours in length and they weren't that pushy), I would receive an additional $100 resort credit. So that would be $200 of resort credit and if I wanted to use that towards a room upgrade, the credit would be doubled to $400. When I checked in, they offered me a room overlooking the parking lot and the golf course on the 3rd floor in the Ocean Tower (which wasn't a bad view). I asked the front desk agent to upgrade to an ocean view room and I was given three options : 1) I could use my Starwood points toward an ocean view room, but that would have been 5,500 points per night (27,500 total) 2) Pay $450 ($90/night + occupancy tax) cash for the upgrade or 3) Use the resort credit toward the room upgrade. To maximize my use of the resort credit, the agent told me to take the vacation villa presentation and then I would have $400 of resort credit to use for the room upgrade. By upgrading the room would cost $450 total ($90/night), but since I would have $400 of resort credit, it would only cost me an extra $50 and the corresponding occupancy tax ($10.27/night). So at the end of the day, I'm only out $101.35 for the partial ocean view upgrade and $100 for the resort fee. The front desk agent was even nice enough to give me the keys in advance to inspect the rooms to make sure that room met my expectation for the price paid. I opted for the resort credit usage and what that got me was Room 284 in the Beach Tower. This room is located about 3 rooms from the end of the tower closest toward the beach. It offered a slim view of the mountains, a view of the lower pool and a partial ocean view. The only bad part was that since the room was located on the 2nd floor (and this floor was designated as a Starwood Preferred Guest floor), my balcony looked out over the mezzanine rooftop which contained trash that guests from higher floors had obviously dropped onto it. A lot of people have complained about the size of the rooms. If you want a bigger room, you should opt for a room in the Beach Tower. Those rooms have about 250 more square feet in them than in the Ocean Tower. They have a full walk-in closet and the balconies are larger (the Ocean Tower rooms only have an armoire/no closet). The bathrooms are also significantly larger in the Beach Tower rooms. The only drawback in the Beach Tower rooms is that you don't have the bar sink that you'll find in the Ocean Tower rooms. You basically have a table stand with the coffee pot and cups on it. Aside from the rooms, the hotel is in great shape for being almost 25 years old. The staff did a great job overall and yes, there were issues with people reserving pool chairs as early as 6am. However, I did notice pool attendants walking around noting which chairs had been vacant for longer than 30-45 minutes. If you get to the pool around 8am, you should not have a problem securing your favorite spot. And the staff did a great job of policing the kids from the adult pool. The restaurant food was okay at the Ono Bar and Grill and the Westin's Tropica Restaurant food was highly over-priced ! Just walk down 30 steps from the Tropica and you've got Leilani's, Hula Grill and the Rusty Harpoon which had excellent food at reasonable prices. One more thing about this property. Several years ago, the concierge made it a point to inform the guests that there is a professional photographer on staff (by the American Express Tour desk) who will take photos of you and your family for free. This service still exists, but they don't mention it to you, so make sure you ask the front desk about this service. You have to make a reservation in advance, but they take you to the most picturesque spots at the resort and the results are great ! Overall, I had a great time at the Westin Maui and definitely recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Robert006
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the six days spent at the Westin Maui. Everything operated properly, including the fantastic slide, and it was a perfect site to relax or be active. The staff were pleasant and attentive. The room was very comfortable. The restaurants in the resort or next door ( particularly Leilani's) offer very good fare, and if you plan it right you can move from Happy Hour to Happy Hour from about 3 PM until 10. We always dropped out after the second Mai Tai, but some people showed amazing stamina. Don't miss snorkeling at Black Rock, just a short walk up the beach. We were fortunate to find the water crystal clear and full of turtles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MaileGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa and had a great time! We traveled with our three girls that range in age from 10 to 15. The location of the Westin was perfect for our family. There is snorkeling right down the beach by the Sheraton, shopping next door at the Whaler's Village, and the fabulous pool. Something for everybody. It was nice having everything within walking distance...since it seemed that some in our group would want to switch activites sooner than others. The pool at the Westin is great! The slide is nice and you can buy inflatable rafts and tubes for just $3 - $4. We were warned that the pool chairs get reserved early in the day, but that wasn't a problem for us. (You do have to reserve them early...by 9am, they were all reserved with towels) But to avoid this problem, we went to the beach or shopping the first half of the day, and headed to the pool around 3pm. (It seemed that the people who had been there since the morning, tended to leave at this time) We never had a problem finding a place to lounge in the later afternoon. Also, if you don't like the crowds snorkeling by the Sheraton , you can catch the shuttle to the Westin Villas where the snorkeling is just as good, without all the people. Oh, one note of caution...there are metal plates (drains) at the bottom of the pool that my daughter accidentally pushed off from, and cut her foot badly! Warn your kids to watch out for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: kctravelguy
Reviews.Content: After reading many TripAdvisor reviews and speaking with friends who own a time share unit in Maui, we decided on the Westin hotel for our summer vacation from Kansas City. We felt that Kaanapali would be the best location in Maui for the kids and I think they were right. The hotel grounds and lobby are beautiful and well-tended although they could use more trash cans around the pool areas. The pools were clean and warm with a water slide and waterfalls that the kids really enjoyed. The beach is directly next to the pool area and was great for swimming and playing. The surf was very low in front of the Westin but was better for bodysurfing down near the Marriott Ocean Club. Good service around the pools and they do make an attempt to prevent people from reserving all the lounge chairs first thing in the morning by flagging those chairs left unattended for more than 30 minutes. Still, it was very crowded when we were there and hard to find chairs near any shade throughout the day. The hotel room was pretty small but was clean and well maintained. Tight quarters with 2 double beds for 2 adults and our 13 and 11 yr old. Our "partial ocean view" room had a great view of the pools and beach though the patio was too hot in the afternoon to sit outside during cocktail hour. We did not eat many meals at the Westin since the prices seemed very high (even for Hawaii) and we had a few dinners at the next-door shopping area of Whaler's Village as well as in the town of Lahaina. The upstairs/fine dining parts of Leilani's and the Hula Grill both impressed us with great fish dishes and were much better than the beachside/bar food parts of each restaurant. There is also a food court (think delisandwiches and Panda Express) which were convenient for cheaper meals for the kids who are not fish fans. I really think you must rent a car to appreciate all of Maui and also to get to Lahaina for dinner/strolling/shopping. It's only about a 10 minute car ride. There is also a Safeway supermarket on the way which came in handy for breakfast and lunch items for the hotel room instead of spending $100 for the breakfast buffet every morning. We stayed for 9 nights and stayed busy the whole time. We drove to the Haaleakala crater for sunrise one morning, took a Molokini snorkel trip aboard the Maui Magic (great crew, BBQ lunch and snorkeling), parasailed with UFO tours (sign up on the beach in front of the Westin) and golfed in Kaanapali (across the street from the hotel) and on the nearby island of Lanai at the Manele Bay course(accessed by 45 minute ferry ride). Dining in Lahaina was great at Kimo's and the Mai Tai Lounge (try to sit upstairs at one of their lounge tables at sunset).Also recommend Mama's Fishhouse on the north side of the island for dinner as well as the Paia fish market which we visited on our last day since it was closer to the airport. Tried Maui Tacos once but we were not impressed. We purchased snorkel gear and boogie boards at home and brought them with us to avoid high rental costs. I'm told you can also buy these at the Costco near the airport but we were not members. The only complaints about the trip are the crazy jet lag returning to the midwest (5 hr time difference), the high cost of everything in Hawaii and the too-close-for-comfort feeling of living with 4 people in 1 hotel room for 9 days. Fortunately we were so impressed with the Westin and Maui that we purchased a week in their villa property just north of the hotel so we'll have plenty of room for the next time we say Aloha, Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: littleone3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in early May. The hotel was wonderful. We booked hour hotel though hotwire so we got a great deal. When we arrived we paid and upgraded our room to an ocean view and it was well worth it. We had a spectacular view of the ocean and the pools. We had the pools almost all to ourselves. The bathroom was a little small, but that was the only problem with the room. The only downside to the hotel is the parking. They have parking included in the resort fee, but the parking lot was full most of the time when we would return from dinner. The valet would park your car free of charge, but then I would feel obligated to tip. The staff was very friendly. Overall it was an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Gem for Westin”
Reviews.Author: MillCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: The positives: Wonderful grounds, pool and beach. Nice location next to Whaler's Village for shops and restaurants. BUT: This Westin has serious customer service delivery issues. Our AC didn't work and we reported it at 4 p.m. after check in. After calling back again, the engineers finally showed up at 11 p.m. after we went to bed. They had to get into the ceiling and replace the condenser. We also requested a rollaway at checkin that took 8 hours to be delivered. The rooms are VERY small - no closet (armoire only) and very few dresser drawers. Both rooms need a "deep clean" - especially the drapes which are a light color and have been stained and appear filthy. We traveled with 2 teenagers and after one night ended up getting a second room. We also had an issue at the restaurant. They had signs advertising a special July 4th meal. When we ordered it, we were told it ended 2 hours before - they had just neglected to take down the advertising. While there are some positives here, you can do far better at the Marriott or Hyatt. Westin needs to do a serious quality control review at this property to protect their brand's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: AlikaTanakaYarnell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (ages 29/33, respectively) spent a week at the Westin Resort in mid-June 2008. Overall we enjoyed our stay and had a relaxing vacation in the tropics of Maui. Here are some items we noted: Renting a car is a must! First, shuttles/taxis costs between $50-80 each way from the airport. We rented a car for $130 for the whole week! There is â€œfreeâ€� self-parking at the resort, so you might as well take them up on it. I say â€œfreeâ€� because it is included in the mandatory $20-per-day fee. There are exorbitant prices within and around the resort. I expected some inflation, but it was over $7 for two small cups of seltzer water (no alcohol) at the bar. So using the car to venture out to the local Safeway and less expensive restaurants was a real plus. And while youâ€™re at it, check out the other beaches and attractions that Maui has to offer! The lagoon-style pools were awesome! We really liked all the waterfalls and the waterslide was fun. The beach and pools were pretty crowded, but there is good snorkeling at the Westin north of the Black Rock. You can park for free in their lotâ€”but donâ€™t forget to bring your towel (they wonâ€™t give you one unless youâ€™re staying at that particular Westin)! I was disappointed in the food overallâ€”I thought there would be more authentic Hawaiian food, but most of the places were geared toward the haulisâ€”lots of steakhouses, diners, and fast food. Boo! But I did have the best mahi mahi tuna steak of my life at the Hula restaurant in Whalerâ€™s Village (which you can walk to easily from the Westin Resort). Order it very rare! Rooms are smallish with no whirlpool tubâ€”but the beds really are â€œHeavenly.â€� Given the price to stay at this resort, youâ€™d think the rooms would be a little fancier with a better bathroom. Ours was small and the furniture was awkwardly arrangedâ€”as if it had been upgraded without thinking through that a small table shouldnâ€™t go directly in front of the desk/TV. No microwave in the room. Given that buying food outside of the resort is a must, it wouldâ€™ve been nice to be able to heat something up in the room. But we did have a small fridge and coffee maker (although we had to buy our own coffee grounds because the "Kona coffee" provided was undrinkable). No DVD player in the room. A minor compliant, but given that there wasnâ€™t much on the 30 channels they offered, it was a little annoying. Contrary to what Iâ€™d heard, we were not given a lei at any time during our stay (even though we saw them hung by the door to great visitors). It shouldnâ€™t be a big deal, but I was a little disappointed. The spa was a big highlight for us. In addition to the massages being fabulous, the spa facility was a blessing. If you book an appointment, you have access to the spa lounge which includes comfy seats overlooking the pool/ocean. You also can help yourself to several different kinds of teas, nuts, dried fruit, and biscotti. There is also a small whirlpool tub, sauna, and steam room in both the menâ€™s and womenâ€™s locker areas. We stayed in the lounge for several hours relaxing and reading in the indoor shadeâ€”better than hanging out by the pool! Overall it was a great tripâ€”I just think it was more expensive than it was worth.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallflour
Reviews.Content: The rooms are smaller than other Westin that I've been too and the noise level is outrageous since the guests were mainly family. Other than the convenient location I would not recommend this location for Honeymooners. Honeymooners should stay at the Sheraton instead. Westin breakfast buffet was okay compared to Sheraton but one plus is that you can sit at the Tropica seating area which overlooks the ocean. That area is less noisy since it's away from the pool. The pool with waterfall is nice but you'll have to go there early to grab a spot. The front desk was not very friendly and the room service was not very good. Several times they forge to replenish the hot chocolate/tea supply and the sheets were never patted down nicely. The bed itself was rather old with the middle section sinking in. Overall, room was below Westin standard.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are beautiful set in the backyard of Kaanapali Beach; Staff indifferent”
Reviews.Author: slippahs
Reviews.Content: Starting off with the pros: The Westin Maui is located on one of the best beaches in the State. Ocean view rooms have great views of Ka'anapli Beach, Lana`i, and Moloka`i. The pool is expansive, has a great waterslide, and great poolside food/alcohol service. The rooms are nicely appointed, albeit, some rooms still are "dirty" based on our conversations with other guests. Now the cons: The staff is indifferent. The elevators can be full of people (in the Ocean tower). The pool can be overrun with kids. The part of Ka`anapali Beach that the Hotel sits on is not as wide as other parts (e.g., fronting the Sheraton Maui adjacent to Black Rock). Self-park gets full early in the evening forcing you to valet when the Hotel is at or near capacity (although they waive the charge). Regular rooms are on the smaller side. Although not as nice, one might consider staying at the Sheraton Maui down the road. The rooms are larger, the staff is a bit friendlier, SPG Gold/Plats will likely receive better recognition, the beach is wider, there are fewer waits for the elevator when the Hotel is full, and there's less of a likelihood that the Hotel will force you to valet your car as they have a larger parking lot for the number of rooms available. We're usually fans of the Sheraton Maui but tried the Westin to experience the pool. In our opinion, it wasn't worth it. Although the pool at the Sheraton is smaller and lacks a slide, the service, we though, was better at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “For your sake, I hope I was the exception...”
Reviews.Author: SiameseTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui Resort had some very great features. It was on Lahaina Beach, which you could swim in. The pools and water playground were awesome.....if you have kids - it's even better. It was next to multiple shopping centers and restaurants. You could just walk out and have what many others would have to drive for. PAC SUN, Coach, Luis Vuitton, Rolex, ....all were here. ABC Store was next door for you to buy all the little grocery and economical gifts. It had a beautiful garden with Kois, Flamingos, Macaws, etc. A multi-level garden incorporated with multi-level pools (including two water slides) was functionally picturesque. Now the bad.... Because it was next door to all those things......businesses needed trucks to bring them items. Trucks arrived in the very early morning hours. My ocean front room echoed sounds of trucks backing up with its "beep beep beep" every morning. I could hear other rooms sliding their doors shut on what was before occupied by the serene sounds of waves. But the worst of it was that one day, I came back from a long excursion to Hana............and my bed was partially made. A luxury hotel with partially made bed! I called the manager "Jason" and he said he trusted me and did not need to see it. He offered to send someone up to make it right away. I usually leave tips at the end of my stay. Made me wonder if it was retaliation for me not leaving it on a daily basis? Jason assured me that was not the practice and it was not up to the hotel's standards. Was room service staff indifferent or had hidden agendas? At the same time I discovered this, my suitcase was also opened. I'm willing to blame this on myself. Nothing was missing, and maybe I forgot to close it since I had to leave early that morning for Hana. Coupled with the way my bed was made, I had my doubts. It seems like someone finished making the bathroom, and then did something to rush through the bedroom. Now I'm not a picky guy. I've been know to overlook details others will not tolerate. This was ridiculous. I have been to less rated hotels including economy hotels where beds were made better. For a 4-star hotel and with the availability of other competition, do you think I needed to tolerate this. Would you? For your own judgment, I've attached pictures the way my two beds were made that day. One was made better than the other, but both were in my opinion sub-standard to even lesser hotels. Judge for yourself if this is what you want from a luxury hotel. I hope my experience was an isolated one; however, for me, there's too many other fine hotels to take a risk again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: tygretygre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui the week leading up to Memorial Day. The hotel was apparently overbooked when we checked in, so we got upgraded from a Garden View to an Ocean View room, but unfortunately there were 2 full-size beds in the room we got which was a bit disappointing since we'd originally booked a king-sized bed. The room was nicely kept, although a little small. The 5(!) pools were very nice, although most of the deck chairs were reserved very early on by people who never seemed to arrive! It could be hard to find a seat in the shade. The hotel has a great location on the beach -- right next door is the Whaler's Village, a little shopping area with food court and restaurants, and a little walking path leads up to Black Rock where there is great snorkeling. The hotel has really beautiful public spaces -- the lobby has a big garden fountain with flamingos and koi fish. Most of the staff were very helpful and nice. The restaurants were okay, a little overpriced for the food, though. Overall it was a very nice stay, although somewhat expensive, especially considering the size of the bed/room.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for 6 nights during our honeymoon trip to Hawaii. It truly is a gorgeous resort!! We spent our days lounging around the beautiful pools, reading and drinking cocktails. Oh, and eating the delicious spicy chicken wings by the pool. Everything about this hotel is amazing. The beautiful lobby, the flamingoes, the perfect location, right on the beach... Just fabulous!! We headed over to Whaler's Village quite a bit for lunches, and shopping. Cute little shopping centre with some yummy restaurants - and only a 2 minute walk away! The free shuttle to Lahaina was excellent too. We used it almost every day, either to grab a lunch or dinner, or to go shopping, or to the Lahaina Luau, which I also highly reccomend. There's something so relaxing about sitting on that little bus, listening to Hawaiian music, being taken wherever you liked in Lahaina, then picked up a couple of hours later! The only downside to our stay was a small one. We had booked a room with an ocean view. When we checked in, they gave us a room overlooking the roof of Whaler's Village, next door. We headed straight back down to reception and asked to change rooms, since that's not what we requested. Apprently they had upgraded us, because that room was larger than what we booked. But... we didn't want a big room, we wanted a nice view! After a bit of coaxing, they eventually gave us what we asked for. Phew. When we thought about it later, we really thought they were just trying to give us a bad room, because they wanted to get rid of it. That made me a bit annoyed. Our new room was fantastic. Just what we were hoping for. Still really big, but with a fabulous view overlooking the pools and the ocean. And yes, we saw lots of whales in the ocean!! Did I mention how fun the waterslides were!? We were on our honeymoon with no kids, but we had a blast on the slides!! Why not!? If you fancy treating yourself, this hotel is definitley the place to do it. Splurge and treat yourself - you'll love it!! I wish I was still there right now, sipping a Tropical Monkey cocktail by the beautiful pools... Ahhhh. :)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place. We will return!”
Reviews.Author: banthatracks
Reviews.Content: Our first stay with the Westin Maui was a year and a half ago on an offer we received from Starwood for $750 for 5 nights+free rental car and $100 resort voucher. How could we pass that up? We loved it so much that we had to return and decided to stay there for 3 nights on a 6 night Maui stay (The other 3 nights were South at the Grand W.) I booked using the cash and points option from Starwood which was awesome-4000 points+$90 a night! I have Gold Status, but wasn't sure if we would get upgraded due to booking partially with points, but we did! Garden View was what we booked, but we got Ocean View! The hotel has all the ameneties you need and has about the most wonderful beach and warm ocean water you could ever imagine. Great snorkeling is just down the beach at Black Rock and the pools are awesome. The breakfast buffet was absolutely scrumptous and the work out facility is excellent-but it does get busy. The staff is friendly and happy to help you schedule activities and the concierge is very helpful. Go to The Gazebo for breakfast! You will have to wait at least 30 minutes-but it is worth it! If I had to make a recommendation of staying here and when we do it again for a stay of say, 3 nights or longer-I would go to the ABC store and purchase 2 chairs or loungers and an umbrella to use on the beach. The Westin will charge you $25/day for this combo and if you have a 7 night stay, it will add up. You can also do just loungers, which I think is $10 and but the umbrella for like $15. The beach is so wonderful, I can't imagine why so many people spend so much time at the pool. The rooms are very nice, although not huge. The service for the rooms is excellent as they seemingly know immediately when you have left the rooms. The decks are not large, but enough to sit and read a book for two and have a drink. Also of note is that if you go during high season, the hotel and nearby restaurants, etc. will be busy. This is where Maui gets a frown from some people because there are just too many people. Not a Westin problem, but just something to think about when discussing whether to spend time on West Maui vs. South, which doesn't get nearly as busy. The Westin Maui is a wonderful experience that is not completely upscale, but in a way that is good. It's real people having a REALLY good time vs. the semi-sterile environment of The Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting, Relax Or Be Active”
Reviews.Author: Tredpositive
Reviews.Content: Westin Maui Resort treated us like royality as Platinum SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) members by upgrading us to oceanfront suite! We were treated to iced champagne and notecard congratulating us on 30th wedding anv'y. Thank you Westin Maui for giving us a most memoriable week with your hospitality, efficient staff, gorgeous well kept resort areas, delicious restaurant food and live entertainment! Particular thanks to Rebecca at front desk for her patience and knowledgeable answers when trying to decide which room to book and resort questions. When considering vacationing at Westin or any Starwood property, highly recommend joining SPG program which provides many benefits for it's members. An immediate benefit is their own check-in/out line. Also, the 35% off rooms and restaurants with 6th night free for SPG members is excellent offer! GOLD level member perks ie 20% off spa treatments, 20% off Discovery Center (kids club), guestroom turndown including pool towels and wristbands left neatly on bed with flower, upgrades upon request and availability, late check out upon request, discounted beach cabana rental ($40 vs $55), large pool cabana rental ($75 vs $90) (recommend booking cabanas ahead). PLATINUM level member perks everything Gold level plus: complimentary access to spa lounge area (sauna, steam and jacuzzi), 2 for 1 kids at Discovery Center or 50% off 1 child, 10% off laundry and dry cleaning. There are also Instant Awards redemption at front desk for quick use of your SPG points for ie food and beverage, spa services and room credits. With all these member discounts and benefits staying at Westin Maui was both more affordable and easy! One of our best meals on Maui or any other island was enjoyed at Westin's oceanfront Tropica Restaurant, with live entertainment, ocean breezes, torches glowing, attentive service and all of our meals exceptional! Tropica also offers Happy Hour 3-5:30. Ono's Restaurant in evening also offers live entertainment, great casual dining with good food and bar as well. Ono's serves breakfast buffet which we recommend, as ordering off menu is almost as much as extensive buffet. Colonnade Cafe is great for quick cont'l breakfast items or delicious sandwich, salad, excellent smoothies, etc at reasonable prices. The Beach Bar located on upper level of pool complex at Adult Pool/Jacuzzi deck serves convenient great appetizers (pupus) and fab drinks. Beach Bar also has live entertainment 5:30-7:30, also Happy Hour 8-10pm. Between all their Happy Hours, free nightly entertainment and varied food/restaurant choices all set in gorgeous gardens, huge pool/waterfall complex, tropical birds, beach, and ocean sounds guests really need not go anywhere else to enjoy their vacation! Kaanapali Beach is excellent walking (sand and/or paved walkway), swimming, body surfing, snorkeling: best at Black Rock in front of Sheraton and other side in front of Westin Villas (free shuttle to both). Whaler's Village next door has many excellent restaurants some with live entertainment and lots of shopping. Lahania Town is 10 minutes away with more delicious oceanfront restaurants and more shopping. We booked highly recommended 5 hr snorkel cruise on Quicksilver boat thru Boss Frogs in Lahania. Best price offered with cont'l breakfast and grilled to order luncheon, sails to Molokini Crater and over to Moloaki Island for excellent snorkeling. Also, booked Air Maui Helicopter Tour of West Maui and Molokai Island thru Boss Frogs, again best price. Air Maui has most up-to-date helicopter with thick cushioned seats, individual air ventilation and wide windows for viewing. First heli tour I've taken and not gotten air sick because there was plenty of proper ventilation! Don't forget to rent vehicle and explore Maui's many coasts. Driving to Maui's South beaches is very scenic and enjoyable day out exploring and beach hoping. In front of Grand Wailea Resort is Wailea Beach. Grand Wailea has basically cut off any public parking access so have to drive past to Fairmont Kea Lani parking lots. Walk thru beautiful Kea Lani foyer, downstairs past lovely pools out to Polo Beach, which is lovely and quiet. If you want to get over to Wailea Beach to right there is easy garden lined with wonderful views concrete walkway which lets out in front of Hyatt Regency and Grand Wailea. BUT, further down past resorts is Big Beach with it's own public parking lotS and well worth the find! Wide, long, deep soft sand with lots of body surfing, boggie boarding and surfing to be had. Don't miss booking Old Lahania Luau way before vacationing on Maui. Best luau we've ever attended by being well organized, beautiful beachfront setting, delicious food and fabulous entertainment from time walking in to leaving stuffed and buzzed with top shelf drinks all night long. Cabs are relatively inexpensive, easy to pickup at end of evening waiting across street and best way to safely enjoy your luau evening. Best vacation Investment is Maui Revealed The Ultimate Guidebook with accurate and essential directions, restaurant and resort reviews, beaches, snorkeling, horseback riding, hiking, ziplining, etc knowledge of Maui! If you vacation on Maui and stay at Westin Maui, don't see how you would not have time of your life? ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: iGoFarDallas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights on Maui as part of an island-hopping honeymoon. As a Platinum guest with Starwood, we were upgraded to the Imperial Suite (room 1188) which is quite possibly one of the nicest rooms I have ever spent the night. The suite had seven balconies which opened to the ocean and pool. The view was amazing and the treatment we received across the property was very nice. We rented a cabana on the beach (for a small fee) and enjoyed the fresh pineapple and ice water throughout the day. The restaurants were very nice and served very nice meals. We took advantage of the spa and fitness center and highly recommend that future guests take advantage of this amazing benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler78
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were very pleased with the resort. We got an oceanview room when we were booked with a garden view, so that was a pleasing surprise. Our room overlooked the pool area and we had a lovely view of the ocean - perfect to watch the sunset. The room was great - an average size room with nice decor and plenty of space for clothes and luggage. Our room had one bed, bathroom with tub and shower, sink area, small fridge (even though sometimes it froze our water, sometimes didn't get it cool enough). The resort grounds were quite impressive - many swimming pools, a little "cave" with waterfall entrances, slides, and an adult pool w/ bar area. Just seconds from Kaanapali beach. The restaurants were great - we ate at Tropica, the Ono, and the snack bar. We also utilized the pool service when waiters/waitresses came by. We made visits to other hotels for meals (since they partner with the other Westin and Sheraton we had meal coupons and shuttle service) and I prefer the Westin Resort and Spa. It was the best between the 3 resorts I saw.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: chinacatsun2002
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a Beauty. Lots of space and stunning grounds. A lovely pool with waterslides and stunning flowers. The hammocks were great, and they even have real flamingos. They have all kinds of fun activities everyday including fitness classes for an additional $10. Although the Westin is NOT in Laihaina, it's in a great spot. It's directly on the ocean and really close to the black rock (best spot for snorkeling). We loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: NCtravel27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our stay to celebrate our five year wedding anniversary. The hotel is beautiful. There are several pools, all with great ocean views. The staff at the poolside areas were fantastic. Food at poolside restaurants was very good, and bar service excellent. Probably the most helpful thing at the Westin for us was the use of the "hospitality suite." Our plane didn't leave until 10pm on our last day, so we took a snorkeling trip that day and then came back to the Westin to use the "hospitality suite" to shower and get ready for our flight. On the downside, our room, which was "upgraded" to ocean view, was really a view of the airconditioning unit(see included pictures). Also, everywhere you turn at the Westin, someone is trying to get you to buy a "Vacation Ownership" aka timeshare. This got old after awhile. The concierge was helpful, but also directed us to the timeshare presentations. The excursions she offered to book for us were more than double the price we paid elsewhere. The other thing we didn't like about the Westin is that you get nickled and dimed for everything. For example, to rent a cabana for the day $60, to use towels $25, to take a yoga class $10, etc. All of this is in addition to the $20 per day "resort fee." In addition the parking is terrible, with folks often double and triple parked in the small lot when we were there. This forces you to valet park, which is another $10. I would prefer to stay somewhere were all of these charges are included in the price of your room. I doubt we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and fun vacation spot with family”
Reviews.Author: ccox02
Reviews.Content: Review for 05/05 through 05/13. I had compared many of the hotels in Ka'anapali for my family's vacation and the Westin was my best guess. It was the right choice. After our 8 night stay, my family doesn't want to go anywhere else for our future vacations. The hotel is the best on the beach for my wife and five year old son who love the beach and water. I can't count how many times we went down the slide or played in the grotto. We went up to the Sheraton which was our second choice and it was very nice but the pool was not near as nice as the Westin's. We also didn't see any kids at the Sheraton which could be a positive if you are looking for a romantic getaway which would be more difficult at the Westin due to the kids. But if you are traveling with kids, the Westin is perfect. We didn't use the Kid's Club but did stop in and it looked to be run very well. The staff was very friendly and my son didn't want to leave after he found the games and toys there. But a quick mention of the pool and he was off like a shot. The rooms at the Westin are acceptable. We had to change out of the first room due to the wallpaper falling off the wall in the bathroom. It looked like that was more the exception than the rule. The next room was OK even though the cleaning people weren't perfect. I enjoyed reading all the notes the previous tenant had made on the weekly schedule that wasn't changed out and the counter tops were sticky with I don't know what. After that first day though, they picked it up and kept the room very clean. They didn't have the king sized bed we requested but it actually worked out well having two beds which were awesome. My wife usually can't sleep in hotels but these beds put her right out. The breakfast buffet included in our package was an excellent value. It generally filled us up for the majority of the day with the plentiful fruit selection and omelet station which will cook any style of eggs for you, yes, even an egg white only one if that's your style. If you are going to do the breakfast, ask for a table at Tropica, their beach front restaurant. This was offered to us the first day and we asked for it every time after that since it wasn't offered again. Sitting at Tropica puts you right next to the beach for a beautiful view instead of watching the pool activities. Also, ask for the smoothies in the morning, they usually have a different flavor they offer a small serving of but we had to ask for it several times. The beach is a wonderful soft gold sand that was just what my wife was looking for. The water was crystal clear and you can even just walk right out into the water and snorkel for a great time. The fish are there, just go before too late in the afternoon when the water starts to get a little warmer and they move out to the deeper areas. We got an umbrella and chairs for several days. It is around $26 for two chairs and an umbrella until 4:00pm. They will only put out 20 umbrellas each day so once these are sold, they are done. You can get your umbrella first thing in the morning and then come back whenever, you paid for it, the staff won't mess with it. I asked about the wooden chair cabana type seats which they sell at the pool towel desk and they run for around $55 a day and have a half day for around $35. These chairs are not on the sand but offer wait service so you don't even have to get up at all during the day. If you are looking for a snorkeling adventure, we did the Gemini tour which was fine. The boat only holds around 45-49 people max and we only had 24 on the boat. It is a nice 4 hour tour with a motor trip up the coast and then we actually sailed back to the hotel. The boat actually loads and unloads right on the beach in front of the Westin. The boat even has windows on the bottom of the hull for viewing when you reach the snorkeling spots. A video of your trip is available for a fee, around $80 and they will spend extra time with you to get enough footage of you to make it feel worthwhile. The other hotels we had been considering when planning our vacation were down in Wailea. Good thing we didn't go in that direction. We took a quick tour on our way out and there is basically no beach down there. That is the spot during whale season but we were there after the season and the beaches down there are a beautiful lava rock with the crashing waves but not for us because we wanted the beach right at the hotel. Of course, if you want the lush tropical foliage, beautiful golf courses and high end shopping areas, Wailea is for you. The road to Hana. Well, after hearing that it was the must do, we did it. I will say the drive is beautiful, remember, it's the journey, not the destination. I can't tell you how many times we heard that. That being said, I loved it, of course, I was the driver. After my son ended up throwing up in the back seat from car sickness for the first time, I realized this was a tough one. He has been on some pretty seriously curvy rods without trouble in his almost six years in the back seat but this one did him in. It is a trip that must be prepared for and entered into with open eyes. If you go during a time with little rain, the waterfalls will have but a trickle of water coming over but can still be beautiful. At every stop on the road, the parking lots are covered with the broken glass from the car windows that have been broken as people take advantage of the tourists getting out and walking away from their vehicles. Just remember to keep everything out of the front compartments/seats of the car where you can see it. The suction cup marks on the front windshield are also a giveaway that a GPS lives in the car somewhere. I still can't figure out if the road to Hana is a local prank or what. When you tell someone from the area you did it they laugh and only after we did the trip did we see the T-shirts that read "I Survived the Road to Hana" that made me feel like I had just completed some crazy feat. I must say that the trip is worth while if you love the outdoors and want to see the natural terrain of the island. It's just not for you if you would rather spend your time on the beach. One final note on this trip, check your rental car CD player before buying the CD guide for the Road to Hana. After I bought the $20 CD at the shell station stand, I tried to stick in my new CD and found that there was already another one in the player. Who knows, you may get a freebie. We did the Old Lahaina Luau and truly enjoyed it. The staff are super friendly and really seem to enjoy their job. They are all joking and super attentive to your needs. The food is good, the bar is open and the view is spectacular. Just book early, it was sold out. I haven't been to any of the other luaus so I can't compare but this one was a good show. The hotel self parking does fill up at night so they will give you free valet but be warned, if you leave your car there the next night too and don't leave, they will charge you the extra $10 for that night. I just told the front desk what happened and they removed the fee from the bill right away. They will offer a time share preview but don't push too hard, just cards under your room door. We took the tour and kids are allowed, even a Gameboy to entertain him during the talk. You can also opt to have them attend the Kid's Club if you want for the morning. Just once we said we were passing, they sort of forgot about us and we just had to walk out after waiting ten minutes to get the exit survey. If you are looking to fill your mini fridge in the room, and I do mean mini, go next door to the Whaler's Village and visit the ABC store. You can get a six pack of beer for the price of one at the pool bar at the hotel. If you want even cheaper, go back toward Lahaina and go to one of the more local stores. We just got lazy and were enjoying our time at the hotel as much as possible and the ABC had pretty much what we needed. The hotel store was our last resort but still had the last minute snacks we wanted and you will pay for that convenience, but hey, we were on vacation. Overall, the Westin will be the hotel of choice for my family in the future and we will definitely be going back as many times as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ngabbay
Reviews.Content: My husband, my baby, and I spent 5 nights at this hotel in May 2008. We thought the lobby, beach, pool, and location were outstanding. When we got up to our room, a felt like I took at trip back to the 1970s. The room needed some serious updating. The carpets, wallpaper, curtains, counters were really worn down. The glass patio table on the balcony was broken in numerous areas. The glass bathroom lamp had a crack that went all the way through. There was dirt on the chairs and tables. I couldn't believe that this room belonged to such a well renowned hotel. I went down to the front desk, the representative assured me that the broken glass on the patio table and bathroom lamp would be fixed. It didn't get fixed until I complained again 2 days later. The overall character of the staff was a big disappointment as well. Any apology was insincere. On the last day we were told by the bellhop that we would be able to use the pool and then wash up in a room before we left. When we attempted this we were told that this was unavailable and had to change in the bathroom instead. again, this was met by a sour apology by the hotel manager who gave me her card and told me that she would "hook me up" next time i stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactlty What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: SadieStarfish
Reviews.Content: Many things... LOVE LOVE LOVE the HEAVENLY beds and truly recieved some of the best sleep of my life. (its terrible but two days i stayed in bed and didnt even go enjoy the beautiful hawaiian weather because the beds were just too comfortable!) I also really enjoyed the onsite Spa. The massage I recieved ranks up there with one of the best of my life. The pool area is very crowded but thankfully if you dont have children, there is a designated "adult pool". One experience i was specifically overwhelmed and grateful for was the generosity of the staff members on my last day. My beach bag was stolen pool side while I was walking on the beach at sunset. Various hotel employees were more then generous and kind in helping me. Security looked everywhere and got me in touch with the police. The manager on duty helped me check out without my physical credit card on me, as well as gave me an airport voucher as I did not and could not recieve and cash in time to leave on my flight. Keisha, my waitress by the pool was a GREAT listening ear, extremely empathetic and made my last day by the pool feel so welcoming - consistently checking on me as well as comping my meal because again, I was without funds and couldn't do anything about it until I reached the mainland. This is a beautiful (yet crowded like all the kaanapali) hotels on Kaanapali beach - but it is one of the most beautiful and the geneousity and aloha spirit of the staff really impacted my trip and made a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: daneaidan
Reviews.Content: Hotel has beautiful grounds and very roomy suites. The kids loved the slide and the adults loved the cabanas and the beautiful ocean views. Food and service was great. Employees were friendly and helpful at all times. We stayed the weeks the airlines went out of business and the hotel was very accommodating, they even credited one of our nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have moved in!”
Reviews.Author: TuckerQ
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay. The property is beautiful. The staff are friendly. Absolutely no pressure to do anything. There is a boardwalk that runs across the entire bay in front of all of the hotels, their restaurants, and a small shopping center. The lobby alone is amazing. Every time you come or go from your room, you walk through this open space with a huge waterfall, fish, swans and flamingos. I normally write longer reviews but this hotel seems to already be gathering pages of positive marks. Some cautionary notes - it is kid friendly and there are many children there. It was noticeable but not annoying if you aren't enthusiastic about kids - the Westin Maui Luau is not worth it, this was one of the very few let downs I experienced - it can be tough to get a lounge chair by the pool. If I ever return to Maui, I have no reason not to stay at the Westin Maui again. If you go, you will LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: marthaintacoma
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend a stay at the Westin Resort in Maui. The grounds were beautiful with waterfalls, black and white swans, pink pelicans and lush tropical plants. The hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and helped us plan our stay with very pertinent information. The location of this resort is excellent where you can snorkel at Black Rock, walk on the beach, run on nearby trails or golf not far from the hotel. The rooms have been updated and are very clean and well kept. The food at the restaurants on location is good if you choose to eat there and are convenient if pressed for time. We loved this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Had Fun - Long Review”
Reviews.Author: bosox2004
Reviews.Content: this wasnâ€™t a 5 star luxury experience, but it was a 5 star satisfaction experience. we stayed here at the beginning of may on a starwood promotion and were put into a 2nd floor
