room with 2 double beds, overlooking the valet parking lot to the right of the entrance as you drive into the resort. the front desk clerk would only upgrade us to ocean view for double our room rate. we stayed at the princeville resort last year on a similar promotion and were upgraded to a beautiful ocean view room at our request free of charge. so at check-in we were already preparing to write a poor trip advisor review. but the resort won us over. as the pix show, the room was very nice, and we had a view of the golf course across the street and the mountains beyond. there were signs of age, such as a missing marble baseboard panel under the bathroom sink and worn flooring under the mini-fridge. the door to the toilet/tub room also opened into the toilet, making access a bit difficult, and the lighting in there was much too dim. the empty mini-fridge was a nice touch, and we were able to load it with snacks and champagne from the star market 2 miles up the road or with takeout or doggie bags from restaurants. the room was right next to a hospitality suite and almost directly across from the 2nd floor promenade that provides access to conference rooms and ends in a stairway leading down to the pool area. however, the hospitality suite was vacant during our stay, and the only noise we heard in the hallway was the occasional sound of staff rolling carts on the service elevator. also, access to the pool area and to our car from our room was very easy by stairs instead of waiting for elevators. the grounds are lovely, the pool is like a disney fantasy, and the resort has a prime location on kaâ€™anapali beach, right next to whalers village. the public areas, including lobby, meeting room area, and restaurants are all part of that disney fantasy. the workout center is also amazingly good for a tropical resort hotel, where working out is likely a low priority. the $20 daily resort fee covered self-parking, in-room internet access, local calls, and bottled water every day. The self-parking lot fills up quickly, and regularly results in the valets having to double park cars when it gets full, which can be inconvenient if your car is blocked. the only meal we had at the westin was breakfast at the ono bar and grill poolside, which was good, although almost double the price of the same breakfast we had at the plantation house in kapalua two days later. however, starwood picked up the tab, the setting was beautiful, and the restaurant was very conveniently located at the bottom of the stairs at the end of the promenade outside our room. we also had great happy hour drinks and chips and guac at tropica, with our shaded table facing the kaâ€™anapali beachwalk and the ocean. service was very slow, however. for our restaurant choices see reviews here ( http://www.chowhound.com/topics/516516 ). gotta give special recognition to our concierge, sara, who is an endurance athlete with seemingly boundless energy and boundless enthusiasm for maui. she made several very helpful itinerary and restaurant suggestions, which really enhanced our stay. overall, we enjoyed the westin maui a lot, its location at kaâ€™anapali and its well-crafted resort experience being the highlights. weâ€™d definitely consider staying here again, but only in an ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Great time @ the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: jenqt
Reviews.Content: We just returned back from a 10 night stay at the Westin Maui with our two sons, ages 4 and 1. Great time was had by all. We were upgraded to an ocean-front suite upon check-in (we are Starwood Preferred Guest Platinum, so that might be why) and the room on the 11th floor was great. Life saver having a suite with a little one. (FYI, found out via their website before our trip that we could request a diaper pail and a highchair for our room--had always requested cribs but never occured to me that many hotels also offer these items as well. Was fantastic to have them, especially the diaper pail!) Kids LOVED the slides at the pool, my 4 yr old went on the big slide by himself and was able to have Dad or Mom wait for him at the bottom as he's not a great swimmer. 1 yr old loved going on the kiddie slide w/Mom or Dad, but also w/his brother (w/one putting him at the top and other catching him at the bottom!) Pools were all around fantastic, only wish they had some part of the pool that was shallower for the kids (shallowest was 4'.)We never had any problems finding seats at the pool, tho' most the shade covered lounges were taken by 8:30-9AM. This was no different than any other resort hotel we've stayed at, where people save their seats then go for breakfast. Never bothered us. Read some previous reviews before we left about the adult poool being un-monitored. This was not the case while we were there, as I mistakenly took my older son there (wasn't paying attention and really thought the pool adjencent to it was the adult pool, realized after that the "adults only" sign was for the walkway UP to the adult pool, not the lower pool nearby) Anyway, we swam quietly for a bit, did get a few looks (Kid-haters! LOL, jk) and a pool waitress politely told us that it was designated for adults. My one beef with the pools is that the kiddie slide needs some refurbishing, both my husband and I got little fiberglass burns/splinters every other time we went down. OUCH! Doesn't bother the kids, but adults have trouble sliding fast (not a lot of water to move you, as is designed for kids) and then you get the splinters. Needs to be re-varnished or something. You do not have this problem on the big slide. Nice being right next to Whaler's Village, went to eat at Hula Grill and Rusty Harpoon, both are nice. Shopping is decent, you konw its a bit pricier, but is so convenient. Went into Lahaina multiple times, ate at Moose McGuillicuddy's (sp?) which was great, the Hard Rock & Bubba Gumps (predictable, but also good), BJ's Chicago Pizza - great!, Kimo's - great! and our FAVORITE (sans kids while they stayed at the hotel w/a babysitter from Happy Kids Maui nanny service) was Ma La. It's on the ocean, on the other side of the Cannery Mall (off Front Street.) People did have kids there, but was definitely better for us to go w/out. I had the ribs which were absolutely delicious. We were also very pleased with the Ono Bar & Grill at the Westin. The food there was pretty good, and bonus for us, the kids meals there were both free (as they were under 5) so it actually was cheaper for us to eat lunch at the hotel. My 4yr old son did the Westin Kids Club one day and he loved it (he's almost 5, which is their age minimum, so we shamefully had him lie about his age. Well worth it.) We did not do the breakfast brunch, but did eat from the Colonnade, where they had cereal, croissants, hot brkfst sandwhiches, etc. We drove to the near by Safeway and got some supplies (milk, oatmeal, snacks, etc.--our suite had a mini fridge) so that helped a bit with the food costs. Hotel room walls are a bit thin, only a problem if you have inconsiderate neighbors who don't follow hotel ettiquette (like ours, who ordered room service, via speaker phone, at 11:30 at night, and shouted to ea other at 5:30 in the AM about who was taking longer to get ready.) For most, it won't be a problem I don't think. Loved Maui, was there about 8 yrs ago pre-kids. Next time I'd love to spend some more time shopping in Pa'ai (start of the road to Hana) a cool little hippy town with very cool shopping and eateries. (w/the kids, we made it 1/2 way to Hana, yay!) Overall we had a wonderful time at the Westin, and Maui in general. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The whales are amazing :)”
Reviews.Author: mauigirl11
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I have been to Maui, nor is it the first time I have stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali beach resort and spa. I got married at this very hotel last year and my husband and I could not wait to get back. I did not expect to ever be able to outdo the experience we had then but seeing the whales was definitely a close second. We were able to just stroll along the beach and see whales breaching (jumping out of the water) but the concierge also helped us set up a tour on a zodiac boat. How spectacular! The hotel was of course as fabulous as ever. I love the open air lobby and entire first floor. The pool area is magnificent as well. I feel this hotel has something to offer everyone (families and couples alike). We now bought a vacation villa with starwood and will surely be back every year. We usually extend our stay at the villa with a few nights in a hotel. I plan to come back to The Westin on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Will come again”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller1411
Reviews.Content: Service was great; when I called the "all in one" button, response was fast and courteous. I was ill and was moved up to a higher floor to accommodate my need for quiet. Heavenly beds are just that--heavenly. Location on Kaanapali beach is close to restaurants and shopping; great for people watching. Am planning on coming back for my anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “The best, most beautiful place to visit!”
Reviews.Author: sbstebbins
Reviews.Content: The staff was terrific, very responsive and the hotel is relaxing and beautiful. I felt well taken care of from the moment I arrived until I left to return home. The room was amazing, comfortable and with a breathtaking view of the ocean and the whales! I highly recommend this resort to all, I know that I will return many times.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to enjoy a relaxing trip.”
Reviews.Author: mamuch1
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui was great! It was our honeymoon and we got upgraded to a suite. We are not sure if they over booked our room or if they were just giving us a wedding gift. Our stay was amazing. Every morning we would wake up and watch the whales right off of our balcony. Their pool grounds were also amazing. A great environment for kids and adults. Their staff knew us by our first names and were very friendly. Their beds were also pretty sweet...made it hard to get up in the morning. I rate this hotel a 5 out of 5!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: melshawn
Reviews.Content: Yvonne, our consierge was extremely helpful. Very good service at restaurants at the hotel. Bellman was also extremely friendly and helpful- went out of his way to bring us an extra suitcase stand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Almost our fave!!”
Reviews.Author: trickechi
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. But I'll start with the front desk. Efficiently checking us in was key because from the lobby you can see the pool-side restaurant and all we really wanted was to get to our room and get down to the pool. The pool: amazing. Fun water slide even for adults. And overlooking the pool/ocean from our room was terrific. When we had our fill of the beach and pool, we sat on our balcony watching whales breach. And took a walk out by the neighboring hotels. Maui is paradise, but we've stayed at a number of hotels....this is our second favorite. The Four Seasons is our favorite...but totally unreasonably priced and the Westin is a close second in terms of quality, comfort, and best location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: tlmolaison
Reviews.Content: Was a wonderful stay everyone was friendly and helpful. The place is truly paradise. Kamilie at the spa was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love Maui”
Reviews.Author: grayhairpapa
Reviews.Content: Having spent a week last year at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa we decided to have a real vacation and spend 12 days this year in luxury. The staff was wonderful and very friendly. We were up graded to an Ocean View on the 10th floor. The hotel provided binoculars and we were able to sit on the balcony and whale watch. The pool is lovely, and luxurious. Did very little sight seeing and we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. The Spa treatments my wife had were fabulous. The restaurants were great as was the pool side snack bar. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in and we will go back again next year. The hotel also runs a shuttle bus to Lahaina which saves driving and finding a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Westin-Maui is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DavidsonProf
Reviews.Content: The Westin-Maui is a beautiful hotel, and we had a wonderful stay. Service is great and the amenities are excellent. The pool area is particular is spectacular with lots of lounge chairs, areas for kids and an adult pool. The Westin's location on Kannapoli beach is superb and we enjoyed the 3 mile walkway along the beach every day. If you can get the buffet breakfast included in your room rate, which we did, its fabulous. Otherwise, it's expensive to pay for it seprately. You also have the option of eating breakfast at other properties (the Sheraton), which we did a couple of days. Overall, this hotel is exactly what you expect to find on Hawaii with a beautiful open air lobby, waterfalls, tropical birds and plant. I would recommend it both for families and honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: freshbill
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were amazed at the property and the location. Then when we checked into our ocean view room we were instantly transformed into vacation mode and ready to settle in. Each day we experienced a different part of the hotel and surroundings even if it was somewhere we had already been. From talking to the macaw birds in the morning to swimming through the waterfalls to the hidden jacuzzi to relaxing on the beach it couldn't have been better. Walking down the beach to black rock we snorkeled and swam with sea turtles and tons of fish. Our friends had their wedding ceremony at the hotel near the beach was a warm, tropical romantic experience and the reception was held at the Tropica restaurant facing the sunset. After 5 nights we didn't want to leave but even now a month later, we still feel relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time at The Westin Maui AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: dgpittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We recently spaent our 2008 vacation at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. We try to Travel to Maui frequently and have been fortunate enough to visit the island several times. We have stayed at two other properties but we definatly prefer the the Westin. Its central location on Kaanapali Beach is great, just a short walk from Black Rock a greta place to snorkle. In the winter the humpbacks whales are regulary seen from the beach and hotel property. Everyone at the resort has always been fantstic and the service has alway exceeded our expectations. The pool is a great place to spend time relaxing the multiple levels provide plenty of room for everyone. We are already looking foward to planning to return.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali Beach at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: LesVaca
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui Resort and Spa is simply the best resort on Kaanapali Beach. The setting is spectacular, the beach perfect, and the staff very friendly. The Westin is centrally located: it's busy and loud around the pool areas, but has a feel of privacy and is quiet at night. I didn't rent a car and used the convenient Westin Shuttle Bus to go to Lahaina. The restaurant Tropica was outstanding, one of the best on Kaanapali beach. The breakfast buffet was outrageously priced and not worth the $26pp. The ocean view rooms and the Heavenly Bed made for a very relaxing time and a great night's sleep. Definitely an excellent choice of accommodations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: pssells
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare on Maui, but decided to let a relative use the timeshare and we chose to "try out" the Westin - It was beautiful and felt like Hawaii from the moment we stepped through the doors. The staff was friendly, helpful and always available. We started out with a room near the elevator that turned out to be too noisy, but as soon as we requested a move, the staff saw to it and we planted ourselves very comfortably for the rest of the trip. We ate and drank much of the time right at the hotel - prices were reasonable and we appreciated the atmosphere. We also had a "couples massage" at the spa - it was perfect. We have been to Maui many times, but for some reason, this was the best vacation yet - we enjoyed every minute of it. I would stay at Westin again if only for the beds! Penny Secor Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon At Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Mahoney12
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon and this hotel and its beautiful setting made for a perfect place for us to celebrate. The staff cared for us and took great care to make us feel like we were the most important thing in their day each and every encounter. A room service guy stopped to help us with our key. The valets encouraged us to take our time, gave us great directions and well wishes on our way (and greeted us welcome back when we returned). The desk clerks were gracious, the servers stayed to talk to us as long as we wanted. The pool waitress' were fun and engaging. The grounds were impeccable. We always felt special.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Escape”
Reviews.Author: allcet
Reviews.Content: Staff and facilities were excellent. Additionally, check-in staff went "above and beyond" to make my stay a memorable experience. One of the most beautiful places on earth - can get a bit "kid-friendly" so make sure you bring yours!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: cewltrvl
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant about staying here after reading many of the reviews posted on this site. We generally love staying at Starwood properties, and we were not disappointed in the least. Actually, we were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel, and especially our room. We booked an ocean view room, and stayed on the 8th floor and did enjoy a beautiful view. As mentioned on previous posts, the rooms are not large, but certainly not tiny. The bathrooms are small, but there is a good size vanity outside the bathroom with plenty of space for storing toiletries. Additionally, there is plenty of cupboard (with a safe & refrigerator) and counter space perfect for snacks, etc. The climate control worked very well for us, not at all intrusive or loud. We hoped to hear the ocean when opening the sliding glass doors, but the hotel fountains were quite loud (but not too offensive) and drowned out any ocean noise. The lobby really is very unique with lots of aquatic life. Of course, the beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was efficient, as was bell service, front desk and restaurant service. Restaurants onsite were priced as we expected for a Westin in Hawaii - about $75 for a family of four (kids ages 4 & 6) for a basic dinner without adult beverages. The Ono Restaurant had pizza on the menu, which the kids enjoyed. Our best value was stopping at Safeway on the way from the airport and picking up breakfast, snacks and drinks. The pool area could get quite loud with lots of children around, but we never had any problem finding chairs (not always shade, though). There is an adult pool here, which was a more relaxing alternative. The ocean directly in front of the Westin, while we were there, was beautiful but a bit rough for smaller kids. But plenty of calmer areas well within walking distance. Overall, this was a great hotel for our family and we would definitely go back. However, if we wanted a quieter getaway, we would also consider the Sheraton which is beautiful about 1/2 a mile away and much more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui (again)”
Reviews.Author: newportmom
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Westin maui - that's twice in five years!!!. We have two kids and they really love the pools at the Westin. We also stayed one night at the Hyatt - my kids liked the Westin pools and activities better, though I think adults might like the Hyatt better (quieter and nicer rooms). The Westin was the only resort that had a kids program for Easter - it was great fun - thousands of eggs to hunt for!!!! Rooms are small, but nicely done. The staff was overall really great. The recreation manager at the Westin went very far out of his way to ensure that my kids were having fun - he was really nice and clearly loved his job - this was the level of service we found overall while there. I highly recommend the Westin Maui for families with kids. Do be warned that finding chairs by the pool is a total nightmare - way too many people there on spring break!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed with the Westin”
Reviews.Author: BobnCarolyn
Reviews.Content: Our family of four arrived at the Westin after a three night stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk on Oahu. Our experience at the Westin was not as good as at Embassy Suites. The parking lot was full so the valet said there would be free valet service for the night...we were billed. We reserved a Garden View room...much cheaper than an ocean view and I love gardens so it was what we wanted. Upon check in we were "Upgraded" to a room on the 11th floor (top floor). The room overlooked the parking lot...not my idea of an upgrade. (After our kids go to bed we like to sit on the lanai, relax and enjoy our surroundings) We were told our luggage would be brought to our room. It arrived 45 minutes later. We had a lanai with a table but no chairs (all the others had chairs). When the bellhop brought our luggage we requested two chairs and were assured it would be taken care of. The chairs never arrived. We decided we really wanted a garden view room so we checked the availability and were able to move the next day. The view was much better (you could actually see the ocean too). The hotel grounds were nice...waterfalls, flamingos, parrots. The pools were nice also. There seemed to be enough chairs at the pools...we were always able to find some when we were there. The location was great...right on the beach. The Whalers VIllage was a block away...little shops with a food court for quick meals. The rooms were very small and seemed well worn. They could have used a good cleaning. I guess they are doing a room remodel...ours must not have been done yet. Overall Maui is a beautiful place but we would stay elsewhere if we were to return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: ckesler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin April 10th-14th, 2008. My wife and I used our Starwood points for an Ocean View room in the Ocean Tower (specifically #813) We loved the hotel. We were a bit worried that it was going to be a little too loud for us after reading all of the reviews, but I don't think either one of us every complained about it. The rooms were great for two people. I had read that they were on the small side, but didn't feel that was an issue at all. An additional sink, and an HD signal on the plasma would have been nice, but I'm not going to complain about that. It was clean and comfortable and that's all that mattered. The pool is awesome but be sure to get down there early, very early. We saw people putting their towels out as early as 7am. It didn't look like the Westin really monitored this either. We sat next to some chairs that were prime real estate and the people didn't show up until 2 in the afternoon. I didn't see any kids in the adult pool but you could hear them from there. It was much calmer up at that pool though. You are literally right next door to Whaler's Village and nice stroll down to Black Rock. I don't necessarily think I would be singing the same praises if we had a lower floor room on the opposite side of the hall. They had a nice view of the parking lot. Definitely ask for a free upgrade when you arrive. It never hurts to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamilySF
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a pkg deal for 5 nights and added a 6th night on separately. The rooms are decent, clean, but not large. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The poolside restaurant was pretty decent, but not cheap. Don't eat at their beachside restaurant. We paid $$$$ for not very good food. Finding poolside seating was a struggle so we chose to pay the extra $55 for an all day cabana for 2. It was awesome! A staff member came by every hour with cold water, gave us fresh pineapples in the morning and afternoon. We had shade and did not have to get up early and pretend to setup something before 8am in the morning and worry that someone would take it anyway. We even ended up buying a timeshare we had no intention on buying before we got there so we will see this place again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: ebat
Reviews.Content: I am finally getting around to writing a review for my Honeymoon this past Sept/Oct (2007). The Westin Maui was everything I could have hoped for...amazing pools, friendly and helpful staff, pristine beach, and delicious food! The staff was so great. They truely waited on us hand and foot. We never experienced any timeshare talk which I was a little nervous for. Maybe we were too young (my husband is 26 and I am 25). I would highly HIGHLY recommend this hotel to honeymooners, couples, families, everyone! We went at a slow time for families so it felt very romantic. I think the Westin's beach is the best in the Ka'anapali strip area. The Hyatt looks like it has a slightly more active pool area, but their beach isn't nearly as nice as the Westin. I also highly recommend renting a cabana on the beach for a day. As a Starwoods Preferened Guest member it was only $40 and it gave us a lot of privacy. The were coming by with water and fresh pineapple all day. I would also recommend that if you are traveling to this hotel that you become a Starwoods Prefered Guest Member. It is free and they have a special floor reserved spefically reserved for Prefered Guests. We were automatically upgraded to a deluxe oceanview room when we got there (reserved a garden view). I'm not sure if this is because we were Honeymooners or because we are Preferred Guests. The pools are so much fun. The slides are for kids and adults alike (my husband really loved the slides). We never had any trouble getting chairs, no matter what time of day we arrived. There is a "grotto" contecting a couple of the pool with a hot tub inside. Waterfalls are all over the place. One of the most beautiful pools I've seen. The location is great too. You are literally all a couple of steps from the Whalers Village which has great shopping and food. And it is only a 5-10 min drive to Lahaina with LOTS of amazing restaurants, shopping, the Old Lahaina Luau, and the famous Banyon Tree. The food is very good as well. Every meal we had was delicious. The breakfast buffett is a little pricey (I think it was $25.95) but very good. You have to expect some steep prices in Maui. Overall it was an amazing vacation. If you are visiting Maui you have to eat at Mama's Fish House in Paia and Kimo's in Lahaina. Two of the best meals I've had in my life!. We spent the second half of our Honeymoon on Kauai at the Hyatt. Please read review on Hyatt if interested.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui nice, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: luvsit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. Travelling was my husband, myself, and our 4 yr old daughter. We've been to Maui several times, usually twice a yr. for the last 8 yrs. We have always stayed in a condo, rather than a hotel, and have always stayed in the Wailea/Kihei area, this time choosing Kaanapali. We're chalking it up to a "learning experience"! To make a really long story a little briefer, the hotel is lovely in appearance, seems very clean. The pics posted on the website haven't been "fixed", it really is very pretty. The staff, for the most part we're very nice and helpful. We were offered a great room upgrade upon checking in, even though we booked a package deal through an airline, and not with the hotel directly. We paid for a mountain view, and were upgraded to a great Ocean view room on the 7 th. floor. This may have been because my husband mentioned that we're Starwood Preferred Guests, while checking in... not sure. Valet's we're quick and curteous. Unfortunately, on our first night, we learned that the hotel has no insulation/sound proofing. We could literally hear every word our neighbours said, if we didn't have our TV on! I am NOT exaggerating. Maybe it was worse as the room we had, had the door that can make it suite?? Not sure. Thank goodness, they left our 2nd day, and some quieter folks moved in! Although, you could still easily hear the words of people walking down the hall, especially while trying to sleep. If you crave quiet in your room, re-think this one. The buffet breakfast included with our package was really good, huge with everything from omelet station, fresh fish, tons of fruit, meat, cheese, waffles... you name it. We ate at the "Ono" restaurant at the hotel 2 evenings, as our daughter was tired and we didn't want to shower and dress for the more upscale restaurant "Tropica" (which I've heard good things about). Ono, for dinner was let down both times, could not recommend it. We had dinner at the "Hula Grill" one night, next to the hotel, good food, nice atmosphere, but make reservations! Shopping.... I love to shop on Maui, but NOT at Whaler's village! Wow, what a big rip-off! some of the chain stores like Roxy, Coach... we're the same as other locations, but the vendors were crazy!! I found some items to be triple the price or more, than some of the markets down in Kihei! Even most of the shops in Lahaina are much better priced... If you're looking for more mainstream shopping head up to Kahalui (near airport), for Macy's, and a great little mall with it. By all means, get out of the Resort!!! If you've never been to Maui before, you will not find a whole lot of "Aloha" at the resort. I think that's what made us feel like we made the wrong decision by staying here, felt like we may as well be in Vegas, with a pretty beach! Oh, the pool is great, huge, just like in the pics, water slides, fun for kids. I still can't believe how many people are out at the pool at 6 or 7 am reserving lounges! This is not for us. Give us Makena beach....Ulua beach, with a funky little condo with a view any day. It would also have cost us about half as much money. Don't get me wrong, I don't mean to bash the Westin, we are actually big fans of Westin properties. We love Mission Hills in Palm Springs... Westin Whistler in BC... Over all I'd have to say the "resort" experience is just not for us. So many little fees... daily resort fee $20, tipping valet on every outing...(oh try to self-park, very close and then you don't pay). Anyway, hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Things to do in Maui”
Reviews.Author: willnlauren
Reviews.Content: Westin Spa and Resort Kaâ€™anapali April 2008 Positives: (See pics also) My fiancÃ©e and I arrived and were greeted with leis. The open air lobby was amazing with a lagoon/waterfall backdrop. The pond was stocked with coy, black-white swans, flamingos, parrots, and cockatoo. The front desk personnel warmly greeted us and promptly checked us in. She asked what the occasion was for our visit. After replying that we were getting married on the island, she upgraded us to an ocean view room at no charge. View was amazingâ€¦sunset, Lanai, whales, beach, pool area. The staff everywhere was extremely friendly and helpful. Poolside bartenders poured nice cocktails. Their wedding staff actually helped us with the planning of our wedding even though we didnâ€™t go through them! The room itself was really nice. Heavenly Bed and Shower was next best thing to being at home. Never turned on the Plasma tv that was hanging on the wall. Free wireless internet provided a strong signal for my IPhone even poolside. The many pools and water falls provided a sanctuary to bask in the sweet Hawaiian sun. Beachfront was among the best we found on the Island for laying out and swimming. If you are into snorkeling, be sure to explore this area (esp. towards Black Rock, turtles and many fish). Even though we were towards the end of whale season, we saw whales just off shore many times during our 8 day stay. After exploring the Kaâ€™anapali strip, we both felt that the Westin was the best place on it. Resort fee of $20 a day includes self parking, two bottles of spring water a day, access to gym, plus more. Seeing that bottled water and parking costs are incurred in most places on the island, this fee wasnâ€™t too bad. We only ate at the hotel one time. This was breakfast at Tropica, and though it was one of the best cups of coffee and omelets Iâ€™ve had, donâ€™t think it was worth $40. (Buffet was $25pp, and may have been more worth it). Overall, I was very pleased with this resort and would recommend to anyoneâ€¦kids or no kids, newlyweds, older couples, singles. Negatives: These negatives are just an FYI. They have not affected our plans to stay there in the future. Everyone reserves pool chairs even though there are signs saying you cannot, and staff will take your stuff and store it if it is left for more than 30 minutes. My advice is to reserve early and donâ€™t leave for a long time if you plan on staying poolside for the day. Our cleaning lady was annoying. Being 6 hrs different from Detroit time, we went to bed fairly early (by 11) and woke up extremely early (usually by 5am at latest). So, our days started pretty early. The cleaning lady hit our room at the end of the afternoon, when we would be coming back from our day and wanted to get ready for the eve. She wouldnâ€™t switch our cleaning to earlier, and we actually just asked her not to clean a couple days so we could use the room. All she cared about was cleaning our room, and not whether we were happy. The last day, after checking out just before noon, I made multiple trips carrying luggage to our Jeep. After my first trip down, I returned to my room to find the door propped wide open by the cleaning lady (who was in the next room) and my luggage unsecured in plain view. I closed the door for this next trip down and she again propped it open. Made me feel like I was no longer a guest there, and wasnâ€™t important. This was reflected in my hotel survey. Self-Parking is part of your daily resort fee. Parking lot is right next to hotel, which is good. Bad thing is, the hotel sells spots to outside parkers during the day, which causes the lot to be full to hotel guests. This happened numerous times daily. Hotels fix for this was free valet, which I would have gotten my car faster if I self parked. There are 7 pools at this hotel. One is designated as an adult pool. This was never enforced, and it made it difficult if you wanted to get a good afternoon nap in the sun with the numerous kids running thru the area. The thought was nice though. April 2008 MAUI VACATION SYNOPSIS Thursday Arrival at OGG airport. Car rental desk (where we rented a Jeep) was close and very quick. (Get your car rental out of the way while everyone else is waiting for the bags to come. You will have keys in hand before your bags hit the carousel. Drive to Kaâ€™anapali wasnâ€™t bad. Checked into the Westin (see above) www.westinmaui.com/index.htm We had dinner in Lahaina at the Lahaina Fish Company. Food was good, view was exceptional. Drinks were very weak and not worth half the price the cost. We watched the sunset on the seawall of Front St in front of Hard Rock CafÃ© (where I proposed). If you want a view of the sunset, unimpeded from the island of Lanai, you need to travel to Kaâ€™anapali or north of that. Friday We went shopping at Foodland for non-perishable grocries for the week. This was a relax day, poolside at the Westin. If you want to reserve a set of chairs and umbrella ($25/day), go to the towel desk at 8am when they open. Poolside and beach were great. Had dinner in Lahaina at Moose McGillacuttyâ€™s. Good place for pub style food. Saturday Woke up at 330am and drove to Haleakala Crater. www.haleakala.national-park.com Trip took us 1.5 hrs from Kaâ€™anapali. Sunrise was at 617amâ€¦Amazing! Totally worth the winding road that seemed forever. We went right to the summit and then stopped at viewpoints on the way down. We would have like to come earlier to see the area in pitch darkness so we could have seen the stars (light began to show around 0500). There a few telescopes just west of the summit at Science City (closed to public). The drive down was better than up because we were able to see our surroundings. It was amazing to see the change from â€œMarsâ€� at the Crater, to forest, then to beach. Oh, and on that note, the change from 38degrees and 30mph winds to 80degrees (dress warm). On the way down we stopped at Kula Lodge to have breakfast. www.kulalodge.com/restaurant_lodge.htm The food was exceptional. I had corned beef hash, potatoes and toast (homemade jams with Hawaiian fruit) and my FiancÃ©e had the bananaâ€™s foster pancakes (WOW!). A must stop on the way down. We were glad we didnâ€™t do the bike ride down cause we were on our own schedule and were able to stop and eat there. At night went to the Old Lahaina Luau. www.oldlahainaluau.com/index_main.html Food was very good, same as all Luaus. I feel that all Luaus are too commercialized and only went so my FiancÃ©e could experience one. Donâ€™t think that this particular one was worth paying more for. See vendors in downtown Lahaina for super discounted rates on Luaus. Sunday Breakfast at Westin Tropica. Expensive, go for the buffet, more choices for the price.Relax day by the pool. Got married at Kapalua Bay. It was so nice. Beautiful area with Lanai, Molokai, and the sunset as the backdrop. Had our wedding dinner at Iâ€™o in Lahaina. Food was really worth it. Monday Lanai Wild Dolphin Snorkeling tour with the Pacific Whale Foundation. www.pacificwhale.org/ The staff was very knowledgeable, biology college students. A very Eco Friendly tour with Biocompostible cups and reef safe sunblock (30)â€¦they provided. We saw many whales breach the water on the way to and from Lanai. Saw about 50 Spinner Dolphins. I have been to Mexico, Virgin Islands, South Carib, Bahamas, Grand Cayman, the Big Island Hawaii, and Jamaica snorkeling. The two reef spots they chose fell at the bottom of my list of places I have been. Hardly any fish or turtles. I suggest taking a trip to Molokini to snorkel and a separate trip if you want to see the dolphins and whales. (NOTE: there are many great snorkel places from Kapalua all the way down to Makena that are easy to access and free if you do your research). We ordered room service after the long day in the sun. Tuesday Drove North from Kaâ€™anapali on Hywy 30, 36, 38, and 340. Not a popular trip, but it was relatively short (compared to Hana) and definitely worth the view. Feel of coastal California hywy. We stopped in a village about half way and bought some Banana Bread and Coconut from a nice lady that sells the stuff from her house. Her house is the first sign when traveling from the West. Short drive down her driveway, she welcomed us happily and even allowed us to view the ocean from her back yard (her idea). From there we headed towards Wailuku. Had lunch at a place called Main Street Bistro. The food was outstanding!!! Just down the road from the entrance to the Iao Valley. Park and parking is free. Valley was surrounded by huge walls of green vegetation. Two streams met at the park and provide great photo ops. If you walk up to the Needle Lookout point, take the trail behind it up. This hike is for those in somewhat good shape. It takes you up so you can see the backside of the needle, where you can actually see waterfalls that you couldnâ€™t see from the lookout point. Be careful though, most of the trail is cut cliff side, and though there is vegetation next to the trail, it is a long way down if you fell! After all that, there was still time to chill by the pool (trip took from 7am-2pm). We had dinner at Front Street Bar and Grille. Ribs were top notch. Wednesday Road to Hana at 7am. If you have two people, have one drive there and one drive back. There is no error for driving mistakes while driving the twists and turns of the road. Getting the Road to Hana CD was worth it (we got it thru the Expedia Travel Expert office in Lahaina (on the Honoapalini Hywy). They had great deals on tours. See Lisa, she was so helpful! (Tell her the Fireman from Michigan sent ya). After exploring Hana, we stopped at a home selling BBQ roadside (just after Hana, on the left, on the way to Hamoa. Honestly some of the best food we ate on Maui. We both had the Mahi Mahi with fresh veggies and rice, and were stuffed after. This guy works for Hana Fire Dept too. It is quite the ride to the Seven Pools and Waterfalls, but worth it. NOTE: Travel to the Crater and Pools within 3 days of each other and you can use the same park pass. We ate dinner for my Wifeâ€™s Birthday at Pacific Oâ€™. Food was great, view was great, service not so good. Thursday Last day, 1040pm flight. Westin couldnâ€™t allow us to checkout late, but did offer their hospitality room for 30 minutes so we could shower and change before leaving. So, we spent the last day by the pool and snorkeling along the beaches of Kaâ€™anapali. After packing up, we went to Mamaâ€™s fish House (www.mamasfishhouse.com) for dinner before our flight. We arrived an hour early and couldnâ€™t get seated early (definitely make reservations). They did seat us at exactly our reservation time though. I was very impressed with their style of waiting for a table. The ocean front property was perfect, the dÃ©cor and atmosphere amazing, and the food was the best we had all week and definitely worth the price. I had the Pua Me Hua Hana â€“ In the style of Old Hawaii â€“ Ono and Opah sautÃ©ed in coconut milk, with slow-cooked Kalua pig, grilled banana, Molokai sweet potato, Island fruit and a fresh coconut and my Wife had the Mahimahi caught by Jeff Holland along the north shore of Maui â€“ Stuffed with lobster, crab, Maui onion and baked in a macadamia nut crust. Dessert was Banana Macadamia Nut Crisp served warm with Tahitian vanilla ice cream and also a cup of Kona Coffee ice cream. A perfect way to end a perfect week in paradise!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Better Than The First”
Reviews.Author: wjsdunning
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day stay at the Westin and we loved it. This was our second stay and the reason it was bettter was the room we had this time. We were in a Premium Ocean View in the Beach Tower, room 782. The first time we stayed in the same tower but were overlooking Whalers Village which was very noisy. The View from 782 was fantastic with the pool area and ocean right there. We could also see whales right from our room. The hotel is great for families and my son loved the pools. The hotel is busy but that was okay with us as you just adjust. If the pool was too busy we would just go to the beach and try back later. Early mornings were quiet and evenings were empty. The hotel is expensive but the location is worth it You could stay there for your whole vacation and never have to drive. You have shopping ,snorkelling,.pools, a great beach and restaurants all in walking distance One way to save money is by joining the Starwood program, it is free. We saved on our room and received 35% off our meals by booking through Starwood. Any question just E-mail me

Reviews.Title: “Westin great pools & grounds but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_4some
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Westin and were very impressed by the lovely grounds, lobby, and excellent pools with waterfalls and slides. Our 11 & 7 year old children loved playing in the pools one entire day. However, the rooms were only average at best. While the beds and furniture were nice the carpet was pretty nasty and the bathroom a bit dated. Although we didn't spend much time in the room, I expected it to be nicer considering the expensive rates. We had breakfast and luch at the hotel and the food was above average but pricey--even for Maui. This is a very busy hotel and a nice choice for families with younger children who like the whole mega-resort type of stay. For our family five nights at a smaller more tranquil hotel where we were out each day exploring wonderful Maui coupled with two nights at the large Westin resort was the best of both worlds. I would reccomend the Westin for families just based on the pools and activities but would suggest something more intimate for families without children or honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families, not for couples”
Reviews.Author: LCC79
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here for part of our honeymoon, and we could not wait to leave. The best part of the trip was the room upgrade; we were also given a bottle of champagne. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. The hotel has an elaborate pool area that makes it very popular for families, so don't expect a romantic experience. If you like walking the beach in Waikiki, with hotels jammed up against each other and people everywhere, then you may like the beach in Ka'anapali. We drove past the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua, and the area was much more secluded. We also spent two nights in quiet Hana, and cannot wait to return. So it all depends on the kind of trip you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Westin!!!”
Reviews.Author: Littleloohu
Reviews.Content: The Westin was beyond my expectations! First of all, when we arrived, the bellmen were quick and very helpful getting our luggage and parking our rental jeep. As we walked into the lobby, we were greeted with the friendly aloha spirit and a fresh flower lei. Check in was super fast and easy! Actually it was a great start to our stay there, we were given a free gift (Box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts, Mmm!). Our room was breathtaking! Looked very luxurious and classy! The kitchen area had a mini fridge with freezer, cupboard space, coffee maker (With free Kona coffee that gets replenished everyday). Same deal with the bottled water. There was also an ice machine on our floor, and each room (I beleive) has a little ice bucket. Beds were really cushy, the blankets were divine! They dont call them, "Heavenly Beds" for nothing! There must have been atleast 3 different covers on.. very convienient for everyone because you can chose your own comfort and take off some, or sleep with all them on top (Although it did get hot in the night) we usually ended up sleeping with just one. The TV was HUGE! There was free internet hook up for our laptop. Lots of desk area to put our luggage on. The lanai was awesome, we used it quite a bit during our stay. We had an ocean view, and overlooked the pools, so it was nice to sit and have lunch outside on the deck. Beware not to lock yourself out there though! We heard some yells from our neighbors who had done just that Haha, funny for us, not for them! I must mention the bathroom... AMAZING! The showerhead was also huge and felt soooo good! Like a massage! Theres even a cupboard with ironing board in the bathroom too. In the room, is a large closet, with 2 robes inside for you to wear during your stay. Nice touch. There are a couple stores in the lobby, one is like an ABC but more expensive. The other has clothing + misc. items. The Westin is located next to Whalers Village, where you can find an ABC store.. worth it to just walk over and stock up on food items and drinks. The pools at The Westin are by far the nicest! The water was a tad bit chilly, but you get used to it after a minute or two. The adult only pool was usually only occupied by a couple people, so it was nice to be able to swim around. The hot tub was great! Especially in the rain! It was usually pretty full at night time after dinner. The bar located right by the hot tub makes excellent drinks, I reccomend the Lava Flow! Pricey, but you have to spoil yourself once in a while, you're in Maui! Another thing about the pools.. lots of lounge chairs, but you should find one in the morning because they are full in the afternoon. There is a towel hut for extra towels, and a cute little shop that sells bathing suits and some clothing. Check out the grotto too, located inbetween the waterfalls! Never did go on the waterslide but it looked like lots of fun. The restaurants had great menus, and while we didnt eat at any, there were lots of people in them, so they must have been delicious. Room service was WAY overpriced.. something like $20 for eggs, and bagel.. not worth it. We drove to the grocery store and got groceries, definetly saved money this way. Pay phones were in the lobby, always available, and had a nice cushy bench to sit on while using them. We were spoiled while at the Westin, but found that people were a lot friendlier in Oahu. Staff was good here, but nothing to write home about. Also found this to be the case outside the resort, at the malls, gas stations.. people just werent as cheery.. maybe it was the weather? (Rained HARD for most of our stay, caused road closures, and radio advisories to stay indoors). All in all, a good stay, but I probably wouldnt spend that much money on staying here again. If you have money to burn, Id reccommend the Westin, as it had the most beautiful grounds of all the hotels, nicest pools, and a great location. Just a couple minute walk down the beach, is Black Rock.. a great place to snorkle. You'll find people diving off the cliffs too, something fun to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WVgirl2008
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Westin Maui in April of 2007 for 1 week. This was our first trip to Maui and we loved everything about it. There were so many things to do and we felt close to everything. We took the Hana Highway which was an all day event, played golf, and did alot of relaxing. The resort was within walking distance of Whaler's Village, which had some really great restaurants. We especially enjoyed The Rusty Harpoon for breakfast each morning. Our room was very clean and had a beautiful ocean view. The bed was truly "heavenly". We were within walking distance of the luau at the Hyatt resort and snorkeling at black rock. The resort was a pricey and so were the food and drinks, but we had expected that when booking the vacation. Everything that we requested at the resort was taken care of immediately. We did the timeshare tour and that is probably the thing that I regretted the most of our trip. It took at least 3 hours and they did not want to accept no for an answer. If your quality time on the beach is important skip this, they did give us some coupons and credit toward our bill, but was probably not worth the time. Overall, a very nice resort and Maui was everything we hoped for and will definitely be going back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JD1946
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for corporate events and families - but not for couples looking for an intimate quiet stay. The rooms (at least in the Ocean Tower) were amply sized, but very noisy. One can easily hear nearby hallway doors close, as well as when the guests in the room next door flush their toilet or take a shower - not outrageously loud but you can hear it. You can also hear the guests above you when they move their patio furniture around. Not a lot of thought went into acoustical engineering in this building. The restaurants were ok - but there is no "fine dining" venue that you might find at the Hyatt or Ritz-Carlton hotels. Lots of pools - and every one filled with lots of very young kids. There is an "adult only" pool, but filled with kids. There was absolutely no enforcement by Westin regarding the adult only venue. The pool wait staff was absolutely worthless. I could go on and on about this but the bottom line was that if you wanted something at the pool you had better get it yourself at one of the restaurants or bars. Location - absolutely fabulous! Literally right next to Whaler's Village where there are two great restaurants, Leilani's and the Hula Grill. Nothing elaborate but good food and service. Do NOT go to the Rusty Harpoon there - bad food and equally bad service. Great beach walking at the Westin. There is, of course, the beach and also a cement pathway that winds parallel to the beach from the Sheraton in the north to the Hyatt in the south end. Perfect for walkers and runners. So to summarize - if you are looking for a boutique hotel experience with a fine dining venue and a romantic peace and quiet experience - the Westin Maui is not for you. However, if kyou have small children - this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachbumNY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic Honeymoon in Hawaii. We stayed 4 nights in Oahu and 9 nights at this hotel in Maui. The experience was excellent. When I booked with the travel agent, they informed the hotel that we were honeymooners. We got a welcome package that included free buffet breakfast every morning, a box of chocolates, postcards and best of all, a 50 minute couples cabana massage at their heavenly spa. That was wonderful. In terms of the resort itself, we had an oceanview room in the ocean towers and the view was breathtaking. Each room had a balcony and you could see the beautiful beach, ocean and all of the resort's pools. The other tower, the beach tower would have had a side view of the ocean. The pools were soo much fun that we felt like little kids. They had waterslides, watersports and poolside bars. They also had 2 jacuzzis that were open until 10 pm. There were a lot of families there with kids but they have an "adults only" pool area that was more quiet and relaxing, but the kids pool was more fun because of the waterslides and waterfalls. The hotel is in an ideal location, right on Kaanapaali beach. The hotel provides umbrellas and chairs on the beach for $25 but if you want an umbrella, you need to get there by like 9:00 AM. We were there for a while and at the beginning of our stay the hotel was not that full and we were able to get chairs on the beach and the pool. But towards Valentine's day weekend, it got really busy and people would save their pool chairs before they were to eat breakfast, which was annoying but still not that bad. I don't think I really have anything bad to say about the hotel, my experience was great and the restaurant, Tropica was really good and very romantic. The are also right next to the Whalers Village, maybe a 2 minute walk, at most, where there is great shopping and a few great restaurants. Also, it is only about a 5 - 10 minute drive to Lahania with great shopping and restaurants as well. Also, in the hotels's other restaurant by the pool, they have live nightly music, but most of the restaurants on the island have that as well. All in all, it is a great resort with great amenities, beautiful views and nice people. I would definately go back if I can ever afford to go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: live4vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort! Spa was amazing. Pools aplenty! Staff very friendly, helpful and professional. Lagoon with flamigos right in the front lobby! It was a spectacular resort and I would recommend to anyone. Very close to shopping. The AMEX booth where you book excursions was very helpful and patient. The only two complaints are: 1.The restaurant for breakfast is way overpriced ($60 - $70.00) for 2 adults and a child. 2. Complimentary photo included and the photographer was in the lobby. We booked with no problems and the photographer was quite friendly..... until the end. They try to push buying their overpriced packages and when you disagree (only want the complimentary one) he turned on us. He became quite RUDE and refused to speak with us after that.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: 60-ish
Reviews.Content: The second half of our first Hawaiian vacation ended with a 7 day stay at the Maui Weston. We had just come from the fabulous Moana Surfrider on Oahu after 9 days of bliss. The drive from the airport was so fantastic and when I yelled out after seeing 3 whales jumping out of the water, my husband almost smashed into another car. The hotel was so beautiful as we approached and we were greeted with drinks and lei's. Check in was quick and when I asked why so low a floor, I was told they were full. Our room was spacious, clean. The view from the balcony was maybe a 4 foot swatch of the beach with the parking lot the main view. Not one to make trouble, we slept and woke up to smelly, noisy garbage trucks in the parking lot. We went to the front desk and a lovely Japanese girl at the desk told us she was sorry and would try to get us on a higher floor with a better view. She tapped on her computer for a time and said she would put us on the 7th floor with a pool, beach view. Since I had paid well over 600 a night...This was acceptable. She told us to come back between 3 and 4 for a room change...We went to repack our suitcases in room 325. When we returned from exploring this magnificent island, we were told we had been moved to room 326 from a not so nice male staff member. I was so angry. You moved us across the hall. We packed and unpacked to be moved across the hall. Only room available, I was told. I asked to speak to the Japanese girl and was told she was with a client and was unavailable. I kept telling him, I was promised a hgher level room to no avail. I gave up. When opening room 326, it was dirty with smoke stained mirrors and glass doors. The smell was disgusting. We look over our balcony and guess what, we see a mostly a roof with a little ocean and pool. Now I am furious so down to the desk again and of course the Japanese girl denies that she promised a higher floor for us so I ask for a manager and after 45 minutes of waiting, I am told both are busy and cannot see us. Totally discouraged, we went to our room changed and went into the magnificent pacific ocean....Upon returning to the room a message was left by the manager, Jeff. I paged him as he asked. I asked him if he would come to our room. He did and was wonderful. He listened to our story. I was visibly upset since I paid top dollar to be treated so rudely. This was our 40th anniversary and our first time to Hawaii so I spared no expense. He said he would work on it and did agree the room smelled horrible....We don't smoke. Within15 minutes we were told by Jeff that he had a beautiful room for us in fact he had 3 different rooms we could view. HUM.....We are ful is what I was told at first. I told Jeff how grateful I was and we moved into the next new room which was so fabulous. Jeff was the niciest person and I thank him but how could the front desk have treated us so badly when Jeff found a beautiful view room. They kept saying they were full...Well that really wasn't my problem. I booked this trip 6 months ago. I had. joined the Starwood program but I am not sure, I will ever stay at a Westin again. Packed and unpacked 3 times in 7 days. The beach and pools were so wonderful but I can't get the nasty way they tried to cheat us with a lousy room when they had better rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Experience At the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: UNCPharm05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Westin Maui (Feb 16 -22). We stayed in room 678 a Premium Deluxe Ocean View Room in the Beach Tower. This was our second trip to Kaanapali beach and our first stay at the Westin. Our check in went very smooth. We pulled up in our rental car, and the bellmen just about had the car unloaded before we could even get out of the car. We were greeted with leis and headed to the front desk. Jeff at the desk was very helpful. He quickly provided us with our room keys and a quick overview. Then we went to our room which was exactly what we booked. About 2 minutes later the bellman arrived with our luggage. The wine and flowers I had prearranged with Ally, one of the great concierges, were there as ordered. There were a few minor things such as the lack of robes and bottled water. But a quick call to the front desk and all was taken care of. Our room was great. I had read reviews the rooms were small, but we had no complaints. I guess if you were trying to squeeze a family of 4 or 5 in, I could see how it might be tough. For 2 it was just perfect. I would suggest 2 adjoining rooms for a family with an extended stay. We could have done with another drawer in the dresser, but other than that it was just right. The bed was very comfortable as advertised (Heavenly Bed). The flat screen TV was nice too. But most of the programming was up-converted 4:3 instead of actual 16:9 HD. No big deal unless your a true tech geek who came to Maui to watch TV. The room was clean. Perhaps not the cleanest hotel room I've been in but certainly not dirty. The view was great. With the hotel provided binoculars we could whale watch right from our balcony. The bathroom was more than adequate and fairly sizable, but it wasn't the most luxurious hotel bathroom we have ever seen. That award might have to go to Bellagio in Vegas. The pool was nice as well. Some of the best chairs do get taken early in the morning, but you could find a chair somewhere at anytime. The wildlife in the lobby pond/waterfall area were fun to watch as well. Our booking included vouchers for the buffet breakfast at Ono every morning. The food was pretty good as far as breakfast buffets go. The omelet/egg station was very good. I'm not sure we would have eaten here for $29 if it was not included. If we did we probably would have ordered off the menu. The food/beverage service pool-side was very good. The waitresses were attentive. The food and drinks were a little pricey. But keep in mind you are enjoying them at one of the best pools on Maui while looking at one of the most beautiful ocean views in the world. I would recommend using the valet if you have a car. It was quite convenient. When you are getting ready to walk out the door for the evening. Simply press the service express button, tell them your claim number, and your car will be there by the time you get to the front door. The $10/day valet fee was well worth it. Somedays they do not charge; if self park is full valet is free. Check out went just as smoothly as check in. We called down for a bellman and to have the valet bring the car around. The bellman came up in about 10 minutes. When we got down front our car was waiting. The bellman helped us load it up and we were on our way. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Westin. We would definitely consider staying here again if we return to the area. It is a little pricey, but certainly not the most expensive on Kaanapli beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for Families”
Reviews.Author: Travlisforme
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 teenage sons) just stayed at the Westin Maui over February vacation week. The hotel is set in the resort of Kaanapali, which is series of high rise hotels on the beach, similiar to Aruba or Miami. The Westin building appears to be about 30 years old, but has been thoroughly redone and very current. In general, the hotel is on par for Westin, meaning the rooms are quite nice, modern, very clean, and the staff is great and very acomodating. Overall, our experience was way above average bordering on Excellent. The only minor things we personally did not care for, were the sheer number of people always crowding the pool area, which at times made us feel like we were on a cruise ship. This was our fault, as the hotel does not purport to be a small boutique hotel. In spite of this, the amount of activity was probably perfect for teenagers. The other compaints were that the beach was seperated from the pool area, and that the room layouts were somewhat small (as the building is older), and as we found throughout Hawaii, the food was very expensive. All in all, we cannot complain. The staff was great, the rooms nice, but if you are looking for a more spreadout, low key hotel, you might be best looking at either another island or a smaller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: We received a mailer to stay at the hotel for discounted price as part of their timeshares promotional rate. It was indicated that there was no requirement to attend the presentation, so we figured why not. So, off we went... We stayed for 6 days, 5 nights. The goods: - The hotel itself is beautiful. The fountain especially is breathtaking. (I wouldn't get too closed to the flamingos though :/) - Beautiful pools. - Excellent customer service. Everyone was very nice and very accommodating. - Very comfortable "heavenly" bed - We were upgraded upon arrival, which was a very nice surprise. - Excellent drinks. We lounged around the pools the whole time we were there and were not disappointed by their drink selections - Location was convenient. We were closed enough to drive to Lahaina town. We walked to Whaler Village Mall, that's literaly next to the hotel - The restaurant/bar by the pool had free nightly shows. - You can sign up to a lot of different activities, especially for children, if that's important. Things that can be improved: - Again, the rate we got was part of their timeshare promotional, therefore, we were hounded by the timeshare lady as soon as we checked in. We just walked into our room, and our phone had started ringing. She informed us to stop by her desk for a $ 75 gift certificate that we could use towards anything at the resort. We told her we would stop by when we had a chance. Well, she called and called and called and called, and left at least two messages each day. She even dropped by our room a few times and left notes. Even though we knew what we were getting into before we booked this trip, this was still very annoying. My husband finally went to pick up this gift card she kept on referring to in her messages. Maybe we were just lucky, but she wasn't working then, and another lady gave us the gift card without giving us the sales pitch. We used the gift card towards our drinks :) - The room itself was very small. We couldn't have both of our suitcases out in the room. We had to take turn opening our suitcases, which was a real pain. - We had couple massage at the spa. While we were happy with our massages, I was a little disappointed by the facility. The woman side, at least, was very small. The whirlpool was also very small. I've been to a lot of spas, so perhaps I'm just a bit spoiled?? By the time we were done with our massages, we had about an hour and half left before closing and was told by our therapists to take our time and . I wasn't the only one left, but I sure felt like I was being rushed out. There was no drinking water left, for instance. The lady that was cleaning kept on walking back and forth and as she walked by, she'd look at her watch. I felt bad about staying in there, so I ended up rushing. I ended up waiting for my husband who got to enjoy the full spa experience for another 30 mins or so. Generally, we were very happy with Westin Maui. We would most likely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Grounds, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: mja1951
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Westin for 5 nights. Our friends went there on a package to see the timeshare, but we booked our room for $335 per night. After taxes and fees it was almost $400. Upon check-in, the staff said that we requested adjoining rooms. I said that we did not need adjoing room but wanted to be on the same floor. He replied that we were on the 10th floor and they were on the 3rd. ADJOINING ROOMS??? After screwing around for 15-20 20 minutes, he said we had a better level room and the only thing he could do was switch our friends from a king bed to 2 double beds. I don't know how that had anything to do with getting on the same floor. While the grounds and the pools were excellent, the rooms were small and outdated. The furniture was good quality but the room was so small the table was pushed up against the TV credenza and there was no place to store the luggage. The toilet seat wouls not stay up, so as a man, going to the bathroom was a real challenge. The next day I talked to a woman manager at the front desk and told her we were very disappointed in the size of the room, the toilet seat problem, and how this room is not what should be expected of a Westin. She repeated that our Mountain view room was a better level room than our friends. I told her that our friends have a full view of the ocean from their room. She instisted they didn't even though we saw it for ourselves. I told her I would be willing to downgrade to a worse level room if it meant we had an ocean view. She offered a $100 total discount on our stay and said the toilet seat would be fixed. No one came to fix the toilet seat and by the 4th day of our stay I finally contaced a property manager. He offered to comp a few days for a future visit and said he would get the toilet fixed right away. By that evening, no one had still come to fix the tiolet seat. I left a voice mail message for the manager. As we were checking out, a maintenance man was in our room to fix "the loose toilet seat"? I told him it was not loose but it wouldn't stay up. We left and hopefully the next person who stayed in our room had better luck. Overall, the locations and grounds were very good, the room was small and needed renovation, and the staff was VERY unresponsive to any of our questions or requests.

Reviews.Title: “High Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Stilettolawyer
Reviews.Content: We headed to Maui for a week of much needed relaxation, and the Westin Maui helped us to achieve our goals. Overall I would highly recommend the Westin. The Grounds: With five pools (one with a waterslide and one that promised to be kid free--although they didn't kick out kids), and a lobby full of coy ponds, flamingos and birds, the Westin boasts beautiful grounds. Though the exterior of the building seemed a bit dated, the rest of the Westin was gorgeous. We spent many relaxing days just swimming in the many pools, and playing on the waterslide. We met a lot of really nice people hanging out on the grounds, everyone was very friendly. There was often live entertainment signing in the outside grounds, and one night, they even had a fire dancer performing by the adult pool. Even better, the Westin is centrally located, and is right next door to Whaler's Village (where you can do some serious shopping and browsing), and it also is walking distance to Black Rock (a great snorkeling location) (although not as close as the Sheraton). The location alone is worth the stay. Also, from the adult pool, you have a prime view of the sunset! We had a great time just relaxing on the grounds of the hotel, and on the beach right in front of the hotel. Though the beach proved fun during the day, at night, it was empty and we felt like we had the whole beach to ourselves. The Rooms: The big draw for us was the Heavenly Bed (we have one at home)...and shower (we own the shower head as well) and it was Heavenly! The room was very tastefully decorated. A lot of people complain that the rooms are small...and while they aren't large...they were spacious enough for us. It was also nice to have a small fridge in the room, as we were able to take advantage of the ABC store (a store that carries an intersting variety of items including food--at relatively inexpensive prices) in Whaler's Village, so that we had lots of drinks and snacks on hand. Another random perk: every room comes equiped with binoculars...which came in handy throughout our trip. We read many reviews that the Westin often upgrades guest rooms, and we too were upgraded from a garden view to a mountain view for the first night of our stay. The mountain view was breathtaking. Although, I would caution, that mountain view on lower floors would have been a view of the parking lot. For the rest of our stay we moved to an ocean view room (see explanation below), and it was gorgeous; although, in hindsight, I would have kept the mountain view, as both were gorgeous--but there was a large price difference. The Restaurants: The Westin's restaurants are not that great. However, because of the location, you can easily walk to the restaurants in Whaler's Village, or take a quick car ride down to Lahaina for some great places (I highly recommend Pacifico's in Lahaina--the tasting menu is a must! and worth every penny!!!). The bar however was great! All the bartenders were very friendly...and I highly recommend the "lava flow." The Spa: We had a pleasant experience at the spa, and had relaxing treatments. The only complaint I had was that the quiet room/waiting room was a bit loud (and not that relaxing)--and surprisingly the staff played a part in the volume. However, they did have amazing dry fruit and tea and water selections, and the treatment itself was pure heaven. Romantic Weekend With Twin Beds: While we had a wonderful time, and I would highly recommend this hotel, the biggest downside for us was that when we arrived at the hotel, they were unable to accommodate our request for a king size bed. We had specifically requested a king size bed, but apparently the Westin does not "guarantee" that you will get the room you reserved. As the trip served as a delayed honeymoon for us, we were very disappointed to receive a room with twin beds. They were able to move us to a different room the second day, but, we had to choose between moving to a room with a view of the parking lot, or an ocean view (adding $200 plus per night to our stay). It was also inconvenient to have to wait in our room so we could be there when they were ready to move us, and then take the time to move to a different room--when we just wanted to enjoy Maui and get our vacation started. I also think they should have discounted the upgrade given the bed situation. However--they apparently have this problem a lot, as every time we walked by the lobby, we heard a couple arguing at the check in counter "what do you mean you don't have any king beds." It started to get comical by the end of our stay. It may have been the time of year (since we went in late September and kids are back in school--there were more couples than families). Smokers Beware/Non-Smokers Rejoice: If you do not like being around smokers, you will love the smoke free policy at the Westin--there is no smoking anywhere on the grounds of the Westin--not inside or outside. If, however, you are a smoker, beware that in addition to not being able to smoke anywhere outside, if you are caught smoking in your room (which includes your balcony), there is a hefty fine--though I am not sure whether this was just meant as a scare tactic or whether they actually enfoce this policy. Though you can't smoke by the pool, there is a smoking section right on the beach that isn't far away.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Lege
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby and pool area. We stayed here for our honeymoon. Because I was a Starwood Gold member, my wife and I were invited to the weekly general manager's cocktail party. We were really made to feel special with some unexpected bath and spa gifts delivered to our room. The breakfast buffet was very good, but I don't know if it was worth the $25 if you're just going to eat eggs and a waffle. Fortunately, I had Starwood breakfast vouchers. If you do go for the breakfast buffet, be sure to fill up on the smoked fish and tropical fruits. The location is close to other nice properties and a large shopping center is within walking distance. If you fly into the West Maui airport, the taxi fare is at least not too bad. Even if you have a mountain view room, the view is beautiful. Our room was generally clean and had a refrigerator which is nice if you want to stock up at the local Costco and enjoy a light meal out on your balcony. There is an adult pool, and the hot tub is open until later at night. The only downside is that we were frequently asked to go on a timeshare presentation for $100 in spa credits in which I had no sincere interest. If you get a rate of less than $250, I would highly recommend this hotel. If the rate is higher than that, I might stay at one of the neighboring properties, but still stop by the Westin Maui for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “bug going around the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: melena1
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying the staff was exceptionally nice. Especially the bell men and house keeping. Very warm and friendly, they went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. The room was small, needed some updating. The bathroom and tub left something to be desired although the duel shower head was great. The second day there, we became VERY ill with a stomach bug that had apparently been going around the hotel for quite sometime. We spoke to at least thirty people in the hotel who had the exact symptoms as us although no one on staff seemed to have heard a thing about it. (we flew in with 15 friends and no one on our plane became ill) judging by how often we were vometing, i would say our carpet would have needed a steam cleaning as would the rooms of the other sick people we spoke with. i thought i de post this in case others became ill also

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: aubhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of our trip for our 1st year anniversary. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff are really friendly. The design of the hotel is nice with a lovely waterfall near reception with flamingos. The location is amazingly beautiful with an excellent beach. There is a small shopping centre called the whalers village just along the beach a couple of minutes walk. Here they have a couple of nice restaurants and shops. There are alot of kids around as they stay for free, so if you dont like kids then its not your type of place. Also the restaurants onsite are nothing special including the breakfast but we just popped down to the local shop and bought some cereal/milk. There is a place onsite to book tours and I would definitely recommend the maui island tour which last about 4 hours. You actually get to walk inside an old volcano which was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgrade at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Skywalker05
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Westin for a week at the end of January. What a great property! Not far from airport (could find it easily in the dark), great lobby when checking in, and great location (close to shopping, cheaper eating, etc). My husband is a Platinum VIP member of Starwood properties, so we got a great upgrade to the Executive Suite. A great suite overlooking the ocean that provided us a view of the ocean and whales every morning. Location was everything for this resort, we went over to Whalers Village (right next door) or to Lahina (2-3 stoplights away) for lunch and dinner pretty much every day. A rental car is definitely recommended - allowed us to save a lot of money by not eating at the resort for every meal. The weather wasn't great during our week's stay, so we decided to do the Westin Villa Tour one day instead of sitting in our room waiting for the rain to stop. It took longer than the 90 minutes they say, but it was interesting. Plus, we received $100 off our bill plus 50% off our next stay at a Starwood property. That was definitely worth it! All in all, we would definitely recommend this hotel.
