Great location, great atmosphere, great pools (my husband spent more time in the kids pool sliding down the waterslides than the adult pool) and a great deal. Maui was beautiful and this hotel is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Sleep But Far From Heaven”
Reviews.Author: part_time_beach_bum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin three nights as part of a friendâ€™s wedding. Overall it was a fine experience and worth the rate we paid ($199 per night â€“ local rate) for a mountain view room but we felt that it wasnâ€™t worth the rack rate in the $400â€™s or even the offered discounted rate in the mid $300â€™s per night. We probably would stay there again at $200 a night but would not for a higher rate because although the hotel was very nice, I wouldnâ€™t say that it was incredibly special or unique. First the good. The hotel location was convenient, minutes from Lahaina and next door to Whalerâ€™s Village. The self park lot was close to the hotel entrance unlike some other resorts. The rooms were perfectly large for the two of us with a very comfortable king sized bed with high thread count sheets and down comforter (the Westin signature Heavenly Bed). The balcony was actually roomy for two and the room features were quite nice: flat screen tv, plenty of cabinet space (no closets though), separate table and working desk. There was a kiosk in the lobby that allowed you to check in and print boarding passes on all major airlines including the inter-island flights. We enjoyed the vast pool area as well as the quick access to the beach. My wife really enjoyed her spa and salon treatments and I though the spa facilitates were excellent with a nice coed waiting area overlooking the ocean and nice amenities in the locker rooms. We only tried Ono restaurant for breakfast which was very good but maybe slightly overpriced for the buffet breakfast. The various ducks, swans, koi and other animals were pleasant and we saw plenty of kids (and adults) enjoy feeding or watching them. The timeshare people were decidedly low key; we didnâ€™t get hit up once even when we asked what the starting price was out of curiosity. The so-so: As others have commented, the bathrooms were smaller but adequate. The provided bath products seemed pretty generic and not really a â€œHeavenly Bathâ€� but we had our own products and the plush towels and robes were nice. Our room seemed a little worn in places such as the carpet by the door (the door was so low that it stayed open without a door stopper), one of the chairs was stained and worn, and the table scratched and chipped. Most of this seemed minor and mostly just wear and tear. The staff was sometimes a little varied; mostly very good, professional and friendly (the cleaning, spa/salon, restaurant, and most of the front desk staff). Sometimes we found some staff (bartenders, banquet and even concierge staff) to be indifferent or even surly. We are pretty low key, non-drinking, few requests sort of people so we found it very surprising because we really werenâ€™t ugly tourists. In addition, we had a mountain view which included the trash receptacles below our balcony and quite a bit of parking lot noise. We understand from others this was way better than the waterfall noise that other rooms had or even the loud ocean waves that ocean front rooms had. The air conditioning was strangely not very cooling even when we lowered the settings. And of course, the not so impressive: One pet peeve I have is that hotels brag about their flat panel tvâ€™s but run then an analog signal to them so that the actual picture quality is not very good, much less high definition. To be fair, the hotel never says they have high definition tvâ€™s but I think most people think flat screen or flat panel necessarily mean high definition digital tv. On a more relevant note, we found some areas of the hotel to be strangely lacking for a high end hotel. For example, the fitness machines had quite a bit of rust on them. The bathroom ventilation grill had black mold on it. The small older refrigerator didnâ€™t shut properly so it never really cooled our bottle of water or anything else. Again this was mostly more of an annoyance than anything serious. We thought the resort fee at this particular resort was unreasonable. We used few of the offered items, e.g. shuttle service, free photograph, high speed internet connection and shopping bag. The self park was a good except that for two of our three nights, the self park was full and we had to use the valet. We thought the banquet food was pretty mediocre even for usual rubber chicken meal. The other issue was that it was fairly expensive even by high end hotel standards. Bottled water was $5 at the bar, we were charged $12 for a lava flow, both of which might have been a mistake but the breakfast buffet was $25. Some of it was worth the spurge but a lava flow is not a glass of champagne and that was too much for a small bottle of non branded water. As you can see, there really wasnâ€™t much really wrong with the hotel. The Westin was nice, the beds were comfortable and people for the most part were friendly and professional. It just seemed overpriced compared to other Westin resorts or high end resorts for what you actually got. I think we would definitely stay there again at the price we paid but definitely not for a higher price. There are a lot of other choices in the area which might be better values.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property that lacks ALOHA spirit from the staff”
Reviews.Author: buffalorx95
Reviews.Content: Ok, before you judge my review you must know 2 important facts about me as a traveller. I travel 40-45 nights per year on both business and personal travel. Typically I stay at properties such as Hyatt, Hilton, Mariott, and Westin. Pros- The Hotel property is situated on the beautiful portion of the Kaanapali beach where the water is clear . I mention this because we also stayed at the Hyatt just down the beach and the water there was disappointingly murky (service was impeccable and much more ALOHA at the Hyatt- more on that later). Loved the fact that the Whalers Village (restaurants, shops, and convenience store) is right next door to the Westin. Literally, a 3 minute walk... which is nice if you are on a budget, which we were not but are prudent with our choices. Location again was a key turn on as the famous "Black Rock" snorkeling area is a short walk away. We saw sea turles, puffer fish, yellow tangs, etc...This was my favorite spot to snorkel.The pool has a fun water slide for the kids, and the atrium has flamingos and swans. Bottom line, the atmosphere and grounds make it a top choice for hotel selection based on LOCATION ALONE!!! Cons- Frankly this was a place that I felt lacked the ALOHA spirit of Hawaii. The employees seemed uninterested in service. This was apparent from check in throughout the 5 nights of lunch/dinner service, pool area, concierges, etc, If you are a discerning traveller that pays for and expects a higher level of service, DON'T, not at the Westin Maui. I guess I expect high level service from a hotel that I pay $500 a night. While this absolutely did not ruin our trip (how could you when you are in Hawaii), I found a few things peculiar. When we entered for check-in nobody greeted us with our welcome leis. This is standard for all guests checking in. Perhaps it was because we were a family of 4 with kids??? We later requested this service as we were departing and got a "put off" type attitude from the greeting person at the front. But, I just had just dropped over $3000 for the 5 nights stay, so I suppose two ~ $10-15 floral leis for my boys should not have been a big deal :) It took 3 hours and 2 phone calls to the luggage stand to get our bags (the kids needed swim suits to go swimming). This was after tipping the baggage handler $10 for 4 bags...perhaps I should have done $20 since this is Hawaii? At our first meal at the ONO Grill (Kids eat free but pretty limited menu for kids), the waitress ditched us halfway through the meal. I suppose it had been a long day so I understand she may have wanted to go home. Another gentleman helped serve us, cleaned up, and dropped the check. I hope the 25% gratuity I left stayed in his pocket and not the young lady that was so recalcitrant earlier toward us. Beach towel hut personnel were a bit short with our kids when geting towels, but just make sure you get towels for the family. No big deal. Bottom Line: We loved Maui and our experiences from the different places we toured and visited had the ALOHO spirit Hawaii is famous for. Westin clearly remains on the lower rung of service excellence among the Big 4 (Hyatt, Mariott, Hilton, Westin). There just is no ALOHA at the Westin Maui. All of these are little things but lower your expectations if you stay there or have been pampered by the Hyatt, Hilton, and/or Mariott

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: Wesi1910
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at this hotel and I was lucky enough to be invited to come along. We had a room with full ocean view and enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the morning, watching the whales near the shore! The walls are indeed a bit thin and if you have a room with an adjoining door it can get quite noisy. The service we received was very good - the one downside was the housekeeping which pestered me one day. As I was ill I hung the do-not-disturb-sign out but was still called twice, even though during the first conversation we agreed for the next day. We enjoyed the excellent breakfast buffet and meals at the ONO bar. The Tropicana bar also opens for breakfast during busy weekends. What bugged me was the attempt to sell the time share - it was ever so present throughout the hotel. However, once I told them clearly that we can't afford the time share they did not attempt it again. One more thing about the noise - the ocean side is very noisy too. We were on the 6th floor and right above one of the waterfalls. We would have appreciated if the waterfalls would have been turned off for the night. In the morning we were woken by the birds in the palm trees just in front of the balconies. Although there's nothing you can do about them it could get a bit annoying due to the sheer noise. However, if I had another chance I would return to this hotel - although it's rather unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... if you've got the dough... and not perfect”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: We received an excellent rate for this hotel - about $150 per night - if we had spent anywhere near $400 as listed we would have been very disappointed. For $150 it's a great experience in a great location. However, there are some imperfections which may bother you more or less. The good- 1. The lobby is beautiful and tropical - waterfalls, banyan trees, flamingos, some nice places to sit, and open to the weather. It is a nice first impression. 2. The pool is stunning. It actually consists of 4 or 5 small to medium pools on approximately 3 levels, connected by landscaped walkways, 2 slides, 3 or 4 waterfalls, etc. This is part of a recent renovation and shows. This is the centerpiece of their landscaping - it is quite large and very well done. There are a couple bars, stages, and sitting areas interspersed. 3. Beach access is excellent. From our room to the beach was less than 5 minutes by elevator and foot. The beach is not really wide, but it is not crowded, and the water has just a few small waves, enough to bob in but not enough for bodysurfing. We took our 1 year old to and into the water's edge with no problem. 4. Access to the local shops and restaurants - much of lower Ka'anapali is walking distance - Whaler's Village is right next door, several restaurants, other resorts and beaches all close by. 5. The room was clean and well-appointed. Very large flat-screen TV. Small but adequate fridge, small safe. Bed was firm but had a pillowtop, so comfortable. Towels and robes are very fluffy. The fair- 1. The service overall was pretty good - but always felt a little uninterested or distant. For $400 or more per night I would have been annoyed. There were no service gaffes at all, just nothing really special. 2. The standard room is not large. There is enough space to move around in, but with a baby and 2 adults we did not have 'excess' capacity. 3. self-parking is very convenient, but the spaces are tight and sometimes you have to search a bit to find a space. The not-so-good- 1. Our room was quite noisy. We were almost directly over the front entrance and the parking lot - and you can hear cars arriving, music playing, bellhops talking, etc., until late in the evening. In addition, the doors and walls were thin. We could hear the TV in the room next door, and from the hallway we could hear other people placing their keycards in their doors, the elevator beeping (we were 3 rooms down) as it went up and down the floors, and housekeeping vacuuming the hallways in the afternoons (during prime nap time!). Bring earplugs if you are at all sensitive to this. 2. Plan to pay for the privilege of staying at this hotel. Everything costs extra. There is a $20 mandatory daily resort fee which covers 2 bottles of water, wired in-room internet access, self-parking, and gym access. The business center has computers but they charge you $.65 per minute; a mai tai at the pool cost $9.25; 1 dessert was $11; etc. It shouldn't be a surprise at a resort like this; just be prepared. 3. If you want to do anything other than wander around the beach, I recommend renting a car. We used the car almost every day to get take-out food, to go to Lahaina, to see South Maui or Haleakala, etc. There is not a lot 'to do' in Ka'anapali other than sand and sun; no history, no culture, not much in the way of 'attractions.' Overall this is a good place at the right price. The biggest problem was the noise, which was easily averted with earplugs. Otherwise no major complaints, and it was a nice splurge for us. We'd go back if we could get another good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: chinadoll418
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I discussed a trip to Maui and less than a week later I received a mailer for a vacation package to Westin Maui. It was a sign, we had to go. We booked thru Starwood Vacations and had to rescheduled our initial trip due to family illness. The guest services took great care of us in both instances and called up with reminders of our trips. We checked in and got quick service and an upgrade. I didn't get the name of the young lady who helped us, but I appreciated her efforts every morning as had a view of the mountain and golf course as the sun rose over the mountain. Milissa was my onsite concierge and she gave me great ideas on where to go the island. She informed me of the villas tour that I took advantage of and got some great incentives. Alberto was my guide to the villas and he also gave me some great tips on where the locals hang out and some great places to eat that were good, but affordable. In addition, I bought another vacation package to return to Maui and explore more Starwood resorts. My boyfriend who has very high costomer service expectations was even impressed with how friendly all the staff was. I woke up every morning before the sun (and my boyfriend) rose, so I worked out in the gym, then hit the beach for a 2 to 3 miles walk every morning. If I lived here, I'd be in great shape! Westin is in the center of Kaanapali, so I was able to walk everywhere within minutes. It was a real vacation just not having to do anything or be anywhere at a certain time.

Reviews.Title: “A True Paradise is Found...”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin Maui on an incentive trip I earned from my direct sales business. I traveled with my husband and 2 children, 8 and 11. I cannot say enough good things about this whole vacation experience... my husband and I were ready to move there and were sooooo sad to leave at the end of our trip. So, to begin with the Westin was a BEAUTIFUL, top notch hotel! It is right on the beach and has lots of places to eat, drink, and swim. We were restricted from the adults only pool because of our kids but we didn't mind at all. The pool area is HUGE and the kids loved it! There is a high waterslide that my son loved and also a smaller waterslide that my daughter loved. The pool area was crowded but there were plenty of chairs and towels. The staff was ALWAYS incredibly friendly and willing to assist with the smallest of details. My son was obsessed with the large Koi fish in the water areas of the hotel. :-) Our room was on the 11th floor, oceanview and the sights from the balcony were breathtaking! You could see 2 neighboring islands from our room. The Westin "Heavenly Beds" were heavenly to say the least as were the shower heads. The staff was even accomodating and friendly to us when I spilled my coffee in bed on the white linens. :-( I cannot say enough good things about ALL of the staff here especially our friend at the concierge desk, Cheryl. She was fantastic and set us up with a vacation ownership tour that we enjoyed and would have totally bought if we could have afforded it. Instead we are going back for a 2nd vacation on their Explorer Package. The weather was a balmy 80-85 degrees everyday in Maui with not much humidity which was pleasant. It was sunny everyday and always a rainbow to be seen! The only rain we experienced felt like spitting and never lasted long enough to ruin anything. We rented a jeep and explored the island. It was very easy to get around even for us that had no idea what we were doing. I definately recommend renting some sort of car. The jeep was great! We went into town and shopped at Hilo Hatties for Hawaiian dresses and suveniors, ate at a few places on Front Street where the cruise ships dock and anywhere you look the scenes are breathtaking. We also drove the "Road to Hana" because I was in Hawaii and I wasn't leaving without seeing waterfalls. Boy did I see waterfalls... It was a true paradise. I bought the book "Maui Revealed" and followed it on the drive to Hana. The locals don't like this book because it tells a lot but it is a great guide that tells everything! The drive to Hana and the Seven Sacred Pools was very windy and adventurous. The locals are not very kind to tourists driving up there. We understood though, their home is invaded by us daily so let them go around you if you can... also see the Black Sand Beach- it was my absolute favorite. Wear sneakers to see the waterfalls- you have to hike to get to them and I wore flip flops like a dummy. We also took a snorkel boat, The Teralani that was great and went to a luau at the Hayatt hotel that I will definately book again. There was also great snorkeling at Black Rock right down the beach from our hotel. Yes, of course the food was the most expensive part of our trip but that is to be expected, we were in Hawaii! Go to the ABC store for snacks and drinks to keep in your room and eat at Whalers Village right down the beack walk. There are some inexpensive places there. Be sure to drink the Mai Tai's and sunburn drinks! I would spend every vacation at this hotel if possible! My family and I definately had our dream vacation and are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not that nice.”
Reviews.Author: CLB10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Maui for a week in December 07. The hotel is very pretty, has a fantastic setting, however I echo many of the other reviewers on this site when I say that the service was sub-par, particularly for a hotel of this cost. The lobby desk staff could not manage our bill correctly (after we waited in line for 30 minutes to check out). Also, I had accidentally left 2 novels in a drawer when we checked out. Since our flight was not until midnight, I had plenty of time to realize this and return to the hotel for my books. The desk staff was nice enough to give me a key to the still unoccupied room, but the room had been cleaned and the books were gone. They contacted housekeeping, who denied finding them. The desk staff nor security could do anything for me, did not offer a reimbursement, nothing. This incident left a very bad impression with me - I just did not expect a hotel of this level to allow their workers to steal items from their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Experience Should Be Alot Better!”
Reviews.Author: nextime
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Our family of 4 (2 teens) travelled from Canada to escape the winter and relax over the Christmas Holidays in Hawaii. Not soooo relaxing. First of all cab fare from the Kahului airport was $86 a little steep. Heard shuttles were not much cheaper and stopped several times. We booked a room with 2 double beds at the Westin, only to find out when we arrived that they had no more rooms left with 2 double beds. They (so called) upgraded us to a King with a pull out couch. When we asked for a cot they were out of those too. So imagine 2 adults and a teen in a kingsize (Heavenly) bed, not my idea of heavenly! We managed to get a cot for the duration of our two week stay, however the cot took up much of the already small rooms Our ocean view room, turned out to be only partial ocean view over looking Whaler's Village. Every morning we were woken up by garbage and delivery trucks, which always backed in and had their backup alarms on! Because the hotel was sold out over the holidays there were no other rooms available.( I guess advance reservations does not mean a thing at the Westin!) As previous guests reported, trying to get a lounge poolside or on the beach was impossible. My husband got into two squabbles with people moving our stuff off of our lounges. The towel service people kept insisting that they were timing peoples loungers and removing towels if no one sat in them after 1 hour, however we only saw this happen twice while we were there. We noticed people from other resorts coming and using the pool loungers. As well we met a family from the east side of the island that weren't staying at the Westin, but came to use the pool! (Westin has to get a handle on this as the poolside lounge issue is what all of the people were complaining about!) I know it was the Christmas holidays and the hotel was full, but the money we paid to stay at the Westin, should provide for enough pool or beach chairs for everyone staying there. Every morning was stressful, just trying to reserve a chair in order to relax(Funny!) The Westin will hound you daily to take the Timeshare Tour, They call and leave messages on your phone telling you they have a gift for you at the concierge. Do not go, if they have a gift tell them to deliver it to your room. (They won't do it!) Personally, I did not go to Hawaii to spend 2 hours of my vacation listening to a Timeshare Pitch. The restaurants Tropica and Ono's at the hotel were very expensive, Tropica was vacant most nights. The poolside food was good, but very expensive, Drinks were outrageously priced! We used the adult pool, which would have been nice if there were more adults there than kids? No one there to enforce hotel rules? The staff was mostly friendly, however when you brought up tough questions, most did not care. We used the fitness room as the $20 resort fee included this. It was very nice overlooking the pool/beach and the equipment was new. Several young kids in the fitness room which were not allowed to be there according to the posted sign of 16years and older? Other restaurants we visited in the area were Hula Grill - OK food but very busy, usually 1 hour or more wait. Rusty Harpoons - Just ok food, more of a sports bar with tvs on everywhere. Leilani's on the Beach - good food, same company owns Hula Grill and other restaurants on the beach so food is basically the same and in Maui (fairly expensive). We went to the Hyatt for Sushi, - very good but very expensive. Spat's at the Hyatt for Italian - just ok and expensive. Dan Teppanyaki at the Sheraton was just ok , heard that Kobe in Lahaini was a much better Teppanyaki show. Do not waste your money on the Luau at the Westin just under $400 for 4 people, dinner was table service just average and the show was average as well. In Waikiki we went to an original Luau, much better food and performances. Heard the Lahaina Luau is the original and worth seeing. Cheeseburger in Paradise was great. Great burgers and Mai Tai's were the best in Maui and the price was average. Whaler's Village had McDonalds, Chinese and Pizza which we saw alot of people had poolside as the price seemed to be right. Grab drinks and snacks at the ABC store and stock your room. You can also take the shuttle to Cannery Mall and stock up at Safeway, this will save you bundles in snacks for the room, breakfasts and drinks (booze too!) We went to Ruth Chris steakhouse for New Years Eve. The best meal by far, expensive but you get what you pay for. If you go before 6pm they have cheaper dinner specials. We did not rent a car and found we did not miss having one. Several people complained about the lack of parking at the Westin for their rental vehicles. Activities we took in were Whale Watching on the Teralani. Excellent and reasonably priced, you get drinks and snacks on the Catamaran and get to see whales - guaranteed. We took surfing lessons just down the beach infront of the Marriott, again a good price, good instruction and awesome surfing, our kids really enjoyed this. We had to go and play tennis at the Sheraton as the Westin did not have tennis courts. We golfed across the street at Kaanapali North and South courses and really enjoyed ourselves. We all rented clubs and it was reasonable. We had a bite at the Clubholuse and was much cheaper than the Westin and good food, however service was slow. Went snorkelling and cliff jumping infront of the Sheraton - Awesome! We took a shuttle into Lahaina twice for shopping and looking around. The shuttle there was quick and convenient, however coming back took over an hour as the shuttle stopped and waited at two other hotels before arriving back at the Westin. We took in the Mercedes Golf open in Kapalua which was great, saw many great golfers up close. You must go see this course if you're a golfer, excellent location, layout and beautiful clubhouse. Several celebrities have their homes right on this beautiful golfcourse. The hotel has a hospitality room if you have a late checkout that you can use to shower change, however you only have it for 30 minutes or you can pay $295 to extend you stay until 6pm! Hope this review helps others make informative choices when it comes to hotels and Maui restaurants and activities. Would probably look at staying at either the Hyatt or the Sheraton as we spoke with several people who had no complaints with either of these hotels. The Kaanapali beach that runs infront of all of these hotels is the same and is spectacular! Overall Maui is expensive, be prepared to pay high prices or don't go!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from Westin”
Reviews.Author: collins26050
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from 12/26/07 - 1/1/08. We usually stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel but it was sold out, so we chose the Westin. Even though we really like the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, we twere excited to try something new and more upscale. Unfortunately, we did not care for the Westin. It was very crowded , noisy and had lots of children. The pools were beautiful, however, we didn't get to try them! By 8:30 am, all lounge chairs around the pool and at the beach were "taken" (saved by hotel guests by putting towels and other items on them). Tried again at around 3:00 - 4:00 pm, found a place to sit...but they were out of towels!! Two days in a row! When we asked the towel person when more towels would be available, he just shrugged his shoulders and didn't seem to care. We had a question about our room on the first day and called the front desk. No one was available to speak to us so ServiceExpress took a message and said we would receive a return phone call. We did not. Buffet breakfast was $30 per person. There is a daily resort fee of $20. As other reviews have indicated, the rooms were okay - pretty small. Nice flat screen TV, though. All in all, it wasn't a horrible stay - but it was disappointing. Next year we will make sure we book early enough so that we can stay at Kaanapali Beach Hotel. Yes....it's outdated and doesn't have large beautiful swimming pools. But, we will be made to feel welcome by the staff with amentities like turn down service, cookies on our pillows and a friendly family type atmosphere. We will also be able to find an available chaise lounge in the nice large shaded pool area where I can sit under a tree and read with some quiet and privacy without feeling like I'm practically on top of the person next to me.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed in Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: 4fortheroad
Reviews.Content: We just got back tonight from 10 days in Hawaii. While in Kauai we were VERY happy at the Grand Hyatt,for 5 days when we got to Maui and to the Westin Resort and Spa, we were extremely disappointed. We spent 5 somewhat unpleasant days at the Westin. The hotel is extremely crowded and noisy, the beach and pool areas too congested. There is nothing relaxing about the hotel. There is a morning battle for chairs at the pool, or a line to wait in at 8 am to get chairs on the beach- which they usually run out of by 8:15. Or you can sign up to try to get a cabana for a ridiculous amount of additional money. We were unable to get one until our last day which rained non-stop. The lobby is loud beyond belief with the faux waterfalls and birds which get even louder around sunset. There is no where to sit to get some peace and quiet especially if it is raining. There are no comfy cozy lounge chairs indoors. The only place to go is the tiny, musty bedroom. I couldn't even open my porch door because the next door neighbor was always out on his porch smoking cigarettes and the smell would waft right in. On the positive side, the staff was very friendly, concierge services were good and the food surprisingly decent for this kind of hotel. We were traveling with extended family totalling 10 and no one was happy with the choice of hotel and room accomodations. Even the Westin "heavenly bed" was uncomfortable! THe room ac did not work during the night. I can not in good conscience, recommend this hotel to anyone unless they are looking for a loud, Disney-like Hawaii experience and have very young children.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: labeba
Reviews.Content: I loved it! it was so romantic and there is so much to do in the island!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about selling timeshares here!”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in early October on one of the "special invitation" deals...the Westin offers you a very attractive price for five a five-night stay if you will attend their time-share pitch. But beware; you get what you pay for here. If you go with this deal, you will be placed in a very small room overlooking the dumpsters from the shopping center next door. If that doesn't please you, you might be offered a "free upgrade" to a slightly larger room overlooking the hotel parking lot, but they will also encourage you to check out their premium rooms overlooking the pools and the ocean. You will want that room! Because it's bigger, it's luxurious and it overlooks the ocean and the pools. If you take the bait, it will set you back about an additional $1k for a five night stay. To offset the price, they will offer you a few hundred dollars in hotel credits for taking the timeshare tour. So, no worries, we're on vacation, let's enjoy! We stayed in a premium room overlooking it all on the 8th floor and it was grand...until we took the timeshare tour. We have done this on two occasions, and enjoyed the hotel because it is centrally located and, though somewhat outdated, quite nice. However, I don't think we will go back because we were so put off by the timeshare hard sell. We took the tour and while the timeshare condos are nice, they do not offer the same experience as the hotel, and we told them early on that we were not interested in buying one (wow! do the math! they are selling each condo for around $2 million!). They passed us from one salesperson to the next and tried every tactic imaginable to make a sale - it took hours and we couldn't get away. When they finally realized we were truly not buying, they became quite rude. At one point, a snippy woman popped into the room and said, "Well, you've been here twice and not purchased, so I can assure you you will never be invited back to the hotel again." Then turned on her heel and stalked off. But within fifteen minutes, there was another fellow hammering us, trying to get us to write them a check for $3k to reserve our room at the inn next year! Huh?? Weren't we just banished from this place?? A nice hotel, but a lot more focus on the guest's current vacation experience and a lot less on selling timeshares would certainly make it more enjoyable. If you're going to pay premium dollars for a nice hotel room, move up or down the beach to a place that isn't selling thousands of shares in the condos next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing island”
Reviews.Author: tahoejules
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin on the last 2 nights of a 3 week Hawaiian vacation, and it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is beautiful- from the grounds, pool, and beach to the rooms. Sure, the rooms are not spacious suites, but they are extremely nice- well decorated and clean. At first I was bummed that we did not have an ocean view room, but the view ffrom the other side of the hotel is just as spectacular- mountain vistas with the manicured golf course below. I loved spending a little time at the pool, going down the waterslide and haveing (expensive) tropical coctails. A couple minute walk next door takes you to the Whaler's Village shops, which has a few restaurants (try the Hula Grill- yum!). Overall, I loved the Westin and hope that I can return sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RainFollowsUs
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. I usually stay at mid-level hotels. I got lucky and got a good rate at this one. It has a very beautiful lobby and pool area. Everything is open and connected. They have tied in fish and wildlife into the many pools on the property. The rooms were small. For the price I would have thought they'd be bigger. They did have a nice LCD tv in it though. I stayed in an ocean view. I think a partial ocean view would have been the same and might be cheaper. The non ocean view rooms face a golf course and a large mountain. I took more pictures of the mountain than of the water. The food at the hotel is good, but it will cost you. Many of the restaurants around the area change names at night and expand their menus for dinner. The westin is right next to the Whaler's village. It has a lot of nice shops and a couple nice restaurants. If you walk up the main walk between the hotels you will find something you like. We ate at the Hyatt and the Sheraton and both were very good. ($$ though) Beware of the timeshare sales... or should I say, go see one. The concierge told us if we went to look at some of the property they would give us $100 to spend at the hotel. She didn't mention that we'd have to sit through a sales pitch first. The up side is, tell them you donâ€™t want one and you'll get your $100 to spend at any of the Starwood hotels. You'll also get 50% off your next hotel stay. It rained the entire time we were there. The worst flooding they've had in 27 years. That is not the norm. You are only 5 miles from Lahaina where there are tons of shops and restaurants to get out of the sun or rain. The staff will go out of their way to help you plan a day or book a reservation. They have a large book of restaurants with menus so you can view them before you book. As far as the pools go, they have a ton of them. The kidâ€™s pool has two water slides. There are other pools deemed for adults only that are ok. There is a nice large waterfall that connects two pools via a cave feature. There is a small hidden pool underneath the waterfall. It would have been better if it was heated. Many of the hotels have small hot tubs. I suppose when itâ€™s hot out no one uses them, but I like to. Plan on spending $10 per adult beverage. You do get a large slice of pineapple with each one. One other negative besides the room size. They have free wifi, but if you donâ€™t bring a computer, they will charge by the minute to use one of theirs. They have two or three upstairs in a business room that is monitored. This was our first time and donâ€™t have anything to compare it to, but I would recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family!”
Reviews.Author: jsox515
Reviews.Content: I got a chance to stay at both the Westin and Hyatt (they are on the same strip) and I can say that the Westin was a great place to stay, but definitely more for a family then a romantic couple. I went with my boyfriend and we had a fabulous time anyways there. We enjoyed the Hyatt a lot more and thought the rooms were slightly bigger and the room service there was ON POINT!!!! The Westin room service is very slow. The hotel itself is wonderful with awesome swimming pools, but like I said it's more for family then a couple. I wasn't really impressed with the Heavenly showers and yes, they could use a bathroom upgrade! The Heavenly Beds were indeed very comfortable and the flat screen TV's were a plus, but other then that...the rooms were a little old and could use a little work. If you are not picky then you wouldn't mind it like we didn't mind it. One day I did find little ants all around our wet bar, but room service sprayed it and they went away. Don't forget to sign up for your free 4x6 Photo at the Photography desk. Also, if you sign up as a Starwood Member before you go... you can qualify for a room upgrade. We got a partial ocean view and they upgraded us to a full oceanview room because we were members. IF it is your anniversary... call them before you get there and they give you a free bottle of champagne!!! The beach at the Westin... um what beach not really much of a beach at all. The water is awesome but there is not much sand. Go down towards the Sheraton and go to Black Rock Beach. The water and beach is a lot bigger and nicer. OR you can drive up to Kapalua Bay where the beach is very calm and beautiful. It is about a 15 minute drive...ask the concierge how to get there. LISTEN CLOSE... If you are looking to save some money here are some tips! Rusty Harpoons which is in Whaler's Village (walking distance of 1 minute) has awesome Happy Hour specials from 2-6pm. Cheap drinks and cheap appetizers. Definitely buy what you need from the ABC store also located in the Whaler's Village. A lot of the restaurants (especially at the Hotel) are very very expensive and will put a hole in your wallet. Our solution? We would go to the Aloha Mixed Plate often which has AWESOME BBQ food for a CHEAP CHEAP price. Don't forget to order their banana cheesecake dessert...it is amazing!!! If you are in the mood for some Chinese food there is a pretty decent Chinese Restaurant called China Bowl with normal price about 5-8 minutes away (driving). Out of the Westin you make a right and then a left onto 30. In a shopping center on the left you should see China Bowl . We had decent Chinese food for an average price (not expensive). If you want to go get great Sushi... go to Sansei which is in Kapalua (15 minute drive). The price is normal for sushi (not cheap), but they have great food there!! If you are looking for a great Luau... I suggest the Feast at Lele. Expensive (about 105 a person), but definitely worth it for the food and entertainment. Also, if you want to go snorkeling... I suggest go to Molokini with Four Winds II. Molokini is one of the top snorkel/dive spots in the world and the captain on Four Winds will keep you company. His crew will take great care of you and I suggest going on the morning tour instead of the afternoon tour. The morning tour is around 85-90 dollars (can't remember), but it includes a boat ride from 7:30 am -12pm to beautiful Molokini. You get served breakfast AND lunch (it is yummy too), and you get to snorkel for a long time!!! It is so worth the money and the crew is awesome. They have lifeguards that look after you and the crew is watching you for your safety!!! Bottom line...just keep in mind you are in Maui, on of the most beautiful places on earth, it is expensive...so have fun and expect to spend that cash!!!! Would I stay here again? Yes, but would I prefer to stay at the Hyatt? YES! It is still a great place to stay here at the Westin...

Reviews.Title: “The awesome location and pool make it special!”
Reviews.Author: mwooduk
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms were a little smaller than we are used to but we had been previously warned by friends so it wasn't a surprise. Bathroom was very small! But we knew we were not going to spend that much time in the room so we didn't let it bother us. We got a room overlooking the mountains which was pretty, although we were right above the valet so it was a bit busy! The hotel is worth going to just for it's fantastic location on the beach and the pool scene. The pool slide is great fun, there are lots of different pools including an adults only pool which was great for us (although I did have to ask staff twice to remove small noisy kids from the adult only jacuzzi) - they could do a better job with monitoring this. The room had a frig, coffee maker, heavenly beds, great shower etc. I took a free water aerobic class in the pool which was nice. Drinks and lunch by the pool were very nice. Good value by Hawaii standards. The exercise room is fabulous and has a great view overlooking the pool and the beach. We loved it and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Westin Maui Resport & Spa”
Reviews.Author: InLoveWithMaui
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 11/17/07 - 11/29/07. We went to Maui for the Maui Invitational Basketball Tournament. When you book this package your choices are the Hyatt, the Westin or the Sheraton..all on Ka'anapali Beach. The Westin was the only hotel with availability. This was my first trip to Maui. I must admit I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews on this website. However, Once we arrived, I couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel was beautiful. The lobby is open to the outside and has a lagoon type body of water complete with a waterfall, swans and flamingos. We stayed in the Ocean Tower, room 538 wich had a view of the mountains. The room had been updated and was very nice. We had 2 minor problems...a burnt out lightbulb and the toilet started leaking water on our last day...both of which were fixed AS SOON as I notified the front desk. The food at the resort is expensive, as is all the food on the island. The Westin has a prime location right next door to Whalers Village (which I must have gone to 20 times during my stay) and 5 minutes from Front Street in downtown Lahaina. The spa was very relaxing (massages were expensive). All the hotel staff I encountered could not have been more friendly.....from the front desk, to the bell hops, to the valet, to the wait staff, to the spa employees. I was ready to move in to this hotel by the end of my stay! I have been home for 2 days and I am already dreaming of my next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Using Starwood Points, but beware the Timeshare Sales Pitch!”
Reviews.Author: tdotdiva
Reviews.Content: I took my mother on vacation using points. I'm a Gold Starwood member and we got a lovely room on a high floor with an ocean view. Very nice to wake up to the sounds of the crashing waves and waterfalls and high enough not to be bothered by the sounds of the seemingly endless kids at the pools. Rooms were pretty standard, not particulary new, but quite clean (although my mother was convinced that the tub wasn't being cleaned properly). Nice new flat screen tvs, daily beach towel service (because I am Gold), comfy beds, the "heavenly " double-headed shower, and a mini fridge in the room which we stuffed with a few quick breakfast items in order to avoid the $30 breakfast buffet. The resort offers several pool options, nicely landscaped grounds, proximity to a small shopping center with a couple of good beachside restaurants and a Borders express bookstore. I concur with others that it is particulary family friendly, so I was happy to have the adult pool option which really did seem to drown out the kiddie noise. As someone mentioned, there's something about water that compels kids to jump and scream, but they all seemed to be having a great time. The beach front is beautiful and although public, never seemed overrun. There's a lovely boardwalk along the beach where people jog in the mornings and walk from one resort to the next. We did have to pay an additional fee to rent a beach chair and umbrella and there were far too few. My mom had to run down early in the morning and do the towel and magazine leave-behind routine in order to secure chairs. I will agree that service was a little lackluster in terms of timeliness from "Service Express" and the elevators are ridiculously slow, but chalk that up to near maximum occupancy during a busy time. Not much different than any conference hotel I've ever stayed at. The walls were definitely a bit thin too - we could hear the TV ( although I think the volume was maxed out) and conference calls in the room next door. In any case, overall we generally enjoyed our stay at the hotel except for the 3 hrs we spent listening to the Vacation Villas timeshare sales pitch. And be advised that if you choose not to buy, right away, they'll offer you a $2500 vacation "deal" with mucho points, more time to decide on the villas and a 7 day future stay at the hotel in a terrace mountain view room (read ground floor room with a view of the parking lot). And although they make it sound like it's no big deal if you choose to buy/not to buy, we definitely got the full court "end of the month" sales pressure. We also learned from the locals that the villas are across the street and downwind from the sewage plant. Eeww!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Maui”
Reviews.Author: samspadejr
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not live up to the Westin name. It is aging and noisy. Don't let them give you a "mountain view" room, they are really just parking lot view rooms. We asked to move and were told we would have to pay a stiff fee per night. The air conditioning did not work and took two phone calls to get it to blow cold air into the bathroom. The rest of the room never did get comfortably cool and we couldn't open the balcony door as the horns, sirens, and traffic from outside would keep us awake. The bathrooms are old with inadequate ventilation. We consistently had to ask for more towels, the quality of which was very inconsistent. The walls are thin and walking down the hall you can easily hear all the conversations in the rooms. The elevators are old and slow and there are not enough to serve all the rooms adequately. They now include the $20/day charge for guests to use the work out room, internet and pool, but spa classes are extra and the business center charges an high fee per minute for computer time if you choose not to bring your own on a beach vacation. The hotel goes out of its way to be family friendly, which is great if you have kids, and somewhat annoying if you are there are a romatic getaway. The lobby is open with real pink flamingos, fish and other birds. It's fun, but a little loud and busy. They have different local artisans set up each day. On the plus side, the beds are very comfortable, although we had to ask for more than the four small pillows on our king sized bed. The adult pool is a very nice touch - quiet with a bar and a hot tub. It has happy hour prices from 8-10 that are affordable. The location is great and the beach is steps away. The spa is very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!! Simply Gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimvad
Reviews.Content: I can't explain how beautiful this place was. The lobby was gorgeous and the views from the beach were incredible. We stayed in the Beach Tower and could be in the bed with a view of the beach and the neighboring islands. Incredible!!! This place would get an excellent from me if not for the construction going on two floors below us!!! We are home-bodies and enjoy staying in the room. Unfortunately the construction was almost unbearable at times...other times it was ok!!! Two floors up and we could still hear the noises. The staff did offer another room in the other tower but was a third the size and for only $30 less per night...we ened up getting starpoints credited to our account. Anyway, besides the construction this place is really great!!! We weren't talked into the tour of the villas, but decided to take it anyway and were in and out in an hour with a $100 gift certificate to the facility and a 50% discount to any other resort outside Hawaii!!! Room service was great!!! The couples massage was expensive but so very nice and soothing!!! Nice to be able to share it with my wife!!! They also had sparkling wine and a nice note awaiting our arrival to kickoff our honeymoon!!! Again, this place was so terrific. Plan a time outside the construction and it can't be beat!!! Shopping and restaurants next door at Whaler's Village make this that much better a place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in paradise! 11/8 - 11/13/2007”
Reviews.Author: PiratesSayARRR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin from 11/8/2007 through 11/13/2007. Checked in at 2pm and said our room was not ready. I wasn't exactly pleased to hear this given a woman had died on our flight over and I didn't have my luggage. I came back around 2:50pm because I still had not received a phone call indicating the room was ready but explained the situation. They kindly placed us in a top floor mountain view room. Everyone is correct in saying that the rooms are small, however they are not too small. I felt there was an adequate amount of space for 2 people. The bed is extremely soft and the flat screen tv is nice as well. The grounds of the hotel are well kept and the pool is fantastic. It is nice to have an adult deck where kids cannot go, which is also where the hot tub is located. Drinks from 5pm - 8pm are actually reasonably priced for a resort. I do have to say the location isn't the best. We stayed at the KBH in May and the beach location was much nicer than that of the Westin. I also do not like the mandatory resort fee I believe they should just include this with the price of their hotel rooms. We will be heading back in March and staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, bad bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: LizzieMagee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were renewing our vows on Maui and we fell in love with the pics of the pool area of this hotel. Well, the pool is great. And lovely landscaping and lots of places to relax. The room was ok. We were offered an upgrade when we arrived to a partial ocean view--fabulous view! Two things I would say were not to my taste: first is that the bathrooms are very small and in need of renovation. Our bathroom had a flickering light and looked like it was part of a motel. The room was nice, as was the bed. Second, be leary of the spot near the lobby where you can purchase coffee and breakfast items. Twice we were overcharged. One morning we got a banana, an orange, one cup of coffee and a muffin and the total was 22.00. After sitting down and looking at what we got, I went back and asked how much each thing was, as I couldn't believe it came to 22 bucks. Sure enough, she added an additional pastry at 8.95 that was not ours. I thought it was a fluke, but the next day my husband bought a cup of coffee and one muffin, and the woman rang him up for 2 muffins. We had to go back and have her fix it again. I guess when you stay at a place like this, paying $330 a night, they don't think you notice when you are charged more. We did. And I don't like having to make sure they are being honest. Overall, very nice stay, lovely grounds and I would stay here again, hopefully after the bathrooms are renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great for children”
Reviews.Author: sewaterman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Maui as part of a business retreat, and had very mixed feelings. Pluses - really nice ocean view room on 7th floor, comfortable bed and a balcony overlooking gardens, definitely big enough and very nicely renovated. Small but adequate gym & spa looked nice. Housekeeping and front door staff were very helpful. Sunsets to die for Minuses - hotel is way, way too busy. Garden is like Disneyland - a huge playground with miles of different pools & concrete water slides . OK if you have highly energetic children who want to run & splash and yell all day, but not somwhere you can relax. There is one adults pool, but its small & crowded you have to be very sociable to be comfortable there. Restaurants are so busy both service & food suffer. But that said, if you have lots of children and want somewhere they can play, this may be your ideal vacation hotel

Reviews.Title: “Crowded - noisy - terrible room”
Reviews.Author: travelingirlfrompa
Reviews.Content: This property is very beautiful...but not up to Westin standards. I asked for extra towels and had to call twice and waited an hour and a half for them to arrive. The last night of my stay was spent listening to the ceiling leaking in the bathroom and the noisy college kids having a party two floors above me. By the time I checked out, my entire bathroom was dripping with water. You should be aware that the property is very busy and crowded...not a place for quiet relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Ecolorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from 11-5 through 11-10, the best part was the comfortable bed. We were there for a time share 5 day preview "deal" therefore we had the parking lot view on the second floor. (I'm sure it would have been prettier to be on a higher floor on the ocean side) The bed and concierge staff truly were the best part of the experience. The hotel lobby is beautiful without a doubt. The room itself was rather small. The hotel cleaning staff were very loud each morning around 8am, talking loudly and sounding as though they were yelling to each other through the hall. There was also an abundance of children running in the hallways at early hours. If you are a "pool" person, you'll love this place. There were several huge beautiful pools complete with waterfalls and water slides. I'm more of a beach person and the beach at the Westin was very small (almost no place to sit because the ocean comes in so far) and there was no space to put a chair on the beach. If you rent their cabana (for a mere 60.00 per day) you either have to sit up at the pool or have a view of the paved walkway and then a hedge where you can't really see the waves crashing. The positive is that the beaches along that strip are all public, so we went up to the Sheraton beach (10 min. walk) and rented their cabana for 40.00 and snorkeled at the black rock area. The beach there had plenty of sand and places to sit or lay out on your towel. (The Westin and Sheraton are in the same corporation and you can charge on your room at the Sheraton.) The snorkeling was excellent there - we saw many sea turtles on the different days we were in the water. The Westin was quite accomodating and sent a microwave to our room when we requested it so we could heat a lunch in our room too. Overall it was a fun stay but I wouldn't return to this property. I heartily recommend the Maui revealed guide book (make sure you have the 4th edition). Also strongly recommend you make reservations ahead of time to see the Warren and Annabelle Magic show in Lahaina. Warren is the most incredible illusionist ! I'm still awake at night trying to figure out what he did in front of my eyes - no smoke and mirrors and quite the small (78 seat) audience. Also if you want a heart stopping disney adventure type ride - take your car along the north coast of maui ! WOW - it was so breathtaking and exciting I felt like we should have had to pay a fee to do it ! Also recommend Big Beach at Sunset for some great pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay!”
Reviews.Author: michiganstategogreen
Reviews.Content: We received a great rate for this stay, and the hotel far exceeded our expectations! The entire Ka'anapoli area is awesome. Perfect beach, a cement walking path running behind the resorts fronting the beach area. Five pools, all connected by waterfalls, a cave, and waterslides. If you want to go to the beach, its a 10 second walk! The lobby area has more waterfalls, huge colorful fish in the pond along with flamingos, parrots, and other birds! We were upgraded to an ocean view room on the 8th floor. We were able to watch the sunset from our balcony! From our room, we could see the island of Lanai! The room had a nice flat panel tv, fridge, and Kona coffee - yum! Nice restaurants/bars on site, yes expensive, but you're in Hawaii, so not a surprise. Whaler's village shopping center is right next door to the resort, great place to grab gifts, a quick bite in the food court, or anything at the ABC store. The hotel has a free shuttle to Front Street in downtown Lahaina if you want to avoid the terrible parking down there. This was very convenient for us! Driving distance to the Hana Highway was only 40 minutes (to the beginning of the scenic drive) so not too bad. Be sure to snorkel at Black Rock, a 15 minute walk North. We were entertained by green sea turtles and tons of fish, that was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1905DL
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Westin locations, we figured this was a can't-miss for our honeymoon. As other reviewers have mentioned, they are doing renovations, starting with the Beach Tower, which happened to be where we would be staying. When we checked in, we told the front desk clerk it was our honeymoon and asked for a nice room w/view. We were assigned a room on the 4th floor...and wouldn't you know, renovations were being done on the 5th floor. So, needless to say our first night was spent in 1) an OLDER ROOM and 2) immediately below construction with noise stating at 8AM!!!!! We called the front desk who assured us the noise would stop (drilling started again at 8:30am). After getting absolutely no where with the front desk, we spoke with the Manager (a god-send) who was able to move us to the 10th floor. On the day of departure, our flight happened to be a red-eye so we inquired about a late checkout. We were told that this would cost us an additional $250.00 (for 4 measly hours). The front desk woman then had the gall to say, "Well, I'm sorry we wrecked your honeymoon..." after we questioned the charge. We reported her comments and behavior to the manager. Needless to say, the Westin Maui's front desk personnel left a very bitter taste. Had it not been for management, this review would have been much worse. For those staying in the Beach Tower, I would recommend that you request a room on the 8th floor or higher (ABOVE the construction).

Reviews.Title: “Great girls getaway at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: HeaveninHermosa
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit tardy - but didn't want the great service and wonderful time at the Westin to go unnoticed. My girlfriend and I did a "girlfriend's getaway" in early May 2007, and I picked the Westin Maui being a Starwood Preferred Guest - I had a great deal emailed to me called "Half Price to Hawaii" - look for it in April-May 2008 next year. The rooms were half price - around $259 for a partial ocean view room - 4th floor, not the remodeled Tower, but we loved our room, even though it had not been remodeled - had a view of the pool, waterfall, AND ocean - our balcony was right above the waterfall - we left our lanai door open a crack every night to hear the water soothe us to sleep. We enjoyed the pools, and even did the waterslide a few times with the kids! The room had 2 double beds, small bathroom, refrigerator - adequate for us. The Heavenly Beds were just that. We found orchids, beautiful cards with Hawaiian sentiments on them, and chocolates on our pillows every night. (Because of the SPG status? I don't know... but we loved it!) We toured the spa, didn't use it, but it's lovely, with a beautiful view. We LOVED getting 1/2 price drinks and "pupus" at theTropica Restaurant every afternoon, from 3-5pm - then we skipped dinner and had dessert later! They have a lavender vinagrette that was outstanding. We also loved Tropica for the breakfast buffet - yes it's pricey at $25, but we only did it once, and loved the eggs benedict, tropical fruits and juices, waffles, omelets made to order, etc. There was also an abundance of Japanese specialties, including sashimi, rice, fish soups, etc. For breakfast mind you! :) We also enjoyed the proximity to Whaler's Village outdoor shopping mall, just a minutes walk down the beach path. It was also just a 10 minute walk down the beach to the Sheraton, where we had delicious coffee one morning, and caught our snorkeling tour. We had dinner at Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina, and loved the funky, touristy atmosphere. All in all we loved the Westin, yes it can be pricey, but you have to find the deals, and realize its a resort, not a quiet, romantic hideaway - of course there's going to be kids and a little chaos! We loved it and I hope to come back soon with my husband and family.

Reviews.Title: “just a word of caution”
Reviews.Author: kdopp2006
Reviews.Content: Hi travelers! Stayed in this hotel before about three years ago...loved it! this time we stayed in a partial ocean room , and the hotel suppossedly gave us an upgrade to the BEach Tower....Beware! the room was dingy and looked dirty, and due to being renovated there is construction in the tower, which can be noisy early in the morning....we asked to be moved and of course there were no open rooms...Stay in the tower that is right above the entrance...

Reviews.Title: “Veteran Maui Vacationers' first Visit to the Westin Maui with the Kids...”
Reviews.Author: chadwarren
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin Maui for our family vacation with two young children (our first of many stays on Ka'anapali Beach with our two children ages 2 and 6 months). During most of our previous Maui visits, we've stayed at the Hyatt Regency Maui, and chose the Westin frankly due to a much better rate. I was nervous because our Hyatt visits were always so pleasant and the bar was set high for our first stay at the Westin. The Westin Maui exceeded most of my family's expectations. We we very impressed with the expansive fantasy pool, ocean-view spa, and comfortable, well-appointed rooms (newly remodeled with flat-panel TVs as well as Westin's signature Heavenly Bed and Bath amenities). In addition to the solid accommodations and amenities, we found the resort's dining to be well above average (better than most, if not all of the other Ka'anapali Beach resorts). The variety of dining options from full service (where children 5 and under eat free) to high-quality self service dining suited our family needs as well as budgets nicely. As well as catering to families very well, it also seems to provide an equal level of accommodation to couples looking for romance. There is an adults-only pool where you could hear a pin drop, and one of the nicer spas and fitness centers on Ka'anapali Beach. The Westin Maui's only major drawback is that the property is aging, and it it shows in the small room size (smaller than current standards) and dated architecture. What ultimately sets this resort apart from many local competitors, however, is the superior service. The staff was polite, helpful, and quick to provide assistance at a moment's notice. This was evident in nice gestures like a letter and phone call from concierge before our arrival to offer assistance, valet parking our car for free when the self-service lot was full, and the food service staff doing little things to make the kids' dining experience more kid-friendly. Overall, despite its drawbacks, it is a very solid four-star resort and I highly recommend it to families and couples alike. Note: the 5/5 (Excellent) rating reflects our experience based on the overall property rating (four stars). In other words, our rating was not based on a five-star-hotel standard.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back to the Westin.............in a second!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FCG50
Reviews.Content: I decided to spend my 50th birthday in Maui with my spouse and two teenagers. I was really looking forward to the vacation I so deserved. Unfortunately, I spent a couple of months before my trip,looking at past reviews on this website and started fretting about whether or not I made the right choice. I heard nothing but complaining and whining about small rooms, busy times and how expensive everything was. I decided to go and see for myself and not worry about what others had said. We spent 10 wonderful days there. The weather was awesome...85 every day. The pool was big, clean and refreshing and it was always easy to find a lounge to sit on. The pool, restaurant and housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were spacious with a mountain view. They were clean and well replenished with all the amenities that were needed. There was always lots to do to and great restaurants to eat at. The tours and activities people were great and helped us choose fun things to do. We parasailed, snorkled on the Gemini catamaran and went to the Westin Polynesian Luau. So here's the thing........I had the best birthday ever with my family and I will visit the Westin again. We went and had a great time and didn't worry about anything. If you want to go on vacation choose a hotel to stay at within your price range, don't go at the busy times of the year(I took my kids out of school and they did their homework on the plane) and expect to pay high prices. You shouldn't have to worry about how much you are spending on your vacation..........coz if you are, you are not having a vacation!!! Places to go and things to do? Visit the Hula Grill and Rusty's Harpoon.Check out the Whalers Village for lots of great shops. ABC is your best store there for inexpensive food, gifts and liquor. Go on the Gemini Picnic snorkeling tour and parasail with the UFO group. The luau is every Thursday and the dinner is awesome. If you have chosen the Westin for your vacation, you will not be disappointed. Have a fun and great vacation!!! Best wishes from B.C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: Oregon Shelly
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 5 night stay at the Westin Maui. We booked it through the Westin Vacation Club mail offer which included 5 nights accommodations, mid size rental car and a $75 resort credit all for $789.00. Overall, we were very happy with our stay. They upgraded us to a high floor mountain view room for no additional charge. We were greeted with a fresh orchid lei (for me) and a ti leaf lei for my husband, which we affectionately referred to as the "Man Lei". Check in was pretty easy, however, our room was not ready until a few hours after we got there. The hotel was nice enough to call us on my cell phone when the room was ready. Our room was very clean and had been recently updated with rich looking dark furniture, flat screen TV and very comfortable Westin "Heavenly Beds". The bathroom was a little on the small side but was very clean and had a great dual head shower. Directly across from the bathroom sink (which was separate from the shower & toliet) is a handy mini bar area, which provided additional counterspace, coffeemaker, mini fridge and in-room safe. Housekeeping tended to be slow and we actually had to call them on 2 separate occasions to have our room cleaned - a trend that I'm noticing more and more with large hotels. The concierge was very helpful with providing us with restaurant recommendations and activities. However, she did try to push the Timeshare presentation on us a bit, promising an extra $100 resort credit. We respectfully declined and that was the end of the pressure, which was nice. The grounds and the pools were lush and very tropical looking. The pool does get crowded from 11am-2pm. We noticed that it definitely lightens up after 3pm and there is still plenty of great sun to soak in! At sunset, have a cocktail at the adult pool bar - it's so beautiful and relaxing. They have live Hawaiian music playing every night as well. The breakfast buffet was outstanding, but a little pricey at $25.00 a piece. You should try it at least once - you won't be disappointed! Be sure to take advantage of the lovely beach path that winds all through Ka'anapali Beach - it's a great way to check out the other resorts in the area. One last thing - ladies, you must try the Spa at this hotel - it's top notch! I had the Bamboo Lemongrass Scrub with a Vichy Shower and it was probably the best treatment I've ever had! The spa also has a gorgeous relaxation room that overlooks the ocean with plenty of treats and magazines to keep that blissful feeling going even after your treatment is done - and you can linger as long as you want! We had a great time in Maui and would definitely consider staying at the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: mammohead
Reviews.Content: just got back from honeymoon late sept. got in late, easy check in. no room upgrade as they were full. stayed mountain side... room spacious and moderized with flat panel tv, etc. all rooms come with empty fridges so make sure to swing by the abc or grocery store to stock up on goodies. pool area is a great layout, but can get very crowded. many people wake up very early to grab the best lounge chairs. adjacent beach is not very deep in terms of beach space, but adequate. buffet is overpriced for $25, but necessary when hungover. massage service was amazing. concierge services were also excellent. convenient location as they are next to whalers village, several restaurants, abc store, etc. free shuttle to lahaina is time consuming, get a car instead. DO NOT go to the timeshare presentation unless you feel you can trade 2 hrs of your time in hawaii for a $100 credit. more family oriented than i thought, but still a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: goingcheap
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for $125 via priceline. Called ahead time before check-in due to flight delay. Since it was late, there was no lei greetings. Was given a mountain/golf view room on 9th floor, but could still hear morning noise from the parking lot, but not enough to disturb my sleep. Room AC was adequate, couldn't cool the room below 78, my wife thought it was warm, but I was OK. Big LCD TV is a waste since it doesn't show HD at all, could not use the AV input since the back panel is not accessible. Same issue with self parking, the lot got full early so had to use free valet (of course I tipped the attendant who retrieved the car). Overall it's a good location if you want Kaanapali area and a good value if you can get it thru priceline (even with $20 resort fee)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Renovated Rooms, Lots of Families with Kids...”
Reviews.Author: waiomaogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Oct 1-3 (2 nights) and got a great rate of $125/night through Priceline. We arrived at the hotel at around 12:30pm and were greeted with leis. I received a fresh dendrobium orchid lei and my husband received a ti leaf lei. Check in was quick and smooth. We were assigned a non-smoking King Size bed room in the Ocean Tower on the 5th floor with a view of the mountains/golf course. The room iteslf is kind of small, but definitely OK for two people. The room looked recently renovated. It had an LG flatscreen TV mounted to the wall and granite counterops. We had a lovely view of the golf course and mountains in the distance and a not so lovely view of the self parking lot. The room also had a lanai with two chairs and a table outside. The room also came with a small refrigerator that was located under the sink, coffee maker, cordless phone,and nice Westin amenities. The bathroom itself was kind of small and looked like it could use an update. The so-called 'heavenly shower' was nothing more than a dual shower head. At least we had no issues with the water pressure, hot water, or drainage. Everything seem to be working just fine. The sink is separated from the toilet and shower area, which made it nice when getting ready in the morning. There were a lot of families with kids at the hotel during this time. We could hear kids running through the halls in the morning which made sleeping late impossible. Also, since we were above the parking lot, we heard the garbage truck doing it's service with its loud beeping. The hotel itself is rather large. The grounds are beautiful with the pools and huge koi pond with waterfalls. We didn't try any of the hotel restaurants. However, Whaler's Village is right next door within walking distance and it offers more reasonable priced restaurants and menus along with shops like Coach, Cinnamon Girl, Crazy Shirts, ABC stores, etc... Definitely worth checking out just to buy refreshments and snacks from the ABC store as it will save you money. Although we didn't try it, there is a tiny food court in Whaler's Village with a McDonalds and other fast food alternatives. The Westin does charge a $20/day resort fee. This includes admission to the workout facility, high-speed internet access in your room, two bottles of water in your refrigerator replenished daily, self parking, shuttle service to Kapalua West Maui Airport, Kaanapali, Lahaina, and the tennis facilities upon availability, a Westin Maui souvenir shopping bag, a complimentary 4x6 color photo which you can schedule by appointment when you arrive at the hotel. (Although, all the appointments were already taken for our 2 days we were there. So try to scehdule early if you are interested.) Self Parking is included in the reseort fee. The parking lot is way too small for the size of the hotel. It fills up very quickly, especially in the evening hours. If it is full, then valet is free. Also note that the parking stalls are compact!! We were never hassled at all by the timeshare people. Here's some other tips: Fly into Kapalua West Maui Airport. The Westin is located only 10 minutes from this airport. It is a teeny tiny airport that is only serviced by Go and Island Airlines and other small aircraft. It has the island feeling and not crowded at all. Go to the Lahaina Cannery Mall which is located a short 5 minute drive from the Westin. Here you can stock up on snacks and drinks from Safeway. There is also a Longs and ABC store along with some other small shops. There is a food court that offers mexican, italian, vietnamese, greek and local cuisine (L&L). There is also a Dairy Queen. So good to eat that ice cream cone when it's 90 degrees outside! We tried eating at Compadres Mexican Restaurant one night for dinner and it was pretty good. It wasn't crowded at all and the service was great! Prices were reasonable considering the prices at the hotel restaurants! Overall, we enjoyed our short stay at the Westin. I would definitely stay here again if I got it at the same price. People looking for a more quiet and relaxing setting or couples on a honeymoon may not enjoy it as much since it's not that type of resort.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Vegas Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: gcwarren
Reviews.Content: We had planned to spend our entire seven-night vacation at the Westin Maui, but left after only two nights. It's not a bad place, but it is big, crowded and noisy -- not what we came to Hawaii for. Were it not for the ocean, we could have been in Vegas. I was surprised that the huge pool was 4-feet at its most shallow, making it difficult for our 6-year old, who is still not completely comfortable in the water. The walk to the next-door mall is short, giving you access to other dining options, which can be a good thing. With one day's notice, the Westin allowed us to cancel the rest of our stay. I'm sure they had no problem filling the room. We ended up moving to the Fairmont Kea Lani, a more traditional Hawaiian hotel, with beautiful lawns, a great -- but not overdone -- pool, and a room that was three times as large for only $25 more per night. The room itself was worth the move, but the more relaxed atmosphere gave us what we wanted in our Hawaiian vacation -- peace, quiet and still a nice and fun pool -- with a slide! -- and beach for our son.

Reviews.Title: “The most important review on the Westin Maui you will ever read...”
Reviews.Author: RMCMIP
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our honeymoon at the Westin Maui. If you're like me, and some of the other posts were making you nervous about your choice, read this review. The Westin Maui is a beautiful hotel. We were in the Ocean tower, partial ocean view room, 4th floor, overlooking the lobby waterfalls. The room had been recently renovated, w/ granite countertops and a flat screen TV. The only problem I had w/ the hotel, that I read others have had as well, is that when we went to check in, the only room available was a room w/ 2 doubles. I had requested a King. Maybe others already know this, but I learned a valuable lesson: When you book through Expedia (like I did) or another service, and not through the Westin itself, or if your travel agent didn't guarantee a king room, you will not have one. I got a little agitated until I read my itinerary, and it plainly states that Expedia will forward my requests to the Westin, but w/ no guarantees. They did offer to put us in a king room the next day, however, after seeing how beautiful our room and view were, we decided to keep what we had. The aquatic playground is fantastic - in fact, the best pool area in the Kaanapoli area. The beach is beautiful, however, the shore break can be a little treacherous. There was never a lack of chairs, however, if you want to sit in the shade, I recommend putting your towel down and reserving early in the morning. (they say you can not do this, but everybody does so don't worry about it) A few helpful tips: Never valet your car - the parking is very convenient, and if it's full (which it usually is, especially in the evenings, valet is FREE!) Our room package included the breakfast buffett at either the Westin, Westin Villas, or Sheraton (right down the boardwalk). We preferred the breakfast buffett at the Sheraton. If you do not want to be "harrassed" by timeshare sales people, like is mentioned in many of the reviews, simply do not go to the concierge desk. They will try to entice you w/ a free gift, and leave you a voice mail. Simply do not ever stop by that desk and you will be fine. Alcoholic drinks are very expensive: Go to the ABC at Whalers Village, mix in the room in the provided coffee cups, and enjoy at the pool! Dinner in Maui is expensive, but worth it.
