We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants. 1. Do not miss happy hour at Rusty Harpoons in Whalers Village between 2-5 (Mai Tai's for $3.50) The food is great, as well. (Be sure to get the lettuce wraps) 2. The Feast at Lele (Luau in Lahaina) is not to be missed. It is the most expensive ($105 pp) but worth it. It's a 5 course menu and very romantic. 3. Aloha Mixed Plate is a local dive, and a more resonable restaurant to give your wallet a break. Lot's of good authentic Hawaiian food (Front Street in Lahaina). 4. Sansei in Kapalua is Japanese w/ an Hawaiian flare, and was one of the best meals we had while in Maui. (order the tempura fried ice cream!) 5. Longhi's on Front street in Lahaina. Italian w/ Hawaiian flare. Go on Friday night - The band starts at 10 upstairs. 6. David Pauls in Lahaina. Very good, but the most expensive meal we had, (besides the Luau) but not the best meal we had. 7. Mama's Fish House in Paia - DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE - (make reservations) The atmosphere is fantastic. And the food is incredible. This was the best place we ate and experienced all week. We didn't drive to Hana, but the drive through Paia to see the windsurfers is nice. Also, be sure not to miss "Big Beach" in Makena (drive through Kihei and Wailea) Big Beach is the best and biggest beach and hasn't been spoiled by development (about 45 minutes from the Westin) Walk up the cliff to "Little Beach," but be advised, clothing is optional at Little Beach. I hope this review helps. I would highly recommend the Westin Maui for a honeymoon or any other trip. Monday through Thursday was relatively quiet, and then some crowds (and children) came in for the weekend, but the pool area is so large, they were never a nuisance. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui - Remodelled small rooms but great facilities”
Reviews.Author: klbears
Reviews.Content: I think September is the perfect time to come to Maui, after school has started for all the school kids. We went there with our 9 1/2 month old and stayed at the Westin Maui for 5 nights. We found the grounds beautiful. The pools were nice with the largest being only 4 ft deep all the way around, so I could hold my son everywhere around the pool and under the waterfalls. The beach in front is great but a bit crowded with all the resorts in Kaanapali. Our room had 2 full beds and a mountain view. Very nice view. One day we saw a rainbow outside our window. They put a lot of furniture in that small remodeled room, so our little one did not have any room to cruise around, especially after they put the crib in...very tight quarters. The Heavenly beds were soft but due to my back strain, I needed a firmer bed. Most people would love the beds. The crib also had a thicker heavenly crib mattress, which was firm. Unfortunately, the room had a dank kinda smell, which is probably due to the humidity outside. The location is great. We did not try the restaurants because we thought they were way overpriced. We walked over to the Sheraton Maui, full hotel charge privileges, and had lunch there at a more reasonable "Maui" price. Everything in Maui is expensive so $12-14 per person for lunch was reasonable. Next time, we would probably get a condo or a place with more room for our baby. Reasonable places to eat - Penne Pasta and BJ Chicago Pizzeria in Lahiana. Tasty Crust in Kahuliu. Bada Bings in Kihei Get the Maui Revealed book, great resource.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui - Just Okay.”
Reviews.Author: Sam0825
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the second half of our honeymoon. We came from the Four Seasons which we loved (see our review sam0825), so take our comments in light of that. There is no comparison between the 2 hotels in terms of luxury and service - the Four Seasons far surpasses. But the Westin would certainly appeal to tourists and those with families (mainly because of the pool area with water slides and lots of kids). Upon arrival we were "upgraded" from the ocean view room we booked to a deluxe ocean view room - BEWARE! The deluxe ocean view rooms in the beach tower - at least ours - face partially ocean and partially parking lots and other buildings. Our "deluxe" room on the Starwood preferred guest floor was very small, dark dank and dirty, with low stucco ceilings, an outdated bathroom and a TV from the 1990s. Having come from an immaculate spacious room at the Four Seaons, we asked to be "downgraded" back to our original ocean view room. We were the next day, to a room in the ocean tower. It was 100 times better! the room was still small but clean and modern with a beautiful view of the ocean and pools, and a large flat screen TV. [By the way, the fact that we had to wait until the next day to get our original room which was unavailble when we checked in made us realize that we were likely not upgraded, rather they gave our room away]. The hotel lobby and pools definitely have a wow factor, although a bit cartoonish. But if you are a tourist who wants to feel like they're in Hawaii, this would fit the bill. The best part was the beautiful beach, although you have to pay $25 to reserve an umbrella and 2 [incredibly uncomfortable] beach chairs. And if you don't do it by 7:30 AM you probably won't get one. And they make you vacate the chairs and umbrella at 4:30 which is completely ridiculous and well before sunset which is beautiful and worth watching from the beach. We found the pool area to be very crowded and dirty. The one day that we decided to sit there rather than the beach, we had to move since there was so much garbage on the ground, the birds were attacking it. The water in the pools was also pretty dirty. There is very limited seating in the shade, and there is minimal staff checking to see if you'd like a drink. We loved the restaurant Tropica and ate there at least twice. Have your breakfast over there too - same menu and buffet as the one by the pool but less crowded with a view of the ocean. I would NOT stay here if you are looking for a luxurious, romantic honeymoon. I would definitely consider staying here with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: misctraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for first half of our honeymoon. Hotel was 100% sold out when we arrived. Our reservation for a lower priced room was upgraded as our original price level was full. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room and hotel in general were in great shape and very clean. Lot's of free activities every day. Complimentary internet access is very nice. Didn't like the "heavenly" showers however. Also, sometimes when calling front desk ("service express") there would be no answer. One other negative point is that the doors separating adjoining rooms are too thin, and you can hear everything from the room next to you when people are right near said doors. Pools are spacious and fun...plenty of families in the lower pools but the adult pool was almost always empty. Beach access was directly behind the hotel and super convenient. Be prepared to pay $$ for beach umbrella/chair rentals though. On resort restaurants were pretty good and moderately pricey for Maui. Nice thing about the Westin is that many of the water based activities (sailing,para-sailing, etc) launch from the beach right there. Also, whalers village is directly next door. If you want to be near all the action and pay reasonable rates with good service, the Westin is a great choice. If you are looking for a very quiet spot, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauikaanapali2007
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through priceline, stayed there in late September, 2007. The property is awesome, great location, first class amenities with free daily lei's, drinks, great sitting areas. Their pool is five star. The rooms are very, very nice contrary to what other reviews mention. We stayed in the ocean tower which has all been remodeled. We had a garden room on the second floor which was a bit noisy from all the people going back and forth but it wasn't that bad. Also, no hot water between 12 and 5 AM for our room but we had prior notice to plan ahead. The location of the hotel is right in the heart of Kaanapali which in my opinion is the best place to stay in Maui, especially if it's your first time. Lahaina is pretty close by and there is actually a lot to do at night in Kaanapali. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful kamaaina getaway”
Reviews.Author: kaluanuibeach
Reviews.Content: Just returned today and my husband and I had a wonderful time. We booked our stay on their website and booked the room at the kamaaina special of $159 per night ......what a deal. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed and treated well. We were welcomed with flower leis and a nice beverage in the reception area. We checked in and got a nice room and found the housekeepers and staff friendly, helpful and of good cheer. The pool and beach are fabulous!! There is no way not to have fun there. It would have been a "perfect stay" except for our visit to "Onos". To Onos, I say "oh, no". That was a disaster, we were treated poorly and rudely and the food and service a fiasco. We were greeted by a hostess (not a very nice or friendly one) then passed off to a server that kept us waiting forever while he watched the football game at the bar there. We ordered our food finally. Then another order to another table came out and another table was served. Our food was on a stand while the other table was being served. A bird flew on our food, pecked and ate at it, then fully disrespected it and deficated on it. They tried to serve it to us!! I told our server "see the bird do-do on my food? I can't eat that". He said "I know". No apology was made, nor an offer to replace the order. The server sneered at me and then huffed away. We left deeming the food unreliable for sanitary reasons. The people at the hostess desk shrugged their shoulders and couldn't care less. Then to add insult to injury, one little worker said "it's outdoors, what do you expect"? Hmmm....perhaps serving one table at a time would be a start. That outlet and it's nasty workers are gross. "Rusty Harpoons" and "Leilanis" much better, good service, no attitude, and no bird dropping in food. The room service was great! The food was delicious (expensive, but wonderful) and the service quick and courteous. Was impressed by a call back to make sure all was good with our room service...it could not have been better. The "Heavenly Bed" was indeed heavenly and comfy. Slept so well and feel so rejuvinated and rested. "Heavenly Shower" a stretch as it is simply two shower heads and nothing too impressive.It was a almost perfect (except for "Onos") stay and I can't wait to go back. I'm missing it already and it was a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tog10
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Maui, stayed at the Westin Maui Resort for 2 nights (not enough) through Priceline. Beautiful hotel, great service at front desk. We got upgraded to an ocean view room, and it was a beautiful view of the ocean on one side and the golf course on the other. Room is pretty typical size, although small if you are considering the rack room price. Beds were nice, although I've stayed in a Westin with a more comfortable bed. Nice pool and beach area. Only ate at Ono, which was ok. Food prices were very high, as to be expected. Location is great, beach right in front of the hotel, Kapalua area 10 minutes to the north, Lahaina shopping and restaraunts 10 minutes to the south. My only major complaint is the parking situation. They don't have nearly enough spaces. Parking spots are very, very tight, and at night the valet drivers park vehicles behind parked cars in the lot. I had to leave hotel at about 10:30 one night, and had to have a valet come and move the car behind mine, then valet it when I returned. Also, the place tends to shut down by 10. We went to eat one night at about 9:40, and all the restaraunts main menus had ended, including at the Whalers Village, which was surprising to us. Overall, though, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “heaven with a timeshare desk”
Reviews.Author: pigeonbob
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. I know that everyone has different experiences based on when they go and what happens but I had a good experience. When I first checked in they gave me a free upgrade to a mountain view room and a voucher for the buffet simply because they didn't have a king bed room but only a room with two doubles. I could have cared less but it was nice of the lady checking me in to offer me the stuff. It was good customer service and I appreciated it. The grounds are very nice. In the lobby there is an artificial pond with 4 pink flamingoes, 2 swans, lots of koi fish and some large tropical birds. I heard one of them say "hi" a few times. The pool/pond complex is amazing, there are various pools, tunnels, and waterfalls. There is even a whirlpool in one of the tunnels. There is also a waterslide but I didn't use it. I've heard that the pool area can be very crowded but it wasn't at the time I went (after labor day) I had no problem getting a spot at any time of day but I can see how it would really suck if the pool was so crowded that you can't even get a spot. All of the phones in the hotel have a one touch "service express" button that you can press. I used it to order room service and it rang just once and the pleasant lady answered and addressed me by name. She transferred me to room service and a while later after I had eaten she called me back to ask me how the room service was. I was pretty impressed by that. I have to say that I experienced pleasant and courteous service by every staff that I encountered. The room is a bit smallish but nice and clean. Most of the rooms have balconies. There is a large screen t.v. with cable, a safe large enough for a large laptop and a small refrigerator and in room coffee maker with coffee, cups, creamers, etc. It is very expensive to eat on the grounds. For example, it was 17 dollars and something cents for a large coffee, a muffin and a half-papaya. But not to fret, there is a free shuttle to Lahaina. You need only to show your room key to board but I always tipped the driver a dollar. The prices are lower there and Hawaii sales tax is only 4.166%. There is also whaler's village shopping center which is literally right next door. Their food court is a joke but will do the job in a pinch. Oh, another thing, if you charge something to your room they AUTOMATICALLY add gratuity! I think I tipped twice before I figured that out and I always tip 20%. I felt so used! Read the fine print on the room charge thingy. There was a free hula show at whaler's village. They were like hula students and they really brought it! The workout room was ok, the equipment was quite old but everything worked like it was supposed to and all the cardio equipment has a t.v. in front. One other thing, this hotel is not good for singles. There were hardly any singles here, just couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: KJSONIT
Reviews.Content: I see that others who have stayed recently had the same issues that we did - overcrowded areas, rude staff, overpriced food and beverages and small, outdated rooms. For our 5 year anniversary, my husband and I went to Maui, where we got married 5 years ago, and then came back for our one year anniversary. The hotel seems to have stagnated over the past few years with no updates or upgrades and the experience was NOTHING that I have experienced from other Starwood Properties. I got a package deal from Starwood for $795 for 5 nights, which is a great deal for anywhere on the island. But, we would have paid more to stay in a calm, romantic environment. Or at least one with a staff that was not rude. Our 6 year old neice was part of our group and when she went to get a lei (they were out hanging to be easily placed on arriving guests - but not us) one of the people in the lobby (bell boy? valet? who knows..) yelled at her. It was totally embarrasing. The woman that checked us in was so unpleasant and placed us in a double room "as I requested". At no time did I request this, and when I told her we were there on our anniversary, she said "good for you - but you requested 2 beds". Really? that is how we are treated as Starwood gold members? At least someone came to put the beds together that night. But the headboards were not moved, so there was this huge gap and the pillows fell between the wall and the bed within 5 minutes. I could go on, but the other reviews seem to cover everything. I will say that our last night in Maui we ended up staying an extra night, so we checked into the Hyatt. From the moment we got there and proceeded to the front desk, we looked at each other with that look - we instantly knew we should have been here the entire stay. The room was georgous, the staff delightful and attentive, and check out was even a breeze. Next time, it's the Hyatt. Sorry Starwood - you lost a customer here.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Experience, but a very busy place”
Reviews.Author: SteveinDallas
Reviews.Content: If you are a fan of Westin hotels, I don't think you will be disappointed. This was a well-managed place with helpful staff and largely followed the standards I've come to expect at Westin hotels. Our room was up to date with granite countertops in the bathroom/bar area and a flat panel TV. We did talk to one person on the management staff who indicated that our tower (Ocean Tower) had recently been remodeled and that the other tower was scheduled to be remodeled in the next year. I suspect that some of the negative reviews could be based on which tower folks stayed. For the standard room rate, I can certainly understand how there would be disappointment at an out of date room. A few notes: - the grounds are beautiful, but it is crowded. Occupancy stays above 90% year round. Pool chairs have to be grabbed VERY early in the day if you want a good spot (or spot at all). This did not bother us too much, but if you are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway, this might not be the place. Those not solely concerned about the traffic, or have kids - no worries. Everything is still clean and beautiful. - Amenities are high. Morning coffee is over $4!!!! However, prices are high all over the island, so considering hotels always charge more, I think that this is more reflective of the locale. - Housekeeping/maintance/bellhop and other services keep up remarkably well, despite the traffic - has all the usual good stuff....heavenly bed & shower, Westin ambiance, great service, etc. - Parking is FREE. And, if the lot is full, valet becomes FREE - Concierges are plentiful and extremely helpful - HEAVY emphasis on the Villas (timeshare property down the street). We received several perks for attending a free sales presentation. Overall, I gave up the time (advertised as 90 minutes, but took longer), because of the perks, so can't complain too hard. However, all the concierges try and sign you up for the sales demo and the pitch is pretty hard. Our sales agent was pleasant and helpful, but when the manager came in at the end to give us the hard sell, it started feeling a bit distasteful. I'm a loyal Starwood customer and don't need the "hard sell" treatment. The Manager seemed disappointed and even put off after we finally convinced her that we would not buy that day. A little too much for me. OK, but the program is cool if you can afford it. - Restaurants are OK. We weren't disappointed as the environment is great. Price is very high and food is good, but not top notch. Eat there for the environment, but plan on getting out for fine dining, if you are so inclined. Overall, this is a good place and I will stay again if back on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs a BIG refresher”
Reviews.Author: seekay03
Reviews.Content: We stay at Westin and Starwood hotels in general very often. Finally having a few days to vacation rather than travel for business, we chose the Westin in Maui because the pictures on the website looked great. The hotel is nice, and the staff are in general very accomodating, concierge service is excellent. The hotel used to be a Japanese hotel so the rooms are quite small. As a Starwood gold member, we were upgraded to a larger room, but this shouldn't be considered the norm. In addition, the hotel is very in need of a complete renovation. The rooms are worn, the bed is not the same caliber as the "expected" heavenly bed, and the heavenly shower is a bad Y splitter with 2 shower heads that are positioned so low that I had to duck to wash my hair. Restaurants are very over priced considering right next to the hotel Whaler's village ( a small outdoor mall) offers various other restaurants and 3 miles away there is the town of Lahaina with many more restaurants. The pool area is OK, there are 5 small sized pools with a couple of water falls, but again, very out dated. The adult pool has very limited seating and the other pools are VERY family friendly. We enjoyed ourselves because we were in Maui and the hotel is nice, but we did expect more. It is unfortunate that there isn't a "standard" level of quality when booking a Westin, they really range from the high end to the OK. It was explained to us that even though the property has 760 rooms, it is one of the highest grossing Westin hotels with an average 98% occupancy rate at all times. I guess you can see Starwood's priorities when charging $400 for a room that as long as they are selling out, there is no need to renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but crowded with rundown room”
Reviews.Author: paul8292
Reviews.Content: I'm a platinum starwood member so frequently stay at Westins and other Starwood properties. I was expecting much more but this was probably my most disappointing Westin experience. We had a corner suite with amazing views but the room was run down - I've been told the renovations are beginning Sept '07. Furniture was beat-up / broken, dusty, bedding smelled like bad body order (had housekeeping replace blanket/comforter immediately), high-speed internet hardly worked, shower was as small as a cruise ship with no shelf for products (shampoo bottle on the floor but I believe regular rooms have a shower/tub and not the separate stand straight shower). Check-in was 2-hours late and only after multiple visits to the platinum check-in desk - no call on my mobile as promised. The concierge attempts to get you into a timeshare demonstration after helping you with your reservations/activities. If you want a relaxing Hawaii vacation you probably don't want to stay in the crowded, over developed Kaanapali area. Lastly, the $20 resort fee which pays for the non-working internet, access to the healthclub/steam/sauna (included as a platinum anyway) and parking does not even include chairs at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations”
Reviews.Author: travel_a_lot000
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui where we spent 6 days at The Westin. Our experience was mixed. This is a very large, very busy, high rise hotel. The common areas are bustling and crowded at all hours of the day and night. My opinion is that the infrastructure is not adequate to keep up with the number of rooms (meaning guests) in the hotel. For example, the self parking lot fills up and you have to valet park your car. This service is free if self parking is full, but then you are forced to wait for the valets to get your car for you - not an easy task considering the cars are stacked to maximize the number of cars in the lot. The wait can be up to 20 minutes during prime time - definitely call for your car a half hour before you want it. The line at the coffee bar is 15 minutes long in the morning. And by the way, I paid $50 for 2 bagels, a yogurt, a banana, a bottle of OJ, a muffin, and precut fruit one morning. We waited for elevators all the time. The worst part, however, is the pool area. The Westin has done a good job of cramming a pool lounge into every possible nook or cranny of the large and lovely pool area. Even so, there was not a chair to be had between the hours of 8AM and 4PM every day of my stay. And unless you are willing to get up with the sun, forget about a chair under an umbrella. These are reserved by resourceful early risers by 6:15AM, despite the hotel's policy against it. Being on east coast time, I watched from my balcony as guests dropped towels, books, and pool toys on rows of chairs at 6AM then walked back into the hotel. It was very disappointing as my kids wanted to spend more time at the pool, but there was no place to sit! Other reviewers have written about the rooms. The rooms are small, but clean, comfortable, and laid out well. I had no trouble storing 4 suitcases full of stuff into the dresser/armoire. So while the rooms aren't spacious, they are clean and comfortable. The service was good, especially considering the density of the hotel. My recommendation is that if you are looking for a romantic, quiet, restful property, look elsewhere. But if you want a nice beach, a fun pool, and a location convenient to food and shopping, The Westin will meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Hawaii and Westin didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: bellissima66
Reviews.Content: I had been dying to go to Hawaii forever but being from the East Coast it's a bit of a trek. I moved to Seattle and had my chance a few months after I moved. I chose Maui based on feedback from friends that it's higher end than some other islands (beach, shopping, great food). We stayed at the Westin. Rooms are quite small but clean. Lobby is very nice. Check in and service was good all around. Breakfast buffet was included with our room and was yummy. Lots of different pool areas and different activities. Beach was nice. All in all this was a great choice for 2 single girls in our 30s looking to relax but not wanting to be so remote that there was nothing to do. Highly reccomend walking around and eating in Lahaina (we went 3 times). David Paul's Lahain Grill was fabulous. EO Trading Co restaurant was delicious...not used to strip mall restaurants but this one is worth overlooking that. Maui was awesome and will return.

Reviews.Title: “too many better choices”
Reviews.Author: sjohnson682
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin and was extremely disappointed. I have never experienced such bad service in any hotel ever before. The staff was extremely rude and treated you with no respect. Everything is greatly overpriced and not worth the money. Breakfast will cost $25 per person. The elevators are very slow and there are only 2 in the main lobby-you can expect a wait. If this is for your honeymoon then be ready for a lot of children-it is nice that they have an adult only pool but beware children do sneak in and also when children want to go on the big slide they run by the adult pool where you may be sitting. Management has no response for problems. I wrote in about numerous complaints and was never contacted by anyone at all! Truthfully, this place is overrated and overpriced. The rooms are not that big and the bathrooms could use a lot of work on them. Beware that they will try and tell you that you are a â€œspecial guestâ€�â€¦meaning they want you to invest in their timeshares. We actually went on it because it was only to be 90 minutes yet was 2 hours and a waste of a beautiful Hawaiian day.

Reviews.Title: “Too congested!”
Reviews.Author: N&N-Global
Reviews.Content: Our ten year old son loved the Westin because of the pools. My husband and I did not particulary enjoy our stay mainly because of the congested layout of the pool area and the crowds and noise. The property is not very wide so the pool area is folded together on multiple levels with little or no views of the beach. The entire main level is noisy and the area near the restaurants and pool is crowded and has a Disney World feel to it. The Ka'anapali beach is a nice long strip of golden sand with high rise hotels and condos (approx. 12 story) along it with a sidewalk running down the strip connecting all the properties. We did not care for this Miami beach type of layout of the area. The area just outside the Westin has a few restaurants and an entrance to the shopping mall, so this area is also crowded most of the time. The hotel is decorated very well in a sleek updated beach design, however, our room (and hall & elevator) was too worn and not cleaned well (for the price) and the "heavenly bed" had a mound in the center. The lobby is very attractive and I like the pink flamengos and the big colorful tropical birds in a around a pool of water, but I'm afraid the waterfalls are too big and noisy and create a constant commotion. It would have been much nicer to have a background soothing sound of running water.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach location”
Reviews.Author: VacationLover168
Reviews.Content: We were impressed about the staff and facility. We spent a lot of time at the 5 connected pools . We had no problem finding a seat for sun bathing. A few steps away is the clear water, low waves, white sands beautiful kaannapali beach. My daughter and I spent quality time every morning while the mom was at well-equipped fitness room. The setting is wonderful. We love the sunset and dinning on a beach restaurant. You can even walk next door for shopping. We spent a few meals in the food court for cheap eats. We spent most of our shopping money at the ABC store since we need the water, sun screen supplies and etc.. The room is just enough for 3 of us. This hotel probably built in the 70s. Overall, I like the location (on beach property, next to shopping, big pool). I will come back if I have a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Maui with Kids!! It can be great!”
Reviews.Author: CarsandBenn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful trip to Maui with our four year old and our sevenmonth old sons. IT WAS FANTASTIC! There is so much for kids to do there. We went for 6 days and 5 nights at the Westin Resort and Spa in Kaanapali, and it was pure heaven. The only thing I would've done differently there is gotten a suite, because the hotel room was tight for the four of us. I was able to rent fabulous baby gear from [--]ahead of time, and were they GREAT! They brought our carseats to the airport and gave them to us at baggage claim, then they delivered a very clean exersaucer, double jogger stroller and a bag of beach gear! They even picked all of it up from the hotel, and met us again at the airport to get the seats again. I would highly recommend using them; we definitely will again. Also, despite some apprehension because of the unknown, we hired two nannys from the Nanny Connection in Maui. WOW!!! We were blown away by these women. They were experienced NORMAL sweet girls around the age of 30, and my kids adored them!! Don't be afraid to do this, it is a great company (and a heckuva lot cheaper than toting along your own babysitter!)

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: TampaRyan
Reviews.Content: At $715 per night for an ocean-view room, I had planned our three nights at the Westin to be the grand finale of our trip to Maui. My husband and two sons, ages 12 and 18, had already spent seven nights at the ResortQuest Maui Banyan condos at around $350 per night. We had been so active during the first seven days of our trip to Maui, I thought we would enjoy the water park and resort atmosphere of the Westin. What a disappointment. The first room I was given (room 375) had multiple holes in the carpet and dirt on the bathroom floor. For the price of $715 per night, I was shocked the room was so rundown, not to mention dirty. It was in the Ocean Tower on the third floor with a view of the parking lot, dumpster and roof of the restaurant next door. If you could look beyond all this, you would see the ocean view, which was magnificent but spoiled by the proximity of the parking lot. I returned to the check-in desk to complain about all this, and was given another room on the seventh floor (room 787). It was closer to the ocean and high enough that the restaurant view wasn't as offensive, but we were still aware of it. The Westin promotes its â€œHeavenly Bedâ€� and "Heavenly Shower." The bed was fine, and the double shower-head is indeed heavenly, but it was in a bathroom with little or no ventilation, and steam condensed on the ceiling in large drops, which then rained down on the bathroom floor. No wonder the bathroom smelled like mildew. A few hours after check-in, I received a message saying the concierge had a gift for me. I went to meet her and she presented me with a box of candy, then gave me the hard-sell to attend a 90-minute time-share sales pitch for the newly-built Westin villas, which are nearby. After paying a room rate of $715 per night, I was insulted to be getting a time-share sales pitch. I had chosen the Maui Westin because its pool area is a water park and thought my boys would really enjoy it. I thought the Maui Westin would be like the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island. But unlike the Hilton Waikoloa, which has its water park far from the lobby, the Westin's water park was practically inside the lobby, and the whole place was a zoo. The Westin is Disney World on the beach, and the pool area is overrun with too many people crammed into too small a space. I happened to visit the Hyatt next door, and it was so serene, I wish we'd stayed there instead. It's on the same beach as the Westin. I don't think my kids would have minded the serenity and less-crowded conditions of the Hyatt, because they didn't seem that impressed by the Westin's water park (and neither was I). The water slide really knocked adults around in a painful way, which my husband and 18-year-old son quickly discovered, but it wasn't bad for a child like my 12-year-old son. However, the slide closed for the day at 6PM, so my 12-year-old had no more interest in the water park after 6PM. To tell you the truth, my husband, 18-year-old son and I were all a little bored at the Westin, and I missed the serenity, privacy, and lower price of our condo at the ResortQuest Maui Banyan, not to mention the laid-back vibe of its Kihei location, and I wished we had just stayed there the whole 10 days of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Honeymoon at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: rebecky
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed to the Westin with a lei greeting, which was our 1st while in Hawaii. We had cruised on Pride of Aloha the week prior. As soon as we checked-in we were upgraded from mountain view to deluxe ocean view! Great way to start off. The lobby looks just like the pictures...very stunning. They even had the makha's (tropical birds). Pink flamingos, fish, flowers, pools, ponds, waterfalls, rock walls, were amazing. Very pretty. We stayed in the Beach Tower on the 8th floor. We could see the sunset everynight from our lanai as well as Black Rock, the mountains, the ocean, boats, etc. The room & bathroom were good size. We bought drinks, lunchmeat, macaroni salad, cereal, bagels, snackfoods at Safeway and we ate breakfast and lunch everyday on the lanai to save $. We went out every night for supper. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants. We did eat at the Rusty Harpoon in Whaler's Village one night which was good. I brought my "maui for dummies" book and it gave numerous good inexpensive restaurants down in Lahaina. Aloha Mixed Grill, Cheeseburger Paradise, Compadres Mexican Restaurant were just a few. Comprades has $1 tacos (chicken or beef) every Tues 4-8p. Aloha Mixed Grill has authentic Hawaiian food. We both got the "plate lunches" which were very delicious. We didn't spend a lot of $ on food but the drinks yes. Every bar has the "lava flows" which I was addicted to. Kaanapali Beach is voted #1 beach on Maui and it is! We went snorkeling at Black Rock and saw a bunch of Hawaiian fish and coral..don't rent your snorkel gear at the hotel it's a rip-off. Walk back in Whaler's Village to the dive shop by the ABC store, much cheaper rentals. The only disappointment about the Westin was you had to rent the beach lounges everyday so that cost us $10/day just to lay on the beach. The pools were awesome. We loved the waterslide. There was quite a few families with kids but that doesn't bother us. It's fun to watch them! For the most part I booked the Westin as soon as I saw the pools, waterfalls, flamingoes, etc. I'm glad I did because we had an awesome time in Maui. We're a middle class couple we tried to save as much $ as possible (we were in Hawaii for 2 weeks with the cruise & Westin), we don't nitpick or complain about little things. If you don't have a good time in Hawaii it is your own fault. We were looking for a once in a lifetime honeymoon and we got it in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven with a Smelly Twist!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiprincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for our honeymoon. We were impressed from the moment we arrived. The valet was very helpful and as we walked through the hotel and into the massive lobby with atrium and waterfalls we knew this was the right choice for us. My thoughts on the hotel were as follows: Rooms: Very nice and updated. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view overlooking the pools. It was a wonderful view. We were actually right next to the elevator and could hear a little bit of noise from that when it was peak times for people to be leaving their rooms. It wasnâ€™t anything to complain about though. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was nicely appointed. The mini fridge really came in handy and we bought fresh fruit and kept it in there to eat as snacks by the pool. Complimentary water is also nice. They also gave us a bottle of champagne with was very sweet of them. The chocolate dipped strawberries were also very tasty. Food: We ate at the poolside cafÃ©, the Ono Bar and Grill, the main restaurant, Tropico , and had room service. The poolside cafÃ© actually had amazing appetizers and the prices werenâ€™t bad. Order the thai chicken wings- they are soooo good. Tropico was decent but definitely not the best food we had on the island. It was about $150.00 for the two of us and neither of us was super impressed but if you donâ€™t want to leave the hotel it isnâ€™t a bad option. Room service was okay but they charge a room service fee that is a tad much and it was very quick. The hotel: Beautiful, Beautiful, Beautiful. We spent some time in the Hyatt because we had to make an emergency trip to a doctor, and his office was actually in the Hyatt. The Hyatt could not compare to the Westin. But if you need a doctorâ€¦ the guy in the Hyatt was fabulous. Took care of an ear infection right away! Anywho, the tropical birds and rushing waterfall are nice additions to the hotel and the pools are so beautiful. There are a lot of kids, but there is enough room that you can have your own space. The beach in front of the hotel was great. Not too good for snorkeling but swimming and splashing around was good times. Service: Okay, so here is the downfall of our trip. We had come back from a beautiful dinner one night and opened the door to our room. It smelled so bad! We checked everywhere in the room and could not figure out where it was coming from. It was so bad that while we were on the phone with the service desk we had to sit out on the balcony with the door closed! I was on hold with the front desk for a half hour and was finally rudely told that a housekeeper was going to come up. What in the world were they going to do?! She came up but didnâ€™t know where it was coming from. That was it, we walked down to the front and requested a manager. We waited until she came back to the room with us. Her face said it all when she opened the door to our room. It was disgusting. It basically smelled like tons of raw sewage. My husband had to get on his hands and knees and smell around the room and noticed that it seemed to be coming from under the door that was adjoining to ours. The manager said that they could not by law open the door, but she went and knocked on the door. Long story shortâ€¦ the people next door did not speak English and when their entire bathtub, toilet and sink backed up, spilling raw sewage all over the hotel room, they decided to just sit in the room with it instead of calling the front desk. The Westin ended up asking us to be out of our room for almost 1 hour so they could do an air treatment to get rid of the smell and clean up the room next to ours. I was pretty disgusted by this and we asked to be changed to a different room, but the entire hotel according to them was booked. So, they ended up paying for two nights of our trip and giving us other credits to the hotel and restaurantsâ€¦ which admittedly was very generous of them. It was a gross night, but we didnâ€™t let it ruin our trip. Overall: I highly recommend this hotel, just beware of smells leaking from under the adjoining room!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort on Ka'anapali beach!”
Reviews.Author: chemtee717
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Maui (the 1st trip with our children, ages 20, 18 and 15). We stayed from July 12-July 20. We had two rooms in the beach tower, 6th floor. We were orginally booked for partial ocean view rooms, but upon check-in, I mentioned that we were there celebrating my birthday and we were upgraded to deluxe ocean view rooms. Our rooms faced the pool area but we also had wonderful views of the ocean/beach and mountains! Our overall impression with the hotel is that is they orginally put a lot of money into it (landscaping is impressive) and all it needs now is some updating. Our rooms were good sized, had large closets and a decent size bath. Two sinks would have been a nice upgrade. The beds were terrrific and we did not have any noise problems at all. The carpet looked newer but needed to be cleaned. Yes, if you leave the balconey door open you can hear the waterfalls and ocean, but that is part of the Hawaii experience! I never heard a sound from any rooms or outside once the sliding doors were closed. The pools were great...the adult only is a nice break from the smaller children and there are lots, but that did not bother us. It is a great deal for families as the kids eat free. We all enjoyed the water slide and waterfalls. The beach at the Westin is much better than at the Hyatt, but I agree that the Hyatt is in better shape. The cost of staying there is much higher though, too. I guess it all depends on what you are there for...we just wanted a nice beach vacation and the Westin certainly meet our needs! The food costs are high, but one needs to expect that anywhere in Hawaii is going to be expensive to eat. We ate at Whaler's Village (Hula Grill and The Rusty Harpoon), twice in Lahaina (Kimo's (was really good) and once at Tropica at the hotel (which I think was the best meal..beautiful sunset views) and at a great burger place called Johnny's which is down near the golf course by the Hyatt. Johnny's is not air-conditioned but had great food for reasonable prices. We also ate at the Sheraton by the pool. Plan to spend $$$ to eat :) Our average dinner bill was close to $200.00 for the 5 of us. Breakfast buffet was $25.00 per person...I believe they offer a package that includes breakfast, get it if you can! We ate breakfast at Whaler's village most days or ordered off the menu. I could never eat $25.00 worth of food for breakfast! Lunch was anywhere from 7.00 to $15.00 per person depending of what you ordered. We bought snacks and soft drinks from the ABC store. Our rooms had mini-fridges which was great for keeping stuff in. The weather was perfect everyday. My husband and boys golfed twice and went diving right from the beach. My daughter and I had massages at the Westin Spa. The hot stone massage is the best I have ever had! We did the luau at the Sheraton....it was just so-so. I would not recommend it, although one of our sons was picked to dance on stage, so that was fun! We have been to the Old Lahaina luau and that is really the best one. All in all a great experience and I would stay at this Westin again in a hearbeat! I wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Yucky Bathroom, Amazing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: VacationingParents
Reviews.Content: WHO WE ARE: I went to the Westin Maui with my husband and three c hildren ages 9, 7, and 6. We decided to go because of the incredible price for the 5 day/4 night stay. Because there were five of us, we had a rollaway bed placed in between the two queen size beds which really made things tight in an already tiny room. We ended up spending quite a bit of time in the rooms because our children need a lot of "down time" between structured activities. Games were played on the beds because there was not adequate floor space. There is no table. I had the kids eating on the counter in the sink area, or on a cooler at the foot of the bed. TIMESHARE STUFF: We did attend the timeshare presentation and got the extra $100. Our personal conceirge (the one who first initiates and schedules you for a timeshare appointment) was Candice and I would highly recommend her. She had excellent suggestions for what to do with children. She was also funny and nice and we enjoyed the hour or so we spent with her getting her suggestions for what to do on our visit. The Westin offers a free kids camp for two children so you can attend the presentation. My kids did not want to go to the camp, but we were assured there would be lots of stuff for our kids to do during the presentation because the staff is used to handling kids. In reality, there was nothing for our kids to do and they were quite bored with most of the time spent there. It would be good if they offered some distraction for different age levels. The presentation was low-key and the visit to the villas was fun. My kids enjoyed looking at the models. No, we did not buy! THE ROOM: Yes, it is small!!! Candice had explained it was built 30+ years ago by the japanese, and they had been designed on the small japanese scale. My guess is that there was originally a closet in the sink area, but the upper portion of the wall was likely removed to create a counter top, and the closet was converted to an area for coffee pot, cups, and more counter space. The wardrobe closet and the drawer space (including the desk drawers) were adequate for the five of us. My husband went to Safeway several times, and we did end up eating food that we stored in the tiny refrigerator. THE BATHROOM: Yuck!!! Old and tiny! They try to make up for it with the shower heads. When I heard about the "Westin Shower", I thought I was in for a spa-type bathroom. No such luck! The "Westin Shower" must refer to the shower heads........ they put in two of them and turn up the water pressure more than I am used to in hotel showers. At other hotels, with their low water pressure, I never feel like I am totally removing the shampoo from my hair. Not a problem with the two shower heads. They also use the curved shower rod so you don't constantly touch the shower curtain with your arm while showering. BREAKFAST BUFFET: I took two of my children to the breakfast buffet one morning. It really is fabulous, especially if you are a meat eater. The eggs benedict were yummy. You can also get made to order omelettes. It was pricey ($25) but my first child was free and the second child was $12. We did not eat any dinners in the hotel but did head over to Leilani's one night for a delicious dinner and a fabulous ocean view table. THE RESORT GROUNDS AND LOCATION: Beautiful!!!!! I enjoyed the beauty of the resort, the convenience of having the amenities close at hand instead of spread out over a huge location. I loved having beach access. We went snorkeling at the Sheraton, which is a short walk down the beach (Black Rock). We were lucky to have a sea turtle in the water with us while snorkeling. Having the shopping center next door was one of the best features of the location of the hotel. I had an ear infection that I did not know about until the plane descended and I had horrible pain. There was a medical service on the 3rd floor, which I would have used, but Candice, the personal concierge, asked questions of me to find out that we belonged to Kaiser Permanente, and she did some research and found a Kasier not far away in Lahina. THE STAFF; They were nice. I think the best service we got was from the bellman (are they still called that????). He noticed we had a lot of groceries, and guessed that the refrigerator would not hold it all, so he took the liberty of picking up a hotel styrofoam cooler, filled it with ice, and delivered it to our room at the same time that he brought up the luggage. Nice touch!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin pros/cons”
Reviews.Author: jachhc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the promotional 5 night stay package. You are assigned to a welcome agent which helps with you any arrangements which is great. No pressure to go to time share presentation but you are offered an additional $100 towards hotel expenses if you go. Worth it to give up 90 minutes-go early a.m. and get free continental breakfast. Not a group presentation but individual couple. Not pushy at all compared to other that we have been to. You get standard room if you go on package time share deal- 2nd floor- view of mountains & parking lot. Still a great deal though. HONEYMOONERS- this hotel is very kid friendly with meals, pools, activities,etc.- suggest you stay at the Sheraton Maui instead. Met many honeymooners who wished they had known there would be so many kids. You can also bill any charges from the Sheraton to your room at the Westin. Sheraton has a great little bar area by the ocean-go about 5:30 for drinks & a light dinner, stay to watch the cliff diver ceremony at sunset. Best mai tai!!! There is a great place for very reasonable food by the Marriott. You can self serve and also order items from the grill and they will take to your table. You sit outside right by the ocean front. Open for all meals. Walk the entire walk in front of Kaanapali hotels. Nice to see all the different hotel properties. There is a nice walkway or you can walk the beach. Gemini sail boat has a great sunset sail. You board right in front of the Westin. Cocktails & a light dinner included. Highly recommend it! Great food at Laninis & Hula Girl also. Suggest Sunshine helicopter ride also. Had massages at the Westin also. If you book a massage early you get full spa privileges the rest of they day if you want to go back to use sauna, whirpool, or steam room. Also did a sail on the America II out of the Lahaina harbor. Different from the Gemini- be prepared for an exciting & wet sail trip- 2nd time we have done it & it is great fun- beautiful! Had our last night dinner at Pacific O's in Lahania- make a reservation ahead- beautiful ocean front and wonderful food. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest hotel in paradise”
Reviews.Author: JulieYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The westin sits on the fabulous ka'annapalli beach and has the location from heaven. The interior design of the lobby is spectacular , with a waterfall and flamingo's. The Heavenly bed is well heavenly and if you wear earplugs the whole time you would have pure heaven. The hotel is dated to say the least as a building and wouldnt be out of place on the high rise strip in benidorm ( no joke) . the patio doors to the balconys are old and have no sound proofing at all. The interior design of the rooms , gives you an immeidate impressions of luxe , but really thats all it is interior design , the walls are paper thin , the bath was more of a shower tray and the sound proffing was none existant. We tried 6 rooms as the first one we went into , wa sover the waterfall whcih was fine , but neighboured the entertaining area , which was very very loud . We had asked for a quiet room by the way. so we were offered another room , complimantary upgrade apparently , whihc we stayed in for the first night due to exhaustion , but his upgradrd room was over the car park whihc is like piccaddilly circus from about 7 in the morning , we then toom a ocena view roomat an extra Â£350 for the 4 nights and its was only quiet whilst the oceann drowned out the sound , you could still hear you neighbours conversation! Maui is superb and well wort a trip my advice get a condo !! as all the other hotels looked the same. If you must viist the westin , just go to the Spa , its was the best massage i have ever had in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: luv2skifast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin-Maui for a week in June and had a wonderful experience. My wife and daughter really enjoyed the lei greeting when we arrived. The check- in process was swift and the luggage arrived promptly with us at the room. The bellman even let us in on a little secret. Use the elevators at the south end of the hotel because they are rarely used and lead almost directly to the adult pool. We took advantage of this tidbit of information often to avoid having to wait for the elevators. We had a room on the top floor of the ocean tower looking down at the Kaâ€™anapali golf course. It was a nice view but we did not come to Maui to stay in the room, so an ocean view was not a priority for us. The room was recently remodeled. It had a nice desk with a built in flat screen television. However I do not understand why they left the little table and two chairs in the rooms. They are unnecessary and really take up valuable space. I was concerned the armoire (instead of a closet) would be too small but surprisingly it was able to fully accommodate all of our clothes. We had to ask for a couple extra hangers and they promptly arrived in a few minutes. We have stayed at Westins all over the country and I can say with confidence that the â€œHeavenly Bedsâ€� are some of the most comfortable of any hotels. The refrigerator came in good use for water, sodas, and adult beverages. If you are looking for a quiet secluded setting this hotel is not for you. When we were there it was full, all 700 plus rooms. Letâ€™s just say the hotel is an active place, but I never felt overcrowded. The hallmark of the hotel is the pools. The grounds and landscaping around them are beautiful. The kids stay mainly around the pools with the water slides. That leaves the adult pool (and bar) and one other as relatively mellow places to soak. Also we came and went all times of the day and never had an issue getting a couple of loungers together. Hint: the pool cabana sells floats for $4. Best deal at the hotel! The pool area is right next to the beach. The beach and swimming are awesome. It is not a good place to snorkel but you can walk down (or take the shuttle) to Black Rock where the Sheraton is, there is good snorkeling there. The beach cabanas and chairs sell out early in the morning so reserve them the day before. We did not eat at the hotel except for Starbucks which was fine since Whalers Village was right next door or you can into Lahania which is only about ten minutes away. The service was way above average. Every request was handled courteously and promptly. For example I went up to the concierge desk to ask for a band aid for my daughter. The concierge smiled and got up on her crutches (I am feeling guilty now) and went to the supply room behind the front desk and got us some band-aids. In general the hotel is in an excellent location. Like I said you can walk next door for dining or shopping. There is a lot of activity in the immediate area so you are never very far from another fun adventure or great restaurant. The bottom line I would highly recommend the Westin for visitors looking for a fun active hotel in the middle of all that makes Maui a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: travelguru5
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fairly small but extremely clean and comfortable. The Westin's Heavenly Beds and heavely showers can't be beat! Location is great! Located next door to the Whaler's Village were there are great restaurants and shops and on a clean and wide beach. Wider, less rocky beach than some of the other resorts in Lahaina. Lobby is beautiful and airy. Pools clean, good temperatures and well kept, though finding pool chairs was a definite problem. Get there early!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Westin is on a great beach, with nice soft sand and clear water. We stayed in the Ocean Tower on the top floor which had a great view of the ocean and a comfortable balcony. The rooms had recently been remodeled and were nicely appointed. There are refrigerators and a room safe. However, the rooms in the Ocean Tower do not have closets and are not particularly spacious. But then again, we did not spend alot of time in our room. The Beach Tower is newer and we did not see the rooms there but understand that they are bigger. Except for the very front units, however, the Beach Tower rooms do not directly face the ocean. The pools were on multiple levels and were warm, clean and nicely designed with waterfalls and children seemed to really enjoy the water slide. The plantings around the pools were beautiful as well. We would have like to have been able to hear the ocean at night instead of the pools. The buffet breakfast was very good. After two days, we learned to asked to be seated in the restauarant on the water (Pacifico)instead of by the pool for breakfast. The hotel is located next to the shops at Whaler's Village (where there is also an ABC for sundries) and a number of good restaurants. We rented a beachside cabana but you have to do this early or they sell out. The hotel cannot offer food/liquor service on the beach, but the pool food shack is nearby. We did not like the $20 per day resort charge. This covers wired internet service in your room (which did not work for us so we had to buy the wireless service), a photograph (which less than 10 guests per day can sign up for and there are 750 rooms or something like that),and a shopping bag advertising the resort. The weather was picture perfect during our stay. All in all, we were happy with our stay, but might try a different hotel on the same beach the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlasiong
Reviews.Content: We stayed there through their offer and it was well worth the price! My husband and I brought our 3 1/2 month old son for his first vacation. I thought the resort premises were perfect to just walk through when we didn't want to get too far from the hotel but my son needed a little walk. They provided everything we needed, including a crib and an electric tea kettle for me to warm up my son's formula. The Heavenly Bed is awesome, our view of the ocean was great and everyone was very friendly and helpful!!! I also used their workout facility and got a massage... all worth it. The only way I wouldn't recommend this resort to, is if you want a quiet time at the pool. It's always busy with kids... which makes it very family-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded With Kids”
Reviews.Author: ssiga
Reviews.Content: We are a well traveled couple looking for a great resort on Maui and can't say the Westin met the expectation. Too many kids, too crowded around the pool area...could have had more beach chairs on the beach....zero on great resturants or nice bar....room was small/bathroom not very well done at all...kind of low-end if you will. Valet parking was a zoo...however, staff was very friendly and helpful...weird that whenever you asked for any kind of assistance from the concierge you received a pitch for the time shares...ugh!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay At The Westin”
Reviews.Author: tjakubin
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at the Westin on the 5 night package that included rental car and 75 dollar resort credit. The standard room with that package is a garden view room which I chose to not upgrade. The view was still beautiful and I think the only time I even really went on the balcony was to leave my swimming to out to there to dry. The room was very clean. Do make sure if you want a lounge chair by the pool that you go down early and lay a towel and/or magazine there to reserve your spot. They go early. Not a big deal. The pool was wonderful to lounge by during the day. The breakfast buffet was very good. Worth the money if you want to eat that much for breakfast. I only did it once. It was way to much food for me so early. Came back late every evening so I never had to self park (because the lot was full) Valet was always available at no charge. Staff was also wonderful. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, enjoyable experience.....but skip the timeshare pitch”
Reviews.Author: napa_vines
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Westin Maui. We had signed up for a Westin Vacation promotion maybe two years ago and finally got around to taking it. First, from what I understand do not go here if you have a garden view room. We upgraded to an ocean view for an additional $195/night (plus tax). The Westin Vacation concierge agreed that it was good that we had upgraded as the garden view "is no view at all". Room was clean, nicely appointed, great bed, flat screen TV, etc. Balcony overlooked the pool and lobby waterfall area. I think you need to be on the 6th floor or higher for best views (we were on the sixth). Also, the waterfalls are NOISY. We slept with the door open, and got used to the thunderous noise. We enjoyed the various pools. The adult pool is somewhat sedate and quiet. The other pools are more "fun" with waterfalls and slides. Kids were prevalent but well behaved and having a great time. Someone in another review had made a comment about the "redneck riviera" but I would not use that characterization at all. Sure, it is commercial, but it is what you would expect. When we want something else we go there (e.g. provencal villa..). Anyway, the hotel is well run and clean and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. However, the Westin Vacation timeshare presentation turned out to be extremely unpleasant. We had no plan of buying a timeshare going in. We made that abundantly clear at the outset of the interaction. We were told that the presentation would take ~90 minutes. I had thought we might have a group slideshow or some such thing. What we had was a dedicated salesperson "work with us" for close to 3 hours. Probably our fault (we were too nice). As we had told them, that such a purchase was not on our radar but we would keep an open mind and listen. What ensued was an ever increasing high pressure sales job. We moved from the salesperson, to his manager, and then the "corporate" manager. At each point, they kept throwing incentives and different deals on the table (only good for the moment). Most of these incentives were variations on free starwood points. We were very straight forward and honest saying that we would not be making such a snap decision on a long term commitment. When we finally walked out we were left with a very ugly taste in our mouth. Their stated purpose of keeping us as loyal Westin customers certainly was not enhanced by this experience. It was demeaning and condescending (manager's attitude). I could go on and on, but frankly we wasted too much time and energy on this topic already. Our advice: the coupons provided for subjecting yourself to this onslaught are not worth it (to us at least). It really put a damper on our whole day. We never ate at any of the hotel restaurants, just used the Colonnade Cafe for coffee/pastries in the morning. Restaurants in Maui that we did go to: I/O - Lahaina (intimate dining on the beach, music from luau next door) Roy's - Kahana (bit of a barn, in a shopping center, food was good). Popcorn shrimp appetizer, a joke, 3 small shrimp for $14 or so. David Paul's - Excellent main dishes. "Cake walk" appetizer - dated preparation and so-so. Banyan Tree (Ritz- Carlton) : Food excellent. Not the high-end fine dining restaurant that we had eaten at 6 years ago (Unui room is long gone). But service was delightful (ask for Robert - (Robaire) and food as well. Great dinner after initial disappointment of it not being the Unui(sp?) room. Capische (Wailea): Very good italian restaurant. Quite a drive from Kaanapali. Beautiful restaurant, sat on the lanai. For Maui, one of the better restaurants. (We live in Napa, California and travel to Europe a lot, so we are rather spoiled). Valet parking at the hotel turned out to be complimentary (not sure this is always the case). Two of the days we rented a cabana on the beach ($60). Nice and private, even though you have neighboring cabanas. No alcohol on the beach (at least, legally). Most people just went to the bar and brought a drink back. Service at the pools is good for drinks and lunch. On balance, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family or couples trip! 2nd stay at this spa.”
Reviews.Author: shuggyshug
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel and spa...and once again we were not dissapointed. If you love a good pool, upscale but comfortable atmosphere, comfy beds, good food, and great service - then this is the place for you. Our first stay was on our honeymoon as a couple - and it was perfect. This time we traveled with 9 other family members (ages 4 - 70) and everyone was pleased with the stay. Kids ate free with adults. Poolside serivce and choices are great. The hotel is right on the beach and is walking distance to several resteraunts and shops. I also enjoyed a great pedicure and hot stone massage. Both of these spa services were overpriced - but were greatly enjoyed. When you go to Hawaii you pay a bit more anyway...why not just go for it and stay at the best? I highly recomend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: azroadrunner
Reviews.Content: Our second place we stayed on Maui was the Westin Maui. It was terrific. We loved getting nice leiâ€™s when we arrived. Our room was gorgeous and overlooked the pool area and beach. The lobby is large and the waterfall and pond(with flamingos and koi) are beautiful. Since it was our anniversary, they gave us some special things which was nice. We found the parking spaces to be small but we always found a space. Parking and internet access are two things included in the resort fee. We have seen this at many large hotels so it was not a huge factor. The flat panel LG display is wonderful in the room. We did enjoy using the laptop in the room, especially to send the picture the bellman took of us (on our lanai overlooking the pool) to friends on the mainland. There is a kiosk for flight checkins in the lobby. We also saw 3 computers at the coffee shop so people could easily check their things online. We ate at the restaurants at the Westin and liked the appetizers and mains. The dessert list included a banana split in a pineapple half, and also a macadamia ice cream creations. They both hit the spot after a day of golf. We also liked keeping drinks in our room refrigerator and enjoying them on the lanai at sunset. The Whalers Village next door is fun for shopping and eating. Haagendazs, shirts, nice art, Hula Grill and Leilaniâ€™s are all popular. We also got our snorkel equipment there at Maui Bobs for about $8 a day instead of much more at the resorts. We walked down to Black Rock and saw lots of fish and some turtles. The catamaran trips for snorkeling and sunset cruising are great fun too- right from the beach. The many pools are nice- busy but not overly crowded. This was definitely our favorite place we stayed. I would love to go back again and again. I have tried to answer questions I had before our trip so I hope you will also enjoy your trip to the beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “room fraud”
Reviews.Author: worldtravels69
Reviews.Content: when booking the room i booked a garden view room when checking in i got s second floor balcony over lookin 3 smelly dumpsters with rats running all over the place when questioning hotel management( marshall gallen, james pulver, chris reeds) they increased my room rate and did not ,move me at all. talking to other guest at the hotel they do this alot. many hidden costs when checking out on your bill next time stay at the ritz carlton at kapula bay. ive traveled to over 42 countries and never got treated like this. traveler beware

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, Definitely one of the Best in Maui. The place to be”
Reviews.Author: MauriceMontreal
Reviews.Content: IT"S A 5 STAR RESORT ALL THE WAY We stayed at the Westin for our honeymoon. I manage a Hotel in Montreal, Canada. So I can be very critical of hotels and resorts. We originally booked the marriot but found out that they were under renovation and the reviews on it were horoble. My wife does not travel much but I do, so you take this review in great consideration. We arrived on Oct 15, 2006 and were immediately greeted at the door. which was very nice of them. They park your car and bring up your luggage asap. The people are very nice and courteous, the service is excellent. The resort itself is amazing. the view and decor is beautiful especially at night. You can take great pictures to remember. The rooms are a nice, some can be a little bigger but it's all up to what your needs are. THE FOOD: I am a very picky eater, so not many place can satisfy my taste. But at the Westin you have great food, the morning buffet is awesome. I have never seen that much great food in a restaurant or resort. Everything on the menu's, no matter which restaurant in the resort you go to is HEALTHY MENU It's definitelly 5 star food and service. The only down fall it's a little pricy but all worth it. The HOTEL The hotel itself is very clean, very modern very nicely decorated. The Pool: The pools are fairly big with slide and beautiful rock decor. Water falls. In a few words, It's a very nice nice setting and just 20 feet away from the beach. Unlike some resort, the Westin as a beautiful ocean front. Last but not least, if you walk to the west side of the resort, you come out to the WHALER SHOPPING CENTER. It's beautiful, some great shopping, Lous Vitton, Rolex, Coach store.. All the high end shopping you can do and some regular shops as well. When you are on vacation, it's very comvenient to have great shopping right be side your resort. All in All 5 STAR RESORT, you have to try it. There are many more details that I did not mention because I can go on and on I let DISCOVER it when when you go there. I don't have the pictures with me right now but a soon as I get a chance I will post them Sincerely MP

Reviews.Title: “More fun than Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: RissesPieces
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Westin on this trip, and 3 at the Hyatt Regency down the beach, and the Westin wins hands down. It's conveniently located adjacent to Whaler's Village, closer to the middle of the Kaanapali Beach walk. Our room was great, it was updated and new, with a plasma flatscreen TV and the Westin signature Heavenly Beds. The Hyatt has an older feel..which might be more Hawaiiana, but for the price I'd take the contemporary luxury of the Westin. Each day at the Westin, housekeeping would provide complementary large bottles of water. It was a great perk not offered at the Hyatt. The grounds and the hotel itself is upscale and beautiful. Great for wedding photos. Lots of waterfalls, and great birdlife (flamingos, swans). My favorite feature of the resort is the pool area. The tiered pool areas are so interstingly designed and landscaped. Just walking through all of the paths is invigorating and kind of exotic. And there are so many trees throughout that you have a lot of shade options when you're out on the pool decks. The pools are so attractive and can satisfy the adventure lover (water slide) and the tranquility seeker (grotto jaccuzzi, adult pool/hydrotherapy spa). They make Kaanapali Beach look blah and boring in comparison. Each morning, my friend and I would race all of the children to be the first on the big pool slide, which is sooo much fun. It's straight out of a water park. And with the 270 degree turn, adults have the advantage for speed and splash. Several restaurants on site. Tropica has a great appetizer menu. I miss the Westin and would love to go back again if a deal comes my way.

Reviews.Title: “Westin and Ka'anapali Beach - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BoatEscape
Reviews.Content: Our stay: May 3-8, 2007 for our 25th Anniversary. We are in 55-60 age range. This is our first time to Hawaii. Wanted to go at a time when there were less people, so chose May. Weather was fantastic. We have seen such great information on Tripadvisor that we wanted to pay it back with a review. Why the Westin: We selected the Westin, after exhaustive searches because of an invitation based on our Starwood Preferred Guest membership. (ok, ok, so we took the cheapest deal we found!) Thought it was a great price at $750 for 5 nights + a rental car and $75 resort credit. We had a wonderful time, do not regret our choice and would return to the Westin and would recommend it to anyone we know. They do ask you to go to a presentation and entice you with additional credits if you go. We went, had fun looking at the Westin Villas a little to the north and got $300 of extra credits for doing it. Also got another card for 50% off future stays at Starwood properties, except Hawaii. For an hour or so, not bad, for us at least. I have noted that the reviews really vary depending on people's expectations and travel experiences. We probably tend to be less critical than many people we know. We travel some, but not a lot and thought the rooms were just fine for the amount of time we spent in them. We would have liked a larger fridge as we like to keep a few breakfast things and some drinks, but that is about it. Otherwise, very comfortable and clean (My wife is a clean nut and she did not make one comment on the room cleanliness.) Some amenities we liked: Heavenly bed (it was!), double headed showers, thick towels, small liquid creamers provided, 2 free bottles of water each day. Check in went smooth. Upgraded from a parking lot view to a Garden View right above the coy pond and the waterfall, so a little noisy. But again, we liked it just fine. Rec'd a bottle of champagne for our anniversary, which was a nice touch! All service was friendly and quick, no complaints at all about anyone. We checked in early afternoon and stopped at the Tropica, Westin's beachfront restaurant for our first drink and some relaxing Hawaiian music. Then went next door to Lelani's in Whaler's village for something to eat. Had our first Lava Flow, which we recommend, some good grub, and finished it off with a Hula Pie. Only need one for a couple, if you still want to fit in your bathing suit. The Pools: 5 pools, was really great. Spent most our time at the adult pool. We have a similar complaint that people grab the lounges early, go back to bed, go down and have breakfast and then come to the pool. I guess this is the way of the resorts, but we found it to be really rude. We wish the resort would remove their things after 30 minutes as promised. The bar at the adult pool has a drink special everyday. If you hear someone talking about a "Sweet Lorraine", be sure to try one. Fantastic! Similar to a Lava Flow, only better. The Area: Ka'anapali Beach is about 10 minutes North of Lahaina and 45 minutes from the airport. Quite a few resorts along this stretch of the beach. There is a beach walkway between the resorts and the beach and it gets used a lot and you get to view a ittle of all of the properties in the area. It really fills up in the evening as peopl are venturing out to eat, view the sunset and generally mill around. Being next door to Whaler's Village, you can get about anything there you need, and some things you don't need and can't afford :). Great shopping. Several really good restaurants. The Beach: Ka'anapali is a highly rated beach in many publications. The waves aren't big at all, but do break right onto the beach, so if you stand right in them, they will really rock you. Just move a little father out and you just bob up and down in the swells and it is not worrisome at all. My wife was a little worried, so we checked out a free noodle from the Westin and she just floated on that and had fun. The water is very clear. As others have said, a good place to snorkel is a few minutes walk north at Black Rock and the Sheraton, which is a sister hotel. Things To Do: At 56, I took surfing lessons for the first time from Maui Surf School just a few minutes walk south along the beach walk. You can see the waves on the point to the left from the beach in front of the Westin. This was very convenient and they were great. The waves were just right for beginners. I had a blast, altho could not use my arms for 2 days! We wanted to do the parasailing and watercraft, but it is shut down for the whales until May 15th. The Old Lahaina Luau was a highlight. Great fun, good food, good presentations and service. It is a buffet style, but worked for us. Do book it as early as you can for the best seats, altho any seat had a good view. Shopping and eating in Lahaina is fun. Be sure to see the Banyon tree. Drive to South to Wailea, be sure to drive to the end of the road and the lava flow. You get to see some great snorkeling areas and scenery. And North to Kapalua and beyond. Road gets very windy, but great scenery. Places To Eat: *Ka'anapali : Places really fill up 6-8 PM. If you can get there by 5-5:30, you will get right in and can relax and watch the lines. - Lalanie's (can you remember Hula Pie? Ate there twice and great foos and service. - Hula Grill (a sister to Lelani's) - Good food and good times. - Rusty Harpoon - Had a good lunch. Ate there for dinner and had one good meal and one so-so meal. - Castaway - We were told about this place just north of Black Rock, but could not find it in the dark and did not get back to look for it. It is a local place and right on the beach, but I think the resorts kinda hide it. We really got a great recommendation for this one, but missed it so much food, so little time! *Lahaina: - Moose McGuillicudies â€“ Great happy hour, friendly place.. Did not eat there. - Bubba Grumps â€“ Be sure to get their Garlic peel-n-eat shrimp. We wish we would have made that our whole meal. Their Bucket of Junk (? Something like that) was pretty good and filling. Margaritas were the worst we have had. Maybe they had a more expensive one that was better, but they did not ask us. The waitress there was simply great fun. Large line for the restaurant, but we got right in to a table at the bar. - Several 2nd stories bars with happy hours including Mooseâ€™s, Hamburger Paradise. They sure sounded fun. *Kihei: - Kihei CafÃ© â€“ On main street and with all the sites we missed it the first time through. One guide book called this a dive with great food. Maybe I need a definition of dive. It has a walk-in order, then go out and get a table. I would not call it a dive. When Barry tells you to get the Fired Rice and Eggs â€“ Do it. Great meal. Our omelet was excellent as well. Both were well above average size, so we did not need to eat the next meal. - LuLuâ€™s. This is just behind the Kihei CafÃ©. We were actually looking for it when we at ate the Kihei cafÃ©.. It is on the 2nd or third story, but you need to look down the side street to see it.
