We ate at one in Waikiki that was great and we heard great things about this one from friends and family. That is probably more than you all needed. Hope we can get back soon and hope this helped anyone that is going the way this forum has helped us. Bob & Sharon

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: mizzrizz
Reviews.Content: Met a friend for a long weekend in April at the Westin Maui Spa & Resort. I was a bit skeptical because the overall ratings for this hotel were low, but I love the Westin's Heavenly Beds! Overall, the hotel was above average. The staff was professional and accommodating and the hotel adds special touches like a personal lei greeting every time you return from the hotel (okay, maybe this was meant for new guests, but I accepted every time we returned from an outing) and free yummy fruit essence beverages in the lobby. The hotel has a luxurious and tropical feel and both the lobby areas and rooms are clean and well maintained (at least mine and my friends were on the 7th floor). Hotel food is mediocre and expensive. The Spa was nice, but not outstanding; I had a crappy pedicure, but the massages and other treatments were great, albeit pricy. The pool was fun and very exotic with waterfalls and caves; like most resorts the pool chairs were crammed and I was disappointed when I saw empty garbage floating a few times. A public-use walking path that joins several hotels separates the hotel from the beach. This beach is just okay for swimming.. unlike the Kihea area, it's a bit rough.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice time at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: bezeck
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a last minute trip to Maui the week of April 24th. We booked the Westin through Travelocity.com. We booked a flight + hotel (garden view) package and the once we checked in, the concierge offered us a free upgrade to an ocean view room (with double beds though). We jumped at the offer and enjoyed the cute balcony with a fantastic view of the pools, palm trees and, of course, ocean. We also loved the flamingos and black swan milling in the hotel pond in the lobby. The hotel is big and there are always lots of people milling around. We had no problem getting pool chaises (we preferred the adult pool) plus we spent a few days on the great beach that is just a few steps away from the pool. There were 3 places to eat right there plus there were some lively places right next door. We choose to check out Lahaina most nights but the Westin restaurants always seemed bustling with guests. Overall, this is a great hotel with very nice staff and also nice guests - it's just quite big. if you are looking for a quaint boutique-like experience, this is probably not the best place to stay. if you want a nice overall experience, then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Westin - A little taste of paradise”
Reviews.Author: IowaWannabeinMaui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui from 5/3-5/10. First this is a great time to visit Maui. It is their low season so it was not terribly busy. We did notice that when we left it seemed to start getting busier. We were upgraded from an ocean view to a delux ocean view which also gave us a bigger room. The view was incredible. The only negative was it overlooked Whalers Village so there was a bit more noise and you couldn't hear the waves in the morning due to the trucks that would be bringing food to the restaraunts. The room itself was okay, not a 5 star room but we were hardly in the room. The one thing that others had commented about that I agreed with is the carpet - stains everywhere! This definitely needs to be replaced. We also got the breakfast buffet included with our package and if you get the chance you'll want to do this as well. The buffet was amazing - there was so much to choose from and we didn't have to eat again until dinner. Now to the best part of the hotel - the POOL! I can't say enough about how fabulous the pool was. Waterfalls, waterslides, hot tubs, adult pool, wow! Plus the pool is so close to the ocean you can walk from the pool to the ocean in less than a minute. We checked out many other pools in the area and NONE were even close to the Westin pool and many were much further back in the resort so it would take you a few minutes to walk to the beach. Plus the beach in front of the Westin had just the right amount of waves to make it fun. Also the best place to park yourself for the day is the pool right below the adult pool and closest to the ocean. There were hardly any kids in that area so it was fairly quiet. Plus you can still hear the ocean waves. Word of warning - it you want to be under a shaded umbrella you must get to the pool early. There are very few umbrellas and when afternoon hits the sun is hot. We were out there by 7 am and by 8 all of the shaded spots were taken. Many people would put magazines, rafts, etc. on the chairs to reserve them. Management says they will pick these items up within 30 minutes but I never once saw them do this. Warning - the drinks are ab out $10 but we found out the drinks everywhere (even restaraunts were around $8 or higher). Overall while the rooms aren't the greatest (they are not bad by any means - just not 5 star) the pool and beach location make this resort the place to be. Other things not to miss on Maui - The Road to Hana, Lahina shopping - there is a guy close to the Banyon Tree in Lahina that has parrots that you can get your picture taken with. They actually sit on your head, shoulders, and arms. It's a bit pricey but worth every penny. This was our best vacation by far and we've been around the world. Please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time At The Westin In Maui”
Reviews.Author: WIHappyfamily
Reviews.Content: After staying 2 nights at the Grand Wailea on the other side of the island, we stayed 5 nights at the Westin in Maui from May 2-7, 2007. We had a nice time at this hotel. We traveled with our 3 children ages 5, 3, and 11 months. Hawaii is a great vacation destination for families. It is beautiful, nice weather, the people are nice, it's safe, and you are still in America. This was our 5th trip to Maui and our 1st time staying at the Westin. There were plenty of families with children at the Westin as well as couples younger and older. Upon check in you receive a lei which is nice. Not all the hotels do that. The service was fine. The housekeeping, bellman, and valet came quickly when we called. Most of the time we parked our own car. Although, the parking lot does fill quickly in the evening. If the lot is full the hotel will valet your car for free. The hotel rooms are a little above average. We had a basic hotel room. It was a little small and a little less appealing in the decorating than some hotels. The heavenly beds are always nice and the room was clean. The hotel lobby and landscaping is very nice. In the lobby there is a lagoon with a waterfall, flamingos, koi fish, swans, birds, and a fish tank. At 9:30am every morning the kids can feed the koi fish. The Westin pools are very nice. There are 3 large pools that are connected with waterfalls, a tunnel, and slides. There is a large waterslide that my 5yr. old spent almost all her time on. There is also a smaller, slower slide for children that parents can also go down with the child. There is also an adult only pool. The biggest complaint I had was that the Westin does not have a baby pool/play area for smaller children that cannot swim on their own yet. The pools depths are 3 feet or above, making it hard for parents with small children. You have to hold your child in the water or rely on floatation devices. We have stayed before at the Hyatt and the Grand Wailea and these places had a sandy baby beach area with zero depth entry. My 3 yr. old son enjoyed theses areas so much better and it made it easier for us to watch him and our infant. I have seen that the Marriot also has a baby pool and play area. We were always able to find a chair by the pool near the waterslide to keep watch on our older daughter. The Westin is very strict on their wristband policy when using the pools. Twice I saw people being told to leave the pool because they were not registered guests. You must remember to return your beach towels or they will charge you. The food was good at the Westin. Better than most hotel food. We ate at the breakfast buffet twice and at the "grab-and-go" food area for breakfast once. We have grown to love the big breakfast buffets that all the hotels have in the morning. Always good and worth the higher price. We have times we eat such a large breakfast we can last until dinner. At the Westin, the kids eat free for each paying adult. We realized it was the same price to eat the breakfast buffet with the kids eating free than paying for all of our individual items at the "grab-and-go" area in the morning. We also orderd food from the resturant that they deliver poolside. The food was very good and a little pricey. A few times we also got snacks, ice cream, and drinks at the Sea Dogs snack bar by the pool. The Westin is very nice because it is right next door to Whaler's Village. This is very handy. There are resturants and lots of shopping. If you happen to walk past Whaler's Village all the way down to the end of the strip you will come to the Sheraton hotel which is built around Black Rock. If you go to Black Rock to swim or snorkel, remember that the Sheraton is also owned by the Westin. At the Sheraton you can make charges back to your room at the Westin. We rented beach chairs and an umbrella and used their beach towels. You can also charge food there or rent snorkeling gear and buy whatever else you need. The policy has changed a couple years ago and you cannot use the Sheraton pool. Overall, we liked the Westin with the exception of lack of baby pool area. We have also stayed at the Hyatt and the Grand Waleia, which we also greatly enjoyed. A few tips, there is a K-mart that is not far from the airport. It is always busy with people loading up with food, drinks, sandtoys, and stuff before going to their hotels. Don't go to the magic show and dinner at the Kannappli Beach Hotel. It was horrible. Not the quality of entertainment that you would expect to see on a high class vacation. If you want to see a show, go to any luau or to Ulena. We also took our kids to the new glow in the dark mini golf course which is one block off front street off the parking lot near Hilo Hattie. Our kids really enjoyed that. Our favorite beach in Maui is Kapalua. It is beautiful and is one of the top ranked beaches in the country. Always great snorkeling right off the beach. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: EWarren
Reviews.Content: We just left the Westin Maui after 5 nights in an ocean view room. I must say, it was quite disappointing. I'll try to be organized in this review....i'll start by saying a travel often and used westin points to book this stay. Hotel Condition: From the outside, the hotel is quite dated. The lanais have old railings that don't seem that secure. In the inside, they have done a nice job with the lobby, common areas/restaurants, spa and pool area. although the guest rooms were re-done, ours was not in good condition. the valence was quite dirty, the wood furniture items were quite worn for their age (assuming they were not too old). the washroom was odd, as 1/2 of it was part of the hotel room (sink/vanity) and the other half was cramped and not clean. Service: Horrible. With the exception of the greeters/bellmen, there was no service. Concierge sent us a letter prior to our arrival, which we thought was a nice touch, however, our session with her quickly turned into a timeshare pitch. When she learned we were not interested, she had no interest in helping us with activities. Food: We can't really provide a great deal of info here, as we only dined at Tropica 1x for dinner. Portion size was small for the price and quality was not 5 star. Not sure if we just had a badly positioned table, but we were amazed by the amount of server confusion/chatter. Clearly not a well oiled machine Pool: This was the only plus. The 5 linked pools were a bit dirty, but quite fun! Overall: Not even clse to any other Westin i've stayed at. In no way is this a 5 star property. also, be ready for time share pitches around each corner by cleverly disguised "concierges". We did stroll down to the Sheraton a few times.....wish we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: soonerfans
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleased with our 5 days at the Westin resort on Kaanapali. We booked a "garden view" room for $199/night (they were running a special) and we fully expected to be on the 2nd floor overlooking the dumpsters. When we got there we were greeted with leis. We found out our room was on the 6th floor, so at least we wouldn't be quite so close to the dumpsters. When we got to our room (629) we were overlooking the ocean! We were so excited. There was a bucket with champagne and glasses waiting for us (our 10th anniversary). What a wonderful time! So here's our tips and suggestions... The spa - I did the sea weed body wrap and it was fine. The spa itself is very luxurious. A great way to have some quiet alone time. The restaurants - We had drinks at Tropica one night and they were ok. We didn't eat at the hotel because we felt like they were a little pricey. The pool - So fun! Make sure you get a wrist band when you get your towels. The bands change everyday to make sure people from other hotels don't try to sneak in. The shuttle - check with the hotel for pick-up and drop-off times. very convenient at parking in Lahaina can be difficult. They pick up at the hotel and drop off at 3 locations in Lahaina... all free! Snorkling - we rented our equipment from the Dive Shop located in Whalers Village (immediately next door to the Westin) and it was $25 for the week... much cheaper than a lot of other places we heard about. Go Whale watching (if it's in season)... I went with Pacific Whale Foundation and it was amazing! They guarantee you'll see whales or you can go again for free. $20 for the 7 AM tour (2 hours). We never had a bad meal... we went to the Plantation clubhouse up at Kapalua, Leilani's, the Rusty Harpoon (both in Whaler's Village), Kimo's and Bubba Gumps (both in Lahaina). We also went to the store and bought some groceries for the room. You can pick up groceries at ABC in Whaler's village or in Lahaina at Safeway or Foodtown (I think that was the name). Go to Hana... so worth the drive. Leave early (like 6 AM). You'll be glad you did. Make sure to visit the black sand beach at the state park (it starts out Waia... then about 12 more letters). It's just before you get to Hana and it was the coolest thing we saw. There was a road side stand just before the state park... we bought macadamia nut banana bread and passion fruit jelly made by some lady named Jane... they were both incredible! We didn't make it on to the 7 pools (my husband wasn't feeling well after all the hills and curves)... we'll go there next time. Take food with you... there are VERY few places to eat and what you find will be extremely expensive. We have absolutely no complaints about the Westin or anything else about Maui. This was my husbands 3rd time to Maui but my first. We can't wait to go back and take our kids!

Reviews.Title: “6 February to 13 February 2007”
Reviews.Author: MisrEmiri
Reviews.Content: I consulted Trip Advisor about my trip to Hawai'i last year and I found myself in disagreement with the reviews about the two hotels where my dad and I ended up staying. The Kaua'i Marriott had received mixed reviews whereas I loved it; the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach had received glowing reviews whereas I was netural on it. So, when I found the mixed reviews this hotel had received, I took it all in with a grain of salt. Our American Airlines flight to Kahului originated in Dallas and landed late in the afternoon. From Kahului Airport, it is about a forty-five minute drive along the Honoapi'ilani Highway to Lahaina and Ka'anapali. We didn't get lost along the way and the hotel was very easy to find. Our check-in was problem-free. However, the room we had on our first night was a "garden view" room on the second floor. Well, this "garden view" looked out over a rise, so one's entire view was taken up by the side of a hill! (I must wonder, what genius ever thought of doing that for goodness' sake?!) We stayed in this room only one night, and after paying an additional $55 per night, moved up to the eighth floor the next six nights we stayed here. The views over the pool, Ka'anapali Beach, Moloka'i and Lana'i were incredible. However, the rooms on the two floors were identical, and I find myself in agreement with others who have commented that the rooms here are rather small. This resort does have a "busy" and at time "noisy" atmosphere. However, for peace and quiet, Ka'anapali Beach is only a few steps away. While we were there, we were fortunate enough to see a mother whale and her calf in the channel between the islands, and one day a Hawaiian monk seal even came ashore onto the beach in front of the neighbouring Ka'anapali Ali'i. Unfortunately, I only waded into the ocean here and did not go swimming as the shorebreaks seemed somewhat intense. With there being no lifeguard on the beach, I didn't want to venture too far into the water. Being a vegetarian, I have found eating out in Hawai'i often challenging. However, the two restaruants at this resort were excellent. I was able to eat very "cleanly" and between maintaining an excellent diet here and staying active, I found myself effortlessly losing weight!! I tried the gym twice and both times, it was quite busy. In fact, on the second occasion, I couldn't find a single unused machine, be it weights or cardio and ended up leaving all together (after all, I thought why bother with a gym when you have a pool, a beach and an ocean at your doorstep?) The hotel helped me arrange surf lessons, so on my 44th birthday, I went surfing for the first time in my life with Maui Waveriders in Lahaina. I also tried surfing a week later in Waikiki and would recommend Lahaina for beginners as there seemed to be no large rock formations lurking just beneath the water's surface. (Yes, I managed to stand on the board three times, and in fact, rode my last wave in all the way to shore to the cheers of my surfing instructor!) The hotel also helped me arrange my bike ride down Mount Haleakala through Maui Mountain Riders. Being up at the summit at Mount Haleakala at sunrise is an incredible (and cold) experience. I also saw quite a few coach tours up there at sunrise so you don't have to do the bike tour to experience sunrise at the summit. Didn't get to Hana, but got to Wailuku, Kahului and the Iao Valley. Prices are quite high all over on Maui and keep in mind that the further one gets from the harbour in Kahului, the pricier things become. My local guides were advising everyone to go to KMart, Wal-Mart or Costco for purchasing local souvenirs. In the end, this resort is beautiful, but there was something about it I can't quite put my finger on that keeps me from giving it a perfect rating like I did last year at the Kaua'i Marriott. However, for a "Hawaiian" vacation, I recommend Maui over O'ahu anyday. I found O'ahu quite crowded this year. They're supposed to starting ferry services soon between Maui and O'ahu. I think next year, I'll stay the majority of my vacation on Maui and just take the ferry for a day trip, if not just a couple of nights, to Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: UK123
Reviews.Content: Aloha I am a UK travel agent lucky enough to go to Maui on the 26 March. The Westin MAui is a great hotel, or should I say resort. The entrance to the hotel is grand and makes you realise that the money is well spent. As you enter the lobby you are welcomed by the sight of Flamingos in a man made lagoon with Parrots at the side. An ambient reception area and speedy check in gives a great first impression. Upon entering the room (Deluxe Seaview) you will find the room large and clean. A nice large bathroom with great amenities and clean fixings oozes quality. The beds are all large and very comfortable. Now the reason to go to Maui. Open your balcony door and you will see the marvelous ocean with views over the island of Lanai and also look into the hills and mountains of the island. Buffet breakfast available for a charge of $25 per head is varied and well made. The eggs benedict is super. You can eat in the lagoon area overlooking the water or overlooking the sea. Dinners and bars within the resort are of a good quality as well. The award winning pool area is made up of five pools, a 128 foot waterslide and a relaxation pool for adults only. There is superb gym facilities and relaxing spa facilities catering for everybody. Next door to the hotel is a great shopping and eating area encompassing all types of quisine and all manner of shops. If you like your burgers go to Johnny Burgers about a minute away for homemade burgers and fries in an intimate environment. All in all a great location. I have all of the information regarding the hotel so if there is anything you want to know drop me a line. Brad

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: spa_mama_ca
Reviews.Content: We were greeted to beautiful floral and taro leis, pineapple & vanilla and berry elixirs. After we entered the resort, we were so excited and taken a back by the beauty of the facilities. OMG, I can go on and on as to how beautiful the entry way of this resort was and is. We were offered an upgrade to partial ocean view, however, weâ€™d have 2 double beds, so, we opted for the mountain view, which just so happened to have a partial ocean view to the right. The staff was excellent, and very helpful. When we return to Maui, we will stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “So Bad We Checked Out Early”
Reviews.Author: rwctraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop on our honeymoon. First, the line to check in was the longest I had ever stood in, about 30 min. Then we get to the room and it is tiny, with no closet and the sink is technically in the room with a half wall between bed and sink. To accomodate for not having a closet, the hotel put an armoire in the room where the tv was located. Upon opening the armoire, was greeted with a mildew odor. Next we opened up the sliding glass door to look out at the view and realized our view was of the gravel roof top of the building next door, and the screen door to the slider had some kind of spray painted graffiti on it. Husband then decided maybe it was time for some Pringles after our 5 hour flight. He went to minibar and opened up the can of Pringles to find it was already opened and half eaten! We tried to grin and bear it at this point and went out to dinner. Came back to our room and found another couple trying to open our door with their room key. We tried to nicely explain that the room they were trying to access was ours, but they told us the hotel had assigned our room to them. When we opened our door to show them we were already settled in there first, they thought we were hiding their luggage and they barged in to look around. When I called the front desk to have them figure out the room assignment confusion, they were not too helpful. After one night there, we could not bear to spend another 2 nights and checked out early. We checked right into the Sheraton next door and had a great stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Yeah!”
Reviews.Author: Beaglehouse
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back there! My wife and I had never been to Hawaii so we chose the Westin based on recommendations. I can see why. Beautiful grounds on the beach and a spectacular pool. Just next to Whaler's Village where there are plenty of shops and restuarants for happy hour and dinner. Just down the highway from Lahaina. Rooms were just fine, for what little time we spent there. I would recommend an ocean view though because the sunsets are unbelievable. The only negative was the parking situation if you get back in the evening with a rental car. We would stay there again, and we can't wait to. Since this trip in October of '06 we've stayed at The Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico and the Westin Maui blows that away...not to mention that we enjoyed Hawaii over the Caribbean hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roxxyhb
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the westin maui and it couldnt have been better. We were in a golf/mountain view room which gave a spectacular view of the sunrise every morning. The room was a tad small but it was clean. The staff was very friendly. Even when I ran into the maids they wuld greet me with a good morning! I was shocked to find such a friendly staff that really will bend over backwards to ensure that your stay is all that you expect it. The Ono restraunt that is there is amazing. They have wonderful food and drink. The buffalo wings with cocnut sauce are a must! They are a little pricey but it s all comparable to Hawaii. I loved this hotel and I didnt have a complaint about it. They have a seperate adult pool so you dont have to deal with all the children if you dont want to. The adult pool is quiet and there are no children allowed at all so you can relax in peace. The beach was very clean as well and there werent a lot of people on it which was nice. The valet is so nice and they are friendly. A few times the self park lot was full and so the valet parked our car free of charge and was very nice about it everytime, I look forward to visiting the westin maui again and am happy to say its one of the best hotels I have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great location, be prepared to pay for everything”
Reviews.Author: TXMellie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort 4/4 - 4/11, which as we soon realized was still spring break for many areas of the country so it was very crowded, lots of kids. We use Trip Advisor to help plan our trips each time we travel so had read all the reviews - good and bad. - This is the most beautiful resort on Kaanapali Beach with the best location. It is very clean and well-maintained, the staff very friendly and helpful. Pull up to the valet when you check in and they will park your car free of charge. We did not know this and the whole scene was confusing. They will take your bags and greet you with a lei. - There are 5 pools, including one adults only area with a spa and bar. The other pools have waterfalls, waterslides and activities. If you plan on spending the day by the pool, you must get up early to claim your loungers. We saw people as early as 6am placing items on the "prime location" loungers. We never were able to get a chair by any of the pools, even late afternoon. The resort has signs stating items will be removed if chairs are not used after 30 mins but we never saw it enforced. - The beach is limited due to erosion but is great for swimming and snorkeling. The beach in front of the Sheraton (Black Rock) is a short walk, very large but also very crowded. There are beach chairs ($5/day) and umbrellas ($25/day w/ 2 chairs) available for rent but are first come, first serve so you must stand in line @ 7:30am if you hope to get one. We tried 4 days in a row and gave up - they would let one person rent 2 or 3 umbrellas and the numbers were limited. We felt like they should be included in the price at a resort such as this. Walk next door to the activity shack - you can rent umbrellas and chairs for the same price and the beach is not as crowded. Beach cabanas (double-lounger with pads, retractable shade cover, $55/day) could be rented but had to be reserved ahead of time. We rented one only once, was nice and had water & pineapple service all day. - Rooms were small but comfortable, bed was great. We loved the turndown service each evening. Upgrade to oceanview if you can afford it - well worth it to watch the whales during the day and sunset each evening. - Food was good but expensive as were the drinks, but lots of other options (Hula Grill was great) within walking distance. The resort and restaurants nearby also have a Happy Hours with drink and food specials. We had a small fridge in our room so went to grocery store (short drive) and bought snacks. Eat at Mama's Fish House if you get the chance - very pricey but the most fantastic seafood we've ever had. - Tours can be booked many places, found the prices at the resort to be high. We did a whale watch (incredible) and half-day Lanai snorkel, both on small rubber zodiac style boats which we highly recommend as there are fewer people and can get to the locations quicker which gives you more time to snorkel, etc. Skip Molokini Crater (about 20 other boats, limited snorkel area, overuse) unless you want to be disappointed and do Lanai snorkel as the reef is pristine and it is not crowded. We saw dolphins, whales and sea turtles and an unexpected group of sharks feeding (from the boat) on a big ball of fish. We love Maui and will definitely visit again but probably rent a condo or house next time.

Reviews.Title: “Think of this as the Tiffany of Maui resorts ...”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2fly
Reviews.Content: ... Lovely and elegant, but at the same time, a victim of its own popularity! The Westin Maui is a gorgeous hotel with beautiful, well-kept grounds -- to keep the property looking so elegant and clean with the literally thousands of people staying here each night is truly impressive. The fact that it is so nice says a lot about the management -- they do not take guests for granted, and clearly work VERY hard to ensure every guest has a positive experience. That is something rare in the hospitality industry! The rooms at the Westin are right on par with other Westins -- comfortable beds, spacious in size, lovely berber carpet, modern, elegant furnishings, big bathroom. Only one small downside - our shower head was quite unfortunately mounted at about 5' off the floor -- for me (5'11") and my husband (6'2") this was annoying (on a beach vacation, it is normal to shower twice or three times a day!). Other than that, we loved the room. We paid for a deluxe mountain view and were upgraded upon check-in to an ocean view with two doubles (we didn't mind being cozy in exchange for the view!). Our room was on the north side of the Beach Tower, so we overlooked Whaler's Village rather than the pool. While the music from the bars and the trucks at the mall were a tiny bit noisy at sunset, I can't imagine it was any louder than overlooking the HUGE pool area! The view north was beautiful -- much more peaceful than looking towards the rest of the resort and Lahaina. Plus, all of Kaanapali seems to shut down by 8 p.m. (there are definitely people in the Whaler's Village restaurants, but it isn't loud) and so there is plenty of quiet. The pool at the Westin is beautiful and well-staffed. There were lots of kids, of course, but lots of couples, too, and plenty of chairs for all. The cabanas are completely reasonable ($60 for the day), but we skipped it, as we always found two lounge chairs. The bars on the property were great, as were the drinks, and I found all of the staff with whom I interacted to be entirely pleasant, professional, efficient and friendly. It was such a treat!! This was my second stay in Kaanapali, and I think it will probably be my last. We were here just after spring break ended in most of the U.S. (one full week after Easter -- and 3 days after the rates went down on 4/16/07) and it still felt absolutely packed with people in the resort, on the roads and in Lahaina. I hate to think what it would have been like during the high season! We went on a little research trip to Wailea one day of our trip, and it seemed SO much more quiet and so much less crowded with cars and people. It is a bit more remote, too -- that's the trade off!. The upside of Kaanapali is the proximity to Lahaina -- there are some GREAT restaurants there that don't involve schlepping upcountry (where the absolute BEST places are -- Mama's Fish House, Hali'imaile General Store, Casanova, etc.) -- it seems like you'd have to eat at your hotel if you were to stay in Wailea. Don't get me wrong about upcountry, by the way -- we were SO smart to book a Haleakala tour with a small, self-guided company out of Haiku, and I wouldn't have missed that for the world. We got to see so many neat little towns on the slopes on the way down that we totally would have whizzed through on the road to Hana. Upcountry is so lovely to visit -- mellow, rural, quaint and beautiful. Try to spend a day tooling around this part of the island, enjoying the lovely restaurants and shops and views! Overall, I had a great time and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Westin to young families year-round and to couples in the off season. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: trsces
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well-appointed, comfortable & clean. The beach is beautiful. Stole down to Black Rock for some out-of-this-world snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! ”
Reviews.Author: Rob_89
Reviews.Content: I was 16 and my friend was 17 (guys) when we went to the Westin during spring break. let me just say The Westin Maui was absolutely gorgeous. The open lobby with its lush landscaping and beautiful waterfalls was jaw dropping. We were amazed at how nice the hotel was. *We stayed in a Partial Ocean View room facing the shopping center. which wasn't the best (Loud truck noises early in the morning) and...you barely see a corner of the ocean and you have a utility deck right below your balcony. However the girls dancing on the balcony of the hotel we were facing wasn't a bad sight ;-) Overall The rooms were decent. Damp sheets etc. but that's what you get in the Maui climate. You are only ever in your room to sleep so no complaints here. *The Pools are second to none in Maui. They are absolutely beautiful...Waterfalls, Slides, Caves. however they are colder than the ocean. The kids will love them. Also you want to wake up early to claim pool side seats as they are snatched up fast. The pool side food and drink service is excellent. Expensive? YES but VERY convenient and VERY tasty.. The Chocolate Banana Smoothies are a definite must (We left with a $1000 pool side food bill) =[ hah. Early in the morning you can take Scuba Lessons in the pool and then go on a Scuba dive. *The Beach is excellent. Snorkeling Gear is provided right in front of the hotel for about $5 an hour.(Definitely worth it) The water is clear and warm..but the waves crash fairly hard. *The Hotel is VERY Family oriented. I believe everybody there was with their family. We were there with ours and Let me say that their was PLENTY of eye candy for us guys. We hung out with several of the girls for the duration of the trip. We even ran into a girl that we had met last summer in Newport Beach. *The Public internet charge is fairly expensive. The restaurants nearby the hotel are great. Try the Mahi Mahi...it is excellent. Overall an AWESOME experience. Stay here and you will NOT regret it. I would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgthompson2
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Maui with our two teenage girls. Excellent rooms, friendly and very helpful staff, plenty to do. Had one minor problem with the room that was dealt with within 30 minutes of making it known to manager on duty. Food was pricey but so is the everything on the entire island of Maui. We would happily stay there again. Even our teenagers liked the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Souless, impersonal and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthPilgrims
Reviews.Content: Lynda and I have just come back from 7 nights in Waikiki, 7 nights in Maui and 4 nights in L.A. By far the most disappointing of our stays was at the Westin in Maui. Maui was lovely, and we did all the trips, overawed by the whales, fell in love with the dolphins and the pacific green turtles, but the Westin was a concrete souless block of rooms which seemed to underline all the excesses of America today. Far too expensive, the food in the "resturants" within the hotel was "plastic" and we much preferred the Hula Grill (next door) or most nights we ate in Lahaina, in the fish resturants (Opah, Mahi Muhi and Ona were my favourites). I did have one breakfast in Ono's (I think) and I sat next to a lady who proceeded to have 12 waffles in one sitting. I felt a bit queasy watching her, so perhaps the food was better than I gave it credit for. I upgraded ($700) to an Ocean VIew room, and it was quite nice to see the humpbacks breaking the surface out in the bay. The hire of the sunbeds at $25 and the cabanas at $60 was laughable, and we heard quite a few complaining about that. Nature gave us a beach and what better way to enjoy Maui than the lie on a towel on the sand, soaking up the rays. The Westin didn't even come near the Moana Surfrider in Waikiki, and much preferred the cosmopolitan mix of Waikiki than the predominantly American clientelle in Maui, and if I ever hear the word "awesome" again, I think I'll scream. Hawaii lovely, Waikiki interesting, Maui beautiful, Moana Surfrider classy but Westin eeuch, not for us, thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: tamstrat
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel which sits right on Kaanapali Beach which in my opinion makes it a very desirable location. We had stayed at this hotel before so we knew how nice the location was and that it was a nice hotel. This stay we did have a few minor, but irritating incidents however. To start, when we checked in we requested that our luggage be sent to our room, then we left to go to the beach and have lunch and a drink at Leilani's (an absolute must! It's a great little place right on the beach to people watch, drink a Mai Tai (or two!) and watch the famous Maui sunsets). 2 hours later we came back to our room to change clothes and get ready for dinner and our bags were still not in our room! We called down and seems there was some kind of mixup with the bell cleck and we waited an additional 30-40 minutes for the bags. Nothing major, but irritating considering we were trying to get ready to go to dinner. Also, we like to sit out on our lanai and have a glass of wine and watch the sunset, the glass table on the lanai had bird poo on it and I tried to clean it off myself to no avail, and I called the desk and requested that housekeeping come and clean it off as it was pretty disgusting, we came back from dinner and it was not cleaned up. However, houskeeping did clean it off the next day. The only other negative incident occurred a couple of nights later when we went down to the Tropics Bar and requested a glass of wine to take back to our room. The bartender rather rudely said "If you are not going to drink that here you have to have a plastic cup!" My husband replied "My wife is not going to drink expensive wine out of a plastic cup!" to which we then took our wineglass and left to go to our room. I understand they don't want someone to possibly drop a wineglass and break it, but his manner and comment seemed a little over the top. Enough of the negatives. This hotels sits right on Kaanapali Beach and is extremely close to the Whaler's Village shops and restaurants. The hotel rooms are clean and well appointed. There is of course, the famous "Heavenly Bed" and "Heavenly Towels". We also had robes which were very comfy. I don't know if the robes are standard or if we got them because my husband is a rewards member with Westin. The views facing the ocean are amazing!!! I love how also leading out to the lanai there is a screen door as well as a glass door to let in those great Maui breezes. The sound of the ocean was so soothing! There a I believe several swimming pools on the property. My husband and I are not ones to sit by the pool, but the pools looked clean and well maintained. Anytime you have a pool there are little kids but none of them were running wild. The concierge was very friendly and helpful regarding recommending restaurants and directions. Overall our experience here was great, and I know we will stay here again. There were a few negative things happen but nothing that would stop us from staying here again or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy2Go-7
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 is from Northern California and travels occationally. We'd never been to Maui before, but had been to the Marriott on the Big Island 2 years ago. The Westin on West Maui is a beautiful hotel with a lagoon in the lobby area with flamingos, koi fish, swans and parrots. My kids, 3 and 5, loved that area. The hotel room was very lovely, but small. It was probably designed for businessmen, as there was a large desk area across half of the long wall. The Heavenly Bed was heavenly, but my 6'4" husband found the bed too small. There were 2 beds in the room leaving room for a chair near the sliding glass door to the balcony but no table. The pools were warm enough to get in without cringing. My kids loved the large waterslide and small water tube, but we were all disappointed to find the grotto area with jacuzzi was a cold water jacuzzi. Cold water jacuzzi?! The only hot tub was near the adult only pool and it was for 16 and older. Wonderful to walk from the pool across the walking path (3 feet) and be on the beach. If we went to the pool after 5pm the towel area was closed so we had no towel if we didn't bring one from the hotel room. The hotel was right next door to the Whaler's Village shopping and just down the street was a Safeway. The hotel room had a little fridge so we had cereal in the room most mornings. My kids want a hotel with a 'hot pool' next time and we all would have liked more room to move around in the hotel room. I liked that when I got in the pool I didn't have to "get use to it". And I loved walking to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: sunloverVermont
Reviews.Content: We read all kind of comments before we went so we didn't know what to expect. The staff went out of their way to give us the best room they could in the catagory we paid for. The room was clean and the maid service was kind about extra towels etc. There were a lot of kids running around but they were well mannered most of the time and when you have the pools around that they have there you really should expect them. We did have a little problem with people "claiming pool chairs" with towels then leaving until they wanted them. The food was a little expensive but hey, it was everywhere. I guess the only thing that I had any problem with was the lack of storage for clothes. I would have rather had the dining table & chairs gone and had a little extra storage. All in all, I would go back in a heart beat. Loved it. David & Nanette

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great service”
Reviews.Author: hedgehogVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin many times over the years. The location is one of the best in Kaanapali, right on the beach and right next to Whalers village for shopping. Staff are extremely friendly, the many pools, landscape, and atmosphere is first rate. Had several meals at the hotel's restaurant called Tropica that were somewhat expensive but always very good. Drinks are a bit expensive $10.00 for the exotics. We had a room in the main building that had been recently renovated, but still looked a bit old - the doors were badly chipped on the bottom and the bathroom fixtures and tiles looked dated. They could have done a much better job on the renovation. If you want great beaches, better than average food, lots of pools with good drink and food service, nice accomodation and friendly service, the Westin will fulfill your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saxbe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only one night after receiving an offer from the Sheraton to move because they were overbooked. We wish we would have stayed here the entire time! This hotel is outstanding! The facilities are awesome, and the lobby is very impressive! If you're looking for a hotel with the "wow" factor, this is definitely it. Also, it's in close proximity to the beach @ the Sheraton, so we could have just walked down the shore to snorkel at Black Rock. We visited the spa, and it is truly "heavenly"! Everything about this hotel is tasteful and luxurious. I am amazed it is not ranked higher, and we are pretty picky. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: julienjay
Reviews.Content: We went to the Westin Maui Feb 8-13 on the $749 timeshare special (includes $185 Avis rental car credit, and $75 resort credit). At this price, I figured we couldn't go wrong! The resort was awesome. I spent so much time on this site before we went, so I wanted to share our experience. We were traveling with 2 kids (age 3 and 6) from Los Angeles. ATA was quite tight on space -- my husband is 6'4", and he was absolutely crunched in coach. Book an exit row or upgrade to first ($150) if you can. When we got to the airport, I had ordered a "lei greeting" which my son just loved. This was worth the price. On the way to the Westin, we stopped in at Maui Tacos which was great. When we got to the Westin, we got another lei greeting and also some yummy elixers. My husband showed his Starwood Preferred Gold card and got us upgraded to an 8th floor mountain view room in the ocean tower. (Very nice.) Plasma TV and heavenly beds. Also, there are binoculars in every room, so don't buy those beforehand like we did! We soon realized we had left one of my daughter's bags at the hotel, but the Westin arranged to have it sent over from the airport (no charge!). We had dinner at O'no at the resort. Great kids menu and they had live entertainment, too. Best dish we had was swordfish in garlic butter. Kids eat free in the resort so that was a big plus. Friday, we booked a Trilogy cruise to Lanai (sunset sail - from 10am to 6pm). This was wonderful. Great for the whole family. Yummy food, great snorkeling...just a lot of fun. One of the highlights of our trip. We saw tons of whales. Highly recommend this. Saturday, my husband went to the workout room and was pretty disappointed. No locker room. If you want "spa" access, that's an additional $20 a day. The machines have great rooms but the gym had a horrible layout and was not great. Every morning, we had breakfast on our balcony and fed the birds. When we got to HI, my husband went to Safeway and loaded us up on cereal, juice boxes, so we could eat breakfast in the room. That represented a big savings. Sat morning, tried to take the kids to the Westin Kids Club. It looked fine, and the kids seemed to enjoy it, but after 30 minutes we were called to pick up our daughter because they questioned both her and my son about her age and she told them she was 3. (Cutoff age was 5.) We took the walk of shame back to the kids club to retrieve them. Then we went to the pools. Very fun for everyone. My son loved the water slides. We bought a delicious fresh pineapple at the snack bar by the main pool. Had lunch at Leilani's on the Beach. Hula Pie was awesome. Took a walk down to Black Rock at the Sheraton. That night, we had booked VIP tickets to the luau at the Hyatt. Drums of the Pacific. Great bc it was walking distance from the hotel. If you have kids, I would recommend the VIP tix because you get seated in front, plus get to go through the food line first. They pulled me and the kids up to the stage for "hula lessons" which was cute. Free mai tais which were weak but you can ask them to "spice them up" for you. Sunday, we took a nice drive around West Maui. We used the Maui Revealed book to guide our way and took a really cool drive around these windy, two-way, one-lane roads. We thought the kids wouldn't make it during the Road to Hana (too long), so this was our compromise. Really fun. Had great banana bread at Julia's. We went to a locals place called the Tasty Krust for lunch. It was pretty good and cheap. Went to the Hawaii Nature Center (1/2 off in Hawaii Entertainment Book), which was small but the kids enjoyed it. We were the only ppl there. Bought a fresh pineapple from a roadside stand on the way back to the hotel, then took a late swim. Got kids meals to go for dinner for the kids at O'nos, then my husband and I got sushi to go from Sensei, down the road in Kapalua. This place was PACKED but their sushi was awesome--esp their special Ahi roll. We ate dinner on the balcony of the hotel room--just pulled the lamp out there for some light. Romantic! Monday, we booked my husband and 6-yr-old son a surfing lesson at Maui Wave Riders in Lahaina. Highly recommend this! They had a great time and my son was up on his board in no time. Our instructor was named Kevin. They also take digital pictures which you can buy at the end ($20 for a CD), and that was really cool. Ordered room service for lunch which was a fun treat. Don't get the pasta, though. (Bland.) Did a little shopping at Whaler's Village. Went for another swim. Got shaved ice at the snack bar for the kids. Went to Lahaina for dinner and ate at Kobe Steakhouse (2-for-1 in Entertainment Book). Very good! The kids loved seeing their food prepared right at their table. We saw the Banyan Tree. Stopped by Star Market for souveniers--coffee and banana/macadamia nut pancake mix. Checked in for our flight online so my husband could get an exit row. Tuesday, time to go home. We got up very early and checked out by 9am, then took my son fishing down the road at one of the beaches on the way to the airport. (Bought shrimp at Long's Drugstore for bait.) Didn't catch anything but our son had fun. Our flight wasn't til 2:50, but the concierge at the Westin recommended that we check our bags in early and then go for lunch at Mama's Fish House. This is just what we did. Mama's was a highlight of our trip. This place was heavenly. Not cheap but the food is amazing. My only regret is that we didn't have more time here. If I go back, I will do this in the middle of the trip so I'm not rushed. Amazing view. Got a table by the window which gave us a great outlook on the beach and the turquoise blue water. This is also the only authentic tiki bar in Maui which was cool to see. That was the jist of our trip. I guess this is a good time to mention that a few times during our trip, we ordered pay-per-view kids movies for the kids, which was fun for them. Also, a really nice perk at the Westin is that kids' laundry is only $15 per bag. I had them do 2 bags of laundry (one in the middle of the trip, and one at the end), which was a bargain in my opinion. You can get A LOT of kids' laundry in one of those bags. It was nice to come home with all the kids' laundry done and folded. Sara (our activities coordinator) was pretty low pressure about doing a timeshare presentation. We would have done it if the kids could have gone in the kids club but since my daughter had been "black-listed" we passed. I thought this was an AMAZING place and I had absolutely no complaints throughout our stay. Beforehand, we purchased an Entertainment Book for Hawaii but only used it twice, so I'd say that really wasn't worth it. (Not many coupons for Maui.) I did however get an A3H card and that saved us over $300 on our Trilogy Cruise. All in all, we paid about $1000 a person for four people and that included EVERYTHING...a great bargain for an unforgettable stay. I would definitely go back given the chance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: wild-oat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Resort and Spa for 7 nights. I wish it had been longer. This is a very nice hotel that appears to strive for a high standard of accommodation. We particularly enjoyed eating breakfast and reading the complimentary paper near the Starbucks coffee kiosk while the various birds mingled nearby. My only criticism is the kisok is too expensive, but if you keep your cup you get free refills for that day. I advise eating most meals at one of the nearby Whaler's Village and area restaurants. This hotel is perfectly located with supurb beach literally on it's doorstep plus excellent shopping a short walk away. Be sure to walk to Black Rock in front of the Sheraton for great snorkeling and sheltered swimming. I am going back to this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Fred047
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Maui on several occasions and have really enjoyed it. Our best experience was staying at the Westin Maui, and I would highly recommend this to anyone. The room was great, the staff friendly and the location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: datwahine
Reviews.Content: PRICE I accepted an offer Hawaiian Air sent me for 6 nights/5 days and $185 towards an Avis car for $785. Having read TripAdvisor prior to my accepting the invitation, I was skeptical about the condition of the hotel, but reasoned that the Starwood chain is reputable and $785 is a deal to be reckon with considering the average price of a night at the hotel. Still, I was not sure of what to expect. ARRIVAL It's been many moons since I've been to Maui and my children (15 and 13) have never been so this was an adventure. We flew over with my sister and her son and my brother and his family were hopping over from Oahu so that plan was just to hang out together and explore the birth place of our mother. When we arrived at the hotel, my son was greeted with a ti leaf lei and my daughter and I were given orchid leis. This makes the Westin a cut above a lot of hotels; Even the Manele Bay hotel, which is an exceptional hotel in itself, does not greet its guests with leis. In fact, neither does the mass majority of hotels on Oahu and Kaui go the extra mile this way. Truly a greeting with aloha! Upon entering, you are invited to refresh yourself with chilled (real) fruit flavored water but your eyes become captivated with the cascading waterfall with FLAMINGOES that's just ahead. The scenery lets know you are in a superior hotel. ROOM We were given a garden-view room on the fourth floor. Okay, this does not sound good, but the garden-view is a room with a view of Maui's mountains! Yes, I did see people and cars since I was right above the entrance, but that's only when I looked down! The noise level was not at all overwhelming or bothersome. In fact, the view from my room was great at night, especially when the island was asleep. The lighted trees that line the driveway, the mountains, the night sky, and the fresh air were things I enjoyed from my balcony. This experience was especially pleasurable, like I said before, at night when people were asleep and during the early morning hours when I had my coffee and thought of nothing. It's just a way of bringing yourself in harmony. The room is on the small side but hey, I did not pay for a suite! It was roomy enough for two teens and me to relax in. After picking our beds and somewhat unpacking, my daughter took a long shower while my son and I checked out the channels on the flat screen. Within minutes of literally sinking into his HEAVENLY BED, my son fell asleep. After donning a robe, my daughter flopped into bed with me and fell asleep! I thought they were taking a cat nap, but they did not get up until the next morning, and that's no lie! With a bed like that, my children were sleeping off their tiredness (they deserved it!). The HEAVENLY SHOWER is a show with two shower heads and enough water pressure to make you want to wash and condition your hair, scrub between your toes, shave and shave again. I also enjoyed the lavender scented toiletries, which I assume gets its lavender oil from the lavender farm on Maui. FOOD I asked the concierge for good local food, places that the local people eat at and was given addresses for Da Kitchen and Tasty. Da Kitchen is a a sit in joint close to the airport that has some ono (delicious) food that comes with two scoops of rice and mac salad (just the way I like it) and Tasty is a place to get da bomb pancakes!!! Also, if you go to Haleakla ask the local peole if they could point you to the store with "bentos and musubi" because if you can navigate your way to this hole in the wall local store you can buy some ono lunches to eat on your way back to the hotel. SUMMARY Stay at the Maui Westin Resort and Spa and experience it for yourself. Don't get too caught up in staying within the confines of the hotel property because there's some beautiful spots on Maui. Use the hotel to pamper yourself. Swim in the huge pool, walk on the beach, sleep in your HEAVENLY bed and enjoy Maui. The Westin is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whale wonderland”
Reviews.Author: CarolSmu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel this time last year and had one of the most memorable vacations. My parents travelled with us and booked the ocean-view rooms. If this is in your budget it is a must. We had mountain view even as beautiful as this was we never once enjoyed the balcony. It is very noisy on this side, and surprisingly felt like Chicago with all the police and fire sirens. We sat out nightly on my folks balcony and I can still picture the moon on the ocean. We also sat there after dinner for the wonderful view of the whales. The binoculars were in your room for use which was fabulous. Rooms: Comfortable and clean, and the added bonus of heavenly beds and linens. Food: It is so well worth including the breakfast buffet in your booking. The spread was great and the view for whale watching incredible. The drinks were excellent. I don't remember the dinners standing out and they were expensive. It was so much easier to walk to the Whale Museum Mall area for better eats and prices. Location: Excellent as we only needed a car one day to attempt the road to Hana. The bus was cheap and we used it in and out for Lahaina shopping and the Feast at LeLe. As a previous advisor mentioned this Luau was well worth the money with an excellent feast for the eye as well as the abdomen. We walked into the Whale Mall daily for local needs and to catch the bus. You can also book a whale excursion right on the beach which was fun and convenient. Pool/Lobby: Above average with a great slide and Koi ponds. Daily Parrot visitors were also a treat. Wares of local artists were displayed daily. No difficulty getting a lounger. The gardens were well kept and lovely. Beach: Rough water during winter season, but my husband loves that type of swimming. Great for walking the entire hotel boardwalk area. Disliked the fact with as much as this resort cost including the added resort daily fee that you had to pay and reserve the shaded loungers. I do remember being pushed about the time share, and unfortunately my Mom talked us into it on a cold, rainy day that was going to be wasted indoors. It did extend way beyond the promised time frame, but we did get $100 of resort money which we used to pay for the resort daily fee. That was the only part of this vacation I couldn't wait for the end.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: jwelte
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with helpful, friendly staff. The pool area is the best on the beach in Ka'anapali. The surf on the beach (which is public) can be a little on the strong side and you have to watch out for the undertoe. Our room was very comfortable (with a very small bathroom). Mountain view rooms look over the parking area/enterance (with the trees it's not bad). Parking is next to impossible, but if it's full you get free valet parking. The food is expensive and it's worth the 1.5-minute walk to hit the restaurants in Whaler's Villiage. TONS OF KIDS, which we weren't expecting. Small adult-only pool which is shaded most of the day. If you want pool time and sun, get yourself ready for the noise of children screaming. It's a non-smoking facility and you're technically not allowed to even smoke on your balconies (newer law in Hawaii). They have a few marked cubby holes you can perch yourself in to satisfy that nic-fit. The beach was really nice and you can even whale watch while you're soaking up the rays. I was never approached for the time share once! I really enjoyed my seven-day stay and wished it was longer. PS: you really do need a rental car here, and traffic's not really THAT bad!

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: willtravelforbeer
Reviews.Content: The westin trys to get you to do a timeshare presentation at every turn. Stay away from the conciere desk. They hard sell you and the spiel goes over the 90 minutes they say it takes. In addition, they promote this 50% off cetificate that is a complete joke. When you try to use it at westin hotels, the rate they give you is more then the web site rates. What a scam.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Book it!”
Reviews.Author: HappyLife1
Reviews.Content: FEEL CONFIDENT TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL- WE LOVED IT: We had read negative reviews about this hotel and we had already booked our stay so we were a little apprehensive about upcoming our stay. The good news is we had a great time! The hotel grounds, lobby area and pools were lovely. We checked in late at night so the 'welcome' people weren't outside but the next day a very nice lady approached us as we were waiting for our car from valet and asked if we had checked in and had we received our lei's - and no we hadn't so we gave them to us then. Very nice. As far as our room: We were trying to save some money so we didn't book an ocean view room- and even without an ocean view our room was very nice, new paint, new carpet, nice linen's, including spa towels. The room was on the small side but for the price we paid, we were very comfortable and happy with the room. It had a tiny balcony and overlooked the front of the hotel where everyone drives up and the parking lot, but it's landscaped nicely and you have a view of the mountain [sunrise] so you get a beautiful sky in the morning. The shower was nice, the beds were nice. There is a small refrigerator in the room- so you can get waters or whatever for the room. The staff were friendly. Lounging during the day: We hung out at the top pool area [there is a bar up there and a waitress continually serves you and she was wonderful] drinks, water, fruit, lunch whatever you want, she was always checking in to be sure you were doing well. We read, we napped, we people watched, it was so relaxing. The views from the upper pool area are amazing. Everything is lush and green and there are water falls, and flowers everywhere. It was wonderful. There are two 'look-out cabanna type areas' that have an amazing views and are semi-private. I think it's something like $50 for half a day and $85 or $90 or something like that for a full day. Someone had booked them every day but you could check in down by the pool where you get the towels at 9am in the morning [to see if they had canceled] and then you could book it. The cabanna's are nice.. amazing views, location - but there are many places to lay out so it's not neccessary but if you are interested maybe call in advance to book]. The fitness center is nice and the spa is nice. They even had free 10 minute massages in the evening outside by the upper pool area. You just show up and make eye contact with the person so she knows you are there and then people take turns. Great massage. The hotel location was great. Outside exercise: There is a pathway along 'just before' the beach and you can walk looking at the ocean. We would walk to the Marriott every morning and they have a pantry right off the pathway- they serve great 'hot' coffee, fresh fruit [they have other food too but we had the fresh pineapple, OJ and an english muffin every morning] anyway- you can sit at tables over looking the water and literally whale watch- we saw whales every morning. It was a wonderful way to start out each day and it's a quick, nice walk from the hotel. We didnt' really eat at the hotel other than ordering fruit , or chicken wraps at the pool. We always went elsewhere. The only negative thing is the coffee at the hotel was cold... they store it in thermos' so it was cold. They do have a microwave that you can use to warm it up but that was a bummer. So for something like $12 for 3 coffees, and they were cold that was the only bummer.... There were a lot of families and kids but there is a nice big pool for families, with a great slide, and everyone looked like they were having a blast. Re kids and safety- There is a lot of water areas, especially in the lobby /open/outside area with koi, flamingo's, ducks, swans, birds, it's so beautiful but for toddlers you'd want to watch them so they don't jump in the water. [I had read where people said it's not safe]- so there is a lot of water, then there's the ocean, several pools etc. so for little kids you'd want to keep a close eye on them at all times but the kids seemed to love watching all of the animals. There is a mall next door that you can get to along the path by the ocean. There are restaurants and an ABC store where you buy water and snacks and anything that you might have forgotten. There is a Safeway down the street and there is a Costco near the airport. PLACES WE ATE: In the morning, we got fresh pineapple from the Marriott a short walk away- OJ and hot coffee. My parents who traveled with us did eat at the hotel one morning and they said the food was good- it's just a lot of food- and the food at the Marriott pantry down the way seemed much more fresh and a better selection and cheaper. Lunches and Dinners: You have to check out Mama's Fish House [fresh amazing fish and other food] - I was told that it was expensive but I thought how expensive can it really be- but it was..we went for lunch and there were 4 of us and we had appetizers, one drink each, amazing meals, dessert, coffee and it was over $340 but it was probably the best meal we've ever had. We ordered seared Ahi and then 2 of us had the macadamian crusted stuffed white fish [i can't remember what kind of fish but they will know] and 2 of us had the fish with fresh garlic and tomotoes sauteed together.. Everything was amazing! We also ate at the mall next store Leilani's and Hula Grill both were good. Lahaina has great places too. Cheeseburger in Paradise was so-so. My dad and husband who love clam chowder and consider theirselves clam chowder experts loved the clam chowder [white] at Lahaina Fish Company. I can't remember where else we ate in Lahaina but everything seemed good. Great salads. Now, on the Wailea side of the island, we ate in Kihei at the 'Kihei Cafe'- a local told us to go there when we asked where there was a great breakfast place. It was a dive...we would never have stopped there if we were just driving by but since we were referred and we love local places, we went in. The food was amazing. One person ordered your basic eggs, sausage, home potatoes, and another person ordered the friend rice with scramble eggs [amazing] and another person ordered pancakes with banana's and some sprinkled coconut, the coffee was excellent, a dive but great food. LUAU: We were told by some friends to go to the Luau 'The Feast at Lele' 808-667-5353 in downtown Lahaina. It's right overlooking the beach and you get to see an amazing sunset and sky. The show was great. The staff was friendly and this luau- you are served. It's $100+ per person but you get as many drinks as you want and food from all over and they tell you about the food and it's not a buffet line that you have to go through. It was nice. Our friends have 5 daughters and they loved it so it's nice for young or old. THE BEST OF THE TRIP: Ok, for whale watching you MUST go with 'Safari Boat Excursions' - we went two days in a row - it was so amazing. The boat is smaller so we were able to stand up and have perfect views, walk around the boat, etc. when you go on a large boat, you have heads, hat's, camera's etc. blocking your view and you can't quickly move around because there are so many people. Ask for Lorrie and Captain Dave [I think that was his name - the boat is the name in Hawaiian of his daughter ]. We went twice and Dave and Lorrie were the best crew. Much better then the other crew. Lorrie and Dave provided amazing facts/information. So call and ask when they are working - it's well worth the wait to go on their shift. 808 661-7660. We went on the 8:45 trip and saw a lot of whales both days... babies etc. The whale watching was the best part of our trip. Who knew! Anyway- if you are like us and you've already booked and then you read the not so good reviews... hopefully you'll be encouraged by our great experience at this hotel- and hopefully you'll have a great experience too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Visit with 15month and 3 year old kids.”
Reviews.Author: axieth
Reviews.Content: From trip in last week of August 2006 with 15 month old and 3 year old: I will be concise: Pros: Kids loved the pool (but no paddling pool.) Close to the beach, Close to nearby cheap dining establishments â€“ good for cheap eats for kids. Cons: Rooms are small. Bathrooms are tiny â€“ worse than you would expect at a cheap motel. Toddler can fit through railings on room balconies â€“ can you believe it! Very crowded â€“ and waiters told us this was their quiet season. Overall, we had a great time solely due to the pool, which our kids loved playing in. However, the rooms are not what we expected for so much money. Furthermore, we did not feel that relaxed there due to the large number of people everywhere, and the need to reserve everything, including pool-side recliners and shade from the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sierra11
Reviews.Content: We did not receive the room we booked. Room was postage stamp size, fridge did not work and the hotel could not fix it for the entire stay. Not a single time the beds were made up before 3PM. Lousy, overpriced food in the main restaurant and totaly untrained and unprofessional servers did not help to soth us either. Resort is crowded, busy and noisy, personnel indifferent, forget Hawaii serenity and experience. At $350.00 per night it is no bargain, Sheraton just down the street is a better choice if you must do Maui.

Reviews.Title: “- Paradise -”
Reviews.Author: Jeb_Marshall
Reviews.Content: This resort is simply the BEST! I spent a week with my buddies golfing and watching the kapalua tournament. The rooms have awesome views of other islands and the food was fantastic. I have just made a reservation to go back for six days on Valentines day and plan on proposing to my girlfriend after we check in. Great location, great pools/beach, very well maintained and grounds beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie”
Reviews.Author: eos_domestic_goddess
Reviews.Content: We were "invitied" by Westin for the same 6day/5night deal others have mentioned; $150 a night for a piece of paradise? Okay! It was a very pleasant experience. We didn't want to pay for the upgrade; we knew we would spend in restaurants, etc. but did talk to the manager about our anniversary. He put us on the 10th floor, mtn view, recently renovated room, smaller than other Westins, but we knew that ahead of time from research. The armoire and all the drawers available were quite suffiicient, and there was actually room under the beds for our luggage, and with four of us, that was a big help. The heavenly beds, wireless internet, and small frig; what more could you ask for at this price? Oh, yeah, how about a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries sent up to our room from the manager? We were greeted with leis at the door upon arrival, and no, the lobby is not as over the top as other hawaiian hotels, but very pretty with the koi pond and waterfalls and birds. Yes it was a busy hotel, it was the holidays (Jan 2-7); there are a lot of families there enjoying themselves; honestly, don't go to a resort if you want to be alone. We ate breakfast by the pool one rainy morning; the spinach benedict was yummy, and large enough to share for two. I used the work out room, but didn't have to wait for a machine like someone else did. We ate at the dinner at the lower Leilani Grill; great location, food not really memorable; lunch at the Hula Grill, goat cheese pizza was tasty and our teens said they made the best virgin pinas. In Lahaina, we had a wonderful dinner at the Lahaina Fish Company (get the scallops), and another night a delicious meal at the Lahaina Store and Grill, a new restaurant (the lamb lollies were to die for!) To end our trip, we rented a condo in Wailea, at the Ekolu Village for three nights. Found an ocean view unit from VRBO.com. We had a great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui Hotel for Kids !”
Reviews.Author: Flames#11
Reviews.Content: Aloha ! Firstly I also was a bit hesitant about the Westin based on reviews here, but quite frankly my only conclusion for the negative comments is people who are comparing this hotel to one found somewhere else (not Hawaii). For those of you comparing this to perhaps an all-inclusive in Jamaica, Mexico, etc., you cannot. You are not going to find the service level you get from third world countries, those service jobs are considered lucrative and you get the best. Maui on the other hand, is part of the U.S., so you are going to get the same type of service you get everywhere else in the U.S. from workers at a resort, average at best ! Also Maui is a lot more expensive than these all-inclusives, get used to that. What you do get however is not having to drive through a third world country to get to your resort, the whole island is beautiful and safe. Also you don't have watch a bunch of drunk 18-25 year olds drink as much as they can and yell and puke, etc.; this crowd isn't travelling to Maui. This is our third visit to Maui and the first with the kids. We stayed in a hotel in Lahaina on our first visit which has now been turned into condos, on our 2nd visit we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton. Once again, the Westin is reccomended if you have kids, and are looking to be in the middle of the action. I did not like the Ritz Carlton at all. It is in the middle of nowhere and it is a very long drive to get to anywhere else on the Island. Also the beach is a significant walk from the hotel. If people thought the pool area was crowded at the Westin, try finding room at a pool that is considerably smaller and where everyone goes to the pool because the beach is so far away. If you are not with kids, looking for a place to relax away from it all, this may be a good pick. As an SPG platinum member, we were upgraded from a traditional garden-view room to an ocean view room in the Ocean tower. The room was large enough for our needs, but we are in Hawaii, who is staying in the room except to sleep ?? We left the door open at night to the lanai and listed to the ocean. The pools here are amazing, there is nothing comparable on Maui, this was an absolute hit with the kids. If you get sick of the pools, the beach is a step away. Prices were a bit steep for drinks (11$), but this is pretty common for Maui resorts everywhere. We found the buffet breakfast for $25/person to be a pretty good deal when you factor in the 2 kids were free. I don't understand the people complaing about the selection, I am unsure what else could have been added to this menu. To echo other comments, you do have to get in the habit of the ritual to get your poolside chairs reserved by 8:00 a.m.. As the sun usually comes up just before 7:00, this was never a problem for us as we were up anyway as we were still on Mountain time. Do be wary of the "Concierge", it would seem they are incented to push time-share visits to the Westin's other resort, a new condo complex. They are good though, simply say you are not interested and that is that. As for parking, we were there when the hotel was sold out and never had a problem finding a spot. I will say the parking spots were pretty small, but we never had a problem finding one. In summary, I would definitely reccomed this hotel to families travelling to Maui. As for other activities we did: We booked everything through Senior Frogs and it cost us $265 Canadian for surfing lessons for two, the Royal Lahanina Luau (2 adults, 2 kids) and an afternoon snorkelling trip to Molokini. Surfing: My son and I took surfing lessons through Royal Hawaiin Surf Academy. I would highly reccomend these guys. My only negative was that I was in a class with my son and two other kids and they all did a lot better than I did ! I was still learning the basics and Lucas the intructor was moving them on to some different stances and other tricks. Oh well sucks to be old. My son had an absolute blast, especially the fact that he was better than I was. Lucas was a great intructor. Royal Lahaina Luau: To be honest, I am unsure what consitutes a good Luau, but I will tell you this is absolutely not it. Even with the two kids being free, this was not worh it. The food was terrible and my wife and I both felt sick later on when we got back to our hotel. We had entirely different meals as well as she eats only fish and vegetables and I am more of a meat-eater, so the food was equally bad across the board We were so far back with our seats, we could not see anything, but from what I could see, we didn't miss much. The only exciting thing, the fire dancer lasted about two minutes after sitting through hours of cheesy jokes by the MC and very repetitive dancing. This was definitely the lowlight of our vacation. Frogman snorkelling to Molokini: We got a very good deal on this because we booked our surfing and Luau through Senior Frogs and they own this boat. The trip out to Molokini was amazing, we saw a number of Humpback whales swimming beside the boat. I was not that impressed with Molokini itself as there was not a lot to see there. We had been on a snorkelling trip before where we went to some rocks off the shoreline somewhere and there were a lot more fish and also turtles. We had a really good time on this boat trip, but in general, if you are going purely to snorkel, I would not reccomend Molokini as a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: KAHCT
Reviews.Content: We were worried about our reservation with the Westin Maui for our honeymoon because of the reviews we saw on it. But upon arriving i found these reviews were unwarranted. We went September 10th thru 21st. Maybe it was slow since it was back to school time for kids, but we found it not busy or overcrowded at all, including the pool and beach. Upon arriving we recieved out Lei greeting and were upgraded to one of their largest rooms since we were on our honeymoon. The room was wonderful and very spacious with an oceanview. The second day their was a knock on our hotel door and we were delivered a bottle of wine and two glasses along with a bunch of hawaiin flowers, with a card congratulating us on our honeymoon from the hotel. We were VERY impressed. We booked our package that included a free breakfast buffet every morning, and the buffet was incredible, they had everything you could think of. The staff was courteous although we never really found that we needed assistance.
