The pools were a little cold and unheated but your in Hawaii and its beautfiul every day so i didnt complain...besides i dont go to hawaii for a pool i can get anywhere i go for the ocean, and the beach right outside the door was breathtaking. The Whalers village was right next store which was VERY convenient for eating and shopping a wonderful place to go. DO GO see Warren & Annabelle's show...we bought tickets well in advance (you have to) and it was incredible. The grounds were beautiful and upkept well. I would say our honeymoon couldn't have been better. The resturaunt next store at the whalers village "leilanis on the beach" was wonderful you can sit up on the second floor lanai and overlook the ocean as you eat a wonderful meal!! Definitly check that out.

Reviews.Title: “A great, albeit expensive, place in Kaanapalli”
Reviews.Author: #1 Bay Area Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at the Westin Maui after all the mixed reviews on this site, but was very happy after checking in and would gladly stay here again. We stayed during the extreme busy holiday season from 12/23/2006 to 01/01/2007. First the positives: hands down, probably one of the loveliest hotel grounds and pool areas in Kaanapali. The Hyatt (a short walking distance away) has a very nice swan court for brunch and also has a nice pool area, but the Westin's grounds are easily more pleasing to the eyes. Excellent location since it is right next door to Whalers village and both the Leilani's & Hula Grill restaurants. We paid for a garden view room, but were upgraded to a partial oceanview room on check in, so of course, this positively swayed my experience with the hotel. The room was small with just one arm chair plus two metal chairs on the lanai (you really can't hang out it in the room unless you lounge on the bed); but the room does have a large plasma TV, small refrigerator, room safe, and two bottles of water provided daily with the $18 daily resort/parking fee. Never had any problems finding parking, even when returning after 10pm at night. Yes, there is just one armoir for clothes, but we were able to place more than 24 hangers in it (honestly, how many warm weather clothes do you need to hang up?). Bed was nicely made each day, no complaints about the decor. We were able to "charge" two cell phones, a DVD player, a camera, and make coffee all at once without having to unplug lamps or search for more outlets. The Westin also provides free shuttle service to Lahaina (every hour, takes about 15 minutes to get there, and 45 minutes to circle back to the hotel from Lahaina) until 9pm at night. There are 5 pools (with one just for adults), plus a hot tub and a pretty fast waterslide. The pools close at sunset, but the hot tub remains open until 10pm. Negatives: yes, the pool area is very busy, and if you don't go out by 7:30 or 8:00am to "reserve" an area by the pool, you may be stuck until early afternoon in finding two lounge chairs together. The towel desk opens at 8am, but about 70% of the prime spots are already taken/reserved (with hats, magazines, t-shirts, pool toys, etc.) when it opens. There's a sign claiming that reserved places are cleared after 30 minutes, but chairs were cleared only after 2-3+ hours if there were only wet towels and no personal items there. The other negative is the price for food. Breakfast for two (whether the $25 buffet or the $18 waffle and $9.50 for two glasses of O.J.) invariable costs $50-60 bucks plus tip. Same thing for lunch: cheeseburger and fries were $15 bucks per person and if you have a mai tai or other cocktail with it, add another $9 per person plus tip. I highly recommend the chicken quesadillas and the Thai chicken wings, they were both the best I ever tasted (if you decide to do this for a pool snack, again, about $20 bucks for the two items, plus $9 for a cocktail). Poolside service is a bit slow, but it is very easy to order cocktails or food at the adult pool bar area. I didn't notice an excessive child problem, but if you're looking for a place without kids, Kaanapali beach and the hotels there are not for you. Try staying at the Ritz Carlton which is much more serene (and perhaps boring). Overall, I would love stay at the Westin at this location in Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin as Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Super7Star
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying at the Westin after reading some bad reviews here on TripAdvisor. I usually don't book hotels that have a few bad reviews, but decided to take a chance on the Westin after finding out the Sheraton was booked up. We stayed at the Westin from Dec. 13th - 19th, and it was wonderful. We rented a car and was quite surpised to find parking at the hotel was not bad at all. The lot seemed to fill up at night, but if it was, the hotel valet was free. When you first walk into the lobby there is flavored water available to the right, and you are supposed to be greeted with leis (we were not, but when we were leaving we told them we didn't get one and they apologized and gave us one as we left) The lobby is like a tropical rainforest with pink flamingos, koi, and parrots. The banyon trees are also very relaxing (although the birds are noisy at sunset and sunrise). The rooms in the hotel were beautiful. We stayed in an Ocean View room and the view was breathtaking! Although, the waterfalls are a bit loud at night, but not too bothersome. I especially enjoyed the new plasma television. I must say, I expected more from the Heavenly Beds (I stayed at the Sheraton Moana Surfrider in Oahu last year and the beds there were much more comfortable.) I didn't think the rooms were too small, but the desk and chairs make it seem smaller. The pool is magnifiscent, definately one of the best I've ever been in. Usually when there is a beach around I don't even step foot in the pool. But, this pool was irresistable. The waterfalls all around are relaxing and fun to swim under. The slide is fun (and not just for kids). The spa on the higher level is also very relaxing. We didn't eat at the restaurants in the hotel because we heard they were not worth the money. Instead we often ate at Front Street. Cheeseburger's in Paradise was very nice and Moose McGuillicuddy's was great for breakfast. I was not at all impressed with the restaurants at Whaler's Village. They seem to have the same things at each restaurant. If you drive to Hana you have to eat at Mama's Fish House on the way back. It is expensive, but really good. We didn't do many activities in Maui. But, I definately recommend going to the Magic Show at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel. I've been to magic shows in Las Vegas and I've never been really impressed (they're mostly smoke and mirrors), but this guy was impressive. And they never stop serving you drinks (open bar)! The lu'au at the Hyatt was very good also. The food was very good and the dancers were great! I also recommend getting surfing lessons. We rented boards and tried to teach ourselves and did not have much luck! We went whale watching too because the submarine tour was not running (the water was too cloudy). Whale watching was probably my least favorite! We didn't see many whales and I got sea sick! The raft we went on was way too small to be swaying back and forth! My favorite part of my Maui trip was the drive to Hana! You have to do this if you go to Maui and make sure you by the CD so you know where things are! Make sure to bring your bathing suits so you can swim in the waterfalls, pools, and the black beach! And make sure you pass Hana and go to the National Park. We hiked 2 miles to the Huge Waterfall and it was unbelievable! The drive will definately take you all day (and even then you won't see everything), so make sure you leave early! And, bring food because there is no where to eat there! Well this was way too long! But, you should definately stay at the Westin and Have fun in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Washfamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at this property. From the moment you walk in you know your stay will be a good one, the lobby is magnificent and the staff is very attentive and polite. We booked our stay using an invitation package for $749 (5 days / 4 nights) and upgraded to a ocean view for an additional $700. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean view (I am a Platinum member). If you go here and can afford this room you should do it, the views are great and the room is comfortable enough for 4 (we have 2 kids 11 & 13). The beach is very decent and the pools are great, especially for kids. During our stay we noticed it was hard to get chairs by the pool unless you got there early. Food is expensive; however we found out that kids 12 and under can eat for free if an adult in the same party pays for a meal. This helped us save a lot. The quality of the food is good but not great. Service is better at the Ono restaurant than the service in Tropica. We were so impressed by this location and the Westin overall that decided to buy into their timeshare program.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best relaxing stays we've had.”
Reviews.Author: 645pro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Dec 11th-20th. Got a great rate, 50% off that included the Ocean view room. The palm trees did obstruct the view of the ocean somewhat so to avoid this you would need to stay in the Premium Deluxe ocean view rooms in the other tower but these rooms get the sun all day long. Our room was in the shade for most of the day. The room was small but Iâ€™ve been in smaller. Renovated with a large dresser and large LG TV. One of the best beds Iâ€™ve slept in, covers and all. The first week appeared to be a slow time as we had no problem with waiting for the elevator. When the weekend came so did everyone else for the holidays, never really saw any children till then. Started using the elevator at the end of the hall to avoid waits. Never had a problem finding a spot at the pool, same with the parking lot as I parked by the fence, I found the spaces a little bigger there. Otherwise the stalls are very small and some people park with no consideration of the other guy. Saw one car with about 5 inches between doors, climbed out the window I guess. Food, had breakfast a few times at the Hotel but stayed away from the smorg ($25). Great omelettes and pancakes filled me up each time. For dinner hit all the restaurants by the water at the Whalers Village, great food. Along the walkway there is the Beach Walk restaurant. Breakfast was $10 semi self serve but was the worst meal we had, most ended up in the garbage. It was my birthday while we were there so my wife reserved the 'SUNRISE RENEWAL' Champagne Breakfast. We were the first ones to try this service and it was great!!! Service was personal and first rate. We paid the extra $25 and had the cabana till 5pm. Hit the Luau at the Sheraton, (same show at the Hyatt), great show and meal but the drinks were watered down big time. The Old Lahaina Luau books up 3-6 weeks in advance so book as soon as you can. No lifeguards at the pool or beach. When you pay $18 a day for hotels extras I do feel this should be included in the fees. Bottom line great hotel, pool and beach, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: david999
Reviews.Content: We booked on points and were upgraded to a partial ocean view room. My daughter got upgraded to a partial ocean view deluxe which was out of this world because looking the other way from the balcony, one saw the beautiful mountians. The room and balcony were great. The strongest point is the spectacular pool-actually 7 interconnected pools. Hawaii is one place where all the waterfalls and lagoons don't seem contrived because that's how it looks right outside the hotel. Some of the service in the restaurants was spotty. However when I complained that the music from the open hotel lobby was too loud at night they actually turned it off-as well the waterfall-for the rest of my stay. The beach is a little narrow right in front of the hotel but of course one can walk further down. in fact there is a great footpath connecting all the hotels. Adjacent to the hotel is the Whalers Village shopping area. We ate at the beachfront restaurants there which were more happening and a bit cheaper than the hotel restaurants. We had bkfst at the hotel which overlooked the ocean. Snorkeling is great at the Sheraton which is less than 10 mins walk. Personally I would stay at whichever of the hotels had the best deal going. However only the Hyatt seemed to be in the same league-although the beach was really small there--and no one had as nice a pool.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: tiff120606
Reviews.Content: Just a few complaints at the Westin. The rooms are small, but most Westins we have stayed in are small. We had a mountain view, which was fine. The pools close at sundown, not quite sure why, but the kids would have swam into the evening. Beach was great. We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning, $25.00!!!!! That's a little steep. Our room was clean, I believe they were remodeling, as our floor smelled like new carpet and looked new also. Overall we would stay at the Westin again, but choose to east elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: t-b0ne
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Westin. When you enter the lobby, you are greeted by a huge waterfall complete with flamingos, koi, and swans. The check in person was very friendly. Our room, though small, was very clean and the view was awesome. We had the ocean view room and it was well worth it. The best thing about the room, however, are the heavenly beds and bath. When you lie in the bed, you pretty much sink in it. Very comfortable. The shower heads in the rooms are called heavenly baths. They basically are two high powered shower heads that feels "heavenly". Had a great experience at the Spa. I feel males benefit from the spa more than females because the men's spa is basically empty. When I went, I was the only one in the whole men's spa. I enjoyed the whirlpool, the dry sauna, and the steam room all to myself. My wife told me the women's side was not crowded, but it wasn't empty like the men's. The massage was also great. My only complaint (not really a complaint) is the restauraunts. I felt that they were very average. The Tropica's food was pretty good, but the service was subpar. The breakfast buffet is way overpriced. All you get is basic breakfast meats (sausage, bacon), egss (scrambled and benedict), a made to order omlet, fish, fruits and other minor stuff like bagels and fruits. This buffet was $25.00 per person. I could get a pretty good dinner buffet for that price. Anyway, overall I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Ranger10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for our Honeymoon during November, wish I had'nt. The resort itself is great, the renovated rooms are small, but very well done (I dont see how famalies fit into these tiny rooms), the pools are great (if you can find a spot), the beach is spectacular and the food is mediocre. Tips: 1) If you want a spot by the pool, be sure your out there by 8:00 A.M. because guests like to throw a towel on a chair and come back around noon. (The staff refuses to do anything about this) 2) If your traveling with more than 1 child, book a suite or get an extra room. 3) Dont fall for the time share presentation. They offer a 50% off stay at any Starwood hotel if you do the tour, what they fail to mention, until the end, is that 50% off cannot be used in Hawaii. 4) If you get sick, its YOUR fault. We met a couple on their honeymoon and they both got food poisoning from Ono. When they informed the staff, they were questioned for over an hour by security and then told, you didnt get food poisoning here, tough luck. The sad part is, the couple told us they werent looking for any compensation, jus wanted to warn the staff for the sake of others. 5) If your looking for a Romantic place, or even just a quiet one, dont go to the Westin. 6) Dont expect much from the staff. Although they are extremely friendly, they are understaffed for the amount of people on this resort. 7) Definately see Warren and Annabels magic show in Lahania. Probably one of the few good meals you will find in Maui and a great show. Just another note, you may take the route we did and think the complaints are from people who went during peak times. No. We asked a staff member about the over crowding and she told us its slow and they were about to get busy in 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Make a Lasting Impression”
Reviews.Author: lucy8181
Reviews.Content: We stayed at five different resorts on our Hawaiian holiday. This property seems be to the hardest to remember, so that tells me something. Didnt make a lasting impression, I guess. A very busy property from the time we arrived, until we checked out. My husband walked in and handed me a lei while I was checking in, I guess they were too busy outside to do that, he said they had forgot to give me one when I got out of the car. Then when I went backout to retrieve luggage, I noticed towels and cold drinks for guests checking in.They were too busy to tell us about them when we came through the door. They did upgrade us to an oceanview room, we had booked a standard, but in order to get the ocn view we had to forgo a king bed. The room was clean and spacious. Hotel lay out was easy to get around. Kaanapali Beach is one of the best on the islands. The Westin is the best spot as far as beach area goes. Location is central, easy walk to the Hyatt and Sheraton's Black Rock. The Whalers Village is next door and very convenient, ABC store and inexpensive food places. Hula Grill is very good. Tropica was good too. Westin is expensive to eat, even for Maui. Breakfast is about 25.00pp and coffee is very expensive too,go to Whalers Village. They should take some of that money and invest in new towels. It seems like every towel I picked up had a hole in it. The pools were great. We really enjoyed the adult only pool. The sunset was beautiful. One of the prettiest in Hawaii. You can see Molokai and Lanai from the beach. We would return to this resort, not as a first choice, too busy for us,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great resort!”
Reviews.Author: kyaces
Reviews.Content: I have read mixed reviews or the Westin and realize"different strokes for different folks." Personally I loved our stay and hope I will be able to return. We stayed in a renovated room in the Ocean Tower, ocean view, and found the room size adequate for two with ample room for clothes in the armoire and drawers. Balcony was small but large enough for two chairs and a small table. Wonderful views of the ocean and lush pool areas. Location on the beach walk and next to Whalers Village add to the convenience and enjoyment. Restaurants were expensive but the food and service were great. Only good things to say about the resort staff. Self-parking was convenient and never full although there was a basketball touney in Lahaina. Great time was had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, crowded, and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: BernardJP
Reviews.Content: Title summarizes it well. The room we had was tired and in need of a facelift, down to the carpet that was heavily stained and ragged. Staff, though functional in their roles, were by no means going out of their way to please. Restaurant food was average. Finally, the size and location of the hotel guarantees that you can't get away from it all, unless "all" is defined as vacationing with 30,000 of your best friends. Our room was free (we used points), but I wouldn't go there again, even if free.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: TommieT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for a week in late September. Overall, the property is beautiful and in a great location. The grounds are very lush, and my 15 month old enjoyed feeding the Koi everyday. You cant beat the location next to the Whalers village and just a short stroll away from Blackrock for good snorkelling. The breakfast buffet is bountiful, but very expensive. Its definitely worth a try at least once. However, we had problems with the valet parking. We were charged twice for valet parking, even though the parking lot was full. The parking lot is a nightmare, as it always is full. Also, the staff seemed very impersonal and unmotivated. On the day of our departure, there was a fire on the island so the road to the airport was blocked. You would think that the front desk staff would know the road conditions. Instead, we were stuck overnight and missed our flight. Shame on them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: surfdog1
Reviews.Content: This past week marked my third visit to this resort, and the place just keeps getting better. My first trip some years back was prior to a large-scale room renovation. My second stay was basically during the renovation, and on this visit we got to see the finished product. Rooms are extremely comfortable, with contemporary decor that is somewhat lacking in a Hawaiian feel. But that's about the only bad news to report...the restaurants are great, the pool is outstanding and the waterslide can keep the kids (and this big kid) occupied for hours. You've gotta love Kaanapali, and while there are plenty of places to stay on this beach (definitely one of Maui's best), this resort's location and amenities are really tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: SFLowe
Reviews.Content: We booked this vacation(11/4 to 11/9) through their special introduction to Westin, of $749 for five nights, car and $100 resort credit. Closer to our departure date, they offered a $700 upgrade rate for oceanview with an additional $100 resort credit, which I accepted. We are Starwood gold members and were assigned a handicapped room (we are not handicapped) on a Starwood Preferred Floor (what makes it a Preferred Floor?), next to the ice machine and elevators. The room had the king bed, amoire, desk/chair, 2 nightstands and one lonely uninviting wooden chair in the corner. The rug was spotted in several areas, the wall paper was ripped by the lonely chair, the lanai furniture were dirt grey. Our $700 ocean view was beautiful, but just don't look down--the roof tops of Whaler Village. We heard every delivery truck with backup beeps and heard every bottle thrown in the recycle bins. I guess we were slumming because we were part of the $749 package. The bed was heavenly; there were not enough electrical outlets. I had to unplug lamps to recharge phones and cameras. One bedside lamp could not be shut off unless one got up to shut the hallway fixture--to shut both. Spa heavenly massage was wonderful, but don't expect the same sereneness at the overpriced nail salon. Based upon the condition of our room, please don't expect us to take our checkbooks for a Westin timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: prbyers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel from 10/29 - 11/06. This was our first trip to Hawaii and Maui. We travel about twice a year and like to stay in nice hotels. We are also Starwood Gold members. This helped us get 20% off spa services, 35% off some food and a little bit nicer room. I've read some of the complaints about the Westin here on Trip Advisor and I won't say they aren't accurate, I'd just say they're not a big deal. Room The room we stayed in (1128) was nicely upgraded with a flat screen TV and new furniture. There isn't a ton of storage space, but we were able to get settled in with almost no problem. If you're the kind of person that doesn't care much about the room being huge, then this shouldn't be an issue. True to reports - it was probably about 350 square feet with a lanai. We faced the valley and golf course. We didn't sit on the lanai even once. Pool The pool is amazing. My wife and I are city dwellers, mid-30's, no kids who love nightlife, nice restaurants and nice things. We also *don't* hate kids nor do we feel we need to be 100 yards from the nearest one when on vacation (unlike others who describe themselves this way). There is a great adult pool that we didn't even use because we don't think that if you see a couple kids around that you have to run for the hills (or complain about it constantly). People need to stop being so snobby! The pool is broken up into 3 different sections with a completely separate pool up above that is adults only. The waterslides, waterfalls and grotto were realy cool and I never felt like kids were in my way, being rude or were out of control. We also never had problems getting a chair, but I do recognize this might have to do with the fact that we were there in Oct/Nov versus the summer. Bottom line - this is one of my favorite pools ever! Beach The beach is clean, has great waves for surfing or body boarding and isn't packed. And you can walk down to the Sheraton to snorkle at Black Rock. They even billed our equipment rentals back to the Westin. Spa We each had 2 massages while we were there. The spa staff was very nice and very friendly. I liked that they seemed accesible versus snobby and intimidating. I had a 50-minute hand/foot massage and a 50-minute deep tissue massage. Both were very good. The locker room was complete with lockers, very nice showers, amenities including a complete spa-quality shaving system, steam room, sauna and hot tub. The waiting area (a "Quiet Zone") was serene with comfy chairs where you could lounge before and after treatments and eat fruit and biscotti while sipping on lemon water, tea and lavender-infused lemonade. I took advantage of all this! Staff The staff was great and always very helpful. The poolside drink service was good (not great, but good). The front desk was *extremely* helpful allowing us to check in a day early at the same rate at the last second and also allowing a late checkout. The only problem we had was with the concierges. They didn't seem to know much about Maui and the area. For instance, we asked our first day there for a good place to go eat lunch and they suggested the Hard Rock Cafe and Bubba Gump Shrimp. Now in Maui there are a ton of local spots that are much better and of course more interesting. I thought it was crazy that 2 national chains is all they came up with. In another example we asked about a play we had heard about that involved the history of Hawaii - they didn't know anything about it. Turns out it was "Ulalena", a Cirque-like show playing right in Lahaina (which was excellent and worth the money by the way). So I found the concierges to be *severly* lacking knowledge about just the basics. We encountered more examples that I won't bore you with. Restaurants Only ate at Ono once. It was fine, but not great. We ate outside the hotel the rest of the time. Not because we're cheap, but because we never like to eat in hotels - its just boring! Get out - Lahaina is minutes away and there's a ton of great places to eat there. I highly recommend Pacificos and Longhis for dinner. Lobby/Common Areas Beautiful ponds and waterfalls with flamingos, parrots, local birds, swans, ducks, etc. This always made breakfast fun as we watched kids feed the ducks and the parrots wave and talk to people. I know this is long, so I'll stop now. Overrall a great hotel in a great location in a beautiful paradise. We will be back to Maui and will likely stay at the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SMG1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from 10/26 to 10/31 and loved it! The hotel location is great. The staff were helpful and the service was great. We are SPG members and were upgraded at check in to what we were told was a partial Oceanview room. Our room was on the 10th floor and looked directly out over the pool, waterfall and to the ocean. We also had an ocean view to the right - and could see Black Rock from the room. It had recently been refurbished and included a large flat screen TV - which we never turned on. It was beautiful! The balcony was big enough to sit comfortably on - we watched the sunset from there most nights, and also drank our coffee out there each morning. The rooms have small refrigerators - we picked up some breakfast items at the grocery store and it worked out well. Would recommend that to others.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative to the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCook
Reviews.Content: Fourteen years ago, my wife and I stayed for the SECOND time at the Hyatt Regency in Lahaina. I freely admit not having been back since, and while I WANTED to stay there again, they were booked for the week I wanted to go. So I booked the Westin. Originally, the Westin was not a Westin - they inherited the hotel. This means the rooms are somewhat small. There's no closet space, only an armoir that holds very little. There is a desk in front of a very nice big screen LG high-def television, connected to the armoir, all in very dark (new) wood - and all with a table and two chairs right in front of it. This aside, it's hard to stay at a bad hotel in Lahaina. Sure, they're all expensive, but the service is really top notch. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and approachable. I did have to ask twice to have my (new) thermostat repaired in my room - we could've stored meat - and it was never fixed, but that was a small thing. The beds are all the "Westin Heavenly Bed" (which I have at home). Ours, new, was exceptionally comfortable and clean. We did hear some elevator noise as we were right off of them, and whenever someone opened the door to their patio it sounded like rolling thunder, but everyone did have a patio and we had a fabulous view of the ocean, and the gardens below. Room service (one night) was very, very good, and quick. It was also a small fortune, but that's what one gets in a high-priced hotel in Maui. No matter where I went, food was pretty expensive. We also did the buffet downstairs by the pool. Very good food, well prepared and actually pretty reasonable. You'll notice I used the word "new" repeatedly in this review; they're renovating all the rooms, and apparantly were nearly done with the 8th floor (our floor). Yes, the rooms are small, and yes, it seems frivolous to have an HD TV without any HD programming, but the shower was really nice, the furniture and bed were all new, we had a wonderful view, our room adjoined with our kids' room (special request, handled), and it was a scant $10/day for valet parking with in-n-out priv's. I consider this a good alternative to the Hyatt Regency, and one that's attached to the Whaling Center Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin starting October 8th for 5 nights, for our honeymoon. We loved this hotel. This was the 2nd island out of 3 total that we would be staying at - and our most favorite hotel of all. The room was great - we didn't notice much that needed updating, but honestly, we were enjoying our honeymoon and not really looking at whether or not the hotel needed updates. We had a few great meals in the restaurants - they were pricey, but we found most places in Hawaii to be pricey. We booked a partial ocean view room and we were upgraded - without even asking for it. We were thinking of asking, but the hotel seemed to be so crowded, we decided not to even bother...but we still got the upgrade, which we were so excited about...AWESOME views!! We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great pool”
Reviews.Author: emikelaw
Reviews.Content: Great location and pool

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBoiler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I looked into several hotels when trying to decide where to stay in Maui on our honeymoon. We considered The Sheraton, The Ritz, Hyatt, Four Seasons, and The Westin. I should note that we were looking for a romatic location, but still close to everything since we were interested in many activites while in Maui. We are pretty loyal Starwoods customers. We narrowed it down to The Ritz or The Westin and finally decided on The Westin because we are both Starwoods Preferred Guests and wanted to earn points for more travel after the honeymoon and because of the location on Kaanapali Beach. We were definitely cautiously optimistic about our choice due to other reviews we read and we didn't want to be around a lot of kids on our honeymoon (we aren't "kid people"). We were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived at The Westin. Both of us received leis and our luggage was shuttled to our room. About 1 minute after entering our room, our personal concierge, Linda, called us to see how we liked the accomodations and if we needed anything. We did notice a funny smell to the room (like stale smoke) and weren't thrilled with the view (I booked a ocean view room), so Linda told us to come find her at the front desk to see what she could do for us. We were then upgraded to the VIP suite which has 4 lanais, a dining room and living room, and one enormous bathroom (1,300 square ft total). This was for only $25 a night more than we were already paying. How could we say no? Well, we were slightly mistaken. We had said over and over to the guy "upgrading" our room, WOW only $400 a night, how could we say no?? We found out at checkout that it was $400 additional a night and they would not let us dispute charges. Needless to say. there's no way we would have spent almost $800 a night for a room and were very dissappointed that things were not more clear when they were upgrading us (be careful!!!!) The view is breathtaking from our lanai. We love those Heavenly beds! Room service is pretty good. The restaurant Tropica offers spectacular views with good (not great) food. The Spa is nice, but not top of the line. We had a couples massage which I enjoyed, but have had better. We spent a lot of time at the adult pool to be away from children and indulged in the wonderful pool side serfice. I would suggest becoming a Starwoods Preferred Guest member if you plan on staying at this hotel or any other Starwoods hotel. It's free and I really feel that we were treated a notch better because of it. We also booked our room for 35% the retail rate becuase of our SPG membership. Also, when booking The Westing, ask to stay in the Beach tower for better ocean views. The reason I did not give the hotel an "excellent" rating is because they do need to start updating some things (parts of our room and the hotel do look a bit aged) and because they were not more clear when upgrading our room. We did take a walk to The Hyatt to check it out. The room rates are much higher, but it is a beautiful hotel and more updated than The Westin. Overall, this is a very nice hotel for couples, young and older, and families.

Reviews.Title: “Earthquake and the westin”
Reviews.Author: NOTAN
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week (OCT 14-OCT 21) At the Westin.The very first morning just after 7 am we had the 6.7 earthquake..!! what a way to start a vacation.There was no damage to the resort and must say the hotel manager kept everyone informed of the power outage over the intercom system.Everyone there seemed not to panic and within an hour people went on with their day and the power was back on by 12:30 pm THE GOOD; The property overall is spectacular.Very clean in all areas with an excellent location on the hotel strip and the pool area is great with several different areas to sit.Staff seemed friendly and proffessional,always willing to help.Being close to Whalers village was very convienient with an ABC store and good restaurants.Did the volcano tour,welll worth the money as was the helicopter tour. THE BAD; Nothing really..!! I really find it hard to believe that people would find anything to complain about...and i'm a picky traveller..! I will however say that the restaurants on site are very expensive and ate next door several times for good yet reasonably priced food. THE UGLY; AVIS rental car service.Disorganized at the office and dirty cars..!! Speedishuttle airport shuttle service...once again disorganized and should be called "slow and forgot to pick us up" shuttle..!! OVERALL; I would stay there again.Maui is beautiful.A rental car is a must have to really see the true Maui sights..!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: barbie27
Reviews.Content: Well we just came back from our honeymoon a few days ago and one of the hotels we booked was the Westin in Maui. Overall the hotel was on a very nice property and the beach was the best beach of our entire honeymoon. The rooms is where it was dissappointing. We were put in the old towers and on the second floor facing the waterfalls, birds, flamingos, and loud parrots. The room had a very small closet to hang your clothes and only two drawers for clothes as well. The air conditioner wasn't working very well so we had service called to fix the air conditioner. Still was kind of warm in the room but better than it was when we first got there. Overall the bathroom was to me not very clean as far as sanitary because you smelled mildew and something else in the air. Probally because the bathroom was never cleaned with the proper cleaners to disinfect. I would only stay at the Westin again if we were given a bigger room and not facing the lobby/parrots/waterfall area. The good points of the hotel is the Whalers Village right next door and some good places to eat and drink. Best drinks are the WEstin bar near the pool, well worth the money. The beach i think is the best beach in all of Maui, Kaanapalli Beach. If you choose to stay at this hotel do your homework and ask questions as to which room you will get. I think for an upgraded room from a standard room it's quit pricey and you can probally get bigger rooms with the Sheraton or Marriott. Although if you prefer the Westin hotel flare, it is a nice hotel with a few minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but busy, pay for every little thing”
Reviews.Author: Debits2000
Reviews.Content: We had been referred by someone who owns a villa there and got a package with a great price which included a car and $75 gift certificate. We could use the gift certificate at checkout which was good. We charged lunch and breakfasts and then used the certificates that way. If you use them in restaurant or store, they do not give change. So you either end up losing some value or spending more if the bill is higher than the $25 and $50 certificate. The room was supposed to be a standard non â€“view room. When we checked in I asked if there were any complimentary upgrades available. They gave us an Oceanside room with 2 double beds on the second floor. The other room had a king, but I was happy to have an Oceanside room. Truth is, it really wouldnâ€™t have matter much, as we were hardly in room. But I think overlooking the parking lot on that low of a floor would have been not so good. The room was okay, a bit tired and worn. They were in the process of redoing all of the rooms. While were there, they were changing mattresses, furniture, carpets, putting in flat screen tvâ€™s -- so all of the rooms should be really nice in short order. The bed was very comfortable and had 2 white down quilts on it!! Sure didnâ€™t need 1 let alone 2! There was a mini-fridge, coffee maker, in room safe and the bathroom amenities were their own brand and quite nice. They had a lighted makeup mirror which was nice to have. We got leis when we checked in, and cold towels and chilled fruit laced water was in the lobby every afternoon. That was a great treat after being out in the sun each day. The grounds are really nice with lots of pools, including an adult only one. There are parrots by the patio and a waterfall you can walk under. All pools but one close at sunset. Our biggest complaint [and we knew this ahead of time] was the $18.50 daily resort fee. [2 bottles of water a day, workout room, a paper shopping bag, internet access w/ your own computer, self parking]. It really doesnâ€™t give you much, you have no choice. Westin seems to be big on this resort charge thing, we've encountered it before. Even with resort fee you still had to pay to RENT chairs and/or umbrellas on the beach! And they make a big deal of stay at one and play at all of their resorts on Ka'anapali, but the have recently changed that policy to exclude the pools! You can use the beach, ride the shuttle, eat and sign in restaurants, but no pool use except where you are staying. There was self park or valet. The self park was small and was often full at night, so then you could use the valet park with no charge except tipping. We had breakfast twice at Westin at the cafÃ© self-serve place again for convenience. We also used this towards our $75 credit. It was expensive of course and nothing special. We had croissant sandwiches, fruit, juice and coffee. We had bagels and coffee and pineapple from Whalerâ€™s Village a couple of mornings that we wanted to get out to the beach fast. Thereâ€™s a kiosk place in the middle of the village and price was reasonable. We had lunch at Westin Villas one day as we were there using the beach. It was expensive, good and again went towards our $75 credit. The place was very busy and although it was conveniently located, I don't think we would go back. I think we prefer a little more tranquility and would rent a condo or go to a B&B next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyM
Reviews.Content: We visited the Westin Maui for our honeymoon, Sept 18-28. After reading several negative reviews I was a little nervous, but felt prepared. This hotel greatly exceeded our expectations! I was so nervous that a bunch of kids would be running like wild animals, but to my pleasant suprise the majority of the people at the hotel were other honeymooners. One of my favorite parts of our stay was the adult pool with cushioned chairs and a bar. There were also cocktail servers who were constantly checking on us. Getting a couple of chairs was never a problem, unless we waited until after noon to go lay out. We are from Indiana, and with the difference in time we found it much easier to go to bed early then begin our days early. The sounds from the waterfalls surrounding the pools cover up noise from little ones perfectly. I think the time of year had something to do with the fact that there weren't too many kids around. Which was great because when we played on the water slide there wasn't a line : ) Our room was in the Beach tower on the 11th floor - deluxe ocean view. The room was huge, with a king bed, desk with chair and a pull out couch. Also had a large closet with mirrors on the doors and great bathoom with big vanity space. Heavenly showers are nice!! I didn't notice any mold or dirt. The patio looked out at the ocean (facing north), but if you looked straight down you were looking at Whaler's Village and the tops of restaurants (this was really our only disappointment). We did get snookered into the timeshare presentation for the Ocean Villas up the street (they give you a $100 credit on your account - every little bit helps!). It was a seamless presentation and very enticing! We booked our excursions through the American Express travel people in the lobby of the hotel. All of it is very expensive, but more expensive through this service we found. I'd recommend picking up those tourist magazines you see everywhere and shop around a bit. You can save a lot of money that way (too bad we didn't figure that out until we had already went on a few!). Highly recommend the Lanai dolphin rafting excursion. We saw nearly 50 dolphins jumping and playing around our raft - it was amazing! Favorite restaurants were Kimo's (in Lahaina), Tropica (In westin - but expensive), Leilani's & Rusty Harpoon(right next to the Westin). One morning we went to the Ka'anapali Mixed Plate to get a cheaper breakfast buffet (the one in the westin is $25 per person). It was cheaper, but it was a busy free for all. If you don't like crowded places with lots of hungry people - I'd stay away from this one (but breafast for the two of us was like $25). We also really liked Moose McGillycuddy's in Lahaina for lunch. We rented a car, which is necessary if you like to explore on your own, and never had trouble parking. It is free to self park at the hotel, and the couple of times the lot was full they valet parked it for us at no charge. We did the luau at the Hyatt, which was pretty cheesy, but we had to go to one since it is part of Hawaii. I'd probably try to get one that is actually on the beach so it is more authentic, because this one was in a small pavillion and seemed more like a show we could see here in the midwest. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. There were plenty of spaces for us to get away and have privacy (since it was our honeymoon). Just be prepared to spend some loot - everything is expensive. If you need to pick up anything, food, beer, lotion, etc., go to ABC stores - they are much cheaper than anywhere else we saw. If there is a next time we may consider staying at the Westin Ocean Villas - because they have kitchenettes - that will save on the expense of eating out for every meal. However it is not as close to shopping and the pool area is not nearly as big. Before we went I signed up for the Starwood Preferred Guest program, I think that may have got us a room upgrade and some other perks. Like I said before -every little bit helps! Hope this helps! Have fun on your vacation : )

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: tagretchen
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm the only reviewer that liked this place??? Early October 2006, was my second time staying at the Westin. My husband and I really enjoyed it. Our room was clean and spacious. The customer service was great, and we were never once asked about buying a time share. We received an ocean view upgrade and a complimentary bottle of champange. They also offer a complimentary photo. The hotel is located on the best portion of Kaanapali beach. Its next door to Whaler's Village (shopping and restaurants), they have a free shuttle to the Kapalua airport, and there is a bus to Lahaina. The pool area is perfect for kids (they also have an adult area.) I think the hotel could use some renovation, however the location is perfect and we were treated great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: tiffsix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (Late 20's) stayed at the Westin from Oct. 4-13th. We just returned today from a wonderful stay at the Westin! Now, prior to leaving, I read numerous reviews about this resort and I have to say that I totally disagree with most of the negative reviews that I have read. Most of the negative remarks are about the lack of pool chairs surrounding the HUGE pool complex. Now, from what I have noticed, these people traveled to this hotel during the peak summer months when ANYWHERE you go is crowded and in my opinion, you should expect the crowds and know what you are getting yourself into. We never had a problem finding a pool chair no matter what time of the day it was. There is plenty of room, not to mention a beatiful beach to lay on! The pool area is amazing and we opted to hang out there instead of the beach. We stayed on the 10th floor of the Ocean Tower and had an incredible ocean view. Our room was just re-done and we were told we were the first guests to stay in the room. It had plenty of room for the 2 of us and a nice flat screen TV that my husband loved! I do have to agree with some of the negative remarks regarding maid service. Sometimes they didn't get to clean our room until mid-afternoon which meant that we sometimes missed our maid service since we were napping, etc. They are in the process of renovating the floors, however, we never saw or heard any construction noise. The restaurants at the Hotel are nice and the food is good. We had a great dinner at Tropica (on the Westin, more on that in a second) and Ono had great food as well. We ate at the Breakfast Buffet there each morning as our package with Expedia came with it (which was good considering it is $25 person!) Now another great reason why we loved the Westin is that if they make a mistake, they take care of their guests. We rented a car during our stay and one night we had to Valet the car because the self-park lot is full (Not a big deal because they do not charge you for Valet) The next afternoon we went to retrieve our car and after 45 minutes, they determined it was GONE! Apparently, the new Valet kid parked the car in the wrong spot and it got TOWED! Anyway, to make a long story short, they of course got our car back and compensated us with a free meal at Tropica (which is expensive) and they also credited our account another $150 in addition to providing us with transportation on the day we did not have the car. We also made a call to the front desk to complain about the maid service and they took off 5 days of the $18 resort charge. So, we can not complain about the great service we received while staying at the Westin. The location is the best on Kaanapali beach. The beach area is also the nicest. Black Rock is a quick walk, Whalers Village is right next door. We suggest eating at Hula Grill and Leilani's. As far as things to do while there, definitely take the Road to Hana! It was a great time and we saw so many amazing waterfalls and got a real feel for the island. Definitely see the Warren & Annabelle show. It was the BEST!!!!!!!!!!! Oh, and you HAVE to eat at Mama's Fish House. It was our best meal of the trip. I was so sad to leave Maui. It is such a beatiful place that I only hope we can one day go back and visit!!!!!! And if we stayed on Kaanapali beach, the Westin would be our number one choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, if you like huge, crowded, expensive hotels”
Reviews.Author: MDiablo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late September with a group and enjoyed it, but the fact I wasn't paying the bill helped a lot. It is a huge place with all of the amenities you would expect - a great pool complex, spa, restaurants, etc. The location is good, right on the beach and next door to the Whaler's mall. It's about a 10 minute, $14, cab ride to Lahaina town. It was very crowded for what is supposed to be the off season (we were told they were fully booked). We never went to the pool, but it looked like most of the lounges were taken pretty early in the day. Check-in took about 30 minutes because of some error with our group booking (not sure whose fault it was, but desk agent should have handled it more quickly). The Ono poolside restaurant and bar was nice, serving breakfast, lunch and some very tasty tapas dishes in the evening. All of the food and drinks were expensive, but not out of line with most of Maui. Our 8th floor room had a nice view of the beach and Lanai. The room was comfortable but nothing too special. If I were spending my own money, I would get an ocean view room at a smaller place like the Napili Kai. But if you like huge resort hotels with all the amenities, you will probably like the Westin. And if you have kids, they will love the pools and water slide.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Place”
Reviews.Author: wbeagletown
Reviews.Content: We (wife and I, no kids) stayed for the first time at this hotel from Sept 30- Oct 5. We picked it because it is ALL NON-SMOKING ROOMS. Most of the pool area is also non-smoking. Because of this policy, the hotel tends to attract non-smokers which we loved. All restaurants on the entire island of Maui are non-smoking, incidentally. The hotel is built around a vast interconnecting complex of pools, waterfalls, lagoons, koi ponds, rainforest/jungle walkways, in which there are flamingoes, swans, ducks and parrots. No other hotel pool complex comes close to this amazing place (combination of Rainforest Cafe and Disney's Animal Kingdom and Swiss Family Robinson and Pirates of the Caribbean).There is a quiet pool for adults only. One of the family pools is actually two pools connected by a swim-thru cavern with waterfalls at each end. In the middle of the cavern is a hidden hot tub! For nightowls or folks with jetlag, there is complimentary coffee in the lobby from midnite to 5 am. We sat in comfy chairs there in the lobby one early morning (all of the chairs are lined up right by the giant lagoon with waterfalls), and watched the koi and flamingoes wake up. Hotel rooms are nicely decorated, very clean, great ocean views. Fridge in room with complimentary bottled water replenished each day. Excellent buffet breakfast either overlooking the ocean or the lagoon. Snorkeling off the beach is only fair, but a 5 minute walk down to Black Rock in front of the Sheraton gives you great snorkeling, including turtles if you swim around to the far side of the rock where they hang out. Next door to the hotel is the Whalers' Village. They have an ABC store where you can buy sundries, supplies and souveneirs, very reasonably priced. Hula Grill is an excellent place for lunch or dinner, choice of simple or more fancy fare. Overall, a terrific hotel which gave us a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: texdad
Reviews.Content: 8 months of planning and our first trip to Maui and the Westin did not dissapoint. We have just returned from a perfect trip. So, what do I think abou the Westin? Since February I have been reading reviews and I think in many ways it comes to this - you get what you pay for. We had saved and planned for a dream vacation, so we booked the Premium Deluxe Ocean View at nearly $500 per night. And guess what? We had one of the best rooms in the place with a spectacular view and had an awesome time. You will find people complaining about "garden view" etc., because they are trying to get the cheapest possible rate and then complain when they are not treated well. Sorry to say, that is the way of the world, and especially in expensive Hawaii. OK.. enough lecturing - on to the hotel. Perfect location steps from the beach and Whalers Village shopping. Plenty of nearby restaurants and activities. AWESOME POOL and slide and great, safe, freindly atmosphere for families and kids (Ours are 13 and 8) Good policy to have kids wear a daily i.d. bracelet to identify the guests. We always found ample deck space and were fortunate that our kids are old enough to run around at will while mom and dad relaxed. The pool staff is young, friendly, very outgoing and helpful. Restaurant employees are cheery and attentive. (Especially our friend Alex at "Ono".) On site coordinators for Parasailing and all other activities. We had no intention of doing a timeshare, so, guess what, we didn't subject ourselves to the 3 hours just to get some voucher or discount. (I must say, in all of my experience of resort properties, the timeshare folks here were pleasant and NEVER pushed us to stop and hear the pitch.) Room - I'm told the "Beach Tower" is newer and has the nicer rooms. That is where we had our top floor room and it was quite nice. Small refrigerator was included, along with a nice lanai overlooking the pool and beach. The Westin is kind enough to provide a small set of binoculars for use during your stay. A word of caution to the many honeymooners - close your curtains !!! My wife and I were witness to a few romantic interludes. My only complaint on the room would be the bath.... compared to Las Vegas and some of the newer properties, it is a bit small. I prefer a separate tub and shower instead of the one piece. A double vanity would be better too. Would I stay again? With family and for the price, YES. Now, on our last day we toured Wailea and the saw the Grand and the Four Seasons. Those are definately in a different league, but the Westin was ideal for our family and we had a spectacular time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed all the activity”
Reviews.Author: danigrrrl
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Maui. The view was awesome, the grounds of the hotel were super-clean. My favorite aspect was the comfortable beds. I enjoyed the spa, the nearby shops and the clean beach. The hotel is not new, but was very clean. I had a very good experience and am returning in November of this year! My kids are all grown, I had no problem with the facility being a family resort. In fact I enjoyed watching the kids have so much fun in the pools. It was relaxing, warm and beautiful. Who cares if the beds are made? I rather prefer to request more towels and not have daily service.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, lousy timeshare”
Reviews.Author: photodave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin on a special package, 5 nights for $750, plus a rental car credit, and a coupon for resort services. We found out we were referred by someone who was a timeshare owner, and that the invitation was in the hope that we would attend a timeshare presentation and ultimately buy a timeshare. Attending the timeshare presentation was not mandatory. We checked in, and were informed that the king size bed we had reserved was not available, because they had a lot of people there from the Maui marathon, which had run that day. They gave us a room with two double beds for one night (not a good fit when youâ€™re 6â€™5â€� tall, like I am) and moved us to a king the next day while we were out. To compensate for the inconvenience (after we complained) they credited us the daily resort fee of $18.50, which everyone has to pay on top of the room rate. Both rooms were classified â€œTerrace non-viewâ€�, which meant it looked over the parking lot, and the West Maui mountains. When we checked out, they would not allow a late check out because the people moving into our room were already at the resort, and were being moved like we had been. I guess that is a regular thing with them, at least on this class of rooms. To compare our experience with others posted here, I will say the following: The condition of the rooms isnâ€™t that bad. In both rooms, the carpet was off-white with a bas-relief leaf pattern, which in both rooms had small stains, but nothing outrageous. Hallway showed some signs of having luggage carts run into the walls, that kind off thing. But nothing was threadbare, or looked like it was in total neglect. Itâ€™s a nice hotel that caters to a lot of families, and shows the effects of all those kids. I donâ€™t know what is so heavenly about the beds. The first night on the king was not pleasant for me. I woke up the next morning with quite a backache, which I canâ€™t blame on the traveling because it was my third morning on the island. However, I had no further problems sleeping, or with backaches. I think the â€œheavenlyâ€� tag comes from the beds looking so plush with all those covers and pillows, which you mostly donâ€™t use in a tropical location like that. Iâ€™ve read comments here that the maid service didnâ€™t do anything except make the bed. But the maids did everything that maids do in a hotel. They put in clean towels, replaced glasses that were dirty, etc. They didnâ€™t clean up my clothes off the floor or anything like that, but thatâ€™s not their job. The pools are great. I think the temperature was just right, which was probably about 80 degrees. I heard one older woman (in her 60â€™s) complain about the water being too cold, but Iâ€™m 52 and loved it. And the slide is terrific! You can go really fast if you try to arch your back as you go down, and ride on your heels and shoulders. You will think youâ€™re going to come flying out on the curves, but you wonâ€™t. But lots of people go slower by sitting up instead of laying down. We never had any problem getting lounge chairs by the pool, even two together. And we had no problem with kids around the pools either. Iâ€™m sure in both cases this is because we went two weeks after Labor Day, when school-age children are back in school. Lots of young couples with infants, however. We found no attitude problems with the staff, but then we never got abusive or even testy with them either. I think most of those reported problems come from tourists who come in, after paying rack rates, and start screaming when everything isnâ€™t perfect because itâ€™s so expensive. When we complained about having a reduced room the first night and having to move, we werenâ€™t abusive. We just called our assigned concierge and expressed our unhappiness. Do see Warren and Annabelleâ€™s magic show. The magic is standard sleight-of-hand stuff, very well done. But what makes it great is the patter- Warren is hysterical! And heâ€™s not afraid of hecklers, he actually encourages you to comment. But donâ€™t buy the dinner package- you donâ€™t sit at a dinner table, you sit at a cocktail table, and have to hold the dinner plate on your lap. And the food is only OK, you can find much better food in Lahaina than this. Do try parasailing. It was definitely a highlight of our trip. We went with Maui Parasail, which operates out of Lahaina, and it was great. The parachute is a big â€œhave a nice dayâ€� face, great for photos. DONâ€™T do the timeshare presentation at the Westin! They tell you itâ€™s different than a timeshare, and that the presentation isnâ€™t the same, but thereâ€™s no difference that I can see. We ended up signing, and were never told that there was a 7-day cancellation window, and you really have to look for it in the contracts. We were lucky and did the presentation at the end of the week, so when the â€œparadise syndromeâ€� wore off, and we realized that we didnâ€™t need any more debt right now, we still had time to cancel. I feel sorry for the people that sign up at the beginning of their vacation, and have no window left to cancel when they get home and the bliss wears off. But when we started emailing our salesman, and the corporate office to make sure where to send our cancellation, no one responded. The contract doesnâ€™t even provide a fax number, we had to use Fed-ex. I believe they have had several complaints to the Better Business Bureau. Donâ€™t get me wrong, the property they showed us was great, and if you want a Maui timeshare, and youâ€™re willing to pay developer prices, this is top of the line. Just hold out to get the best deal before you say yes. But if youâ€™re not really looking for a timeshare, save yourself a lot of hassle and â€œjust say noâ€� to the presentation. The timeshare experience soured the whole vacation a little bit. Overall, I'd go again at that price, but I'd never attend the timeshare presentation. They just won't take no for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tropical-Explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several hotels across Maui and I have to say that The Westin and the Kaanapali Beach Hotel were are favorite. We stayed at both as well as the Grand Wailea and a hotel in Hana so we definitely were able to compare. We originally were going to stay at the Sheraton but after walking by and seeing LOUD repairs going on at the pool we rebooked the Westin. The Westin grounds are beautiful and the pool is amazing! Also I was impressed with the front desk staff and the restaurant/bar workers. They even had a happy hour special every day! Prices seem high, but this is Hawaii. Look for a special. The location of the hotel can't be beat. You can walk to other hotels, shops, restaurants and it didn't feel busy. Try to go in the off-season. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: DrMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for the first week of our honeymoon and had a fantastic time. We arrived late at night to dicover that, as we'd hoped (we were on honeymoon) they had upgraded our room to an ocean view (we had booked a partial ocean). However, the new room had 2 queen-sized beds instead of the requested king, this was compensated by a free lunch token worth 45 dollars each, and also by daily buffet breakfast, which we hadn't expected. The room was ok, clean and spacious enough, the bed was comfy, nice view over the ocean and whalers village. The bathroom was what you might expect in a 3 star at best, but it all functioned well. An irritating inconvenience was not having a bedside lamp on my side of the bed, or a light switch nearby to control the main lights. Eating options included the Ono bar and grill (nice pupus), and the Tropica which had a great wine list and gorgeous seafood, we only went there on our last night and regretted not visiting sooner. The room service took around 45 mins but the burger was fantastic. The hotel sits right next to the Whalers village shops and restaurant centre, giving another 3-4 restaurant options (leilani's on the beach, sit upstairs for the good stuff) plus some nice shops for browsing e.g. Tiffanys, Louis Vuitton, Quiksilver and ABC. The landscaped pool area looks lovely with multiple waterfalls and pools. Adults can escape the children by going the the upper level, no under 16's. The hotel is one of a line of big resort hotels on Ka'anapaali beach, and the restaurants and bars are available to all. A daily stealth tax of $18 per day adds to your expenses. This is supposedly to cover the cost of such necessities as faxing and self-parking, however, in the week we were there, the carpark always claimed to be full, which meant that we had to valet park, which was $10 per day (this was not advertsied anywhere as far as I could see). Overall the Westin was a great base to see Maui, nice but not over-the-top. They made us feel a little special on honeymoon with free meals, upgrades, sparkling wine and chocolates which made a difference. Also, it is just a short drive to Lahaina which was thoroughly charming. happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Ka'anapali beach !!”
Reviews.Author: 9xKINGx9
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 10 day-honeymoon at the Westin Maui. It was everything we had hoped for and more. DO NOT worry about the negative reviews, it is a great hotel! When you book, make sure you include the buffet-breakfast in your hotel rate....trust me, its worth it!! Here is the truth: the Westin is the best hotel on Kaanapali beach. Not because of the rooms (they are ok but nothing fancy...who cares anyways, you spend so little time in it!) but because of their location, their portion of the beach and their swimming pools! The location right next door to Whalers Village is a HUGE plus because you have quick access to all the nice restaurants but also the quick & cheap food courts and the ABC store where you will find yourself buying almost everything. The swimming pools are just fantastic! 5 pools all connected in some way plus the water-slide which is actually pretty fast. Some people have said that they couldnt get a chair around the pools unless they got up very early in the morning....well, we never got to the pool before 10h30AM and never had any problems finding 2 chairs. In fact, there were TONS of chairs available at anytime during the day! I also recommend going to the Westin at the beginning of a school semester because this will minimize the number of kids around the pools. We were there at the beginning of September and there were hardly any kids!! I would definitely go back to the Westin if I were to return to Maui. OTHER RECOMMENDATIONS: - rent a car while you're in Maui....with so many things to see, you definitely need one. - read the "Maui Revealed" book and carry it around with you everywhere. I did it and it really helps. - you must do the Road to Hana. - you must go to the top of Haleakala. - you must eat at Mama's Fish House in Paia (best meal I had in Maui). - you must go see "Warren & Annabelles Magic Show" in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Maui”
Reviews.Author: ewilde
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the Westin in Maui - it was fantastic and we can't wait to go back. Some highlights: - The waves were great (and strong) in front of the Kaanapali Ali (next door to the Westin). -Contrary to over reviews we've read, we liked the breakfast buffet. It was expensive at 25 per person, but there was SO much to eat (and it was great after the long flight). We didn't do this every day - there is a stand with pastries that we bought from the other days. -The pools were awesome - and my husband loved the waterslide. I thought it would be kids-only using the waterslide, but there were a lot of adults using the bigger one. -Our room was in the beach tower facing Whalers Village. We LOVED it. View was amazing (even though we were one of the farther rooms from the ocean). The room was bigger than the ones in the other tower, and had a full closet. It was clean and nicely maintained. And had plenty of room (bathroom was good sized too). DIdn't notice too much noise from Whalers Village. -SO nice to be nice to Whalers Village. We enjoyed Leilani's and the Rusty Harpoon for meals. We did the food court a few times too - it's nothing special, but gives your credit cards a much-deserved break. -Close to Lahaina - we loved going to Lahaina. Tons of neat shops, souvenir stores, drug stores for snacks, water, gatorade. -The daily hotel fee (which I read a lot of people complain about) covers self-parking, 2 bottles of water daily, internet in the room (if you happen to have your laptop - we forgot it). We didn't think it was too unreasonable. Things that we were not impressed with: -Self parking - there is not very much of it. It is hard to get a spot unless you come back in the middle of the afternoon or before dinner as more people are gone during the days. It is impossible to find spots if you are coming back from dinner. Luckily, if the lot if full, they will valet your car for free. -Housekeeping - they didn't come until late afternoon (like 5), and somedays did not come at all. We didn't want to remind them, as they did such a poor job anyways. They barely pulled the covers up on the bed (see picture attached). I am a frequent business traveler, and was appalled at the maid service. They forgot to take dirty towels on the ground by the sink, and didn't pick anything up. Overall, the Westin was great - there were a few downfalls, but nothing that would prevent us from coming back. We definetly wished we would have stopped at Costco after arriving (its right by the airport) for water, gatorade and snacks. But there's always next time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - worn rooms, terrible housekeeping, and unresponsive management”
Reviews.Author: sleepy05
Reviews.Content: The good: Westin Maui Resort And Spa is in a great location with a nice beach and very large multi-tiered pool. There are many activities that can be booked right off the beach in front of the hotel. It is also right next door to a fairly large outdoor mall called Whaler's Village, which has shops, three sit down restaurants, and a couple of fast food operations. The bad: The management and most service workers at the hotel have an "it's not my problem" mentality. When you call at 4pm to ask why your room wasn't cleaned, donâ€™t be surprised when you are informed by the person on the other end of the line that it is not their fault because their shift just started. There is no team mentality with the management or the service staff. Expect to get a lot of attitude from the towel distribution staff and don't think you are getting a towel from them past five when they close, even though the pool shuts down at ten. Don't be surprised when your a/c or balcony door do not function. Of course you will be informed that the hotel is planning renovations to "begin very soon." Expect to contend with tons of kids. This hotel is not up to Westin standards. I have stayed at Westins all over and this is the worst. Go to Maui, you will have a great time, but stay at the Fairmont or the Hyatt next door, they are both superior.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: pgd411
Reviews.Content: We just got done with a 5 night stay at the Westin resort. As many of the reviews said, the resort could use some updating (carpet, paint, torn wallpaper), but it's not horrible. They brought us a roll-away bed which made it much easier to fit a family of four (or five) in the room since the double beds are pretty small. The pool area is very nice but you better get up early if you want to make sure you can get a lounge chair, and you better get up really early if you want a chair under an umbrella. The last day, we got up at 6:30 and got the very last set of chairs under the umbrella. I think most people got towels the day before and just went out early and set the towels on the prime chairs, and then came back later in the day to use them. Also, they never checked our wristbands, so I'm not sure you need to even bother with those. Having Whaler's Village shopping mall next door is great if you've got teenage kids. If/when they get bored, you can just send them next door to shop or get ice cream or pizza. Snorkeling at the Black Rock outside the Sheraton is great (although expect it to be crowded), and that's just a 1/2 mile walk down the beach. So its a great resort to stay if you're not expecting pristine accomodations, and you don't mind the crowds that come with a large family oriented resort that's right on Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to five stars”
Reviews.Author: Dessert_Rat
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s see, where to begin: - The housekeeping crews were awful. On most days we would return to the room around 4:00pm to find the room un-serviced. Inevitably they would arrive while we were getting ready to go to diner and we would tell them to come back in Â½ hour. This was mistake since they go home at 4:30pm, they donâ€™t bother to tell you this. I had to call the front desk a few time to get to room serviced - The rooms were very small for the price. This was the opinion of most people we talked to by the pool. - The â€œmountain viewâ€� rooms should have been called â€œparking lot/construction viewâ€� rooms. The mountain is being torn apart to build more timeshare properties. - One of the two waterslides they mention in their literature is only about 10 feet long. - The $25 breakfast buffet was a waste of money since almost all the food was overcooked. - The parking lot was so small I could not find a place to park. And when I did, I would find my car parked-in by the valet service the next day. - The quality of the TV signal was terrible. All the channels were snowy and on two occasions the entire system was down. I know you are not supposed to watch TV when on vacation in Hawaii but the kids still want their fix of Cartoon Network. - The pools were so crowded that you could not find two chairs next to each other. I was watching people arrive at the pool at 7:30am to claim their spots.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction will Depend on How Much You Paid”
Reviews.Author: kibuminla
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but your level of satisfaction will depend greatly on how much you paid and your expectations upon arrival. My family (wife & 2 kids 7 and 4) received a special promotional invitation to stay for 5 nights for $750 (included rental car and $75 food credit) which was an offer too good to refuse. We also attended the timeshare presentation and got another $100 voucher. Because we paid so little, we had very low expectations (especially after reading some of the terrrible reviews on Tripadvisor) and didn't feel too bad when they stuck us in the worst possible room (2nd floor overlooking the valet parking stop). My sister-in-law's family, on the other hand, paid almost $400 per night through Costco and couldn't have been more disappointed. The first room they got was moldy and they got moved to a slightly better room. The property is pretty old -- rooms look like they were built in the late 70's or early 80's -- and small. If you pay for an Ocean view room, the views will be amazing, but you will still have a small, outdated room. We noticed that the carpets had stains, the grounds were clean, but not immaculate, and the hotel overall feels a notch down from other Westin properties. If you have kids, take a wetsuit because the pools are pretty cold and they won't be able to stay in there all day. Also, there is no kiddie-pool, so if you have any kids that can't swim, you'll have to stick by their side all day. The beach has a steep drop-off that creates a rip tide, so is not very safe for small children. It was also very difficult to get a pool-side chair because they were all "reserved" with towels, newspapers, etc. by about 8:00am. Despite the stated hotel policy that you can't reserve the chairs for more than 30 minutes, everyone was doing it and getting away with it. We usually tried to go sight-seeing in the mornings and went to the pool after 3pm when some of the chairs started opening back up. Forget about getting a chair under the few umbrellas ... these were usually taken by 6:00am and occupied all day. Sorry for all the negatives ... but I found that the "warnings" from other Tripadvisor reviewers helped set my expectations and therefore helped me enjoy the trip better. On the plus side, the grounds are beautiful, with lots of waterfalls, flamingos, koi and lush landscaping. And the service was generally pleasant. Maui is a beatiful place (although crowded) and you can't really complain about being there! I would go back if I was offered a good deal. I would NEVER pay over $250 per night to stay there. If you end up going, have a great time ... you're in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: MTJK
Reviews.Content: The Westin was the second resort that we chose to stay at while we spent the first week of our honeymoon on Maui. We stayed for 3 nights and I was actually bummed when we opened the door to our room and saw how small and plain it was. We had started our trip at the Napili Kai Resort further north, there the rooms were large, CLEAN and comfortable. The Westin's "ocean view" room was small and the bathroom was dirty with black hairs everywhere from the toilet to the tub, we actually wondered if they had even cleaned it. I thought the "heavenly" bed and shower was average. It's just unbelievable that we had to pay MORE than double of what we had paid at Napili Kai to stay at the Westin, it was sooooo not worth it. Pros... - adult pool -Ka'anapali Beach -proximity to Whaler's Village -breakfast buffet -Mojito's at the adult pool bar -valet guys and parking were convenient -boogie boarding in front of the Ka'anapali Ali' Cons... -couldn't find 2 lounge chairs together without walking around for at least 20 minutes. -It's impossible to relax around the pool. Go to the beach to get away from the packed pool atmosphere. -over-priced (I expect to pay more at a nice resort on Hawai'i, but this place is ridiculous) -out-of-control children running, screaming and acting-up everywhere! -numerous hidden costs, charges, taxes, fees, etc. This is not a place for a couple to relax and especially not a place for honeymooners. Do not stay here if you do not have children. Trust me- I am a 2nd grade teacher, I deal with kids daily and I could not stand the children that acted like crazies all over this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Still on Maui time...”
Reviews.Author: Loddii
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui 3 days ago (BIG SIGH). I think I'm still on Maui time. But, oh well. Ok onto the review... The Westin Maui was an awesome place to stay. We were supposed to be booked into a Garden View room and they upgraded us to an Ocean view room for free. Which was awesome. I would say it was a Mt. view/Ocean view.
