We had the mountains to our left and ocean to our right. Incredible. The hotel room was just that, a hotel room. It was clean and well stocked. The room was a little rough around the edges but nothing I couldn't live with. You're paying for location, location, location. We had a problem with our safe one day and they had an engineer up within 5 minutes who fixed the problem. The pools here are AWESOME! There are 5 pools here, 1 adult pool and 4 regular pools. The adult pool is the place to stay if you're traveling without children. My boyfriend and I hung out here or on the beach. The pool was a little chilly the first day we went in, but after you're in, it's great. The second time we went in it was perfect. So who knows... maybe wait a bit later in the morning/early afternoon to go in? Also, the bar/waitstaff at the adult pool were great too! They have these really yummy drinks up there called Lava Flows... OMG. They are heaven. :) The restaurants... We ate at Ono most of the time we ate at the hotel. We had dinner there our first night and I could not taste anything as I was sick (head cold). My boyfriend said it was good though. And the other 3 times we ate there we had the breakfast buffet. Which I realize at $25 a crack it's expensive but, it's a really awesome buffet with an omlette station (they will also cook eggs over easy, etc. for you there) and we got sat in front of the ocean on the tropica (another restaurant on the grounds)side. Their coffee rocks too. :) Other than all that, it's a great location on the beach with great amenities. A little updating would be good but we were in our room to sleep in that was it. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: starwoodfan782
Reviews.Content: I browsed countless reviews before booking the Westin and wasn't sure what to expect. We are fairly frequent travelers who have tried a number of Four Seasons, etc. We often find them too snobby and uptight, so we wanted a happy medium. When push came to shove, I trusted the Westin brand. My family of 5 (3 teenage/early 20s kids) returned today after an 8 day stay. We loved the Westin, and would return in a heartbeat. The atmosphere was upscale and laid back, the service good, and the location AMAZING. The pros: Room: I know that the rooms get a lot of heat on this board. We stayed in a luxury suite and were incredibly pleased. It was a good value for a room of that caliber and was about 1600 square feet with 5 balconies--2 of which overlook the ocean. With grown children, we need 2 rooms. This was a great way of giving us space while getting top notch views. Pools: We walked around the pools at all other resorts on Ka'anapali Beach and were far and away most impressed with the landscaping and pools of the Westin. We tried to pin down why the Westin facilities were so much more upscale and determined that it was the plush, cushioned lounge chairs vs. the plastic strip kind that the Hyatt and Marriott have. Yes, it is crowded ane yes, there are children. However, these are consistent across ALL of the top resorts on the island. The adult pool was peaceful and the hotel was at 100% capacity. Location: In the middle of the Ka'anappali strip--perfect. It's next to Whaler's Village shops and restaurants and within walking distance of Black Rock, some of the best snorkeling on the island (we saw 2 giant sea turtles within 15 mins on the first day). Black Rock is adjacent to the Sheraton--as a Westin guest, you can use the facilities there, get towels, and sign snorkel gear to the room. Service to elite members: The treatment of SPG platinum and gold members is enough to get me to return in itself. They try to place upgrades, give substantial discounts on spa treatments and cabana rentals, and allow platinum members to use the spa facilities as much as they'd like. General service: The concierge was wonderful...ours (Pamela) went out of her way to schedule tours, give us a gift upon arrival, etc. The cons: Overagressive time share solicitation--The concierge was fantastic, but the Westin is now encouraging the desks to really push the timeshares hard. They need to cool it a bit...but most hotels seem to be doing this. We noticed this when we walked by Marriott as well. Of course Maui is expensive and the hotel food was not amazing, but this is common across hotels and no more-so at the Westin. Try the Whalers Village restaurants--specifically Leilani's and the Hula Grill. They're fantastic. Other really great experiences on the trip included: Temptation Tours Hana SkyTrek--Van/Helicopter tour to Hana Old Lahaina Luau--great, but book 4-6 weeks ahead Sunset sail on Teralani--convenient, left from next door If you stay at the Westin, people told us not to bother booking a snorkel boat trip--the snorkeling at black rock is just as good! We're not expert snorkelers, but were really happy with the quality of fish and diversity of sea life (rays, turtles, etc) Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice PooL but that is about it”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMan1965
Reviews.Content: Our Balcony was dirty..Outside of the Pool and the Beds the food and drinks is average and overpriced at best. This is not luxury and anyone that tells you it is are only kidding themselves. =)

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui is still paradise!”
Reviews.Author: goingoinggone
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks on this site trying to decide where we should take our two teens in Hawaii, and as someone else mentioned, the more reviews I read, the more confused I became. We weighed hotels and islands, and in the end, decided to return to the Westin Maui where we'd had many good experiences. As I write this, I am sitting at a desk in my room overlooking the beach (steep? Where? Looks wide and flat to me!) and listening to the sound of the waves as they roll up upon the sand. We chose the Westin for its great siting and its unstuffy experience. My husband and I would choose a Four Seasons experience, but our kids wouldn't, and we don't blame them. Don't come to the Westin and then complain that you didn't get a Four Seasons experience. They are different hotels! We were last here in 2001 and the whole area seemed to be suffering a bit from the drop in Japanese tourism. Today, things are lively and busy. The Westin has kept up their property, adding palapa umbrellas in the pool area and reopening their beachfront restaurant. It seems a waste of space to me to complain about the cost of food -- Hawaii is expensive; don't blame it on the hotels! I noticed that the Westin offers free dining for kids under 12 at their pool-side restaurant if a parent is ordering off the menu -- sounds like a pretty good deal to me, and far better choice than the food court at Whaler's Village...where, by the way, vendors have become quite aggressive as they attempt to sell you pearls and timeshares. We came here many times having to watch every penny. We could have chosen to go somewhere less expensive, but to us,it was worth the self-discipline to experience paradise. It's tiresome to read countless slams against hotels simply because of frustrations due to the rigors of penny-pinching. Most of us have been there and done that; to let it overpower the experience seems counter-productive. I've only been here 24 hours, and haven't seen a bug, let alone a cockroach. I'll definitely report it if I do, but for anyone to think the Westin Maui is cockroach-infested would be disingenuous. It's a bit crowded, a tad understaffed and didn't open just last year, but we've already spoken to other families who could affford to go anywhere on the Islands and keep coming back to the Westin. It's lovely, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back to the Westin Maui Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: JetSet1
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Westin. We stayed there from 8/1-8/5 then moved on to the Grand Wailea for another 5 days. At the end of our stay I almost wanted to cancel our room at the Grand Wailea and stay at the Westin but I didn't. Minuses: 1. The pools attract people from nearby hotels and resorts and they don't seem to do much to enforce the "guests only" rule. 2. There are not enough lounge chairs to accommodate everyone. You have to get up early and claim your chair each morning if you want a good shady spot. One day my husband and I had one empty lounge chair next to us and a Japanese family of 9 shared it for about an hour!! There were 5 talkative adults and 4 children congregated beside and behind us--it was an uncomfortable and loud experience. When they left another family of 5 came and shared the one lounge chair!! On our other side there were two empty lounge chairs that were left unused by two women for at least 2 hours--again, nothing done to enforce the no saving lounge chairs for more than 1/2 hour rule. 3. No water coolers allowed by the pool. They have a water dispenser near the pool but who knows how clean that is or if it's tap water or what. We brought a very small cooler to fit about 4 small bottles of water and they took it away from us. They kept it for us behind the activities desk but we had to walk up to them and ask for our own water whenever we wanted more. Pluses: 1. Gorgeous view from our ocean view deluxe room close enough to the ocean that we could hear the surf crashing on the shore as long as the pool and pond waterfalls were not on. 2. Excellent Service: far better service here at the Westin than at the Grande Wailea!! Pamela at the concierge desk really helped to make our trip more enjoyable-recommending great restaurants and activities with a smile!! 3. Location! Easy walking distance to Whaler's village for shops, restaurants, and a food court where you can get very reasonably priced food if you just want something cheap and quick like breakfast for $5 or a sald for lunch for $8. Also a really short drive to Lahaina for more shops and more restaurants and water activities. 4. Comfortable beds and pillows. Our room at the Grand Wailea was much larger and had nicer furniture but after my first night at Grand Wailea I woke up with an aching back and a stiff neck. The "Heavenly" beds really are wonderful. 5. The Spa!! The Grand Wailea Spa is world class but I had a better experience and massage therapist was just as good at the Westin. The massage tables in the couples massage room is state of the art--it adjusts and elevates your kneess with the push of a button by the massage therapist! We really enjoyed ourselves there and once we have children we will definitely be coming back to the Westin Maui but for a romantic getaway, I wished it could have been a little more quiet during our pool lounge time. Tip: if you lounge at the pool in the morning up until 11:00 am you won't hear as many children. They tend to come out in crowds at every resort (here as well as at the Grand Wailea) right before or around lunch time.

Reviews.Title: “Give and Take”
Reviews.Author: pizando
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is not for everyone and anyone. Lets start with the good points. The pool is the selling point in my books for anyone staying along the strip of Ka'anapali. The main pool is however crowded and finding a lounge chair after 8AM is tough. You are better off using the adult only pool if you can handle alot of traffic lateral of the pool because of the pool slides. Service was decent however it is not 5 star folks. The Westin will charge your room 17.50 each night you stay there as a "Service Resort Charge" I felt that was ludicrus since they were charging me 6.00 service fee 3.00 tip fee on top of that for Room service The service was average at best. My suggestion is not to eat at the hotel or plan to eat at the hotel. The restraunts are nothing to write home about and very pricey. Your best bet is to walk 50 feet to Whalers Village and eat at the food court for half the price. Remember the restraunt Lei'lanni's. Its the best restraunt in the area and its right next door to the westin. As for the bad points. We travelled with 19 family members. 4 total families. My room personally I was very dissappointed with. We stayed in the "Upgraded" Mountain View room. Upon arrival I felt I was going in a jack in a box. The rooms are VERY VERY small. Considering we had 1 infant staying with myself and the wife, we were pressed for space. We found our sheets to be dirty and later found a blood stain on the flat sheet. We were not happy at all since we already had our 7 month old playing on the bed. We asked them to change the sheets and they did relatively fast. Fruthermore later in the day we found the sheets they replaced the dirty ones to be food stained also. Incredible is all I had to say. On top of this the bell boy sent one of our suitcases to the wrong room and I had to walk down mayself to retrieve it. The hotel was clean to the look however the floor is very dated and old. Stains everywhere, cracks and rips along the carpet and walls made the hotel look motel 6ish. This is not what I had expected paying 400+$ a night. My parents stayed in the Ocean Tower/Full ocean view, the 2nd best room the westin has to offer at 900+$ a night. Their room is exactly what I had expected at the price I paid(400+$) Their room was about 700SqFt and had alot less foot traffic because of the location. Bottom line - If you are travelling with Kids, the Westin Maui is the best alternative on Maui due to the Day care they offer, the swimming pools and the atmosphere of 5 million other kids screaming and running around at a modest price(excluding Full Ocean Rooms) If you are travelling with your significant other, on a honeymoon, trying to get away from the "real world" on vacation to relax, I would avoid the Westin at all costs. By the way, I was propositioned about 20 times by timeshare propaganda while at the Westin, I got quite peeved at that.

Reviews.Title: “Great property!”
Reviews.Author: jsimon816
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 4 nights/5days. Prior to booking my trip at this hotel I spend countless hours reading the reviews of this and neighboring hotels in Kaanapali. The only advise I can give you is go with your first instinct. The more reviews I read, the more confusing I became. The biggest thing is to remember who is writing these reviews ie. families, honeymooners etc. For me an my finacee this was the perfect spot. The hotel is beautiful with its open-air lobby. Great pools which at times were over populated with children. I would recomend the adults only pool which is quiet enogh to read a book or just relax. Also, a full service bar is only steps away. As far as the rooms go, we stayed in an ocean-view room on the 9th floor. The room had everything you needed; oversized bed, interenet access, fridge and safe. The room was clean but not spotless. The actual time we spent in the room awake was minimal. Housekeeping made sure there were an ample supply of towels & bottles water in the room. We dined at all the outlets at the resort. Tropica is a great place to have dinner, located right at the beach with a great view of the sunset. Overpriced like all restaurant on the island, the food was great and had a reasonable selection of entrees. For breakfast I would recommend eating at the coffee stand, it offers fruit, bagels, yogurt etc. Eating a full sit-down breakfest at the restaurant will run you about $45 each day with the buffet costing $22 a person. Overall the hotel was a great value and was located close to everything in West Maui. It had a good mix of families & young couples which we are. In addition, the spa is a great additional to the hotel. I would definetly recommend the couples message.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: LunaC
Reviews.Content: What an incredible stay at the Westin! My husband, 2 daughters (15 & 13) and myself spent a week at the Westin in the Beach Tower in a Premium Ocean View room. Rooms - While the rooms are said to be small, we were quite comfortable. At check-in, the desk clerk did say that the room type did have a little more space than a regular room. We also had a king w/ a pull out and got a roll away, that did make it a little tight getting to the balcony. The bathroom was much larger than I expected. Pool - The pool temp was comfortable. If you are sitting in the sun for a little while, you will find it refreshing. My husband spent almost all day in it. While the chairs do stay pretty full, the pool never feels crowded. It's huge! There are also areas that attract parents with young children, and other that have older children so you can kind of gauge where you would like to sit. There is even an adult only pool (16 yrs.+). Get out early to get a chair, getting under an umbrella is almost impossible. The pool attendents do their best at making sure people aren't leaving their stuff and taking off for hours. Chairs seem to turn over around 2:00 so you can probably get one then. Food - Did the breakfast buffet once, overpriced. We stuck w/ the continental breakfast (Starbucks coffee & nice ham & cheese croissants, etc.) Ono's is good service & food, very fresh, nice salads, too. Our first evening there we ate their tapas menu and I really liked it. Go to Tropica's! We went our last night there. Terrific selection and great view. It gets a little windy there so bring a sweater. Location - So glad we chose the Westin over the Sheraton. The Westin is right next to Whaler's Village and we walked over there to the ABC store almost everyday for something. Great little stores at Whaler's Village. DH walked over to the Sheraton pool and said he was not impressed, smaller pool. I did not see it myself. I think I covered about everything. I never like to vacation in the same place twice but I would definately stay at the Westin again. I'm sure we will make an exception and go to Maui in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work but lots of pluses”
Reviews.Author: mike1318
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Westin Maui 3 times over a 9 year period. Our last stay was May 2006 Postives Pool Area is Great Location, Location, Location Great Staff Whaler's Village Lot happening in the area Boats on the beach for cruises Negatives Rooms are BADLY in need or remodel Restaurants so/so Very busy place Kanaapali beach was very dirty! Amazing since it as voted best beach in the world! When we first stayed at the Westin Maui in 1998 it was really a nice place. When we stayed in 2005 we were upgraded to the best suite in the hotel so it was nice but probably masking the overall quality of the hotel. When we stayed in 2006, we still had a premeire suite but were stunned at the condition of the room. Our room was truly in bad condition. It needs a major upgrade NOW. Carpets dirty, bathroom old and drain clogged, furnishings old. We had a suite that overlooks Whaler's Village and the ocean. It was very loud with all the deliveries to the Village. I would strongly recommend staying on the other side of the hotel. The decks are large and very nice. The pool area is great, clean and with very good service. The pool area is very busy with lots of kids and lots of people watching so my wife would say it is not relaxing. They have a large waterslide that they allowed our 6 and 4 years old to go on so they loved it. The lack of a hot tub for kids is a big MINUS. The weather was not great so our kids turned blue with cold. Fortunately the helpful staff allowed our kids into the adult hot tub to warm up. Kanaapali beach was disappoiting. The storms have eroded the beach so much that it is now very steep. The beach was covered with cigarette butts and trash. Really not the hotel's problem but noteworthy. The Westin's location is the best on Maui. It is right next to Whaler's village and has a spectacular view of the boat cruises, boats, Molokai, and Lanai. There, in general, is a lot of activity and things happening here. Whaler's Village is nice. It has basically the same stores as the Shops at Wailea but is much better. For one, it is right on the beach and has 3 restaurants where you can enjoy the view. Granted their not great for food but they're ok and have great atmosphere but be prepared to wait. The Hula grill is the best of these. They also have fast food, which is great for the kids, ice cream, coffee, and a nice hula show every other night. Lahaina is a short drive away. IF the Westin evere reads these reviews -remodel now and add a hot tub for people under 16 As they say Location, Location, Location and you can't find a better one.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lbgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 days at the Westin Maui. We usually stay at the Hyatt and thought we would try the Westin this time. Our first impression was a good one. The lobby with the flamingos and swans is probably the nicest in Kaanapali. We had a lei greeting and there was juice and cold towels which is very much appreciated after traveling. The gentleman who checked us in was very nice and upgraded us to a deluxe ocean view room from the partial ocean room that we had reserved. We were on the 5th floor of the Beach Tower with lovely views of the pools and ocean. We had reserved two beds because we had our 5 year old with us and they gave us a room with one king. We called down and they sent up a rollaway at no extra charge. The room was nothing special. The artwork was sparse and the furniture nothing special. Plastic curtains. The rack rate on this room was $650 - $750 and certainly not worth it. The heavenly bed was very comfortable, but a bit too much bed for the tropics. For the price of the rooms I expected better housekeeping. Our room was cleaned, but not straightened up and basically the covers on the bed were just pulled up and the pillows thrown on. Because it was summer vacation, the resort - all of Kaanapali actually was quite crowded. We had trouble finding chairs by the pool and forget finding chairs in the shade unless you stake your claim early in the morning. The adult only pool is very nice and much quieter - it feels like a different resort there. The beach is nice but we were told that it was $5 to rent a lounge chair for the beach which we felt was unfair considering you are already paying a $18 resort fee. Our son went to the Kids Kamp and loved it although it is pricey. Whaler's Village is right next door but iit is a zoo. Hula Grill is nice for lunch - much more crowded at night. We loved running/walking on the boardwalk every morning in front of the hotels and the gym is new and included in the price of the resort fee as is internet. All in all I don't think we will go back to the Westin. It's been twelve years since I have been to Kaanapali and it's just too crowded now - especially with all the new timeshares. I think we will try other areas and other islands.

Reviews.Title: “Roach infested - awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: aleongro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my honeymoon and it was a true disappointment. Our room wasn't ready on arrival and we have to settle for a two full-beds instead of a king size one. They change us to a king bed for our second day, so we couldn't really unpack and unwind on our first night. The hallway was quite run down and the carpet must be at least 10 yrs old. The room was infested with roaches and after complaining with the front desk, I was told that Hawaii is a tropical island and that I should expect to see roaches. On the third night the roaches were crawling on the bed. The front desk offered to change rooms, but could not guarantee the new room would be roach free and it would mean a third different room to pack an unpack for, so we declined. In the end they comped us a meal and one of the seven nights we stayed there, but only after speaking to two different managers and them being quite condescending even making a big deal of how much that one night costs an we were getting credit for. And that is my point, no one should pay $350+ a night to sleep with roaches and get an attitude from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were privileged to spend thirteen days at this magnificent resort. We stayed here three years ago and came back again. Thw Westin Maui has the most ideal location on Ka'anapali Beach. Besides a tropical wonderland, with views that take your breath away, the staff is helpful, the restaurants are memorable, and the pool is roomy and gorgeous. We visited each resort along this infamous beach. They are all spectacular and inviting, but the Westin Maui is our favorite. If we are lucky to return again, we will book The Westin. You will be awestruck when you arrive, and so sad when you depart. A few suggestions: Surf lessons at The Hula Surf School in Lahaina....great! Dinner at Longhi's..ask for "Tan Dan" the waiter. Request a table upstairs overlooking the ocean at sunset. Wow! For Fun....the Hula Grill restaurant...steps away from The Westin Leilani's Restaurant...steps away from The Westin A restaurant to remember..The Plantation House in Kapalua...call for reservations, and be there for sunset. Also serves breakfast which is supposed to be incredible Almost forgot...Cheesburger in Paradise in Lahaina..Eat upstairs over the ocean. Music, views and a burger to remember. Wish I was there. Maui is paradise for all. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at the Westin for my honeymoon. I read a lot of the negative reviews here before I went, so I was a little leery, especially since I admit to being a pretty high maintenance, picky hotel guest. Here is the lowdown: Positives: We had a big room in the Ocean Tower on the second floor. It had a full ocean view (which was an upgrade since we booked a garden-view). The front desk clerk was very gracious. The Westin lobby is definitely a little Disneyland-ish, with the parrots and flamingoes. Same goes for the pools, which were beautiful and not cold at all--they were actually warmer than the ocean. I am not much of a pool person, but these were very inviting. The beach out front is great, definitely the best on Kanapaali Beach. We never really ate at the hotel, although we did have drinks at the pool bar, which were pretty good. Having Whaler's Village next door was a huge plus--we liked Hula Grill and Leilani's (hated the Rusty Harpoon), and we had some breakfasts and lunches at the food court, which was a great way to save money. There were a lot of kids at the hotel, but that seemed true for all the hotels on Kanaapali Beach. In fact, there were a lot of people EVERYWHERE on Kanaapali Beach. When we went to the pool, we spent most of our time in the adults pool, which was never crowded. Negatives: It was hard for us to get side by side chairs at the pool before 4 p.m. We were NEVER able to get an umbrella at the beach--we counted 13 umbrellas for the entire hotel. The beach attendant told me that he started renting them at 8, and by 8:20 they were all gone. This put a damper on things, as my husband burns very easily, so we had to really limit our time at the beach. Housekeeping wasn't great. Our room was always clean, but all they did was clean the bathroom and make the bed. Nothing was ever straightened up. I ironed the first night, and the ironing board and iron stayed out for days, the maid never put them away. Room service was very slow as well. CHOOSING BETWEEN THE HYATT AND THE WESTIN: This was a big dilemma for me, so here is my opinion: The Hyatt did seem a little more quiet, the pools were just as nice, and so was the lobby. The grounds seemed more expansive, but that was not an issue for me. No idea what the rooms are like there. For me, it came down to beach and convenience. The Hyatt has virtually no sand beach in front, and a few couples we met from there told us that they walked down to the Westin to go to the beach every day. Also, the Hyatt is furthest from Whaler's Village. Having it next door was very convenient for us, as we could just pop over anytime for less expensive food and beverages. If the beach and the convenience don't matter to you, you'd probably like the Hyatt better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Atrium”
Reviews.Author: Ladyhawke
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. My favorite part was getting up early (which was easy, considering we are from California and due to the time difference--are naturally up before dawn) and seeing the birds sleeping in the atrium trees before daybreak. The whole lobby was beautiful. My son loved the pools because there is a hidden grotto (a jacuzzi underneath a waterfall) and I have to confess to having a great time finding it myself. We had a lovely ocean view over the pool area. I loved walking around the beach at sunset and listening to the sounds of the Hyatt luau in the distance. It was also convenient to be directly next to Whaler's Village (which includes the Whaling museum). We never ended up eating at the hotel because we were always over at the fantastic restaurants on the beach in the village, though I heard other guests saying the food was good. I found the heavenly beds incredibly comfy and the service great. I love Westin hotels in general and tend to pick them when we travel, but this is definitely one of my favorite Starwood properties in the islands, second only to the Princeville on Kauai (only due to location--Kauai is my favorite island). On Maui, the Westin is for us :).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - Not up to Westin Name”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Maui for 5 nights (6/18-6/23/2006) as part of our island-hopping honeymoon 2 weeks ago. I was utterly disappointed in the Westin for having put their nameplate on this hotel. It is simply not up to par with the 7 or 8 other Westins I have stayed at nationwide - period. To be fair, the lobby is very nice, and in a "punch you in the face" over-the-top way, much like the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the big island. Lots of waterfalls, koi ponds, amazing pools, etc. But unfortunately, that's where the quality ended, as far as I'm concerned. As soon as you get in the elevators and make your way to the guest rooms, it is painfully obvious that this is an older property that Westin bought and has put their name on. The walls are very beat up, covered with vinyl wallpaper, all of the outside corners of the wall in the rooms and the hallways have this cheesy plastic angle-bracket material on them in an attempt to cover up the thrashed drywall on the corners. Our bathroom tub had a drain that simply didn't drain, and the tub was clearly the beat-up original one from the old hotel. The wallpaper in our room was peeling off all over the place, and the desktop was all gouged up. I would put the level of quality on par with a lower-priced Mariott property - not a Westin. I should say in all fairness that in areas where the Westin clearly had done completely new construction, like the workout facility, those areas were of disntinctly normal Westin quality. It almost drew more attention to the shortcomings of the rest of the hotel, however - the fit and finish on the Westin-built sections was drastically different. I've stayed at plenty of other Westin properties nationwide, and have always looked forward to staying at one when I have had the chance on business. This property was an absolute letdown, I'm sorry to say. The food was mediocre at best at the poolside restaurant, and the place was crawling with screaming kids - it was like an amusement park. I'm not saying that kids are a bad thing, but the acoustics in the pool area/lobby are terrible - it's like an echo chamber. Conversely, we stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Poipu on Kauai for a week after that, and there were just as may kids there, and you hardly noticed them. It was easy to get away to a relaxing spot, and the fit and finish of the hotel was worlds better. Granted, we started the trip out with a week at the Four Seasons Hualalai, so my level of comparison was possibly skewed, but even the Hyatt was orders of magnitude nicer for about the same money - and for nearly $400 a night, I would expect to see no peeling wallpaper in my room. That is straight-up Holiday Inn. Overall, I think Westin should change the name of the hotel and maybe put a "powered by Westin" logo on there or something, because as a standalone Westin resort, it is simply just not up there with the rest of the Westin chain.

Reviews.Title: “Had a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: mauijunkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin on a vacation package through Starwood since we are members. This was our 3rd trip to Maui, having previously stayed at Embassy Suites and Sheraton. We had a mountain view room, which essentially looked out over the parking lot. Not a problem since you are in Maui and not spending a whole lot of time in your room. We did not hear any noise from the parking lot at night and we were on the 3rd floor. The room was spotless and appeared well maintained. I did not think the room was small at all. Plenty of room for all of our things in the armoire and we had packed for a 10 day stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We were asked to attend a timeshare presentation but declined and it was laft at that, no pushiness at all. Liked the hotel so much that we are planning on another trip in 2008. I can see why there are complaints about the lack of seating at the pool. My thought is you are at one of the best beaches in the world, whay hang out at the pool? We did go by the adult pool one afternoon and did not have trouble finding a chair so maybe it is just near the kids pool area. Also the pool was a pleasant temperature since I tried it to see what everyone was complaing about. Maybe the complaints are from the time that there was a prpane shortage on Maui and the resort pools weren't being heated as a conservation measure, hardly the hotels fault. All and all we were very happy with our stay and are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Returned a few days ago from the beautiful island of Maui. It was our first trip to the islands and a positive one at that. Upon arrival at the Westin we were not able to find a parking space in the lot. This happened 3 out of the 6 days we were there. Each time we let the valet area know and were given complimentary valet parking. (You will need to review your bill at check out as we were charged but it was removed upon notification). This was a special trip to Maui for my husband's 50th birthday and we also took our 11 yr old son along. I like the heavenly bed/bath with Westin and noticed when we checked in there were no bathrobes (a little detail no big thing but again they were brought to the room when requested). When I made reservations I selected the Premium Deluxe Ocean View Room and requested to be on as high a floor as possible (to get the best view). I also mentioned wanting to be able to view the sunsets. We were on the 10th floor (of 11 in our building). About the only complaint I have is that I specifically wanted us to be able to sit on the lanai in the evening to watch the sunset and have a glass of wine. Our room was not in the direction of the evening sun so that was not possible. I would have been able to upgrade for $257 more to a room that would allow this but didn't see the value in it after already paying a higher rate for the Prem. Deluxe. The room was in line with the Westin reputation and met our expectations. The maid even left wine glasses for us after seeing a bottle of wine sit out the first day. The breakfast buffet, although a little pricey ($25 pp-but kids eat free with each paying adult) was good. The selection and quality of food was good. When we travel we like to get off the beaten path some and experience where the locals eat. The concierge recommended several places. To name a couple: Java Jazz-quaint, eclectic place for dinner, Aloha Mixed Plate-great place for inexpensive dinner. We ate at the hotel restaurants quite a bit as with our 35% discount on food it was comparable to other places around us and equally as good. We ate lunch one day at the Hula Grill (on the beach) which is at the Whaler's Village, just a short walk from the hotel. Food was good-no complaints. One of our more enjoyable and least expensive meals was on the drive back to the airport the evening we were leaving. It is called Da Kitchen (just minutes from the OGG airport). Small, locals hang out--large portions, very good food, great service! We did go to a luau--the Old Lahaina on Front Street. We took the trolley (for $1 pp as stated in previous reviews). The trolley stops running at 7pm though and the luau isn't over until 8:45. Knowing this beforehand I planned for us to take a taxi back to the hotel (cost was $11.50). Small price to pay for not having to bother with parking or for those who might imbibe too much. As for the luau, I chose the table seating (recommended). One side of the table we were placed at faced the hot evening sun which wasn't pleasant but the sun goes down within a couple of hours of getting there. You're only facing it directly for a portion of that time as you are walking around looking at the arts and crafts and watching them uncover the imu. The food was okay (certainly didn't get $250 worth for the 3 of us but when food is mass produced like that your expectations are not the same). I guess we could have drunk from the open bar but it just didn't appeal to us. The show was entertaining--dancers were talented. Back to the hotel--our son loved the aquatic playground. There are 2 water slides (one for older kids and adults, the other for much younger kids). Each morning at 9am they have slide races and the winner gets a free huge snow cone made at the pool side Sea Dogs. They also have 3 pt. contests at the basketball goal in the pool. Winner gets a snow cone or if it's an adult you get a free drink. The hotel was not overly crowded as I had expected for the time of year we went. You do need to get out before 9am for best chair selection by the pool (as stated in previous reviews). The water was cool initially upon entering (80 degrees) and would warm up to 84 during the day. We did not venture out from the hotel to sight see. This trip was to relax and do nothing and that was what we did. We found it extremely relaxing and quite near perfect (remember not being able to see the sunset)! We figured we could sight see the next time we're back there. Would definitely recommend the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My gf and I stayed 7 nights from June 7-14 and it was fantastic!! We arrived b4 check in time, but the front desk found us a room quickly. Had a room in the Ocean Tower over the parking lot... not as noisy as some suggested except for some construction... but not bad at all. The breakfast buffet was fantastic!! Best I've had (free for 2 everyday w/ Pleasant Holidays)! Room was decent size, with space in TV to hang 6-8 items, no closet. The Bed was very comfortable! Housekeeping did accidently "misplace" my gf's swim suit bottoms, which were never found, and a Manager took care of it after 4 days. The grounds are beautiful!! With a party of 4 or more, get a pool side seat b4 10:30!! 4 or less, your good all day. Adult pool fills up fast though. The pools/slides/grotto/waterfalls are amazing!! If you are younger looking, bring your ID everywhere if you want a drink... they ID. Beer $6, Mai-Tai etc. $9. The poolside servers were prompt. TIP TO EATING IN MAUI: Make reservations anywhere and eat before 7 p.m. to avoid rushing servers and meals, cuz it gets busy!! Roy's in Kahana Center was "A+ seafood." Meals at hotel are a bit expensive and not bad, but will work in a crunch. Safeway in Lahaina Center is good for snacks and lunches and many restaurants along the beach close buy, all about the same price. Great snorkeling about 300 yards away, at Black Rock. Can rent snorkels at beach or close by at Snorkel Bob's for half the price and WAY better equip. CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK MAUI, AND TO THE WESTIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: 2anj
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort hotel. Fabulous pools that weren't too crowded at any time. The beach is lovely and the situation right next to Whalers village is good. We had breakfast a few mornings in the Rusty Harpoon which was good. The bedroom was comfortable albeit a bit small. We had booked a Mountain View room which also overlooked the car park. If you can get an Ocean View I expect it would be better. We dodn't eat much in the hotel. Restaurants in Whalers Village were Ok but nothing to shout about. By far the best meal we had on Maui was at Mamas Fish house at Pai'a. The food, service and location of Mamas made it a truly wonderful experience. If I return to Maui, I would definitely think about going back to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 6 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. This was our third time at the Westin, my husband refuses to stay anywhere else. We traveled with our 8 year old son and he could not get enough of the pool and waterslide! Yes, there were some kids but I don't think it was terribly crowded with children, there is also an adult only pool and hot tub if you want to get away from the kids. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, we booked a partial oceanview room and were upgraded to a full ocean view room overlooking the entire resort, pools, beach and with a fabulous view of Molokai and Lanai. The beds are really comfortable, the room is not too big but why would you spend much time in your room anyway when you are visiting paradise! We enjoyed the beautiful sunsets from our balcony at night. My son loved to feed the koi fish and swans every morning. The food can get a little pricey at the hotel so we stocked up on snacks, fruit, drinks etc at the Safeway in Lahaina and kept them in our small refrigerator in our room and took them to the pool during the day. The beach in front of the hotel is very nice, not too crowded like the one in front of the Sheraton where we went to snorkel a couple of times. The Whalers Village and Shops next door is very convenient, you can also buy snacks and drinks at the ABC store in the Village. We like to eat at Leilani's and the Rusty Harpoon but the buffet breakfast at the hotel is great to have at least once. Kimo's and Lahaina Fish Company in downtown Lahaina have great fish if you want to get away for dinner. I am already looking forward to our next trip, can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: brauns
Reviews.Content: westin maui resort and spa is an amazing place for families and honeymooners alike. We have 2 kids, almost 4 and almost 7 and spent 6 nights on a perfect vacation. Beautiful pools with wonderful waterslides, great beaches, a boardwalk, a mall next door. These are the ingredients for a great vacation on Maui. We had a car and explored a bit. Went to Napili Beach but the waves were for surfers. Kaanapali is great beach. Lahaina is great to walk around shop and dine. Went on a snorkel trip Four Winds II. Many folks were sea sick so be prepared. Lots of time to snorkel in Molokini. $300 for 4 including 2 kids was a bit steep. Went parasailing with 6 yr old and we loved it!!! Sheraton SUnsetting ceremony is neat for 1st timers. Maui is definitely high class compared to Mexico and is also more expensive. Easy 5 hr flight from LA.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: LauraIsela
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our two girls 12 and 9 had a fabulous time at the Westin(5/28 to 6/2)! The pool was the best for the kids. Slide was so entertaining. The goal of this trip was nothing but R and R and we got it. Everything we needed was right at our fingertips. Concierge was great helping us make reservations for dinner. We never had to wait more than 15 min for a pool chair and the beach was just a hop away. We charged most meals to our room so we never had to carry our wallets. Food was extremely pricey but good. Must try the Seafood Paella at Tropica. It was delicious!!! The rooms were small, but cozy for the family. The bathroom shower curtain did smell a little mildewy but I was so relaxed that it really didn't matter at the time. This was a perfect setting for a family serious about getting Relaxed. It was kid friendly but in such a controlled environment. I would highly recommend to anyone with kids. Classy place and professional friendly staff. BTW- Starwood villa timeshares were tempting.. but found many resales on net for thousands less.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyFoot
Reviews.Content: I am sooo glad that we kept an open mind when reading all of the reviews posted. We spent four nights at the Westin Maui (May 22-26). As we were on our honeymoon, we were upgraded from a garden view to a partial ocean view in the Beach Tower. We were also given a bottle of champagne and candy on our first night's stay. It's true the consierge did try to schedule us to attend a westin time share tour. We weren't pressured at all. We told them we had activities booked for our remaining time and received no pressure. The pool was wonderful. It was huge and very clean. Although there was a water slide, only about one quarter of the users were children. I didn't see an over abundance of children at this resort at all. The buffet breakfast was much better than many other four star hotels we've been to. It wasn't that crowded either. We also enjoyed a very nice dinner at Tropico on our last night. The rooms were large and very clean and we had no problem with room service. The location of the Westin next to Whaler's Village is a big plus. Whaler's Village has many shops, restaurants and a food court. I would recommend this hotel to anyone (including honeymooners). Our only complaint about Maui was the daily traffic going throuh Lahaina. This made travel outside of the resort area a real aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: funsandiego
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean front room in the Beach Tower. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful. However, the entire hotel is in dire need of renovatioh. Although our room had a lovely view, the carpet was dirty and stained and the furniture worn. The hotel is geared to families with small children and to conventions. Reebok was having a convention there - need I say more? We didn't use the pool because it was overrun with small children so we utilized the beach instead. We rented a cabana each day for the entire day and could come and go as we pleased which was really nice. The food is cafeteria quality and pricey, but I found this to be true throughout most of Maui. The Tropico Restaurant at the hotel is a nice place for sunset dinner, music and people watching. The concierge does try to talk you into attending a timeshare for the Westin Villas which we declined but she was pretty persistent. Also, our package included a portrait but all the dates and times were already filled so were never able to get our portrait. Overall the staff was very nice and it was a pleasant stay. A word of caution if you have small children - the ocean currents are very strong.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about choosing the Westin especially after some of the reviews I read but all in all we had a fabulous time. We stayed on Maui for our honeymoon 5 years ago at the Hyatt which is just up the beach from the Westin. Comparing it to the Hyatt I would have to say there are definately a lot more kids at the Westin then the Hyatt. We felt that we were one of the few couples without a baby or small child at the breakfast buffet. So I was happy that we weren't on our honeymoon because it is not nearly as quiet and romantic as the Hyatt was. We did find the rooms to be a little small but that really wasn't such a problem since we spent most of the day outside the hotel room. The pools were great- they were never over crowded and we always found a chair. We did the sunset dinner for two which was one of the most romantic dinners I've ever shared with my husband. Although if you do set it up (we did through our travel agent) check with "service express" since no one at the desk or the concierge had any idea what we were talking about. I also highly recommend the spa- my husband and I did the couples massage- poolside and it was great! There was no one around the massage area and it was nice and quiet. Also- just a tip- if you go to the concierge be forewarned that they will try to talk you into going to the villas/time share presentation. Which is fine if you want to spend 2 hours of your vacation looking at a pricey time share. We opted not to do it but they basically pressured us to go the tour when we stopped to ask where the doctor's office was located.

Reviews.Title: “Too crowded, overrun w/kids, not good for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Big mistake for honeymoon. Room overpriced and small. View lousy. Kids in the hot tub and all over the place -- parents taking advantage of daily free brunch for children under 12, no doubt. Surfer bum slept in hallway outside hotel room on our final night. Parking lot always full. Long waits to talk to staff. Spa was terrific, but, on the whole, not appropriate for romantic retreat. More of a family spot, w/busy day at Disneyland as model. Couples w/o kids, stay away. Parents, this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great resort”
Reviews.Author: parrothead1691
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review when we returned around the 14th of April but haven't seen it posted, so pardon me for being redundant if it appears. I had to write because we LOVED the Westin. My husband and I went without kids for 7 nights. After reading reviews, I was expecting a dated property and dated rooms. I am not sure where that came from because the resort was top notch. In fact, I am glad we chose this resort over the Hyatt or Sheraton because the Hyatt lacks a decent beach, and the Sheraton has an overly crowded beach due to Black Rock, a snorkeling destination. The Westin is just steps away from Whaler's Village with plenty of shopping and restaurants. It is minutes away by car from Lahaina. Rooms are lovely, well appointed, nice size bathroom with granite, refrigerator replenished with 2 bottles of water daily, the Heavenly bed...what more can I say? I would say the only downside is this place is overrun with children. I compared it to an elementary school playground. I would estimate 90% of guests were families. Also bear in mind, this was the week prior to Easter. It was very difficult to get a chair by the pool. The Westin didn't heed to the 30-minute unattended chair rule. However, guests took advantage of this rule themselves, can't say I blame them. I thought the Westin pool was nicer than the Hyatt (the Hyatt is ranked #1 pool) although the Hyatt has a better pool area for the 6 and under set. Breakfast buffet was excellent, we ate all other meals off the property so I can't comment on that. Overall, I would highly recommend this resort. If you are honeymooners or looking for a tranquil resort, this may not be it as I was astounded by the number of kids (but this seemed to be Maui in general, not exclusive to the Westin). If you are disappointed with this resort, then you probably won't be happy anywhere. Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin: The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: vizli
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of taking our Hawaii vacation just after the monsoons ended and even then, the weather wasn't the prototypical sunny every moment of every day we had expected. With that said, the Westin is a beautiful resort. Is it expensive? Of course, its Maui. But I felt that the facilities were first rate. My bed WAS heavenly and my wife loved the spa. The view from my veranda was great and I did not think the place was too busy. Also, Tropica, the best restaurant at the Westin, was first rate and gave us a spectacular view of a sunset right from our table on the outside deck. Also, the Westin is centrally located on Kaanapali Beach. While the Hyatt appeared to be more plush, its beach was tiny and it too far away from the rest of the strip. Now the bad. The pools WERE freezing. I am a hardy soul and I thought they were ricidulously cold. I can't believe that the water could ever be so cold in Hawaii. It absolutely ruined any thought of cooling off when it finally got hot. If they are always so cold, they should be heated. Only kids were crazy enough to stay in for any extended time. Would I go back? To Maui , definitely. To The Westin, maybe but only if the pool temperture situation is resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: tddn
Reviews.Content: Our trip was April 8-17. We stayed at Westin Resort first 6 days using starpoints. We had 2 oceanfront rooms in Ocean Tower the older part hotel. Rooms were nice & clean. I can see how 4 people staying in one room would be a problem as rooms are smalll & only have armoire for storage. But by having 2 the four of us were fine. (I wish the Westin chain would ditch double beds & just get queens & kings) If you are paying would go for Beach Tower. Refrig in room can hold milk & juices etc no problem. Yes pools are cold (my son was told not heated due to propane shortage ?) Kids liked slides at pools, hotel grounds are nice. Gym is small & young kids in there early mornings (shouldn't be). We ate at Tropica one night food very good. Kids (12 & under) eat free with adults at Ono (even breakfast buffet), only had lunch & breakfast food was fine. Service slow. My husband used spa twice with no more than calling night before was able to book appointment for next morning. Whaler's Village next store is good, ABC store has anything you could need. Ate at Leilani's food was good, nothing special. This hotel was crowded with families. We stayed here because we had our kids and knew they would like pool. If it was just my husband and I we wouldn't choose a hotel that lists "waterpark". I don't understand how people book this hotel who don't have kids then complain it's a waterpark when hotel clearly states that it has one. I would recommend this hotel it's close to alot of things but would note Kaanapali is a windy part of island.

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTr0tter05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the latter part of our honeymoon at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. Our experience started out on the wrong foot. We came from the beautiful Grand Hyatt, Kaua'i, where we were treated extremely well. We got to Maui and were immediately disappointed with the service at the front desk. There was no, "Congratulations, Mr. and Mrs. So and So." Instead the lady at the front desk acted as though we were disturbing her. She was obviously new, but there was still no excuse for her attitude. We asked to be upgraded to an oceanview room because we were successful in having our request met at the two previous hotels we stayed at (Sheraton Moana Surfrider, Oahu and Grand Hyatt, Kaua'i). The answer was, "I wish I could do that, but because you guys booked through a travel agent, and got such a low price, we can't upgrade you. Next time you should try booking directly through our website." We were shocked by this response. A simple, "No, we can't accommodate your request" would have been just fine. Instead, she made us feel as though we were not spending enough money to be treated well. Besides, our package was far from cheap. We didn't say much at that point, trying to not let her spoil our honeymoon. Then she gave us the keys to our room, and didn't even bother to explain that there are two sets elevators and that we should head towards to elevators on the left. Needless to say, we went to the wrong elevators. After we got to what was supposed to be our floor and realized that our room wasn't accessible from this part of the hotel, we became really upset. We called the hotel manager and told her the story. She was very apologetic and offered us a $200 credit towards the room. So our issue was resolved, but it wasn't a very nice way to start off the week. The rest of our time at the Westin was pleasant. The hotel is nice. The lobby is beautiful with Flamingos and waterfalls, it is quite the sight. The pool was always freezing cold, so we spent most of our time on the beach or in the hot tub. The area around the pool is beautiful. The chez lounges are wooden and not cheap plastic, like at some of the other hotels. The drinks are very good, though very expensive. We met a lot of other honeymooners, which was nice. There were quite a few kids at this hotel, but they weren't too loud. It's true that the rooms are a little small, but they're very tastefully decorated. Plus, how much time does anyone actually spend in their room? Overall, we loved the area the hotel was located in. Lahaina is very close by, and we went there on most nights for dinner. The restaurants at the Westin were great for breakfast and lunch, but for dinner you must go out. Maui has a lot of great restaurants. Specifically, I would recommend David and Paul's, Royâ€™s and Cheeseburger in Paradise. If you like sushi, there is a great sushi restaurant right next to the Ritz Carlton, though I have forgotten the name. We also loved the sunset sail cruise, snorkeling tour and haleakala is a must see. If you do decide to wake up at 2 am and drive 2 hours to get to the top of this 10,000 foot moutain, make sure you ask the hotel for blankets or bring some warm clothing. It tends to be very cold up there (37 degrees). If we went back to Maui again, we wouldn't stay Westin. We would probably try the Ritz Carlton or the Fairmont Kei Lani. Though those hotels might be a little pricier, I'm sure they're worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Terri S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 night stay at the Maui Westin and had a great time. Yes, the rates are high, but that's Maui. Many of the complaints I had read about previously on this site (parking, customer service, getting a place at the pool) were not issues for us. The few times that the lot was full, valet was complimentary. Anytime we needing anything, the staff was very helpful, particularly the concierge staff. They have signs up asking people to not save chairs at the pool, so that too wasn't much of a problem. The pool is still cold, but so is the ocean...that's what happens when the pool is so large! We were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View which probably helped with the space accommodations, as the basic rooms are smaller. The bathrooms are huge however, which was very nice. The location of this hotel is great - 10 minutes to Lahaina, and a similar short drive to the Northern Beaches - also right next to Whalers Village. It's also very nice that you can use the accommodations at the Sheraton - we went to that pool a few times after snorkeling at Black Rock. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty of the island made perfect”
Reviews.Author: kristinanethercott
Reviews.Content: We had the perfect stay at the Westin. I'm a bathroom person and these bathrooms had tonnes of counter space and the rooms had very good views, even the cheaper ones. The staff/service was wonderful and helpful with lots of aloha! Rooms were clean and a decent size. The pools, well what can I say, absolutely stunning! Best on Kaanapali beach by far! My only complaint would be they only had one hot tub..........adults only though, but often busy. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it. No time share pressure at all that we noticed. Location is only minutes from downtown Lahaina and the beach is exquisite.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, my kids( aged 8 and 10)and I stayed at the Westin From March 31 till April 7 2006.We had an awesome time. Check in was easy and the upgraded us from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view over looking the pools. It was Beautiful! the only downside was the millions of birds squaking as soon as the sun rose. The rooms were a little on the small side but the beds were great ( the most comfortable hotel beds that I've slept in. Also the shower has 2 shower heads that were a nice treat. We put the Kids in the night time kiddie Kare the 2nd night and they kept bagging to go back. They loved Ester Lynn and the geko hunt, not to mention the x-box, air hockey, foose ball basket ball games and crafts. They ended up going there 3 times. (bonus alone time for Mom and Dad!!!) Other than the birds the only other downside was that the resort food was very expensive. I would recomend stopping at the local safeway and picking up some breakfast food. Also the whalers village is next door and there is some great restraunts there. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Overrun with kids...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for a quiet getaway, and I insisted on Westin for their Heavenly Bed, my favorite. I was disappointed to find that my favorite fluffy bed was hard, lumpy, and not heavenly at all. The hotel was besieged with families with screaming children. Maybe it was the place to be, because the Westin has a lot of pools, and lots of animals in their courtyard lagoon (parrots, flamingoes, koi fish, all kinds of birds). The breakfast buffet was average in quality, selection, and flavor. Also, when we went to the beach, we waited 10 minutes for someone to set up chairs for us (since we weren't allowed to do it ourselves). Finally, we grabbed them ourselves, only to be chased after but the cabana boy. We explained how we waited, then he let us go with no charge for the chairs. Not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pools ruin the trip!”
Reviews.Author: Oshkosh123
Reviews.Content: after reading all the reviews before our trip. had to share our experience. we had a very smooth check in and were upgraded to the Beach Tower. this is the tower with the larger rooms and a real closet. I would definitely try to get into the newer tower. we got a few postcards at our door to get us down to see the timeshare but we picked up our free gift and just declined. no pressure or problems. Just like Maui, the Westin restaurants are pricey BUT if you have kids, the kids eat free part does save you some money. we loved the food at tropica. we loved the bath products, good sized room, the property is clean and friendly, staff is nice, spa is beautiful, great location, close to whalers village. pool chairs are padded and comfy. CONS: the pools, the pools. the pools at Westin are freezing. they were freezing every day and many guests were annoyed. the kids still go in and come out with their teeth chattering. one day someone is going to get sick..the front desk, etc gave us different excuses but this has been posted so much that its got to be the Westin. we walked down to the other resorts and all other pools were so much warmer to the touch!. all in all, we did have a nice, pleasant stay but for the high room rate. cold pools, and the ridiculous resort fee, they didn't help us gain any loyalty to this particular resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation with hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Warmwaterdivers
Reviews.Content: We received an offer to go to the Westin Maui a few months ago, so thought we'd enjoy a quick trip during spring break this year. Since we own a Marriott timeshare on Maui, we are very familiar with the Westin's location, and Maui in general. Pros: Checking into the Westin was very easy, and we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a 9th floor room with a view of the mountains. We had 2 queen beds and plenty of space to move around. We didn't feel that the room was undersized at all, and the Heavenly Bed was everything the Westin says it is. The grounds were gorgeous and very clean, and the pools were loads of fun. Self-parking was very easy and we never had trouble finding a spot. We had a refrigerator and safe, both of which I think are "must haves" on Maui. The location on Kaanapali beach is the best, being next to Whaler's Village and in the middle of the "strip". They offered a shuttle to the other Starwood properties so we could have used the amenities, but since pool use wasn't part of that, we didn't see the point. Cons: We opted to sit through the timeshare presentation for an extra $100 voucher. This was a mistake as it took far longer than 90 minutes and at the end the finance guy immediately began pressuring us. They started out telling us how unique their Starwood program was, but the more they talked, the more it sounded like the program we have with our Marriott timeshare. When it was all said and done, we simply couldn't see how spending $45,000 plus a yearly maintenance fee of $1800 was a "bargain". The daily resort fee was $18 and paid for water, a newspaper, parking, and admission to the workout facility. It would have been nice to be able to opt out of it and pay a $3 a day parking fee instead. I found it amazing that a resort that charges $350+ for a room will nickel and dime people the "resort fee". For $350+ a night everything should be included IMO (except meals). I've read reviews here about kids running up and down the hall. We had the exact same experience, including a family who fought so loudly that we could hear them through their door as we walked down the hall. All in all we had a great time at the Westin. Would we go back? No. We felt that the property seriously overcharged for the rooms and amenities, and we were so turned off by the pressured sales pitch that even if we had been interested in a timeshare, we likely wouldn't have purchased from them because they made us so uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: AFter reading a lot of the reviews on the Westin I felt a need to chime in. We stayed there in September of 2001. We were actually just waking up as 9/11 was happening. We also got married there. We found the hotel to be great. The rooms were just slightly smaller than I expected, but hey guys when your in Hawaii, are you really staying in the room that much? I thought the hotel was beautiful, the staff very helpful, specially considering the circumstances during our stay. The views were breath taking, we had poolviews, mountains to one side, and the ocean to the other, all from our balcony. We used the laundry service..to press dh suit and my wedding gown..without problems. We also used their wedding services and everything was excellent. The photos, had my makeup and hair done in the room, the flowers, the video, the wedding, perfect. By the way our wedding cake...made by the Westin..the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: exp
Reviews.Content: We spent the week at the Westin in Maui during a very rainy spring break. Although it rained most all week, we had a great time, and the hotel was a lot of fun. Our kids loved the pools although they were very cold due to a propane shortage on the island. The entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. The concierge even sent a complimentary bottle of wine to our room when she found out it was our anniversary. The grounds and beach were beautiful! The tropical birds and fish were a nice touch outside the lobby. We loved the close proximity to Whaler's Village shopping center and restaurants since the weather was not always cooperating. The room was a little small, but always clean! It is a great place for family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “nice but needs an overhall”
Reviews.Author: CONNIE4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at the Westin - the lobby & pools are FANTASTIC - but the elevators and rooms need updating - the elevators smelled horrible! We paid for a Deluxe Oceanfront and ended up overlooking a parking lot of Whalers Village, smelled like cheeseburgers & lots of noise in the AM with trucks - they nicely moved us to a new room overlooking the pool & ocean and gave us food vouchers - breakfast was fantastic as well as Tropica - very lovely! The staff is great - even Room Service was great - they came and picked up the table about an hour later without us calling. - They need to spend some big $ overhauling the rooms - OLD safe - closet door didnt close - we wouldnt go back unless they spent big $$$ to over haul - be sure to say you DO NOT want the rooms overlooking that parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “Diappointed with Westin”
Reviews.Author: pbregman
Reviews.Content: Trip report from Maui, Hawaii and our stay at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa at Kaâ€™anapali Beach March 24th â€“ 31st. Excuse the rambling and detail but we need to get all this off our chests. We are a family of 5, mom, dad and three girls ages 9, 4 and 21 months. We typically book a suite or get two connecting rooms to accommodate our family. After serious research we booked the Jr. Suite at the Westin. The Westin website states that the suite is 845 sq. ft. with separate bedroom and living rooms. The confirmation we received stated that the room had â€œdramaticâ€� ocean views. The rate of $650/night was worth it considering the size of the room and the â€œdramaticâ€� ocean views. After reading negative reviews here from people who I believe stayed in the Jr. Suites I was concerned about the views and size of the room and called the hotel directly. Both times they confirmed the sq. footage and â€œdramaticâ€� views. Upon arrival I asked Rebecca at the front desk about our room and she wasnâ€™t overly thrilled. After I told her we were a family of 5 she thought we might be cramped. I was confused because the room was 845 sq. ft. She proceeded to show me a map of the room with sq. footage which showed the room is really less than 475sq. ft. Rebecca told me they were probably including the sq. footage of the lanaiâ€™s (balconies). I asked her about the views and she said it was on the 2nd floor overlooking Whalerâ€™s Village and that it was not a great view, I was furious. She stated that she had nothing better available other than the luxury suite at $1100/night. She gave us the keys and told us to check out the Jr. Suite and come back if it was not acceptable. When I complained to Rebecca she went to talk to the manager. When she returned she said she was giving us the Luxury Suite for the same price as we had booked the Jr. Suite. It was right next door to the other room but even though it was on the 2nd floor this room did have dramatic ocean views (see pictures) and was approximately 1110 sq. ft large (not including balconies) and was amazing. The room had a treadmill, 3 lanaiâ€™s all with stunning views, dining table, huge master bath and a separate hallway half bath. We were truly satisfied at this point. It was large enough where our two older daughters did not have to sleep together. We ordered a cot for our 4 year old which by the way is more comfortable than the pull out sofa! The Westin made this right, however, even Rebecca stated that she wished the booking agents at Westin would be more honest about the rooms and I agree whole heartedly. Had she not been able to fix this problem we would have been livid. As a matter of fact while I was down working this out I had my wife on the phone with the Hyatt next door where we have stayed in previous trips. They were ready to accommodate us. Even though Westin got this right in the end, I am extremely disappointed that it had to go that far to start with. I felt totally deceived! The pools are great and were a little chilly like everyone on here states but I find that refreshing. We are very disappointed about the fact that this property only has one Jacuzzi and that you have to be 16 or older to go in it, come on. Twice our kids were asked to leave the Jacuzzi. Look, kids love Jacuzziâ€™s at least ours do and with all the rain and the chilly pool they wanted to warm up. It is ridiculous that they only have one Jacuzzi and they wonâ€™t let kids in it. This made my wife livid. We never had problems getting towels or seats by the pool but it was raining most of the time we were there so I am sure this may have been different had everyone been out by the pool. Only committed swimmers were out most days willing to swim in the rain or stormy conditions. The elevators in the beach tower of this property had foul odors. Not sure what is up with that but we were overwhelmed by the foul odors in at least two of the elevators and this disgusted us each time we went to and from our rooms. Thank goodness we were only on the 2nd floor. We found the staff very friendly and accommodating. The food on the property was nothing special. There is no indoor restaurant so all the rain made it not fun to eat on property which we really only did for breakfast. The breakfast buffet is expensive $25/adult, kids eat free but it was very good. Some people complain about the $18 daily resort fee but in my opinion itâ€™s worth it. For this you get free internet, free parking, a couple bottles of water each day and some other stuff that made it worth it for me. All in all the property is showing some wear and tear and needs some updating. The location is fabulous and the property is very keiki (kid) friendly with the exception of the Jacuzzi. The health spa is very nice with some great machines for working out. My wife and I both had massages and they were both good. The spa has great facilities. We absolutely wouldnâ€™t stay here again based on the deception about the rooms and needed repairs to the property. Probably we will not consider another Westin property for quite a while because of the deception. Some other highlights of the trip included road to Hana, Maui Ocean Center, Big Beach, Old Lahaina Luau, Kealani Kai Boat Excursion, Paâ€™ia Fish Market for Fish and Chips, Pacific Oâ€™, Nickâ€™s Fish Market, Ruths Chris Steak House, Kimoâ€™s, Hula Grill, Leilaniâ€™s and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: bft178
Reviews.Content: We decided on Westin Maui for our honeymoon. What a great choice! The staff was very nice from the get-go. Right off the bat they provided us an upgraded room which allowed us to see Ka'anapoli Beach. Room - Our room was nice and spacious, no complaints, bed was heavenly. Pool & Beach - A lot of kids present, meaning the pools were full. A perfect place for families. The beach was nice. I believe you have to pay extra to get beach furniture. Perfect sun sets. Food - The restaurants located at Westin were good, but expensive. We highly recommend going into Lahaina. A nice drive south of the hotel for food and shops. Bubba Gump Shrimp and Cheeseburger in Paradise were awesome. Also, food & shops just north of the hotels. A Luau is another great idea. I believe we went to the Hyatt's. Westin offered a nice workout facility & spa. We took part in both. Sometime during your visit you will be asked about their timeshare villas. Our concierge advised us to go sit through the 1-1.5 hr sales pitch and just say no. Thats what we did and walked away with $100 credit towards any Westin Maui service(food, spa, or whatever) and they also provided us a 50% off coupon for any future Westin visit. We thought it was worth our time. To end this review, I would recommend this Westin to anybody. Everyone is laid back. Weather was nice. Rent a car and tour the island. Don't forget about helicopter tours!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: NSW
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our second trip to the Westin Maui (first time was 12/04). This time, we brought our 3 mo. daughter with us. We stayed in the cheapest room(mountain view) but it was actually more enjoyable than the pool/garden view room we stayed in last time. (The pool/garden view rooms are LOUD due to the thundering waterfalls, screeching parrots, and kids playing in the pools.) The room size was fine for the 3 of us. We reserved a crib but our baby slept so well in her stroller that we didn't need the crib after all which saved a lot of space. The biggest drawback is the lack of closet space. There is a TV armoir with 2 deep drawers and a narrow space to hang about 5 pieces of clothing, but nowhere to store luggage. We packed several small pieces of luggage that we stuffed UNDER THE BED so we didn't have to trip over them all the time. The bedside tables also have 2 drawers each- perfect for smaller items (diapers/wipes, socks + underwear, bathing suits, baby clothes etc). We used the hotel's Nanny service (Nanny Connection) so we could go out by ourselves for dinner. We recommend Denise HIGHLY. She is FABULOUS! She has been taking care of kids on Maui for 12 years and is totally trustworthy and experienced. If you are travling with a baby, I suggest reserving Denise in advance so you can have some time for yourselves. Between our two trips to Maui, we've tried many of the Island's top rated restuarants. Our favorite is actually the Westin's own Tropica. The food is GREAT! We had the crab and shrimp cake appetizer (absolutely fantastic) and the surfing goat cheese flat bread (fabulous) and the seafood paella (one of the best paella's I've had- no joke). And if you can grab a table at sunset, you'll have an unrivalled setting too.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: kmmurray
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my mother as a winter getaway for a week. We had spent the previous week at the Ritz Carleton and were surprised that we actually liked the Westin much better! The food was great and the beach was beautiful. Ka'anapali is so close to everything from shopping to touring and many many restaurants. My only complaint was that this is a kid friendly hotel with lots of noise, but if I had a family I would definitely bring them here. Also, rent a car: it's worth it to be able to drive around the whole island to the less crowded beaches and shopping areas. LOVED the Westin. Got a room upgrade on arrival, which was beautiful, and the staff were very friendly. I am planning on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: dig deep
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb.06 The hotel is a very nice resort, my only negative comment, I stayed in room 855 Ocean front. The rooms ending in 55 are the smallest in the hotel. I found this out on my last day when the design team came to look at room to deside what improvements could be made to improve the layout. There was not enough space to unpack our bags, but the views of whales breaching was great. John F Surf City,NJ

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: baileyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 5 nights and just returned from there. We booked the mountain view room...their low end rooms. Yes we were facing the parking lot, but we also had a view of the mountains. It was really quiet and we enjoyed sitting on the lanai. The rooms were small but very nice, the beds were very comfortable. The grounds were very beautiful and our son really enjoyed the birds, fish/koi and pools (although ice cold - needed our wetsuits). Nice location as well. Easy walking distance to the Black Rock for snorkelling and scuba diving and Whaler's Village right next door. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We will likely be staying there next time we go to Maui.
