Reviews.Title: “needs some big updating”
Reviews.Author: bug4ballet
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed at the Westin in about 7 years until this March. Got an oceanview room on the 9th floor with a very good view. At first you don't notice much except that view but as the days went on the place really starts showing it's age. The room was actually filthy. Everything needs replacing. There is no closet, some sort of tv cabinet with 2 drawers and a few hangers, very sad when you are paying that kind of money. The "bathroom" - so small and the floor has some real grime when you get on your hands and knees and take a look (that was when we were looking for a dropped earring!) There is a tiny refrigerator you are lucky to get 2 bottles of water in. The pools are missing tiles, it's very noticable. They charge a resort fee then another fee for beach chairs and then they tax it all. I don't mind paying for any of it but the maintenance needs to be addressed. ALL they care about is selling their timeshares or villas or whatever. We lasted 4 nights and were ready to leave before the entire room closed in on us. We are Starwood Preferred customers and they did nothing extra. Then we asked for an extra hour late checkout and they said NO. We weren't surprised. There is no warm feeling in that hotel. What a shame. Perfect location and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Westin - mostly good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin with my husband for a babymoon before our 2nd child is born. In general we had a wonderful stay - the resort is beautiful - we got there and we were upgraded to a golf course view (I think because I 'm an SPG member) and our bags arrived right behind us. We spent most days as follows: early @ the gym - the facilities were always clean and well kept - machines did get packed so the earlier you went the more likely you were able to get the machine you want. Then back to the room and off to the adult pool (enjoy it while you can:) The food service at the pool was good and the proximity of the hotel to good restaurants - Hula Grill, Lelani's, others at Whalers Village was an added bonus. The staff was always very accommodating with any needs we had. The pool is beautiful and a lot of fun. My husband won the adult waterslide races one day during our stay. Our room was clean and well kept - my only complaint was the timing on room cleaning service - we had days when we were gone from 8am to 5p and our room still hadn't been cleaned upon our return - but aside from that we had no real complaints. We'd like to go back again next year with our new addition.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful HUGE BUSY Resort”
Reviews.Author: cindi and kevin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 3 nights before moving over to the Villas and for one night after the Villas. This resort is beautiful--entry is stunning but is very busy. Lots of people--not a quiet resort but next to Whalers Village so very convienent for dining and shops. We were in the Beach Tower the 1st 3 nights--very nice but on our return we were in the older section that is much more worn and smaller rooms. Greatest thing about this hotel? The adult pool which is up high and away from all the noise of kids. Great staff--nice welcome. Fitness center and spa is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Already planning to go back next year!”
Reviews.Author: Peblipoo
Reviews.Content: I'm with the other reviewers on this site who can't believe there are negative things said about this hotel. My boyfriend and I both travel all the time for work (I'm a flight attendant!) and we are in hotels enough to know when it's a great one. We were there on a points stay for half the time and a paid room the rest of the stay. His platinum Starwood status helped, but we had a normal room, new tower, North view of Whalers village for the first half, then upgraded to an ocean front suite. The regular room was just fine. Heavenly bed is always great, good size room, and a nice lanai to look out. I included a view pic from this room. We loved the suite, and always ask for an upgrade - the worst they can say is "no". It had three balconies on the north side and a big window right out front of the ocean. Nice sitting room. Liked the bathroom better in the regular room! The Whalers village is right next door, a photo is included as well. It is full of upscale shops, art, an ABC convienience store, and some stores you all know from your local mall. It also has a dive shop where you can rent a full set up with 1 tank for only $25 per 24 hours! Snorkeling supplies avail too. Hula Grill next door has great atmosphere, food, and drinks. We did not eat at the hotel at all as we know to never expect much from them as we are in hotels all the time for our jobs. You know what I mean if you are too. Right out front several catamaransâ€™ pull up to take people out for whale watching. Very convenient and we had a GREAT time on Gemini. (Photo included) You can arrange for it at the hut right off the beach in front of the hotel and should do so when you get there for a few days out as it's quite popular. The pools were refreshing - NOT cold. I highly recommend a "tropical monkey" adult beverage while you sun yourself there. We scuba but enjoyed snorkeling Black rock just up the beach. EASY walk north up the path and TONS of fish. OH, when renting a car, the parking is indeed tight, so maybe pick the smaller car - but the lot was full most of the time and we were not charged for valet if it was the only option. I also can't say enough about the location - only a 5 minute drive to Lahaina (a wonderful town to go to dinner, shop, or find a Starbucks - hey, I'm from the NW!) I must include a warning on price, if you are trying to stay on a budget, this is not the place for you. We NEVER travel like that so don't think twice about the price of things and just enjoy it for what it is. We're on Vacation! Westin is an upscale hotel chain and not for those without means. With that said, ENJOY! We certainly did! Obviously, I can't say enough about the hotel. We had a wonderful experience and I hope you'll pick this hotel, you WON'T be dissapointed. I also recommend the book "Maui Revealed" to guide you around the island - but don't believe the hype on the banana bread - ICK!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but didn't meet all expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Waited for our baggage to be brought up to our rooms after bellhop took them but they didn't come. Gave them reasonable time but never brought up bags until we called down to remind them. Shouldn't have to do that in a 4 star hotel. Facilities/ammenities are nice. Nice pool with poolside food service, nice beach, close to shopping (just steps away from Whaler Village), etc but grounds and beach are crowded. Rooms are small but have updated furniture. Beds are very heavenly. There were many stains on the beige carpet(wish I had taken photos but forgot). Also balcony is dirty and rails are rusting (again wish I had taken photo), not what you'd expect for the money you pay. If they aren't going to clean carpets then they should use a darker color carpet. Stains are unsightly and unexpected in a hotel room as expensive as Westin. Staff are nice but misdirected us to wrong wing of hotel. Had to go back down 11 stories back through lobby to another wing. Then arrived at room and front desk never gave us keys, went back to get keys and then one of the two they gave us didn't even work. Next day, came back to room after lunch and room wasn't cleaned. Left again and came back and still wasn't made up. They actually didn't come to clean our room until 4pm, even though we'd been out all day. So had to be interrupted for their cleaning late afternoon. Overall the facililty was good but expected more for the money, especially not as many irritating little annoyances as we had. Obviously the facilily and ammenities make this rated 4 stars but some of these snafu's just should happen at a 4 star hotel, thus overall 4 star on the surface but expect in reality less and you'll enjoy it more. In this case if you have lower expectations you won't be as dissapointed (i.e. Expect stains on the carpet in your room and when you find that your room doesn't have stains, you'll be thrilled! Expect that your room won't be cleaned, and when you return and it actually is cleaned, you'll be overjoyed!)

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself by staying at this resort!”
Reviews.Author: jb7056
Reviews.Content: I was sent to Hawaii on business from 2/15-2/21 and chose the Westin Maui Resort. My colleagues and I had to leave for a different island each day, but my husband stayed behind and languished at the Westin and kicked around Whaler's Village, Lahaina, etc. We had a Premium Deluxe Ocean View room on the 10th floor and it could not have been better! It overlooked the pool and the ocean where you could watch the whales frolic from the lanai. The food is fabulous at the OnNo Bar and Grill, as are the drinks!!--which we probably had too many of! We fell in love with the waiter John from Chicago and he treated us like royalty! Because we travel so much, good service is especially appreciated. We had no trouble checking in or with getting any services or amenities. Warning: on the weekends when we wanted to sleep in and cuddle in the comfy Heavenly Bed we found that the housekeeping staff is especially efficient and timely, so put out the "Privacy Please" notice! Additionally, I was surprised at how many children were there when I thought they would all be in school! We heard one small child screaming on our floor when walking down the hall, but were relatively oblivious to them for the remainder of our stay. All in all, this was a wonderful stay and I found that by reading the reviews on Trip Advisor before going, I knew what to expect (Valet parking, et al.)I do recommend requesting and staying in the Beach Tower!!

Reviews.Title: “great pools”
Reviews.Author: christy2064
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great outdoor area. tons of pools and also an adult pool. Right on the beach. The rooms are small, and closet almost non existent. only holds about 3 hangers and 10 inches wide. rooms are on the small side, but do have balconies, small also. the parking is bad at the hotel also, not enough spots and hard to get in/out of your car as those spots are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioner view = partial ocean view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a partial ocean view room for the rate of $435.00 per night. The room we received was on the 2nd floor (room 278). The view was of the enclosed air conditioning unit for the hotel and a very partial view of the ocean if you looked beyond the air conditioning unit. The air conditioning unit was also loud when the sliding door was open. Very disappointing not to get a room with the value you pay for. Unfortunately the hotel was completely booked and there were no other rooms. Bryan the front desk person was not helpful and said it was the best he had. The Westin is a nice property but the partial ocean view room for $435.00 per night was disappointing and not worth the money. Advice do not pay more for a partial ocean view. I think our situation is rare, but it could happen to you. It happened to us. Having a mountain view or a garden view would be better and cheaper if you decide to stay at the Westin. From this experience we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Location - Skip the Timeshare Presentation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Westin Resort & Spa starting on 2/5/06. It was my first trip to Maui and my wife's 2nd trip. The hotel was fantastic. Location: The location could not be better - right in the middle of everything. The beach was great with Whaler's Village right next store. The drive to Kapalua is only 10 minutes and Front Street in Lahaina is only 5 minutes away. Dining: I would recommend eating lunch at Whaler's Village versus at the hotel to help your budget. The food at the hotel was pretty good, but expensive - not a surprise. We ate at Kimo's in Lahaina & Hula Grill at Whaler's Village - good food, good prices, great service & location for both restaurants. The Food Court at Whaler's Village offers McDonald's, Chinese, Mexican, Subs, and Smoothies - prices are reasonable and well worth the walk next door for lunch. Rooms: The rooms were small, but well appointed and clean. Housekeeping does a nice job at this hotel keeping the rooms clean. The bellmen and concierge staff are very friendly and knowledgeable - use them if you aren't familiar with the area. Pools: Great pools. The lounge chairs are padded and the best on Kaanapali Beach. The adult pool area was a nice break. The Westin's pool rivaled those at the Marriott & Hyatt. Timeshare: We met with a concierge one morning and got roped into going to a timeshare presentation. They offered us $100 to be used in the hotel, so we decided to check it out. The person who gave us the presentation spoke so fast we could hardly understand her. They said it wasn't a high-pressure sale, but it was. You'd think they would understand you need time to think before spending $50,000 - $80,000 on a timeshare. While we put the $100 towards the spa (which is great by the way), it wasn't worth dealing with the stuck-up, high-pressure sales presentation...don't waste your time unless it's raining or you are really interested. Luau: We went to the Royal Lahaina Luau. It was a lot of fun, but somewhat cramped for space. The location was great - 2 minutes from the hotel. The food was good and the show very entertaining. Dinner Cruise: We went on the Terlani Dinner Cruise which picked us up right next door at Whaler's Village. The staff was excellent, the food good, and the bar stocked. We had whales swimming around the boat the entire trip. I highly recommend this trip and this specific Terlani Boat Tour. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and would go back. The Westin was a great place to stay and we have great memories of our honeymoon there. We would also consider staying at the Hyatt, Sheraton, Kaanapali Alli, and the Marriott...whichever had the best deal when we were ready to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a sham timeshare!!!”
Reviews.Author: kristie_bridgeman
Reviews.Content: My husband, my father, my 18 month old daughter and I visited the Westin for 4 days. We felt pressured to go to their timeshare presentation and then found out that you would own at the Westin down the beach. We decided to go hear them out because we were looking for a timeshare on Maui. We let them know that we had to pick up my father in a few hours. Four hours later, while my daughter is screaming and my father is waiting for us, we tell them we will get back to them. They follow us out and the women asks me "Did I Waste my Time?" We finally just walked away. By the time we got back to our room, we had a message from our advisor asking what are decision was. We also later found out that the Westin does not own their land!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Parking Lot Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MrsAloha
Reviews.Content: First,the rants, ~ and (please be patient!) then the raves. Rants: "Deluxe Oceanview" what a crock! I wish I had discovered this site BEFORE reserving this category. What a sorry joke. For $485 a night, we were offered a room overlooking the parking lot of Whaler's Village. The noise was horrible! Delivery trucks, cars coming and going, (beep beep beep) and the poisonous, foul smell of diesel. You could not see the ocean from any place in the room...only from the balcony. I know they need to sell these rooms, but they should be fairly priced and more honest in the description. This room was on the 7th floor. Joven said it was a "very nice, deluxe room." After a very long, highly unpleasant process, we were able to move to a much better room on the 6th floor of the main building. This was an "Oceanview" category. The view was great, including soothing sounds of the fountains, and views of the pools, flamingos, koi, waterslide, people, and parrots. The housekeeping staff kept the room spotless. The only other complaint regarding the room would be the stench of cigarette smoke. Smoking is banned in all guestrooms, but allowed on the balconies. This new policy is a brilliant one for Westin --- saving Westin money on cleaning smoke-infested rooms. Those of us who prefer fresh air (we spend most of our time when not sleeping out on our balcony when in the islands)are denied such because all of the smokers (in our case we had smokers on one side and below us!) are out on their balconies, puffing away. The smell of smoke managed to not only infect our balcony, but also blew into our room. The non-smoking policy is a huge blessing, though, in the lobby and around the pools. They do have designated spots for those who need their smoke, including one of the pools. One more rant, ~ the service in Tropica. It's a really great place ~ the location is awesome and the food is really good. But they are seriously understaffed. We popped in for lunch while waiting for our room on the first day (the 3 p.m. check-in is the rule --- which surprised us, as we have now stayed at almost every hotel on Maui and have never had that problem.) There was a very sweet lady who seated us. Then she disappeared. What reappeared was a mad cow who should never work with the public. When the gods were handing out aloha spirit, she must have gotten in the wrong line. Unbelievable! She hardly acknowledged that we existed, looking mostly annoyed that we were taking space in the restaurant. WHAT? Are we in FRANCE? We heard her involved in not just one, but two arguments with other guests. Scary lady. After 50 minutes, our entrees arrived. One problem: No napkins or silverware. And no waitress in sight. I finally found the wait station and got our own, as Ms. UnFriendly was no where to be found. Our entrees were delicious, though, worth the wait. By the way, though we're mainlanders, we pretty much live our lives on "island time." So, it's not that we expect super prompt service. We just expect service. Two days later, we chose to dine at Tropica again. They were still understaffed, but what a difference an attitude can make. A nice gentlemen greeted us, apologized that they were understaffed, but welcomed us to relax and enjoy the view and that he promised he would get to us within the next ten minutes. No worries! Thoroughly pleasant experience. The raves: The pool area is beautiful. Although the resort was at full occupancy, it never felt crowded, due to the great design. The various pools are spread out nicely. The landscaping is abundant and well tended. The waterslide is a blast! Cushions on the lounge chairs -- this is becoming rare at resorts, but gratefully, the Westin Maui is maintaining a very good tradition. The lobby area is wonderful. The infused waters and lemon towelettes are a nice touch. There is a nice "flow" and again, it never felt crowded. All in all, it was a wonderful vacation. We visit Maui twice a year, splitting time between Wailea and Kaanapali. We would recommend the Westin, but encourage you to be particular about the location of your room. The Parking Lot Deluxe rooms are not for those who enjoy the peace and serenity of such a magical place as Maui. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “"nice" kid friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: rdesai52
Reviews.Content: on a scale of bad to great, this is a "nice" resort in hawaii. Very kid friendly. Kids eat free in their main outdoor restaurant called "Ono". The "free" kids meal you get is actually a nice meal too (good quality)! To make it simple, here are the pros and cons.. PROS = nice pool, waterfalls, lounge chairs, outdoor lobby, maid service is thorough & prompt & friendly, free daily waters in room (20 oz x 2), Spa looks very nice. CONS = heavenly bed was NOT heavenly at all, live entertainment goes until 10pm outside and it is LOUD if you're trying to go to sleep earlier than 10pm, pool is a "bit" cold, checkin staff told me there are no categories within a category, however, the further you are from the elevator, the nicer view you'll have of the ocean (beach tower). Their concierge staff is really nice and helpful. They are genuinely there to assist. Very impressed since this is not a top notch resort (i.e. ritz or four seas). Our "beach tower" room was large, with a closet, nice bathroom, nice heavenly shower, decent products that you won't mind using everyday (westin brand), and had a pullout sofabed. The crib they provided was nice (not squeaky, old looking, etc). I would have been more critical if I had paid their normal rack rates (Our room normally goes for $440/night), however, we were on a package and the room was only $120/nt so we were very happy with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds... Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mollmack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent out honeymoon at the Westin in Mid November...after reading some of the negative comments by people I wondered to myself if we stayed at the same hotel! We flew directly from Chicago to Maui the morning after our wedding and were so excited at the idea of laying on the beach to relax a few days! Upon arriving at the Westin we went directly to check in, we were so giddy at the warm weather and the beautiful open area lobby that the girl, I believe her name was Yoko, behind the counter pegged us as newlyweds. When we told her we got married the night before she upgraded out room to a deluxe ocean view. It was truly spectacular. We looked out upon nothing but the beach and the two islands in the distance. Beneath us was Tropico (best lobster tail we had in Maui and you have to try the carmelized onion and goat cheese flat bread...we liked it so much we made our own version back in the mainland!)that has live music every night. While we were there it was just one guy and his ukulale...very soothing and romantic! My husband and I actually went to Safeway (Same comapny as Dominicks to us Chicagoans...and I even used my preferred card!) and picked up alcohol and sat on our balcony one night drinking and listening to music and the ocean! It sure beats the 9 dollars a drink at the bar! We also were suprised with champagne from the management in room on our second night there! As for the timeshares, no one bothered us about is at all....we didn't even go pick up our "gift" from the concierge as we knew it would be a trap! Upon learning the gift was only "chocolate macadamia nuts" I wasn't too upset! We recieved a message to remind us to pick it up but we ignored it...we were left along all week...it was wonderful! Our rooms were always clean and fully stocked and as my husband and I are talkers (we are both in sales) we found to the staff to be very warm and kind. The pools were wonderful, and yes they were cold when we were there also, but felt great after sitting in the sun all day! We alterated between the beach and the pools every afternoon when we were not out and about. We even had a "drunk day" one day were we decided we were sitting by the pool and drinking all day like we were in college again. Abraham the bartender by the "adult" pool is great! He laughed and joked around with us the entire afternoon, even making up new drinks for us to try! He always plays Bob Marley so if you hear it, go get a drink and ahng out for a while...you wont be disappointed! All in all it was a wonderful stay, the westin is close to EVERYTHING and for us provided a wonderful get away! We are already planning our first anniversary with a few other newlyweds to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on our honeymoon. The in-room "free" internet access didn't work and took 4 hours for them to finally figure it out and fix it. Otherwise the pools are okay but not amazing and dispite it being the low season, they were crowded and hard to find a spot to lounge. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were what we expected. The grounds looked nice and the amenities of a large hotel are convenient but the charge well for those conveniences. Overall it was not even close to being worth the price. All our other hotels and B&Bs we stayed at during our 2 week stay were nicer in their own ways and definately worth their price. The Westin Maui is not worth the $300 a night price. Plus they charge you a mandatory resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Swimming Pool!”
Reviews.Author: BlondiSCal
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff was super friendly and accomadating, the grounds were beautiful and clean and their swimming pool is one of the best on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Westin was the BEST”
Reviews.Author: addictedtothesun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin in Maui. It was an excellent location. The hotel was beautiful and met our every expectation. The heavenly beds were heavenly! We've never slept better! Our room was very nice and clean. Our only complaint was we had a mountain view which faced the parking lot so we heard a lot of car horns as people were searching for their rental cars or locking the rental car doors at night. We have stayed in a lot of high-end resorts and were very satisified with the Westin. The pool area was beautiful. We found the pool down from the "adult only" pool was very relaxing (the sound of the waterfall in the background). Frozen drinks were $9, beers were $4. We went to a local grocery and bought a 6-pack for $7. We did not eat at the resort because we read the bad reviews. We found our choices in restaurants were so many that we don't feel like we missed out by not eating at the resort. Each room comes with a refrigerator. You could stock up if you wanted. They do supply bottled water. We always felt like we had enough. The work-out room was nice and they have a great running path outside the resort. We are wishing we were back there now!!! We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Heavenly at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Westin Maui Feb. of 04 for a week. We had done a lot of research on what hotel we wanted to stay at and the pool and amenities at the Westin Maui seemed too good to be true which turned out to be the case. (1.) First off our Heavenly bed was anything but heavenly. The side of the bed closest to the window was totally broken down and seemed like the mattress had never been turned, I was rolling off all the bed all night and felt like I had to brace myself. The mattress was also very lumpy and my husband became very irritated about this. We spoke to the front desk but nothing was done. (2.) The Heavenly showerhead was mounted too low. If you were any taller than 5'-5" the showerhead was not above your head and hit you in the chin if lucky, this made washing oneâ€™s face and hair very difficult. We were told that the rooms had been renovated recently but the mounting heights had not been changed. This was a big mistake in my opinion. (3.) Our toilet leaked and ran all night which made our sleeping on a lumpy broken down mattress that much more enjoyable. (4.)Our small patio looked on the roof of the timeshare offices and it was anything but pretty. (5.) There was scheduled maintenance occurring on our patio that we were not notified about. We would open our drape one morning and see workers painting and then come back to our room later and see that all the plants had been ripped out of their planters. (6.) We were hounded and hounded to look at some timeshare villas next door to the Westin. We finally gave in and were told the process would only take an hour and a half well three and half hours later we were sick of all the lies and pressure. The gift also totally sucked and they changed their story on what the gift really was. We were treated like garbage once Westin knew we werenâ€™t going to purchase a timeshare. One the brighter side. The Barefoot bar and Hula Grill are also Awesome and defiantly worth your while. The Marriot Ocean club looked like a better place to stay. We ate at the Beachwalk cafe several times. It's the most affordable self-service place to pick up snacks and breakfast, their hours were also much for flexable than the Westin.(7.) The Westin breakfast hours were way too short, My Husband liked to sleep in until ten making getting breakfast at the Westin troubling. In conclusion, I would never waist my money at the Westin Maui or any other Westin property again. Their help either won't assist you or couldn't speak English. I would skip the Westin Maui and stay somewhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and myself stayed at the Westin Nov 26th-Dec 3rd and we both were very happy with our experience there. I have traveled a lot and this is my third trip to Hawaii. The grounds are beautiful! The opportunity for pictures is plentiful. You cannot beat the location. All your shopping and dinning are right next door at Whalers Village. The town of Lahaina is only five minutes away. If you stay here you do not need a rental car. Save your money! The pools and waterfalls are beautiful and very clean. The service was top notch. The staff was very attentive. I have read negative reviews on this hotel and I just don't get it, I guess some people are impossible to please. Next time we go back to Maui, I already know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our wedding and honeymoon in Maui. Our first night we stayed at the Maui Prince and than the remainder of the time we were at the Westin Spa and Resort. We opted to go with the honeymoon package, which included the resort fees and taxes, valet parking, breakfast, dinner at Tropica, couples massage, whale watching trip on the Gemini II and strawberries and champagne. When we first arrived at the Westin we were greeted with fresh leis which was wonderful. The lobby and the hotel grounds are spectacular. When we checked in we went to the gold and platinum Starwood Preferred Guest desk and had the worst experience of our entire vacation. Jovan at the desk rudely advised us that only gold and platinum members could be helped at this counter, after having him recheck our SPG status he found that we were gold member and he agreed to check us in to our room. However he did not apologize for the misunderstanding and was very cold. Our honeymoon package was not available and we were told to pick it up later. Jovan did upgrade us to the beach tower, however our ocean view room also overlooked the parking lot. (Not what I had in mind for my honeymoon.). After talking with 4 different people we finally received our honeymoon package, minus the strawberries and champagne (it took us four tries to get those delivered). The housekeeping staff on the 11th floor left much to be desired, they provided the bare minimum services of clean towels and making the bed. Also I had read in other reviews that there was not enough closet space, I did not find this to be the case. On the positive side the next day things improved greatly. We stopped by the counter (not the gold and platinum counter) and talked with Brandy. Brandy was so helpful she moved us to an ocean front room for an extra $50.00 per day. We could not ask for a more spectacular view. The housekeeping on the 6th floor was great, they kept our room straightened and provided fresh robes daily. We watched the whales from our lanai every morning. Breakfast in the Ono cafÃ© was excellent, I would highly recommend eating there, however the cost is $24 per person, but kids eat free. We had dinner at Tropica and it was okay, but not somewhere I would recommend. The pools at the Westin are beautiful, really cold in the morning but by afternoon they are okay. We rented a cabana by the pool on two days and the pool service was great, they catered to our every need. (If you are wanting to reserve one of the nicer cabanas you should do this as soon as you check in. Amazing as it might seem when we were checking out the service at the gold and platinum counter still fell short of what we have come to expect from Starwood properties. We were billed for a few things that were included in our package. The woman at the counter was difficult and again did not offer an apology. I recommend taking a whale watching tour, try the Gemini II the staff is great and we got to see 6 whales up close. Also donâ€™t miss the dinner show at Warren and Annabelleâ€™s it was one of our favorite evenings. One final note, donâ€™t leave home with out a copy of the book Maui Revealed it is truly invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: JKUTraveler
Reviews.Content: January 15th, 2006 - Just back from a 8 day stay at the Westin. When we first walked in the lobby, we were so impressed by the waterfalls, pink flamingos, ducks, ets... It was a tropical paradise. We upgraded to a ocean view room on the top (11th floor). Our room also overlooked Whaler's Village. While the view was breathtaking, the noise from the delivery trucks at Whaler's Village at 6:00am (the backing up beeping noise) was annoying. But we were in Maui - so I bought earplugs. The service at the Westin is outstanding. We had a whale watching trip planned at 7:00am one morning. The ride to the marina was 30 minutes at a minimum. At 6:30 am I tried to start the rental car only to find the battery dead. We prepaid for this excursion, so we had to be there on time. The valet guys found a pair of jumper cables, found a car, pushed my car out of the parking slot and jumped it in less than 5 minutes. Needless to say, they got a huge tip! Service throughout the hotel was just as great. The Concierge - Only use them if you want to hear about a time share. This really annoyed me. The first time we used the concierge to find out about the Road to Hana. All we wanted was a map and to find a good place to pick up a box lunch. It turned into this long pitch about time shares. At first I thought, okay, let's just listen for a moment - I mean she did give us great information about the secrets of Hana - and then 20 minutes later, it wouldn't end. Every time I used the concierge after that, I would start with, I am here to make reservations at XYZ Restaurant and I am NOT interested in a timeshare. The Pool - Beautiful!!!! BUT COLD. The ocean was warmer than the pool. We did all (every day) of our swimming in the ocean. The pool is crowded by the sunbathers, but you didn't see very many people in the pool (at lease not very long). The water is freezing. Overall, our experience was wonderful. We will be going back to Maui & would stay at the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Xmas Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too read many previous complaints about this resort prior to our spending 11 nights over the prime Christmas vacation. We paid premium dollars for our room and the hotel was at capacity. We loved the hotel, service and overall stay. We really enjoyed the Tropicana restaurant and the quality of the food served. Initially we were surprized at the cost of food in Maui but the Westin was no more expensive then anywhere else on the Island. The rooms could do with an update but as a family of 4 including two early 20's this was ideal place to stay and would definitely go back as the location and beach, golf courses were ideal. We were able to get a golf package which was a little cheaper for 5 rounds of golf. Overall very pleased with the choice of hotel given all the negative comments on this website.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeynla
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand all of the gripe written up on this hotel. It seems that many people using this site get so raved up about minor incidents and decree the entire hotel a waste of money. Yes, it's expensive, as is everything on Maui! So, on with my review. Our stay was perfect from the get-go. It was my birthday, and they upgraded us from the "mountain view" room that we'd paid for to a "deluxe ocean view" room, with a spectacular view (only partially obscured by part of the hotel's facade) of the ocean and the beautiful Westin grounds. Our room was in the newer tower which features slightly larger rooms than those in the original tower. We had the Heavenly King bed as well as a couch, not to mention the large balcony with that gorgeous view. The room was everything one would expect from the high-end Westin name. The hotel grounds were amazing. Gorgeous waterfalls, pools, strolling paths, etc. The lobby isn't even enclosed, but opens up to a lake with swans and waterfalls. Just beautiful! The pools are awesome! We never had any trouble getting chairs, though some people would try to save chairs at 8am, go eat, then return. The hotel doesn't allow this, which is a good thing. After eating breakfast and enjoying a morning stroll, we found nice chairs at the adult pool, near the bar and the waterslide. What an afternoon! The Westin's location is superb. While one can find better snorkeling just up the beach in front of the Sheraton, the beach in front of the Westin is smooth and calm, and perfect for sunbathing and swimming (the beach in front of the Sheraton is a bit steeper, with rougher waves). We walked up to the Sheraton to check out the snorkeling, and also enjoyed drinks at Whaler's Village. For groceries, one can drive just a few miles south of the Westin to a large shopping center with a drug store, supermarket, and plenty of other diversions. The Westin Maui is wonderful. Expensive, but worth it in my opinion. In fact we'll be back again in April!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCTravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful nine days in Maui. For the first 5 days, we stayed at the Westin in Kaanapali and the Fairmont in Wailea for the rest. This was our 4th trip to Maui. Here are some overall comments that people might find useful. The Westin is a great hotel both given its location and the property itself. It is great to be a 2 min walk to the Whalers village with some great dining options, an ABC store and the Maui Dive shop to rent snorkeling and diving equipment. In addition, the â€œblack rockâ€� off the beach near the Sheraton is about a 5-10 minute walk. The Westin is in the Kaanapali area which is a very popular area. As such, the area is crowded but is close to a lot of amenities. Lahaina and Kapalua are about a 10 min drive from the Westin. The Westin is gorgeous with its great lobby, waterfalls, three pools and on one of the best beaches. We had a mountain view room in the Ocean tower. The room was small but comfortable. It was very clean and had the Westin bed and shower. There is a small fridge in the room which we used to store bottled water, sodas and some lunch meat. In order to get a chair by the pool, we needed to be there by 8 am to reserve a chair. The pool service people were good at removing chairs that had been reserved but unoccupied for about an hour (sign says 30 min but an hour is probably better customer service). When we could not get a chair by the pool, we were able to get chairs by the beach for an extra $10 per chair. Do not understand how a lot of people can be so inconsiderate with reserving chairs. We had a family of 6 that reserved 6 chairs at 8 am, went on a snorkeling expedition, did not return till 2 pm and threw a scene about their towels not being there. The Westin charges a $18 a day resort fee. This fee covers your parking (self parking only â€“ valet is an extra $10), free local calls, free internet access from your room and 2 bottles of water per day. Usually parking in big resorts costs this amount so we were fine with the charge. Only two issues with the Westin was the Ono restaurant and the water temperature in the pools . The food at Ono is bad and the lunch offerings were very unexciting. Christmas dinner was awful. However being so close to the Whalerâ€™s village is an advantage. The Whalers village has a food court that has Chinese, Mexican, subs, salads, smoothies and McDonalds which is great for lunch. The pool water was very cold again. Just do not know why they cannot fix this problem. This is our fourth trip back to Maui and is definitely one of our favorite hotels for the value of the money, location and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, but you'll have plenty of company”
Reviews.Author: MWales
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon at the Westin in December 2003, after spending our first week on Oahu. The hotel is excellent; the pool is extensive and great fun with the slides; and the beach is spectacular, especially if you like a bit of rough and tumble in the surf (though be wary of the currents that can drag you up the beach). The staff were very friendly and were keen to assist you from the moment you arrived. The rooms were light and very clean; the beds, as soft as you can get (I've never seen pillows so big!) The food was also of a high standard, but hard to compete with the restaurants in the Whaler's Village a few yards along the beach path. On the down side, so it goes, the Westin can get very busy at this time of year - as we found out. It's not that there isn't plenty of room in the grounds or on the beach to go around, far from it. It's just that some people might find it a little bit too busy. It was unfortunate for us that after three days of sunshine we then had the worse weather Maui's had for five years, so the locals informed us. The streets filled up with water and so did the hotel; to the extent that the lifts in the hotel actually started leaking water like in some disaster movie! The path along the beach at one point was knee-deep from the torrential rain; the sea turned a horrid and violent red and we were forced to cancel our whale-watching trip and our flight over the Big Island. We hired a Ford Mustang to get around and as we drove it home from a restaurant in Lahaina one night, without exagerration, the water on the roads was nearly level with the underside of the car. Other than nature's setbacks, we'd recommend a stay at the Westin to anybody, and Kaanapali Beach as a perfect setting. We'd almost certainly stay at the Westin again. M. Chandler

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot for Families”
Reviews.Author: mlizBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for five nights in November during Thanksgiving week. We were using Starwoods points and paid extra to have two of the best possible rooms in the Beach Tower to accommodate our family of six (mom, dad, 4 kids ages 14, 13, 10 and 9) in connecting rooms (1 King, 2 doubles). It was a good choice for our family although more crowded than we expected due to the annual basketball tournament. We expected it to be crowded because it was Thanksgiving week, but didn't appreciate the fan clubs and college bands playing at pep rallies on the premises while we were hanging at the pool and beach that week. Obviously, not every week is like this and it did not ruin our trip, but be warned if you are planning a Thanksgiving week visit in the future. The pools were terrific and we also loved the beach. Our kids loved the big, twisty slide and had a lot of fun in the connecting pools. Although we didn't use it, there was an "adults-only" pool which is a very nice feature if you are not there with kids. The two restuarants on-site were good and met our expectations. There were an abundance of activities and excursions available to book. We chose to take a great snorkeling trip on a catamaran one day that departed from the beach out front and we absolutely loved it. Another day we went into Lahaina and took surfing lessons at "Goofy Foot" Surfing School. Fantastic fun for kids and adults. Our connecting rooms were on the sixth floor and while they were not spacious they were perfectly fine since we had terrific weather and didn't spend a whole lot of time in the rooms. We had lots of closet space and good housekeeping service every day. The location of the Westin is good. We were looking for 5 days of R&R on a beautiful island where our kids could be kids and we could relax at the pool and beach. By walking on the path along the beach we had the chance to walk past and through some of the other hotels/condos in the Kaanapali area. It confirmed for us that the Westin was the preferred resort in Kaanapali for what we were looking for, with the Hyatt coming in second (we stayed at the Hyatt for our honeymoon). The Westin has the best pool, nice landscaping, plenty of activities to book and the "Whaler's Village" next door. It is a more crowded scene than we would choose if it was just my husband and me traveling but it was great for a family destination. I used the gym and found it to be spacious and well-equipped. I had one treatment in the spa which was beautifully appointed. This is a very busy resort but the management did a nice job of running things smoothly and maintaining a positive, friendly attitude throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunbound
Reviews.Content: The best in Maui, with beautiful views, nicest beach, stunning pools, simple gym with ample cardio equipment and a nice view, great food at all restaurants. This resort has it all...even ants in the room but it was still worth it. Don't leave food in the room or else the ants will seek it out. They do offer a mini fridge in the rooms however the space is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Sticker Shock”
Reviews.Author: penolan
Reviews.Content: I go to Maui twice a year and have stayed at the Westin the past three trips. The hotel is beatiful with a wonderful pool area and easy access to the beach. Onos restaurant is also nice for a simple small plate type dinner. The downside is that the rooms are on the small side and look in need of an overhaul. When booking for this comming May, I found that the room prices have gone up 100 dollars for cheaper rooms. This is totally out of line for the room one gets. I've opted for the Big Island were I can get decent value for my money. I will still spend 7 night at the Westin Villas where I have a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Best Thanksgiving Ever!”
Reviews.Author: famoffivelgnniguel
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at the Westing was amazing! I had read reviews before we left but still thought my expectations are usually higher than most. I was not disappointed! The grounds are beautiful, from the waterfalls to the flamingo's everything was perfect. The staff were very nice and helpful. The room was great and bed super comfy! The waterslide is so much fun and grotto is very cool! The breakfast is great. Each kid eats free with a paying adult. In maui that is helpful! We brought in some fast food from Whalers Village a few nights (right next door). That also helped the wallet! Maui is not cheap! Just to give you an idea, breakfast for three people(2 of our kids were free) was $60.00 each morning. You will love everything about the Westin, just be prepared to spend money!

Reviews.Title: “loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Right can I first start out by saying I HAD been so worried about staying at this resort due to some negative comments about this hotel but if you appreciate my comments below then please do not listen to any of the negative comments about this hotel. I have stayed in may hotels around the world and this was right up there at the top Myself and my wife were there celebrating out honeymoon from Dec 4th -13th. Upon arrival we were greeted with very helpful porters and the usual Maui welcome etc. We checked into our deluxe ocean front room (which I would recommend as the sun is on your balcony all day) and the fun started from there. The concierge are very helpful but be warned, they do try and encourage you to attend the 'timeshare' seminar but if you are strong minded then you simply say no thank you. Our room was fantastic. The beds are 'heavenly' and the showers are the same. We had wonderful views of the pool and the ocean. The ocean was literally 30 yards from our balcony. In and around the resort is very cool and relaxing. We preferred the pool bar at the top of the rocks as the views at sunset are something in itself. The other bar near the ono grill was also good,especially at night when a bartender called 'Frank' is on duty, he makes you laugh. Eating is very good in and around the hotel. On our 1st night ate in the Ono Grill, yes this was expensive but what do you epxect for a 5 star hotel??????? you are not going to get burger and fries for $2.99, its far from mcdonalds. Our 2nd night we booked a table at 'hulas', this was a superb meal and pretty good value for money. This restaurant and others is literally 100 yards from the hotel, a short walk on the beach front and you arrive at Whalers Village. Whalers Village is cool. We found ourselves in a good routine in having mid-afternoon cocktails in the 'rusty Harpoon' then back to the hotel for more drinks. Away from the alcohol, the resort is simply superb stacked with shops from louis Vuitton to the abc convience store There is so much to do in and around the resort. The reason I have gone into this so much as I dont want anyone else to worry about the resort like I did. I booked this holiday in January and have been checking some of the comments ever since. Looking back at these comments now, because I know the resort, some of the comments were totally untrue and unfounded. I think sometimes people will find anything to have a moan about. We walked upto the Sheraton and the pool is small only 1 pool bar didnt seem as nice as the Westin, neither did the Marriott!!! * yes you do have to pay $18 per day for resort fees ie. Towels,water and Internet access in your room..... so drink the bottles of water on your room and take your laptop!!!! * yes, drinks and food are expensive but search around the resort and there are plenty of 'happy hour' deals ie Rusty Harpoon. * The pool area does get a little busy but the beach is literally yards from the hotel....... plenty of room on there folks. * Its a family resort, so you can epxect children.... where else in the world is not these days????? * A wonderful hotel!!! I hope I have put a lot of peoples minds at rest now, I can honestly say that I would love to return to this resort. ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui vs Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Split our 10 night stay between Westin Maui and Sheraton Maui. For our family, Sheraton was the preferred location overall. Your opinion may be different. Read on. Westin Maui: 1. Extremely hectic feeling (the landscape is awesome with waterfalls but add a ton of people noise during the day and it loses ambience quickly) 2. Has more staff on hand to assist you 3. Keiki (Children's) Camp is awesome (especially Nicole, their counselor) 4. Ono Grill serves decent food at high price 5. Terrace serves pretty good food and great view 6. Very helpful and friendly staff 7. Very nicely equipped workout room (didn't use a minute of it!) 8. Good pools Sheraton Maui: 1. Awesome snorkeling right at your footstep 2. Relaxed and more serene atmosphere (reminds us of Jamaica) 3. Ample parking 4. Fabulous view (if you get ocean front) 5. Fairly helpful staff but minimally staffed compared to Westin 6. Restaurant food match up to prices quite well (except for the breakfast buffet) 7. Kid's pool - wading area and 3 ft area Not very impressed by both locations' rooms and bathrooms but no complains since we spent minimal time in the rooms even though we had ocean front/view rooms. If you have little kids, both places are fun but Sheraton has the kid's pool. Older kids will prefer the Westin slides at their pools. If you want to try out snorkeling and scuba, definitely pick Sheraton because it's right at your doorstep. We decided on the Starwood properties over other properties like Hyatt and Ritz (all about the same price as we received great package offers.) We checked out both locations and was very happy with our decisions. Hyatt probably has better pools but was even more crowded! The thing that pushed us to Sheraton over Hyatt was the beach. Review on Hyatt's lack of beach was the major reason we avoided Hyatt and the review was correct. To get my little ones to the beach was not as easy at the Ritz as it was surrounded by the golf course. If you decide on Maui, do get the "Maui Revealed" book if you intend to venture outside of your resort. You'll find great tidepools, beaches, activities and food recommendations. As for food, if you decide to eat at Whaler's Village, we love Leilani's (lunch and dinner). Hula Grill was quite good too. Rusty Harpoon service and food is mediocre at best (lunch and dinner). Sansei close to Ritz at Kapalua is as good as advertised. Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina is decent but Da Kitchen in Kihei serves awesome local food. For Califonians, you will most likely find David Paul a tad bit overrated. Wished we had time to try Pacific'O. We found no reason to try Moose McGillycuddys or Roys as they're readily available in California. Hope this helps. Definitely get "Maui Revealed" book. Enjoy your trip. We did ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: acctgdweeb001
Reviews.Content: The Westin on Maui has a gorgeous pool and lobby area. The hotel was way too crowded. I have stayed in the area at the Hyatt which is more spacious and seemed less crowded. We had a Mountain View room which was very small and the bathroom was as small as a broom closet. We booked a king size bed when making our reservation but ended up in a room with double beds as there were no king size beds available in the mountain tower and we were not willing to upgrade to the ocean tower for a king size bed at an additional $180 per night. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from a Westin Property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin has great pools and grounds, good service and nice restaurants, but the rooms are poor for the price. Too small, worn out, and the "heavenly" showers were nothing more than what you get at a Motel 6 except for the two showerheads. Beds were comfortable, but not spectacular. We have stayed at the Embassy Suites (Maui) and Ko Olina Marriot(Oahu)recently and they were, especially Ko Olina, much nicer for about the same price. The workout room is very small and has limited equipment. The Spa services were great but expensive. Go at least once to David Paul's in Lahaina. The food and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: KMac19
Reviews.Content: After all of the negative reviews, I was not expecting too much but boy was I suprised. The lobby area is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. We were given flower leis at arrival and promptly checked in. Our room was a decent size but the view was spectacular (we had a beach and pool view). No there is not much closet space but who really brings a lot of clothes that need to be hung when they are staying at the beach! It was enough room to hang the clothes that needed to be hung (for 2 people). The room was very clean at arrival and was cleaned daily. The maid never forgot our water, in fact, we received double one day. We never had a problem finding parking in the self parking lot. The pools are great, we especially loved the adults only pool. I saw them ask children to leave the area a couple of times. The rest of the pools were great too. Very kid friendly but kids were never a problem. We made sure to go in each pool and down both slides. It was never a problem finding two chairs together, no matter what time we went to the pool. The spa was excellent. I had an 80 minute Lomi Lomi massage and it was everything I could hope for. We were never bothered, or even approached, by the timeshare people. We choose to do one off of the resort property and ended up signing up. The location could not be any better. Many nights, we walked right next door to the Whalers Village to eat and shop. They have a wide range of shops...from the ABC store to Tiffany. We ate several times at Leilanis (downstairs) and watched the sunset. Lahaina is a quick drive (10 mins) or if you are going to drink, a $10 cab ride. In Lahaina, I do recommend Bubba Gumps for the great location (pretty much over the water) and Kobe Japanese Steakhouse. The food was terrific. All in all, the resort was spectacular and I will stay there each time we visit Maui. Just one thing, they need to add the $18/day resort fee into the room price instead of as an additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “The real deal on the Westin”
Reviews.Author: pattyatips
Reviews.Content: I would give this property 4.5 stars if I could, we loved it. But here's the real deal at this place. You have to be in the Beach Tower. This tower is newer and the rooms are larger, as are the lanais. We had a beautiful premium ocean view on the highest floor (11) and could not have been happier. The lanai accomodated our family of 4 quite well and the room looked as it had been recently redone. Nice bathroom, not huge, but nice. Great heavenely beds. The location of this resort is superb. Walked about 100 steps to Whalers Village for dinner several nights. The pools are awesome. Yes, chairs are tight but we never had a hard time finding one and we were there during the Maui invitational basketball tournament. The only negative I would say is that it is crowded, maybe because of the tournament. It seemd a bit "Vegas-like" with the crowds but it was also fun with all the excitement of the games. This is not a five star property so don't expect the same type of environment. But we had a blast and enjoyed it very much with all the waterfalls, birds, flamingos, etc. Go into it knowing your won't be getting Evian spritzed on you at the pool and you'll do great and make sure to splurge on the Beach Tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “At These Prices, I Expect a Closet”
Reviews.Author: MissPicante
Reviews.Content: The rooms here do not compare with the landscaped grounds and lobby areas. Our room was cramped and dark. There was no closet, just eighteen inches of hanging space in an armoire that also held the tv. Bathroom light was so dim it was like a nightlight-when we asked for a better bulb we were told that actually they use even dimmer ones and we should be happy with what we had. The planters on our lanai were empty and had chipped black paint on the insides. Not an attractive place to spend time and relax. From the lanai we could see several bright orange tar cans that had been left there by the maintenance crew for several days. The main problem with this hotel is that they have tried to cram too many people onto what is actually a fairly small property. The lounge chairs around the pool are all touching each other, so to get on one you have to crawl up from the bottom and hold your drink the entire time because there are no side tables and you can't put your drink under your chair because the chairs are all firmly together. It's a bit like being in bed with strangers on either side of you. I'm trying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: Prycer
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I just got back from staying at the Westin Maui (11/11-11/15). I was extremely hesitant on staying at this resort due to all of the negative reviews. I have to honestly say I went with low expectations, boy was I surprised. I was suppose to get a mountain/golf view ($260 per night) and they double upgraded me to a full on ocean room. It was my 40th birthday and left in the room was a chilled bottle of champagne. I cannot say anything negative about the resort. We requested a late check-out since we were on a red-eye flight and they let us stay in the room until 4pm without any extra charges. Also there were a couple of charges on my bill that were wrong and they immediately removed the charges without questioning me. The only thing I would not recommend on doing is the time share presentation. They say it is only 90 minutes but I was in there for 2 1/2 hours. The â€œcloserâ€� was really nasty because I said no to purchasing the time share. I do not hold this against the resort because I requested to do the time share. Not once was I asked to do a time share at this resort. If you are a golfer I highly recommend going to The Plantation golf course. I do not play but my boyfriend does and I have to say that it was the most beautiful golf course I have ever seen. If you play after 1pm the cost drops from $250 to $100. If you have any questions please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Fab time at the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 4 nights at the Westin Maui in September for one leg of our honeymoon. It is fantastic! We loved every minute in it. We were upgraded when we arrived and had the most magnificent view of the pool and beach! Rooms are spacious and the beds are sooo comfortable! The pools are brilliant and the whole area is really lovely! What can I say, we'd give anything to go back but given the distance I can't see that happening for a long while!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way for every age!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pools! The bars! The beach walk that connects the neighboring hotels! I can go on and on. Their service,location, and cleanliness of the Westin is excellent. We had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Somethings that can make it even better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: * Pros: - Very nice and clean pools, spectacular beach. - Public areas (lobby, garden,...) are nice and clean. - Bed is very comfortable, true heaven feels. - Very close to the Whalers Village, just next door. - Walkable to Black Rock - Wonderful snorkeling place. - Utilizable Sheraton Maui hotel facilities: pools, bars,... * Cons: - Elevator: Old. Remodelling is needed. - Room: + Noisy: Thin wall with no noise control at all. Heard all conversations of next room, very annoying. + Cleaniess: Small bug was found under the refrigerator door. - So so customer service. - 2 bottle water + internet service for $18.00 additional charge/day, no matter you use them or not. They avoid to directly put it into the room rate to increase the competition under price comparison. * IMO, this hotel only deserves 3-1/2 stars. I will try Sheraton next time. One out-of-topic but important thing need to tell is DO NOT buy Pleasant Holidays transportation optional package, the shuttle is just as horrible as you can think. Last year was really good but no more. They cut back to increase profit by contracting with worst quality transportation vendor. You can easily get a better service with less or similar price. Believe me, you won't get lost on the island. Although, Pleasant Holidays Hotel and Air package is good on both price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there Oct 8-15th 2005 Beautiful hotel and grounds. Friendly staff. Didn't eat on property, can't say anything about the food. Next door to Whaler's village/great shopping! Everything was great - any questions? Email me at cdjjs@earthlink.net. Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: sgsilva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Maui for a week in October 2005. The grounds, pool, & beach are all beautiful. The service was great and very welcoming. The room was on the smaller side, but tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. We checked out all of the neighboring hotels on Kanapalli and deceided that we had made the best choice. We ate almost every lunch by the pool or in the outdoor restaurant. For lunch they were great and convient. However I would not recommend eating dinner at the hotel as the food isn't very good. Definately eat at Leilani's next door in the Whalers Village and for a really special meal, David Paul's in Lahina is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: travelerof3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Westin in Maui after spending a week there. There's nothing really wrong with the hotel, but it's not as outstanding as some others that we've stayed at for the same price or less. The hotel is very nice and clean. The grounds are very lush and tropical. When we arrived, we were immediately upgraded to a partial ocean view room which was nice. A lot of the previous reviews said that the rooms were really small, but our room was a reasonably sized room. The previous reviews said the lanai was small, but it was certainly big enough for two people to sit on and relax comfortably. The room had a refrigerator which was nice. We were able to get some snacks and drinks and keep them in the refrigerator instead of constantly paying the high price for the drinks at the hotel. The daily resort fee was a bit much for free internet access, parking, a newspaper, health club access, and free water everyday, but there's no way out of it. They said that we only got 2 free waters a day, but we easily ended up getting 4 free waters a day. Still not worth $18/ day. The restaurants at the hotel left a lot to be desired. They were expensive and just so so. We had a breakfast buffett everyday which was nice, but for $23.75/ person it would have been nice if it had more variation throughout the days of the week instead of the same thing everyday. The food at the pool was expensive. A gardenburger was $14. We ended up ordering off of the kids menu and the servings were adult size, but at kid prices. We were somewhat surprised that they let us, but they didn't bat an eye. The hotel was located right next to the Whaler's Village which is a shopping center with nice shops and some restaurants. The restaurants were about the same price as the hotel restaurants (or maybe a little cheaper,) but had more variety and slightly better food. In the evenings, they were always crowded with a good 45minute to 1hr + wait. The pools were great. There were 5 of them. We never went to the adults only pool, but it looked the same as the rest. There were not that many kids there (I'm guessing because of the time of year.) So, we were able to enjoy all pools without kids bugging us. It was a little wierd that they didn't have a kiddie pool anywhere, but whatever. There were some nice slides and grottos and waterfalls all around that were fun to swim around. You could rent cabana's for $50/ day or $25/ for a half day or chaise lounges and umbrella's on the beach for $25/ day. Either way, you were kicked out at 4:30pm whether you were finished or not. I kept reading about the great service at the pool and wondered if I went to the same hotel. Two out of the 5 days that we went to the pool, there was one waitress for all 5 pools. She was fantastic and did a great job all things considered, but when she has to take care of 5 pools..... It took a while to get food or drink. The prices of drinks was outrageous! We paid $10 for a regular frozen drink and $6.50 for a virgin frozen drink! We finally went to the Safeway down the street and bought the ingredients to make our own and took them to the pool. We weren't really harassed that much with sales pitches about the time share which somewhat surprised us. Before we arrived, we received several phone calls at our house in CA to make sure we stopped by the concierge as soon as we got there to pick up a gift. We also had a couple of phone calls the day we arrived, but we never stopped by the desk because we were too afraid of getting roped into a sales pitch. We found out the gift was a paper bag with a picture of the resort on it. We didn't feel like we missed out on much. All in all, there's nothing really wrong with the hotel. There are just better hotels closer by for about the same amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Maui was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Westin Maui. After arriving at the airport it is worth hiring a car in Maui at the airport for your stay, saves a fortune on transfer, and the hiring of the car worked out cheaper for my family of five. We hired a Buick people mover with a dvd player, which kept the kids quiet, donâ€™t forget to take dvds along. On the drive from the airport you drive past Kmart which is 5 minutes on your left as you drive to the Westin. At Kmart you can purchase any additional items that you forgot or didnâ€™t want to carry like chillers, masks, snorkels, bogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas etc that you forgot to pack. About a few more minutes up on the left are 10 factory outlets like the Sports Authority, liquor, Old Navy shops etc for those extras. After I suppose a 30-40 minute drive along the coast, which was beautiful we arrived at the Westin Maui, we were greeted with leis on arrival. The entry and front desk area is magnificent, with the waterfalls, pond, fish and birds. Our 2 rooms were mountain view and normal size and fine, and I donâ€™t go on holidays to vacation in my room. Dresser and wardrobe space was adequate for the tropics, Iâ€™m not going on a world cruise and require a walk in wardrobe as some other reviewers have stated??? The room was quite well presented with the dÃ©cor and presentation. It was cleaned daily on time, and the staff were prompt and courteous for any matters referred to for extra pillows or linen. I think it has paid off for the Westin to stop the sharing scheme for pools between Sheraton Maui and the Westin Mauiâ€¦ The only ones complaining are the Sheraton guests, but now at the Westin you can always get a lounge at any time by the pool. The pools were fantastic for the kids and the kids at heart. I saw lots of honeymooners, and they seemed to be down by the normal pools and not by the adultâ€™s only pool, but the honeymooners always have that option. The waterslide was great fun too. The timeshare people never annoyed us, I did a morning presentation at 9.30 and the family got fed too, muffins, juice pastries. $100 voucher for food and a 50% off next stay voucher too. We didnâ€™t have breakfast, by the time we got up by 10â€™ish it was almost time for lunch. We generally got fresh fruit salad from next door at the Whalers shopping shops if we felt hungry or the ABC store for sandwiches. We did have dinner a few times in the tapas bar by the poolside, which was good. Cocktails and food by the pool were the normal prices and the quality you would expect. I have no complaints about food or their service at the Westin. We had dinner at the Rusty Harpoon, which cost us $150 for 2 adults and 3 children with the kids having childrenâ€™s meals, the food was fine. I wouldnâ€™t call it great value but hey I was on holidays. Down at Lahaina town we went to Buba Gumps, which initially I wasnâ€™t sure about, but it only cost us $75 and the meal passed my expectations, so I would recommend it to anyone. We did some driving on Maui, but limited our driving to the west side of Maui which was quite picturesque. We went snorkeling o Black Rock, which is 5 minutes north up the beach next to the Sheraton Maui. I think this is the easiest and best sport in Maui for a quick snorkel. We saw sea turtles, sting rays and numerous tropical fish. Just a few tips, I would take some bread like a bread roll to feed the fish when snorkeling. Also, if you want to hire the snorkeling stuff just hire it from the Maui Dive shop in Whalers Village as they seem the best value, for example mask, fins, snorkel, mesh bag and they put some no-fog gell in the mask for $7.95 for the day per person, there are other packages but well worth it. Make sure you buy one of those dispossible underwater cameras too. Plus if you have smaller children hire a boggie baord too for $5 a day. Go to mauidiveshop website and then go to rentals tab. Whalers Village was right next door and had all the normal up market stores to kept the females busy too. The ABC shop was very handy, we bought a lot of snacks etc plus it was the cheapest place for ice creams. It might also be worth getting the Hawaii edition of the entertainment book, but Maui was very limited for coupons, unless you were also going to Oahu. But thatâ€™s another review I still have to write. Overall, the Westin Maui was great and we look forward to coming back very soon with my all the family again. I would recommend it for anyoneâ€¦ family, couples, honeymooners, old, but for singles not really the right place to meet other singles. For the other negative reviews that have been placed, I just cannot understand what they are going on about and could not fault anything here. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: 12142011d
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Maui for 7 nights (10/3/05-10/10/05) for our honeymoon. We would both higly recommend this hotel to anyone taking a trip to Maui. Service was excellent, room was nice, pools were great, and the beach was fabulous. We would also recommend the private Ka'anapali Sunset Dinner they offer, it was unbelievable. The rooms were a little on the small side but for the amount of time you are actually in the room it shouldn't matter. There were always plenty of chairs available by the pool and we had no problem with there being too many children. There were some but they never made excess commotion. The location of the hotel is also excellent, with plenty of dining options in Whaler's Village right next door. We also took advantage of the Spa which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay at the Westin Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just back from our honeymoon in Maui. We stayed at the Westin and to be sure, our stay there was great. Sure, there were a few snags (nothing's perfect...unless you shell out tip top dollar that is), but all in all, our stay was very nice. The good parts --->> The pool complex (five huge pools -- all very big -- one for adults only -- great fun), service (all but the front desk), room (be sure to get an ocean view, unless you like getting woken up by car alarms), food (both at the hotel and in nearby restaurants -- all somewhat expensive, but VERY good --- but heck, you're in Maui), atmosphere (very festive -- the hotel brought in dancers every night for a short pool-side show -- nice touch), lobby (holy cow -- very big and GREAT layout -- what a way to greet guests), spa (now ranked the best on Maui -- this is a pro outfit all the way -- we got a couples massage right next to a stream near the pool -- very cool), workout room (very nice equipment), location (The Westin is right next door to Whalers Village, which is an upscale shopping center with some really great restaurants as well), animals (fish in the ponds are huge - flamingos in same areas are very cool -- the well fed swans were big, friendly, and fun to feed -- the tropical birds in the eating area were cool), personal patio (they're small, but every room has one and it's very nice for viewing sunsets), HEAVENLY BEDS (A+++++++ --- no other hotel offers such...and lemme tell you, these things are NICE!). The not-so-good --->> Very busy when we were there (this could be seen as a good though too --- everyone wants to stay at The Westin), hard to get a shaded pool chair (people would come down and "reserve" a shaded pool chair very early in the day by simply putting a towel on it -- major drag), parking (the lot was a bit full, which made it hard to find a spot sometimes), daily resort fee ($18 per day -- this is just another way for the hotel to get a little more out of it's guests -- their way for charging you for a newspaper and some other stuff that would be nice to just get for free), room size (the rooms are small, but our ocean side view on the 9th floor made up for it -- you won't care either as soon as you see a Maui sunset dressed in your robe with a beverage in your hand while standing on your personal patio), carpet in the hallways (these need a re-boot), elevators (a bit slow sometimes and bit dank -- you can tell these things get a ton of use -- a quick overhaul on all would be a nice touch), employees at the front desk (these folks weren't the nicest we encountered, but they're the ones that hear any/all complaints --- I'd be a little cranky too if I was the one to catch all the flack in such a big place). Tips ---> 1) Get an ocean view room. 2) Don't use the concierge to book island activities, unless you want to get seriously overcharged. Would we stay at The Westin again? You betcha!!!! Thanks for a great stay Westin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back last night from a 5 night stay at the Westin. First, let me start with the positives....if you like pools, this is the place for you. They are beautiful with lots of comfy chase lounges and great poolside service. (I have the bill to prove that!) We never had any problems finding a great chair, even on the busier days which were Friday and Saturday. It is also right next to a terrific section of beach so if you like to swim in the ocean, you will love it here. By far the biggest disappointment was the room. They are rather on the small side but as long as you haven't packed alot of clothes you can make it work. But the thing that bothered me the most was the noise factor. I am a light sleeper and you could hear the conversation of the people in the room next to you! If they went out on the balcony it was even worse. Luckily, we had quiet neighbors the first few nights, but the last two nights we were awoken several times by out neighbors....they weren't even being that loud it's just that the walls are that thin. So if you are a light sleeper I would suggest bringing a small fan or some other noise blocking device with you. The staff was just so-so, except for the poolside servers who were terrific. I don't think we would ever stay here again unless we got a really really good deal...too expensive compared to other properties we have stayed at while on Maui, like the Sheraton, Hyatt, Four Seasons, and the Wailea Renaissance. The rooms of those hotels don't even compare with this one....but if you like pools, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about the Westin because of the reviews I read - boy was I wrong! This resort is beautiful - we walked into the lobby and were greeted by a man with lei's a little futher was a girl with tropical juices for us - nice touches! The lobby is amazing with flamingos and waterfalls. We reserved a premium deluxe ocean front room - The only downfall was the first room they put us in - next to the elevators, too noisey - I called down and within a few minutes we were in our new room. The rooms are plenty big and the heavenly beds are exactly that. The pools are very nice and having an adult only pool is a good idea. The location is good - the Whalers Village has a lot of great stores - The Westin has a lot of good restaurants - Tropica's and a great bar - Ono's with some really nice bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “Maui View”
Reviews.Author: mxhawaii
