Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin. Our 27th wedding anniversary. We got a room upgrade, Champagne delivered to our room and preferred seats for dinner. We are not even tourists we live on Oahu! They were great, service and view were amazing. I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin in Maui and loved almost everything about it. After reading several mixed reviews on Trip Advisor we were interested to see what our experience would be. We found everyone on the staff to be very helpful (I've NEVER seen so many concierges at one hotel before) and they "offered" the time share sales pitch option only once and in the most "un-pushy" and low key way I have ever experienced. The few times we had to call down about something, the response was almost immediate. The resort is absolutely beautiful and excellently maintained. The lobby and outside area was so appealing with the huge number of waterfalls, lush foliage, and colorful water birds. We found (in late September) that it was not overcrowded at the pool area at any time, and the pool lounges were far nicer and more comfortable than the vinyl ones at many other hotels. Our room was quite small but nicely equipped, we had a marvelous mountain view from our balcony and we saw rainbows many afternoons. The "heavenly bed" is quite comfortable, the sheets are really soft, and the pillow menu has something for everyone. The Westin is nicely located such a short walk from the Whaler's Village which has scads of restaurants (of all price points) and shops. The only slightly negative things we would say are: *housekeeping often didn't get our room made up until late in the afternoon; *we don't feel that we got our money's worth out of the $18 per day "extras" charge since the only part of it we really used was the 2 bottles of water each day ( housekeeping forgot to put the water in our room 2 of the days we were there, but it was brought to us right away when we called down); *they really don't have near enough non-valet parking (but when we arrived late on our first night there we were told that when the lot is full they'll valet park for resort guests at no charge). These tiny negatives were nothing in comparison to the beauty of the Westin, its wonderful location, and accomodating staff. We would stay there again "in a New York minute" and will recommend it to our friends. While on Maui be sure to drive the road to Hana; eat at "Cheeseburgers in Paradise" and shop in Lahaina; go up to Haleakala and marvel at the landscape (go for sunrise, or sunset, or just in the middle of the day...it's so worth the ride!). Maui is one place where it really is a good idea to rent a car!

Reviews.Title: “Westin was a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the pools- they were the best part of this hotel. The beach is beautiful but I was annoyed that they charge $5 to rent a chair till 4:30pm when you have to give it back. The service is pretty good (not as top notch as some places in Wailea but still very good). The location is great- close to Old Lahaina and Whaler's Village. I love the water falls, koi, black swan and flamingos- VERY original and beautiful. The rooms are ok- small. And the patios are tiny- just a couple of chairs and a small table- but excellent views for sunsets. We only ate breakfast there- which was ridiculously overpriced, but great service. Make sure you try the POG juice! They also charge you $18/night there that includes parking but valet is an additional $10/day. So be prepared to spend some cash! Overall we had a very good experience and I would stay there again- it does look like the nicest hotel in that area. The hot tub is a bit small but the waterslide makes up for it. :) And the other bonus is that Black Rock at the Sheraton is just a 5 minute walk and that is excellent snorkelling. The Sheraton is their sister hotel so you can rent the gear w/ your room key.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort, Annoying Time share salespeople”
Reviews.Author: GUJUsweetpea
Reviews.Content: ill keep this to the point. wife and i were in HI for a 2 wk vacation, stayed in honolulu, maui and kaui. were originally booked at marriott maui, which was a dump, walked over next door to the westin, which was MUCH prettier. got a BEAUTIFUL room for $10 more per night. positive: beutiful resort: rooms/gym/towels/lounge chairs/restaurants excellent pool on the beach- which is perfect only $10 more per night than the marriott next door (a TOTAL DUMP) negative: pushy timeshare folks, but hey, we signed up for the $$ discounts had such a great time, became SPG members!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel property, great location”
Reviews.Author: LarryA
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a beautiful property located on our favorite part of Maui (Kanaapali beach). The hotel delivers on service & hospitality, clean well appointed, appropriately decorated rooms, beautiful grounds and top location. It's located on a beachwalk that connects about a dozen hotels, making visiting other properties & restaurants very convenient. Another plus is its location right next to Whalers Village, a great shopping mall that has 2 of the best and most reasonable eating establishments "Hula Grill and Leilani's" (owned by the same owner as Duke's). This is all the more significant seeing how the Westin has little to boast in the restaurant dept. The Hyatt property would be our first choice but for significantly less money the Westin is the next best thing. They also have a time share not too far from the property, which we didn't like as well for our interests, and there was no pressure to go on one of the timeshare presentations. The Westin seems to be above that. The spa was used by both my wife and I. We found it quite nice but not quite as nice as some of the other hotel features. My wife was not impressed as there was not much of a relaxing ambience (no dimmed lights, candles, fountains etc. in the "relaxation" area). Next time we will go to the spa at the Hyatt. The Spa staff are lovely, as are all the hotel staff. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the negative reviews here, and wonder if we even stayed at the same hotel. Maybe we had lower expectations, but my wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay at the Westin. Negatives: The walls are very thin, and you can hear people in other rooms fairly clearly. This didn't bother us too much, though, and I'd forgotten about it till I read another review here. The hot tub was surprisingly small for such a large hotel, and not deep enough. Postives: We thought the service was great, the room was spacious, extremely comfortable, and had a beautiful view. The 5 or 6 pools are very nice, though perhaps a little cold for my taste. All the staff were very friendly, and they had talking parrots that sat around in the morning. The white one is very friendly and will sit on your shoulder. After a week at the Westin for our honeymoon, we certainly have no regrets about our hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: Irochka111
Reviews.Content: I spent my honeymoon here in January. I really liked it. The room was very well kept, the service was good, the restaurants were a little pricy, but the food was excellent. The beach, I was not too crazy about, as I did not like the high waves and the water was not blue and calm, but it is not the hotel's fault, it is just that this beach area doesn't have these kinds of waters, if that is what you are looking for. Overall, I had a nice time, because we traveled a lot in a rent a car and the island of Maui is soooo beautiful. The hotel was very nice, but we really did not spend all that time in it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this is the same hotel that's been reviewed so negatively by others. We chose this hotel specifically for the pool and we were not disappointed in any way. It was not overcrowded and for those who only want to be around adults, there's an adults only pool. It was fun, relaxing and we appreciated the food and drinks. They've also created a policy to prevent people from saving pool chairs. We watched a woman lay towels down on 6 lounge chairs in the shade and then leave. After 30 minutes, the pool attendant removed them so others could use the lounges. When we first arrived, we were greated with lei's and a sense of humor. No line for check-in. Complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room. We rented a cabana on the beach the first day. What a treat! It was so comfortable. Even though we weren't supposed to receive any food or beverage service down at the beach, the cabana attendant came by with ice water and pineapple several times. They even allowed us to do a half day rate. Sure there was an invitation to view the timeshare property ($100 for 90 minutes of your time), but the whole island seems to be doing this. Some people seemed excited about the offer. We weren't so we just said no. Every interaction we had with a staff member was positive, down to the maid greeting me with a friendly "Good Morning". Thank you Thad and Stephanie. The one time parking was not available we were treated to complimentary valet parking. The day we checked out our flight was not until 10:30p.m. They were not able to extend out check-out time as the room was reserved. However they did allow us to use the pool and facilities throughout the day and provided us with 30 minutes use of a suite in which to shower and change for our trip home. The location was perfect, great beach, close to Lahaina, close to Black Rock, and the Whalers Village mall where there's an inexpensive food court and photo developing. We just wanted to be sure to put in a positive review on behalf of the Westin. We had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: dravila
Reviews.Content: Last year we received a coupon to come and enjoy the Westin Maui for a special price of $749.00, so even though I had reservations about coming, due to a prior experience at the same Hotel, we booked our family vacation. We also decided to extend our stay, so we stayed 4 extra days at the Napili Kai, then the 5 nights at the Westin and we stayed an extra night as well. At the Napili Kai, we had a lovely stay, but when walking into the Westin, the atmsophere changed. Our rooms were the size of a crackerjack box, and when the air came on in the room, a chunk of mold came spewing out of the vents! My children rented a movie which cost $15.99 each, and to check their e-mail they were charged $10.41 (4x) to check it 1 time. We decided to go to the pool and on one occassion I was verbally abused by one guest at 6:30 in the morning for removing a pair of shoes from a chair under a cabanna! This same thing happened the first time we stayed at the Westin! So, here I am already planning my vacation for next year, and thinking to myself what I don't want in a vacation when the Westin came to mind.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: giulietta429
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from September 7 to September 12. The stay could not have gone smoother. As we walked in, we were greeted with lei and welcomed. In the beautiful open-air lobby a woman took our picture near a waterfall. On check-in, we were upgraded (without asking) from a terrace room (non-view, parking lot) to a full ocean view at no extra charge. We went to the Westin on a package $749 for 5 nights, with rental car included (midsize) and a $100 resort certificate. Having read all the negative reviews, we were worried, but it was simply perfect. Our room (#656) was spacious, very clean, beautifully decorated, and had a wonderful view. Housekeeping was timely every day. The parking lot was always full so we got free valet parking. We used the resort certificate to pay the $18/day resort fee. We also got a welcome gift (calendar) and a Westin shopping bag. As part of the resort fee, we could have gotten a free portrait sitting and a 4x6 photo, but we did not arrange for it. The pools, the landscaping, the waterfalls - were picture perfect. The hot tub was relaxing as well. They could have enforced the no-babies in the hot tub policy a bit better. the adult pool was warmer than the other pools. The waterslide was an absolute blast. The waterslide attendant taught us how to go really fast and we just could not get enough of it. We felt like kids again (I am 26, my boyfriend is 33). We walked up and down Ka'anapali beach comparing the Westin to other resorts and decided that it was the best. It's fabulous pools and central location (right next to Whaler's Village, close to the Black Rock) made it a wonderful place to be. I did not find concierges to be pushy in terms of time shares. We did not attend a timeshare presentation (although the idea behind the deal that we got was to encourage us to attend one; it was not required so we did not go). I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui for a week in September. We had a great time. There were several aspects of the Westin, however, that left a bit to be desired. First, this Westin is not up to the standard of other Westins where we have stayed. It is not a "luxury" hotel. As other reviews have noted, the rooms are small and not the most clean. There is limited drawer and closet space. The furniture looked a bit beat-up. The Heavenly Beds are cozy, but if you want clean sheets daily or turn-down service, you'll have to request it. The first room we stayed in had a vague smell of mold. The workout room is cramped and not air conditioned enough. The hallways are also stuffy from an apparent lack of air conditioning. The pool area is very attractive and well-maintained. Overall, however, the facility is aging and not really what I'd consider a luxury property. Second, customer service is not great. We faced a long line for check-in. The reason why was apparent when we reached our agonizingly slow clerk. What should have been a quick transaction took about 10 minutes. When we got to our room, we had a question about it, which we tried to resolve by calling the front desk. No one would answer the phone. So, we went back downstairs and waited in line again to speak with a clerk. When I told him we tried calling but couldn't get through, he said, "Yeah, we're really busy." Not the right answer! How about an apology? The pool staff were generally equally clueless and disdainful of customers. There were several times when I went to the front desk or the pool desk, was the only person waiting there for help, and would have to wait for the several employees working to stop their own conversations amongst themselves before I would be acknowledged. Not good. Third, and this would not be a drawback for everyone, there were a lot of kids. We did not expect to see so many children on vacation after Labor Day! That said, the Westin Maui has several strengths. The first is its location. It is right on beautiful Kaanapali Beach. It's walking distance to Whalers Village and a couple minutes' drive to Lahaina. There is a lot to do very close to the hotel. If you enjoy snorkeling, you can walk to Black Rock, at the end of the beach on front of the Sheraton, and see tons of fish right off the beach. We'd agree with other positive reviews of Hula Grill. The food is very good and much more reasonably priced than the Westin food. Hula Grill has a wonderful view of the ocean, and you can sit at a table with your toes in the sand, sip a fruity drink, and watch the sun set while you enjoy the nightly live Hawaiian music. The staff there was great, and they also have a good happy hour. Lahaina is a fun place to walk around, shop, and eat and drink. We ate at I'o and David Paul's Lahaina Grill and both were excellent. The pool and beach areas are great. The pool area is meticulously landscaped and includes an adults-only pool. The one drawback to the pool area is it has limited shade. The spots under the umbrellas were usually claimed early and remained taken all day. So, unless you wanted to bake in the sun all day, you had to stake your claim to a shady spot early! But the pool and beach overall are very, very nice. One final note -- while I find hotel food in general to be overpriced and mediocre, we enjoyed the lunches served poolside. There are several tasty healthy options such as salads and lighter wrap sandwiches. While the drinks are overpriced, the food prices were reasonable, especially given that eating at the pool is more convenient than getting up and going elsewhere. Overall, Maui was a great place to visit, and the Westin was nice, but it may not be what you're looking for if you're considering splurging on a "luxury" vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: BDE
Reviews.Content: If you are a Starwood Platinum member you will really enjoy this hotel. We had reserved a standard room on points and were upgraded to a great ocean view room. There should be very little compliants about the beds as they all have the Westin Hevenly Bed that makes the night sleep great. The hotel, pool, spa, and location was much better than we expected. The hotel is a bit crowded at times and lacked a good evening bar, but the spa did make up for that. Utilize the spa and as a perferred guest you get free access and also 20% off spa services. If you are a golfer, pass on the Konapoli Course and make your way up to Kapalua. Also, pass on the resturants at Whalers Village and go to Lahaina. Overall our 5 nights at the Westin were great. I travel a lot and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd to None”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 days at the Westin Maui for our honeymoon in July. I was a little concerned with some of the reviews I had read prior to our trip but after staying there myself I have to wonder what these people were thinking about. I almost find it hard to believe that they were at the same resort. The Westin was everything I expected and more. It was expensive but what in Hawaii isn't. The pool is the best in Kaanapali, and the beach behind the resort is beautiful. There is plenty of room on this beach compared to the Hyatt (grass, a steep drop off, and approxiamately a 10ft wide swath of sand). Your right next door to Whalers Village which offers some of the best shopping on the island and 5 minutes from old town Lahaina. The hotel service was prompt and extremely friendly and the concierge was right on the money when recommending David Paul's (first class restuarant in downtown Lahaina). The American Express travel desk has the ability to book just about any type of event or experience that you may be interested in. You could stand in the lobby for hours and marvel at the sight of waterfalls, flamingo's, parrots, and huge coi fish swimming beneath your feet. My wife and I are going back next year for our 1 year anniversary and we will not even entertain the idea of checking out a few other hotels before booking at the Westin again. This is the place to stay, hands down. There is so much more that this resort has to offer but I could go on for hours.

Reviews.Title: “Bad management. Nice resort. But wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: adamak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Maui for a week. Let me tell you this hotel is not in the luxury category, not even moderate-luxury. The location is perfect, resort is beautiful. But the service is very inconsistent. And the pool area is a zoo. Pool towel desk didn't open until 8am. You just can't get any towels if you're at the pool earlier. We were there in Sept, so technically not peak season. Still lots of kids screaming, running around. But I expected that & dealed with it. However, the pool attendants were just not up to par with their services. We were yelled at by other guests. The pool attendant, instead of trying to ease the guests angers, decided to fuel it. She just stood there, and let the whole fiasco go on. I eventually talked to 2 managers, who agreed with me. By that time I was embarrassed, and angry. The bottom line is, these staff are just not trained to handle difficult situations or solve any problems. They just DON'T CARE. We went to Four Seasons afterwards, and it's night and day difference. Room is small and dated. Lots of stains on the carpet. Was promised turndown service, but none until I requested it. Safe broke after 2 days. Plastic pieces in our bed sheets. Westin Maui is not cheap. But yet they still nickel and dime you. Valet parking is $12 a day. Resort fee $19 daily. Very limited pool service. No lounge bars or anything. Food was OK, but nothing to write home about. We have 4 adults, with 2 rooms, but they just couldn't figure out who is staying at which one. We have to explain ourselves each time we charged to our room. Just clueless management. The spa was good, but not great. The whirlpool is small. The service is not that personal. Again, I like 4 season's massage a lot more. Maui is beautiful, and Westin has great location. I honestly hope this hotel will pull itself together. Otherwise, people will read from this forum and realize it's not a great resort like they advertise it. The thing is, if you can afford to go to Maui, save up a little bit more and stay at the Four Seasons. It really makes a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time in an idyllic location”
Reviews.Author: jstravels
Reviews.Content: We loved Maui and the Westin. It was a big change after being on the Big Island which doesnâ€™t have as many cars, roads or people, but it was great. We splurged on an Ocean View room and it was worth the money. Sitting out on the lanai as the sun sank to the horizon was indescribable. The room itself is very nice with the wonderful Westin beds. We had a two double bed room with a rollaway. The rollaway cots donâ€™t fold so the mattresses are much better than those normally found in hotels and provide a very comfortable night sleep. The room also had the sink outside the bathroom across from a counter area with a coffee pot, refrigerator and safe. All tucked neatly away, but allowing room for all the snacks and things that usually make a room very messy. There werenâ€™t quite enough drawers (only two very large and deep ones) and a small hanging area, but we made do. The lanai was big enough for two chairs and a small table and we took the room chair out sometimes. The bathroom was tight near the toilet (you had to close the door before you sat, but the shower was spacious, particularly since it had the rod that extends out in an arc giving more space and the double shower heads are great too. This is definitely a higher end hotel. Even though it is an older hotel the facilities are impeccably maintained. Things are expensive though. The hotel tacks on an $18 daily activities fee which includes two bottles of water, parking, use of the workout facilities (which are really wonderful) and a couple other things. The most critical is the parking since there is little parking available and nearby all parking is paid by the hour. The hotel is very heavily marketing the Westin Vacation Ownership packages so you need to sidestep this frequently, but there isnâ€™t any pressure to do a meeting, but you are exposed to it everywhere. (We actually bought a property and we went into it thinking â€œno wayâ€� so they are good salespeople!) There are a few restaurants in the hotel. The Oâ€™no Restaurant is OK and not terribly expensive, but there are better restaurants nearby. The Tropica sits looking out over the water and is a beautiful setting, but everyone (including hotel staff) told us the food wasnâ€™t that good and was very expensive. We avoided it. The poolside service (they bring the food to you) was excellent (Surf Salad, Thai chicken wings and hot dog were family favorites) and reasonably priced. The Westin has some kid friendly pricing so the purchase of one entrÃ©e gets a free kid meal (with good, varied selections) for a child 12 or under. We actually liked the Hula Grill which was next door at the Whalerâ€™s Wharf. We ate the bar food (make sure to make reservations because the wait is long) and it was excellent. Iâ€™m sure the dining room food is as good, but it is more expensive and wasnâ€™t necessary. Leilaniâ€™s, also next door to the hotel, and a sister restaurant to the Hula Grill, was AWFUL. Avoid it since it is expensive and the food mediocre and the service terrible. The only redeeming factor was the view. The Hula Grill has the same view, hula dancers and music and better food! We ate lunch our first day in Kahului at Las Pinatas of Maui. It is a family run place and everything is made from scratch, down to the salsa. The restaurant was very good and reasonably priced. Avoid Fiesta Time which we drove to and past since it looked rundown and not in the best area of town. We ate a fine dinner at David Paulâ€™s in Lahaina. This is a classy restaurant with a beautiful dining room, excellent ambiance and wonderful food. It isnâ€™t cheap, but it was well worth the money. The fish is particularly well done. Finally we called and got reservations over a month in advance for the Old Lahaina Luau. It was expensive, but well worth the cost. The location is prime with expansive views of the harbor and sunset. The bar is open and there is every kind of fruity mixed drink you can think of â€“ and more. The help is nice and welcoming and the luau is very well organized at serving over 450 guests nightly. There are four buffet lines and tables are called up so you never stand in line. The entertainment starts after all the food is done and cleared and tells the story of the Polynesians coming to Hawaii. It is fascinating and beautifully performed. Make sure to make reservations well in advance. There was a list of 300 people who couldnâ€™t get in the night we went. We didnâ€™t tour around much since there it was great fun hanging by the pool. One caveat is that there arenâ€™t that many pool lounge chairs and they fill up very quickly, particularly those under the small thatched umbrellas. Since we were on East Coast time when we got there I was up early and went down the first day to sit by the pool around 6:30am. Almost all the umbrella-covered seats were already taken! People come and put down towels or floats to hold the seats. The hotel policy is that if a seat isnâ€™t used over the course of an hour then the staff will take the property. I never saw that happen even to seats that were saved all day and the people didnâ€™t show up until 3pm. It was totally obnoxious! So, if we planned on a pool day it was easier to get up early and have a relaxing hour down by the pool holding onto our lounge chairs. I will say the lounges were really, really comfortable so staying all day wasnâ€™t a hardship. One day we scheduled a helicopter ride with Blue Hawaiian helicopters. We only went on the West Maui ride since it was expensive for a family of four. The kids really enjoyed it and didnâ€™t get sick at all. After the ride we were on the Road to Hana so we started down it. The AMEX booking office at the Westin will give you a two sided Xeroxed sheet called â€œThe Road to Hanaâ€� that includes markers so you can know where to stop along the way. You can also pick up a taped explanation in town. We didnâ€™t since we knew we werenâ€™t going the whole way. Be prepared, it is long and windy and it isnâ€™t clear it is worth it! Wear a bathing suit and bring sunblock, bug spray and water shoes. Stop at the Maui Grown Market at mile marker 15 to get a very cost effective (with incredibly slow service) box lunch. For $8.50 you get a cold sandwich, drink, chips, two chocolate chip cookies (fresh baked), and a candy bar. You can also borrow a dog. Yes, a dog! There are dogs lying around and you can take one with you as a companion on the trip to Hana. Koa was especially cute and two families both wanted her. It was very funny! Our first stop was Twin Falls. There is a nice fruit stand and portapotties there. Put sun block and insect repellant on before you venture further. There are two waterfalls to hike to and then you can swim in the pools. Donâ€™t drink the water since it isnâ€™t clean (from animals upstream). We hiked in and took the right trail at the fork. It is about a 20 minute walk, mostly uphill and over some very narrow bridges and rock walls. The pool was some slippery rocks (from algae) so be careful getting in, but it is chest deep and very beautiful â€“ and fairly warm. We backtracked and went down the left fork to the other waterfall. It is slightly closer, but you have to go through knee high water to reach the falls so wear shorts, not pants. This is a taller waterfall and the water is colder, but still very nice. Be careful of the surrounding rocks and tree limbs since they are covered with red clay that can stain your clothes (and is used by many shirt manufacturers as a selling point!). This was the highlight of our trip to Hana! We piled into the car and tried to stop at the Puohokamoa Stream, but couldnâ€™t find it! The Kaumahina State Wayside Park is under construction so we continued on until we found a pretty, but small, pull off where we took pictures, ate lunch and looked at Honomanu Bay (a black sand beach) below. We then turned around and went back to the Westin. The girls got really nauseous in the car with all the bends and turns. There are many one lane areas where you canâ€™t see what is coming so it is a bit scary! There is a fun Swap Meet in downtown Kahului on Saturday morning which has tons of shops selling food, gifts, local handiwork, flowers and tons more. You could easily spend two hours there. We didnâ€™t eat lunch, but the food smelled great and there was a long line. Parking can be a bit touch and entry costs $0.50 per person (kids are free). Our favorite purchase was home made Kettle Popcorn called Maui Kettle Korn. It was great and we easily ate through two huge bags. There are different flavors so try them all. By far and away, the favorite adventure of our time in Maui was parasailing with UFO Adventures off Kaâ€™anapali beach (a stoneâ€™s throw from the Westin). Our daughters didnâ€™t weigh enough individually (130 pounds each) to go on their own so they flew tandem. My husband went on his own. They did the 800 ft package for 10 minutes in the air. They take you up, bring you down with your feet dangling in the water and then take you back up. The pictures from on high were amazing and we also bought the $20 roll of film from the onboard photographer since he had a telephoto lens. Very neat and they all canâ€™t wait to do it again. You donâ€™t even get wet since you take off and land in the boat. And itâ€™s safe too. Finally, I recommend getting the Maui guidebook put out by Paradise Family Guides. It rates restaurants, hotels, place to go, etc. all with an eye on family vacations. It was amazingly accurate and we came to rely on it wherever we were!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravel81
Reviews.Content: After researching the differences between the Westin Maui vs. Sheraton Maui, my boyfriend and I decided on the Westin. Well, I am pleased to report back that the Westin provided my BEST vacation experience to date! Here are a few reasons: 1. Location: Center of Kaanapali Beach, with a gorgeous view of the Black Rock. Parasailing, jet skiing, and snorkeling are all within walking distance. Whalers village is literally a 2 minute walk away, and provides a nice alternative to dining at the expensive hotel restaurants. Cute little shopping center, great for souvenirs. 2. Rooms: It doesn't get any better than the Heavenly Bed and the Heavenly Bath. Period. As Platinum Starwood members we were upgraded to an Ocean/Mountain view room, but either one overlooks some of the most amazing scenery - even the mountain view was gorgeous despite the fact that most people like the ocean better. Our room was cleaned regularly every day, and the facilities were in excellent condition. 3. Pool: Hands down, the best pool in West Maui. Several different pools connected by waterfalls, including an quieter adult pool/hot tub (enforced!) which can be a welcome break from the kids. Although a lot of adults, including myself, enjoyed the massive water slide as much as the kids did ;) This hotel caters to honeymooners and families alike. However if you are honeymooning and looking for a REALLY quiet place to stay, the Westin probably isn't for you. Try a hotel in Wailea, which has more private resorts. All in all, I can't imagine a better experience than the one I had at the Westin. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an ultra picky person and expect the best when I travel. I am use to satying at Four Seasons/Ritz Carlton hotels. I wasn't expecting much from The Westin but I was pleastly surprised! From the moment I walked in the lobby, I was happy. It felt clean and nice, a must for me. When I saw the location of this hotel, I was very pleased. The pool is steps away from one of the nicest beaches on the island. I love that because I like going back and forth whenever I want without a long hike. The pool was tropical, pretty and fun because of the waterslide. If you have kids, they will love it! If you prefer, there is and adult pool but I do think this is a family-oriented hotel. I also liked that the pools was CLOSE to the rooms. I stayed at the Grand Wailea and hated that it was a long walk from the pool to the room. The hotel was steps away from Whaler's Village and great restaurants. The location cannot be beat. Here is the only negative: The rooms are very small!! There is no closet, only an armoie, hardly big enough for a family's clothing and other things. The room was clean and nice and the beds were comfortable but they were just too small. Get an ocean view, it is worth the upgrade. The decor was nice and new and the bathroom, although small, was clean. I have stayed at the Grand Wailea, Ritz Cartlon, and Kei Lani. Overall, for the value and location, I would stay at the Westin again. I will have nothing but great memories and positive thoughts about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expecations”
Reviews.Author: googro
Reviews.Content: First time on Maui - we stayed at the Westin for 5 Nights on points - pay for 4 get five - great deal! We got there late afternoon, and no rooms were available, but they were quick to offer usage of their hospitality suite. Ended up walking around the beautiful grounds and nearby Whalers Village. Although signed up for a Mountain View room, with some persistence, were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room with a Lanai (Have gold status). Overall - highly recommended! We?ll be back! Good: The room was great - not huge, but perfect for what we'd need. Clean, heavenly everything, mini fridge which they stocked with free waters everyday. Great Lanai over looking the pool and ocean. 18 resort fee is well worth it as it includes internet access and parking. Concierge?s were great and very knowledgeable ? and there are a ton of them ? literally 10-20! They only handle restaurants, as you have to go to the Amex activity center for help with tours and activities. The beach is beautiful, not too crowded. We were always able to find chairs by the pool, however you have to move often to find shade. Agree with an earlier poster that the chairs are great compared to other resorts on Kaanapali. Cushions versus cheap lounge chairs at Hyatt and Marriott. Great waitress service brought drinks and water if you wish ? food as well. They even bring fresh cut pineapple around a few times a day! The hotel was sold out and the pool was busy ? but not over crowded ? yes a lot of kids, but what do you expect in August. The adult pool is a great escape ? although the other pools have waterfalls. Tropica, the upscale restaurant, was one of the best meals we had in Hawaii ? hands down! Food was amazing ? great location right on the beach ? but yes- very pricey. Ate at Ono?s once ? and it was pricey and not great, as we had expected. Gym is nice- has the essentials, is pretty new ? and they have daily classes with a one time fee of $10 covers you for the week- Allowed us a late check of 4pm ? so we still had the entire day to enjoy there! We called at 8am to request this ? and was told its on a first come first serve basis- on the day of your departure Could be better: Sea Dogs- the pool side snack bar- awful food ? as we had heard- avoid if you can! Had to call a few times to have them clean the room, as they hadn?t gotten to it by 2pm or so ? but no problem- was cleaned promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through Hotels the week before I found this web site and we were so discouraged after reading all the reviews I was actually dreading our vacation! And contemplating whether we should change hotels. But I am so glad we stayed with our original plans. We just returned from a family reunion in Maui and we had a fantastic time! The majority of my family stayed in the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. One brother opted to save money in order to stay for an additional 3 nights and stayed in a condominium. He did not have air conditioning in his bedroom and had bugs in the kitchen area. YUCK!!! He LOVED our hotel and visited often. I'll tell you about the GREAT things first, and then I will touch on a few of the needed improvements. The moment we arrived we were greeted by a door (lei) man (there are no doors)! Who gave everyone a lei. I must have died and went to heaven! The hotel was stunning, the lobby is absolutely beautiful, a waterfall, flamingos, ducks, flowers and greenery everywhere. Check-in went very smoothly for us. Since we flew in from different parts of the country we arrived at different times throughout the day. My sister, husband and 2 younger children (7 and 11) stayed in a Mountain View Room. My brother, wife and their son (12) also stayed in a Mountain View and my mother (72) stayed with us 3 nights and then her own room, an ocean view for the remaining 3 nights. My husband, daughter (16) and I stayed in a deluxe ocean view room. We paid $200 extra a night, but for the extra space, closet and the absolutely beautiful view of the ocean from a very spacious lani we got to enjoy anytime, it was well worth the money! My other family members would also agree, however they all liked their rooms just as well. The rooms are very simply stated with nice decor. Very comfortable. The heavenly beds are great. The shower is not anything to get overly excited about, but two shower heads spraying you at the same time certainly cuts back on the length of your shower and was a bit more relaxing...Our room was larger and we did have a roll away in it for the first three nights, but I would not suggest it for any other rooms as it would not fit. The smaller rooms do not have a closet, just a small area in the hutch. So, you put your suitcase on a stand and live out of it. They have plenty of extra luggage stands you just need to ask. No biggie! We ate dinner at the hotel the first night and although it is pricey, the food was very good and the ambiance could not have been any better. The live music, breeze from the ocean and the beautiful landscape, it must be a dream. My husband said the fish was the best he ate on the island. We did grab breakfast from the pool side eatery one morning when we were trying to get to the winery in a hurry and it was good. Pricey, but quick. The remaining days we ate at the food court next door. My sister did get a free breakfast buffet and said it was good and well worth the money if you are hungry and can eat a lot, but would not eat there again. There are too many other restaurants on Maui to eat anywhere more then once. The wonderful thing about The Westin is the beach, no other area like it on the island. It is right in front of you! Large white expanses of water and sand every where. The hotels and condos on this beach are connected by a brick walkway that runs parallel to the beach in front of the hotels and shops at Whalers village. It was fantastic to walk or run as many do in the early morning hours. And that is also when it is least crowded! I just can't say enough about the hotel...walking distance to Whalers for breakfast, lunch, dinner, shopping and the service. Most activities can be accessed from the beach. My daughter and husband went parasailing. My family went to black rock to snorkel. We went to the luau at the Hyatt. And we walked to all these places!! At night we would sit on the Lanai, enjoy the breeze off the ocean, and listen to the live music from the restaurant below and the excitement from the passerby's on the boardwalk! We loved the ambiance of the hotel, very festive! I attached pictures and hope you enjoy them as much as I enjoyed taking them! Activities we did together or separately and would do again... Snorkel black rock, Snorkel with the turtles/dolphins, visit Maui Ocean Center, Play on the Beach, Take in a Luau, Go Parasailing, Horseback riding, Zip Lining, visit the winery and take the tour, Go shopping in Lahina, Lay on the beach, Lay by the pool, Relax, Relax, Relax... Might do it again...Maui tropical plantation, sugar cane train, Hana, the summit at the crater. Places to eat that the whole family enjoyed...Bubba Gumps, Hard Rock, BJ's Pizza, the hotel, Whalers Village (lots of restaurants)! And although we tried several times and could not get reservations for Mama's Fish House, we heard it is the place to go! Now to the very few negatives of the hotel and our trip. The rollaways are uncomfortable...My sister said her room was dirty. For some reason her room is always dirty! Go figure. But they did give her 4 free breakfast coupons and "re-cleaned" her room right away. The hotel has a resort fee and the Internet access is included in this fee. My sister could not get their Internet access to work and had to use dial up (Our internet access worked great in our room!). They were charged . 99 for every 800 call they made. Several per day. Once they explained this to the front desk, their bill was credited. There are plenty of pool chairs but you must get yours early as they are normally all taken by 11 o'clock. You are not allowed to save chairs and someone must use their chair every 30 minutes or so in order for you to keep it. The hotel staff does walk around and take chairs away. We did go at the busiest time of the year so it may be different other times. That is it for the hotel...not bad eh? Do not recommend the submarine trip if you are going to snorkel or go to the Maui Ocean Center. The submarine ride does not do justice to the magnificent color of the coral or the different variety of fish you can find doing the other two activities. Do not do Hana or the crater's summit if you have motion sickness or trouble breathing (crater). And other then that, we would go back in a heartbeat and will stay at the Westin every time!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui Is The Best In Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Bob_LSanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: Why is it the best in Kaanapali? Closest to Whalers. Closest to the North Course. Closest to the local food places by the North Course. It is on the best beach in West Maui. No doubt, I know, this is my 3rd time in Kaanapali. Yes there was a lot of people in the lobby, by the elevators, walking around, etc. But go straight to the ocean, and it is liberating. And yes, I attended the Starwood Vacation Ownership sales pitch and almost bought a $45000 1-week time share. If you are not mentally strong, and I promise you, you will break down - you will be carrying a green bag to your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Westin / Four Seasons / Other Maui Resorts”
Reviews.Author: lionshead
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Westin from July 29 to August 4, 2005. I'm convinced, after the stay, that there are people posting at this site simply for the purpose of trashing Westin; the same is true for reviews of the Sheraton. During my stay on Maui (which concluded with 2 days at the Four Seasons in Wailea), I had a chance to visit nearly all the big resorts on the island (excluding only the Ritz and the Maui Prince). I'll tell you my impressions of all of them, but let me begin with the Westin. Overall, the Westin is the best place to stay on Ka'anapali Beach (which, in turn, is the best place to stay on Maui). I must admit, I didn't turn on the TV during my stay, so I can't speak to how many TV channels are available. And the rooms are not decorated particularly memorably. If you care about these things, look elsewhere. And yes, there are lots of children -- shocking, finding children on Maui in August! The pool at the Westin is the prettiest on Maui, overall. I think it compares favorably to the much-hyped pool at the Grand Wailea. The Waterslide is decent. The many waterfalls to stand under are very fun. The adult pool is peaceful, if you're looking for that. Personally, I don't like to sit by the pool all day in Hawaii -- I do that at home in Virginia -- but if you do, this is the best place to do so on Ka'anapali beach. The lounges are nicer than at the Hyatt, Sheraton, or Marriot, and there is (slightly) more space; the people appear less packed in. The chocolate monkey drink at the bar is delicious, and the poolside restaurant decent enough. (Hyatt lacks a poolside restaurant with table service; instead there is a food court -- but try those onion rings!). The beach in front of the Westin is fabulous. The sandy expanse is big and the waves. The Marriot and the Hyatt have practically no beach at all; everyone sits poolside, or on the grass. (They do have hammocks at the Hyatt, and that was a nice treat.) One irksome thing about the Westin is that they charge $5 for a lounge chair on the beach each day -- I do not understand how they make enough money off this to compensate for the lack of good will). Service was good. Everyone was very friendly. We had a personal concierge who was very helpful, but they were all able to give advice as far as restaurants. We loved the wildlife. We were upgraded free from mountainview to deluxe ocean view. The view of the ocean was great, but we could also look back at the mountains, and that too was spectacular -- a rainbow every night. Heavenly bed. Heavenly shower. Perfect location for a home base. I cannot understand those who complain. Of course, for $200 more per night, you could be at the Four Seasons in Wailea. Here they have thought of everything. Housekeeping folds your clothes. They heat the pool to bathwater after about 5 PM, so you can watch the sun set in the pool. An amazing drink called the Maui Orchid takes the edge off. Even the thing to clean the sand off your feet has heated water. Free valet parking. They bring you water and pineapples and strawberries on the beach. Still... there was something about the Four Seasons that was... not as fun as the Westin. Maybe it was the other guests. I didn't witness anyone horrible, but I just didn't feel as friendly an atmosphere. Certainly, I prefer the Ka'anapali location, with easy access to Lahaina and Kapalua, to Wailea with easy access to charmless Kihei and its fast food strip feel. And I was actually bothered by the expense of the food. $18 was the most I've ever paid for a burger, but it wasn't the best burger. (Overall, Maui's burgers disappointed me; I ate one nearly every day, and none stands out). I don't know when I will return to Maui. I loved it, but I've been there three times and done almost everything. But when I do, I will be staying at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Westin!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui for our 5 year anniversary. The Westin was perfect. The people at the front desk were very nice, the consiger was very helpful in planning our events, the room was great, the pools were super, especially the adult only pool, the cocktail waitress never let you go thirsty and the food was tasty. We took advantage of all the free things that come with your room including the bathrobes which you need to ask for. They came and made our room cooler too!!! The Spa was very relaxing and so worth every penny.The gym has TV in front of the tredmills and bikes. There was a Paper everyday outside our room and two bottles of water every day. My only problem with the Westin is the managers and billing. They use your first day spending activity to come up with a total average price and put it on your card the second day you are there and in addition to chargeing you $200 a day. In the end it is taken off your card unless you use a debit card like we did, and it was take right out of our account on the second day of our vacation. We had only spent about $568 but were charged $1725.30. Word to the wise, secure your room upon check in with a charge card not a debit card. The managers were not very helpful/speedy in returning our money ($1725.30). Did put a bit of a damper on the end of our vacation! Overall, a very nice place to stay and a wonderful location. Close to everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for our honeymoon and we absolutely loved it. We loved the beach, the large pool, and our room was so clean and comfy. The service was excellent! We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Too many people!! Our stay July,8-13”
Reviews.Author: FStinnett
Reviews.Content: We checked into our "cheap room" and quickly paid 140.00 upgrade to at least see the ocean. I would only go back to this resort if I could get an ocean view room for 250.00 or under because that is all it is worth. The room is very very small.We had to find very creative places to put our luggage. We did have an awesome view it was just so hard to enjoy the room when it was that cramped.The pool was fun and tropical but it too had a cramped feeling because of the crowds I felt like I was at Disney world. We met a great family that had a 550.00 room it had a closet. I am so surprised people will pay that much for such a ordinary hotel room. I will say my kids had a blast and the location was great next to Whaler's village. The beach is awesome. I was just surprised it was so crowded. It felt like Wakiki. This is a good place for families my kids loved it if you are looking for a layed back Island place this is not for you. If you love Orlando you will love it here!

Reviews.Title: “Love Maui!! Westin nice but no Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Devinch
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we discovered that the glass door to the lanai would not open. we were moved to another room but realized that neither room had a king size bed and a double bed which is what we had booked. There is no way a king and a double would fit in the rooms they were so small.We were told all of the rooms were the same size and we did get a roll away for our daughter which after rearranging a bit was just fine. There was no closet which the girl at the desk said was due to remodeling and using the space for a mini fridge and safe. Instead of a closet was an armoire with about a six inch wide space for hanging, the rest was space for the tv and two drawers. Good thing we packed light! The bed was heavenly, and the room was very clean. One thing that was upseting was when my daughter and I got into the hot tub it turn our sterling silver jewelry black. I have been in many hot tubs with same jewelry and have not had this happen. I have since been told that it isn't a good idea to get in the hot tub with silver jewelry. When I spoke to the manager he told me sorry, go to a hardware store and get some cleaner! Now regardless of whose fault it was, I thoght he handled it unprofessionally. Like maybe he could have offered to get me some jewelry cleaner? All in all it was a pleasant stay,I would probably stay there again,but after staying at the Ritz- Carlton, the Westin is no Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but won't return”
Reviews.Author: OPtraveler51
Reviews.Content: I agree with the writer who said there were too many people here, although when I saw they have about 750 rooms, what did I expect? Next time I would book into a smaller hotel that would give more of the feeling of a tropical paradise, not an amusement park. Yes, the waterfall is noisy but not offensive. Restaurants here as elsewhere on Maui were about what you would expect on an island resort - expensive! I would go to Maui again but I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveler30000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel June 22-29, 2005 for our wedding anniversary. I was happy that I had used airline miles to pay for our stay, because the bill would have been $2800 for the seven nights. The hotel was extremely average. But what really disappointed us was the indifference of the staff. Only once during out stay did we encounter someone who went out of his way to be friendly and greet us. I expected a higher level of friendliness and hospitality. That indifference carried through just about every aspect of the hotel. The housekeeping, valet parking, restaurant staff, concierge, front desk staff, gift store staff, and others seemed to forget that they were working in the "hospitality" industry. I felt the $18 a day charge for parking, internet access, the fitness center, a 4x6 photo, and a souvenir shopping bag was unfair. If the hotel management feels it must charge an extra fee, they should build it into the room rate. I think if they are charging $400 a night they should not nickle and dime the guests for $18 more per night. We asked for the souvenir bag and they were "out for two weeks." We were not offered anything in exchange. A $20 gift shop credit would have been a nice gesture. I would have probably taken it and spent $40 on some sort of tote bag. We were disappointed with the dining choices (no atmosphere, unremarkable food, poor service) and the lack of shopping on site. There was only one gift store (sundries and souvenirs) and one small clothing shop. I expected the Westin to be a big resort with lots of fun and tempting on-site shopping. I feel that when you stay at a resort, part of the experience is the inclusion of ammeneties like special shops. The hotel seemed more interested in dedicating space to timeshare sales. Our room was on the second floor very close to the hotel's large fountain. The roar of the water was very loud 24 hours a day. One high point was the beauty salon staff. I had a make-up trial appointment and a two-hour hair and make-up appointment. They did do a nice job, but were a bit rushed during the hair and make-up appointment (it was prior to our wedding vow renewal, so it was an important appointment for me). All in all it wasn't the worst place we could have stayed, but we could have probably had just as nice a time spending half the amount of money. The level of luxury, service and ammeneties I expected just were not at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Too many people”
Reviews.Author: cynvii
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Westin. Where did all the people come from?? It was difficult finding a spot away from the crowds...the walkways, restaurants and pool were full of people. I wasnt expecting it to be that crowded but then again it was high season. Noticed lots of familes so this must be a good place to bring the kids, great pool...big w/waterslide and waterfalls! On the otherhand, room and balcony were small but fixtures were updated so was tolerable...big gripe no closet only a small armoire! Service was fine and staff seemed friendly. Beach is first rate so spend your time there. I won't be going back---too crowded for me.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: mbinsac
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui is my favorite hotel on Kaanapali Beach. I've stayed there serveral times, and would still go back. The rooms are small as are the balconies, but since the idea isn't to be in the room, it's not a big problem. The pools are great. I've never been unable to find a lounge chair there. The drink service poolside can be a little slow. The renovated spa and workout facility is excellent. Nice to do your cardio with an ocean view. The Westin is centrally located at Kaanapali. It's a short walk to the Whalers Village next store. The dining at the Westin is a disaster. They need to upgrade the food service. tropica is passable, but with the Hula Grill and Leilanis steps away, I usually pass. The breakfast service on my last stay was consistently a disaster. Half the tables were empty yet you had to wait to get seated and they were not taking people in order. It seemed consistently disorganized. Given the high price of breakfast there, I opted to go next door to Whalers Village. There is no nightlife at the Westin. You'd think they could do something after dark with all of that pool deck space. It's a short cab ride in to Lahaina though and the Hula Grill is a great hang out at sunset or after dark. All-in-all, I recommend the Westin and would gladly go back on my next Maui visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Cookers78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. We stayed for a week during our honeymoon. We were very nervous about staying here since we read a number of bad reviews after we booked our trip. Fortunately, there was nothing to complaing about. We stayed at the Halekulani on Oahu for a few days before coming to Maui, and yes, that hotel was definitley better than the Westin, but the Westin is definitely a great hotel for the price. We had almost booked on the internet without any discounts, but fortunately we called the reservation number and were instructed to sign up for the Starwood club and we got 35% off the internet rates plus one night free. We als received 35% off our lunches and dinners (unfortunatley we had to pay full price for breakfast). The location of the hotel is excellent. It is right in the middle of the beach and allows you to easily access the other hotels along Kaanapali by foot. It is also a short 10 miunute drive into Lahaina. The conceirge was excellent also. She was obviously very enthusiastic to help us plan our week in Maui and she was very sincere. She asked us to do the time share presentation (which is completely separate from the conceirge), which we did in order to get some money to use at the spa. The activity desk was also very helpful . We were able to book all our activites through it. The spa was very nice as well. It is newly renovated and has very nice facilities. The room had an excellent view. I suggest getting an ocean view if possible, as the other views probably aren't as nice - which is why the ocean view costs more. The room seemed a little old, but the bed was very nice. It wwas a lot more spacious tan we anticipated from the reviews we read - this was a very pleasant surprise. The resort fee is unreasonable.v They should just add it into the rate so you don't even notice it. Valet parking is $10, but if you are lucky the self-parking will be full - which it is most of the time - and they wont charge you. We only had to pay for the valet on two of the 7 nights. All in all this was an excellent hotel and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, seems a little old, and crowded.”
Reviews.Author: HoosierBuff
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeymoon. We spent a few days at the Hyatt Regency Kauai, a few days at the 4 seasons in Maui (wailea) and a few days at the Westin. The places are so different, that it is a bit of an unfair comparison, but, here goes. Relative to Kaui, Maui is crowded. Maui (and Ka'anapali especially) is like New York City - people everywhere, all the time. What is interesting is how the hotels handled the crowds. The 4 seasons did a great job. . . it seemed busy, but, never intrusive. The Westin was jammed, and it was hard to find a lounge chair. There was not much romantic about the westin. . . .very little to offer in terms of peace and quiet. The westing doesn't feel personal, quiet or charming. . . it's a nice place, but, its crowded. The pool at the westin is top notch, relaxing, fun, with many diversions. They do a good job at keeping the adult pool for adults, and I believe kids enjoy all the things to do in the all ages pool. The servers and the food is good, and at a comparable price to everything else on the island. Kaanapali beach is great, but, very crowded. We spent some time in the Spa, which is new, and actually very nice - easily comparable to the 4 seasons of the Hyatt on kauai. The location of the westin is good too. . . right next to whalers village, which, really expands the 'easy' dinner/drink options. The downer is the hotel building itself. The rooms are dated and small. Smaller than any other room we stayed in. In fact, we didn't even have a closet in our room, just a tv stand with an airplane sized hanging bag area. The faciliites are pretty, but, dated. . . the rooms have a musty smell, and the elevators are slow, and a little uncertain. Finally, a huge beef with the "resort fee" that DOES NOT include valet parking! you pay $18 PER DAY and you get to use the pool, park the car yourself, and I don't know what else. . . but, it doesn't allow you to valet. This is weak. . . it should include the valet parking in the fee. All in all, its a nice place, its price kind of cheap, but, you get an older building and smaller rooms, and no valet parking for your activity fee. A fun place on crowded Kanapali where you have to compete for lounge chairs. Good for what it is, but, falls a little short of relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location for a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: needabeach
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after some of the reviews that I had read on here about the Westin. I was thrilled to say the least to find them all baseless complaints. We had a deluxe ocean view that was VERY spacious for myself and my husband and our two boys (8 and 10). The bathroom was very spacious, and the closet was more than adequate. I had packed everything prepared to live out of suitcases for the week for no reason. The grounds were beautiful. With our package we received 35% off of the food in the hotel, and this made it very reasonable to eat most of our meals there. The seafood paella and the giant prawns at the Tropica were so great we had it two nights in a row! The convenience of being next to Whaler's Village was marvelous. We could walk to the Sheraton and walk to our luau at the Hyatt Regency. We didn't even bother with the parking lot and just used the valet. It was worth it to us. Lahaina was great to run down to, and the Kapalua Bay area up to the north was fabulous and not crowded. You have to stop at Java Jazz for breakfast one morning as well. It is up by the Embassy Suites. The coffee is wonderful and the pancakes are to die for! The housekeeping came fairly early, unlike some of the complaints I read, but I did have to request for the sheets to be changed, and they could have done a little more than they did. It was definitely acceptable. I found everything to be wonderful and would do it again (assuming I have saved up for a Hawaii trip again!)

Reviews.Title: “Great second visit”
Reviews.Author: djssrca
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our second stay at the Westin Maui and enjoyed it just as much as the first. Beautiful location, beautiful grounds, very nice rooms... relatively small, but very comfortable, especially the bed. Great service. We ate dinner in both restaurants and it was fantastic. The highlights for me are the beautiful landscaping and pools, and the animals ... koi fish, gorgeous swans and flamingoes, and parrots. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay at the Westin. We've stayed at some nice places during our travels and this one certainly ranks right at the top. We were given an Ocean View room in the Ocean tower and the views of Lanai and Molokai were great. After reading other reviews, I was worried that the rooms would be too small and that they would be sub par. However, after getting to our room and seeing how beautiful they were, I was relieved. I certainly don't know how someone could give negative reviews of these rooms. If you are wanting a large room with closet space and full size refrigerators, then I would suggest a condo. Otherwise, the pool area was beautiful and the beach was perfect. The water was clear and was just as warm as the heated pools. We walked around to the Sheraton, Marriott, and Hyatt and quickly decided that we made the right choice. Whaler's Village is also close with an ABC store to pick up snacks, etc.The parking lot was always full; however, we always had the option to valet. This is certainly a beautiful property and we won't stay anywhere else the next time we are in Kaanapali. I would certainly recommend it and I am glad that we didn't let a few negative reviews deter us from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pools, beach and service...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 6 nights at the Westin in Maui. We are avid travelers and use this site as a guide for many of our trips. I was initially worried about the Westin based on reviews here but quickly learned that many of these reviews are from disgruntled travelers. If you have nothing to complain about, you have no reason to gripe! For that reason, I write this review. The Westin was wonderful. As Starwod Preferred Guests, we were upgraded to an Ocean View room at check-in. And though we were only on the 5th floor, we considered ourselves lucky to be upgraded, considering the price of these rooms for people that actually have to pay for them. You do get what you pay for. The view was fantastic and we enjoyed the man-made waterfall/white noise to the chatter we'd have heard coming from the pool otherwise. Our room was clean, very cool and our bed was Heavenly as well. The fridge was small but kept my drinks cool. The spa is great too - with another outstanding view of the ocean. We enjoyed the adult pool and had an easy time finding space to sit - in the sun or shade. The beaches in Hawaii are all public, so anyone can use them for their enjoyment. That's wonderful when you want to spend an afternoon at the Kapalua Ritz-Carleton, so don't complain when you have to share the beauty with others...we did not find the beach crowded and the water was so warm and calm it was like bath water. Another review talked about how the "TV had nothing on." Are you kidding? So sorry to hear you take vacations to watch TV - there were probably about 30 cable TV channels in my room - something for everyone, even kids. And as for the parking - use the valet! If the parking lot is full, they'll valet for free! If you can't afford the $2 tip find somewhere else to stay. The men at the Valet station were great - they even carried a trunk-load of groceries up to our room - immediately. If you treat people right, they'll be helpful. In all, it was a wonderful resort. When we go back to Maui we will stay at the Westin again. Its location (next to Whalers' Village - good shopping and food), beach and pools were far superior to other resorts we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: soccrgrl
Reviews.Content: My family of 4, stayed at the Westin from 5/24-5/31. We had a great experience! I was a little apprehensive, after reading some of the reviews. But, we stayed on 8th floor,in the Ocean Tower, with 2 double beds. The room was clean and had a fridge and safe. If I had to "nitpick" about anything, it would be the lack of a closet. You have a small space inside an armore to hang your clothes. With a family of 4, things did get a little tight. But, we were basically only in our rooms to sleep and take showers! Service was great, no lines at check in or really for anything, although the hotel was completely booked. The self parking lot was full most of the time, but they did valet park us for free, if the lot was full. You will not find a better beach location! We basically explored the entire island, and decided that the Westin had the best location, and beach/pool area. Plus, it was great to have use of the Sheraton's facilities, when you snorkeled at Black Rock. All in all, I would stay there again, in a heartbeat! It is a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: BillDen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awsome! We checked out the Sheraton and Hyatt and there was no comparison to the Westin. The grounds were beautiful with palm trees everywhere and a multitude of waterfalls. We had an ocean view room in the Ocean Tower and the room was great. I read many reviews saying the rooms were too small with little closet space. We had three people staying in a room and didn't seem to have any trouble. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was fine. There was a refrigerator in the room which kept enough stuff for all three of us. The lanai was spacious and provided plenty of room to sit back and relax and enjoy the view. After our first night, we received a free box of maui chocolates from the concierge. I thought this was a nice touch. The service was great and the employees were very hospitable and accomodating. The concierge was very helpful in planning our stay. They provided maps and offered suggestions. The hotel is right next door to Whaler's Village which was a plus and the restaurant selection around the hotel was superb. We ate at the Hula Grill which was great. We sat outside and ate while taking in the fantastic views of the sunset. The hotel also offers an activities desk right next to the beach which allows you to book excursions. The beach in front of the hotel was great. It wasn't quite as wide as it was in front of the Sheraton; however, it was perfect for us. After checking out the beach in front of the Hyatt, we were glad we didn't stay there. Parking was difficult at times and we had to valet twice while we were there; however, we didn't let that bother us. When you are in Hawaii, you can't expect to get by cheap. Otherwise, we would of probably stayed at a cheaper location. Overall, I wouldn't stay anywhere else on Kaanapali. I certainly don't understand any of the negative reviews and I would recommend this place to anyone. I would definitely stay here again when I go back. It is laid back, yet it has enough happening if you want to do something (without having to drive too far). If you are picky about the trivial details, then the Four Seasons or Ritz might be better choices. Definitely a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Z2thFairy
Reviews.Content: Just returned after accepting an invitation from Starwood to stay at the Westin Resort for a greatly reduced rate. The trip was in celebration of our 25th Anniversary. Have to say that we were very pleased with our overall experience. Here are some of my thoughts: At the bargain rate, we were not expecting to be placed in a great room. However, we were not disappointed. Our room was on the 6th floor in the Ocean Tower. We were above the parking lot, but had a great view of the golf course. Despite the parking lot, noise was not a problem. We were in our room mainly to shower & sleep. Rooms are average size and not small as indicated in previous posts. The armoire has 2 very deep drawers and a very narrow closet and also serves to hold the TV. It was quite adequate for our 5 night stay. The bed and pillows were indeed heavenly...no sore back or stiff necks. Definitely the best hotel bed we've ever slept in. Bathroom was fine, too, altho' I'm not sure why they call their showers "heavenly." Basically you get two vertically placed shower heads, so there is double the water being used to shower. I remember when Maui was suffering from a drought! It was nice having the mini-fridge and safe in the room. Judging by the occupied poolside lounge chairs and filled parking lot, the hotel was pretty packed. Yes, it can get crowded by the pool, so best to plan to be there early if you want a prime spot. We only had to repark our car 3 times after we checked in, and never had a problem finding a spot. We liked it there so much, that we rarely left the hotel. Whaler's Village is only steps away so you easily walk there in under 5 minutes. For dining there's Hula Grill, Lelani's and a food court. There's even an ABC store for sundries. snacks, drinks & inexpensive souvenirs. We only had one meal (dinner) at Ono's at the hotel. It was delicious, but pricey, as is most hotel dining. Decided to dine tapa-style and ended up spending $72 for two of us (and we are not big eaters!). Also had meals at Hula Grill & Leilani's at Whaler's Village which were only fair. Our best meal was at Roy's in Kahana. The concierge secured reservations on the night we requested. Great workout facility with a great view. The three times we went it was not crowded, altho' it can be. There were also apples & protein bars in a basket if we needed a snack. Customer service was excellent, no lines, no waiting for anything....check-in, check-out, pool towels, restaurant, concierge service and even the elevator! The staff provided excellent recommendations, also. Upon taking the advice of a bell hop, we saved quite a bit on golf club rentals. The girl at the front desk directed us to a great place near the Kahului airport to have a homestyle Hawaiian breakfast ($8 for two, including coffee) before we flew home. Although they were not pushy in regards to touring their new property, we decided to see it anyways. Went for a continental breakfast at 9am and didn't leave until almost noon. My hubby was all set to buy into their property, but I wasn't comfortable with spending $27,000+! They did give us a $100 certificate for our time which we applied to our hotel bill and a voucher for 50% off rack rate for a future stay at any Starwood property. I think fair enough for listening to their sales pitch for 3 hours. We probably could have left earlier had my hubby not been so enthusiastic! All in all, we left the Westin quite happy. We are now Starwood Preferred Guests!

Reviews.Title: “If you like a nice hotel, don't come here!”
Reviews.Author: Coloradon8tive
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Westin Maui for 3 nights. We used Starwood points to get the rooms. We get 2 per night due to having 2 teenagers. We made reservations 7 months in advance. We are Starwood Gold members and have stayed in very, very nice accomodations before. We have also had our days of stays in Holiday Inn's, Ramada"s and Super 8's. We have moved up in taste from those to the Westin's, Sheraton's, Luxury Collections, Four Points and such. We checked in and orginally were given 2 rooms overlooking the front entry area/parking lot - facing inland. We asked to be upgraded being Gold members (a perk) and were given one room upgrade but had to keep the kids in the parking lot view room. When we went up to the 4th floor room for us, we opened the door and a wall of heat hit us. We tried to turn on the air to cool it down, no big deal. Then we found out why. We walked out onto the balcony and if you were to step over the rail, you would step onto the roof of the connecting buiding. They were tarring the roof right outside our room. The view would of been of the side of the tower building that the roof we overlooked connected to our tower building. If you looked to the left you could see about 5 feet of ocean view. We called the Starwood Gold front desk (they have their own check-in desk where you don't have to wait in line) and requested a different room. There was someone different there and they gave us a room down the hall. The room had a much better view which was of palm trees and bushes just outside our balcony. If you looked down to the right, you looked at the Koi, swan, flamingo pond that you first see when coming into the hotel. We could see some ocean between the trees. We did get to see some sunsets so the view was upgraded. The room was a different story. The minute we opened the door, the musty, moldy smell hit us. We also noticed makeup on one of the pillows. We called the express services to tell them these things. A couple hours later they sent up maids that brought new sheets and they changed out our entire bed. I mentioned that I thought the smell was the carpet and asked if they had recently shampooed it. They nodded yes, and made a phone call to someone-they talked in a language we didn't understand so I don't know what was being said. I think that they would agree with anything that I suggested was causing the smell because they didn't know where it was coming from either. Several hours later a man with a spray bottle of a chemical came up and sprayed a few places on the carpet. It worked...for about 1 day then the smell returned, as strong as ever. We decided to go to the local store and buy Fabreeze and keep spraying it until we could leave. We didn't want to keep complaining because it would get us maybe to a worse room. The toilet had to be flushed twice each time because if not, it would clog up. We put up with that - we aren't paying the water bill. The t.v. had really nothing on. Mostly Starwood sales information and local tourist information. There wasn't a variety of programs at all and t.v. seemed like a waste. The bed has seen it's last days. It is time for the hotel to replace it. It doesn't have the soft luxurious feel that other Westin Heavenly beds have. It didn't have that sink down in pillow top feel that we know the Heavenly bed has. The hotel staff takes several hours to deliver a requested item whereas at other resorts/hotels we are use to receiving it within an hour. The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort & Villa's deliver items within about 5-10 minutes! It took two phone calls to get a lightbulb for our desk lamp at the Wesin Maui and the second time no one knew if it was being delivered or not. The Westin Maui is an older hotel. It is very, very beautiful if you see if from the lobby. The rooms leave much to be desired and the hotel has so many people walking about that it reminds me of a shopping mall at Christmas time (amount of people). You have to fight to get a spot anywhere. The beach was very, very crowed and I likened it to Wakiki Beach. There were people just feet from us. I have kids and in no way do we dislike them but were next to people that had a young boy. He was about 3 and kept making "beeping" noises every 2 seconds that went on for a good 5 to 7 minutes. The parents didn't bother to avert his attention to something else or try to get him to stop making the annoying noise. They had no care in the world if they were bothering the people next to them or not. They were the sort of people that you meet in a lower cost/type hotel. Their was also a group of people (8) that were drinking beer, cussing, talking about everyone and smoking by us. We rented a covered cabana for one day and there were no others to rent.
