We had to stay where we were. They were also the type of people that you see at the lower cost hotels. I know the hotel cannot control this but it just added to the dislike of our surroundings. If you enjoy lots of people, crowed pools, scoping out a vacant seat/plot of sand and older rooms then you may enjoy this hotel. For us, we like way, way less people, more personal service that makes us feel like we are the only ones there and cleaner/newer rooms. I don't like taking my little 6 foot wide space of sand on the beach and sharing the rest with everyone else and not being able to move if I want. We like quiet, clean, uncrowded beaches and feel like we have experienced so many different resorts/hotels that we have finally learned what a true, relaxing vacation is.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: texasbeez
Reviews.Content: The pool area was amazing with several pools and waterfalls. There were few kids, mostly couples. The "heavenly" bed was about what you would find at a Ritz Carlton. Great location right on the main beach were all the action is. The only problem was when we checked in they were going to give me and my fiance two double beds even though I reserved a king. This was our wedding/honeymoon and I would not accept that, so they upgraded us to a deluxe ocean view. TIP: Become a starwood member so you can check in faster and possibly get an upgrade. My now husband has stayed at the Ritz in Maui and said if he came back he would stay at the Westin instead because of it's location and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As my rating indicates this hotel was "okay". We arrived to find that there was a prom being held that night and there wasn't a parking spot to be found. In all fairness they did valet park us for free unless you count the tip they still expected. Throughout our 6 night stay parking continued to be a huge hassle. The slots are not even big enough for a standard car much less a mini-van. I think they should take that $18 a day resort fee and build a parking ramp. We went to see the sunrise at Haleakala and needed to leave at 3 a.m. one morning. When we got to our cars we found that valet parking had double parked all of us in. We had to wait for someone to find all the keys to the cars that were in the way and move them. At check-in we asked for a roll-out cot for our daughter. (There is no space in the room for a sleeper sofa.) Before leaving the hotel in the evening we called again as a reminder and were told not to worry. When we got back from the Whaler Village still no bed. It took 3 more calls of being told it would be there (an hour later still no bed and a very tired 7 year old asleep in our bed.) Finally after having had enough we finally got ahold of a manager and had a bed in a matter of minutes. (My brother went through the same ordeal with his bed request) The rooms are not very big and storage is very minimal. We put our dd's items in the night stand drawers. Our fridge was very small and seemed to be putting out heat not cold. The fridge in my mom's room was twice as big and worked fine (she had a double bed room). The bed was very nice with a super fluffy comforter. The bathrooms are okay. Not as spectacular as they want you to think but okay nonetheless. They do give high end toiletries which do have a very strong scent. We did get our daily water bottles. They say it is complimentary but remember that is also what your $18 resort fee is supposed to cover. Wireless is included which my dh loved. The grounds were simply gorgeous!! We were on the 7th floor with an ocean front view and it was truly stunning. One thing I probably would have preferred was the sound of the ocean vs. the overwhelming sound of the manmade waterfall, especially at night. The end of March was an extremely windy time. This made for some disappointments when it came to whale watching and going to Molokini. Due to school schedules this was the only time we could go but be forewarned the weather at this time is not what we dreamed of when we thought of Hawaii. We had no problems with the towel lines at the pool as they moved very quickly. More difficult was getting a chair anywere at the pool. Pretty much I let my child go swim within sight and I scouted out a seat or waited for someone to leave. It was the week after Easter so I expected this and tried not to get to cranky about it. The staff was enforcing the rule about losing your chair if it is left unoccupied for more then 30 minutes. They also did a very good job of keeping chairs open to guests only. My dd loved the huge snow cones they sold at the poolside food counter. It is a bit of a stroll down to Black Rock but not really bad at all. It is close to many restaurants and stores. We also went to Safeway and got basic groceries. Since our fridge was crummy we had to borrow some space in my mom's. My SIL signed up for a Safeway discount card and then we all took turns using it. It was a nice perk going down to the Sheraton to use their pool . We liked the Westin's a whole lot better but it was nice to have options. I would say that I saw more Sheraton visitors at the Westin pool then vice-versa. (you can tell by the color of the arm bands). My dd wanted a hair braid and when I inquired about them I was very rudely told that I needed to call the hair salon if I wanted an appt. If they don't want to talk to people then why not put out a sign explaining how it all works? All in all this is a beautiful hotel with average services and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: FitzLA1
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hawaii many times and have stayed at both Hotels and Condos. This time we chose to stay at The Westin Maui. I have to say that I do not understand all the negative reviews about this resort. I was raised a spoiled child and became use to the finer things in life, and the Westin Maui is no exception. If you are traveling with a family, and you are worried about the amount of space in your room, then I suggest you get a condo. The rooms are not large, but they are also not small by any means. They are average size hotel rooms. You are not paying a premium price for the size of the room, you are paying for the location and the amenities, namely the pools. We paid for an ocean view room and boy did we get it. On the 10th floor with a knock out view of the ocean and the pools. Garden view rooms be aware; waterfalls are on all night, and they are quite loud. With the door closed, you will barely hear them. For those that say they paid discount internet prices on some website and were given the cheapest room in the category you paid for, well what did you expect? Those of us who paid top dollar should get the better rooms. Ever heard the saying "You get what you pay for"? Anyway, the rooms are very comfortable, but for a family of four, I could see how they might feel small. They were perfect for the 2 of us. The rooms in the Beach Tower are a bit larger, but not much. They also come at a premium price, and I felt our view in the Ocean Tower was better, unless you get an ocean front suite. The bathrooms are a bit small, but not surprised for the age of the resort. The armoir was perfect for us. We had enough space to hang everything we needed to hang, and had ample drawer space for the 2 of us. Again, in the Beach Tower, you get a full closet. The shower heads were a little low for someone tall like myself so I had to duck to get the head wet, but the showers were fine otherwise. We had the air set to 65 the entire stay, and during the day it would stay at about 71, and at night it would stay at around 67. It never did get to 65, but it was also quite hot outside. The beds were very comfortable. No compaints there either. As for the pools, what can I say? There are no pools like them in Kaanapali. The adults pool was great for someone without children, and it was more like an adult area with a pool, hot tub, pool table and a bar. There was security to keep the kids away as well. The other 4 pools were great as well, and perfect for families of all ages. The slide was a ton of fun, and the pools were a perfect temp. The hotter it got outside, the colder the pools felt because of your changing body temp. But once the sun went down, you could tell they were heated. They were quite warm, actually. We did eat at the breakfast buffet a few times, and it was pretty good. There were a lot of options to choose from. It was really as good as it can get for pre-made food. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel other that the occasional snack by the pool, as we wanted to eat at other restaurants around the Island. The drinks by the pool were small and watered down for $8.25, and don't bother with the daily drink special as it is $7.75, a mere 50 cents cheaper. The pools did get quite crowded, but not a problem if you are an early riser. The beach in front of the hotel is great, and it gets even better up towards the Sheraton. We never had a problem with the customer service, but again we were always nice and didn't complain about every little thing, and always managed to have a smile on our face. I would imagine they get quite sick of people complaining to get better rooms when they got what they paid for. We never got hasseled by the timeshare salespeople, but be aware that when you get an invitation to come to get your free gift, it will come with a sales pitch. We were aware of this ahead of time, and choose not to go and get our 2 dollar box of chocolate. If you are a gold or platinum starwood member, you will also get a invitiation to a managers cocktail party, and we chose not to attend that either, and assumed it came with a sales pitch as well. Stay away from those 2 things and you will not have a problem. For those who talked about the ongoing painting, rest assures it is all done now. They are just improving the hotel for all of us to enjoy. Would you rather them shut it down while they are complaining? The Westin Maui is no longet pink, it is white now. All in all, it was a wonderful stay, and if you are complaining about the Westin in Maui, then you are just looking for something to complain about. How could you ever go wrong in paradise?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon At The Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: k.s-l.Brampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Aug 28- Sept 5th. The hotel was great! They immediately upgraded our room to a partial ocean view. The atmosphere was quite nice with the flamingos at the entrance and parrots flying to your balcony. Lots of pools and waterfalls. Great scenery! Free portrait and chocolates. Nice people and great restaurants and bars surrounding the hotel. Excellent shopping just a 2 minute walk away. The only negative here was that the rooms are quite small for teh price you pay. But if you're not on your honeymoon you will probably be enjoying the feaures of the resort much more!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit to the Westin Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui Resort from May 11th thru May 20th. This was our 2nd time to Maui, & our 2nd time at the Westin. We enjoyed the 1st time which was in 2001 and I was a bit hesitant after reading the reviews from people on this trip to even stay there. I got a decent rate for being a Starwood Resorts Gold Member (join - it doens't cost anything to do so). It was $260 a night with the 6th night free (we stayed 9 nights there) plus we got 35% off our meals (only lunch & dinner) from their 2 restaurants. When we arrived we were given a room on the 9th floor of the Ocean Tower facing the mountains & parking lot. When we went into the room, someone was already in there. We went back to the front desk, the girl seemed very surprised about someone being in there so she gave us another room, on the 8th floor, facing mountains, and she said for our inconvienence she would drop the $18 daily resort fee which saved us about $160. That was fine by me. I will admit, the rooms are small, but they are clean & functional and the beds are comfortable. Feather pillows- not those hard foam ones everyone else gives you, down comforters, not the bright colored polyester quilted ones everyone else has. The bathrooms are small, the shower heads are a bit big for the size of the tub, but they work well. I usually never hang up my clothes on vacation, I keep them in my bag folded until I wear them, so the tiny armoire everyone complained about didn't bother me. I didn't hear any noise from the parking lot as others said they did. We never had to wait long for an elevator. I had heard the Beach tower had bigger rooms, we checked them out but I didnt think they warrented $130 more a night for a little more room. The pool area can get a bit crowded at times. If you want a spot in the shade, you have to go down early in the morning and put a bag or something on the chair you want. By 9am most of the decent chairs are taken, but alot of people dont stay all day so you can usually get one that you desire (except for under the umbrella thing). There are alot of kids there but you can sit at the adult pool if you want some quiet. We sat at the main pool and it was fine. I think the pool chairs could be situated a little better - not so close to the one next to it, but I guess with so many people staying there, they want as many chairs as they can fit on the pool deck. You can go down to the Sheraton & use their facilities like the pool, but the walkway in front of the hotels doesn't go all the way to the Sheraton- you have to walk out on the beach to get to it, so I found that a bit inconvenient. I think more people from the Sheraton came to use the Westin pool than the other way around. They had a buffet there back in 2001 that was very good but they dont have it anymore- too bad). We only ate at their restaurants once for lunch and once for dinner at Ono's . I wasn't too pleased with the dinner choices at either place. They wanted $25 per person for the breakfast buffet which I though was way too much. Alot of people did eat there I noticed but most of them had Breakfast coupons that they got with whatever package they booked. We opted to eat at the Marriott for breakfast- French toast w/bacon or sausage for $8.75 which I thought was very reasonable or we went to Mc Donalds foir pancackes. I would rather spend money on a nice dinner than on breakfast. We tried dinner at the Marriott- all you can eat crab legs- STAY AWAY. That was terrible & expensive. The Hyatt had a nice dinner at Cascades, although I asked for one thing and got another. The waiter seemed a bit annoyed- but he brought me what I ordered finally. We did eat at Hula Grill & the sister restaurant across the way Leighlanis. Stay away from The Rusty Harpoon in the Whalers Village (that came for the locals). Kimos in Lahaina had excellent Halibut- we ate there twice. Also tried Ruth Chris Steakhouse- very good. If you want to know where to eat or have a question about a restaurant, ask a local store owner or whatever. That's what we did if we weren't sure. Over all I was pleased once again with the Westin & their staff. We did have one day when the room wasn't cleaned until about 4pm, but other than that it was fine. The were in the process of moving the gift shop to near the elevators which makes it much eaiser from where it used to be. The parking situation - the parking lot is small and so are the parking spaces. One side of a row is for compact cars, the other for bigger ones. So you get a big car parking in a compact space, which results in taking up 2 spaces- theres the problem. We only had to valet park the car once because the lot was full (they double park them ) We were never approached by a time share/vacation club person there so I can't comment on that. I think for the price I was given ($260 a night) it was a good choice. (I know the Hyatt is $350 - $400 & up a night. ) If you can get a good rate for it, I would recommend staying here. I don't think I would pay $350 a night for it, (the Four Seasons in Kapalua charged that). The best thing to do is check the internet on the hotels website for all kinds of specials and then call & ask. The rate I got was by phone, it was lower than the AAA rate or any other advertised rate. Hopefully this will help someone with their choice.

Reviews.Title: “will not come back!”
Reviews.Author: shing
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this resort. They gave us a room with 2 double beds on the 2nd floor with the garden view. Basically there is no view at all and very dark. We complained and they gave us another room with the king size bed on the 2nd floor on the other tower. But we have to promise to switch to another room the next day. So the next day I asked to review the room first before we move. Again they gave us another garden view room on the second floor and you will hear the sound of the waterfall which is so noisy all day. After a few pick, I rather choose the mountain view room on the 9th floor facing the parking lot which is less noisy. We heard lots of guest complain to the front desk during our stay. After all I do not recommend this resort, we walked to to Sheraton resort which seems much better even the pool area is not as nice as the Westin. The staff at the front desk is not friendly except one lady called Grace whom let me look and choose the rooms the 2nd day. Beware ! They treated you like second class citizen if you buy the package from the internet and will give you the worst room on the lower floors only.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room, Spectacular Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated a belated honeymoon at the Westin. It was an expensive trip for us, but we felt that we couldn't go wrong in Maui. Maui did not fail us. It's a beautiful place to unwind and relax. It's perhaps not the best place for partygoers. The place seems to shut down around 10 pm or so and we were there with lots of young families (but they weren't noisy or obnoxious) and retired folks. If you're looking for peace and quiet, this is where to find it. The hotel was average, although the scenery was amazing from the 4th tower. The hotel is made up of about 6 towers so if you're in the farthest tower, be prepared to do a lot of walking between the lobby and/or parkade to your room EVERY DAY. The rooms weren't anything specatular, which was a bit disappointing. Our room had a small balcony, which was great in the mornings because you could walk out into direct sunlight. Our hotel package did not include breakfast, so we shopped at the local Safeway and had cereal and fruit every morning on the balcony. The only annoying thing was having our neighbours' cigar smoke drift our way some of the mornings. We also went at an unusually windy time in Maui. When we strolled along the beach in the afternoons, large gusts of wind would wind up blowing into our eyes and hair if we were sunbathing. It's a bit more expensive, but it's worth booking either one of the canopies (get there early in the a.m.!) or even an umbrella stand (be mindful the wind doesn't blow it on to you ...). Rent a car, because you'll need it unless all you intend to do is stay in the hotel all day long. The roads are windy and require some care during the evening, but there's plenty to do with a car, driving about 20 minutes out from the resort area. You'll find great eats, boutiques and art galleries on Front Street. Lots of small shopping centres (but power shoppers - you'll be disappointed. There is no Ala Moana style shopping centre here, most of the stuff is not worth buying nor can bargains be found). We also attended a luau at the Hyatt hotel, which was fun although the entertainment was quite cheesy. The beach by the hotel was not the best for boogie boarding or even surfing. Not enough waves - but really good for snorkeling. If you're looking to save some money while in Maui, here are a few tips. There's a fast food court in Whaler's Village, which is about 5 minutes walking distance from the Westin where you can find cheap, universal fast food (e.g. McDonald's). You can also pick up small items at any ABC store - we loaded up on water, soda, and snacks. If you have a unit with a kitchen, you can probably find everything at Safeway. Whatever you do, avoid eating in the hotel. The average cost per person (regardless of breakfast, lunch or dinner) seemed to be about $30. You can get a really great meal on Front Street for far less than that per person. If you're planning on spending more than two hours at the beach, consider booking a canopy or umbrella. They tend to get booked quickly (especially with families) so if you're making it a full day at the beach, might as well book it and have it for the day. On a scale of 1 - 10, I would rate my experience as an 8. There is plenty to see, do, and experience in Maui and you will definitely return home more relaxed. For single travellers, this is an ideal getaway if you really just want some R & R for yourself and in a safe, secure environment. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons of Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: uclady
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant to stay at the Westin after some of the reviews here, but it turned out the hotel was gorgeous and the service exceptional. The pool is amazing, the breakfast buffet delicious and abundant, and the bartenders at Tropica great fun to chat with. I also loved being able to board the Gemini catamaran directly from the Westin beach. We sailed with them twice: sunset cruise and snorkeling day trip. Another good thing about the Westin is that they allow their guests to use the amenities of their sister property, the Sheraton, up the beach a bit at not cost. There were some negatives however and I feel compelled to point them out: 1) The rooms at the Westin are very, very small, especially those in the ocean tower (better views than the beach tower, though) and the armoire in the ocean tower gives you only 16 inches of closet space (my husband measured)! 2) The Westin is intent on selling its timeshare property up the road and makes all the concierges subtly push attending an "introductory tour" of the place. If you say no, they do not insist, but the next time you visit to ask a question about another service (e.g, a spa treatment or snorkeling trip), they will try again to get you to do their timeshare thing. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for our Honeymoon from May 2-9. The first 5 nights we stayed at a private condo in Wailea (----) and the last 2 nights were spent at the Westin Maui. The Pacific Villa was perfect and just what we needed to relax after a hectic and busy wedding. The Westin Maui was even better. What a treat! I enjoyed the Westin so much and wished I hadn't waited until the very end of our vacation to stay there. We were on the 9th floor with a oceanview room and king bed. The poolside service was wonderful and the staff was very accommodating. The pool did seem a bit cold, but other than that, we had a fabulous time. If you have the chance, definitely book a treatment at their onsite spa. It's pricey, but worth it if you want to pamper yourself. We enjoyed the Hula Grill down the beach and also had a fabulous dinner at Leilani's. I miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kanapalli beach Maui”
Reviews.Author: Kick_8
Reviews.Content: We spent last week (4-22 to 4-29) at the Westin Maui and had a wonderful time. We were traveling with a 7year old and a 4 year old and were pleased with the family atmosphere at this hotel. The children can eat free from the childrens menu at two of the restaurants on the grounds with a paying adult. They had crafts by the pool that the girls could do for a 5.oo fee. The property is beautiful and the grounds imaculate. We found our room to be very small for 4 people, as there was only one sink and no closet or room to put 3 suitcases. (there was an armoire with a foot of hanging space.) The heavenly beds are very nice. The pool is beautiful, but the temperature of the water was TOO cold! My children who will swim in anything could barely stay in the water more than 30 minutes at a time, and my husband and I thought it was excruciating! We stayed the last part of our stay at the Grand Wailea and the pool temp was delightful. I would recommend this hotel, the prices were high, but everything seemed reasonable after we stayed at the Grnad Wailea where everyting was a little more. The location is great, everything is close and there are many restaurants to chose from. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Yolie912
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin from April 20-28, First i got the 4th floor with 2 double beds, they didnt have anything left. So the next morning i got up went to the front desk and asked them if there was any king beds available. The next morning I was checking out into the 7th floor ocean view with a king bed....Fantastic........I loved the view of the pools and the ocean. The pool area was always packed, but we always got lucky to get a good spot. We walked to the Sheraton and what a lovely and romantic hotel....The westin is Ok but the rooms need an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed with the Westin”
Reviews.Author: rawhide
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 days in Maui -- spent the first week in a condo right on the water -- nothing too fancy but good size, great view, peaceful -- then spent the last two days at the Westin -- felt like I was getting robbed every time I turned around (ie $4 for a regular cup of coffee in the morning) -- the Westin felt crowded, was not peaceful at all, the rooms were TINY for two adults and two kids, had a view of the parking lot and it was fairly noisy --- I have to say that my kids enjoyed the pool and slide at the Westin and my wife liked to have poolside service but my preference was somewhere not quite so overdone--- Not sure I would pay the money to do it again

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: aussiebel27
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to staying here but it really disappointed. On arrival at around 4pm our garden view room still wasn't ready so we were given another one - overlooking the car park! We eventually were moved but beware - the rooms are small, especially the bathrooms which could use a renovation require that you close the door in order to move around. We did not meet one pleasant staff member here our entire 4 night stay, they were rude and unhelpful. On the positive side the pool area is fantastic, there's an adults-only area where you can escape the kids and it's so big you're bound to find a quiet spot somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back our 10th anniversary at this hotel and had a great time!! We originally were booked at the Sheraton, but changed when we went and looked at this place (the walkway past Whalers Village takes you to all the Lahaina main beach hotels). It was more of our style and we ended up paying just $3 more a night than the Sheraton. They upgraded us automatically to a partial ocean view, like we had at the Sheraton, without asking. We ate out a lot during our trip and did not use their facilities except for the concierge for booking stuff, which was great. The place is busy and the pools are packed, but make sure you get to the hot tub and meet some new people. (Try the Lava Flows from the bar-fantastic) The rest of our trip was a combination of sightseeing (hiking, helicopter tour, and mountain biking) and I would recommend Maui and this hotel to anyone. One note...they are trying to sell the time shares next door, so don't be surprised about them trying to get you into a meeting. We did do it, but had to pass. We are, however, Starwood guests forever.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Westin Maui and was very impressed. When we arrived, we were upgraded to an ocean view overlooking the pool instead of the garden view we reserved. We had never stayed at a Hotel in Maui, always a condo. Resort was great. Excellent swimming pools and access to beach. Room had a fridge, so we went to safeway and bought food for breakfast and lunch, had dinner our every night. Parking was a nightmare. Not enough spaces available and if you couldn't find one, had to use valet parking at $10.00 per night. Also was in non-smoking room and could smell smoke coming in from air cond vents. All in all, was very impressed and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent , but some major problems for our family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Maui after a last minute cancellation of our cruise to Hawaii. We were there for 5 nights, from March 28th-April 2nd. The immediate feel upon arrival is that of a very nice place. The lobby area is open and lovely. The pool area is great...lots of interconnecting areas, waterfall, a large waterslide, etc. We were booked in a room with two double beds....definitely not a good idea with two children along. Unfortunately, there were no two room suites available. As mentioned, this trip was booked with no planning whatsoever after our cruise was unexpectedly cancelled. The bathroom was great...very large and spacious with lots of shelves for toiletries. We had a nice side-ocean view. Our bedroom area was nice, although nothing special. Both my husband and I did not feel that there was a pleasant smell to the beds/bedding...quite frankly, they did not smell fresh. The elevators were often a problem with very slow service or several out of service completely. I heard many other people complaining about this problem. The health club was quite nice with separate tv's and headphones for each piece of equipment. There were several pieces of equipment out of order, however. The entrance to the spa/gym area is pretty and serene with a "wall of water". I did not have a spa treatment, but I did have a polish change service. My nail technician did a very good job, although I believe that I was over-charged according to the price list which I saw. We dined in both the poolside casual restaurant as well as the more elaborate dinner restaurant. We were happy with all of the food and service. The breakfast buffet was very good. Probably the biggest advantage to staying here, if you have kids, is that they can eat for free with paying adults. This was a real savings as the cost of everything in Hawaii is high. The hotel also offered a "grab and go" option for bagels, cereal, etc. in the restaurant/lobby area, although these items are very over-priced. The beach area in front of the hotel is pretty and there is a nice walkway as well. We had two big problems....our camera was stolen, including all of our photos from a pre-trip in San Francisco. We believe that my husband left it in the car and it was subsequently stolen out of an unlocked, valet-parked car. My 8 year old also had his security blanket from birth taken along with the bedding when the housekeepers provided service. We notified them immediately. This blanket had his name and birthday monogrammed into it and someone must have just thrown it away. There is no excuse for them to not have been able to find and return this very valuable piece of sentiment to our family. I would also consider staying in Wailea over West Maui. Our weather was very windy and rainy. I was told that the weather in South Maui is considerably better. I would have researched all of that if I would have had planning time! Best of luck on planning your trip to Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrendous”
Reviews.Author: JCB24
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Hawaii - and the last 4 days were spent here. How disappointing - even the kids ranked it as their least favorite (ages 11 and 13). Crowded, crowded, crowded. Parking is very cramped and sparse. Lobby is filled with people - so is pool, beach and restaurants. Forget about getting a poolsdie lounge chair unless you throw your belongings on one early in the morning. Yes, they are still painting the front of the hotel. One couple I spoke with said they still had blue painters tape arount their sliders. Houskeeping never showed up one day. They finally cleaned our room when we left for dinner. Long line - with one font desk person checking in guests. Hawaiian hospitality is minimal - they are just too big and are in the business of shuttling thousands of people in and out every week - so one guest looks like the next. Very impersonal. Guest rooms are tired. Need sprucing up. VERY SMALL. Scheduled a pesticide sparying during my stay. I called guest services and told them to put it off. The only benefit fom staying here is now my kids also know never to go back. Basically, I felt like I was in Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Westin. It was one of the most beautiful hotels that I have ever stayed in. The open air lobby lead to waterfalls and Koi ponds. Do understand however that it is a business and that businesses want your money. That being said, I spent $40.00 for breakfast for two. A very good breakfast but $40.00 is a bit much for me. A good thing is that whaler's village is next door with many shops and more reasonable resturants. The best thing about the Westin is that just down the beach is Black Rock, the most spectacular snorkling on that side of the island. The only two things that I would change is that we were double beds and the fact that I origanally planned to host my wedding at the Westin, but after the Westin's Wedding Coordinator found out that it would not be a ten thousand dollar event she just stopped returning my phone calls. I left her 8 messages over a period of two months, none of them returned. But I had a beautiful wedding anyhow at the Seawatch in Wailea. A little about Wailea, it is a nice place, however I believe that I am too young to stay there. I am 23 and I still have a pulse. Who wants to travel to Hawaii and wear a suit and tie. But Maui is beautiful. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. Overall our experience was a good one. We were dissapointed on arrival to find we had been put into a room with two double beds instead of a king bed, but a call to the desk got us a king bed for the rest of the stay. They even sent up a bottle of champagne after they found out we were honeymooners. The lobby was beautiful as was the pool area. Food was very expensive here. The resort fee was a little high too. Finding parking in the evening was difficult. While there were some minor problems during out stay, the staff promptly corrected any complaints we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but could be better for the price”
Reviews.Author: saxmanlee
Reviews.Content: I wanted to share my two cense after reading reviews on this resort before and after my trip to help those travelers think wisely before spending a lot of money on a trip. We stayed at the Westin Maui Deluxe Ocean Front Rooms, for four nights April 2-6 on our multi island hopping trip. Let me first tell you this Hotel is a cash cow. First off, they charge you a ton of money for the rooms, the least they could do is wipe off that silly daily resort fee. Two bottles of water and parking does not equate to that fee. If you want to waste more money, by all means enjoy the food at the hotel, but luckily the hotel is next door to the Whalers Village which offers plenty of food choices. The bathrooms are by no means heavenly, a double shower head which is fixed in position. Our toilet almost fell over, seems like the plumber forgot to bolt it in the ground. They only included one bathrobe in the room so my wife was able to enjoy that. The vanity was very nice. Included the usual accessories, but also had a lighted magnifying mirror and plenty of bottled stuff women love. The refrigerator was a bit tiny, but we were able to keep some food and drinks in there. The room also has a safe to lock your valuables inside. The bed was very comfortable. This is not the bed for those who would prefer a firm bed or an extremely soft mattress. The duvet cover was a bit much, unless you like to sweat in your sleep. We had to keep adjusting the thermostat because the AC kept going back to Auto- mode when we wanted to keep the air moving. We had to keep it set at 64 deg. for the room to stay at 72 deg. There is no closet in the room for hanging formal wear, not that you really need formal wear in Hawaii. They provide you with a Dresser / Chest that includes two drawers, one for you, and one for her and about 1' rack to hang your clothes. The hotel is decorated beautifully with the open lobby facing a tropical pool with waterfalls, fish, flamingos, and if it's not to windy, the parrots will be outside on their perches. The pools are pretty, but it can be a bit crowded. The beach is very nice and provides excellent views for whale watching and the neighboring islands of Molokai and Lanai. Over all I would give this resort 3.5 stars, everything about the hotel is wonderful until you walk into your room, then you may become greatly disappointed. I hardly spent any time at the hotel since there was too much too see and too little time while on Maui. This resort is for perfect for people who love cruise ships, crowds, and lines. This is not the resort for people who love quiet remote destinations. Oh watch out for the time share vultures, they are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jimed
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the grounds of the hotel and the adjoining beach are breathtaking. Also, being next door to Whaler's Village was a huge plus for our family of 4. My biggest disappointment was the room itself. We were in the newer tower, but were told at our 3:30 check-in that there were no doubles available. We would have to use the couch and a rollaway for the kids. OK, not a huge problem. So we get to the room and surprise! no couch in the room. It turns out, this was a handicapped accessible room so no couch, no heavenly shower (replaced by an ordinary hand held shower head). We were told we could switch to a double in 2 days (Spring Break week). Nothing horrible, just hadn't planned on spending my nights with a restless 8 year old sleeper in the bed between us! Just didn't feel like we received everything we paid for. Would probably choose a different hotel in the same vacinity next time. Also, am I the only one who thinks the heavenly beds are too HARD?! I would have rated this hotel as 3 stars, but the pool area and adjoining beach made it a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauifanSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. We stayed there for 3 nights over Spring Break in March, and although it was crowded (to be expected), the hotel was very comfortable. Beds are great, everything was in good condition, and we had a lovely stay. If you have kids, the pools are just terrific, and the "keiki club" kid's camp was perfect! We actually moved to a condo after our stay at the Westin, but our son loved the camp so much that we came back to the hotel several times so he could attend the camp again. Lots of fun and a really well-run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: ScottKurant
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel in February. All three nights were free via Starwood points. We are Gold members. We arrived around 12:30 pm expecting a room immediately. They say 3 p.m. check in but most hotels accomodate you especially if you are a gold member. I complained several times until they somehow by magic found us a room in the old building two hours later. The room was the size of a large closet. we finally were told by a very nice mgr. that they would move us to the larger beach tower rooms the next day. At 12 pm the next day we were told the room still wasn't ready and it would not be ready untill 3pm. I complained to a mgr and somehow by magic the room was ready in five minutes. All in all most of the desk staff were indifferent and unaccomodating. The concierges were always trying to get you to take the time share tour. They also have a number of salespeople in different locations between the pool and beach hawking guests to take the time share presentation. This hotel has absolutely no class. Wailea is much nicer and much less commercial.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jasmine99
Reviews.Content: We Just Got Back Friday Had A Great time At the Westin They up Graded us to A ocean Front Room The room was Great Seen Whales from Are Room. The people Were So nice to us and the Resort is Beatiful. Some of the food was drinks were pricey but we eat at the food court next door and the hulla grill drinks are cheap there. We snokleing at black rock alot of fish. maui is nice place to go too.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a seven night stay at the Westin Maui, and we were not fully impressed. Though the facilities were absolutely breathtaking, we did not get the room we requested (we had booked our trip MONTHS in advance). For their rather steep prices, the Westin Maui does not seem to deliver with adequate rooms. Also, the maid service was the worst we have ever experienced in years of travel (and the rest of the hotel seemed very understaffed as well--but to be fair, the staff they did have was very friendly). For three days they didn't make our bed, but simply pulled up the covers, and the room was dusty. Also, sometimes our room had not been cleaned until after four o'clock in the afternoon. However, the great pools and breathtaking and convenient location almost let us overlook some of the other deficiencies. The food in the restaurants within the hotel was good, but the prices were quite expensive (as was most everything in Maui). Also, if you were not satisfied with the food, then you could simply walk next door to the Whaler's Village shopping area where there were various dining locations (including the Hula Grill--HIGHLY RECOMMENDED). Overall, I would recommend going to the beautiful island of Maui, but I would also recommend staying at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Feb. 19-21, 2005. After 3 nights in the worst of rooms at the Sheraton in Waikiki, I was so happy to arrive at the Westin in Maui. We got a free lift from the airport in West Maui to the resort and the driver offered a lot of information. We were greeted at the door with leis and smiles. Since I used points and promotions for 3 free nights, my original reservation listed a "low floor, garden view" room, so I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a high floor, in the beach tower upon check-in! (Platinum Member) even though the resort was sold out. The $18 resort fee is per room, not per person, and includes free internet access, two bottles of water daily, etc. The resort was beautiful and everyone was so friendly and helpful. They do try to get you to take a tour of their time-shares, but it's not a hard-sell and we didn't go on the tour. The fitness center is kinda small, but adequate. The pools and waterfalls are amazing! Our bed and bath were heavenly! Water sports are available - we rented boogie boards one day and snorkle gear the next. The restaurants were slightly expensive, but the cafe and pool service are worth every cent! Overall, a terrific place to stay - we can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shame, Shame on you Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms and we were all assigned to the old tower. Without being advised beforehand, painting crews and drilling were right outside our Lanais rendering them useless during the day. I later found a note in our rooms which said "Please do not use your Lanai between 8 AM and 6 PM; we are keeping the Westin beautiful for your future stays. We apologize for the inconvenience." Do I really care about "our future stays?" I am a Starwood Gold member; only because of that did they move one of our three rooms to the "Beach Tower." You see....they had many groups and were sold out. Well, you do not do exterior painting during the high season; you simply close off a portion of the hotel and paint/repair in September-October. But painting crews charge more in low-season. The rooms in the old tower are ludicrously small and you cannot get maid-service it seems before 5PM, even if you call "service express." In the "Beach Tower," however, the rooms are cleaned early and even turned down. It seems like you must pay for an Ocean View to get "Heavenly Service" in Maui. The beds may be "Heavenly," but surely some of the mattresses haven't been changed in years. I have never experienced a more uncomfortable bed at a Westin. However, the Spa at the Westin is spectacular. Everyone in our group had an amazing treatment. Jon, the Spa concierge is a sweetie, and Kelly my masseuse was wonderful. I was surprised, however, that one of the spa assistants said that it would be "too difficult" to lower the temperature of the men's whirlpool. It must have been about 105 degrees. All in all, unless you are dying to stay at a water amusement park, the Westin is ridiculously overpriced, with almost no spirit of "Aloha." Save your money and stay at the "Aston Mahana," 1.5 miles north. Beautiful sunsets from every room and true Hawaiian spirit are to be found there. The Westin Maui has almost no relation to it's mainland namesakes.

Reviews.Title: “"Heavenly Experience?" .. with Prices from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: mewcom
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just a Westin Curse for me, but I have never been able to justify this chain's mediocre amenities with the utterly outrageous prices. We had a less- than-perfect experience in Grand Cayman in 2004, and most likely would never have returned to a Westin, but we were participating in a wedding at the Westin Maui and decided to stay there. Hence, another disappointment -- with even extra expenses! Our room, in the older tower, was ridiculously small. My husband and I were bumping into each other all the time. There is no closet; the armoire which holds the TV set has a little side door with a double rack for hanging clothes, and two large drawers. The fridge just sits out in the room, with no enclosure whatsoever. I can learn to live with small coffees for breakfast and outlandish prices for juice, muffins and rolls, but the experience in the Salon/Spa was simply untenable. I decided to have an "up" do for the wedding, which was posted at $45 on the Westin Web site. After the stylist spent about 15 minutes creating a so-so style, she charged me $105. A miscommunication in the Spa led to an interruption mid-massage, which ended with the therapist leaving me lying on a table in a dark room for about 5-10 minutes. They would only refund up to 20%, or provide a repeat massage. I opted for a repeat massage, which was OK. Not great mind you, just OK (I had a better experience on the beach in the Dominican Republic in January -- for a whopping $35.) What's more, there is a $17 a day "hotel charge" that covers virtually nothing but parking. After spending a small fortune on the room, I believe this "hotel charge" to be extortion. The rooms were never cleaned early in the day -- quite often we would return at 3 pm, only to have to stand and wait outside the room for the cleaning to be finished. To the lost and found/security department's credit, they returned some jewelry (COD) I left behind right after I notified them, which indicates a level of honesty among the housekeeping staff that is admirable. My husband and I both got the impression that they were woefully understaffed for 100% occupancy. The location is wonderful, the pools are very inviting and the management staff seems somewhat concerned about guest comfort. But when one considers the very pricy tab for this hotel, there is no price/value equivalent. I would recommend an alternative -- there are many beautiful properties on Maui. Take the time to find one that offers a true comfortable vacation experience

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin in April 2004, we're getting the bug to go back around now as we live in Indiana and the whether isn't all that spectacular. We had one of the cheapest rooms available, right above the reception area off to the side of the hotel. We were just above one of the entrances to/from the pool, and we absolutly loved it. Our room opened up to the ocean, sure we could see the top of the roof below us, but we didn't mind. The beds were incredible, and we had a waterfall right outside our door. We went to bed ever night with our patio door opened so the water put us to sleep, talk about a dream vacation. All of the staff we came across were very polite and helpful, they even recommended a doctor for when I got water blisters from the sun (gotta love being a redhead in Hawaii). We'v been saving ever since we got back from our last trip and anticipating our next. If your going to Maui, stay here, it's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful family place.”
Reviews.Author: CaFuntrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed there December 17 through 23rd. We were lucky to have beautiful weather and a great hotel. Two kids, age 9 and 11 loved the beach and had many friends from the first day. Yes, the rooms are small but why are you in them except to sleep? Even though the place was full, we had no problem with the pool chairs and no wait for service. We had breakfast included and to our surprise the kids under 12 eat for free. Highly recommend to have breakfast included if possible otherwise the buffet is $25. Took a trip to Molikini and Lanai with the whale foundation and found it to be perfect. The staff all were very knowledgable and helpful and this snorkel cruise was one of the least expensive. Ate at Leilanis a few times with good prices and great food. Lahaina was very pricey and crowded while we were there. Don't know if it is always like that or was just because of the Christmas break. Overall, a great stay with The Westin and will return. Oh yeah, The Heavenly Beds!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Penny!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WKONewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin Maui in January 2005 for 9 days and it was worth every penny. We were upgraded to a Oceanview room without asking. The room is spacious with a great view of the pool area and the ocean. The bathroom is super spacious with the wonderful Heavenly Showers. We had the Air Condition on high all the time so having the Heavenly Beds (Down comforter) kept us warm overnight. The grounds are nicely kept. The restaurant is abit expensive but the food is delicious. There is also food service while you're by the pool with almost the same menu as the restaurant which is several dollars less than sitting in the restaurant. We did go the Whalers Village almost everynight which was nice. The shaved ice by the pool is wonderful and delicious especially if you need to cool down from the hot sun. The staff and maid service was excellent. We had a cleaned room everyday with fresh towels and two bottles of water in our refrigerator.The day we checkout (1pm), we were given a suite to shower and change before leaving to the airport at 6pm without charging us. That was a plus since our flight wasnt' till 12midnight. Overall, we had great experience there and are thinking of going back the end of the year. We have also recommended this hotel to friends and coworkers who are thinking of going to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Westin reservations? No sweat!”
Reviews.Author: fourcalls
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Westin Maui Resort. If you've made reservations, relax!!! I am a fan of this website and since making my reservations at the Westin last June, I have sweated this trip. When you spend this kind of money to stay at a hotel, you have certain expectations. From many of the reviews I'd read, I wasn't sure what to expect and wondered if I'd spent my vacation wishing, "If I'd only changed my reservation to ..." From the minute we arrived, we found not only the Westin staff, but Maui folks in general, have a very pleasant disposition (heck, what is there to complain about in Maui anyway?!) The bell hops greeted us warmly, we received leighs and were kindly assisted into our room. We had a third floor "garden view" room and found the view very pleasant. We did try for an upgrade, however the hotel was booked (mid-winter break for many of us mid-westerners!) It is always worth asking just the same, as I am often granted upgrades in most hotels if they have a room available! With a family of four, the standard room is small. Accept that fact right now, resign yourself to living out of your suitcase and getting a comfortable night's sleep and you will have a great time! For those of you on a budget (if there is such a thing in Maui), consider using your in-room frig to stock up at Costco and Walmart. On our first day we purchased, paper bowls, cereal, spoons and milk; bagels and peanut butter; apples and grapes = with the in-room coffee (Kona coffee is the best) we had BREAKFAST. We also purchased turkey lunch meat, paper plates, a loaf of King's Hawaiian bread (excellent), chips, cookies and "beach snacks" = with the fruit we purchased and some mayo and mustard packets from the breakfast bar downstairs, we had LUNCH. Mix this up with a few meals out and there you go! Not grand, but affordable! We used the two drawers in the TV armour to store our food and we were all set! A few other tips: WHALE WATCHING-- do NOT go out with Pacific Whale Foundation's captain "ZEEK." Trust me on this one, you will watch (through your binoculars) the other boats head to the spouts and breaching whales while you troll or "park" in still water. However, our trip with them earlier in the week with captain Mike, was excellent. SNORKELING--if you snorkel around Black Rock in Ka'anapali, don't forget the north shore around the other side of the rock near the Westin Villas. While we saw many beautiful fish and felt very safe in the water in front of the Sheraton; however, we didn't see any turtles until we ventured around to the northern shore. Water is still relatively calm and safe. HANA--it can be a very long day depending on how many stops you make. A couple of suggestions. If you have the Maui Revealed book, there are several suggestions of places to visit where they tell you to ignore "keep out" or "private" signs. The islanders were very clear on this point: in many instances these lands are on private property and in other cases, these stops are on SACRED LAND. While you will probably visit unscathed, we respected the islander's request to leave that land alone and enjoy the many other PUBLIC spots available. We still saw more than we had time to thoroughly enjoy! Lastly, CAR RENTAL--if there are more than two of you and you plan to do the trip to Hana, you really need a four-door car. We had a two-door and after about the third stop, the seat flippin' thing really getting old! I have really gleaned a lot from this website, hope I can offer something here in return. Aloha and mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Westin Maui!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTruth
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the naysayers. The Westin Maui is an awesome place to stay. If you book a "budget deal" room...you get a budget-room! Since you don't go to Maui every weekend, (or else you wouldn't be reading this) step up to the plate and spend the extra dough and get an ocean-front room or suite. You won't be disappointed. (This from a guy who used to stay at the Four Seasons in Wailea) We had a wonderful week at the Westin Maui! Gorgeous views of the beach (one of the BEST in Maui too) and great service from the hotel staff. They all have the "Aloha Spirit"! You can watch the Humpback whales all day long from your balcony! I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui was absolutely OUTSTANDING! My husband and I went here for our honeymoon. We stayed December 12-17, 2004. We were welcomed with a beautiful lei greeting. This is a great time of year to come to the Westin Maui. We are actually considering returning this year for our 1 year anniversary during that same week. It was very quiet and the hotel was filled to about 70% capacity. Everything about the Westin Maui is amazing. The hotel lobby-waterfalls, poi fish, tropical birds, etc. The restaurants are great. I would highly recommend going to the breakfast buffet in the morning, ask for Tammy. She is very nice and has excellent advice on what do to and see in Maui. The "Heavenly Beds" are just that-and the "Heavenly Showers" are average. The pools are excellent, water slides and water falls to play in, very comfortable chairs to lay out on. The outdoor massage is a treat! The gym is nice, it overlooks the pools and beach. In the winter, you can see the whales jump right out in front of the hotel. Honestly, the Westin Maui was perfect to us. We wouldn't have it any other way. The staff is there to make your experience memorable. Also, make sure to always ask if there are available upgrades. We got a beautiful ocean view room just by asking. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently went to the Westin for our honeymoon, almost always stay in 4+ star hotels. We researched and researched and researched for hotels in Maui in every location. We read all the reviews, looked for the deals, the same thing you are doing...spent some 20+ hours! The Westin had a good deal with Expedia, we were torn between the Sheraton and Westin for the Lahaina area. The Westin's pictures looked terrible on the websites except for the pool area so we were worried but the price was lower so we went for it. The Westin was gorgeous! The common areas are all outside and updated. There are five huge beautiful pools with slides and waterfalls that connect them all. There is a private adult area and we never had a problem with kids. There are two towers, one renovated and looking just like Westin's usual brand new contemporary look with the most amazing beds. The room was spotless and we were upgraded for free. The older tower was being renovated so that is where the only bad reviews are coming from. The rest of the hotel, including the service is exceptional. Everything was clean and everyone was nice! Shopping right next door with a very nice mall, Coach stores and places like that. We did a ton of traveling! Put 800 miles on our rented jeep in 8 days! Went to almost every beach and every nice hotel, we did EVERYTHING there was to do on the island and I mean it. Hiked 2 hours through jungle, bamboo, swam through rivers and climbed waterfalls to get to private 300 foot falls in the middle of nowhere. We got an awesome Maui adventure book that was worth every cent 10 times over, told us everything. Almost all of the hotels were older and just starting renovations. The sheraton was way dumpier in my mind, the rooms are nicer than the Westin's old rooms, but not the new ones. The rest of the hotel is plain and boring, nothing cool except black rock, which is on the beach and within 3 minutes of walking, open to everyone. Go to the Westin, book through Expedia if you can get deals like free upgrades and meal vouchers(the best thing we got, free breakfast buffet every morning at the nice restaurant, usually $30/person, everything in Hawaii is like that) Book through Starwood otherwise and become a Starwood member regardless, they give you free upgrades when you checkin. Rent a vehicle, go see the island, get a Jeep if you like to be adventurous and buy the 'Maui Adventure' book (the name is close). Do the road to Hana with the book and stop EVERYWHERE it tells you, it will be sooo worth it. Some people complain about the long trip and say don't do it, well we went back for another day to finish because there was sooo much to do, hardly anyone knows what is really there. Have fun, save money by eating at chain places, Outback or fast food, go to Walmart for snacks and liquor and go see the island, it is one of the most beautiful places on Earth. I won't even go back to Florida now, just seems so pointless :- (

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Makeover gets an A+”
Reviews.Author: islandmele
Reviews.Content: The Westin has always occupied the top spot of hotels along the Kaanapali Strand. However, I have seen a decline in the aesthetics of ALL the properties along Kaanapali Beach since Kapalua and Wailea started developing their "coasts" along the Maui Isle and have lured more and more of the tourist market. You'll see that many Kaanapali resorts have come under the "time share" thing. (Stay away salivating sales reps or you will get lured into one of these two hour hard sell sales pitches)! Anyway, the Westin has impressed me in their makeover which gets an A+. They have relanscaped the grounds, updated their eateries, and the best part - installed new heavenly beds in all the rooms. Wow! The bed in the room was incredible. The rooms are small and there is very little storage space so be prepared to use your luggage as a make shift drawer and your bar counter as a dresser table. Apart from that, location is terrific - mid strand. Everything walkable/strollable! Whaler's village is right next door which is very convenient. Enjoy your stay. I did!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: tandr321
Reviews.Content: Reading these reviews are ridiculous! I love staying at nice places, I have expensive taste and I thought this hotel was perfect! The beds, the room, the service, the views... all of it was perfect! We stayed at the Westin on our honeymoon in August and we loved it! I just do not know where these people who complain about this hotel are coming from. We will definately stay at the Westin when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “sweet georgia brown!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at westin. True the rooms are not the greatest and a bit small But we spent no time in our room hello your in Maui try going outside. The pool is sweet, and the location is great. I dont know what people want. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Westin Maui last August. I did quite a bit of research ahead of time, as Maui is by no means an inexpensive place to visit. I had considered several more inexpensive resorts in the area, and I'm very pleased that we decided to splurge. We booked a partial ocean view, and were upgraded to full ocean view on arrival. If you read all reviews, you will find that this is more of a rule than an exception. At any rate, we were in a room on the 10th floor which provided us a tremendous view of the ocean, pool, and surrounding islands. I had read several reviews about the size of the rooms, but it was plenty large for our week-long stay. Most of our time in the room was spent in the bed, which was quite comfortable. We also received a bottle of champagne in our room on our second night. A nice touch, although it was lousy champagne. Staff was courteous and accomodating - we visited the concierge several times for recommendations and services. We also indulged in a couple's massage at the Spa, which was awesome! It was my first massage ever, and it was wonderful. We spent time every day at the pools - 90% of it at the adult pool because there was much less traffic, and the wait staff was very attentive. The drinks were great, the food was pretty good, but very expensive. Don't be shocked by the bill at the end of the trip. The breakfest buffet was expensive, but worth it for the convienience and quality and quantity of food. Most days we only had a small snack for lunch because we were still full from breakfast! Overall, we had a great time, took part in several activities, and loved our stay. It seems to me those who post extremely negative reviews must be extremely hard to please. If you are fairly easy-going, you'll love it too!

Reviews.Title: “We won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaTravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Ka'anapali Beach several times during 1990's. We had always stayed at the Hyatt Regency, so this time we decided to give the Westin a shot. Bottom line: we'll stick with the Hyatt Regency on future trips. We arrived at 9 p.m. which I knew might be a problem, but we didn't have much choice because of airline schedules. Busy hotels tend to have only the dregs left if you arrive late. Sure enough, our reservation for a "garden view" room with a king sized bed was met with an offer of a parking lot view room (a.k.a. "terrace" room) with two double beds. When we objected that our reservation stipulated "garden view" and "king sized bed," the front desk clerk told two bald-faced lies. First, she claimed that "garden view" and "terrace" are one and the same. The Westin web site disagrees. It clearly shows "terrace" and "garden view" as being in different parts of the buildings. Second, she claimed that the type of bed is not guaranteed. Again, the web site disagrees, stating only that "special requests" cannot be guaranteed. The type of bed is integral to the room type description on the web site, and in fact, rooms with king sized beds are sometimes quoted at a higher rate than rooms with two double beds. Realizing that we were not about to accept this nonsense, the clerk offered us a "complimentary" upgrade to an "ocean view" room with a king sized bed. So we accepted that, but when we went to the room we discovered why the clerk was so quick to offer us this room: a notice said we would not be able to use the balcony because the outside of that part of the hotel was being painted. We went back to the front desk, and said that there was no way we were staying for a week in a room in which we couldn't use the balcony because of paint fumes. Our next room was a "mountain view" room with two double beds, and a promise of a "partial ocean view" room with a king sized bed (and a usable balcony) the next day. We accepted that and got into what was a minor upgrade of what we reserved, albeit a day late. When we checked out, we discovered that the hotel expected us to pay $20 extra for that first night and $50 extra for the six subsequent nights because of the different room categories. The hotel also tried to charge $10 for the valet parking we had to use when we arrived because the self-park lot was full (we were told there would be no extra charge). I objected to all of these extra charges, and they were removed. When I asked why I had been charged for what we were told were "complimentary upgrades," both the desk clerk and the duty manager said they had no idea. I can only assume that their back-office staff are told to ignore "complimentary upgrade" notations on the chance that customers will not notice. Certainly, the front desk didn't argue about removing the charges (the rate we were quoted was right in front of them on their monitor). To add to my irritation, there was no hint of apology from any of the staff. Their attitude seemed to be "OK, you spotted it, we'll take the charges off." If you stay at this hotel, check your bill carefully, especially if you received services or upgrades which you were told were "complimentary." Now for some other comments on the hotel. The $18 per day "resort fee" includes self parking, two bottles of water per day in your room refrigerator, use of the gym, and a few other small things (like a "free" portrait sitting and 4x6 print from an onsite photographer who, of course, will want you to purchase a $200 package). There is no reason to pay $10 extra (+tips) per day for valet parking, since both the valet lot and self park lot are literally 50 feet from the entrance to the hotel. If the self park lot is full, they will valet park your car for no extra charge (check your bill) except the valet's tip. The water is nice, but you have to ask for it. If you don't remind the maids to restock each day, they will not (even if it is obvious you have consumed the previous day's water). We didn't use any of the hotel's restaurants, because quite frankly, they have zero atmosphere. The OnO Bar and Grill is in the pool area, right beside the major foot traffic route from the lobby to the pool and beach. The noise from the waterfalls is deafening, you'll be sitting mere steps away from bins full of used pool towels by the pool activities hut, and the view in the other direction is people lounging around the pool in bathing suits--not a pretty sight, for the most part. The Tropica restaurant claims to have beach and sunset views. That might be the case, but it looks like a huge concrete patio which lacks any decoration or landscaping whatsoever. We ended up dining at the Hyatt Regency several times, and realized that the difference between the Hyatt and the Westin restaurants is the Hyatt isolates their dining spaces from the rest of the hotel, and also divides them up within, so you feel like you are in an intimate space, not sitting in the lobby or on the beach boardwalk. The Hyatt restaurants also maximize views. You'll be looking at lush foliage or the beach and the ocean, not service huts and foot traffic. The Hyatt restaurants are not cheap, but they are no more expensive than the Westin's restaurants. The same comments apply to the Hyatt's bars. The Westin's pool is rather ordinary. For some reason, they have outfitted their loungers with ivory colored cushions which all look stained. That's a really bad choice of color. The loungers look quite unattractive because of this. We took advantage of the Westin's "stay at one, play at three" service, whereby you can use the outdoor facilities at the nearby Sheraton Black Rock and the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort (a timeshare on north Ka'anapali beach--more about that later). The Sheraton's pool is much more interesting and the pool bar there is much better, with a great sunset view. The Westin's "heavenly bed" which they brag about so much is comfortable, although a bit over done. You don't need the duvet, especially because the air conditioning thermostat is on a motion sensor, which means as soon as you drop off to sleep it switches off regardless of the room temperature and thermostat setting. We found the room uncomfortably warm at night for most of our stay. The room and bathroom itself are typical for tropical hotels. The hotel figures you've come for the weather and the beaches, and there's lots of demand (if you don't rent the room, someone else will), so why bother spending money keeping the rooms up to a typical North American mainland standard? The bathroom fixtures look to be at least 15 years old (maybe older). The furniture is sparse. There is no wall closet, only a small freestanding unit that includes the TV and two deep drawers. At least we didn't see any bugs. Speaking of bugs, the hotel wanted to spray the inside of our room with insecticide while we were there. We wouldn't allow it. You really do have to be firm with the hotel management, or they will walk all over you in spite of the king's ransom you're paying them. Like a lot of other hotel chains, Westin is pushing timeshares. Every time we turned around in the lobby, someone was asking us to go to one of those "presentations" to learn about the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort. We realized that these are opportunities for sales people to try to hook us into making what most timeshare owners eventually realize (too late) is a huge financial blunder. However, the 7500 Starwood points they were offering us to play along, combined with the points we were earning during our week at the hotel, would be enough for several nights at hotels on a road trip we're planning in the Pacific Northwest this spring. So off we went at an appointed time. Our sales rep was a personable but rather inexperienced young woman who was obviously following a detailed sales script. She took us on a tour of one of the units (the resort is still under construction--only one of three buildings is complete). We then returned to the hotel where she took us to one of the "closing" rooms. This is where the hard sell takes place. After a bit of back and forth, she said she had to visit the ladies room, and returned with a sales manager. The sales manager placed his chair in the middle of the doorway (there is no escape), but when he realized that we were not about to spend up to $80,000 for a week per year (plus pay up to $2600 per year in maintenance fees for that week) he became quite rude. He said we were "wasting" our money staying at a hotel like the Westin. He strongly implied that we were, in fact, stupid for being "renters" rather than "owners" (even though as an "owner," our annual maintenance fees would look a lot like the cost of being a "renter" for a week, not to mention paying as much as $80,000 up front for the privilege). He also claimed that Westin timeshares will be worth more in the future--which is not true for any timeshare on the planet (see below). At this point, our "90 minute commitment" had stretched into almost two hours, and I announced that the meeting was over. Fortunately, we did get a receipt for the 7500 points we were promised. By the way, if you go for the presentation and begin to feel like buying a timeshare (and it is a timeshare, in spite of the fact that Westin claims it is different), know this: when you buy a timeshare from a developer, on average 40% of the price goes to cover the developer's sales and marketing costs. This is consistent with the fact that resale of timeshares (by people who have realized what a mistake it was) is a buyers market, and most sellers will be lucky to get back 40% of what they paid. If you really want a timeshare, buy a resale.

Reviews.Title: “Maui-great:Westin-not”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip was Dec. 27-Jan 5. Quite crowded but Maui was wonderful. Lots of sight-seeing and beautiful scenery! Rent the convertible and do the road to Hana, discover the drive around the northern tip of the island, snorkel, book a Pacific Whale Foundation whale-watching trip, and check out the volcano! We travelled with 9 yr old twins and had a ball. The hotel however was mediocre at best. When we entered the Westin it looked very nice but looks can be deceiving. We stayed in the Ocean Tower and the room was old and run-down. The rug was dirty and full of stains. The room was small and there was no drawer or closet space. We were staying for ten days and had to leave all of our clothes in our suitcases. They remained on the scrungy rug for the entire trip. Not sure what the cleaning staff did in our room each day other than make the beds and most of the time leave us some towels. We did have to call and beg for towels on one or two occasions plus buy shampoo down in the sundry shop since none was replaced in our bathroom. Maybe because of the luggage problem, the rug, which was dirty to begin with, was never vacuumed and I noticed for four days in a row the same grains of sand on the bathroom floor. We wiped the floor ourselves with the bathroom towels. The last two nights the pipes in the bathroom were banging so hard from around 11:30 pm through 2:30 am that my husband went to the front desk to complain, but to no avail. We would've asked to move but because of the suitcase issue it would have been even more inconvenient than staying up half the night. One day I came out of the shower to find men hanging on a scaffold doing work outside our lanai. Needless to say I shut the curtains quickly! Luckily, we were hardly in our room but for the price, we expected it to be cleaned at least. If you want to hang by the pool you need to get up and save lounge chairs by 7:30 am. People put towels down to save the chairs and don't return all day, very frustrating if you just want to take a dip. The cushions on the chairs are absolutely disgusting, make sure you get enough towels so that you can put at least one over them before sitting there. The positive was the location!! Great beach, easy access to very good restaurants in Whaler's Village and at the surrounding Marriot and Hyatt. Don't waste your $ at the Tropica, mediocre food at best. Best restaurant was in Lahaina, the Cafe Savauge (SP ?)! Would NOT go back to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed....”
Reviews.Author: dancer45
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meeting there the second week of January. Since the company paid for the 4 days my experience was probably a bit different than the average tourist. Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, I have to say that some of the points are valid and some of the negative critiques appear to have been written by those who are generally quick to find fault. Here are some of my observations: If you want to hear the sound of the waves and the wind through the trees from your balcony I would recommend staying in the beach tower. They have this lovely waterfall centered in the middle of the hotel, but the white noise totally obliterates the ambiance of the surf and the wind. What were they thinking? Our room was an ocean view, but looked out directly over the waterfall. Although my husband didn't mind it, it was a bit to harsh and loud for me. We requested a room change and were moved to the south end of the tower the next day which was a little better. There were a lot of children there, but it seems there are small chidren wherever you go. The only place you might see less of them might be at the Ritz in Kapalua? I don't know. There is an adult pool which is a bit more quiet. I personally didn't have a hard time finding a chair but it may not always be in the spot you want to be in. Don't be shy about asking an employee to help you search for one that looks like it's being held but not in use, as they have a policy to not let that happen. The rooms are small and at first glance it seems there is no storage to be had. Realize that there are 2 large drawers under the t.v., and closet (albiet small) space to the left of the armoire. There is a double bar in the closet and my husband used the lower bar and I used the top. You might want to call housekeeping for extra hangers. We used the drawers in the nightstand, and we also used the storage under the wet bar for our toiletries and smaller traveling bags. Our shoes went under the bed. Ultimately we were able to put everything out of sight. Room service, valet, and housekeeping were timely. Remember, in a big hotel you're going to have to wait longer than 15 minutes for something, but we never had to wait longer than 20 to 30. Remember that you're in the tropics and between the salt and the humidity things can get a bit corrosive although the only mold I saw was a bit under the soap holder in the shower. I was walking down the hallway on afternoon and saw the hotel maid wiping clean the wall and interior door trim as she was working her way out of the room...you can't ask for more than that.
