There is a Safeway and a Long's in Lahaina and we stocked up on soda's/snacks and put them in the mini-fridge. Finally, you have to remember that EVERYTHING in Hawaii is expensive. If you want more for your dollar go to Mexico. We were in Cancun this summer and although it was nice...It's not Hawaii. Whaler's Village next door has good shopping and a McDonald's if your so inclined. One almost needs a car to really sight -see although there are excursions from the hotel, and the whale watching (fabulous) boat picked us up on the beach next door in Whaler's Villlage. There is an excursion kiosk down by the towel hut on the property as well as in the lobby of the hotel. I walked around and looked at all the hotel resorts along the strip and honestly feel that if you are going to stay at a resort in Kaanipali that the Westin is a very good choice. FYI about the airport...remember it's not a major airport so checking in is very SLOW! Give yourself plenty of time to catch your plane.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 month old son and I stayed for 5 nights after Thanksgiving during a 10 night trip. The Westin experience began w/the valets and our welcome, very nice folks. We stayed in a corner Ste with a great view of the water and beach. The room was nice and spacious. We spent a couple days hanging out at the pool and made full use of the beautiful facility. The water in the pool was quite cold, I enjoyed the ocean much better. But, the staff had given us a floaty and ball for our son, which he thoroughly enjoyed. The location is great. It was so nice to go for a morning walk along the path and to have Whalers Village just a short distance. Some good options for meals around the hotel, as well. This is quite convenient to be able to use our stroller and walk to dinner and back to put our son down for the night. Only faults I could point out are a bit of aging facility (rooms), shows in the wear of the walls and carpet. Our bathroom needed to be updated too, shower wasn't that nice, tub was small and little counter space for all our toiletries. Add a shelf, that'd help a lot. I've stayed in nicer rooms, but I really can't complain about having a Suite. It didn't hamper our trip or experience, we would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: dazzlin
Reviews.Content: My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin. The food was excellent, the spa is wonderful, the rooms were exquisite and the service was the best! The grounds are absolutely beautiful and even though we found our balcony "locked", we snipped the seal and enjoyed it (without furniture) anyway. The inconvenience only lasted a a couple of days. The pools are very busy - lots of kids (was week before Christmas) and some parents let the kids use the adult pool and whirlpool even though clearly posted "adult". Book tours when you get there or in advance as the days they are available are sometimes limited. Highly recommend Hike Maui trip to see waterfalls and even jump off a cliff if you're brave like me! Loved the place - Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and lack of cleanliness ruins what COULD be a first class resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Westin Maui. The hotel is located on the same perfect stretch of beach as other fine hotels, most of which are more reasonably priced than the Westin. We found the hotel to be beautiful, but poor service and sporatic cleaning as well as odd rules regarding beach towels destroyed the concept of a "heavenly" vacation (Westin likes to use the word "heavenly" to describe their experience). We were told that if we wanted to wash clothes we had to hike 15 minutes to the Sheraton Maui to do our laundry (or send our laundry out via Westin). The pool was overcrowded with lounge chairs, yet one is asked to pay 5$ to take the same chair to the less crowded beach steps away. Our hotel room was never vacuumed once during our week long stay. The rugs are soiled and the pool area is dirty. The spa was never at spa temperature. I felt like Westin had come upon hard times to nickel and dime patrons the way that they do. And try to get a towel after 6:oopm. You are asked to wait in line at the front desk, then are told to go to the bell captain's desk (outside in front of the hotel). There are signs everywhere that The Westin will charge patrons $25 for "unreturned towels". The towels are dingy and threadbare; we were curious why anyone would want to take one in the first place. We plan to come back to Maui, but not to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Westin”
Reviews.Author: fatdawg
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent a week in Dec on Maui after running the Honolulu marathon. We did a lot of research since it was our first visit to Hawaii and selected the Westin. We usually prefer the smaller accomodations but figure how can you go wrong anywhere on Hawaii. We had a great stay at the Westin. The only thing we had to go thru was that they did not put us in a 'full' ocean front room when we first checked in. We paid for an ocean front room and they put us in a 'partial' (the building closest to the Whaler Village). The receptionist checked us in mentioned some thing in the affect of 'if the room is not what you expected, please let us know..' It was quite strange and I wondered if they tried to get away with it if people do not complain. We went back to the front desk and Taka found us a much better room on the 8th floor facing the ocean. Although it took him a little while to accomodate us, he did let us check out the room first and made sure we liked it bettern than the original room. The room we got was in the building facing the pool. The room was a little smaller than the origianl. But the wife preferred the full ocean front view. Beside this little incident, the rest of the stay was great. The room was clean. The heavenly bed and shower were wonderful. The food was good (we only ate in once and breakfast a few times). The staff were courteous. We had a very pleasant stay. One small note, the noise of the waterfall is a little loud even on the 8th floor. Although it was not something you can't get used to. By Friday (the week before Christmas), the place got a lot more crowded. The Westin during high season must be pretty busy. Something else to keep in mind. Overall, I recommend this place.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Long Island, a sister island to the Hawaiian chain
Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Maika'i
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending Christmas vacation at the Westin Maui. It was great! The place is elegant with an impressive walk through water garden... streams, plants, waterfalls (including a large waterfall you can walk behind), fish, etc... The food was delicious at the resturant "Ono"... which means delicious in Hawaiian. I'm a big breakfast person. The breakfast buffet was nothing short of incredible, having everything, lacking nothing. Even though it was crowded (Christmas week - yikes!), we were able to get an ocean view table every morning. I guess people don't realize they have the ocean view area. Shhh... don't tell 'em. The place was spotless! Everybody was friendly even though you could see they had their hands full. The valets were masterful at their job. My 9 year old son and his friends loved the pool and 130 foot water slide. After spending two weeks in Hawaii, we asked them what thier favorite thing was... it was the water slide. Hey, they're only nine. I noticed a gripe about lounge chairs in another review. There was a slight problem with the lounge chairs being "saved" by inconsiderate people. Simply point out the abuse when you see it. A Westin employee with gather the belongings and hold them somewhere safe for the offenders. BTW, "saving" lounge chairs is not unique to the Westin Maui... it happens EVERYWHERE... at least everywhere I've ever been. IMHO, another unfair gripe was concerning the time-share thing. They ask you exactly once if you want to view the time-share presentation. A polite "no" results in a free box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts and a Maui calendar. In fact, they don't even ask you directly. They leave a note in your room saying you can exchange the note for a free gift. So if you want to pass on the free stuff, you NEVER have to talk to them at all about time-share. Just about every major hotel chain is pitching time-share now-a-days. I found the Westin's approach to be extremely low key and I appreciate them for it. I thought the other reviewer's statement about the Westin's approach to selling time-share to be... well... ridiculous. This is an awesome hotel with all the amenities and services you'd expect in a fine hotel. And let's not forget location, location, location. The hotel is smack in the middle of the Ka'anapali strip and right next to Whaler's Village, a small mall of interesting shops which contains a nice whaling museum and some really great restaurants. They have a new spa, but we didn't use it. I kept saying I would get a message, but the days just flew by. Lastly, the "stay at one, play at all" program was very nice. You can go to the Black Rock Sheraton or the Weston Ocean Resort and use their facilities. We did some snorkeling over near Black Rock and it was nice to be able to order food, drinks, get towels, go swimming in the pools, etc... at the other hotel. The Westin Ocean resort also had a water slide, albeit shorter than the Westin Maui. The Ocean Resort was a little less crowded at the pool and I liked their pool side cafe. I'd say "two thumbs up" for the Westin Maui. The only negative I can offer would refer to the entire Island during the Christmas holidays. It's crowded. Expect long delays to eat at any reasonably priced restaurants. You need to eat early or else join the masses and wait. Also, the boat excursions we would have liked to take were booked. There were still many activities to do, but many of our first choices were not available. I recommend booking before you get there if you go during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “It was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Keila81
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect hotel for a honeymoon. We had reserved a garden view room but when we arrived they upgraded us to a ocean view for free. We had the view of the mountains on the left, and the ocean on our right. It was great. The heavenly beds were so soft and comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. I loved their buffet and the pools were wonderful. We took pictures with the hotel photographer and he took great pictures around the hotel, we bought them all. I will never forget our honeymoon in the Westin Maui. I recommend that you don't buy breakfast there, up the main street, there is a wonderful cafe/resturant called "Java Jazz" that makes the best breakfast at low prices. We would eat breakfast under $20 and that's cheap for Maui.

Reviews.Title: “some problems in paradise.....over all a good time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THE SCENARIO: I took my wife, aunt (71) and uncle (73 + handicapped) and my two sons (6 and 3 yrs old), on a family, 1 week vacation from 12-06-04 thru 12-13-04, monday too monday. So I had my hands full juggling the two extremes of age. We were all basically satisfied with the trip as a whole but we did have our set backs. THE HOTEL: First impression when driving up, maybe a little dated. First impression of the lobby, beautifull; waterfalls, swans and a "mini" lake. First impression of the employees, pleasant. Well thats the end of the first impressions. We asked for our two rooms to be connected, they failed to accomodate, we asked that our rooms not be facing over a parking lot and / or service area ie. trash cans etc. they again failed to accomodate. I instantly called down to be moved into connecting rooms with a partial ocean view. They responded "those are requests, and we try to help with all guests with there requests, but unfortunately we cant help you today". I told them I have had numerous & lengthy conversations with your front desk & emails over the last month, my uncle is handicapped and my aunt needs help moving him about, the connecting rooms, not an option its an absolute necessity! After 15 mintutes of complaining, (meeting a little resistence I might add), we were then given 2 rooms, connected, rooms # 554 & 556. Ours #556 with a great ocean view, however now we didnt have a closet. My aunt & uncles room # 554 remained the same floor plan, but had a view of the trash can storage area and the ocean...still a problem, but hey were on vacation whos wants to ruin it with complaining, right? Our room was appaerently the econo package, no closet, broken fridge, the connecting door hit the bar to smash your kids fingers (EVERYTIME THEY OPENED IT!!). I once again called down to complain, they said thats it for the next 3 days, then they might "might?" be able to help us. My wife my two sons and myself had a 18" wide cubby hole they said was our closet, and I mean exactly 18", and a 2 door dresser under the TV....that was not good, we couldnt unpack half the clothing. We never moved again thinking it was going to be more work than it was worth. Maintenance came up and removed the door, and replaced our fridge, well they simple put it on the floor next to the TV and plugged it in leaving the broken one. Pool very big, slide a lot of fun and surrounding area very nice, kids loved it. Bring float vests for your toddlers, the pool shop only has arm floaties. the bar/grill by the pool, expensive and surpsisingly small portions, $17 for 4 baby back ribs (1/8 of a rack or so), $23.00 for a piece of fish as big as my cell phone, it was so small my wife took its picture so we could laugh about it later!!!-get the burger and fries for $13.00 its the best value. Tropica is the main resteraunt of the Westin, still small portions but a great atmospere, they are closed sundays and mondays? That was 3 of the 7 days we were there, really stupid!!! So many people were walking in there to eat, and there wasnt even a sign saying closed. Some people sat in chairs wondering where the waiter was for 15 minutes plus, until I noticed them and told them. There are 5 or 6 concierge desks, all have a one track mind to sell you condos and time shares, so I was "pitched" at least 10 15 times to go to a 90 siminar, annoyed I refused every time, the rest of their service was questionable, such as very poor restraunt suggestions and where to go. The concierge sent me to the Iao Valley (may be misspelled) but failed to mention the road to get in there had been closed for several days and waisted about 4 hours of my day!!! They said ohhh sorry!! Do you dads know what its like to have a angry wife, yelling kids, and senior citizens that have to pee every 45 minutes, in a car in packed traffic on a detour with no signs.....I was %^$@##@%$#*&^*&!!!! ....to say the least! MAUI RESTERAUNTS: For fun go to Bubba Gumps for dinner -shrimp and drinks, although our waitress was very new and slow. It was a fun bar good service, excellent drinks! Suggestion-get ocean side table, modeled after the movie Forest Gump (Tom Hanks). Pleasant: Kimos, good food, atmosphere, ocean front view -get the ocean front table and not expensive, about $18 tp 25 per plate average, enjoyed the entire experience. For top notch but $$$$ food and service go to Ruth & Chris Steak house, no ocean view but the food, cream spinach, the steak even the mashed potatoes were noteworthy!!! $35 a plate average... the Hard Rock was like any other hard rock Ive been to, better for lunch or informal dining, a burger and beer kind of place. Cold Stone Creamery Ice Cream: Simple the best ice cream I have ever had, period!!!! The Hyatt Luau was like many other Luas Ive been too, although the one young lady that plays the princess, was gorgeous and I mean a 10! My wife said that, and I being the savvy husband pretended not to notice...I know that trap!!! WHERE NOT TO GO!!!!: Tomato Pie Italian food was horrible, I mean I got sick, bad! My 6 year old son god bless him asked the waitress what happened to her teeth? I looked up and she was missing several, my wife and I sunk in our chairs and asked for the bill, 1970 deco and frozen dinners being passed as dinner, or so it seemed! I didnt say it but I wanted my money back. Canoes: A horrible steak house with bad atmosphere, the cook should of retired 40 years ago, expect a for sale sign on it withen weeks! Canoes is where the concierge from the Westin suggested we go. BIG MISTAKE!!!!! My wife wants me to add that down town is the best shopping, park in the big lot, not those small ones that charge $10.00 the big lot is validated where ever you go. This is how we found Ruth & Chris, Kimos, Cold Stone Creamery and Bubba Gumps, by walking by them. IS THE WESTIN A GOOD HOTEL? YES, but like most vacations expect some set backs (thats me having a good sportsmen like attitude). Take advantage of the walk way along the beach, stop for lunch or a few drinks at the beach side bar and resteraunt I think was called Whalers village, usually very busy. Hope this helps your vacation......easier Scott & family

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with sloppy operation.”
Reviews.Author: markandtom
Reviews.Content: Sorry to report negative features of this hotel, starting from the moment we pulled up to the door. No "aloha" greeting for us. Had to search out a valet parker, and received no lei (everyone else got one- guess we should have asked. Our Garden View room wasn't ready, so we opted to pay more for an ocean view room which we were told WAS ready. Got to room and found patio door bolted and a painter on the balcony. On top of that, there was an overpowering paint smell. How can they sell such a room?? Went back to desk, and were assigned a new room. Got there, and found dirty razors, coffee cups and used shampoo bottles in shower. Is it too much to ask for a clean room with an accessible patio? Waited 45 minutes for our luggage to be delivered. When they arrived, they had only one of our bags, not two. They had lost one piece of luggage between valet parking and the room. We panicked when they denied ever having a second bag. Luckily they were able to produce the "non-existent" bag after an hour or so. Just a sloppy operation all around. I must say, however, that their much-advertised "Heavenly Beds" were just that- great. And note, the rooms in the Beach tower appear more spacious than those in Ocean tower. For a first visit to Maui (especially with kids) this hotel should be fine. Just know that there is much better out there, at much better prices. Just don't understand how they can sell rooms with no balcony access(and with workers outside balcony door) without informing guests beforehand. This hotel isn't cheap- should get more for the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “go to this wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent there my honeymoon last week, and we were amazed and stunned from the beauty, the kindness, the place and the food (breakfast is great!). I was to see the Ritz, Marriot, Sheraton and many other hotel of Maui, I can assure you the Westin is the best hotel I saw in Maui. I am spontaneously suggesting you, go to Westin with no doubts. I wish I go back soon there. Vittorio

Reviews.Title: “Kids enjoyed it....”
Reviews.Author: washington_wahine
Reviews.Content: My kids and I spent a few days at the Westin Kaanapali before going to South Maui for Thanksgiving. The kids loved the pool, activities, great beach and surroundings. The staff were very kid friendly, with welcoming packages, leis, activities like koi feeding and candy lei making. We also enjoyed the "stay at one play at three" deal since the pool at the Villas was much quieter with a great play and wading area as well. I found the room itself very small, our AC broke and did not get fixed, and there was a very bad smell in the armoir which the housekeeping staff would not remedy despite repeated requests. Would we do it again? Yes, especially since our Hotwire price was such a deal, but definately not for more than a few days. We were happy to get out of there and go to Wailea for peace, quiet and larger surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to the whaler”
Reviews.Author: DT98
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Westin hotel. I'm a Gold member so I managed to get upgraded to a Moutain View room even though I booked via Priceline for $175. All in all, the rooms were a bit smaller compared to the Hyatt and Wailea Marriot but clean and up to the standards I'm used to for Westin. There is a $18 resort fee which basically pays for the parking and internet in your room which I think is worth it because other places charges you a resort fee and don't even throw in the internet like the Hyatt ($15). It's riight next to the whaler shopping center so you can eat there to save money. Also it's about a 5-10 minute walk to the Black Rock for snorkeling. IT's busy in this area unlike Wailea and there isn't much to do aside from Golf, Lahania and the beaches. I like Wailea better because it's was closer to a town (Kihea?) and close to the other activies in the insland (Snorkeling, Volcano,etc) and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seans66
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!! Gorgeous Maui hotel. Our room was on the smaller side, but perfect for a honeymoon. The "heavenly bed" that I kept hearing about, was by far the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The views out the back of the hotel of the waterfalls and pools and ocean were great too. Location is fantastic too, a quick walk to Whaler's Village for souvenir or clothes shopping. Tropica Restaurant made for a great first night dinner. Food was average, but the ambience was perfect. Can't comment on value since I got it as part of a package deal - but seemed reasonable doing it that way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will admit I was a little nervous about our trip to the Westin after reading some of the reviews on this site. My husband and I, along with our 12 year old son and nephew stayed at the Westin Maui for 5 nights from 9/1/04-9/5/04. We absolutely loved it!!!! The swimming pools are awesome and we spent more time at the pools than at the beach. The beach is o.k. but there are much better beaches to be found in Maui. We had a room that overlooked the parking lot, but believe it or not, we still had a pretty cool view of the hills, we even got some great sunrise photos!! The rooms are a little small, but very clean and comfortable, however, the closets could be a little bigger! Who goes to Maui to spend time in the room anyway, so it wasn't an issue for us. The staff was very friendly and eager to answer any questions we had. The buffet breakfast is a little pricey, so if you're on a budget you might want to consider eating somewhere else. We loved our vacation in Maui and loved the Westin, we've already booked another vacation for next September!!!!! (It's a great month to go, after all the kids are back in school!!!) I think all the negative reviews I read about this hotel came from people who are just looking for something bad to say. If you're looking for something to complain about, you're going to find it no matter where you stay!! ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice... But BUSY”
Reviews.Author: Danuary
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but very, very busy. Had to wait in line for the front desk. The room was fairly spacious and very nicely appointed. There is exterior renovation going on and some rooms lose the use of their balcony; this appears primarily to be on the ocean side at the moment. We were on the mountain side and not affected by this. The hotel restaurants are VERY EXPENSIVE - more so than others in the area. Fortunately it's right next to the Whaler's Village Mall and there are places to eat there, including a place that does a good breakfast for a reasonable price. The hotel was so busy it was occassionaly difficult to squeeze in the elevator. The pools were crowded, but nice. The beach in front of the hotel had some pretty rough surf while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the beds and shower - pools was great!”
Reviews.Author: megalittle
Reviews.Content: The Westin has the best beds and showers. A good night sleep and shower can make up for other little things. We were there on a package deal and they tended to remind you of that fact. I didn't let them though - reminded them that I too am a customer and my satisfaction is guaranteed - that worked. It is a resort in a very busy area and at 100% occupency so when reviewing them, you have to keep that in mind. All and all, we were very satisfied. We had a room on the 8th floor on the mountain side. The view was fabulous! We could have done without the parking lot noise but it made for some good people watching. The rooms are small and bathrooms even smaller but the beds are comfortable and the shower is 'heavenly'. We are both short so didn't have a problem with the low shower heads but I could imagine a taller person being challenged. The lobby is great with the waterfalls - I enjoyed my $5 cappaccino on one morning. The ambiance made up for the overpriced coffee and the fact that it was a great cup of coffee. I didn't like the phone system. On many occasions I had to call a few times to get anyone on the other end. They are very busy all the time. The parking lot does fill up but valet is free when it is full. They housekeeping staff is great about delivering ice buckets, flutes and place settings - no charge just a tip. We enjoyed having a fridge to keep drinks and snacks to enjoy from the balcony. The food is very pricey for dinner but the ambience is nice. We didn't eat breakfast there except I bought a small container of $6 strawberries. Drinks were not that great and $8.50 each. I suggest having a little bar in the room (save your plastic cups!!) We really enjoyed the adult only pool during the day as the other pools were a bit noisy with the kids. But it is a pool! The pools were just great. I didn't much enjoy the waterslide as I tended to bang my heals around the bends - I heard many of the adults commenting on that but the kids didn't seem to have the same issue. I woudn't spend the money at the spa - it wasn't that over the top and was a very short massage for the time and money. And, there is a coed lounge to and from the massage - I am shy when I am naked, wearing just a robe. There is a great spa at 505 Front Street - Lei Spa - very basic but prices are good and massages are just awesome. The couples room is very fun and cool! We really enjoyed the 'stay at one, play it all' and use the Sheraton pool on one day and the free shuttle. We have stayed at the Sheraton and the Westin Ocean villas too. I would recommend them all! The Sheraton has the best beach for snorkeling and a lot more land space so you can move about - more resort feeling than hotel. The Westin Ocean Villas is good for family and if you want a kitchen - very spacious rooms and brand new.

Reviews.Title: “renovation going on couldn't use our balcony”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids recently stayed at the Westin in Maui. The hotel was beautiful and very family friendly as promised. Unfortunately, while we were there they were painting and we were not able to use our balcony the whole time. In fact we often had to keep our curtains closed as you never knew when there would be five guys looking in. When I inquired at the front desk I was told by a very terse clerk that "it has to be done sometime" and that we couldn't change our room as she "didn't know the workers schedule". Not what you want to hear on your vacation. It was a shame to pay for an ocean view when you couldn't enjoy it. I was there NOV 1-6 2004 so you may want to call ahead to make sure this is not going on when you visit. Otherwise a nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June, 2004. We had a special deal thru Hawaiian Airlines. We were upgraded to a view room,which was of the pool and ocean. The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. We didn't eat here instead went over to the Whaler's village to eat. We really like Leilani's and their beach side grill below the restaurant, also the Rusty Harpoon. You can't beat the location,the pools were great, and the service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: cgbroderick
Reviews.Content: My wife and our three daughters just returned from the Westin Maui on Kaanapali Beach, where we stayed for six days on a package. We also stayed at Wailea for three days on this trip, so the contrast was interesting. For kids, the Westin is hard to beat because of the pool complex. As a guest, you also have full reciprocity at the Sheraton Maui a short walk up Kaanapali Beach (both are Starwood resorts), and the Sheraton is also a great place for kids. The grounds at the Sheraton are beautiful, nicer than the Westin, and the snorkeling at black rock in front of the Sheraton is the best in this area. The beach scene at Kaanapali can feel a bit like Vegas with the restaurants and crowds, and I recommend Wailea if you want to get away from that. What we liked about the Westin was: the pool complex, our room in the beach tower was big enough for five people with a nice big bathroom, the fact that kids eat free at the poolside restaurant, the beach in front of the hotel, Whaler Village shopping next door, the beachwalk down to the Sheraton to the north and to the Hyatt to the south, the helpful service, particularly with all the activities available at Kaanapali and Lahaina. You can find excellent deals at the Westin because it is a big place and even with conventions it does not fill up during offpeak periods. We were there the first week of October, the manager upgraded our room, we had perfect weather, Kaanapali was uncrowded and we had a wonderful stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “water paradise”
Reviews.Author: susweet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights Oct 4 - 9th for our 20th anniversary. We loved it! At first it seemed very loud and busy after staying in Hana for 2 nights but we quickly found the quiet adult pool with a small but nice jacuzzi and bar near by. The other pools are fantastic too. The water slide is exciting and the swim thru grotto was beautiful. The water at first seemed cold but was always very clean. We had no trouble finding a chaise, were a little annoyed we couldn't use the beach cabanas without paying extra. The beach was great, a little undertow but very safe and warm with no rocks to hit when walking in. The room was small but very comfortable and clean. The showerheads are definitely too low unless you are less than 5 ft. The light was dim in the bathroom but nice when you had to get up in the middle of the night. We only ate at Tropica and found it to be delicious but overpriced. Don't be scared away by the music they play from 5 - 6(hard core rock) because at 7 a live musician comes to play and it sounds great. Leilanis was good, get the cashew chicken plate with veggies and rice. We loved shopping at Whalers and they have great free hula shows. For inexpensive but great food, go to Lahaina, 5 minute drive or 4 mile walk. There is a shuttle for a $1 from Whalers. Penne Pasta had great spaghetti, veal parmesan etc, nothing over $10. You pay 1st then they bring it to your table outside or in. No liquor at the outside tables though and no view. Alexanders near Mauii Tacos in Lahaina square has the best fish and chips we have ever had but if you eat there, you are eating at a cement table in a shopping center. Both places have great food but if you want the ambience, get it to go. We took one tour; the adventure boat to Lanai. A 5 hour tour with 2 native hawaiins aboard a pontoon boat with about 20 other people. It was great!!! The food was plentiful and delicious, we snorkeled at 2 spots, no turtles but we saw dolphins. Our guides were very knowledgeable and the trip back was very exciting with HUGE ocean swells. Don't go if you have back problems but go if you want to have a thrill. All in all, it was a fantastic 5 nights and yes we would go back in a second especially if we got the special rate we did.

Reviews.Title: “glad i didn't listen to other reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was getting worried because of some of the reviews as my trip got nearer. my husband and i were not only spending our honeymoon at the westin but we were getting married on maui as well and i didn't want anything to go wrong. my opinion is if you are a snob, don't stay at the westin. you would probably be more comfortable in a place like the grand wailea. it's beautiful, but i wouldn't feel comfortable in a place like that. the thing we most enjoyed about the westin was that it wasn't over fancy but it was still a very nice hotel. the bathroom is small (especially compared to some of the other westin hotels) but the shower heads made up for it. also, the carpet was a little too thick and it made the door kind of hard to open/close. other than that i had no complaints of the hotel. it was beautiful with the landscapes and pools. we walked down the path in front of the other hotels and the westin had the prettiest setting of them all. it is right next to whalers village which is nice. upon arrival we were asked if we would like a floor closer to the top and without being asked we were upgraded from partial ocean view to an oceanfront and champagne was delivered to our room with no charge. we definately weren't bothered with any loud noises and we slept very good in the heavenly beds. there aren't many parking spots but they will valet you for free if there isn't anywhere to park. also, our package included the free breakfast at ono and i would suggest that to everyone because it's worth it. we looked forward to the buffet every morning. we enjoyed ono's many times during our stay, it was my favorite restaurant at the resort. i can't say the same thing for tropica. it was okay but too expensive for the quality. lelani's was very good and you absolutely have to go to cheesburger in paradise on front street. overall, we were very pleased with the westin and i'm glad i didn't take the reviews to heart. we will be returning to the westin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Update”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin from 9/27/04 thru 10/1/04. Prior to making arrangements, I researched comments on this site and others. Here is an update / my impressions / clarification. First of all, the cost: Our deal for five nights for a 'normal' room came to $160 per night plus the $18. resort fee. This rate did not include any food extras such as breakfast. When we arrived we were told that we were upgraded to a higher floor (7th) with mountain view. The room was adequate and was on the small side, the bathroom was exceptionally small. The bed was very comfortable, perhaps not 'heavenly'. Westin goes to great lengths to overuse the word 'heavenly'. The shower was 'heavenly', the shampoo and conditioner were labeled 'heavenly. The 'make-up' of the room was not heavenly but was sporadic. One day at 10 AM the next day at 4 PM. Claiming environmental reasons, the Westin also imposes a mandatory 3 day use of the sheets/pillow cases; not the greatest idea considering the beach resort happenings [hot climate, sand, lotion etc.] and the room cost plus resort fee. On the third day these sheets have lost that 1st class feel. Some previous comments dinged the Westin regarding refrigerators & ice. We had a small fridge in our room (empty, not bar) so we could stock it with goods purchased elsewhere. Ice was free and available down the hall at a large ice machine. The hotel grounds, garden, pool were quite impressive, We did not have a problem with noise, kids etc. but then we were off-season for kids. Anything extra at the hotel; food, drinks trinkets etc. is extremely expensive. The easy walk-to access to the Whaler's Village was great because it provided alternative restaurants to the Westin that were comparable in quality/decor and less expensive. We ate at the Westin's Ono restaurant once; they have tried to make this a tapas style place and are still in the trying stage. We followed the advice of one of the other reviewers and went for breakfast to the Gazebo restaurant at the Napili Shores hotel. This was fantastic We had no hassles self-parking in the Westin lot; if spots were full we went for the valet parking at no charge and had no surprises on our bill at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin from 9/7-9/14 and had a great time. We did not find the hotel to be overcrowded with people. The pool area was wonderful. The only negative was that if you wanted a spot at the adult pool you had to get there early. The service was okay. We did not eat very many meals at the hotel because their prices were extremely high. Try the restaurants next door in Whalers Village. Room service was also cheaper than their restaurants. The rooms were nice but not unbelievable. The bathroom was small and dimley lite but it wasn't terrible. We had a great view from our lani. Overall this was a nice hotel with great service and we would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: alohapop
Reviews.Content: I could not believe I saw so many negative reviews about the Westin Maui. The moment I stepped into the lobby I was awed by how big this resort was! The check in counter was small, but the staff were all very friendly and soon we were on our way up to the 11th floor. I must warn people that this hotel does charge a resort fee of $18.00 a day. You can see the full list of what you will be paying for on their website, but if you have a rent-a-car, this is good because the parking is included. An average hotel will charge you around $10 a day for parking so hey, it's worth it. Some other things you can get are free access to the gym and business center. The room was just what I expected of a Westin. Very contemporary and modern. I found out afterwards that this hotel went through a renovation. The carpet was so thick and fluffy that the door doesn't close behind you. The carpet held the door open. I guess that was the only hassle. The thing I look forward to when I stay in hotels are the amenities. Because I also like contemporary looks, I was looking forward to the Westin amenity set. I loved it! The containers the shampoo, etc. came in were simple and so stylish. The Heavenly shower was different. It's a double shower head, and the shower curtain rod had a circular arch that I liked as well. The Heavenly Bed was nice to see again. I already experienced this bed at the Westin Tokyo and was very comfortable. Here at the Westin Maui, there is a catalog where you can purchase the bed sheets and comforters the hotel uses, as well as the shower equipment, and even accessories for your pets. The prices are reasonable too. After getting settled in, we all went down to the bar to get some drinks. Average service, and nice view of the huge pool. It was like being in a water park. We never got to utilize the pool but I know I would have had fun on those slides! After the drinks, we went on a walking path of the hotel. We got to take pictures of flamingoes, ducks, parrots, koi (carps,) waterfalls, and a lot more!! Oh, when you enter the main entrance, turn right, pass the front desk, pass the Concierge, and turn right and you'll see some spooky Chinese soldiers awaiting you. :) Anyway, to keep it short, it is a great property with lots to do in the hotel, and once you're out of the hotel, Whaler's Village it there and you can do a lot of shopping and dining!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons 9/13-9/17”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for the first half of our honeymoon. They immediately upgraded us from a garden view to a partial ocean view. Donâ€™t be afraid to ask for an upgrade! The lobby is beautiful. The flamingos, carp and parrots are a nice touch. We were sent champagne. The room was small, but the â€œHeavenlyâ€� bed was very comfortable. The decor seemed updated, but the bathroom area was very small and dimly lit. Strangely, the shower seemed designed for people under five feet tall. Not quite â€œheavenly.â€� The view from our terrace was gorgeous. We brought our laptop and the high speed internet was great and is included in the $18 daily room charge. (We ended up getting the room charges dropped from the bill due to an air-conditioning malfunction that lasted 2 days.) Breakfast was not included in our package, so it cost $50 a day. However, the breakfast buffet was worth it! The food is great. The grounds are truly beautiful. The lagoon style pools were interconnected by cave-like structures with an array of waterfalls and a cool waterslide. We didnâ€™t find the pool area to be crowded and enjoyed the steady stream of frozen drinks brought to us by the waitress. We found it easier to just charge everything to the room. The Westin has reciprocity with the Sheraton. You can certainly walk there and hang out at their awesome lagoon style pool (and charge drinks to your room there too!) The Sheraton is located on the beach at Black Rock, where you can do some snorkeling. We were lucky enough to see huge turtles and a nice array of fish. Snorkeling here is almost better than Molikini! Anyway, the Westin is right next to Whalerâ€™s Village. This is good shopping and decent restaurants. However, avoid the Rusty Harpoon. We found the food there to be less than impressive and extremely overpriced. My husband ordered the $40 steak and said, â€œThis is the worst steak Iâ€™ve ever tasted!â€� I negotiated the bill down. Lelaniâ€™s was fine, but remember to always make reservations. The beach at Kaanapali is gorgeous. The surf is calm but not boring. The sunrise and sunsets are to die for. We really enjoyed renting the beach lounges with the canopy-very relaxing. Unfortunately, you canâ€™t bring them close to the water, but we managed to sneak some drinks. Generally, the service at the Westin is very good. Yes, everything is expensive, but thatâ€™s Hawaii. I am very picky about good service, and I wasnâ€™t disappointed. A quick note: If you are honeymooning or going without kids, try to go when school is in session-I can imagine this place gets crazy when there are a lot of kids aroundâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “My Disappointment-Westin Maui Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took a trip this summer with my daughter and hereâ€™s a list of the goods and bads. Restaurant Mixed Drinks They were weak in flavor. You need to go to Bubba Gump to get better drinks. Chase Lounge Chairs Were dirty. That turned me off right away. I just came from the Outrigger on the Beach in Oahu and it was so perfect. Rooms Bathroom and Kitchen They were very little. There could only be one person in the rooms at one time and barely turn around in there as well like a airplane bathroom. Bedroom The room felt so tiny â€˜cus the bed took most of the room. My daughter hit her head quite often on the counter when going to the vault or to the refrigerator. If you're looking for a place only 'cus of the showerhead, stay here. Ceiling It had the popcorn ceiling, which kept falling down on us. We havenâ€™t scene this type for many years since the Best Westerns going through the United States. Walls Dark and depressing Time Share Desk I asked about the condominium time-shares and they were so rude. I asked about a brochure and prices and they refused to give it to me. Usually around the world, theyâ€™re so pushy on selling time-shares but in this situation, they acted as if they didn't want to sell them; so that was my last thought of those people. Lobby Was good. 3rd Floor Waiting chairs next to Elevator Were dirty. You donâ€™t want to sit in those. Parking Terrible â€˜cus there were not enough spaces. Unless you have a handicap sign or donâ€™t have a car, or pay for valet, donâ€™t do it. The Good Things Showerheads They were good. But that's it. Pools Maid - nice Other Hotels we walked to I took a walk down the beach to the Marriot, and saw their hotel seemed better, but their snorkeling was as good as our hotel. Their people were friendly who showed us their time-shares which is the normal way to be. Overall, the Westin Maui needs an overhaul and in general, itâ€™s for honeymooners and families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cornich
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of staying at the Grand Wailea before coming to the Westin. DOn't get me wrong, the Westin is a very nice resort but, in my opinion, pales compared to the GW. THe lobby area seemes a bit run down and the pools and pool area in need of some renovations. THe rooms are adequate but the heavenly beds are not all they are cracked up to be. The bathrooms are very small. The Westin definately has LOCATION plus. It is right next door to the Whalers Village and some wonderful resaurants. We enjoyed the path that stretched from one end of the strip to the other. We also liked the looks of the Marriott. We did not eat at the cafes or restaurants at the Westin. They were very pricey We either went to the Whalers Village where they have some great fast food places or in to Lahaina. THe Westin is a decent hotel with a great location if you can get it for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 16 year son stayed at the Westin from 8-3-04 through 8-9-04 and had a great time. I was a little worried after reading all the previous reviews from people with their opinions of the Westin. But since we are a Starwood member, we received a room upgrade and I used points to pay for the room for 5 of the 6 days Yes, the daily resort fee that is tacked on each day should just be included in the room charge; yes, the pools are crowded and it is hard to find a lounge chair in a good location for most of the day and yes it is very expensive to eat at the hotel (buffet breakfast for 3 was almost $75.00) . Also, the rooms could be larger for the price they charge. But overall the stay was fantastic - the pools and water slide are very impressive, you can walk down to the Sheraton and snorkel at the Black Rock and then use their pool before walking back to the Westin. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but very busy”
Reviews.Author: lad104
Reviews.Content: This is anice hotel with beautiful pool and a great beach.It is next to Whalers village and is close to Lahaina . The hotel is bustling withy activity there are people everywhere ,the chairs by the pool are all on top of each other. but the beach was never crowded and it is very nice.We stayed at the Fairmont Kei Lani in wailea before we went to the Westin and it was much more relaxed and not as crowded, would stay here again for the pool and beach

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it...better hotels on Maui”
Reviews.Author: AGalagrr
Reviews.Content: I was not pleased with the Westin at all. I have traveled to Maui many a time and thought that the Westin deserved a try. The service needs serious improvement from the front desk to the pool waitresses, it seemed as if everyone was too busy or my concerns/requests were not important to them. The rooms are very tiny and the bathrooms are even smaller. Barely any counter space and only room for one person at a time. The bed is comfortable but takes up the majority of the room. The food is mediocre. The breakfast buffet food was usually overcooked and sits there for hours without being changed. The pool is very nice and great for families. If you can afford to spend more on a hotel and the pool is a large priority, the Grand Wailea has the most amazing pools and waterslides (plus their Spa is fabulous). The Fairmont Kea Lani and Four Seasons are wonderful too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dmsmorgan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Maui (8/23-8/30) with our two boys, ages 5 and 7. The hotel grounds were beautiful and the boys enjoyed the pools. The hotel has a wonderful location in the middle of Kaanapali Beach and next to Whaler's Village. It's a short walk to the Sheraton where Westin guests can use the pool (very nice) and swim and snorkel at Black Rock behind the hotel. The Westin is very busy so it was nice to go to the Sheraton where it was a little quieter. We really enjoyed walking along the beach path and dining at Whaler's Village, particuarly at the Hula Grill and Leilani's. The Westin's rooms were average as was the service. Food was very expensive. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package (otherwise it's around $80 for a family of four with tax/gratuity) and we chose to eat at the Westin and the Sheraton a few times for lunch and dinner since the boys were free and it was convenient, however, there is better dining at Whaler's Village. Because of the Westin's location and reciprocity with the Sheraton we would choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in maui from august 7- aug. 21 in 2004. we stayed in 6 different resorts like ritz carlton, four seasons, grand wailea, fairmont kea lani, hana maui, hyatt and westin. the staff and accomodation in westin was the best of all of these resorts. WE were upgrated to a suit which was beautiful and huge, we also recieved complimentary bottle of shampain and chocolate strawberries as honeymooners, we went to their presentation and got 100 dol. certificate for food in any restaurant or store in the resort. everything about this hotel was great: pools, views, location and staff especially. If you ever stay there ask for marissa at the front desk. She was the best !!!!! THanks to all of you in Westin.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but not a great value...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here at the conference rate with my parents and enjoyed it - great for us since we love to just lay around during a vacation, with just a few big excursions. the westin is almost worth the money if you are just going to hang out there, swim, etc. but it is certainly not a value. even at the conference rate i was amazed at paying so much and then having to fork over so much more for food. the brunch is excellent but over $20... and that's your cheapest meal. go into town for fish tacos in the minimall if you can. beautiful landscaping, though, and gorgeous pools - the water slide is a blast for all (tall enough) kids and grown(sorta)ups.

Reviews.Title: “Simply stated.....FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two daughters (ages 12 and 3 1/2) spent 10 days at the Westin - July 15th-July25th. I did my homework on checking out all the reviews on the hotels/condos in Maui and took our chances. We simply, loved it! The Westin made our stay very comfortable...sure the room was small, but how long are you in it with the fantastic weather in Kaanapali? When we arrived, we did not like the 5th floor, we wanted up higher, the front desk was very accomodating and changed our room to the 10th floor - great view of the pools, ocean, etc. The staff was friendly, and helpful. You might want to get a refrigerator for the room. We needed it with our younger daughter. The one that is in there is too small and not cold enough. The hotel was quiet....you could hear the ocean and waterfalls at night...very relaxing. Restaurants are awesome...try out the Hula Grill, we ate there three times! Whalers Village was a great place to go shopping. We went to the luau at the Hyatt Regency....very nice. We did notice that there is not any beach at the Hyatt - the hotel itself looked really nice, but I like to walk on the beach at least and you couldn't do that there. The walkway along the beach in front of the hotels and condos was fantastic. The Westin helped us book our activities....pricey? yes, but you are in Hawaii don't forget! We tried the road to Hana....went 3/4 of the way and turned around. Because of the little rain they had, there wasn't much in the way of waterfalls. The views are very pretty but would not recommend it especially if you have small children. Our 3 1/2 year old got car sick on the way back because of all the turns! If you really want to go, leave early in the morning...it is a long trip! Also, do a catamaran cruise - we did the sunset cruise - absolutely beautiful. Drive to Makena beach and Waliea. You have got to see the water there. Stunning blue and aqua water! The beach at the Westin was ok, not fabulous. It was very clean, though...be careful of the rough water on certain days...the water down by the Sheraton at Black Rock was very clear....great for snorkeling. We took the Tropical Plantation tour. Very informative and pretty...worth going. Back to the hotel, we were very pleased and would stay there again...we parked our own car every day...easy to do; spaces are VERY tight but you get used to that. On our last day our flight was at 9:30 p.m. we asked the front desk what we could do since check out time was 12:00...they let us sign up and use the "hospitality room" later that day so we could swim all day and still shower before leaving for the airport - nice perk! All in all, the Westin was clean and the beds were "heavenly". The shower was great too. The lanai was quite small, new chairs are needed but again, how often do you use it? July was a great time to go - the weather was absolutely gorgeous....87 degrees with no humidity! The pools were tremendous....water slides were great for the kids...Kids 12 and under eat free...but do go and eat around Whalers Village - it is worth it. We picked up some groceries at Safeway which helped with snacks throughout the day. All in all, we would definately stay at the Westin again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Upscale Hotel, Location and Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin K'aanapali Hotel was fabulous. My husband and two sons ages 12 and 14 and I had a fantastic time. I learned something from locals about the beachfront which I will pass on. We spent the 3rd week of April 2004 at the Westin. Prior to booking, I read many reviews here, some of which complained about the beach front being poor. Yet, it was great when we went. Locals told us that it is common that being an island, wind, currents, etc., literally change the beach year round. Some months, the beach at one hotel will be superb and other months much of the beach may have been swept away. In short, it is a constantly changing situation and that accounts for the inconsistant reviews regarding the beach. Our family of 4 was comfortable in our hotel room, but it was just a room with two double heavenly beds and an armoire. Our room had a mountain view of the pineapple fields - it was lovely and this was the "cheep/undesireabale" view. The grounds have been well described here already and they are fabulous. Service was tops. It's pricey, for example, a snow cone by the pool was $5.00. We liked being next door to the Whaler Village for browsing and film development. Laihaina town has a great Longs Drug Store and Safeway and many restaurants. Our sons learned to surf at "Dukes" and had a terrific time. Great instructor. While we were there, we checked out the Embassy Suites. For a family, this might be a better choice for elbow room. Very nice property, also. But we were very happy with the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui was amazing. My husband and I were married at the resort on July 1st and it exceeded all of our expectations! Sheryl, the wedding coordinator, planned everything to perfection. Our ceremony was wonderful and our dinner reception with our family was incredible. We were able to dine in the massage tent by the pool overlooking the beach - very intimate and private. We loved our hotel room and enjoyed each day we spent at the hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing at the Westin Maui May 2004”
Reviews.Author: txerica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the Westin Maui in May 2004. It was fabulous. This was not our first trip to Hawaii, but it was our best. The hotel is relaxing and GORGEOUS. I am very picky about where I will stay, and this resort was awesome. The pools were the best I've ever seen - and the reason why I chose this hotel. Beautiful waterfalls and flowers everywhere. The location is fabulous - directly on Kaanapali Beach with Whaler's Village next door. The room was a little small, but every room has a balcony. We had a mountain view (over the parking lot), but it was still beautiful. We could see rainbows from our balcony in the afternoon. The lobby was breathtaking - and friends viewing our photos couldn't believe it! If you're looking for a relaxing vacation, this is the place. Poolside service was friendly. We spent many days just relaxing by the pool with a few frozen drinks. There is an adults-only pool (another reason I selected this hotel), but also a water slide and pool activities for the kids and big kids. We were also within a short stroll to the other resorts along the beach for more dining options. Swan Court at the Hyatt is pricey, but has gorgeous views and grounds.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Maui is Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: har_d_har
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin from 7/13/04-7/17/04 after spending four nights in Waikiki. The Westin is amazing and was more than we could ask for. It sits right on Kaanapali beach, and is only a few miles from Lahaina, which has plenty of eating and shopping available. From the moment we arrived, the staff was great. Everyone was very helpful and accomodating, from the bell person at the front door to the attendants around the pools and along the beach. Our mountain view room was wonderful, with plenty of space, nice furnishings and decor, and some of the best hotel beds we have ever slept on. In addition to that, the hotel grounds are fantastic...acres of lush tropical plants and trees, fish ponds with koi, flamingoes, and swans, and many walking paths and waterfalls throughout the gardens. Simply amazing! The five pools were great, and of course the beach is literally just a few steps away. As to the other reviewers for this hotel, yes the hotel and pool areas are crowded...what do you expect in Hawaii in the middle of the summer??? In regards to the parking, we had a rental car, and yes, if you come back to the hotel after about 9:00pm, the self-service parking lot is usually full. But if the lot is full the valets will park your car for no charge...all you have to do is ask. We took advantage of this and it was no problem at all. Finally, to those who always complain about the resort charge...I agree, I don't understand why the hotels issue this separate charge. Why don't they just raise the room rates by that amount, since you will end up paying the fee anyway? But more to the point, why do people always complain about it in the reviews? When you booked your room, you surely knew you would be hit with this charge...if you don't want to pay it, THEN DON'T STAY THERE! We knew about it when we made our reservations months earlier, and it was no big deal, just a part of the cost of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty but not a good value”
Reviews.Author: bellref
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews I felt we were prepared for the ups and downs of the Westin. Thanks to previous entries we stocked up at the Costco next to the airport - water, dried fruit, cereal, and VERY IMPORTANT, a beach umbrella. Great advice! We asked the hotel to empty the minibar fridge. After a stop at the local Safeway for milk and paper bowls, we were able to have a quick breakfast in our room. The Westin's breakfast buffet is good. It's $20 per adult. Our 8 year old ate free. But sometimes one doesn't want to do a big breakfast every day. The hotel staff was friendly and took care of our requests promptly. On check-in we had dirty linens on the bed but they rectified this pretty fast. The Ono Grill staff was good, too. Only one bartender up at the adult pool was grumpy. Our mountain view room had a pretty view but had no closet and only a small amount of armoire space - not enough for 3 people. But we did bring too many clothes for a beach resort holiday. We were surprised that the pool was empty every night. We love to swim at night. But the water was too cold and the pool area was very dark and uninviting. Oh well. Our biggest complaint about the Westin is the lack of poolside seating and shade. There are only a few palapa umbrellas and the seats there are "reserved" with towels and paperback books by 8 AM. And yes, many of these "reserved spots" do sit empty for hours. The hotel will rent you a movable umbrella on a tripod for $15 a day. A rip off!! They're useless on the beach because they are too flimsy for the wind. Buy a Costco umbrella instead. But this only works at the beach, not poolside. The other disappointing thing was the cost of the beach cabana chairs. These cost $50 a day even for guests and even if you only want them for a short time. Other hotels on the island do not gouge their guests this way. All in all, we liked the location and the beach there. But we will probably not return to the Westin. I feel that their real reason to exist there is to sell their timeshares ( I call them "timescares"). This is the driving force of the hotel. Every nook and cranny is devoted to this purpose and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: travelinspiration
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin in the beginning of May for 5 wonderful nights after leaving the Mariott in Kauai for 4 nights (please see my review on Mariott, great hotel!). Let me start by saying that we travel extensively and only stay in the nicest hotels and are very picky about our trips simply because we work hard to save money to travel and it is by far our favorite thing to do. With that being said, I don't think even my review can do this hotel justice. It is probably now my favorite place to stay ANYWHERE! In a nutshell, opulence is everywhere - lobby,grounds,rooms, pool, beach,etc. We spent our 2nd year wedding anniversary here and had booked a partial o.view. They upgraded us to a ocean view which overlooked the entire pool, beach, etc. - simply breathtaking! Everything is beyond perfect at the Westin: the concierge, the Amer.Express office, restraunts, gym, spa, and location,location,location. I'm not in the travel business but always like to check out other hotels if time to see if I'm staying at the best. I walked along the 3 mile beach and saw all the other high-end hotels, Hyatt,etc. and definately made the right pick. Even went up north to Ritz and Kapalua Bay to eat and even though they were beautiful, the location of Westin and perfect blend of activity vs. relaxation far exceeded these hotels. Westin has a phenomenal pool that can't be beat!! This is the perfect hotel for any age and families/couples alike. I use the word perfect rarely, but this hotel definately deserves it. I will not stay anywhere else in Lahaina on future trips!! However, if we return and decide to stay more South, we will stay at the Fairmont - heard and have read countless glowing reviews, including from my travel agent who is a Hawaii Vacation Specialist. When in Maui, I also recommend Mountain Riders (Bobby and Adam were great) for the volcano tour- do not go with anyone else. This company and tour will far exceed your expectations. The best tour ever - even beats the helicopter tours and road to Hana. However, Hana is great and you must do TEMPTATION TOURS, the only way to do Hana(www.----------------------). I have done many stylish and personalized chaffeured tours and this is one of the best, definately worth the money. (Randall was also a great tour guide). To wrap up, Maui is the place to be if looking for activity and paradise. Kauai is beyond beautiful but Maui has more activity/nightlife, but not too much like Oahu (too crowded/commercialized). If staying in Lahaina, spoil yourself and stay at the Westin (pref. in partial or ocean view room) and you will not be dissapointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 5 night (July 15 to July 20)stay in an very nice oceanview room at the Westin Maui.which we paid our money for. The hotel it self was great, a beautiful place but for over $500 per night you would think their "Resort Service Fee : $18.00 Per Room Per Day will be charged to cover the following services" would be uncall for. One of these services "Complimentary Self-parking" was alway full and not once were we able to get out rental car in. We had to pay an additional $10 per day plus tip each time we took our car out of valet parking. That was the only option we had.. "No access charges for local calls" We didn't know anyone to call locally but we did try to make a long distant call to Texas. My wife dialed the number herself and the phone rang 6 or 7 time and seeing our daughter was not at home she hung up, my daughter doesn't have an answering machine. We were changed by Westin, on our bill $10.04 for something like 9 minutes use and it couldn't have been more than one minute. We were with my wife's sister and her husband in ajoining room. They were as inpressed as we were. The beding was outstanding. We have stayed at several Westin properties but I think this one did it for us. We heard there was a mold problem but we didn't see any.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was like a dream! We took a family vacation to Maui during the last week of May and had a wonderful time. I was a little worried about the size of the rooms but we were so happy when the front desk upgraded us to an ocean view room which is also larger than the standard room. The weather was perfect and the pool was spectacular. We have an 8 year old who lived in the pool the entire week we were there. Avoid the hotel restaurants, over priced and not very good. The concierge was very good in reccommending other restaurants. Cafe O Lei, Cheeseburger in Paradise, and Bubba Gumps were all very good. If you go to Cafe O Lei, reserve a table upstairs and by the water...it was beautiful and the food was excellent. Also, make sure you drive down to La Perouse bay to see the beautiful lava rocks and then drive 5 minutes back to Big Beach. Park on the side of the road and bring a picnic and enjoy the water and beauty of Hawaii! I went snorkeling there with my own gear and saw sea turtles and other magnificent creatures. Snorkeling at Molokini was ok but not great...too many people. Find a different destination. There's a Safeway right down the street from the hotel so stock up there on whatever you may want. If you golf, you must go to Kapalua, my husband had a great time. The Westin's spa is very nice. Overpriced but if you want to splurge...go. Make sure you take advantage of the steam room, sauna, jacuzzi or just the peace and quiet of reading a magazine and enjoying the view. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui June 26-June30”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 26th to June 30th at the Weston Maui on Kaanapali Beach. I was very impressed . When I entered the hotel lobby with my family, I couldn't believe the beautiful waterfalls and landscaping. There were 6 flamingos and 2 parrots and 1 cockatoo, a carved canoe. There were giant koi or goldfish (not sure which.) Lots of pools, tunnels and a waterslide that wasn't too fast or steep. This was lush and green...it made me feel like I was puttin' on the Ritz. I had received a special invitation for a low price for the 5 nights as well as a car rental and a $75 hotel coupon. We had a view of the parking lot from our lanai. When I asked about upgrading to a partial ocean or full ocean view it was $100 or $125 more per night. We didn't upgrade since we were there on a budget. We used the $75 hotel coupon on lunch at the hotel ordering sandwiches and soda. The lunch was really good. All but $1.50 was used on the four of our meals. Lahaina is where we ate our meals normally. I saw a previous review and I would have to agree that Bubba Gump's, Kobe's Steak House, Kimo's all had wonderful food. I wasn't too impressed with Chesseburger in Paradise or Hard Rock Cafe..nothing special there. I would also recommend Warren and Annnabelle's Magic show. It is $45 per person and reservations are required at least 1 week in advance. I could have done without the 90 minutes in Annabelle's parlor, where you order drinks and appetizers. The magic and humor was great though! Back to the hotel...nice rooms not huge but big enough. Bathroom light was a little on the dim side. All in all a great vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 7 night visit from the Westin last week. Before I went, I read everyone's reviews and was a little worried about some things. We stayed on our SPG Points, so we were expecting the worse room since the hotel was full. We were greeted by name, and were told we had been upgraded to a partial ocean view. It was in the ocean tower on the end, on the top floor, very nice. The room was larger than I had expected. I actually had a closet. Carpet was a little dirty, and the sink area was only about 36in. wide, but overall a nice room. The parking lot was very cramped, but usually always found a spot. They graciously valet parked when the lot was full for free. We found the staff to be extremely nice and helpful. They told us about some local spots, that were cheaper to eat at. The beach tends to be very rough, and deep. It was very windy just about every day. Not good for swimming. The pool area was always crowded, but always could find 2 or 3 chairs together. People did let their chindren run wild in the pool area, mostly teenagers. They would jump off the rocks, or right over your head making sure they splashed you. I'm not blaming the hotel for that, I blame the parents. They need to put more hot tubs in. There is one in the adult only pool area, but since I had small children I wasn't able to use it. The other one is inside the main pool, and it is cold water. Pool water was a bit cloudy, and very chlorinated. It was tough to get a late check out even though we are guaranteed 4pm. We got a 2:00. If you ask nicely, they'll give you a key to the hospitality room on the second floor where you can shower or just hang out. The Westin is a nice place to stay, I would recommend it. Don't waste your time in the Walers Villiage, go to Front Street if you want to shop, and don't spend the extra money on the Old Lahaina Luau. If you look hard enough you can find something wrong with everything. Its a hotel on an island. Sit back and relax a little, and enjoy the beautiful sunsets from your lanai.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel managers take note ...”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: We had taken a weekend trip over to Maui - we don't care for the island in general, but had business to attend to, and had found previous stays at other properties tolerable. For the record, we are Starwood Platinum members, and were treated very shabbily at this property (in contrast to the Royal Hawaiian on Oahu where they thank you for being a loyal customer): we were told that the "resort" properties are unable to guarantee late check-out for the Platinum members. We found the check-in staff to be snobby and all together unpleasant. We found the management team unresponsive and disinterested. The grounds are generic (for Hawaii), but pleasant. However, the nickle-dime routine gets very old. I would rather pay an extra $50 per night, and have everything included. I can safely say that should I need to return to Maui, I will not stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Married at Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: Got married at the Westin Maui and everything was wonderful! Not one thing went wrong! Wedding coordinator at the Westin was out of this world, nicest lady ever!!! Grounds were beautiful! Absolutely breathtaking! Heavenly bed was just that, heavenly! The shower was great too! Room was a little small and over priced....but that is ok, we would still go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 5th anniversary at the Westin Maui from May 20th to May 30th. One thing about Hawaii is that it is not an inexpensive place to visit, but we were not expecting cheap! If you want cheap, don't stay in Kaanapali, unless you get a great deal. During our stay, a festival of canoes was going on, which is why the Westin Maui had the hula dancers and show every day. We thought it was wonderful and very Hawaiian. The food at Ono's and Tropica was excellent...once again, not cheap, but well worth the money. If you want a little less expensive, walk over to the Hula Grill, Leilani's, or the Rusty ??? They were all excellent places to eat, but don't expect to just walk in for dinner, there is a wait. We booked all of our activities through the American Express Travel agent a month in advance. The agents are located right at the hotel. Jan was wonderful and very helpful. I recommend that if you can, do the same because the good trips fill up fast! Did the Sky-Trek trip to Hana and flew back in a Helicopter. Made the trip to Hana very tolerating and learned alot from our tour guide Anselm! Much better than driving it yourself. Took a snorkel trip to Molikini via Trilogy tours. This was an excellent trip and lunch was delicious. Got to see Sea Turtles, an eel, and We did 2 Luau's...Old Lahaina Luau and Feast of Lele. I guess I was expecting more from the Old Lahaina Luau so I was a little dissappointed, but the Feast of Lele was outstanding - excellent food, excellent show. I would not hesitate to go back to Luau. Back to the hotel. The staff was outstanding - never had a problem with anyone. The in-room bar service was the only negative I could even come up with. We had to call 3 times to get Diet Coke replenished. The maid service was excellent. The concierge made excellent recommendations for dinners - Kimo's, Bubba Gump's and a Japanese Steak House in Lahaina. The pool area was the best part of the hotel. All of the palm trees, tropical flowers, and waterfalls made you feel like you were in paradise! You may not get the best seats next to the pool if you go at noon, but there were always plenty of seats at any of the pools. The water slide was a blast and surprisingly very fast! There was plenty of room in the pools to get away from kids if you did not want to be bothered. When you book your trip, it may be worthwhile to call Starwood and sign up as a preferred guest. It's free and it will save you money on your trip to the Westin Maui. Once again, this was by far the best vacation that I've ever been on, and we've been to some pretty tropical places. We are looking forward to returning to the Westin Maui for our 10th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: RBM1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Westin and loved our stay. We are SPG members (gold) and were given a free upgrade to a partial oceanview room when we checked in. The one problem we had was our A/C was not working well and it took 3 complaints before we got a room change. However, they took care of us and upgraded us again to a better room, got a free fruit basket from the hotel and several calls from the manager to ensure that we were okay. Kimberly at the concierge desk is very helpful and friendly - she helped us by telling us where to eat, snorkel, etc. Yes, it is pricey to stay here but you get what you pay for. Although it was very busy with families, couples, kids staying here, the rooms were built pretty well and did not hear our neighbors hardly ever (only heard people in the hallways).

Reviews.Title: “Nice-Bustling-Overall Impressive”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 27 to June 1, using a very appealing discount package we received last fall (part of an attempt to drum up timeshare business, it turned out, no surprise). This was our fourth trip to Maui, and we have stayed previously at what is now the Renaissance in Wailea, the Maui Prince, and the Alii condos. I would say that the Westin, in general, does a very good to excellent job at providing an enjoyable resort experience. My views, however, might be less generous if I were to pay rack rate for the room, or if I had not had a deduction from meals and incidentals thanks to the package we were on. I was a little anxious after reading some of the reviews, but I think the worst reviews probably reflect bad luck and/or overly high expectations. You're staying at a huge hotel designed to part you from your cash, next to other hotels and establishments with similar objectives. Most of us are not staying in the Presidential Suite, and Kaanapali is not a remote corner of a sparsely populated island. So some imperfections and noise are to be expected. The pros: try to score breakfast buffet vouchers (but they don't just cough them up, see below), it is a very nice buffet with rotating dishes and friendly service; the bed is very nice, but it is the sheets and bedding that do the trick -- the mattress is about on par with an above average but not extraordinary mattress; the shower is not life-changing, but it is better than the standard one nozzle in a stall situation; the bellmen, pool waitresses, towel station, room service, and service desk operator were always very friendly and expressed concern to make sure the question or need was addressed (kudos especially to the pool staff for always keeping my pregnant wife supplied with fresh ice water on their own volition); the gentleman who seems to run the handing out of leis on arrival was a real prince, he gave us two leis on our last day at the hotel to wear to my wife's birthday party (and told my wife that I "deserved something nice" for asking for the flowers); room was cleaned nicely and at convenient times; noise level dropped off considerably by ten p.m.; ample drawer space; quiet refrigerator; plenty of towels and pillows supplied and delivered on request; very good lunch food on the pool menu -- get the vegetable flatbread; adult pool was a mellow scene; seemed to be just the right amount of pool chairs, with only the most prime (under umbrellas) chairs being snapped up by 8 a.m; Nathan the guy who runs the cabanas was very organized and set us up with a bucket of chilled Evian; the gym was super nice; the beach was pretty good, what can you do about the standard undertow, not the hotel's fault;
