the show with island dancing was fun to watch (saw that somebody had an issue with the drums ... we have young kids too, but we would not expect a mega-resort like the Westin to be very quiet and the show was usually around 5 in the afternoon) The cons: the front desk staff, except when things were very, very slow, was understaffed, rushed, and not very friendly (biggest example: we just asked about breakfast vouchers, explaining that somebody at the timeshare desk had said it wouldn't hurt to ask...we didn't pull any kind of "so and so promised we would get them," we just asked: you would have thought we asked for the desk clerk's first-born, TiVo, and last scoop of ice cream and that we had sold her grandma shares in Worldcom... when we went back to pick up the vouchers, desk clerk no. 2 gave me the third degree about who had said we could have a voucher ... all while a big black binder titled "Breakfast Coupon Log" sat right in front of him. Definitely made the free $45 breakfast that much sweeter every day ... sheesh, sorry to cut into the 90% profit margin, Westin!); great location; bathroom lighting was pretty dim and flickering; the waterfalls are great when you arrive, less so if you are a light sleeper, but my light sleeping wife seemed to do ok (but we were on the 10th floor); the pay per view movies (just basic PG and R fare, thank you very much) were $16 -- yikes!; the elevators are very, very stuffy, it seems like there is literally no air flow in them, which can get a little old when you are coming from, say, the 10th floor; the concierge was misinformed about the dress code at Kapalua Bay Club: had we not checked, i might have shown up in long-sleeved shirt and tie and sent the geekmeter all the way to 10. In sum: if you want quiet and pampering, look elsewhere, but if you can deal with big hotel and can get a good deal, this was a pretty terrific place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed in the service at the Westin. The bellmen and the front desk were very nice, but the staff at the retaurant and pool area were extremely rude. The pool area is not friendly to smaller children who can't swim because each area has a depth of 4 feet or more and there are no direct paths for people who are trying to navigate the pool area with stollers. The maid service was horrible. We would return to our room at 3:00 and the room was not made up and we had a baby that needed to nap, we requested that our room be made up in the morning and never once did they come at that time. We would have to call to have fresh towels brought up and to dump our trash. Also, every night and on 3 days during our visit twice a day, they had a hula show. It was nice the first few days we were there but, when you have small children trying to nap the loud bongos can get really annoying. I would say that the best part of this hotel is that it is close to Whaler's Village and on the beach so you can leave. It is probably a better hotel for adults only.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: seeslime
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 10 and stayed until May 15. After reading some of the reviews, I was worried about a couple of things, namely the size of the room and parking availability. We booked the Westin in a package which included a full breakfast and rental car. I thought the room was a very adequate size with 2 double "heavenly" beds. The armoire was a bit small with barely enough room to hang 4 or 5 garments but that was not a problem for us (2 adults..male and female) as most of our stuff remained folded in the 2 deep drawers in the armoire. Upon arrival, our lady bellman explained that valet parking would be provided "gratis" if we could not find a parking place. Most of the time we did use valet and upon checking out, we found that we had been charged twice for $10 each time. When we called the front desk to question the charge, it was removed immediately with apologies. All the people we came in contact with who were employed by the hotel were more than cordial and helpful. There were plenty of pool-side lounge chairs and the pools were wonderful and clean. I forgot to mention that we were upgraded to a full ocean view room when our hotel voucher stated "garden view with partial ocean view upgrade". Evidentally, there were no partial ocean view rooms available, so we lucked out. We loved the location...right next door to the Whaler shopping mall with beautiful, uncrowded beaches right there in front of us. Possibly due to the fact that most schools in the U.S. were still in session, there were not many children. The ones we did see were well behaved with parents in attendace. We would definitely stay at the Westin again and, yes, the beds are "heavenly".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/so-so service”
Reviews.Author: thaliajen
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler who had stayed briefly at this hotel before, I thought I knew what to expect. My hubby and I had stayed in February of 2004, but only for one night. (Origianlly we were at Embassey Suites and I wanted to find something nicer for our anniversery). I had stayed Superbowl Sunday by myself (hubby was at Football party at embassey Suites) and I came back raving about this hotel. I had booked us a suite at the Westin for the last night of our stay and we'd enjoyed it immensely. We were there during a high rate season so I had paid $330 or so for one room, and then upgraded to a suite for about $500 a night. It was the nicest suite I'd ever seen, with two bathrooms and of course, the Heavenly bed, etc. It had amazing views of the ocean and pool area during whale season and complimentary binoculours. So, when returning by myself for work last month (April, 2004) I was thrilled to book at the Westin Maui. Now, I did find out that the suite I was given for our anniversery normally goes for $2,500! I discovered that when, to my chagrin, after paying extra for an ocean view, my room turned out to be disappointing and the view was of the Whaler's Village trash cans! As a Gold Preferred Member, I do not feel I got good service, not do I feel that the hotel staff tried to offer that service. I did complain about the room and was told that it was considered a sea-view room, despite the trash. Not exactly happy, I asked how much it would be to upgrade to a suite. They claimed they had no single rooms on the side I wanted to be on- the one I had been on 2 months earlier. So, I paid an extra $200 a night for a smaller suite thatn I'd had the 1st trip, which took the sting out a little bit, but it STILL had the view of the trash! After realizing that I paid for this upgrade, and that there were other rooms available, I was pretty angry. The suite was really just a living room with a bedroom so small that the bed barely fit in it, and you had to go through the bedroom to get to the bathroom. (Bathroom was very nice, BTW- the suites in Westin Maui offer a very nice bathroom amenity service, with excellent shampoo, conditioner, and other treats, as opposed to the Westin Mint type shampoo they normally offer.) Also, at thsi resort, as in many resorts in the area, you pay a $15/night charge. This gives you free parking (IF you don't forget and give your keys to the valet, because then it is about $15 more a night!) and a nice touch- they DO give you free internet access if you have a laptop. It is highspeed and doesn't cost a thing. (Well, it's included in the $15 resort charge). One evening I was out/about and in the lobby where a Platinum member was arriving with her husband, and they'd been guranteed a suite. Well, maybe I took the last one, but it wouldn't have mattered because the couple took one look at the view of the trash cans and left for the Four Seasons! The view can make all the difference for the trip- so be sure that you get an ocena view that is ALSO overlooking the pool area. Only the big suites get the pool AND ocean side balconies. And you DO want a balcony. Hawaiian trips are no place to skimp- the view is too amazing. If it costs a bit more for a blacony, pay for it. It's nice to rest out there and read, or watch the ocean or see the whales. As a Westin fan, I was shocked both times at the treatment we got from the hotel staff. They were never friendly, never seemed to care what I needed and even gave attitude at the simplest things like asking for extra pillows! Now, there were exceptions and of course, the lady who upgraded me on my february visit for our honeymoon, did an exceptional job. I didn't know until I paid to upgrade a 2nd time that the suite she gave us was worth 5 times what we paid! She was not friendly when she upgraded me and acted as if it was a problem, yet she gave us the best suite in the whole hotel! I have to recommend this hotel in Maui simply because of the pools, the beach and the beauty surrounding it. It is a perfect 10- the place I always thought Hawaiian hotels would be. From the waterfalls to the goldfish ponds, the landscaping was amazing, and the beds and showers were as always, heavenly. If you overlook the front desk staff (the room service guys are very nice) and remember to park your own car after dropping off your luggage (they charge $15 a night I think just for keeping your car in a stall marked "valet") and concentrate on the ambiance, you'll like this hotel. Having two different experiences, I still say that I would stay again, but I think the front desk staff needs a class in customer relations. I stayed a few nights at the Embassey Suites in February, and for the money you get more space but it just isn't a nice place in my opinion. The Westin has a lot of those Lahaina beaches beat, and I think they know it. That may be why they arean't as friendly. A big plus with the Westin Maui is being right by Whaler's village. You don't need a rental car to go shopping- just walk over there. They have a Mac Donalds and they have a Louis Vuitton store. VERY diverse! I would say that as a Starwood Gold Preferred Member, I think I deserved better treatment (even the line where the Starwood Preferred Guests are supposed to go is ignored) but the actual hotel is hard to beat. Great looking with an amazing beach area and spectacular views, plus its own water park- it is among my favorite hotels of all time. They had an adults only pool for us grown-ups without kids and I met a lot of people congregating there in the sun. It is raised so the best sun exposure is really up there and you can rent cabanas if you want out of the sun. (I don't quite get that part, LOL!) If you are a Starwood Member, be sure to walk through their Starwood Map area- it highlights all the properties all over the world and it's huge- you can walk through it. I know I wrote a 1st review when we went in February but I think this one is more detailed and after a 2nd stay, you really get a lot of experience. I hope everyone enjoys this hotel, and just ignore the bad attitudes if they surface. You really only deal with them on check-in and check-out, so why ruin the whole vacation on their attitudes? And maybe you'll get a good customer service rep- you never know! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and beach”
Reviews.Author: redfish0119
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Maui for our honeymoon for a week. We arrived and were upgraded from a partial oceanview room to a full ocean view on the 9th floor. Weâ€™re still not sure of the reason that they upgraded us. The views are fantastic; Kaanapali beach is beautiful and waves are usually pretty calm. Great snorkeling right off the beach at the Sheraton (about a 5 minute walk down the beach). The room size was fine â€“ king heavenly bed and heavenly shower I think are in all the rooms. This is a beautiful hotel â€“ open and airy, great pools and we found plenty of chaise lounges open at all times of the day. The hotelâ€™s restaurant/room service is expensive, but decent food. The Tropica restaurant also on grounds had great food, but the service was very slow. Our room was not cleaned one day, and possibly would have been skipped again a second day if we hadnâ€™t called to complain. No reason given why, but no problems after that. Only one other problem â€“ the parking is awful. We found spots easily during the day, but at night it is packed and the parking spaces are TINY. If the lot is full, you have to valet, and our rental car came back with a big scratch across the front bumper after valeting. But I would still recommend the Westin Maui to anyone. It isnâ€™t as ritzy at some other hotels in Maui, but is a fine place to stay. Definitely a great place to stay for your first time in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Too many people-Too fast paced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Maui for almost 16 years. We used to stay for a month at a time before we had kids and knew the island very well. However, we had forgotten how bad the weather can be in that area of the island. If you want sun, stay away from Kaanapali, Kapalu and Napili. Beatiful areas just subject to rain and lots of wind. We finished our vacation out at Wailea and had sun everyday, but I could clouds looming over Kaanapali. We returned to Kaanapali with our kids for the beaches, the Westin pools and because of the deal we received. 5 nights, car and $100 in hotel credit for $750.00. We thought how can we lose. It was a pleasant experience but not the low key island experience you look for. We have two kids 9 and 11 and the pool with slide and water falls was great. It seemed they overbooked the hotel, lots and lots of people and noise that never stopped. The pool side lounges were all reserved (people placing personal items or towels) by 8:00AM. leaving you to find a place on the grass or in some small corner of the pool area. The lounges would sit empty for hours with nobody around. Finally, on the second day I moved a single flip-flop from a vacant loung and used it for an hour before the irrate guest returned. This is a policy that the Westin needs to change to allow turn over in the pool area. Access to the beach is great with sandy bottoms and great views of neighboring islands. The hotel, food and services are really pricey. The hotel roof leaked during a rainstorm and the steamer for the hotel washer/dryers stopped working. SO, no pool towels for a full day. Twice our room was left without any fresh towels and the attention to detail was missing. We got a great deal on a 2 star hotel that claims to be 4 star. We finished our vacation off in Wailea at the Marriott. Great deal and nice hotel, especially if you have kids. Next year we'll stay in Wailea for the full two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Is There A Mold Problem At The Westin Maui?”
Reviews.Author: eightydegrees
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Westin. While we had a good time we were both feeling like we had bad colds and had slight trouble breathing everytime we were in the room for any length of time. We also noticed that the room smelled very musty. We kept asking housekeeping to spray because the smell was so bad. When we would leave the room we would start to feel better. We woke up each morning with bad headaches and my husbands eyes ran constantly. Neither one of us has allergies. When we went to another part of the island and in a different hotel all our symptoms dissapered. Our shower curtain also had quite a bit of mold on the bottom, which housekeeping did change. The rugs in our room were also very dirty. We were there when they were brand new and the color was not brown then! The staff was wonderful and the service was great, but there were kids everywhere screaming and yelling every time we turned around. We have decided never to return at this time of year again. We had heard that they have had a lot of problems with water leaks. With the way that we felt while there we are really wondering if there is a mold problem with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No big whoop”
Reviews.Author: richp5
Reviews.Content: Visited Maui from March 27, 2004 thru April 5, 2004 (11th trip). Split our stay between the Westin and Outrigger (1st time for each). Positives: The grounds are very impressive and the boys (8 & 11 yrs) enjoyed the pools. Short walk to whalers village and black rock. Oceanview rooms are nice but must get above the 8th floor as palm trees obstruct views. Staff was good. Negatives: Resort fee ($15/day). Small rooms of mid-range holday inn quality. Costly for all purchases - from $2.50 for a can of soda to $50 for lunch. Parking was a problem but may be due to spring break. Very busy atmosphere and kids are plentiful. Will not stay again based on room size and the nickel/dime approach.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui A Big Mahalo!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is what Maui is all about. First Class all the way! The entire staff was very accomodating, and willing to answer any question and provide us with anything we desired. We were welcomed with a fresh REAL Flower Lei, and it only got better from there. The 5 pools were great, although we relaxed mostly in the Adult Only Pool, a very nice touch. Just steps to the ocean and shopping at Whalers Village. Kaanapali Beach is the only place to be on Maui! We'll be back many times!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Myskate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Maui Feb 26-March 2. Lets just say that I was underwhelmed by the facilities. First off, things that were not the hotels fault. We stayed there during 5 days of very heavy rain and wind so the pool was mostly unusable. The beach had waves 6-10 feet high breaking very close to shore. Pretty much unusable too. The good-Our garden view room had a view of the pools, waterfall and panoramic ocean view. The only bad view was of the roof to the left of us. The tropical feel is great, very lush. The rooms were quiet. We were right across from the elevator and never heard it. The not so good-during the heavy rains the hotel was leaking in the main hallway with buckets collecting water!. I know I heard water leaking onto my air conditioner unit -with us on the third floor, it had to come from somewhere. We called the operator to find ice and was told we have to buy it. Never heard that before. Our shower curtain barely worked. The floor was always wet. Lots of mold on the bathroom times. No fan in the bathroom either. Rented a refrigerator and was taxed on the delivery fee. All toll free calls cost 0.99$. I was told this charge was on the phones and in the resort book but couldn't find it anywhere. The morning we were leaving no less than 4 people came to our room to ask us what time we were checking out. Since we had a late afternoon flight, I explained that we would leave at checkout time. Very annoying. I just felt that you were nickel and dimed to death here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to the Westin Maui. The rooms are an adequate size and the grounds are beautiful. The complimentary breakfast buffet (came with our room) was fantastic. Parking was never a problem. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: cori51480
Reviews.Content: Despite many other honeymooners who said The Westin Maui was not for honeymooners, this was the best vacation I have ever been on!! The Westin was absolutely beautiful!! We had a "partial ocean view" room, but there was nothing "partial" about the view. We had a perfect view of the ocean in a beautiful room! There are lots of pools and even a couple water slides. There wasn't much of a beach due to the high tide (we went in October), but we still enjoyed the beach just as much!! The only complaint I have is that it is VERY expensive to eat at the hotel. We drove into town (Lahaina is about a 5 min drive) for every meal and LOVED everything we ate!! We had a PERFECT honeymoon and we can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples and families alike”
Reviews.Author: spinmove
Reviews.Content: The landscaping and pool are what make this hotel great. Very lush and tropical with the pool winding down around and even under walkways! The pool here rivals some of the enormous Vegas swimming pools with the tropical foliage, waterfalls, grottoes, and water slides, etc. We had the best time on the water slide - all the males (i.e. anyone over 170 lbs.) in our party just FLEW down that thing! It was a hoot. My boyfriend and I went with my sister's family; including her three children. Excellent feature: the adult pool is secluded and private from the rest of the pools. We layed out at the adult pool, with nice chaise lounges and fluffy padding, while the kids swam and splashed around the other varied pools. I had a seaside, open air massage, while my neice had her hair braided. A real treat having a massage with the tradewinds blowing... We stayed in a recently remodeled (check to see if all the rooms are now remodeled) top floor room and made daily use of the bar area in the room. Nicely appointed plantation style bedrooms and finishes. Though there is too little clothing storage for a long term stay. The washroom had a separate sink area from the commode and tub/shower room which is always nice. The "heavenly bath"... well, I've been in heavenlier (sp?) baths before. But they do have the rounded shower rod making the shower curtain expand so you have more room to shower - which is a std. "heavenly bath" feature. Otherwise the bathroom was std. issue 1970 hotel bathroom configuration with upgraded finishes. We enjoyed morning jogs and sunset walks along the seaside promenade. It travels and winds it's way along the shore line and you get to see about eight other hotels that are also lined along the Kaanapali beach. It is also beautifully landscaped. We took some great sunset pictures here. DOWNFALL: Beach is not kid friendly and has serious undertows. After five minutes in the ocean the kids were back at the pool. A MUST: The main restaurant (open at 5:00 pm I beleive) has hand made, all fresh pina coladas. No store bought mixers; just fresh, island pineapples. Whalers Village is right next door. You could take a dip in the pool, layout a bit, then, if you wanted you could just run next door and window shop, then head right back to the pool. I loved that the hotel was right next to this quaint shopping center. It has clothing stores, accessosries, a book store, fast food, sit down restaurants, ice cream store, hawaiiana, jewelry, and also high end stores (Gucci, LV, among others... as I recall) We usually stopped by the poolside bar (open late) after dinner and enjoyed a night cap. Very casual bar, and we liked that it had a couple TV's there were you could watch sports. Casual and easy going. That Kaanapali beach is lined with other hotels, we took advantage of the excellent variety of restaurants the other hotels offered, for breakfast and dinner. And we didn't need a car, we simply walked the promenade. It was great to see and visit other hotels, too. Though, even after seeing the other hotels we did not regret having stayed at the Westin and we really enjoyed our stay here. Casual, friendly and easy going.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience at The Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Westin. We have stayed at many different Westin Resorts around the world-and this was the least impressive. Since we were delayed leaving our point of origin-we didn't check in to the hotel until 6pm-having called from the airport in Oahu to let them know we were going to be delayed. We had the worst possible room-right next to the elevators-and with a mountain view(which was really pretty)-our room was several floors above the main entrance-which caused for lots and lots of noise. There was a motorbike reving its engine at 6am one morning-it was a bit annoying. The pool area is nice-fourtunately they have an 'adult' pool where no one under 18(or 16?) is a 'allowed'. It did help relieve some of the noise inthe pool area. However-space was very limited-and there were many cases of 'chair reserving' and chairs going unoccupied for many many hours. The hotel restaurants were average-the staff was okay-pleasant, but never went out of their way. I'll be blunt-there were far too many children running around this resort-and many were left unsupervised and badly behaved. As Starwood preferred members-for a few years-we found that while we had an awesome time in Maui-we would not return to the Westin. Oh-and about the rooms being too small-I don't know how anyone could fit all of their clothing and shoes in that TINY armoire they provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui (Feb 13 - Feb 20). Stayed at Westin. It's a great resort with a friendly atmosphere. Pros: Great landscape. Lobby area is a cool place to hang around. Several swimming pools. Easy access to the beach. Nicely appointed room. Good in-resort restaraunts. Good view of the beach (watch for the so called ocean view on the side of the whalers village. You'll have to upgrade to Deluxe ocean view to get the pool/ocean view. Didn't bother to upgrade as we were spending most of the time outside.) Friendly staff with good service. Great for families. Can use the other facilities in the hotels belonging to the starwood resorts group of hotels. (eg. snorkeling near sheraton) Introduction to scuba diving (didn't take those lessons but a nice feature if interested). Kids camp. cons: Narrow and wet beach. In resort services are expensive. (food/laundry). Have to request refrigerator, which would occupy more space. No microwave. If booking with travelocity etc. certain things may not be guaranteed, but it is cheaper. (eg. double beds or king size beds etc.) Overall we had a very good time and this was one of our best vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from visiting both Maui and the Big Island January 30th thru February 6th. Our first 4 nights were spent at the Westin Maui and were we surprised. First, let me say that after reading the reviews here, I was somewhat skeptical about staying there. However, from the very moment of our arrival until we departed, we were treated like royalty. The staff was great and very courteous, the room very nice and plenty of pool/beach chairs. The remarks about the size of the room I don't understand, what are people looking for? One only sleeps and changes in the room, not entertain. There was plenty of room for our luggage and my golf clubs. We had no problems hanging our clothes, or bumping into one another while getting ready. Over priced, yeah, but name one hotel that isn't anywhere, especially on Maui. Why would anyone ever eat at the resort? Food and drinks are always higher there. Next door at the Westin is Whalers Village with good medium priced restuarants and a McD's. So do yourself a favor and indulge in the Westin Maui. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from both Maui and Waikiki (Feb. 6 - 12). I am glad we stayed in Maui first. The Westin is everything a resort should be. We stayed in an ocean view room and it was worth every penny. We faced the pool with all of the palm trees and beautiful landscaping - what a view. The room was a little small, but we were rarely in it. The beds are quite plush, too. The food is expensive, but Whaler's Village is just around the corner with restuarants and shops. We saw whales as we were laying out at the beach! The beach chairs are free, but are on a first come first serve basis and the adult pool has great lounge chairs and is so peaceful. The parking is free, but if there is no parking they will park it for you - just watch your bill because they will charge you $10. Tell them at check out that no parking was available and they will take it off your bill - no hassles. After Maui we headed to Waikiki for a conference. No comparrison - Waikiki is full of people - everywhere and at all times. The beaches are packed and we even had a private beach (Sheraton Surfrider). Stay in Maui - it is so peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: mauisun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui. We spent five nights at The Westin and loved it. The pools and grounds are gorgeous, the staff very friendly and courteous, the location perfect. We had a mountain view room on the 11th floor. Each day we were treated to rainbows appearing over the mountains. Yes, the rooms are small as is the closet space, but the beds are wonderful. My only disappointment was the breakfast buffet. I would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Westin. I have to say that my wife and I absolutely loved it. We got a great deal on the room through Hotwire, and, as the hotel wasn't very crowded, they upgraded us to a 9th floor ocean view room - the view was spectacular. The rooms themselves are fairly standard, nothing particularly noteworthy; and at these prices anywhere else I would have expected a much bigger bathroom/tub and a much more handsomely appointed room. But we did stay at the Hyatt Regency for one night, and this room was very comparable (the Hyatt is slightly more upscale and refined/quite. The Westin is more of a fun resort).The resort itself is outstanding, with birds and fish, and is fairly opulent in its appointments. It's right on the beach and is right next door to Whaler's Village, which is a little shopping center. The restaurants are all overpriced, so we didn't eat at any of them. We went to Lahaina each night and had really great food at the various restaurants. The service at the Westin is outstanding, from the pool to the front desk to the lobby, and they all made us feel really welcomed.The Starwood program is pretty nice, and we ended up spending an afternoon at the Sheraton pool (the Westin has a couple of large waterfalls that make the pool area quite noisy - so we went to the Sheraton for more quite pool lounging time).We booked all our activities through third-party activity vendors, as the Westin activity center is fairly pricey. We had a truley marvelous time in Maui and at the Westin. On our next trip we may, however, stay at the Sheraton, as it seemed a little more downscale and quite. If you're looking for a fairly opulent Maui resort in Kaanapali, the Westin is probably right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation...would go again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Maui with another couple in September 2003. We decided to stay at the Westin after many, many hours of reading. Although we were not given a king bed the first night, we were moved the next morning to a king bed. The lobby, waterfall, and pool area is simply beautiful. Like others have stated, the heavenly beds are very comfortable. The rooms are on the small side, but you really do not spend much time in the room. The beach and water was really nice the first two days, but then high tides and strong winds churned up the water and made for some slight body sandblasting. All in all, we had a woderful time and would stay at the Westin again if visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The best area in Maui”
Reviews.Author: macdec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin from 11/6 to 11/16 with our three kids, 7, 5 and 16 months. Our kids loved the Keiki Kamp programs and also enjoyed the swimming pool and water slide. The service was excellent and everyone on the staff was very good with our children. The Lahina area is our favorite area in Maui for both views and activities. This hotel is not inexpensive but we enjoyed every day we were there, and previous stays at the Sheridan and seeing other Hotels in the Kaanapali strip we would still return to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Westin in Maui and I have to disagree with some of the reviews that are posted, we had a wonderful time, our room was a Deluxe Ocean View and we had views of the resorts pools plus the Ocean view. The room was great plenty of room and the Heavenly bed and Bath are to die for!!!, we had the buffet breakfast every morning and it was excellent, the omelet bar is great, everyone that worked at the hotel was helpful and friendly, after reading some of the reviews before we went I was really worried but didn't need to be, when you walk into the lobby there are beautiful waterfalls, flamingo's, ducks and parrots, the landscaping is the best I have seen. It is very kid friendly, there are water slides and waterfalls to play in and the pool is excellent, for restaurants we went to whalers village and down town great food and excellent service, we recommend a sunset meal at the Plantation house it was amazing and the food was awesome. we also travelled to other beaches that were better than at the resorts and had a great time, I would recommend this resort to anyone in fact we are going to return in July with our family, can't wait!!! we also checked out all the hotels in the resort and this was definetely the best .

Reviews.Title: “15-17 year old guys come spring break 2004!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this hotel!!!!!!! in fact we are coming bak spring break 2004 for some partying. the hotel is really cool and lots of fun! if u know any sexy singles between the ages of 15-17, male, bring them along for this week that will be unforgettable...we kno how to show u a good time!

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: lw87netl
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the "ocean view"... we were overlooking the roof of Whaler's Village next door and had to lean out the small balcony to actually see the water. Weather was not good. Most days were cloudy, cool and a couple downright rainy. Beach, as all other reviewers mention, was terrible. Very rough and not attractive... just a small strip of sand. Nothing to do at night for entertainment at the hotel. Best thing we did was hire a tour guide, his name was Neil. He took us in a Lincoln Navigator all around the island... to Hana and back. He had just spent a week taking care of Ted Turner. He was a local guy- absolutely fascinating. Food was very, very, very expensive which would be just fine if it was worth it but unfortunately it wasn't. Not going back to Maui. Booked for Aruba in March.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Perfect Weather”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 10-days in December at the Westin Maui and our trip couldn't have been more perfect. You can really tell the difference between high season and low season as our stay spanned both. The service was excellent and the Hotel was beautiful. The heavenly beds were nicer than other hotel beds. Our room was near the waterfalls and we found the sound to be more soothing than irritating. Our children loved the pool. Great hotel for kids, not so good for honeymooners. They have enough pool chairs for everyone, but do not enforce any kind of use-it-or-lose-it policy. People go down and reserve a group of chairs by placing a towel or personal item on them early in the morning and they remain unused for much of the day (high season, nobody did this the previous week). I sat for 2 hours on a group of 13 "reserved" chairs for 2 hours one morning and not one person came to claim them. Other reviewers have stated the hotel does not provide enough pool chairs. I'm here to tell you--there ARE enough chairs if people would only use them while they are at the pool. That is my only complaint, the hotel staff were great at I felt they catered to our every need. The beach is a bit steep and the winter waves are pretty strong but we knew of this going in. We will stay at the Westin Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin over Thanksgiving. Had an incredible ocean view room in the Ocean Tower. The room's size was fine, although it was lacking a closet. The beds are indeed heavenly...I have never slept so soundly before! Others have commented that the waterfalls below are noisy, but I actually found them, along with the ocean's crashing waves, to be quite soothing. We slept with the balcony doors open every night. There are 5 swimming pools, one which is an adult only pool, so if you want to be away from kids, this is the one to use. The hotel was under construction while we were there, so we only had one restaurant/bar to eat/drink at. Service was great and everyone was extremely friendly. The front desk people aren't rude, but they aren't very friendly either. However, the bellman are the best (ask for Christopher in the evenings!). They helped us get our bearings our very first night, gave us tips on where to go for dinner and drinks, shopping, etc. Extremely helpful. The hotel also has a hospitality room that can be used if you have a late night flight. Our only issue with this was the previous people left it a mess. However, the front desk was extremely apologetic and helpful with resolving this issue. The hotel is conveniently located next to Whaler's Village (Hula's is the place to eat/drink!). There is a beachfront walkway to walk amongst all the hotels. There is a shuttle that will take you to Lahaina that departs every hour from Whaler's Village. Very convenient. Beware of the timeshares! They will give you a $100 gift certificate that can be applied toward your bill, but if you miss the meeting, they bill you $100 for the gift certificates!
